I'll tell you whose not there. There's no film producer. There's no film director. There's DEFINITELY no film editor because this supposedly highly acclaimed film that has suspiciously garnered eleven (11) Academy Award nominations in March 2023 left me and Mrs. Shullivan at our open front door looking around for what the heck all the buzz was about this piece of garbage?I cannot emphasize enough how disappointed that Mrs. Shullivan and I were after investing some $40 for a 4K copy of this film when it was initially released which I rarely do but I proceeded with my advance copy of the film based solely on the eleven (11) Academy Award 2023 nominations that the film attained.I am using the analogy of a "Knock Knock" joke because this film is delivered in three (3) chapters (just like a Knock ... Knock .... Knock joke) all which were basically a mirror image of each other with total chaos being the premise and an underlying theme of the strained relationship between the Laundy Mat owner and mother Evelyn Wang (Michelle Yeoh) and her daughter Joy Wang (Stephanie Hsu).Mrs. Shullivan and I kept waiting for the tempo to slow down but instead the Chinese western theme continued throughout with fight, after fight after fight through the Disneyland eyes of a poor copy of the 1940 Fantasia film.Hey my wife and I are senior citizens and our days of experimenting with hallucinatory drugs are decades behind us. Maybe, just maybe the film critics who are praising this piece of garbage went to a screening and instead of chomping on M&M's and Caramel popcorn they were fed some potent hallucinatory drugs and spiked Kool-Aid and then attended a big after party afterwards. Otherwise I cannot in my wildest dreams comprehend how this film pulled off such a big scam on the general public.I hope the general public isn't drinking their Kool-Aid and I also suggest if this film comes knocking at your door ..... DON'T ANSWER IT!I give the film a very disappointing 3 out of 10 IMDb rating.

reviews.review_title: Gratuitous weirdness, but that's the whole point
reviews.content: It's hard to criticize this film cause it works as a an insane story, in an insane world, and is obviously appreciated by many people.Strange how it was like a rollercoaster ride but also really boring at the same time, with no real purpose beyond 'be kind', and 'accept people'. Both nice themes but paper-thin to sustain a 2+ hour movie.There's a superficial level of excitement, a key element of the plot is 'do random stuff' and that's okay, but beyond that there's not much more. It just depends on how you like your entertainment.

If the Jet Li movie The One was written by Monty Python you'd get a film very much like this.It's pretty fun, even if the character development is sporadic rather than occurring over time which can be a bit jarring, but over all its pretty entertaining.

reviews.review_title: This must be what it was like watching The Matrix in 1999
reviews.content: Wow, what an experience. Everything Everywhere All at Once is a genre-defining masterpiece. I haven't been this in awe of a film in a long time. It mixes so many disparate elements together to create a kaleidoscope of profound commentary on the world we live in.The mix of martial arts, absurdism, comedy, and family drama makes this a truly original film. I went from laughing out loud at one moment to having tears in my eyes in the next. The mixing of this is so seamless. The script is razor sharp and everything that happens occurs for a reason that is later explained and leaves you in awe. Michelle Yeoh is outstanding and should get serious awards consideration. This film should be the absolute frontrunner for Best Picture and I really hope it wins.

This movie's plot is the most insane and ludicrous thing ever. It makes absolutely no sense of any kind. It is trying to be like the Matrix and not succeeding at all. The multiverse concept has been done many times in Marvel so it's not new. I can't believe this movie got 11 Oscar nominations. The Academy will nominate any garbage movie nowadays. This movie is a stew of randomness that just makes me sick to my stomach. It is convoluted to the point of no return. I am getting really tired of Hollywood making trash and people looking at it like it's gold. I have a need for movies to make some sense even if it's fantasy or science fiction.

I saw Everything Everywhere All at Once, starring Michelle Yeoh-Shang_Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings, Crouching Tiger,Hidden Dragon; Stephanie Hsu-The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel_tv, Shang_Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings; Ke Huy Quan-Encino Man, Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom and Jamie Lee Curtis-the Halloween movies, True Lies.This is one of the weirdest-but in a good way-movies you will probably ever see. Think of a trippy Matrix and you come close. Michelle and Ke are Chinese immigrants that run a laundromat with their daughter, Stephanie. They go to pay their taxes and Jamie is their IRS agent trying to make heads or tails of their receipts. That's when things go bonkers. Ke tells Michelle that he is from another world and needs her help to defeat a chaos agent that is trying to destroy everything. It takes quite a bit of convincing before Michelle can believe him but when she does, she discovers that she can access her other selves from the multiverse as well as their abilities. This leads to lots of exciting battles and a big helping of comedy. An example of weirdness; On one world, the people have hot dogs as fingers-they have adjusted by learning to use their feet more. By visiting these other universes, Michelle sees different lives that she could have led if she took a different path but basically, it's about relationships with her father, husband and daughter. Oh yeah, Michelle is not the only one that can access other versions of themselves and their abilities. The movie is also divided into 3 parts; Part 1 is Everything, Part 2 is Everywhere and Part 3 is All at Once.It's rated R for violence, language and sexual content-no nudity-and has a running time of 2 hours & 19 minutes.If you are looking for something a little different, this one is for you. I enjoyed it and would buy it on Blu_Ray.

Pros:
You will never see another movie like this.Insanely creative imaginative complex beautifulvisually stunningMind opening scientific ideasGreat ActingGreat DirectingCons:
all the pros are completely demolished by the lack of depth in MEANING.What do I mean? The audience is left shorthanded in the end behind every great scene, every great sci-fi idea, every great action, the answer to "why is this happening?" is always insubstantial and frankly dumb.If I could sum up this movie in one metaphorical sentence: It's like buying a five star restaurant then finding out it's filled with incompetent garbage chefs. So does that really make the restaurant five star or garbage? Isn't a restaurant as good as its chefs? Just like isn't a movie as good as its message? Hence my rating.If I could sum up this movie in one literal sentence it would be: Asserting the idea that the infinite Cosmos, and infinite possibility of our existence, all of life and all of the Creation, all the time effort energy matter was all made for the sole purpose of advancing the United State's leftist political agenda. (And no I am not left nor right nor even an american nor do I take any solid position in anything. I'm just a human observer watching a movie. Resist the urge ti put me in a box lol)I mean the literal quote they use in the ending of the movie and throughout is "nothing matters". It's as if they are only looking at the chaotic part of all Creation but forgetting to also see the orderly part of all Creation. I mean creation is both chaotic and orderly at the same time. And saying things like "Be kind especially when you don't know what's going on". Well if you don't know what's going on then shouldn't you be neither kind nor mean. Your assuming kindness is always answered with kindness. That is equally as dumb as assuming unkindness is always answered in unkindness.This movie wants to pretend it is being open minded when really it is just taking an extremist position just like any other boring bias movie. It had so much potential...that's what will disappoint you the most.

Eat your heart out, Kevin Feige; as much as I've enjoyed the latest MCU ventures (because I'm basic), I much prefer Michelle Yeoh & the Multiverse of Madness. It's the psychedelic sincerity of The Beatles "All You Need Is Love" in the form of a cinematic kaleidoscope of colors. Every single element is flawless: script, direction, action, humor, performances, romance, science fiction, heart. It utilizes filmmaking economics with such brilliance you could miss it behind the smorgasbord of fun on the surface.

reviews.review_title: Good Idea but just too long
reviews.content: If this film had been about 40 minutes shorter I would have left the cinema thinking innovative, fun, imaginative, good acting, good action scenes and nice message. As it was it just went on too long with too much repetition and a failrly obvious family resolution playing out far longer than needed. It was a film in dire need of an editor.

It's like they chopped a movie up like a pizza, picked one slice and played it over and over again for an hour longer than it needed to. Literally picked it for it's high rating and left shaking my head. After, my 12 year-old daughter turned to me and said: I didn't understand any of that.

Unlikely award winner Everything Everywhere All At Once is perhaps the first film to capture the chaotic mental dopamine of constant Internet use, which is not necessarily a good thing, though obviously most people can relate. Attempting philosophy, action, and comedy all at once, the film can be best summed up as a mixture of the Matrix, a Stephen Chow or Jackie Chan film, It's a Wonderful Life, and Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen. A disparate set of influences, nearly all of which are better films.Stylistically, the Daniels borrow the most from Michael Bay here, pushing his type of rapid-cut, juvenile sensory overload to arty levels. They nevertheless lack both Bay's sense of composition (con), and also his misanthropy (pro, though the stuff they do to Jamie Lee Curtis goes beyond unflattering). Still, the overall effect the film produces is about the same, especially when it comes to the humor.Unlike the Kung-fu comedies of Chow, the humor of EEAAO lacks a sense of comic delirium and is more fractured and crude. When in Chow's 'Shaolin Soccer' a soccer game transforms into a trench war, it's funny not only because it's unexpected, but also because it parodies the intensity of the sport. Had the Daniels made that film they would have just as likely turned the game into a sex dungeon. Too often they're only willing to throw random stuff at you in place of actual wit---the concept that alternate realities can be experienced through statistically improbable actions is funny at first, but gets dull very quickly. Especially as it's used almost exclusively for high school gross-out humor: inhaling flies, sticking mucus in someone's mouth, etc.The resulting action scenes lack the smooth inventiveness of even a lesser Jackie Chan film. For another example, the fight in 'The Accidental Spy' where Chan, completely naked, tries to beat off several assailants (while covering his privates with anything at hand) is infinitely funnier than anything offered here. The main reason is that the best humor, like Chan's, needs some basis in reality so you can understand the characters' reactions and frustrations. The Daniels have that in the opening scenes but quickly abandon it, choosing instead to indulge a kind of TikTok randomness.It can still be imaginative (I'll give it that) but only up to a certain point. You'd think a reality where people evolved giant hot dogs for fingers would look entirely different even in terms of simple objects such as doorknobs and shirts, but the Daniels merely show us the same world, only where people play the piano with their toes and squirt condiments at each other. Again, this is more about throwing random crap at the screen instead of allowing the premise to develop naturally.So the film fails as a comedy, but how about as a philosophical tract? Like 'It's a Wonderful Life', EEAAO deals with the lost chances of life, 'what might have been' through alternate reality. It goes without saying that Capra's film is far more mature and thoughtful, but it's also more emotionally moving. The Daniels are able to engage nihilism head-on, since especially in the face of the infinite multiverse any form of meaning melts away. The problem is that they don't know how to address it; the idea that humans are no more than insignificant specks is only indirectly repudiated, and the final message is spoken: 'We don't know what's happening in this world, but just be kind to each other!' This conclusion is so basic that it's beyond criticism, except for the fact that it is so basic. EEAAO lacks Capra's edge---advocating as he did kindness and happiness even in the face of intolerant cruelty---though it obviously strikes a chord in our culturally confused, digitally-addled times.

I don't understand the high reviews, it is a mess from the beginning to the end. Yeah, it talks about the multiverse, but in a very chaotic and annoying way. I'm sorry to disappoint those who gave it 10 stars, but it is not even worth a star.I just wanted to watch it because so many people recommended it, so I watched the first 15 mins a month ago but couldn't continue and a month later I said, I might be wrong, so I continued the movie but turned out I was right about how silly it is.

reviews.review_title: Childish, ridiculous, pathetic and a total mess
reviews.content: I suppose, I can call it as filmmakers on drugs especially acid!It has some points but it was very badly executed and made.I can't believe there's people who like this!It seems common sense is rare for some!Sci-fi ideas were extremely crap, as ridiculous as a boyish fantasy.Alternative universe to a painted animation! Oh, come on!People, not everything that looks or sounds new is very good!Or something that a lot of money and time has spent on it!4/10.

reviews.review_title: it really was everything everywhere all at once
reviews.content: I'm gonna be honest here and say I was disappointed that I didn't absolutely LOVE this movie like so many other reviewers- but I hope through my explanation you can see why. Is this a bad film? Oh, absolutely not. It's incredibly charming and delightful at times, and even very meaningful- and made me cry towards the end. Where my problem lies with this film though is through its messaging. There are some basic flaws to be had with this one, it can be predictable at times, its pacing can kinda drag, and there are quite a few cliche moments here and there- but most of them feel insignificant enough to ignore and enjoy the incredibly bizarre atmosphere and story this film is trying to tell. Its overall meaning though feels a bit squired, and feels very mixed in my mind. I know it means well, but I can't help but feel it doesn't do enough to satisfy me. All this time they are dealing between the relationship of the mother and the daughter, and still as the film comes to an end we see the mother nitpicking and not changing. She seems willing to change, but then does nothing in the end to resolve these facts and it just feels a bit too messy to ignore. Not only that, but the fact that just because the mom loves the daughter is an excuse for her to keep hurting her- is not okay, and I feel kind of hurt that a lot of that goes unresolved and the tone seems to pick up where the story has no right to let off. If you can get past that, the film is enjoyable. It definitely feels otherworldly, and has a very unique feel. It's easily a very originally made film, with some familiar elements, and visually it is also quite beautiful to watch and see unfold. The acting is incredible and I love how detailed and full of life each little character is, never shining away from darker elements, even if it means not fully settling things. It has some missteps here and there for me, and I can't ignore certain aspects of it- but in the end, Everything Everywhere All at Once does deliver on its promise enough to be enjoyable and is certainly a memorable watch.My Rating: 7.3/10.

I like Michelle and that's what caught my eyes when choosing this film. But even she cannot save this rubbish! The film all over the place, wasn't funny and made no sense! An hour into the film, i just gave up on it and switched it off! Don't waste your time with it.

I had high hopes for this film. I love Michelle Y. She is a brilliant and talented actor. However this film is a big let down. Her acting is excellent as usual. The plot is all over the place. It is random to the point of feeling like some sort of bizarre circus show from an alternative Universe.I am completely baffled by the rating and can only concur that it's high because of the pretty high standard of visual effects and constant barrage of random action.I Felt like I was eating 10 portions of sticky toffee pudding and needed to vomit by the end but I was to delirious to find a place to release the contents of my stomach and therefore had to hold it in. Not a great feeling!This film had huge potential. The cast is great. It ended up feeling lazy and confusing. Maybe that was the intended effect? Maybe this is a film that is feeding into the random Instagram/Tik Tok scrolling generation?For those with huge attention deficit this film might be a blessing.Not for me I'm afraid. A big waste of talent.

reviews.review_title: Inane movie, don't understand the hype
reviews.content: I came into the movie with high expectations, since I like most A24 movies and it had such great reviews. But I couldn't stand it. I'm not sure who the audience for this movie is, but it's definitely not me.I should say that I can't stand any comic book or superhero movies, and I now see it relates to a multiverse which might be a superhero thing, so maybe that's it. I thought it was going to be an indie drama type of movie with some mild fantasy/superhero tie-ins, but it felt more like a children's comic book with constant mind numbing action scenes.The movie was just full of ridiculous fantasy stuff that changed every minute. You couldn't even keep track of all the crazy things going on, which I didn't even care to try to keep track of once I realized how inane it all was. After about 20 minutes I could barely pay attention because it was all just so far fetched and unbelievable.

Having seen countless raving reviews about this movie both on IMDb, and even more so on Twitter, I thought "damn, I have to go see this ASAP". I went in expecting something incredible, movie of the year standard, but wow was I disappointed.Literally 75% of the movie is fight scenes, like okay it was cool at the start but 2 hours in and still?? 'Everything Everywhere' is perfect for people with a short attention span because there's always something ridiculous going on. I understood what they were trying to do with the plot but honestly nothing stuck, it just felt shallow.Don't get me wrong it's not a bad film, but it's nowhere near these 10/10 reviews that's being advertised.

reviews.review_title: Michelle Yeoh, what a shame... what a waste...
reviews.content: I guess her wonderful "Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon" days are gone... and now she's acting in... movies (?) made by drugged deranged psychos...All the good reviews are from so many drug-addicted or metaverse-wishing people that populate our planet nowadays - and this shows what a deranged planet Earth has become...

Watched it and gave it a breathing room first. But instead of having a better perspective after a while, unstained by initial skewed and biased impressions, the movie was forgotten it in its entirety by my brain.Nothing sticked, nothing remained with me, zero I can reminisce with enjoyment.But I understand why it was hyped so much, it's slightly chaotic in which average moviegoer will get lost thinking it's deep and people with mental problems will think it's relevant to them.Watched it because user reviews we're always an indicator of a good movie, but this one broke the system. User reviews are no longer to be trusted. You owe me two hours "reviewers".

1. After being riveted by a brief shot of Michelle Yeoh watching laundry tumble in the dryer, I now believe I actually would watch her do literally anything.2. I cannot imagine what possessed Jamie Lee Curtis to take on this film, but I am soooo glad she did!3. This film is crazy, crazy fun!

While I'm a big fan of actresses Michelle Yeoh and Jamie Lee Curtis I was excited to see them both in the same film.. I clapped when I saw Jamie's first screen-- what a treat!! I'm late with my review and I'm pleased that the results are in and there is an Oscar Buzz, but the movie was wayyyy too busy for my brain to digest.. I reviewed the great reviews so I was even more anxious to check this film-unfortunately to me-- It appears many are simply deers herding of a cliff.. I've come to believe many are not comfortable being the negative voice.. I'm comfortable in my skin and I must say- the film is insanely busy- the concept is allllll over the place-- but so are we, so I'm certain most can relate to our own noise.

I can't understand how this movie got such high ratings but it was painful to watch this movie which was nothing short of tedious and not funny at all. There was no entertainment value. Don't waste your time.

reviews.review_title: Too self indulgent to be called an epic
reviews.content: What could had been a sweeping adventure like back to the future or zathura, is reduced to same thing happening over and over and over again for more than 2 hours. Its not as complex as it aims to be, neither its as engaging. To please the me-she-you audience, it throws some propaganda and lgbt gimmicks too, which adds nothing to the fray. Michelle Yeo and Ke Huay Quan are wasted. This is neither a time travel adventure, neither a time loop incident, and neither it is a miltiverse movie. Its too self-indulgent to be called any of these. Maybe someone from the team of jumanji or zathura or goosebumps or night at the museum should have handled this.

There is so much to take in from the plot of this movie, i decided not to be too overwhelmed even though it concerns something almost everyone can identify with. The script is very clever, but everything else is even better. The soundtrack works beautifully, and the editing is amazing to say the least. And as for the superb cast, Michelle Yeoh turns in a flawlessly perfect performance, while James Hong is delightful and Ke Huy Quan is top notch as well. Then there is Harry Shum who is a riot and the absolutely marvelous Jamie lee Curtis is spot on in her turn as different versions of Deirdre from different universes. Expect a lot of heart, a lot of soul and a lot of zaniness from this mindblowing film that you will benefit more and more from repeated viewings. Take it from someone who knows.

Silly plot, bad writing and acting. It insists upon itself. Very fake pretentious style film. Trying to be a oscar bait movie, trying to steal the zeal of Robin Williams, and Barry Levinson and Aaron Sorkin.

Everything Everywhere All at Once is a film that accomplishes something very difficult - it's a movie that looks like an action blockbuster on the outside, and succeeds not only at that but also as a film in general. It actually has a plot very reminiscent of many superhero films - an average person, in this case middle aged Chinese immigrant worker Evelyn Wang, is swept up into a fantastical world (or worlds) where her true potential is realized. It's bolstered by solid performances from Michelle Yeoh, Ke Huy Quan (who was the kid in Temple of Doom back in the day), Stephanie Hsu, and Jamie Lee Curtis. It is a very creative and original movie, both very welcome attributes in today's movie industry.This is an off the wall film, but a perfectly made one. It has lightning-fast editing, and it feels much shorter than 2 hours, 19 minutes long. One of Everything Everywhere's best successes is that it takes the concept of a multiverse - the exact same thing Marvel has been doing for the last few years - and manages to make a cohesive structure for a complex metaphysics in just one film. There are still holes in its worldbuilding (like how there can only be one everything bagel if there are infinite universes), but as far as something this complex in a 2 hour movie goes, it's as good as it can be. The martial arts combat is the best there has ever been in an American action movie. It's got nothing on actual Chinese wuxia, but for Hollywood it's a massive upgrade from anything before. The costume design also aids the world building, and gives each unique universe its own distinctive flair.Despite all the laud it gets, this movie is not at all perfect. The weirdness doesn't always feel organic, much of the content of the movie seems weird for the sake of being weird. There is a point at which to distinguish weirdness and uniqueness, this movie is on both sides. Some seem to think that there's a philosophical depth to this movie, which there isn't. This is the biggest problem with the movie. The movie's message is that nothing matters, but yet Evelyn and company most certainly act like things do, whether or not they'd admit it. The idea of nothing mattering is a de facto rejection of objective good, but yet the movie insists on a vague notion of "kindness" being the ultimate objective good. You can't have it both ways. The idea that in all these universes Evelyn and Joy come to the same point also implies the existence of fate and thus an ultimate purpose. It's the type of pseudo-philosophy that's tailored for the "I am very smart" superiority complex driven Rick and Morty crowd.It is also worth noting that as of writing this, Everything Everywhere is the current frontrunner for Best Picture at the Oscars. It does not really deserve it compared to the others. Tar, The Banshees of Inisherin, and even Top Gun: Maverick are all better movies than this. That doesn't mean it's not a good movie, it is, but it's far from the top. It is a surprising film to get attention from the awards crowds, there hasn't been an action movie win Best Picture since 1971. Back when this came out I said it was going to be one of the big snubs of the year.

reviews.review_title: You can't trust IMDB ratings any more
reviews.content: Imagine a bunch of really annoying characters living that very busy life where non stop random rubbish happens to them all the time, I mean people constantly try to talk to them, they need a ton of random stuff get done and it's never ending, then suddenly add a sci fi "let's do a multiverse" gimmick...The story is pretty boring, the realisation is pretty average, my only guess someone is testing a ratingbot on IMDB...

reviews.review_title: Everything Everywhere All at Once Review
reviews.content: A Chinese woman living her worst life is swept up into a interdimensional catastrophe where she alone can save the universe.This film is incredible and I cannot believe the Daniels were able to pull off this crazy story. This film combines a number of different themes and genres and somehow makes it work.You get some extremely good martial arts action along side some raunchy comedy and the two make for an extremely entertaining film. That combined with a complex multiverse story and a family dynamic intertwined makes for an incredible film.The pacing of this is very quick and you do not feel like you've been there for 2 plus hours. It moves quickly but allows you to get to know the characters and develops them very nicely.Michelle Yeoh is phenomenal as the lead character Evelyn, Oscar worthy. She is moved from being funny to being an action hero to being this extremely emotional character so flawlessly and it's amazing to see.Stephanie Hsu is also extremely good in this film. The rest of the cast is also across the board outstanding. Ke Huy Quan, James Hong, Jamie Lee Curtis all give great performances in their respective roles.In terms of gripes, there are times where too much is going on and it's hard to follow and as a result certain aspects are lost. But it doesn't happen overly often. Also this film can be over the top at times in terms of raunchy comedy. This didn't bother me but I can see others being disturbed.Overall this film is incredibly well done. Their ability to combine a number of different genres and make it flow so well is something I've never seen before.9.5/10.

You see people say things like "a once in a lifetime movie" or "run, don't walk to the theater!" and it's easy to dismiss because they seem sensationalized. This was the first movie I have seen in a LONG time where I don't think that's an exaggeration. Sweet, sad, touching, hilarious, crazy, doesn't even begin to describe this one. Wonderful performances and the runtime flew by. Entertaining from beginning to end. I'm trying to avoid saying much, because I'd hate to ruin anything for you. Just go see it.

ITS CERTAINLY A UNIQUE EXPERIENCE!What I Liked -1. It's a Completely Insane Cinematic Experience.2. The Rock Scene3. The Fights are Good.4. The Comedy for the very most part landed well with the Audience I was with. There were I would say close to a dozen Belly Laughs throughout.5. The way they tie Everything in and out of eachother throughout the movie, was in my opinion done very well.Critism -1. Its Too long. Multiple Times i thought it ended.2. The Movie Does Exhaust you by the End of it.Overall, It was an Insane Experience but ONLY a one off Watch.

I am normally very good with these types of movies but this one one fell off and had no idea what was going on.First 40 or 50 minutes was good but this then went somewhere that I cannot even explain, not in a good way.I love MY, she is excellent and the kid from the Goonies (could not mistake his voice) was wonderful in his role but this was an experiment gone wrong in term of story.Not sure why this is rated so highly, maybe like the joker, everyone was giving it 10's when it was like a 6 or 7....

reviews.review_title: Pretentious film with a confusing plot. Visual effects are peculiar and well made.
reviews.content: I was very curious to watch this A24 movie. Over the course of the last few months I saw that "Everything Everywhere All At Once" was praised a lot online. Unfortunately I was quite disappointed: aside from the peculiar visual effects and the compelling photography, the plot is almost non-existent. The story is confusing, the director tried to explain to the audience how the multiverses works in this narrative, but he failed to deliver a convincing exposure. By the end I wondered what was even the point of these almost two and a half hours that I dedicated to watching this mess. Some might say that there is a hidden message to this story, but I could not find it. There are a few genuinely funny scenes, but overall for me this was quite a tedious experience: this production is way too long for what it is and there are a lot of repetitive sequences that could be removed completely from the final cut. The cast did overall a good job, Stephanie Hsu and Michelle Yeoh were amazing in their acting, even though the characters they played were basically empty shells with little to no development.Personally I think that this was a very ambitious project, but the production required more work on the writing and editing side. This production is way too complicated, it needed to be simplified in order to make the movie more digestible for the audience. A24 productions are a hit or miss, this is definitely a miss, but I appreciate the effort in trying to make a good sci-fi movie, having a more limited budget, compared to a Hollywood company.

What kind of drugs does someone have to take to come up with this stuff? I wish they spent more time telling the story then dragging on the fighting, which went on for about an hour too long. I fell asleep after awhile, then woke up to realize that basically the same thing was still happening. So I fell back asleep. At one point in the middle of the movie, credits started playing which got me very excited thinking it was over and I was done having to watch it, but it was a trick. The movie dragged on for at least another hour. My friend liked it though, which I don't get at all.

reviews.review_title: A novel idea...but just too messy and tonally dissonant for me to fully enjoy it
reviews.content: "Everything, Everywhere, All at Once" is a rollercoaster of glitter, color and chaotic multi-verse hopping nonsense. Beneath it all is a stretched story about a dysfunctional Asian family trying to muddle their way through life as they negotiate their relationships, heart-breaks and bitter disappointments.While visually impressive, with a kinetic pacing and clever editing, I found it hard to be invested emotionally in the story. The absurdist slapstick humor is sporadically funny -hotdog-fingered apes reenacting the stick scene from 2001: A Space Odyssey made me snort- but more often it's just crude and stupid (yes, butt-plug fight scene, I'm looking at you). When it slips from Gen-Z 'Rick & Morty' style gags to tender family moments that are supposed to make us cry, these scenes don't really hold up. It's hard to feel moved by a mother embracing her wayward daughter when you've just watched a guy sumo squat on a dildo and dropkick someone through a door.The script pokes at existential questions, but isn't really clever enough to come at them in a meaningful way; In fact, I don't think it's really interested in doing so. Much of the dialog is just exposition for the wacky dimension-hopping world rules, which you quickly realize don't make any sense. The sequences where characters are switching in and out of their parallel selves become so frantic, it's often hard to tell which version of a character you're looking at and what their motivation is. The writers can of course always keep leaning on the main point of the film that 'life doesn't make sense, so this doesn't need to either'. The ultimate effect on me was that, rather like our main character Evelyn, I just felt exhausted by it and rather lost.I have to give a film kudos when it dares to try something new. There were some spectacular moments and genuine laughs, but it wasn't the masterpiece I'd hoped for.

reviews.review_title: Nothing and doesn't claim to be nothing
reviews.content:
I..,
was planning to watch this movie several times, but after watching it twice ( original version), I realized that this movie lacks any depth and has practically become a clown game. But no, it has not even reached this point and remains at the level of the same idea. The Daniel brothers seem to be perhaps more successful in making dolls. The only thing cinema has in common is that it shows the unconscious, and in this film I realized the subconscious of these two directors, which is superficial. It uses mischief as a substitute for character and expects us not to notice. No, this is not more extreme and sloppy expressionism..,..

After being disappointed by a recent multiverse themed movie, I went into this one excited for a thrilling, thought-provoking, action movie and based on the trailer and movie description, I was going to be getting just that. And the first half of this movie did a perfect job at this. However, it abruptly became a movie about the journey between a mother and daughter as they rekindle their relationship, all while promoting kindness and acceptance, especially to those living alternative lifestyles. I have no problem with those latter themes and perhaps would watch that sort of movie but since it was advertised as a mind-bending multiverse fantasy movie, I was very disappointed!

This film is a puerile farce comedy. It isn't thought provoking in any way and is quite exhausting to watch. Not my cup of tea at all.8.5/10 is an unfathomable rating. In this universe, it's a solid 2.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst highly rated movies I've ever seen
reviews.content: The first 10 minutes set the scene with relatively unintelligible dialog, no clues as to plot, and uninspired scenery and cinematography. The plot, when it eventually appears, vaguely, about halfway through the movie, is weird, even for this die hard sci fi fan. The frenetic scenes, poor dialogs, unrelatable characters, truly ho hum cinematography and costumes and makeup and sounds, made this unbearable to watch. I watched 2/3 and then fell asleep. Only potential positive for me was lead actress acting but that was overwhelmed by the film. To be so highly rated I guess this movie contains some technical aspects that professional reviewers appreciated but to me as a viewer, the plot, dialog, costuming, scenery, and characters made it very unentertaining.

That was hard to watch. The movie started well and got me and my family's attention. We were excited for a fun family movie until... But things took a turn and things got weird. Super weird. To the point that we see a character fighting 2 guys with 2 sex toys. I got baited into watching this because of the high rating. It has good moral lesson and the premise is good but execution is messed up... 4 stars for the production and acting. Messed up movie.

Sorry but my titie says it all, plus the cast mumbling added to the misery. I couldn't wait for the film to end. I guess it is amazing what people create thinking the project will be a success. This film completely passed me by.

reviews.review_title: I tried. I really really tried to like it. It was a torture.
reviews.content: On paper this movie had all the ingredients to be amazing: Michelle Yeoh, Jammie Lee Curtis, wacky Sci-Fi alternate reality, comedy, drama and kung fu. What the hell happen?!!!This movie was a pain to watch! I watched it in little 15 minutes portions. More than 15 minutes and my brain started hurting. It took me about a week to finish it.The movie was annoying. Torture. I could not handle it.The story was over the top silly ridiculous. The dialogs cringe worthy. In my point of view the movie was poorly directed.The movie has some moments of creativity but they get destroyed by the dialogs.Even the fighting sequences of this movie felt off. I found them boring generic.I have been watching Michelle Yeoh movies since the 80's. I hate to say that this movie is not one of her bests.

I don't even know where to start, or how to describe this movie. Multi-verse? A cross between The Matrix, Inception and Buckaroo Bonzai, though not NEARLY as good as any of those. Incredibly, irredeemably silly at times. Extremely difficult to follow at others.Probably 6-8 couples at the theater viewing I attended. Two couples walked out. My wife left halfway through. I've never walked out of a movie, but this is as close as I've ever been. It is about two hours long, but I could have sworn I was in there for 3 1/2 hours. The people that made it through the entire flick were simply shaking their heads when it was over.I am stunned at the composite rating for this movie, both here and on Rotten Tomatoes. It makes me question the reliability of both.
It started out ok, but quickly became unwatchable. We were lost after the first 20 minutes. Maybe this movie appeals to young teenagers whö are gamers. Not good.

reviews.review_title: Dreadful Acid Trip Plot Offsets the Great Acting
reviews.content: The first time I attempted to watch the movie, I spent 45 minutes on it and gave up. A month later after all of the buzz and Oscar nominations I forced myself to stick with it to the end just to see if I was missing something. I wasn't, although Michelle Yeoh's acting is so good that there is a nice resolution for her at the end.I admire creativity as much as the next movie fan, but this one is so over the top it looks as if the writers/directors were on an acid trip trying to insert a bunch of dream sequences. I suspect there is going to be a big backlash if it wins Best Picture. Yes, Michelle Yeoh deserves Best Actress, but the picture is not worthy.

This may be the worst movie I have EVER seen. Plot did not make sense and it just went on and on and on and on. Both my husband and I joked as we left the theater that "that was 2 hours we will never get back. Wonder if we could get our money back at least ?" We are intelligent people, so not sure what we missed that so many liked.
This movie made me feel confused all the time. I understood all the philosophical strands, but this was just badly executed. I've just felt annoyed and wishing the movie would end soon enough.

reviews.review_title: I want to love this, but I'm left confused
reviews.content: I really really wanted to love this movie. It is a spectacle, visually interesting and it has a nice ending, but for a majority of the time I was just so confused with what was happening. All the multiverses, the weird jumps in time, the plot that escalated quickly and weirdly. The first 45 minutes I was waiting for something to make more sense or for the movie to pick up some speed. I don't know, I honestly feel a bit sad because my partner really loved the movie and was touched by it!Maybe I have to watch it another time to grasp the magnificent feeling it gave many people. The ending was nice though.

This movie is an ultra bizar copy of Matrix. By far one of the worst movies I have ever seen. It's confusing, mixed with some forced comedy touch and filled with many copycat references from one of the best trilogies ever made. Everything Everywhere All at Once is beside Memento as one of the worst movies ever made and abnormally rated. Believe me, do not waste 2 hours and a half of your life watching this. I don't know how this could be rated 8.0 on IMDb right now. Normally rates are very precise here, therefore to try to scale down this anomaly I'll be rating it as low as possible.Good luck to the ones that wanna attempt to watch it.

I watched this film based on the 8.1 rating and some of the rave reviews and I am astounded at such praise for this mess of a film.It started out fine as Michelle Yeoh and her husband are called to an IRS office in a dispute over the taxes they owe on their laundry.Jamie Lee Curtis is funny as the IRS auditor who is making their lives difficult.Early on the film turns completely bizarre with Yeoh entering an alternate universe with a series of nonsensical scenes and endless kung fu encounters with numerous villains.A giant bagel is at the center of the story and it left me scratching my head in bewilderment.Please take my advice and save yourself from two hours and nineteen minutes of nonsense.

reviews.review_title: I honestly don't get the hype
reviews.content: Such a wasted premise. It's one of the worst movies I've ever seen. Overly fragmented and ridiculously actioned. I can't believe I wasted almost 2h30 of my life on this. I feel bad for the concept of the multiverse.

Storyline is not that good. It's confusing and chaotic. Pivoting around an (very) stereotypical Chinese family and their gay daughter. At the same time the movie doesn't care about their problems, divorce etc., but mostly a chaotic view to the "pressures" of life, (very very complex) relationships and family and the expectations from the children.Then you'll have the right to ask am I getting old or is every movie nowadays written from a teenager's point of view to the life?If you're somehow interested in the concept but expect a nice and meaningful movie, I strongly recommend Mr. Nobody. :)

It's very long, and it's not an exaggeration to describe it as sitting on pins and needles. All the characters except Michelle Yeoh have no acting skills. The plot is messy. The American chicken soup is late but it arrives. When you enter the scene with your brain, no one will give you any room to think. Lie down. Just be indoctrinated. Is this the future of cinema?

I'm confused as to how this movie is rated so high... someone said they were tricked into watching it because of all the great reviews. I feel the same exact way. It is such a bizarre movie. I would have rather spent my time watching something else. People say they liked it for the deep meaningful message of the film but I couldn't even tell what it was trying to get at. I see now after reading about it and sure it's a good message but uhhh maybe we could have done without some of the universes and weirdness that came along with it. Hotdogs for fingers? Come on what's that about? Doing something weird to click into other versions of yourself? Why? Some of the things were just so unnecessary... like butt plugs and dildos. If it's such a profound deep meaningful film why is it necessary to include all this other junk? I'm sorry but it it's a no for me. I only gave it an extra star for the good acting and the attempt at a good message. Other than that, no thanks.

Potentially an interesting storyline but poorly written; difficult to follow; excessive flashbacks and scene jumps; not at all a believable sci-fi. Only interesting scenes take place washing clothes in the laundromat.

reviews.review_title: I don't get the hype, it really was just so so
reviews.content:
Starting with what I did enjoy about this movie.1. The setting of this movie was indeed a more accurate representation of an Asian American household. The family dynamics sounds about right. I like that Asians are getting more spotlight.2. The concept/theme of this movie is rather novel and therefore interesting. Although I think it could have been played out much more sophisticatedly.3. The parent-child relationship is well portrayed. The perceived lack of validation from parents felt by the child, the poorly communicated love of the parent, the process of gaining awareness and emotional growth for both the parent and child is inspiring.Things I didn't like
1. It is a very bizarre movie, you could even say chaotic. It's as if they tried to combine every single meaningless detail together and gave up filtering out what's actually worth or necessary to the main plot. Tried too hard to make it funny/original/emotional/relatable that it ends up being neither of those things very well.2. The movie is also unnecessarily long.Those two points combined makes this movie just a long, confusing, and sometimes boring mess. The novelty makes it watchable/bearable, but to me, it's nothing more than that.

20 minutes into the movie and I wanted my money back. It was literally a chore to get through it only to feel let down with a cliché unimpressive ending. The character development was terrible, the effects 3rd rate, and the story line seemed like it was written by a 20 something on mushrooms. This was a low budget film and it came across like it in every way. Using the fantasy storylines to metaphorically act out internal struggles has been done many times, and done much better. Don't get me wrong, some low budget films are great but they have well developed characters and storylines that are impactful. I didn't feel this movie had either, or maybe I'm just not emotionally damaged enough to relate to it. And no, it doesn't get a pass b/c it had a gay sub theme. "Be kind, especially when you don't know what's going on" but sometimes you gotta tell it like it is just like mom did.

I am at a complete loss for words regarding the good reviews and praise. I just dont get it. I have never felt so irritated/annoyed watching a film. Constant obnoxious and chaotic fighting scenes w/ no breaks whatsoever. The actual characters and story were nowhere to be found so i turned it off and saved myself the headache. Pretentious bull****. I am genuinely concerned by how many people "love" this movie.

reviews.review_title: Creative storyline but disjointed and messy
reviews.content: I appreciate the ambition of creative innovativeness in seamlessly blending drama, comedy, dark comedy, romance, action adventure, sci-fi, and fantasy all in one movie. The cast is terrific, no qualms about the performances. The hallway fight scene is stellar and I wish there were more of those dark humor action sequences.I felt that the film lost the non-stop action adventure and dark humor tone at the halfway point when they start focusing on the black hole everything bagel motif. Which was probably the point the producers and screenwriters purposely wanted instilled - a varied yet uneven thematic tone to convey the overarching film's theme of life being meaningless.

Extremely overrated unless you've never thought about these things before and had your mind totally blown. This is absolutely not even close to one of the GOAT films but it was very well done! Would highly recommend to anyone but don't expect an 8.7/10 like it's currently rated. 7/10 at best. Since everyone and their mothers seem to think this was one of the most profound experiences of their lives, I highly recommend everyone who watched this movie try shrooms or DMT. Cheers.

reviews.review_title: I want my time back Do not believe the ratings
reviews.content:
WTF Did I just watch
Mind numbing Nonsense
Wokeness allowed to think for itself ! And its not a good thingThe only thing this has is good acting , too bad the story makes no sense , If it makes sense to you then you are probably institutionalized somewhere and your medication is late.The production is awful , theres no other way of putting itI would get better special effects by splicing filmmardigrah meets kung fu meets sex shop meets Prozac.
Was looking forward to this movie after reading the reviews. Some good scenes and unique techniques but pretty boring storyline. Not sure what everyone is raving about.

reviews.review_title: Bonkers and insane... one of the most original and creative films in years!
reviews.content:
This is a movie you must experience for yourself to fully grasp exactly what it is. I absolutely loved it, and yet I find myself unable to write a coherent review... because the movie is absolutely crazy, as well as being cinematic perfection. It's one of the greatest films I have ever seen, or rather, experienced! Instead of writing a full review, I feel this movie is best described in points, because I don't want to say too much about anything, I just want this to convince anyone reading this to go out and see it as soon as they can (in theatres with an audience)! It's the most original and creative piece of filmmaking I have witnessed in probably the last 5 years, I just can't believe what the directorial duo Daniels was able to pull off here! So without further ado, here are my thoughts on "Everything Everywhere All At Once":* The film is flawless and true cinematic perfection in my eyes!* An assault on the senses; the visuals and sound design are insane!* Extremely impressive from a technical standpoint.* Editing is a huge standout and was incredibly done, the edit alone took us on a ride! They used match cuts so creatively too!* Cinematography was stunning, I especially loved the creative use of lighting!* Sound design was absolutely crazy, it had so much going on and complimented the visuals perfectly!* Every genre of film in one!* I've never seen anything like it, it's ambitious, crazy, bonkers, insane, creative, hilariously funny, heartfelt, clever, wild, awesome, the best, odd, wacky, touching, chaotic but in a well-written way, stylized, brilliant, and most of all, masterful!* None of this movie should work, and yet due to the Daniels' excellent and clever direction, it somehow does (and yet I still don't know how they were able to pull it off)
* There is no way Multiverse of Madness will be half as crazy as this movie, this is the best multiverse film we will probably ever see
* The writing so cleverly establishes the multiverse rules and keeps it flowing in a way that allows you to feel like you understand what's going on despite how complex it gets. It perfectly guides you through the story without spoon-feeding it to you, making sure the chaotic multiverse makes sense.* Also loved the thematic exploration in the story, and that they didn't let the novelty and entertainment value of the multiverse stuff take away from the story, it just complemented it instead. It's some genius writing, especially when heading into the second half of the film where the emotional/thematic core really starts to open up and shine!* Action is phenomenal and intense. It's some of the best I've seen in the last few years, it's so wild! It's very stylized and impressive, the Daniels know how to direct action so well. They get great coverage that shows off the choreography and every hit, and perfect timing for cuts.* The film is so funny, has some witty dialogue, insane gags that I never saw coming, and some hilarious comedic payoffs - one of the funniest movies I've seen in a while, it had both me and the audience howling with laughter!* Michelle Yeoh's performance is astonishing! She's just awesome as the lead; she's so badass in her action scenes, so funny, and yet still gives such an emotional, heartfelt performance
* I also loved Ke Quan as her husband, he was so loveable and had some of the funniest moments. So great to see him acting again, have really missed him since his days in "Indiana Jones" and "The Goonies".* Stephanie Hsu was phenomenal as the daughter, and a huge part of why the 2nd half of the film works as well as it does!* Jamie Lee Curtis had me laughing so hard, she was hilarious here, I've never seen her do anything like this!This film does things you would never expect to see, and I loved it for that! I was enamoured by this film, it's truly a glorious piece of filmmaking. It's one of the coolest films of the last decade and I cannot stop thinking about it. I really want to see it again too, it's so much to take in on first viewing! Daniels truly knocked it out of the park on all levels; as a comedy, action film, familial drama, sci-fi film, something that's thought provoking and emotionally potent, technically impressive and so imaginative. It's just a masterpiece; cinematic perfection. It left me with a feeling of pure joy, I really hope everyone gets a chance to experience this film. You have to see it in a theatre with an audience... it's an insane experience! I just loved it, highly recommend! The film's title really says it all; it's "Everything Everywhere All At Once"!

Wonderful and exciting film. Michelle Yeoh is extremely underrated and I'm happy she's getting the recognition she deserves. Her humanity in her characters and range is incredible. The effects were very cool, interesting characters, timing in the reactions was brilliant. Jamie Lee was amazing as well. Also Data is back! He was hilarious in this.

So many contrived, downright strange plot devices which lead nowhere. Melodramatic acting, sophomoric platitudes about love, and almost no substance beneath the constant scene shifting. Could not wait for it to end.

reviews.review_title: Not that good in my opinion....
reviews.content: Why so many excellent reviews and scores? Maybe most original storyline, but if that storyline isn't particularly good, it's not exactly a good movie.... Good actors, can't fault them,.but the movie itself is chaotic and not very well directed... And originality? Well, the last couple of years there are a lot of tv shows and movies made a lot better then this one about multiverse....

This is an odd movie. I hated some of it, didn't like more than I hated, then I enjoyed a bit, and had a few beautiful moments. Kinda like life I guess. The acting was good all around. But, it was just too lonnnggggg, it just kept going and going and I wanted it to end. I gave it 5 stars because I did enjoy some of it.

A friend and I saw this movie today. It's the 1st time I've rated a movie one star. The draw for me was 98-year-old James Hong, an actor whose career I've followed for over 50 years. We agreed that the script must have been written by someone on a bad acid trip. We were ecstatic when it was finally over, because we didn't understand it at all. I still enjoy watching James Hong, but whatever the message of this film is, we definitely missed it.

reviews.review_title: This movie is definitely chaotic and that is the point of overthinking what could have been
reviews.content: Watched this on a streaming service when our family just recently subscribed into one on a smart tv. I've heard how great this movie is but I should have prepared more for the chaos that was about to ensue. I would really have much preferred watching this at home as I don't think I can handle that much visually in theaters. But I think the editing and production was great enough to show the parallels of the timelines and the actions. I didn't like some of the embarrassing scenes but I think that's just me with any kind of scenes like that on other films. I did enjoy the rest of the movie even if most of the humor wasn't really my thing but I get the point of those. Just going with the flow and not thinking too much about everything or else it will be easy to get stuck questioning a lot of things. I do like the originality and the creative execution of a fairly simple story of acceptance of what ever already happened and dealing with problems in an optimistic way. It was a fun experience and it's probably not one that I would watch over and over again as it was already fulfilling the first time.

reviews.review_title: I can't even write a review
reviews.content: I'd say just go see this movie with as little information as possible. One of the most creative and insane films I've seen. Emotional and very intelligent.An Instant Masterpiece!

reviews.review_title: I can't even write a review
reviews.content: I'd say just go see this movie with as little information as possible. One of the most creative and insane films I've seen. Emotional and very intelligent.An Instant Masterpiece!
They get points for creativity and acting, but people these days just go bonkers for anything with multiverses and cool effects. Don't think it lived up to the hype.

reviews.review_title: In the minority, obviously, but I really found it bland.
reviews.content: Many films, most of them really, tell the same stories. It's just the approach, the style that differs (in some of them, even the style is the same). Daniel Scheinert and his filmmaking partner made it clear in their debut film, 'Swiss Army Man,' what kind of style they were going for: a quirky, absurdist style, and even though I didn't like it, I don't like it, I respected it for its newness. In this film, Daniel takes the story of 'The Matrix' and tells it in his fashion. He makes it seem fresh and original, but the bore I got from watching this was of Olympic proportions.Dense! You think 'Tenet' was convoluted - buries that! But, if the things in 'Tenet' do start to make sense if you stop to think about them, here, I'm not sure they do. There's so much information coming from everywhere, suffocating you. The film takes you down and then starts beating you to a pulp. But I'm not sure. Maybe I couldn't keep up with it. The whole story felt like it had so many plot holes. Like, a lot of the stuff that happened didn't make any sense. It's weird because the film sells itself as a very grounded movie, regardless of the premise, which it isn't - I'm talking about the filmmakers' approach - but then it switches in the absurdist elements, and it just didn't feel like it all fit nicely. It didn't fit at all.Most of the films that leave me convoluted also leave me with the urge to rewatch them, but this one doesn't. I didn't appreciate this film, and I don't think I'll ever touch it again. But, who knows? Maybe I'll find myself in the right circumstances - I'll lose a bet or a dare or something, else, there's no way - and I'll watch it again, love it, and think of how wrong I'm being right now. But as of now, as of this first watch, I think 'Everything Everywhere All at Once' is one of the most tedious and tasteless pieces of film I've come across recently. And, to think I've had some bland and distasteful film experiences lately.

reviews.review_title: Too much of everything & all at once.
reviews.content: This movie got very high ratings. And I get it - it's imaginative, different, crazy, unconventional. But at two hours-plus, it is also unrelenting and wearisome.I thought it was melodramatic and ironically I had this feeling of "I am watch this from another dimension". I wasn't in the story, I was spectating a movie instead.Similarly ironic, I didn't care about any of the characters whatsoever because everything could happen at any moment, all at once. There was no purpose to invest in the story because there wasn't any real threat, just chaos. The daughter said it herself: "it is all purposeless because everything is possible". Very nihilistic in a way.It was fun to see the protagonist gained skills from other dimensions, but set aside the funny visual gags and fighting scenes, I didn't think that concept was leveraged that much creatively.A movie that bombarded me with so much visuals and melodramatic craziness left me bored and uninvested.I did love the way how the mind made the travel between dimensions possible. The production value: editing, direction, post-production, etc was top notch. The acting was average. Not bad but nothing that'll remember tomorrow.

reviews.review_title: The most bizarre movie to never have a moment that didn't make sense
reviews.content: I had succesfully avoided any trailers or spoilers prior to seeing this film. All that I knew was that my favorite film critics were calling it excellent and weird. While both of these are true, I want to offer what may be a common praise but I have yet to see because I am reviewing blindly: this film handles absurdism in the most realistic way I have ever seen. Taken out of context, numerous scenes from this movie would be the most ridiculous thing you have seen on the big screen. But every single one of the bits and jokes and plot devices works within the context of the film, which is so beautiful. I don't know that I count this as spoiler so I feal comfortable saying, there is a bit where two objects are talking to one another that is so absurd, but it serves to eventually be the most poignant symbolism in the entire runtime.Of note, Stephanie Hsu is an absolute standout. I am scrolling through her film history now to add things to my watchlist because she was so phenomonal. I assume she had a blast with the role given the context of the character, as did the design team. Everything Everywhere All at Once is a film you won't soon forget, and you should see soon so that you can be in the conversation if it is ever brought up, inevitably, for years to come.

reviews.review_title: Unlike Anything I've Ever Experienced Before
reviews.content: What a piece of art this was. I don't want to give anything away so I'll just say this film made me laugh, cry and go "wtf?...sometimes all at once. It was an incredibly original vision that seems to have had incredible care and quality put into it by everyone and was just such a unique experience. I would recommend it to anyone to give it a shot.
I like the actors in the movie (especially santa), but it was too hard to follow and just too strange for me. To each his own. Would not recommend to anyone.

The funniest pattern in these reviews is the number of ravers condescending to everyone who disliked this mess, 'You obviously didn't get it.'Uh-huh. That's it. Went straight over our heads...Three out of four of the main actors were excellent (sorry, Stephanie Hsu). Portions of the film were quite moving; I cried more than a bit.But, god, my kingdom for rewrites and some ruthless editing! The film was so repetitive and overlong I wondered how the directors and producers could possibly believe the story played as is. Much of the visual humor was overused to an embarrassing degree. The IRS audit evoked more suspense and tension than the super villain/end-of-the-world plot, which was entirely unconvincing.The film's ultimate Message, the love and kindness offered as an antidote to...well, everything, would have carried more weight if it weren't undermined by the protagonist almost immediately.How 'Everything Everywhere All at Once' got so overhyped is a mystery, beyond the obvious appeal of a feel-good Hollywood underdog(s) tale. Love me some underdogs! And weird is *always* more interesting than tentpole flicks. But when people first touted EEAAO as a potential Best Picture nominee, I thought they were joking. Now it's the odds-on favorite? Are films where you could sleep through 45 minutes and not miss anything essential really something to aspire to?

The movie is confusing and somewhat irritating. It's not worth anybodies time. Trying to jump on the multiverse hype and make a quick buck. The rating system is either rigged or seriously faulty. This is a below 5/10 movie. Please don't waste your time. Find an old movie like back to the future or something if you really want something to watch.

reviews.review_title: Some of the most fun I've ever had while watching a movie.
reviews.content: There's really something for just about everyone in this movie. It's part Kung-fu action, part absurdist comedy, part cerebral sci-fi, and part indie family drama. I think this is an instant classic that uses the art of cinema and movie-making to it's fullest potential.They really throw everything AND the kitchen sink at the wall and somehow it all sticks and becomes a really fun and really special film that I would recommend to pretty much anyone.Michelle Yeoh is fantastic as is the whole cast. The writing and direction is phenomenal and innovative and creative and it features of the best editing I've ever seen. It's a really wild movie, but if you sit back and absorb it, I think you'll have a good time.

Just because of how it made me feel. I'm not going to belittle it by trying to encapsulate it here. Such a great movie for so many reasons. Just go see it. Get ready to be intrigued, laugh until you can't laugh anymore, cry because of the beauty of it all, and then question existence on a cosmic level. Just get ready!

reviews.review_title: I guess I just didn't "get it"
reviews.content:
When I walked out after the movie was finished, all I could think was "what the heck was that?"
I mean the cinematography was great, the effects were great... But the story... well not so great.It really fell apart in the third act with no explanation of how such unknown random acts would give them "powers" where earlier there was a whole process to lead them to them.Like I said, I guess I just didn't "get it".

reviews.review_title: Hitchhikers Guide meets Kung Fu Hustle meets the Matrix
reviews.content: I enjoyed this movie for what it was. Pros: decent acting, great action sequences, good cinematography, great imagery.Cons: Loads of cliches, sophomoric humor, sloppy writing, overly baked, unoriginal.It's definitely par for the course in an age of short attention span and low expectations. A high pace tempo and colorful style to keep the masses dopamine flowing.I'm not surprised it's rated so high, considering how Hollywood force feeds movies like "Glass Onion" and Marvel down our throats. But at the same time, this movie was enjoyable enough to get something out of it, Pure energy. This is not a mind blowing movie and not nearly as intelligent as the mainstream believes it to be.6/10.

reviews.review_title: It's a very, very bad movie!!!
reviews.content: The movie "Everything Everywhere All at Once" is boring, repetitive, with a bizarre script, childish dialogue, and bad direction. The actors look like robots directed by novices out of school. I couldn't believe that the great actresses Michelle Yeoh and Jamie Lee Curtis were part of the cast of this disastrous movie.The plot may have all those allegories and metaphors that are in the review comments, but the movie is odd, weird, and full of unconvincing bestiality. It's too childish and it's the fault of directors Dan Kwan and Daniel Scheinert.The more I read the review comments, the more I wonder if I watched the same movie.

I really had to force my way through this one. The plot makes no sense whatsover. Some funny moments and cool ideas regarding the multiverse and how we are living all these parallel lives. Not sure that is true or not but it's fun to think so especially when nothing goes our way. The characters are boring and miserable except the dad who is quite sweet and has some serious kung fu moves! The trippy sequences were not done very well. Reminded me a bit of that film Mr. Nobody which i never got. And also the show Legion which did this kind of thing at a very masterful level with cool, sexy characters with dark humor and great music mixed in (unlike in this besides Debussy piano toes part, that was funny). At least the film is attempting something different which i can appreciate. Just never connected with the story or characters, I felt like I am having a bad trip and please be over soon and it just kept on going and making less and less sense. I wish it would've ended the first time it said The End when there was still an hour to go. Anyways, I'm Markus and this is my first review. Go listen to my music on spotify, just search for Vicevoids. And connect with me on social media. Hope you enjoyed my review. Bye. Good luck to anyone even trying to write spoilers for this! Not possible.

The movie poster was already explicit, but still, I gave it a chance because of the ratings.The guy who wrote this movie is "the best acid trip experience" obviously never took LSD in his life!It is just a mix a recent succesful productions like Stranger Things and some Marvel movies, spiced with Kung-Fu and woke culture.Maybe the targeted audience was 12-16... Not sure.

reviews.review_title: The best part of this movie?
reviews.content: Reading the 8, 9 and 10 star reviews here as people go overboard with superlatives trying to "sell" this movie. Some of the reviews feature adjectives that aren't even actual words.I gave up on this with a half-hour yet to go.At the core of this movie is an unoriginal concept about how our lives would be very different if we made different choices in life. In this movie the mechanism isn't angels ("It's a Wonderful Life","The Family Man") but the now overused narrative device of "the multi-verse".The emotional core of the movie is about a harried Asian woman and her gentle-mannered husband as well as her strained relationship with their daughter.So far so good.Then it goes off the rails. It all gets buried under a ton of overdone wire-work martial arts, much shouting and screaming and lots of frantic special effects.Like a LOT. Like about sixty minutes too much.I think it was the point where our heroine is fighting two dudes who have anal plugs dangling from their asses that I just rolled my eyes and gave up on it.At this point I was losing the thread of the plot and, honestly, didn't care about it anymore.I wanted to get on with an actual story, but we see the same scenes more or less repeated over and over. Crazy fight scene... heroine dies or seem thoroughly defeated... no, wait! She's back up again for another crazy fight scene. And another. And another. Quiet emotional scene with husband or daughter. Then MORE fighting.It's exhausting and you're a better person than I am if you can get through this endurance contest.

My first instinct is to say "they don't make em like this anymore" but that begs the question: "when did they ever?"Everything Everywhere All at Once is genuinely one of the best films I have ever seen. I have nothing to say other than I loved every second of this masterpiece. No movie is objectively flawless; it's simply not possible. This just so happens to be a film that works for me on every level. In a release lineup packed with Fantastic Beasts, Sonic 2 and Ambulance, This movie is the one to see if you're looking for something truly special.

reviews.review_title: Buckles under the weight of its own creativity
reviews.content: Everything Everywhere All at Once left me feeling simultaneously overwhelmed and underwhelmed. There's a lot to admire about this film. Its premise is original, the direction is very well done as is the editing, and the entire cast is genuinely great. When this film started, I thought I was going to love it, but as the movie went on I started to like it less and less. This movie feels like an art house film made for the Tik Tok generation. It's very random, overly chaotic, and absurdly fast-paced.I can't help but feel that Everything Everywhere All at Once really buckles under the weight of its own creativity. It's a film that's trying to be a lot of different things. It wants to be an art film, a sci-fi film, a kung fu film, a comedy/absurdist film, and a family drama. I admire the ambition but it really began to feel like way too much after a while. The pacing is so breakneck that I literally began to get a headache, and it was hard for me to get emotionally attached to anything in the story because the movie was just throwing so much stuff at me constantly. It felt like the directors were trying way too hard just to show off.I understood what this movie was trying to convey thematically. It's clearly a commentary on finding optimism in a nihilistic world, or in this case, worlds. I get it. But whatever genuine emotions this movie was trying to have, it all gets immediately undermined by nonstop visual gags, some of which were needlessly juvenile and all of which felt weird just for the sake of being weird. I think a great film to watch as a juxtaposition to this one is Eternal Sunshine of The Spotless Mind. That's a great example of a weird and highly original movie that doesn't have its depth or emotional weight undermined due to its staggering creativity.I wanted to love this movie, really I did. And I understand why so many people do love it. It is different, there's no denying that, and who knows, perhaps during a rewatch I might feel differently but as of right now, Everything Everywhere All at Once feels like an overhyped film that is far too chaotic for its own good.

I watched about 2/3's of this. Just couldn't force myself to watch the rest.It's weird and bizarre and just didn't flow very well.The filming was good and character did their job. Some of the scenes would have been better to just leave them out. Just because you can do something doesn't mean you should.

reviews.review_title: I felt like I took drugs, and got a bad trip...
reviews.content: So, the movie Everything Everywhere all at once (2022).The first few minutes of the movie are really promising.Just a normal intro. But then it gets really weird, and not in a good way. It also gets really boring.Thats why I lost my interest really quickly.The music in the movie is okay, and the images are also okay (could be better though).I didn't see any famous actor, when I recall it correctly.For anyone who wants to watch this movie, I would say DO NOT DO IT. ITS A WASTE OF YOUR TIME.I always check the trailers on for head of the movies and series online. Hoping this will help.
I can't believe how much people are praising this movie. This is one of the worst movies I have seen. It reminds me of the Disaster Movie. Some scenes were very hard to watch.

reviews.review_title: Kill Bill and Inception Make a Beautiful but Stupid Love Child.
reviews.content: The genre is hard to define. Think Kill Bill meets Inception, but silly. It attempts to meld comedy, mind-bending sci-fi, and action into one, which it does to an extent, but fails to make it more than a sum of its parts. It was a great idea with an arguably poor execution.A slow-burning first half turns into a fast, colourful, adventure sailing through the multiverse. It's a visually impressive piece that pounds the senses and ends with a wave of feel-good fun. Everything Everywhere All at Once oozes originality and creates a new mind-bending world in which to immerse yourself.Yet, originality alone cannot carry this film. The jokes did not always land. The script was so simplistic it sometimes felt like it was directed towards children - something belied by the unnecessarily sexual nature of many scenes. Possibly the worst issue is the many plot holes. In a modern world where anything is possible, the choice of martial arts as the main medium of warfare is unexplained.To use an analogy from the film, Everything Everywhere All at Once is like a clay pot that holds your attention in the moment, but is so full of cracks that it fragments the moment you start to reflect any deeper.

reviews.review_title: Tries to be everything all at once and fails at most of it.
reviews.content: To be honest I don't know what the hell I just watched. Bland family drama, comedy, action, science fiction, all haphazardly mashed together into a +2 hours senseless new-agey blob.The family drama which runs at the core of the movie feels strangely forced, specially in the third act which drags on forever. Most jokes are genuinely funny at first, but some of them are dragged for way too long and stretched thin and a few others are bordering cringe territory. Spends an unnecessary amount of time explaining the multiverse concept that drives the comedic/action parts. Character development is basically absent.On the bright side, action scenes are well choreographed and imaginative. If you want some wild, absurd, flashy action mixed with cheap tear-jerking, go see this.

Why the hype? Why the good reviews?It was only because of so much positivity around it that I lasted 30 mins before eventually realising that I just don't get it and then I went away to do literally anything else instead.For me personally, the 30 minutes I endured were noisy and meaningless and full of cliches from any number of Tarantino bubblegum movies, noting in my opinion that his movies are way better.Maybe the movie improves after the first half an hour, maybe the story line starts to gain some clarity, but for me I was ready to quit after the first 10 minutes, staying with it for a bit longer to try to understand why people are loving it.Oh well, my partner loved it, so whilst she enjoyed the rest of the film I want away to wash up the dinner dishes and then deep clean the kitchen.

1 June 2021Everything Everywhere All At OnceEvelyn Wang and her husband Waymond are immigrants running a laundrette in the USA.. Evelyn's chaotic life includes her disaffected lesbian daughter, her invalid father with possible dementia, her husband about to present her with divorce papers if only he can get her attention, and a forthcoming tax audit which she is frantically trying to prepare for. We somehow manage to get all this from the first few minutes, despite the fact that the lead characters switch randomly between Chinese and English multiple times during sentences. Then they arrive at the tax office, her husband inexplicably changes character and slips her a cryptic message, and things get weird. What follows is a surreal scifi kungfu multiversal comedy mystery with deep emotional subtexts and buttplug-driven martial arts. In short, it is almost indescribable in any meaningful way - the title sums it up perfectly.Some people will hate it. They will find it prentious and confusing. I completely understand, because so did I for a lot of its running time.
