Evelyn, a Chinese-American laundromat owner, discovers a lot of parallel universes---and within them---different versions of herself and her family.Everything Everywhere All at Once is a comedy science fiction action film that is also bizarre and eccentric even. This film easily becomes one of my favorite movies I've ever seen.The story deals with love, family, being lost, and a lot of things all at once. Michelle Yeoh is brilliant, relatable and funny as the main protagonist. Ke Huy Quan, who quit acting in 2002, returns in this movie as well, portraying Evelyn's klutzy and naive husband Waymond, and his acting is perfect as well. I am also impressed a lot with his action scenes, and most of the stunts were performed by him. Amazing. Stephanie Hsu is incredible playing Evelyn and Waymond's rebellious daughter. Jamie Lee Curtis also stars as an IRS agent, and she too is wonderful in this film. She, Michelle and Ke Huy Quan will surely be nominated for an Oscar, and it will be Jamie Lee's first nomination if ever.The story will make you laugh, thrilled, cry and sometimes you will feel everything all at once. Yeah. The dialogues are also great, with a plenty of beautiful moments to offer. One of my favorite aspects are also the cinematography, editing and soundtrack. It was just done so well.I wish someday, I can find someone who I'd love to do my laundry and taxes with.Overall a beautiful movie, so i give it a 10.

reviews.review_title: This is a simply amazing film
reviews.content: This movie is made from the unexpected. But in a really good manner.At first, I thought was watching a Marvel movie. After, I thought I was watching a comedy one. And after, an action movie. And after, a drama movie. How can this movie reunite all these genres in such an incredible manner?The film delivers us a lot of different topics: existencialism, nihilism, faith, family relationships, depression, fear of the unknown, acceptance of the different... so many good aspects and necessary themes in a single amazing movie.I never thought I'd cry so much watching two rocks talking with each other. And, after that, laugh!It brings to us the most valuable philosophical questions, makes us question ourselves what brings us "joy", happiness, and what we value the most in life. You're gonna cry, laugh, feel curious, intense feelings: everything, everywhere, all at once.
I expected more reading the reviews. Too many ideas but not excuted right. You reach a point where it is a complete choas. Definitely not for everyone.

reviews.review_title: I'm not a sci-fi fan....but THIS!? Wow.
reviews.content: Full disclosure. I never watch science fiction and have never been a fan. I only watched this because of the hype AND I am a huge fan of Michelle Yeoh and Jamie Lee Curtis. Another honesty - IF I'd tried to watch it before the Golden Globes, I 'might' have turned it off half hour in. A 'what the bleep is this?' moment. I'm so gad I stuck with it (and may watch it again to see the nuances I missed first time round). Be prepared to go on a wildly frenetic, confusing, mind-boggling ride. And be prepared to also have your own inner thoughts challenged and poked. What an incredible ride. What an incredible insight opportunity in to your own life. Bravo to all the actors, the writers, director and the phenomenal editing.

Really tried hard to like this and given the actors and the premise there seemed like a lot to like but finished up turning it off half way through. So if the film gets hugely better in the last half then I apologise. The moments leading up to the big fight scene half way in when in order to get their special "boost" the fighters had to look around for object to insert into their bottoms, and then having found the objects (they were fighting in an office so they chose various things you would find) they proceeded into combat with objects hanging out of their backside. I mean, this isn't a prudish thing, it's an aversion to totally ridiculous scenes thing. Just couldn't forgive the film at this point so off it went.

I don't understand the hype surrounding this movie. I suspect it is the Lemming syndrome where everyone is jumping off the cliff with glee together.I am not one to agree just because others do. I thought this production was pure crap, and I clearly land in the minority on that point according to the vast majority of reviewers. But I'm totally ok with being where I am on this one.For starters I don't like sub titles, secondly I find asian dialects irritating at the best of times, then when the sub titles were turned off I could barely pick out any words due to the very thick accents. I totally dismissed this garbage when a female actor laid a beating on someone using a pair if dildos as weapons. Pretty much the worst piece of garbage I've ever wasted my time watching. Oscar sweep? Laughable.

You could just leave it as the title says. I'm not doing any spoilers as I think it would spoil the fun when you watch it. First of all the acting is great. Michelle Yeoh deserves a clutch of awards for putting in a stellar performance. The supporting cast are great. The film itself is split into 3 parts. Everything , Everywhere and All at once.Everything (Part 1) was the best of the three, the last part is only about 10 minutes long. If part 1 had ended the film, which it appeared to do , I think this would have been worthy of a 10 but part 2 kicked in and it was a bit long. You know when you start looking at the clock wondering when this is all going to get wrapped up. Don't get me wrong its still very good and the fight scenes are something to behold. Especially the one involving a butt plug (yes you need to watch this)/. So excellent film if it got a snip in part 2 it would have been a 10,

reviews.review_title: Shut up and just appreciate your life!
reviews.content: What better, more urgent message can a film have these days? What's so uncool about movies with messages anyways? Sometimes we desperately need them. I read a couple of reviews lightly mocking any attempt to find deeper meaning amid all the silliness, as if there wasn't enough already on the surface. What if we stopped equating tiny with insignificant? What if the more minuscule we discovered ourselves to be, the LARGER our world became, and the more SIGNIFICANT we felt? So it's not surprising that Daniels take us on the most inventive, overstuffed, relentless journey only to land us in the simplest, most heartfelt of places. That's the real judo-move here -- an infectious, goofy sweetness that extends even to the (hundreds? Thousands?) of action set pieces. Anyone can dimension-hop and fight the baddies. This combination of heart and spirit is the Daniels own. Also, for anyone who's putting together the next time capsule of human civilization, please consider the scene of Michelle Yeoh and Jaime Lee Curtis dancing with wiener fingers.

reviews.review_title: The ideology ruins everything everywhere at once!
reviews.content: It is ugly, crungy, empty a movie kept alive with money. Just a matrix+inception+kung-fu movies copy-failed,(try to) watch it and you'll understand the reference. This is an insult to good actors working hard to keep high standards. Stop with the Woke stuff fgs!!

I'm no stranger to the more artsy side of filmmaking. Hell, I love David Lynch and I just recently really enjoyed The Green Knight. However, I'm not really sure this movie feels like an artsy, indie drama/action flick. It feels more like a parody of one. In fact, this movie frustrated me so badly it nearly ruined the double date I was on because of how irrationally angry I was getting.There are some really, really weird decisions in this movie from a production standpoint, and plotholes so big you could drive a semi through them.How about why does the bad Joy always look like she hopped off the set of a Kanye music video and didn't even bother changing before filming her scenes? Her multitude of costumes didn't strike me as "multidimensional" so much as "crackhead popstar". Or are you trying to tell me that in the multitude of dimensions, Joy is only this woman's daughter in like two and a crackhead popstar in every other one?And did we *really* need a dimension based on the throwaway gag of "raccacoonie". Talk about taking me out the movie...except there wasn't much of a movie to be taken out from in the first place. I had literally forgotten the plot halfway through the movie and it wasn't until Waymond said something about the main character's plan working that I recalled what the was going on and it wasn't just more "fighting bad guys time". Honestly, half this movie felt like some drawn-out, never ending fight scene.In short, thin, fast-paced, muddled plot buried under flashy expensive visuals, childish humor and frustrating production decisions. Potheads with art degrees will probably say this is one of the best movies of this year. That's fine, everyone's entitled to their own opinions, but honestly I left this movie feeling like I could throttle someone I was so angry.EDIT: Now that I've had some more time to digest this pretentious mess, I think the main issue with this film is that it stretches the plot way too thin too fast and then piles on a nearly non-stop chase/fight sequence with flashy visuals and usually only sees the characters exposition dumping while in the middle of the action. Or told through fast moving subtitles that you will spend more time trying to keep up with than actually watching the movie.This movie should really be called "Way Too Much of Everything Not Anywhere All at Once" or "ADHD the Movie". I guess if you find kicking dogs and using them as weapons funny, you'll like this movie.

reviews.review_title: Utterly Unique, Endlessly Creative, Effortlessly Funny and Surprisingly Deeply Emotive.
reviews.content: I have been fascinated for years by the concept of the multiverse as a narrative device, in the past roughly four years, mostly, I think, because of Sony's stupendous 'Into the Spider-Verse', and probably Adult Swim's 'Rick and Morty' multiverses seem to be everywhere, largely in Marvel and DC's respective universes, but, thanks to the Daniels, we've got an entirely new take on how the idea of a multiverse can be used in media. I hadn't, and still haven't seen the Daniels' previous film 'Swiss Army Men', but the abundance of praise this film was receiving is what made me so excited to see it, reading some of the reviews I knew that, at the very least, I'd like it, but, in all honestly I wasn't expecting to love it as much I did; I had heard of the film's creativity and overall just unique feel, but I still don't think I was fully prepared for the madness that awaited me. The story, in its most simplistic description, focuses on a Chinese woman named Evelyn Wang (Michelle Yeoh) trying to do her taxes, and this very simplistic premise, which, by the way, does spin off into an utterly chaotic multiverse plot, is one of the film's greatest strengths, as, despite all of the hyperactivity and action, the plot isn't overstuffed, its very simplistic premises allows its more symbolic elements and emotional beats to flourish more freely, and, in turn, be more impactful. The film's humour was the thing I was worried about the most, as I am very specific, or, more honestly, very picky, when it comes comedy, the bizarre, in-your-face nature of the comedy in the film, as showcased in the trailer, anyway, can work for me, but typically, I prefer more low-key comedy. However, the comedy here surprised me by being both utterly bizarre yet, surprisingly the film's dialogue has a very sarcastic vibe to it, the film manages to combine to styles of very different types of humour to create a completely new and unique comedic experience. The performances are probably some of my favourites since 'Parasite', everyone brings their A-game, though, Michelle Yeoh and Ke Huy Qaun particularly stunned me. However, all of the stuff mentioned above wouldn't have mattered if it weren't for the Daniels' phenomenal direction (and writing, though I did already cover that) as well as the truly sensational editing by Paul Rogers, which brought the film together so well.'Everything Everywhere' is such a unique and special film, that already feels like a classic, and a testament to what filmmaking can be and do.

I have tried to watch this movie twice. I could watch about 30 mins at first try, second time about an hour, then I realized it's just waste of time. I don't get how this movie got an 8.2 score, I even had doubts about the movie's file I've downloaded, I had to check the trailer on YouTube to be sure.The main problem of this movie is that there is no logic. The story won't remain loyal even to its own logic. The first 15 minutes is just irrelevant prologue about the lesbian daughter and stressful life of business and family. Then in the elevator scene we get informed that husband is from another dimension and there is no time, So the main character has to defeat an "enemy" in another dimension in the middle of an IRS meeting. After that, there is no destination or logic, just random battles and random dimension visits without any hurry. After an hour, comes the realization that the story hasn't progressed even a tiny bit and probably there is no story.So this movie is a great example of why movies should have stories, non-random-well-thought stories. A better title for the movie would be "Everything everywhere all at random in favor of protagonists, because we couldn't think of anything more sensible". From other positive reviews, I suspect that maybe you have to be a stoner or acid user (which I am not) to enjoy this film. With all said and bad acting, the only relatively positive side of this movie is special effects. Bottom line: This is a bad Kong fu movie with some stupidest sci-fi backstory, that some may enjoy.

reviews.review_title: Some funny bits. Just did not get it.
reviews.content: With each act I kept wondering when it was going to end. When I saw the first credits, thought the ending made no sense I was glad it was over though I was sadly surprised it was not. Had a group of 4 and all walked out wanting the 2+ hours back. Don't get the positive reviews, but that is what reviewing is all about.

reviews.review_title: Great idea, but this one is not for me
reviews.content: The movie is okay. I get the message. I like the creativity and some dialogues, but in my opinion, it's overhyped. For some it might be confusing, dizzy and unbearable to watch, even to me, I couldn't stand some parts, and I have a very high tolerance towards this type of films. I know the point is to overwhelm and have some funny, ridiculous scenes from all the nihilistic, madness and existentialist plot, but it's not my stuff.

Imagine someone on some pretty strong drugs and making a movie of it.I had high hopes when I saw the trailer while seeing another movie. I laughed a few times, but really just a cheesy movie.Love the actors in this, but the script just didn't warrant these awesome actors.

reviews.review_title: One of the craziest and best movies I've ever seen
reviews.content: The first step is figuring out how to turn the concept into a tale, and they excelled beyond all comprehension in the process of turning a story into a motion picture. Second, everything worked flawlessly. Everything in the movie, including the visually stimulating soundtrack, the inventive action, the faultless acting, and the character writing, was just excellent. A meaningful and magnificent lesson can be discovered in all of these things. It's been a while since I merged like this. A great movie, one of the greatest movies I've ever watched.

reviews.review_title: If Kung Fu Hustle and Swiss Army Man had a Baby ...
reviews.content: ... this would probably be the result.Such a funny, bizarre and refreshing movie. Packed with a heartwarming family story.I had so much fun.This is cinema!

reviews.review_title: Easily the best movie I've seen in theatres in decades.
reviews.content: This movie is so good it's mind blowing. At a time when every other movie is a formulaic super hero blockbuster that, while entertaining in their own right, often have literally nothing valuable to say, Everything Everywhere All at Once shows us that we can have great action blockbusters that also have something to say about life, love, happiness, and our own infinite regrets.As much as I loved this movie though, it should be said it definitely will not appeal to everyone as I witnessed several people walk out of the theatre when I saw it. I can only imagine why they left, but looking at some of the negative reviews here my guess is it was either because they felt offended by something in the movie, or because they just did not understand it. That's unfortunate, because they're truly depriving themselves of one of the best movies in recent years, if not all time.

reviews.review_title: do you love quick takes & being confused?
reviews.content: So what does this movie want to be? Well it really really wants to be the new Matrix and profound yes, very important to be profound ah.. and also preachy, and he also wants you to remember that the worst thing you can be is ordinary in life, the most important thing is to choose the right decision that will lead you to a famous actor, sounds confusing? Yes.

reviews.review_title: You won't see a more original film this year!
reviews.content: This film is so creative! It's really a film about family and love, but told in a way I've never seen. It has so much heart that it'll have you grinning and tears in your eyes all at same time. All the performances are fantastic. You can tell all the actors are having so much fun. Michelle Yeoh can definitely carry a film. She's was great. It was great to see Ke Huy Quan back in a film again. He does a lot of heavy lifting in this one and honestly deserves a Best Supporting Actor Oscar nomination. Jamie Lee Curtis literally lets it all hang out, and you can tell she's having more fun in this movie than any of the new Halloween films. The only negative thing I can say about this film is there is an image that is blurred unnecessarily. I highly recommend this film and hope it's remembered in awards season.

reviews.review_title: A Fun Romp into the Multiverse
reviews.content: I recently had the opportunity to view this movie, and I'm certainly glad I did. It's a decidedly unique take on the genre of science fiction/action/adventure. The acting is top notch, especially Michelle Yeoh's portrayal of the protagonist, Evelyn. It's bizarre, funny, smart, sweet and a whole lot of fun that will maintain your attention from start to finish. Is the film's message particularly deep or profound? No. Is it one of the greatest movies I've ever seen? No. But it's a wild ride that ought not to be missed for its uniqueness. Edit: As of 4/28/2022, this movie has landed on IMDB's Top 250 list, the only 2022 film thus far to reach this remarkable milestone. As of this edit, the movie is at #57 with an average rating of 8.4. It's likely to go higher, because the movie's IMDB page show it as 8.8 with 26K ratings. How high will it go? Who knows? Top 15 maybe? At any rate, I'm so happy that this has occurred.

Liked: Everything! Not one second was wasted in this movie.Not so much: Started off a little slow but that was pretty much it.Loved: Michelle Yeoh! She def needs a nomination for this role(s).This movie was absolutely stunning! Started off a little slow while the foundation of this movie was being placed but once it took off damn did it ever! I was totally not ready for this movie. The trailers feature a little of what it is all about but till you actually sit through the whole thing will it actually get across that this movie is more than the flashy sci-fi action flick that is being advertised. Great Flick!

reviews.review_title: How a multiverse should be done
reviews.content: This spectacular, bonkers, incredibly original, laugh out loud and incredibly moving film puts all other attempts at a multiverse to shame. And most other films for that matter.It is so utterly unique that it is hard to compare it with anything that has gone before it.That it was even made gives us all hope that, amongst all the regurgitated clones, lazy and unoriginal films that are made each year, a true diamond can still be found in the rough.Everything about this film is nearly flawless. The script is one of the heros. It's tight, hilariously funny, moving, ribald (don't let kids watch it!) And, despite the utterly chaotic nature of the film, still flows and manages to keep the viewer informed enough to abandon it for being to hard to follow, which is no mean feat.Yeoh is incredible in everyday. She shows the full range of her talents, which are broad indeed.The rest of the main cast are superb and the casting team should be commended.The action is, as you'd expect, it brilliant and varies enough not be become repetitive, a perennial problem with many martial arts movies.The score is great, as is the direction and editing, which, once you've seen the film would have been a tough gig indeed.Ive just watched it a second time and enjoyed it even more as there is so much going on, it's hard to take it all in on first viewing.Let's hope more original films now get a chance at life. God knows, we need the..

I'm a fan of absurd humour. I like Jackie Chan & Michelle Yeoh. I like films which have a long build up... but this... this... something is just boring, pointless, stupid (oh yes, and I like slapstick humour). I couldn't even watch it till the end and had to turn off after an hour and a half, my worst spent 90 minutes. Avoid... just...avoid.PS: my reference to Jackie Chan is meant for this second class Jackie Chan look alike...

reviews.review_title: The 2nd movie I ever walked out on in 50-years!
reviews.content: Like a pointless student film with an unlimited budget and one page hallucination. Camera work was mediocre and scenes whipsawed between meaningless to amateurish.

reviews.review_title: A hot steaming pile of metaphysical nonsense
reviews.content: Have to love Michelle Yeon in this film, she was great, as usual.The rest of it? Well, on occasion amusing, but mostly a waste of time This parallel universe smorgasbord pretends truly Deep Thoughts, but essentially boils down to a young lady having a temper tantrum, convinced her mother doesn't understand her. Oh, really? Yawn. The ultimate answer? Love your family. Uh huh.Yeah, those "insights" have been stated many, many times before, usually in a much more elegant and impactful way than does this film. The movie has a few good moments, but falls pitifully short of its grand aspirations.

8.3/10This isn't much of a review, but it's a small tidbit on the filmThis film is absolutely true to its name. It's pure chaos with so much going on. I don't think I have a big enough brain to explain what I watched. The cinematography, score, story, and acting were all just spectacular.The meaning of the story was ultimately the thing that made me most pleased with the film. We all have stuff going on in our lives and though we may be distracted by them. If we be true to ourselves and those we care about we can come out on top.Overall, if you can get past reading subtitles this is a film I would recommend checking out. It's pure chaos, but it tells a compelling story.Thank you for taking the time to read this very short, and not entirely helpful review, but I hope someone gets something out of it. Until next time.... Enjoy the show!

reviews.review_title: One of the worst movies I've ever seen
reviews.content: It was so weird and hard to follow. Nothing made sense. It kept jumping around in a random order and it got so confusing that I finally had to turn it off. The worst part is that I was actually angry by the time I turned it off. I was angry because I was trying really hard to follow it and I kept getting blindsided with absolute nonsensical jumps from one scenario to the next. With no flow or aim. Who made this and why? That was my main question and I still feel that way. I got absolutely nothing out of it- not even a story line. Major thumbs down.I would not recommend this movie to anyone- unless you are a glutton for punishment lol.

I was positively surprised with the first 30 minutes as I had not watched the trailer and was not expecting anything special. Well, it was special and I enjoyed it even though I felt like stuck in a nightmare watching the scenes and jokes repeating again and again. What sounded like a genius plot at first, quickly becomes an everlasting dad joke as the story unfolds.Ironically, the story lacks of dimensions. It felt like we are served a nice chocolate mousse as a starter and then the main course is also a chocolate mousse and surprise surprise the dessert is also a chocolate mousse. You still eat it because you like it but it does not taste the same at some point.One important disclaimer comes from the fact that I did not watch EEAAO in the theater, which I heard is a game changer. However, I do not believe that sound or visual effects could improve the flatness of the jokes.

I love cinema.This is not it.I tried to watch this movie three times, every time after being convinced by some acquitance of the sheer greatness and uniques of the film.On my third watch (that is going on as I am writing this), I had to make this review. I hate saying it, but its really trash, lowest-tiered entertainment with philosophical aspirations that are laughable.The key purpose that it served is that it showed that no reliance can be made to film reviewers, critics and that cinema seems to be on a steep downward road.If this movie was made say 15 years ago, when there was actual competition, the movie and its creators would be ridiculed.

reviews.review_title: No sure why this is rated so high? Bots Maybe
reviews.content: This is one wacky film to say the least. It's basically Michelle Yeoh just fighting with everything everywhere but the plot is nonsensical and nuts! You just get a headache from trying to follow along.The action sequences are alright but that's all that really keeps the film together. It's a visual roller coaster and I left feeling Ill.

reviews.review_title: Don't be fooled by the high rating
reviews.content: This movie sucks, I stopped halfway. All this nonsense talking from the start of the film gave me stress and headache. It is overly hyped by this people.

reviews.review_title: A Revolutionary Game Changer in Profound Storytelling
reviews.content: Rarely does a film manage to explore so many themes about the multiverse all at once successfully, because the ones that do have to defy all plausibility to achieve a worthwhile story. In the case of Dan Kwan and Daniel Scheinert's latest feature Everything Everywhere All At Once, the endless imagination shown on screen has never felt so sincere. With the film having garnished critical acclaim from critics and moviegoers alike, one has to wonder how this movie managed to pull off an overly complicated multiverse premise. The answer, as simple as it may sound, lies in one unhappy woman in an unfulfilled life.The film stars Michelle Yeoh as Evelyn Quan Wang, a Chinese American woman who faces a serious IRS audit. Upon discovering a more serious threat in parallel universes, Wang must connect with alternate versions of herself to prevent ultimate multiverse destruction. With that premise established, not even that synopsis alone can summarize how overly complex the storytelling is. By subverting this story of an unhappy woman's life in her failing business along with her naive husband Waymond and changing adult daughter Joy, the film knows how to balance its highly tense tone with a lot of absurdist humor and familial pathos. On top of that, there can't even be one genre to describe the movie, as there are numerous elements of black comedy, sci-fi fantasy, martial arts action, and even experimental animation. Of course, at the story's heart is a bittersweet domestic drama dealing with marital problems, immigration trauma and a struggling mother-daughter relationship. In the end, the creative elements cleverly service the swirling multiverse angle in lieu of a straightforward drama.In analyzing the meaning of life through generational nihilism and otherworldly profoundness, the filmmakers accomplished telling so many different stories while bringing them all back to the main focus. While the film can go on a bit long in its excessive imagination, it makes every scene worth the runtime with a fun mix of entertaining fluff and emotional substance. For all of the entertaining action choreography, gripping stakes and hilarious transition from one weird world to another, the craziness has a purpose in developing Evelyn past her mistakes in order to move towards being a better person. Given how much society tends to put down those who think outside our own universe, never has one whole movie felt like such a relatable palate cleanser. Maybe it might be from the cast's spot on performances, especially depending on the universe, but seeing so many different points of view on one subject matter alone makes the experience far more sympathetic than it might have been without everything occurring all at once. It's all out there in the best possible way.Of all the weirdly unconventional thrill rides of a motion picture in the history of filmmaking, very few seem to even come close to the absurd brilliance of Everything Everywhere All At Once. While it might seem like a lot to take in as far as tackling so much in more than two hours, it will surely inspire at least one human being to find proper meaning in their life once and for all. Regardless of who you are and where you are, I would recommend this to everyone in the world. It's a movie with a lot on its mind, just like how you will feel after seeing it. That alone is worth risking everything for just one view.
I'm trying to work out beyond the message feom the film that a mothers love conquers all, why I wasted over 2 hours of my life to see this film. Absolute dross.

This movie is so embarrassingly bad.You are thrown around by a crazy story where all the actors are totally useless.That someone can finance such a bad film is a mystery to me.If it had been possible, it would not even have received 1 star.

🔥 RATED PHOENIX 🔥I'm just going to go around in circles for this review, so for a tl;dr: Everything Everywhere All At Once is perfection. It's a rapturous cinematic experience that takes the viewer on an emotional rollercoaster through existential dread, the crushing burden of expectations, and the overwhelming nature of life. It's funny, ridiculous, poignant, and, above all, unashamedly hopeful. In spite of its themes, Everything reminds us that, even when the world overwhelms us and brings us to our lowest, there are moments, moments when, sometimes, just sometimes, we can overwhelm the world.For a more in-depth look and more posts like this, visit my site: The Phoenix Project - Read. Watch. Play.

reviews.review_title: I think I just watched one of the greatest movies of the 21st century
reviews.content: This movie better embodied "I love you in every universe" much, much better than the film that actually spawned said piece of dialogue.Watch this with ZERO knowledge of it. Let it wash over you, and marvel at the absolute majesty that is Everything Everywhere All at Once.

This movie is the most insane, action packed, heartfelt movie I've seen in a long time. Absolutely perfect, no complaints, I hope this film goes on to win several awards and has cult status for years to come.

!It was good for ten minutes. Then -- for the 1.5 hours I could bear it -- it was a procession of kung-fu fight scenes, scene after scene after scene after scene, merged with a really bad video game, written by a ten-year-old who stayed up for three nights by drinking several tank loads of coffee.Truly unbearable.

I went to see the movie because of the 9.0 rating... I came back double checking because the best moment has been when it finally ended. Chaotic, crazy, absurd... and in spite of that, boring as hell!

I liked the concept and message of this movie which is similar to "Red panda", a struggling relationship between an Asian American daughter and an immigrant mother. However, the graphic was horrible and all the dirty jokes are not funny and very childish... I understood that there is no mega-hit Asian SF action movie in Hollywood before, so this movie was a big deal for especially Asian immigrants. But as I'm Asian and grow up in Asia, I think this movie is overrated. I've seen greater Asian movies in my life, so hope Hollywood will catch up soon so that people don't have to praise this kind of horrible action movie.

Holy Moly! Just watched this gem of a movie made by A24, Daniels and the support of Russo brothers. This would be one of those instances where I would like to say best thing I have ever seen in years. I am a big franchise movie fan but this would knock all of it out of the park. It is a low budget movie so of course can't expect like Marvel level CGI or anything but the storytelling and the concepts were the real art about this and yes the acting don't forget that. So, the movie is basically about exploring the multiverse by switching personalities and being everything to protect the end of it from your daughter. Movie is separated into 3 parts, Part 1 being hilarious. I have never laughed as much as I did in this movie and so did everyone else in my theatre. Part 2, is emotional, drama and with epic fights and Part 3 the shortest 5 min with a really satisfying conclusion. The Daniels throw you in a loop, after Part 1 where you think it ends. The movie makes use of simple concepts like maybe wearing shoes on the wrong foot to explore multiverse. Though it might sound weird but it all pans out better than expected. They do follow all the multiversal rules.The movie also explores sexuality in a sense and inter family relationships and how to look at the positives. A lot of great scenes and don't forget this but the rock is one of the best and the plug is even better. Won't reveal the details. Michelle Yeoh is the best at this one. She is just marvelous and I can't get enough. Daniels makes a rather budgeted spectacle and I think the movies story is why RUSSO Brothers invested in this project.All in all, a perfect masterpiece. Yes it is perfect.

I'm not 100% sure of what was happening during each and every scene of this movie, but I know I had a great time, laughed a lot, and was even moved a lot at the end. Michelle Yeoh is excellent and it's nice to see Jamie Lee Curtis in a fun role like this.

reviews.review_title: Marvel style humour. Boring and repetitive.
reviews.content: "All in Everywhere at the Same Time" is a well-acted, well-directed film with very good sound editing and mixing, however, I don't like its marvel-like humor, its criticism seems hollow, its slapstick style is unconvincing and its editing is tiring, the good editing of the film is lost when you use it to excess, and that happens with all the good aspects, after an hour and a half, everything stops working and at a certain point I just disconnected from the work, I thought about everything , except for the movie there in front of me, I don't understand how hype it is and the theaters are so full, it's the same audience that stays in queues for hours to see "ant-man" or any canned food of that kind, and at the end "All in All Place at the Same Time" is a gourmet canned food with good ideas that gradually self-destruct, leaving a giant shell of scraps behind. I like the universe created and I like the performances, but all this doesn't hold back the great tangle of "nothing" that we have here, in which even its great differential, the "humor" is weak, its Oscar competitor, "Inisherin's Banshees" it is a film with a humor that is also present but of an infinitely superior quality and tune. Note 7/10.

Existentialism? Okay. I watched this today and I kept checking the runtime bar frequently to see how far I've watched. It was long, longer than needed, too much ranting. Yada..yada! Even the greatly choreographed action sequences became tedious after some time. It was flashy, I give you that. I don't know how the 10-raters watched this without any constraints. I get the message, I just care less about it. I liked the concept, ideas and all but this movie does not justify the rating. But the perfomance, particularly of Michelle Yeoh was superb. Good movie but not a fan.

reviews.review_title: A spark of light in the infinite cinematic universe of darkness
reviews.content: This here is the Evangelion of the cinema. Finally, after 3 years - a movie that actually I didn't have to FFW most of the time. It's wacky, it's confusing in a proper measure when it's the right time to be confusing, it's preposterous at times (Look for a guy doing it with a table lamp) but if you are not one of those people who watch a part of a movie, or read a part of a book, and decides on a judgement with an incomplete experience - you will watch this entire epic and you might just enjoy, or have fun, or feel relieved in this time of uncertainty. I wanted to say something about prizes and Oscars, but let them slap around. Awards don't make a good movie, good writing and execution do. And this was obviously a hard movie both to write and execute - and it was done accordingly. I am happy I've taken time to watch this, and I don't remember a movie leaving such a good taste after finishing it for a long time now. This is great.

reviews.review_title: Very clever and acclaimed contemporary commentary
reviews.content: With Marvel's clever ideas to delve into the multiverses, this film takes it a step further, paying homage to the more simple adventure stories, yet by itself telling a deep and profound story,It is nominated for the Best Picture Oscar, as well as numerous awards, something unusual for these kinds of scifi tales - but it just goes to show how special it is. It's a very deep and emotional, well-acted film with an extremely clever script and incredible cinematography and effects.It feels like a very fresh take on the typical run of the mill-adventure stories in splendid and masterful fashion. Give this masterpiece a watch!

Seems like everybody makes a Multiverse movies nowadays.I'm a fan of Michelle Yeoh since Police Story 3... she lately for the past couple of years kinda have a renaissance in her acting career... she is everywhere... movies and TV.Of all the movies she's in...I think she never play a role that carry a movie... she always part of ensembles. This is the best movie she's ever in that shows how great of an actor she is. She not just have a wide acting range... she have ALL the range.This is the movie that her agent need to put in the top of her resume as reference when sending to movie studio for casting.The movie itself kinda amazing... a beautiful chaotic mess, action packed, funny and emotional... I love how Multiverse were explained in the movie and the approach to Multiverse itself is very unique and new. The jump pad where they tap into Multiverse skills are hilarious.The only one negative for me is the 3rd act... somehow the film maker couldn't find a way to neatly wrapped up the conclusion. Since it is a beautiful mess that are chaotic... the 3rd act keep going on and on and it become exhaustive. The runtime is around 2 hours... it could be tighten into 1 hour 45 minutes.HIGHLY... highly recommended... 8/10... the actor who played the husband is the kid in Indiana Jones and The Temple of Doom and The Goonies... he done a lot of acting work since then but I always remember him from that 2 movies.

reviews.review_title: What a mess, how can this be rater 8.3?
reviews.content: Atrocious acting, bad CGI, predictable script, again another movie putting asians in bad Hollywood movies. Probably Michelle's worst performance ever. The directing is all over the place, bad editing and the acting is so bad. The dialogue is atrocious, predictable and the funny spots are ao flat boring..

I'm 68 years old and have seen a lot of films in my time. There have been only a few times when I've left the theater in something of a state of awe for what I've seen. This was one of those times. It is a psychedelic rollercoaster, a Kung Fu flick, a love story, a family story, an immigrant saga and a comedy all wrapped up in quantum physics. It is also surprisingly moving at times and the ultimate message of the film is sorely needed today. I really can't praise it highly enough though I know it's not going to be everyone's cup of tea. Michelle Yeoh was simply amazing.

reviews.review_title: A blast of an adventure, both absurd and profound
reviews.content: The movie starts with a scifi premise and descends into farce. But, it has heart as the protagonist (Michelle Yeoh) attempts to unravel her family dysfunction, while contending with an IRS audit.There's long action episodes in the IRS building; which should lighten the hearts of anti-government personalities. Then, there's the Wuxia fantasies, backed by some intense martial arts manoeuvres.In the end, the plot resolves itself as an existential humanistic conundrum; about acceptance, love and belonging. Culminating in an intense mother-daughter confrontation.The veteran cast is excellent, as is young Stephanie Hsu. Perhaps, this is Michelle Yeoh's finest dramatic performance; despite her inability to speak fluent Cantonese.Highly recommended for the curious and young of heart.

reviews.review_title: A fun idea that came off dull.
reviews.content: The biggest complaint I have is that the movie seemed to start at the end of the first act. The setup of this "world" seemingly happened for the sake of happening. If you can accept the premise, then you will enjoy the movie.For me, it didn't earn my attention. I found myself watching the movie and liking the concepts, but not caring. It felt like I knew the ending before it came. Usually this wouldn't bother me, but I thought about the ending because I wanted it to come faster than it did. Most of the meat of the movie is good, but nothing is ever great.With an almost no first act, it's like a tripod with 2 legs that slowly toppled over. The top of the tripod was filled with good acting, good action, good direction... but none of it was strong enough to support a score better than just above average.

Everything Everywhere All at Once is totally and completely bonkers in the best way. It's charming, heartwarming and incredibly weird. Michelle Yeoh is great in the lead role, and the entire supporting cast all do an excellent job pulling off a story that is as far out there as it gets. The film is hilariously funny, action packed, and very genuine is its message, presenting a timely theme of generational change and the existential crisis of modern youth. Top notch editing also makes the madcap story progression really shine, overall one of the best films I've seen in a while.

reviews.review_title: I Left the Theater Speechless in the Best Possible Way
reviews.content: A Chinese-American woman is struggling in nearly every aspect of her life. She is in the process of getting divorced from her husband, her laundry business is struggling, she has distant relationships with her family including her own daughter and she is being audited by the IRS. On the day she and her family go to a meeting with an IRS inspector, her husband's mind gets taken over by someone from the Alpha Universe. Evelyn Wang learns that she needs to connect with different versions of herself in different timelines. This is because there is an evil entity named Jobu Tupaki that is seemingly trying to destroy the different universes. In the parallel universes, Evelyn learns different skills to fend off against her enemies which seem similar to her hobbies.Going into Everything Everywhere All at Once, I was pretty excited for it, but also a little worried that it might be overhyped due to the sheer acclaim it received over the past few weeks. Just from the trailer alone, this looked unique and stunning. It looked like the type of movie that I dream of seeing in theaters. Original, action-packed, creative and funny. I prepared myself for a movie with a bonkers story... and yet it still manages to stun me.I do not think there has ever been a movie that I have watched in a theater that left me speechless the way Everything Everywhere All at Once did. I don't think I have seen a movie as creative and original as this... ever, at least as far as brand new movies go. EEAaO takes its already insane premise and goes as deep as possible with it exploring different possibilities a single person could live, how it can all go wrong for them in seconds and how when a person decides to go rogue and stop caring, it affects the people they are around. Watching this movie made me think of all of the possibilities I could have had and what decisions I made led me to where I am today. That was one of the biggest takeaways I had from the story and the script does a wonderful job exploring this insane premise to its fullest.But of course, you cannot have a story like this and not have humor. This is one of the funniest movies I have seen. The jokes in this film had me cracking up like crazy. It can go from physical comedy to more subtle things like references and situational comedic moments such as making fun of the chosen one trope or how Evelyn's world keeps going from the Alpha Universe to her normal universe. That leads to some hilarious moments of physical comedy. For me though, the funniest scene in the entire film is a specific fight with Jobu Tupaki against a few of the security guards. That scene made my mouth drop like no other scene did. I could not believe the utter nonsense I was watching and I loved every minute of it. This movie is comedy gold as it is not afraid to push the boundaries at all.Despite the wacky nature of the script, the movie does not lose its way of the sad and touching moments such as Evelyn's relationships with her family and spouse both in this universe, and in the parallel universes. This leads to me Evelyn herself. Despite Evelyn's rude attitude and unpleasant nature, you cannot help but feel bad for her during this film. She is shown how successful she could have been, she seems to get frustrated about everything and everyone and she her relationships with her family are distant at best and disastrous at worst. However, you can still she has a caring and loving side and her experience through the multiverse shows her this side of her. In fact, the multiverse shows several different sides of Evelyn! She uses them in combat to go from being a confused and scared woman to being just as strong as Alpha Waymond. This makes Evelyn a very intriguing and flawed protagonist that I enjoyed watching develop.Michelle Yeoh is terrific as Evelyn Wang. Every single expression, emotion and line of dialogue she delivers are all on point. Yeoh captures the fear, confusion and fright a woman who is exploring alternate timelines of herself has while fighting against people controlled by others in the multiverse trying to kill her. I'm not too familiar with Yeoh's filmography, but this movie makes me want to see more of her films. Then there is Ke Huy Quan as Evelyn's husband, Waymond. This man has so much diversity in this role from a bumbling, but kindhearted family man who is struggling just as much as Evelyn is to a badass agent from the Alpha Universe. He is perfect in both roles and he is a great action star too. However, the scenes where he is Evelyn's husband work beautifully because of his sincerity and sweetness in the role. Quan shows how diverse he is with this role as the same man with two vastly different personalities.The rest of the performances are great too like James Hong showing great comedic chops as Evelyn's father while showing some hidden depths to that character, Jenny Slate as a bratty customer and Stephanie Hsu as Evelyn's daughter Joy and as the villain Jobu Tupaki. Just like Evelyn, Tupaki had some depth to her actions. Hsu captures the creepy vibe from her character as well as those depths that are explored. Jamie Lee Curtis as the IRS agent also manages to give a performance that shows a soft spot to her seemingly cold hearted nature which makes her shine. Finally, Harry Shum Jr. Cracked me up in his role in the movie, but I don't want to spoil it. All in all, this is a fantastic cast.There are even some martial arts fight scenes and they are a blast to watch. I love the editing techniques used in them. They make the fights energetic and fast paced without making them confusing and shaky. Each fight had me smiling because they involved wacky antics as well making them all feel different from each other. The cinematography is beautiful as well with many shots reflecting the situation Evelyn is in with her different dimensions as well as her fractured relationships. The sound design is what really shines though. This movie sounds amazing with how it sets up the tone of the film and how it portrays the fighting sequences as fun, but brutal. The soundtrack is awesome as well with a beautiful musical score and some great vocal tracks as well.Everything Everywhere All at Once is not only easily the best movie I have seen this year so far, but it is my favorite movie that I have seen in theaters in years. In a world where there are so many franchise films and remakes and reboots, this is the type of film I love seeing come out. It has so much to say about decisions, love, hatred and family while being hilarious, awesome and original at the same time. While I think some people may be turned off by some of the trippiness of the movie and visuals, I highly recommend this movie to everyone who wants to see a great original film. Seriously, if you have plans to go to the movies soon, this is a must watch. I don't think I will ever see another film like Everything Everywhere All at Once.

I not sure where to begin. I guess first of all, I'm surprised at all the 10-star reviews. Really?I tried to follow the plot, but not really sure if there is one.It is just a confabulation of events, if one can call it that. There is really no rhyme or reason. And the jilted Chinese accents were difficult to follow, and subtitles went way to fast. I paid $5.00 to rent this, I couldn't even finish it. In a word, abysmal.

I was losing my mind while watching it. There are lots of things and reference that keeps you pump up, and it's just hilarious.However, the main metaphor of the movie just seem very weak, and draggy at the end. At its basic, it's about a mother daughter relationship, however, the chemistry and backstory isn't there to justified the ending that was chosen.That said, I choose not to be too bothered by it, and just enjoy the film at its surface.Producers: Russo Brothers, Casting Director: Sarah for all you marvel fans.

Just a bad videogame - everything, everywhere is killing the love of cinema. Really, nothing happens. You just observe something irrelevant in a certain set... Next minute, the film changes set, just because. There's nothing fantastic in it, just a change of set as if you were playing a videogame: one button to to the left, one button to the right... and some characters mumbling an irrelevant dialogue. Really amazing is the fact that this year you have great films like "Tár" and this poor game of mirrors is celebrated like a real piece of cinema. The audiences, specially young people, are being taught to dispise the purity of cinema.

I was amazed at the reception of this film, seeing all the glowing reviews and praise this film was getting. It was encouraging to see plus the fantastic box office as well meaning it wasn't just snobby critics that liked this film but general audiences as well.Wow was I disappointed by the outcome after watching this film. I feel as if I have watched something completely different to what everyone else saw.Firstly I completely respect the craftsmanship this film is made with, it is very unique, original and bold. I have to give the filmmakers/writers credit with that. Cannot claim they are doing something boring and re-done many many times. I can also understand how that would resinate with people and become popular, plus the allure of an A24 production. Also what a boost this must be for the Asian community having such a huge film like this be so popular in "western" culture, huge win!It's all good being original, however its still got work as one cohesive film. That is why I do sort of feel that this film might be a "me" problem as well. I never got on board with the story right from the get go. Never got behind the characters, never felt attached to them in any way shape or form. This 100% feels like a film that needs multiple viewings to be appreciated and understood fully. However I was never enjoying myself watching this.........the multi-universe wall breaking concept, although fascinating, becoming very boring quickly! At some points it was almost cheesy, not a good sign!More felt like "To much going on" all at once! Nothing felt cohesive as if this film had like 20 writers working on it all at once. This film aims for stars, for me it facepalms the moon....... I can see where its going and its potential however for me I just never could get into the story. It introduces a new thing and then within minutes its onto the next, nothing gets to marinade and breath.Maybe I'll re-watch it again in the future and it'll click for me? I'm on the fence, I appreciate and can see the talent on had with the concept of the story and the directing....(acting is also fine in the film)......Sadly for me it doesn't work overall.50% out of 100.

For some reason, then I had been putting off getting to watch "Everything Everywhere All at Once" a couple of months. And let me just say that it was a mistake on my account.The storyline in "Everything Everywhere All at Once", as written by Dan Kwan and Daniel Scheinert, was rather impressive. It was a very original storyline, one that proved every bit entertaining and enjoyable, as it was bizarre and hilarious. There were so many things going on in "Everything Everywhere All at Once", that the movie is well worth watching more than just once.I was initially drawn to the movie as it had Michelle Yeoh on the cast list, and she was spectacular in this movie. I dare say that her performance in this 2022 movie makes it worth the 139 minutes of watching the movie. Now, she wasn't alone in carrying the movie, because the entire cast performed quite well. It was a blast to see Jamie Lee Curtis in this movie and in such a role. The movie also had the legendary James Hong on the cast list.Visually then "Everything Everywhere All at Once" is a trip in its own. There are so many things going on that it is hard to take it all in at once. And as such, the movie can easily be seen more than a single time. And the visual effects in the movie as spot on and look good, which definitely talks in favor of the movie."Everything Everywhere All at Once" was a blast of a surprise and a very enjoyable movie. Keep in mind, that the storyline itself is a bit spaced out and out there, but it works so wonderfully well. This movie from writers and directors Dan Kwan and Daniel Scheinert is a movie that I warmly recommend you to watch.My rating of "Everything Everywhere All at Once" lands on a well-deserved seven out of ten stars.

Finding it difficult to think of the words to use to review this movie.Acting 9/10Top notch performances from everyone involved. Yeoh in particular is magnificent. Great to see 'Shorty' make a major flick comebackPlot 5/10People seem to think it's hugely original but if you think about it, it's got loads ripped off from The Matrix. Some funny parts and an interesting concept but too slow, mainly due to the huge over use of slow motion effectsEntertainment 5/10Some entertaining parts with nice choreography and fight scenes but it felt way too long and started to drag near the endCinematography 10/10Some truly beautiful scenes and very well madeCharacters 6/10Lead and her husband are great. Her dad is great too. Daughter rather annoying.Effects 10/10Superb. Top notch, especially during a time of some diabolical CGI being used in media.Dialogue 7/10Great mix of the two languages. Some truly mental dialogue at times.Longevity 3/10I won't be watching it again. I feel like it won't be a long lasting classic that people talk about in the future.Music 2/10Actually pretty poor. Quite annoying and frustrating at times. Hurt my brain.Flow/Pace 3/10Far too slow and really dragged towards the end. Too much slow motion used.Overall average 6/10.
Absolutely THE worst film I have ever seen, and I am old enough to have seen a lot of films. I stayed to the end, but I wish I had left after the first half hour. Horrible film!

Now, I must declare an interest. I'm a martial arts expert and kung fu movies do nothing for me - I see the fakery. The entire movie seemed to be a loop of the same fight scene. Boring.The parellel universe has been done to death in other movies and no matter how bad they were, they were better than this.this.It is the only film I have watched to the end and still hated - how did it get so many 10 star reviews???I didn't care a jot about any of the characters, could care less how it ended or who won. Take this movie and remake it word for word, scene for scene, with unknowns and most would have given it a one star. The ratings are more for who is in it than the actual content. Dire, dire, dire.

reviews.review_title: Couldn't stand it anymore - walked out
reviews.content: I don't normally walk out of a movie, in fact, I can't think of the last time I did.But, this movie will cure insomnia and lose hours of your precious life.Do not bother going as it's unfathomable, boring and disjointed.

reviews.review_title: Across The Multiverses I Chose You Because You're the Best Movie I've Ever Watched
reviews.content: Across the multiverses i've seen thousands of movies and I chose you because you're the best movie I've ever seen, and being my number one favorite movie.Just watch it and it was more that what I was expecting for. Super fun, super funny, super cool, gorgeous visual, I always laughing cause this movie was very funny. The story is kinda weird and absurd but trust me it was so so so so good, you need to see this movie once in your lifetime.Within only 9 people in Visual effect team they're really do a great job cause the cgi and the visual effect in this movie was super good and the visual in this movie was so gorgeous, pretty I love it. And I think this is my favorite A24 movie and my Favorite movie cause there's all in this movie like sad, funny, super enjoying action, beautiful visual. I feel like I need to see this movie again cause I can't just watch it once in my life.

I've wanted to watch this for some time now, and was not disappointed.It's chaotic, VERY creative and more importantly.. it delivers on an emotional level, with a message that should reverberate with anyone, out of shared pain, experiences and a desire for something better.For me, just like it's title, it has a little bit of everything. It might have been predictable in some developments, unrealistic in others (even with the weird rules it sets for itself, but for obviously-fabricated-memorable-moments) and a few lows and slow-paced scenes. But it doesn't matter, because execution is everything! I was entertained, touched and excited as well. It does things we expect and but it also delivers something you probably have only ever imagined. And it works very well. Specially the way it ends the conflict it started, and how it all feels very human.I also quite enjoyed the superb sound editing!Easy recommendation for anyone interested in having a small journey. One that might leave you exactly where you started, but with a small smile that might spark something unexpected. I don't know.

Quite possibly the stupidest movie I've seen in many years. It looks like it was made by a high school movie class. Silly special effects, low budget "sci-fi" props (2 Bluetooth headsets used together? Really?). I cannot for the life of me figure out why this is nominated for anything. Apparently this is "the film" this year. Really dumb.From the outset of this movie I kept waiting for it to get interesting, the only thing I could think of throughout the movie was that the actor who played the grandfather was the same actor who played the manager of the Chinese restaurant in the famous Seinfeld Chinese restaurant episode. Every time he was on screen I kept hearing him say "Cartwright?" Unfortunate for him, I'm sure he's a talented actor.Really, don't spend a dime to watch this. It'll be streamable for free soon enough. It's just bad.

reviews.review_title: convinced they bribed people to say this film is good
reviews.content: I just have this feeling that they bribed people to say this is a good film. And, because of that, it has influenced the masses. I think it was a societal push type of film; one to get a message and agenda across by appealing to society today. I was bored and thought it was terrible. So much cringe.

I really hate to write and give a bad score like this one. However myself watching with my mum both agreed it was time to turn off around the 45minute mark.It's just such a bizarre movie, at first I was intrigued as to what may come next, but I was only left with confusion and uncertainty.For me it was in comparison albeit no where near its level to a "fake" inception movie but as previously mentioned no where near the class or production to even compare.Upon seeing this currently rated at time of writing this review at a steady 8.1 out of 10 I'm left disapproved and dissatisfied, and begin to wonder if the ratings mean anything anymore?Just really wasn't for myself or mum this turn round.

10 minutes into it and I was nauseous due to the frantic camera movements and nonstop incessant dialog. Insufferable. So I turned it off. That's really all I wanted to say but I can't post this review unless it has a sufficient amount of characters...so if you couldn't watch Blair Witch Project without getting sick to your stomach don't even try to watch this because you will suffer the same fate. Just from the brief time that I watched this movie I can understand why it was nominated for an academy award. Oscars not so white any longer. Unfortunately that doesn't mean that they are any better.

I laughed, I cried; I peed myself but couldn't access the multiverse. There seems to be a massive disclosure going on. Everywhere I look there are info drops about time ravel, other dimensions and truths that have always been there but kept hidden. Glad this was made...It all makes sense now...

Nothing in this movie makes sense, it starts off alright but goes downhill when the illogical part of the plot starts. Heavily overrated IMHO, don't let the camera switching scenes 3 times per second distract you from the fact that this is not an exciting movie. By the way, do NOT watch this of you are an epileptic..5/10.

reviews.review_title: It had everything, was everywhere all at once
reviews.content: What can I say, I laughed, cried, cringed and felt fulfilled all while watching this movie. It had the laugh out loud humor you would expect of anime and real subtle ones as well. As for the acting, it was sublime. It seems those who gave this movie a low star rating was because they set their expectations WAYYY too high or they could not go past the culture barrier. They will grow up someday...or not. Go watch this movie and give it a real try.

Question. What is the hype around this movie? It is complete nonsense, quite badly made and we have a universe where everyone has hot dogs for fingers....Some of the acting is cheap, the writing is cheap, the imagination of alternate universes is cheap, the 'message' of the movie is corny an cheap.It is BAFFLING how this movie has been nominated for Oscars for any category, let alone best film. The Oscars and their credibility have sunk even further down the pan. It whiffs of token gestures. It's an insult to anyone's intelligence watching it and suggesting to them this is possibly the best movie of the last 12 months.It tries to be funny, Jamie Lee Curtis's performance comes closest to achieving anything like comedic. The end. Even that storyline goes cringe in the end though.I'll try and end on a positive and say I've sat through worse. That's the best I can do. Complete rubbish.

reviews.review_title: A must watch movie for any parents out there.
reviews.content: Connects you on a emotional level goes fast funny confusing tragic all emotions but delivers a final message although there are movies out there delivering messages not be shy of who you are etc etc this movie really brings out it's not easy as it is said no matter what universe you are you cant be Everything Everywhere All at Once. So cherish each moments with your loved ones .

reviews.review_title: A24's most insane film to date.
reviews.content: As a fan of A24, I knew nothing about this film & I'm happy that I didn't because this film was insane. Everything Everywhere All at Once (2022) is a must-watch for A24 fans.

The topic of familial relationships could have been interesting. Unfortunately, it has been glossed over in favor of superficial fight scenes, overcomplicated multiverse nonsense, wannabe philosophy, crude unfunny jokes and scenes.There must definitely be some herd mentality effect behind so many positive reviews.

reviews.review_title: This Movie Answers the Question of What Would Happen if You Put EVERYTHING on a Bagel
reviews.content: This film is easily one of the greatest ever made. I laughed, I cried, I had an existential crisis. A perfect movie. Couldn't ask for more. This movie deserves all the praise it gets, and certainly deserves more.

This is a movie like no other before. It has a truly unique story which starts of with a tax audit and ends up in places you never could imagined. Visually stunning, funny script, some great action pieces, wonderfully acted, superbly edited and creative from start to the end. One of the best movies of 2022 for sure and a film that surely will go down as one the most memorable films in the last decade.

Without spoiling you, basically this is just another nihilistic movie about existential crisis that states the solution for finding a reason to don't suicide is loving your family and your partner therefore this movie disappointed me. If I had known this movie has a such point of view I wouldn't watch it. I only gave 5 out of 10 just because of its sense of humour, otherwise the movie is very empty uninteresting movie. I liked cinematography, the style of the movie and the acting in general but these had no effect on my score.So, what if you cannot love anybody but yourself and you don't care about having a partner? That's why this movie is primitive because it assumes everyone cares about their biological programming. It's better to only love yourself and enjoy your life by enjoying yourself by being yourself no matter what. But according to this movie everyone would suicide when they don't have family and they don't have a partner which doesn't make sense.In detail, it just didn't make sense when people start to have existential crisis just because they could travel between parallel universes. And it didn't make sense why they started to believe "nothing matters". It doesn't make sense because if you are such a person you would believe "nothing matters" when you living your only one life so how being aware of living in lots of parallel universes can make you believe "nothing matters"? In real life people don't suicide because somehow they enjoy their life and they have no reason to suicide. It's not about what matters. It's all about they believe living life is better than suiciding even though they may believe "nothing matters".I also think the idea of "nothing matters" depends on the context. For example when you have a husband and a child who loves and needs you, your life and therefore everything matters because you have to be part of the family so you have to judge everything in the context of if it will hurt your family or not. That's how family works. But for example for me it wouldn't matter to do something to save the human race because the human race doesn't matter to me. They will die anyway so what's the point? In that regard I think "nothing about the human race matters" as well as "nothing about my life matters" but I didn't have to be aware of my lives in parallel universes and I'm not suicidal. Carpe diem, bruh. No reason to be emo about it. But I think Nacho Cheese Doritos matters because it taste so good.I think it was the right choice to make this movie have a decent sense of humor otherwise I would stop watching this movie after like 30 minutes because it was very boring but I stayed for the sense of humour. The Crazy random interesting sense of humour saved my day.

Wow! With all the awards hype around this movie I expected to at least be mildly entertained. I was not. It is relentlessly over wrought, banal and narratively obsequious. Not worth reviewing frankly. What is going on with movies these days? Remember when 'Nomadland' won best picture? That was weird but you could blame it on the pandemic. Maybe if I saw it in a theatre where I'd be trapped into making more of an investment. This makes my list of worst movies ever. After the first ten minutes I paused the movie only to discover that I was forty five minutes in! All I could think of is what decisions had I made in my life that found me in a portion of the multiverse where this is considered a good movie! Yikes!

reviews.review_title: Creative coherent take on nihilism vs optimism
reviews.content: Rating: 7.8Multiverse movie about nihilism vs optimism. The presentation was creative and clean (for the most part) and the multiverse system was consistent and well explained. The premise itself is refreshing and the themes around generational trauma, and the choice we have to choose what matters when nothing matters were cohesive. The absurdist humor was obnoxious, as well as the action sequences (fanny pack kung fu, pinky kung fu, etc..) though it was nice to see the Bruce lee standing punch. It makes no sense how Evelyn was able to take a beating throughout the film even with multiversal fighting skills she's still an older lady who shouldn't even be remotely able to take a punch unscathed. But this movie isn't taking itself too seriously.

reviews.review_title: You either get it or don't
reviews.content: It's love and hate situation with this movie. If you get the message of the movie, you'll love it. Otherwise, it'll look just nonsense to you! Very well written and perfect execution! Third eye experience friendly!

I have zero bad thing to say about this movie. Firstly, I love how unapologetically Asian it is. Just how much Cantonese, Mandarin and Chinglish was spoken. Even the little Asian thing tune and habits were spot on. It was touching to see it being accurately portrayed on screen.The CGI was so fabulous and fun! The whole movie was so intense but it starts making more sense as it goes. I love how the coloring and makeup of Joy, and the set up plus various of the different universe.I just have a lot to digest regarding the meaning behind the film. But it really got me thinking about the infinite possibilities in life and how i let my parents possible reaction stop me from pursuing things I love. The bittersweetness of Asian family and generational trauma is very beautifully and naturally displayed. The last scene between Joy and Evelyn is EVERYTHING. It touched my soul when Evelyn said she'd choose this universe a thousand times.

reviews.review_title: A Cinematic Trip For The Mind And Soul
reviews.content: Upon seeing the trailer for Everything Everywhere All At Once, I sensed this film was something truly different. I have to say I wasn't disappointed in the slightest.I won't say much about it other than it was much deeper and moving than I expected. It'll leave you dizzy and teary eyed, and I mean that in the best way possible.Even though it's packed with action and lots of laughs (verbal and visual), this film demands your attention. So save the popcorn, Skittles and soda for the next Marvel schlock-fest, and buckle up, because you're in for one hell of a ride.10 out of 10.

I understand the message. Nice message hence two stars but the film is absurdly chaotic and more like a colorful circus performance than a superb film. I do not understand how this film can receive so many Oscar nominations! I am a movie buff and also studied film theory at University. This movie is a tornado of incoherence and you cannot wait until the tornado moves through so you can collect your thoughts after the storm. Reminds me of Symphony Fantastique by Berlioz, which was allegedly composed under the influence of drugs. However, Symphony Fantastique is actually an fascinating piece of Program music.

reviews.review_title: EEAAO is outstanding - you must see it if you get the opportunity!
reviews.content: A truly sensational film! The utter definition of a must-watch.'Everything Everywhere All at Once' is impressive from every single viewpoint. I had heard murmurs of it being a great film, yet it still managed to completely smash my expectations. This 2022 release features a superb cast, a fascinating story and some top notch visuals. The editing and pacing, in particular, are brilliant.The onscreen talent are all fantastic, but Michelle Yeoh is still the absolute standout from this. What a performance! I could watch her in this role over and over and over. With that said, Ke Huy Quan (welcome back!) is awesome as well, as are Stephanie Hsu, James Hong and Jamie Lee Curtis. Everyone plays their part very, very well.All of the humour lands, with some parts being truly funny. It also manages to show supremely enjoyable action alongside a highly meaningful side too. In short: EEAAO is outstanding - you must see it if you get the opportunity!Raccacoonie 👀

reviews.review_title: Aa perfect example of "modern" wokewood movie.
reviews.content:
Unbearable mess, watchable only when (as stated by lots in reviews) "under influence".This kind of... "movie" happens when 90% of the budget goes to controlled substances, 9% to Internet "reviewers", and 1% to trailers.I think that the actors worked for tips. :/
But hey! Now they film in digital, so no problem!

Yes, let's spend millions and exploit the imagination in ways we would never conceive - huge dildos as weapons, putting sticks up a butt to put him in a different universe, great kung fu fighting scenes etc - really out there and critics think this is brilliant? Chaotic mess many extremes. It was only the ending that tied it all together - but again - yes - that's life.The acting is over the top and I can see why the two main characters are up for awards. The cinematography was way out there - as was lighting and sound.I just didn't find this enjoyable because it's like ok - we have all these thoughts in our brain that we can act or react upon. Maybe it was my mood - but I just don't get the brilliance that everyone is talking about?

I could see this being being a kids movie if you removed the explicit scenes. I found myself constantly checking the time left in this movie because I just wanted it to end. I ended up stopping with 40 minutes left because I just couldn't watch anymore.

I love all the actors in this movie and was excited to see it with my wife. We see a tonne of movies and heard this was really imaginative.It may have been imaginative and innovative etc ... but it took all my strength to sit through this. I was totally bored. Actually bored is a complement, I felt tortured.I think I am not clever enough to understand how good this is supposed to be. I just found it really bad. Worst movie I have seen in a very long time.

I like sci-fi, I like silly, I like action, I like funny. Sometimes you put it all together and I love it, like the movie Scott Pilgrim. In this case though I don't think they did it quite right, like they did too much, tried too hard. So at the end of the day, the cast does a great job and it's visually very engaging, and overall quite entertaining. But it does feel a bit messy without much of a point. I'd give it a 6.5 if it was an option.

Not my type of movie. Perhaps I am not artistic enough to understand. Thumb down for this movie.I am a bit disapointed when see Michelle's movie like this. A bit like Stephen Chow's movie. Insane and don't make sense.If you plan to spend time, can go a head with this movie.

You saw it before many times: the matrix, meets the worst Rick and Morty episode, EVER: sick, depraved, insane does not equate to original or entertaining. If you enjoyed this... you have serious mental issues!

reviews.review_title: First movie I've ever attended to receive an applause across the theater
reviews.content:
Nihilism explored in such a perfect, creative, mind-boggling and hilarious way.I walked out of the theater feeling elevated in a way I've never experienced from a movie.I'm not a wordsmith and have never left a movie review, but this movie deserves it. People need to know how amazing it is!To everyone involved in bringing this movie to life:
Thank you.

This movie is that kind of art - either you love it or you don't. There is a point don't get me wrong but coming to that point could have been done in a more entertaining maybe even fun way. Jokes are not that funny at all and everything seems like the producers and directors along with actors took some really heavy drugs before making this movie. I liked the ending but it was an effort to go through this entire movie without turning it off.

I watched "Everything Everywhere All at Once" recently. It is a very strange movie about multiple realities intersecting and affecting the entire universe. It is up to a middle-aged Chinese immigrant (Michelle Yeoh) to save the universe! Also involved is Jamie Lee Curtis as an overzealous IRS auditor! To me, it seemed like being in an overlong acid trip (although I have never taken LSD, it seemed like something one might experience on that drug!). So, I am not sure I can recommend this movie, except that Michelle Yeoh and especially Jamie Lee Curtis's performances are very good. I found the movie itself to be overstuffed, overlong and ultimately ridiculous. 5/10.

reviews.review_title: Inventive but just too weird for me
reviews.content:
POSITIVES:1) The performances were great, especially in the more emotional moments. I really did feel for Evelyn, Joy and Waymond in particular and that is testament to the actors portraying them
2) The film is bonkers and it's really a credit to the writers that they were able to come up with a script this inventive and unusual. Whilst not all of the ideas work for me, there are some which work really really well
3) The fight scenes, particularly in the first half of the film, are really cool and fun to watch
4) The film explores nihilism and the meaning of life in some really engaging and interesting ways, particularly after Joy is revealed to be the villainNEGATIVES:1) The film uses waaaaaay too much slow motion. It's constant throughout the film and it was really irritating me by the end
