On the one hand, she is quite a big asshole to her daughter because she is still stuck to old values, but we understand her more and more the better we get to know her. Well, and she is also sympathetic because she is a bit clumsy and dreamy. This also means that she cannot do everything immediately. When there are fight scenes, it takes time for her to master them and manage to enter other universes. At least on purpose. She is a multi-layered character with weaknesses, with strengths and a great character development. And the same applies to the rest of the characters.But probably it's also due to the great actors who embody the fantastic characters. Michelle Yeoh is just great in the role and plays everything damn convincingly so that she could carry the film on her own shoulders. But fortunately she doesn't have to, because after all she also gets great support. Among others, of course, from Ke Huy Quan. Except for Indiana Jones and The Goonies, I didn't really know him, but he's probably the heart of the film. He is so naive and actually always in a good mood and always nice and he just plays a character you have to like. But Stepahnie Hsu is also great and always convincing in her role, even if I didn't really know her before. Well, and then of course there is Jamie Lee Curtis who can also be seen here in a completely different role than you are used to from her. Well, and what more can you say, except that she is also fantastic.But as already mentioned, not everything is so perfect in my opinion. There is the first act, which I think takes too long. The characters are introduced, their relationships with each other and the film is built up, but the first act is clearly the weakest. Or then there are other little things. For example, I am bothered by the fact that in a multiverse full of different possibilities, the good and evil are mother and daughter. I know it's about family, but I still found it a bit too constructed. For example, I would have liked it better if the antagonist had been someone completely different or Evelyn herself.Well, I'm just saying that the movie isn't perfect, but what's perfect? (Except Fight Club, of course) But even if something is not perfect, you can still love it and somehow that's probably the message of this film. Unconditional love.

reviews.review_title: Best film I've seen in years
reviews.content: I never write reviews on here but I just HAD to for this movie. This movie is genre-defying and so unbelievably creative, humorous, thrilling, stunning, and ingenious. Do not miss seeing this in theaters. From the unexpected plot to the costume design, special effects, and incredible cast, it's an A+++ all around.

What is in the film multiverse jumping somewhere and anywhere
Little bit comedy
Over highly rated
Confusing scenes
Lengthy
Action scenes are nice
Nothing more to hype or overate the movie.

reviews.review_title: I love this movie in every universe all at once
reviews.content: This movie was the best experience I've ever hand on cinema. I was sad and happy, I was laughing and crying in every universe all at once.Go and watch this, you other self already watched this and loved it.

This film was the best film I've seen all year I was so desperate to watch it, as the UK got a delayed release date, luckily with my Odeon limitless membership I got to experience this work of art a couple of days early. Visually this film is stunning, most of the shots are just so amazing to look at and must have taken quite some ingenuity to put together. The different universes are so well handled and all feel vastly different from one another but are also grounded in a somewhat similar reality. There are plenty of moments where I heard the whole crowd laughing as there wasn't a single line that didn't land well. The performances by Yeoh and Quan are very well executed giving life to incredibly fleshed out and relatable characters who you really empathise with and want to see overcome their barriers and obstacles they encounter. The overall philosophical message I took form the film was of Nihilism and how sometimes there is no meaning to what events happen, but not to get too bogged down so that you don't see what's truly important right in front of you. This was very liberating and refreshing to see. I've never heard of the director duo before but I know they're now on my radar and I am extremely excited to see what other works they will be creating and will surely dive deeper into their previous cinematic works. It comes to no surprise why this film was produced by A24 who have produced other amazing films such as Moonlight and The Lighthouse. This film is a must watch, you won't regret it.

reviews.review_title: Random is not the same as creative
reviews.content: Unfortunately, it is not as fun as I was waiting. I can't understand all th hype honestly. It looked like my childhood games, where someone would say a piece of a story, then another one completes it. Not funny, just random. The drama didn't catch me either. I may have smiled one time along the whole movie. My girlfriend slept. The film has its moments and its great a indie film is grabbing attention, but please see with low expectations. If this is the best film ever, I just want to quit cinema. Or probably people are seeing only marvel movies. Actually, Wandavision is way better. Nice film, just not the best ever like everybody is saying.

reviews.review_title: Unique, exciting, funny, touching... literally "everything", as the title implies.
reviews.content: This is a movie for which I came in with no expectations or prior knowledge, except something about googly eyes. Having watched the trailer after the fact, I think I still would not have been prepared for just how absurdly fantastic and out of this world EEAAO would be. This movie is probably one of the most unique films I've ever seen. It's not simply the visuals as others have pointed out that make this movie so different. It is also the direction, storytelling style, humor, and just the entire vibe of the movie, which blends and shifts between different elements and styles as fluidly as our protagonists shifts between versions of herself.The writing and direction here are top notch. While it does rush through the specifics of how the multiverse travel works, it explains precisely enough for you to follow along while not boring the audience with too many details. The main plot is laid out early, and is relatively straightforward, but still has enough twists and turns along the way to make it really fun and interesting. Our main antagonist and the main plot device are... fantastic, you'll see. The writing really shines when it comes to character development. This is heightened due to us of course seeing multiple versions of each character. We are able to see how characters differ in various universes, but also the core things that stay the same and really make each character who they are. More so than any other multiverse movie (which there are a lot of these days), this film really uses the alternate versions well as vehicles in order to further develop the main versions of our protagonists. A big part of this is the direction, and how the jumps between different multiverses are shot and timed. This is especially incredible during fight scenes, in which it will often quickly snap back and forth between the different versions of characters. It looked really slick and I'm in awe at how they were able to film it so well.As far as the acting - every single member of the cast was so superb. Michelle Yeoh was INCREDIBLE, I truly hope she gets nationwide recognition for her work here. She had amazing stunts as always, but also had scenes in which she could really showcase her acting and comedic timing. Ke Huy Quan, the actor who plays Waymond, was equally superb in my eyes. Some of you might recognize him as the little kid from Indiana Jones: Temple of Doom! His entire character is so unique, playing mostly a fragile man with a high pitched voice, but he really shines in ways you would not expect. He has one of the most memorable and well delivered scenes in the whole movie, which nearly brought me to tears. It seems he does not act much anymore but I would love to see him in more stuff. Stephanie Hsu, the daughter, was also fantastic and brought an amazing charisma to the movie. Good ole reliable James Hong did his thing as always. Probably the most interesting and funny performance to me was Jamie Lee Curtis as Deirdre, the IRS lady, who had some hilarious moments throughout the movie. All in all a stellar job from the entire cast.While I will likely need a second watch to try and fully grasp the message here (though not every movie has to have one), I did have a few takeaways on initial watch. I think this film really tries to tell us to appreciate what we have, even though it is quite literally focusing on the "what ifs" that lead to the alternate realities. Again without spoiling, each version of our protagonist has some flaws (some REALLY weird ones as you'll see) or some regrets. Applying this to just our non-multiversal reality, we tend to focus on what our peers around us have that we don't, when we should actually realize that everyone has things they regret or feel are missing. We should instead focus on fully cherishing the life we have and loving the people immediately around us. Another message, closely related to the first, seemed to be that we should sometimes slow down and just soak in what is around us rather than constantly worry about what is next. One particular scene involving silence and rocks especially drove this home. This soundless scene was placed so perfectly in the middle of a super audio-visual movie, and really made me feel how nice it was to just soak in the silence sometimes.A24 absolutely killed it with this one. I cannot wait to see what they have in store next. And I sincerely hope this film gets the recognition it deserves and wins awards. 10/10.

reviews.review_title: Movies this beautifully made come once every other decade. An absolute masterpiece.
reviews.content: I'm keep this review simple and short. Yes it is a great and beautifully made movie, from the cinematography to the script writing, the acting and the costume design, everything about this movie was done to almost perfection.If you make the decision to see this movie, after 2 hours you'd be filled with so much emotions, good emotions you'd probably cry tears of joy. A job well done and the high ratings you see isn't just hype.Enjoy the ride.

reviews.review_title: What the hell did I just watch???
reviews.content: I love artsy, indie, sci-fi, etc but I can't even tell you what genre this is supposed to be... first thought it was satire but halfway through felt as if my brain was undergoing a torture experiment -- it is definitely not comedy. It tries WAY TOO HARD to explore themes that frankly have been done better many times (Matrix, etc). I'm always up for a good mind-bender (Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind and Interstellar are 2 of my favorites) but this is a mess from beginning to end. It's chaotic and leaves you wondering what the plot even was. I expected "arthouse," but this should end up in the "outhouse."

The thing that impresses me most about this movie is how it remains coherent in spite of the multiple threads, not least the different iterations of each character, and how it manages to bring those threads together at the end, to be poignant and relevant, but to do this and be laugh-out-loud hilarious, too - that's something special.Up until Everything Everywhere All at Once, I hadn't seen either Michelle Yeoh or Jamie Lee Curtis do comical performances (I do watch movies and TV, honest), so the whole thing was a double delight!We could talk about the science fiction and how the movie was another take on the multiverse, but these were mere vehicles to whisk us along and communicate some strong themes, much the same as the outlandish weirdness of Being John Malkovich.It does demonstrate something I've learned as an aspiring writer: it makes no difference how implausible a situation is so long as the characters acknowledge and respond to things as we would ... to a degree - here I'm thinking about the head-with-legs scene in The Thing with Kurt Russell.An excellent movie.

I listen to a film podcast The Filmcast (great show) where the hosts actively avoid using the word "pretentious" when describing a film. I generally agree with their view on not using the adjective, since it rarely describes the movie and often short shrifts its content. This time, however, I must say I find it very difficult not to use this word in describing Everything Everywhere All at Once; the title of the movie already begs for the adjective, after all.I found this movie to be extremely boring and opportunistic, while at the same time it was trying way too hard to be inventive. There is a fake ending at around the half point of the film, which was a cruel joke. After that scene, the film seemed to drag on even worse. The technical directing, on the other hand, was masterful. Unfortunately, beautiful moving images aren't enough to keep me entertained.

I can't say I've related to a movie more in so many different and diverse possible ways. The film captures so many facets of the human experience. It is genuine heartfelt, smart, philosophical, funny, thrilling and wild.

This has been one of the best movies so far, in my opinion, I have seen recently. Too bad it has not been marketed much, but it is definetely worth the time and money. The whole cast is superb and terrific and the story is original and blew me away. Please see it. You won't be sorry. Michelle Yeoh is fantasic in this film.

I cant remember the last time I was so excited about a movie. Everything Everywhere All at Once was the best film I've seen in quite a while and an amazing breath of fresh air.One thing that really impressed me is that the movie worked on so many levels without feeling messy or convoluted. It was a great action movie, a comedy and a drama all rolled into one - and in some crazy and chaotic way it just worked! The film often had me laughing, crying and ond the edge of my seat within minutes and didnt have a boring minute over its two hour+ runtime.Another thing thats amazing about this movie is that its the perfect counter model to all the boring and mediocre blockbuster movies of today: it risked trying something new instead of relying on old patterns. This is also reflected in the way in which the movie defies gender roles. Instead of a square-jawed male action hero or an infallible female lead we get to main characters with individual strengths and weaknesses who complement each other. It was amazing to see Ke Huy Quan's character being a hero in its own relatable way withouth relying on stereotypical male qualities. I just hope we get more movies like this in the future!

It's absolutely impossible to understand why critics and Hollywood considered this ridiculous and boring movie as one deserving to be recommended, or nominated for 11 Academy Awards, including the Best Picture category.Even though the film has lots of expensive special effects, and good performances of the whole bunch of actors involved in it (including Jamie Lee Curtis' part as the IRS agent), it is absolutely void of any artistic essence.While suffering watching this naive product, I was thinking about other films which had been nominated to several Oscars before, like the excellents "BEN HUR", "GONE WITH THE WIND", "THE GODFATHER", "OUT OF AFRICA', "LAWRENCE OF ARABIA", "PATTON", "THE DEER HUNTER", "APOCALYPSE NOW", etc.; and came to the conclusion that films taste has unfortunately decayed through the years.

reviews.review_title: Both a mess and a waste of time
reviews.content:
Oscars or no Oscars when there is bad filmmaking, there IS bad filmmaking. When you can't understand the lead who is supposed to make any kind of sense of this messy, out of control, unrecognizable film, the viewer is in trouble.There is a reason why this actor has not acted in decades! And dto give him the lead, was ridiculous.Can you tell I am angry?I AM ANGRY.WhenI think about film, I am reminded that it starts with a STORY. A comprehensible, beginning, middle and end.This film did not have ANYTHING that resembled a cohesive story.I can see where this "thing" would appeal to gamers. It's fast-paced, loud (except for the dialogue, that was unintelligible, was that on purpose because there was no there, there...
What a mess, a sorry mess.What was the Academy non com thinking?I give up hoping that today's audience even cares about quality stories any more. Maybe COVID has not only made us sick but has hindered our taste as well.

I just want to say so many things but other reviewers already said everything everywhere all at once. It really has everything! Just watch it!P.s.Asian humor never fails to get me, it has one of the most hilarious scenes ever!

Stunning film, how it mixes action, fighting, comedy, family drama into a film that delivers is some achievement. Gorgeous film with some good family home truths, morals in there. Really surprised by how this finished and delivered. I hope they go and win all the awards, the film, story, cast deserve everything. Stunning film.

reviews.review_title: Been a long time since I fell inlonve with a film.
reviews.content: Probably the BEST I've seen in recent years.It struck fast, it struck hard, it struck everything everywhere all at once.If you take a moment to disconnect from popular media and judge the movie as it's own you'll love it even more. Comparing it to Matrix, Rick & Morty, Back To The Future and whatnot - it's all pointless and makes you miss the feeling of the film itself.I can feel so much similarity with the absurdism & nihilism "The Hitch Hikers Guide To The Galaxy" offered me. On purpose or not, it matters less, but the feeling of having to deal with the absurdity of life with a straight face - Absolutely stunning and hitting. Just like the book series I mentioned.Of course, if you don't enjoy or handle less well dark comedy & fast yet complicated plot, don't force yourself. But if you push past the discomfort and try and focus on the philosophical points of the film - I doubt you'll regret it. I've seen so many people miss the point by complaining about the humor or similarity to other things, which is an absolute shame. I don't mind people not liking certain stuff, but for the love of god, at least UNDERSTAND the film first.

Profoundly cerebral. Deeply invocative. Insanely absurb. Brilliantly conceptual. Ridiculously and hilariously obscene. Spiritually evolved. Universally anchored in one message. Takes a real 3rd eye and all chakras fully spinning to absorb this movie and immerse into its cosmic plasma of awareness. Thank you for realigning what matters in my own reality happening currently - for real.

Michelle Yeoh is one of my favourite actors. She's one of those rare gems who seems to care for the role she's playing and seeks out the unusual. She kinda reminds me of John Hurt in that regards.As such I was looking forward to seeing this. I missed it at the theatres (curse you covid) so had to make do with renting on a streaming service.I was not disappointed. Everything Everywhere All at Once is a fantastic film. One of the best I've seen in a long time. And it's so nice to come across something this isn't just some franchise mass produced, money grab content. I love my weird and wild adventures. This gives me hope that cinema isn't dead.Probably my only complaint (and that might be because I've been mildly depressed for so many years now that I don't actually feel anything anymore) is that I felt there was too much focus on side concepts at times. I just feel like some ideas were awesome to begin with, but wore out their welcome after a while. And that if the film was a little tighter it would've popped more. As is, it's still fantastic and I will definitely add it to my DVD collection (yes I still buy DVDs/Blurays but they're reserved for my favourites)

reviews.review_title: Shallow flashy movie with good cinematography and no cinsistency.
reviews.content: Do you know what a MacGuffin is? Basically it's a plot device with no reasoning or depth, that exists only to move the plot. Well here, you have a movie where every character is a MacGuffin. Cinematography is the only thing that stands out with quality here, and for that I give it 5 stars. The story is all over the place, non of the characters have depth to them. Evil guys are evil just to be evil, good guys are good just to be good, main special person is main and special JUST because they needed someone to be so. You will see a lot of scenes "inspired" by old classics, but it feels like the creators didn't see any of them, relying on the movie poster to understand what those classics were all about. Imagine if all you knew about "2001: A Space Odyssey" is that it's a movie where monkeys find an obelisk, and that's it. This movie doesn't borrow from years of quality cinema, it is a shallow attempt to pretend to be one of the cool kids.Maybe you will like the movie if you're drunk or high.

reviews.review_title: Every meme everywhere all at once
reviews.content: As much as I enjoyed Michelle Yeoh's acting, the movie itself is no more interesting than a series of combined social media memes. It will appeal to a younger generation but the visuals were not for me and thus had no comedy quality. What was left then was an interesting storyline that would have been better off without the unnecessary goofy elements such as the bagel which for me ruined the entire movie and made it seem like it was trying too hard to be symbolic, accessible and popular. The underlying messages and references were nothing but a sweeping acceptance and self-acceptance thing. Not so much to think upon.I found the opening scene to be much more promising when it stayed in the realm of realism which made the title less literal and the story somehow deeper. Being everywhere all at once with no time for yourself to figure out what is happening in your life is a great theme and a more realistic portrayal of the situation would have led to the same amount of absurdity, only maybe more subtle than what it turned out to be.

The film strikes a good balance between stimulus overload and actually having a lesson to teach. Although the moral of the story has been told before, it is the mind bending form that sets this film apart. Though the film gets conceptual (and quirkily random UwU) really quickly, it does so with clarity and grace - Nolan take note. On the other hand, it does lose pace in the middle and desperately reiterates the same point. (Kinda like a kid telling a joke and asking if you got it, numerous times.) Also the setting gets a bit mundane as the film progresses.All in all, the experience is worth it as the film attempts a striking a deeper note by allowing character transformations and reappraisals, something it's younger target audience can do well to follow.

reviews.review_title: My favorite film of 2022 is one for the ages
reviews.content: I was skeptical due to the multi-verse storyline, which I've honestly had little interest in exploring historically speaking. That said, the combination of the cast and A24 intrigued me enough to put my multi-verse prejudice aside and go in with an open mind.Though it took until the second act to really come together for me, the set up was essential for letting the elaborate story unfold. There were a few times I thought it was trying to do too much, but that idea would subside with each action sequence or poignant moment between the truly lovable characters.In terms of comparisons; it has shades of 'Matrix' (R. I. P.) but with far more heart, humor and creativity. There was a Charlie Kaufmann-esc depth to the script that ultimately drew me into this world of infinite imagination. Unlike Kaufmann, Daniels ('Swiss Army Man') have a dramatically more optimistic view of human nature that I found both refreshing and necessary considering the world we find ourselves in post COVID.The third act is transcendent in every sense of the word. Without giving away too much, I can say for certain that they stick the landing with such poise here that I found myself misty eyed and laughing for a solid 30 minutes. It's rare that a film -let alone a science fiction film with an unlikely combination of characters- elicits such a profound emotional response from me. From what I've been seeing and hearing I'm not alone there. A+On a related note, I would place 'Everything Everywhere All At Once' right behind 'Moonlight' and 'Ex Machina' as my top A24 film to date. Kudos once again to the greatest independent entertainment company in existence.

reviews.review_title: What the heck was even going on ?
reviews.content: I don't know if it was just me but I just didn't get it. Why did she even do all of that and in the end she gave a hug and went back to the same life ? Idk how this movie got a 8.9/10 lol.

Everything Everywhere All At Once, the perfect name for this crazy movie.One of the most original things you'll see in your life.Even if you don't want to go too deep into it's meaning you'll have a lot of fun.The movie feels like a videogame, the first 20 minutes of the movie are some kind of tutorial, the rules are explained and once you get everything you'll flow with the action.What a ride, you'll laugh and the ending if a bit predictable will still make you shed some tears.

It feels like more and more everyday there continues to be more and more Deathnote. The biblical allegorys and refrences this film shows just undermines all the work that Japanese authors put into their work. This movie is disgraceful to the entire world!!!!!

What a total pale of nonsense. This movie lacks everything intelligent people are looking for. No storyline at all. Just a lot of multi universe bs and confusing dialogues. The Emperor's New Clothes, nothing more, nothing less. Couldn't finish it because of the severe headache I got after 1½ hours of watching this mess. To be avoided at all costs.

reviews.review_title: Very good but could have been a masterpiece
reviews.content: 3rd watch and back to my initial opinion. A masterpiece from a technical point of view, with great performances (Hsu is perfect, but Yeoh and Quan do a great job too) and I love almost all the slow moments (a bit too much exposition in the third act though).I still think this would be even better with less 20-25 minutes and that the 2nd act is too much, it's overwhelming and I always disconnect for some minutes, feeling the urge to pause it.The themes are relevant and the way they are treated in the script is great. A bit less of that "ecstasy feeling" or stupidity for the sake of it and could have been one of the greatest. Either way, a must-see and a film that can leave a mark on an entire generation. Or at least, on Film Twitter.

This is yet another of the movies that the critics rave about, will will loads of awards and at the end of the day is a confused mess. At a run time of 2 hours 20 minutes this got on my nerves well before the end even though I did stick with it.It's all about time travel and different dimensions and here I will admit that the editing is fantastic and should definitely win an Oscar. But the film really does jump about all over the place and it is also at least 30 minutes too long. Michelle Yeoh is always worth watching and there is a good performance from Ke Huy Quan as her husband. But too many scenes are filler and not needed at all and it's a movie that will not linger in my memory. At the end of it all it is in very basic terms a story about a Mother/Daughter relationship and it takes an utterly bizarre route to get there.

reviews.review_title: It's imaginative, new and bloody tedious
reviews.content: This film has moments of real quality throughout, it is beyond wacky and is the modern day Dr Strangelove in its out there brilliance. 5 sittings it took to watch the whole movie as it was like a constant buzz saw, unrelenting and demanding, an unruly child that wouldn't give up. I kind of liked it but will never watch it again as it is so in your face for such an awful long time that I had to keep stopping the movie and come back another day to continue.The actors are good and I love the minimalist cast and the multi-roles, I can see this style working on the stage with minimalist sets and cast and it is very cleverly worked. Action scenes are great although the hot dogs are gross.It just feels like too much and I love long narrative and FX laden movies but this was too much for me.

Wow. This movie deserves an Oscar or more! Quality. Life lessons. Will stay with me. Will definitely rewatch it again. The plot, the storyline, the characters are all fantastic. Kept me captivated in what is happening every second. Enjoyed the 3 parts seperation. If I could help them with their taxes I would.

reviews.review_title: Taking in the "Everything" and Understanding the "Everything"
reviews.content: Some of the most important ingredients needed to make a film possible are passion, determination and craft- but most importantly it takes an immeasurable amount of CREATIVITY! If it's one thing I've learned with seeing films from both A24 and The Daniels, creativity is a quality neither are short of when it comes to displaying it out to the world. With all that being said the latest venture from The Daniels, Everything Everywhere All at Once, is one of the most extraordinary and pleasantly psychotic pieces of entertainment I've ever seen on the silver screen!!! This film fires on all cylinders when it comes to displaying the abundant amount of originality and creativity behind its premise, which I something you don't see very often in movies today. It's a real rarity when finding films of this nature that not only succeeds in whacky & absurd entertainment (being action or what not), but also finding the time to deliver a meaningful & and complex story that you're unlikely to forget anytime soon.Based on my observations from previous Daniels' productions, I came to expect the usual quirks and weirdness with their brand of humor but never did I expect for it to effectively blossom as it did on such a large scale. Tagging alongside the humor, there is a great amount of heart and feeling to further increase your emotional intake as you truly do feel just about 'everything'. The Daniels have found such a creative & moving method to demonstrate a vast array of emotions, which never feels like it will teeter too far in one direction. An immeasurable sense of fun stays with you all the way through- that's a feeling I rarely get to experience in such a consistent manner where it lingers onward after the screening. An experience like this one has managed to carefully and cleverly infuse so many emotions to feel when watching EEAAO, which can be easily trace back to the craftsmanship of this film's directing duo. All the plethora of feelings to experience here are attributed by the amazing direction & writing from Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert, who allowed themselves to let their creative juices flow so openly and freely. Perhaps the only gripe I would have is that a few minutes could have been shaved off, which may not seem like a major deal at first but at times a few minutes more or less in a film can make a huge difference. As I've mentioned before, the majority of the time (practically 100%) I enjoyed myself during the screening, but it did feel ever-so-slightly longer than it needed to be. For me this was a very minor dent in the overall experience but it was not enough to damage the massive enjoyment and thrill ride this film was.With this film still being more of an indie flick, you would think there'd more limitations as to what they are able to do here, yet the production teams utilize what's available to them and more in order to create the wild spectacle presented to you. Both practical and special effects are demonstrated throughout the film, which is a quality that may go unappreciated at first but later on you could look back it and applaud for what these filmmakers had to work with. Budgets and finances for a film of this type don't usually happen often, but for the instance of EEAAO the money was used adequately across all areas whether it be production design, costumes, visual effects or sound. As an audience member, it's a great feeling when you see filmmakers like The Daniels who seemed to have used their film's budget wisely without making it look like they deliberately cut corners to save a few bucks. It's a discouraging feeling to go see a movie nowadays and you see a blatantly incomplete product right in front of you, especially, when you see the big price tag attached to the film. In the case of EEAAO, it looks like every dollar was spent accordingly and it feels as complete as it a film should be when you see it in a theater. On both the narrative and technical levels, a film of this nature finds itself in a cozy little spot to fully display its colors in the upmost confidence without damaging itself by means of nonsensicalness & outlandishness.Besides the filmmakers and rest of the crew, a cast makes up the other majority of creativity power behind a film. And this cast... is OUTSTANDING!!! We have here a lively and energetic group of performers that give their everything in terms of delivering dimensional performances, plus the energy behind their performances shows just how much fun they seemed to have tremendous fun while making this film. Michelle Yeoh & Ke Huy Quan are the major standouts among this cast, but it wouldn't be fair to not mention performances from Stephanie Hsu & Jamie Lee Curtis who also give some notable performances. The leading lady herself, Michele Yeoh, truly shines as an actress with her continuously impressive physicality and emotional range with a character like Evelyn Wang. Making leaps and bounds across the multiverse, Yeoh seamlessly jumps between comedic and dramatic moments with each of those showing her 110% devotion to those moments. Alongside Yeoh, Ke Huy Quan makes an explosive return to the silver screen as an optimistic hearted and fun-loving character that serves as so much of the soul among the whole cast. As to the antagonist here, Stephanie Hsu's Joy Wang acts as a good clashing figure to go up against Michele Yeoh's Evelyn. Joy's character is complicated and emotionally resonating as someone simply wanting to be accepted and loved while understanding the craziness of the multiverse, which Hsu does exceedingly well. Plus it's amazing to seeing actresses Michele Yeoh and Jamie Lee Curtis being given the opportunity to play characters like these at their ages and show off just how badass they can be.Creating something like EEAAO is a once in a lifetime kind of film where you get a meaningful and humorous story as well as a wildly entertaining spectacle that brings nothing but fun to all who watch it. A24 has done it once again as a studio known for creating new and original pieces that truly standout among the mass collective of films coming out every year. The Daniels have placed themselves in a special place in people's consciousness as filmmakers that will surely blow their minds with the unexpected and wildly creative imagination to come out of any two people's brains. It's an exciting opportunity to see cast of this caliber and creative vision this distinctive to shine as bright as it has in this very cluttered world.

reviews.review_title: Emotional rollercoaster! The worst movie ever yet the best one!
reviews.content:
In this order ->
At the beginning you get confused about all the hypes and get disappointed. You don't halt watching it because you wanna understand what the movie is about. You reach halfway with that confused state. Then you start to understand the concept -> then you start to enjoy it somehow -> then you get the point of the movie and you start to think about yourself -> then you start to think about this cruel world -> at the last part of the movie you completely understand the message of the movie and you become emotional with what you see in it. You may cry but at the end you may see and feel the better version of you running on your body. The movie ends then you join the group who hyped the movie."PLEASE BE KIND, ESPECIALLY WHEN WE DON'T KNOW WHAT'S GOING ON"bye.

reviews.review_title: The most original movie I've seen in a while
reviews.content: The last movie which made me feel this certain type of way was Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind. Such an original idea, combined with great cinematography, makes this amazing. A perfect mixture of comedy, action, sci-fi with big philosophical questions leading the plot. A true 10/10.

I had a lot of expectations for this movie after hearing so much positive about the movie from both critics and the audience. The makers tried to be deep and profound, but what resulted was two hours of head-splitting chaos and confusion. I just don't understand the hype for this movie. They tried too hard to be weird. I think at the end they were trying to pull the heartstrings, but I was too confused to know for sure. I'm not even sure what the movie was about. Whatever it was, they should have had an epileptic seizure warning. Overall, it was just a messy movie with bad editing and it was just movie's luck that it worked at box office.

I hated this film ! Not often I want to walk out but my friend insisted on staying until the predictable end
Confusing, weird, overlong story about absolutely nothing !I may be oldish, but generally like off beat films, but for me.....a ghastly waste of time.

reviews.review_title: Between a sentimental rock and a thousand hard places
reviews.content: You remember that observation that someone with a fancy car was usually compensating for "something" or shall we say, a lack of something?... I feel I could apply that to this film, but the fancy car in this films case is a stylish cinematic visual orgy, and what's being compensated for is (imo) the ability to visually and creatively convey human truth and touch the human heart. They tried, they really did, but it's similar to people who overindulge on self-help lifestyles, and throw every bit of hypocritical guru advice, 'spiritual' workshop, buddhist mantras, Alan Watts diatribe and the garden ornaments with the kitchen sink thrown in for good measure, it's just too much to the point the core of the intention is lost in the superfluous, crushed in the mass volume of input.This film has so much going on, that in places and at times it creates a sensory input overload, and by the time the lovely sweet, almost gushy but very meaningful beautiful message of finding love in the mundane and those around us, myself and I feel others who have watched this who saw through the glitz and glamour are left with a cinematic experience of a film who's heart suffers from existential density. It is dense because of the amount of matter shoved into a heart shaped chocolate box, filled with concrete.Let me suddenly shift things a bit, not unlike the films visual style... I have been a fan of Michelle Yeoh since Police Story 3. One of my favourite films I have seen her in is "Sunshine", which I think is highly underrated. She shined in that movie, even though it wasn't a major part for her, it really showed her talent in a short space of screen time. Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon, a beautiful experience, imo was the highlight of her career, a delicate but stoic performance underlining a powerful presence and impressive physicality and martial ability when not being played by a stunt-woman. With EEAAO, I'm so glad someone gave her a chance at centre stage, and throughout this film she was a pleasure to watch. But for me the real gem of this movie was Ke Huy Quan. It took me maybe 15 minutes to finally realise, "Hey that's the kid from The Goonies!". His performance actually managed to pierce my heart. This shows also a very well written character, which shows me 'The Daniels' can write impressive insightful screenplay, half the time at least. I feel the same about this movie as I do with their prior film, "Swiss Army Man", a mixed bag oddity of beautiful humanitarian concepts and deep social commentary and an interesting probe into the less visited parts of the human psyche, whilst simultaneously grappling with perverse visual humour and sickly gushy sentimentality. The same could be said of EEAAO, but the perverse over the top visual humour is toned down for most of the film, but still rears (excuse the pun) it's ugly head in the form of a giant dildo being used as a martial arts weapon, a scene where Michelle Yeoh is dressed as an adult baby and red substance is squirted on her as if mimicking blood which I found quite disturbing and completely unnecessary for any plot development and character unravelling, and lovers with sausage wieners for fingers which when bitten into leaked and squirted mayonnaise or custard or god knows what everywhere. To me, these things are perverse and disgusting, and just seem to be two guys with some warped fetishes getting their fix from sneaking this stuff into their movie (but hey maybe I shouldn't be so surprised, this is Hollywood we're talking about, I'm sure everything is normal about Hollywood social cliques these days). There is a lot of unnecessary things in this movie, including the reference to Wong Kar Wai's movie "In the Mood for Love" and similar, as much as it's nice to give a visual nod to their inspirations/role models, they seem to forget they have a story to tell. By this point in the 3rd act of the movie it was dragging on.... Much like my review.It's a visually impressive movie when it's not shoving things up it's own a**, but takes too long to get to it's most rewarding point. Great performances by all actors involved, some inspiring moments both visually and emotively, but overall a cluster pluck of mostly needless martial arts cliches and what seems to be a ridiculous competition to see how far jokes and meaning can be pushed before it all becomes meaningless. Yeah, the rocks were cute and funny, but by this point, I wanted a landslide to come along and push them to the end of the movie.

reviews.review_title: I will never look at hot dogs the same way...
reviews.content:
Here's The 4K Lowedown on "Everything Everywhere All at Once" (R - 2022 - Theater)Genre: Sci-Fi/Time
My Score: 8.9Cast=10 Acting=7 Plot=9 Ending=10 Story=9
F/X=9 Pace=8 Tech=7 Time=10 Intense=10A simple laundromat owner is swept up in an insane adventure, where she alone can save the multiverse by taking on the abilities from the other timelines she has lived."Every rejection, every disappointment has led you to this moment...don't let anything distract you from it." You could watch this half a dozen times and still see something new...the thought put into this project was amazing! I love Michelle Yeoh and Jamie Lee Curtis did not disappoint. I for one can't wait to buy this on 4K when it comes out on video.

I made my account just to review this movie. I saw this movie two days ago and I keep coming back to this page to see how many reviews it's received. As of now, it's at about 8,000, which makes me sad. It tells me that not enough people are seeing this incredible movie. From beginning to end, this movie was immaculate. The story was intriguing the entire time, the cinematography was awesome, the editing was out of this world, and the acting was great all the way around. This movie had me laughing hysterically one moment and brought tears to my eyes the next. Overall, this is going to be the best movie of the year, if not the decade. 10/10.
Just simply a masterpiece, probably in my top 10 films of all time. It's just beautifully directed, written and acted. Some people won't get it, and I'm sorry about that.

A hypnotizing kaleidoscope of creative genius, a baffling comedic triumph, an unintelligible masterpiece, an unspeakable treasure of cinema. If you like anything, anywhere, at any time, do yourself a favour and see it yourself.

reviews.review_title: There is one born every minute ... and it was my minute!
reviews.content: I fell hook, line and sinker for the terrific reviews. After the first 20 - 30 minutes I was in the nightmare of rabbit holes! The only redeeming feature in this movie is that it does FINALLY end, after over 2 very long hours! Can't think of a single teeny, tiny reason to go see it.Awful, terrible movie!!!

After all the praise and Oscar nods, and being a film buff of sorts, I thought I'd best watch this... and OMG, its really rubbish!Its like a bad chinese movie of the 80s, with money thrown at it, spliced with Matrix/Multiverse theories willy nilly.Michelle Yeoh, as always was amazing, but a very poor script and bad storyline there is nothing that can be done to save this movie.In my opinion, I think the Oscar elites are thinking they are being clever in nominating this movie in so many categories, because they are somehow enlightened individuals who see so many levels in this film, but the truth is, Emperors New Clothes - there is nothing good to see as there is nothing good here!

reviews.review_title: The greatest cinematic experience i´ve ever had
reviews.content: Original, weird, unique, funny, action packed, emotionally poignant, brilliant casting, acting, pacing, editing, great story.. This film has it all and I cannot seem to find any flaws. A true masterpiece that will be remembered through the ages.You will laugh and cry; this movie is a rollercoster ride from start to finish.I walked out of the theater feeling my life had been greatly enhanced.Thank you for making this, i really needed it.

Great performances by the key cast members in an original presentation of unoriginal ideas. In structure it is a very conventional 'Heroes Journey' with all of the required elements of the reluctant hero, her quirky new friends and an ever growing, life threatening challenge. Some very cute moments and ideas, such as the 'everything bagel', but it ran out of ideas after an hour and just relied on never ending jumpcuts of combat scenes. As such, it could have been cut down to one hour instead of its totally unnecessary 2:20. Credits to the editor for the massive amount of work in putting this together, but after the first hour, the story did not advance at all and the scene after scene after scene of pointless fights got tedious and boring.There was also a problem with the premise of saving the infinite universes. I suppose the key character did, but the issue sort of fell off the edge of the table and was not addressed. If you have to blow up the death star to save the galaxy, then you need to show the death star being blown up. You don't go straight to the awards ceremony without showing us what happened.So ya, some great stuff and a lot of tedious, pointlessness.

I'm still in the movies, 1h38 minutes into the movie, and have absolutely zero interest in seeing what will happen. I'm so disappointed. Many people on tweeter saying this is not only a good movie, but one of the best they've ever seen. Wtf happened to people???My guess is Tik Tok has ruined people's brains and attention span and so this is the kind of movie they enjoy: cheap comedy, very short scenes that make no sense and shallow 'philosophical' ideas. Totally depressing. I was expecting to at least see Yeoh performing some quality martial arts scenes, but not even that. They've added so many ridiculous special effects that the fight scenes become embarrassing to watch. They're not funny at all. Disgraceful. I'm giving a 1 in order to maybe save some people from having high expectations as I did and wasting their money in the kino. Total garbage that may please social media addicted adolescents, that's it.

This film is Oscar worthy and will sweep next years. Parasite esque.Michele Yeoh stand out performer and deserves all the plaudits but the whole cast were amazing.This film was so immersive, it was edge of your seat stuff for the guts of it. The multiverse theory is gathering real pace across TV and film I'd expect we will see more it in the future.But this one will be catalyst. BRAVO.

reviews.review_title: The Wacky Riot That We NEED
reviews.content: In Dan Kwan and Daniel Scheinert's Everything Everywhere All At Once, Evelyn Wang (Michelle Yeoh) is an aging immigrant going through the daily struggles of life. That is until Evelyn learns from her other multiverse husband, Waymong Wang (Ke Huy Quan), that she is the only one who can save the world from a multiverse evil and she must fight this evil by hopping between multiverses using the skills of her other versions and also learning what she could have done with her life based off the chances she didn't take.The movie surprisingly blowed me away. While watching the film I was quite surprised by the quality of the VFX as I had learned that the movie was a highly rated, low-budget indie film. I assumed the VFX would be fine, but did not expect it to so believable and feel as if I was a watching a big-budget popcorn flick. It's an impressive feat to be able to deliver such good CGI on a budget of $50 million.The film has an intriguing screenplay with the first 15 minutes giving zero hints about the surrealism about to be experienced (I personally didn't even view a trailer and just watched it based off recommendations, so it truly blew me away). From the point the surrealism and the multiversal activity begins the pacing picks up and entirely hooks you in, although the drama that came prior was just as interesting. The film feels like it's movie a little slower during the final third of the film, but it's sealed off with an emotional climax that churns the heart.The writing of the film was very deep and this is noticed by the many layers, peeling off the layers towards the end of the movie you realize that this movie used the tool of a multiverse battle to give us a deeper message regarding how we should look at all the possibilities we have at hand and never look back with regret. The movie touches on other topics like the generational gaps, stereotypes regarding immigrant parents (particularly from Asia), and homosexuality in a very organic way such that it never feels like it's forced in to send the message at the end. In fact, the final emotional message sent seems to organically originate our of the character interactions and the metaphorical multiverse battle. When you complete the movie and ponder about what you have seen is when the layers come off that the movie was largely filled with metaphors about how to look at life.Overall, this is a deep movie which on the surface gives you a fun, beautiful multiverse battle, but peeling open the layers shows you that there are multiple metaphors involved and that there is more than that meets to the eye, giving us a new outlook on how to view life. It will be a movie I also will be highly recommending to others.

reviews.review_title: Looks like acheap parody on multiverse movies
reviews.content: Add in a struggle of a Chinese-owned small business in US, owners torn between tradition, taxes, everyday life drudge and modernity.Probably some woukd add wokeness points for a struggle to introduce daughter's lesbian love to a strict Chinese patriarch.It had some funny moments - too few, IMO, and probably some good message - but it was lost in stretched scenes and messy not-funny multi-verse jumps.

Don't waste your time with this worthless overhyped movie. It's bad. Packed with sensless violence. With non laughable humor. Flat personalities. Story is devoid of interesting turns. Nothing spiritually, no intellectual challenges just bad humor bad lines.A total waste of time and money.I fail to understand how this can be so overhyped. But then, in todays world its easy to manipulate ratings if you have enough money. The questions is why would you do this? Because the movie will bring you down to their low level of dissonance. And I even needed 600 words to make this review, so hereby I end.

So I was excited to watch this movie because the IMDB rating was 8.1. I watch a quick YouTube trailer and even though it did not fascinate me I said why not. There is some decent actions and funny scene but boy I was confused. Someone else mentioned that it reminded them of the matrix and I agree. I think the directors aimed for this movie to have a deep message but im kind of unsure what that is. My interpretation is basically the obstacles the mother has to go through on her own why also learning to let go of her daughter, let her be her own person and live her life. The mother seem to have a hard time doing this because of how easily her own father was willing to send her away. In the end the movie was long and drawn out I do not recommend.

reviews.review_title: A genre-defying roller coaster masterpiece with a lot of heart and craziness!
reviews.content: I saw this in Los Angeles this past weekend (3/27) and this movie absolutely delivers! Such a ridiculously ambitious and awesome film with career-defining performance (in an already legendary career) for Michelle Yeoh. Pretty much everyone was amazing about this film and the swiftness and suddeness this movie jumps around genre and still remain coherent and heartfelt is just a testament of how strong the script, the directing by the Daniels, the cinematography, editing, and all the crafts involved.It's an ode to so many films and shows , including In the Mood for Love, Kung Fu Hustle, Melancholia, Rick & Morty, Satoshi Kon's Millennium Actress, Scott Pilgrim, 2001 Space Odyssey, Ratatouille, and so many more.Right after it finished, I already want to watch it again and I just can't stop thinking or talking about it. Best film of 2022 by far!

reviews.review_title: A family story disguised as a sci-fi action flick
reviews.content: The hidden gem of 2022, this is a must to see if you like action and wild fantasy story.It just proves that you don't need a big budget to tell a good story.I won't spoil but this is a story about a mom and her daughter.Just go watch it.

This film is like a sci fi Jackie Chan film, & that's not good.Quite simply it's bizarre with a plot from a B movie sci fi film from the 1950's that makes little sense.It's bound to have a cult following in the same way The Firth Element does, an equally bizarre & awful film.You can't fault the acting but the script & plot are woeful. As is the way it jumps around all over the place between the 'multi verses' with same actors playing multiple versions of themselves in the same place & the same time.Confused? You will be.It also comes across as just being.... silly.So bizarre, confusing, awful, woeful & silly.

reviews.review_title: This put shame to Multiverse of Madness
reviews.content: Okay so Doctor Strange 2 was good but it's name was very misleading as they didn't even explore much about Multiverse. Coming to this movie, first of all, I found this movie very confusing and so I had to watch it's explanation later. One thing I had in my mind, why they chose Asian family? Could the same story be true about any other race? Later my friend told me it's because Asian parents they are very bad at showing their love to their childrens and the story centrally revolves around expression of love and choices.

I couldn't care less if the multiverse is under attack. This movie will make sense if I took acid. It's not The Matrix, which I loved. I sensed early that this was not for me, as I didn't feel a connection to any of the main characters. It's not funny but maybe if you're drunk it's funny.Some scenes seem to be entertaining but I just don't understand. I love science fiction. I didn't love this. Pretty must fast forwarded it. Ok so maybe we are split into many personalities like a multiverse but then go and get therapy and don't watch this movie ever. I can't see this movie getting an Oscar..

I don't understand how they do it. This movie is absolutely absurd and over the top on one hand, yet simply beautiful on the other. The humor can be jackass-level crass, yet somehow the moment of reconciliation feels so cathartic that I literally had tears streaming down my face. I'm old and jaded, so it takes a lot to touch my cold, dark heart. Did I tell you I don't get it? The happy ending plot is fairly cliché, almost formulaic even, but it works to the degree I didn't think possible for something with so much tropes. If it's food, it's like somebody takes stuff out of a gas station, then inexplicably mixed it up to create a Michelin starred meal. Inconceivable, and yes, it means what I think it means.

This movie is a masterpiece. Layered, funny, complex script performed by an amazing cast. The costumes, effects and comedy were fantastic. I was so incredibly satisfied at the end. Please see it, and take someone you love.
This is the worst movie I have seen in a long time. The idea of multiverse is depicted in such a confusing and boring manner. There is not one aspect of the movie that I really enjoyed.

It's amazing how many people will say that a movie is bad just because they can't understand it and I've noticed that some of the negative reviews are from people who didn't even watch the whole film, how can you rate a film when you only watch part of it??I have to be honest and say that I think that the first part of the film was a bit to long ( I would have given it a 9 but for that ) but overall an excellent film and well worth sitting through, a good storyline with some great special effects and interesting enough to keep you watching.Happy watching.

reviews.review_title: Extremely Hard to Follow, Ending Very Confusing
reviews.content: In this movie, infinite universes exist. This would mean there is a universe for anything. One where Evelyn was the Queen of England or one where Evelyn was the laundromat owner. Each with their own passions, their own families, their own wants and needs. We begin at following the Evelyn in the laundromat. She eventually gains a power to be in every universe simultaneously at the same time. Therefore she has infinite amount of joys and worries in her world. At the same time, she has 15 kids she has to worry about, at another she's locked away in prison, and in another she has the 1 child, Joy, and husband, Raymond. In the end of the movie it tried to conclude by saying that she chooses her daughter and husband. But how it could it be that simple? How can she "choose" anything when she is everything. There are universes where her daughter and husband don't exist. There are universes where her daughter and husband are abusive to her and her choosing them would be the worst possible thing. In the movie we see into universes where her daughter doesn't seem to exist, the hotdog universe and chef universe. I guess you could argue that she chose happiness in each universe what ever that meant to her. But was she not choosing happiness before? Happiness is very subjective, so how can you say someone just decided to choose happiness all of a sudden. Nevermind the fact that everytime a decision was made in that movie a universe was being created. There are universes where she chose to kill her daughter. Universes where she died. Universes where she went into the bagel. The movie seems to act as if only 5 universes exist and completely glosses over the infinite universes. Additionally there is no resolve. Joy and Evelyn still have the power to be in every universe at the same time. Where is the conclusion of the movie, what changed?

So whatever you think this movie is about - you're wrong. All the opinions i had before and even while watching this movie went out the window. So refreshing to watch something like this. Boy what a rollercoaster. Please, watch it. Be open minded - this movie is something else. Still can't believe it got me so off guard. Be prepared to experience a bunch of emotions. Even the ones that you deep down from surface. Thank you for this experience.

In the first few scenes I was absolutely overwhelmed by the movie. My brain chemistry was getting overloaded but then something either shifted in the movie or in my brain and I was mesmerized.Excellent cast. Outstanding visuals. Trippy story that embodies just about everything about cinema. I look forward to watching this again. And again.

One couple I know walked out on it. Another friend loved it. They are all smart people with a good sense of humor. But it is also continually mentioned as a shoo-in at the Oscars. I feel that I had an open mind when I bought my ticket. The story, as far as I could tell, is about a Chinese-American woman who is kidnapped and thrown into alternate universes when she's overcome by stress. And that's what happens in this movie. He marriage is basically over, her daughter just came out as a lesbian, her ailing father, who lives with her and constantly criticizes her, demands attention. The family business (a laundromat) is failing, the IRS is harassing them, and she is haunted by her failed career as a singer. In the alternative universes she has superhuman strength and is a martial arts expert. That's a good thing because she's also being pursued by an arch-villainess who is determined to kill her off in every one of those alternative universes. There are a lot of fight scenes (mostly CGI). There are also some laughs along the way, but nothing truly hilarious, unless you like jokes about sticking objects where-the-moon-don't-shine. I guess it comes down to the fact that this is just not my kind of movie. The audience I saw it with was composed mostly of young people who seemed to enjoy it enormously. The makeup was outstanding. I did not recognize Jamie Lee Curtis at all. Since most people confuse acting with makeup, I predict that she'll win the Oscar. But ultimately, to me, it was just silly.

reviews.review_title: As ambitious as the title suggests, this surreal philosphical morality-tale is so complicated it's perplexing.
reviews.content: In "Everything Everywhere All At Once" Michelle Yeoh's an inner-city laundromat owner bogged by: dad James Hong's birthday party; hubbie Ke Huy Kwan wanting a divorce; daughter Stephanie Hsu wanting independence; & tax auditor Jamie Lee Curtis doing her job. But when an alternate universe cuts sharply in she sees limitless alternate versions of all these (and herself) waging often violent battles rooted in questions like 'What's the point?' & 'Will love conquer all?'. Co-director / co-writers Dan Kwan & Daniel Scheinert sure were ambitious with this surreal philosphical morality-tale, but too much so - being so complicated as to be perplexing.

reviews.review_title: A mulitverse of brilliance and heart
reviews.content: The movie brilliantly melds concepts into an unforgettable sci-fi masterpiece headlined by Michelle Yeoh. You will never forget this movie. You think I jest? Wait until you watch it! It rolls from hilarious, to heart breaking, to inspirational, sometimes mixing all of them together - fulfilling the prophecy of its title. Michelle Yeoh gives an incredible performance, anchoring every single scene, no matter how ridiculous, with a sense of reality.This is a movie that aimed at a million targets, and hit every single one of them. Sci-fi creators across all media will be inspired by this movie for decades to come.Will it win an Oscar? It damn well should.

I must be different. The last Spiderman (already about the Metaverse); the Northman and this are probably some of the worst movies I've ever seen, despite them having great reviews from everyone else.I watched this with my wife and none of us got it. She even stopped watching in the middle of it.The story is messy, the movie is too long (what happened to under 2 hours long flicks?) and it's not funny, not at all. Some of the scenes try to be and end up being annoying (the hotdog fingers, the multiple dildo fights...).I don't know, I just didn't get it. It failed at being funny, it failed at being an action movie, it failed at everything actually.

reviews.review_title: All the realities are within your grasp
reviews.content: Brilliant. Good concept dealt beautifully with technology and emotions. What matters st the end is the kindness. Love truimphs hate? Or maybe not. This is the things we love to see and adore. Lots of things on my mind. A good lesson too. The failed parenthood, the burden of existence, fear of not being enough... ups and downs, everything is happening everywhere and it is happening all at once. Can we get through it? Or we will fall into the void. Watch and fall in love.

And no that's not a misspelling lol....what a ridiculously stupid storyline that added absolutely no value to the film. If not for that it could have been higher rated. Good movie with a lot of amazing themes that they tackled well..themes about family and how we treat people...definitely much needed and much appreciated.Waymond is my fav character and Quan portrays him in spectacular fashion. Yeoh did a good job as well. I'm still wondering how I made it 9 months never having heard of this movie but I guess not much budget was made available for marketing....but it's not Best Picture worthy.

This movie has a unimaginable plot line that moves so quickly you are not able to follow it. There are so many quick changes and poorly done special effects it renders the plot line totally confusing. There are some really good actors, but I wonder how they felt about the finished product. The Hollywood elite gave it 11 Oscar nominations. Why on earth! For those of you who liked this movie, I am glad you did, but you need to check out past Oscar nominated/winning movies to see the difference. I started watching this a few weeks ago and stopped after 20 minutes realizing what a bad movie it was, but after the nominations I decided to give it another chance. I barely finished it while shaking my head in disbelief the entire time.

This film... was so different. Not only do I respect the things that they did in this movie, but I loved them. This movie was almost 2 and a half hours, and it did not drag on for one second. This film is an experience that you can't miss.Everything from the acting to the special effects to the amazing editing, and even the humor was hilarious. The main story was also very sad and made me want to tear up a bit.I love this film a lot, and shows how different A24 films can be.

Creativity, breaking so many rules and yet tying everything together in a clear and relatable story arch. Visually stunning, too. CGI that completely serves the needs of the film.Breathless action that veers into the ridiculous.It's an audacious work of art. The best film of 2022. The best film of the 2020s. Certainly one of if not the best films of the 21st Century.Gonna give it ten starts.As a comedy, action, think piece, it doesn't perhaps land quite as powerfully on a single emotion as some other films. It covers too much ground. Also, my wife hates it, mainly because it was confusing and had some gross humor.

I sit here minutes after finishing the movie, as the end credit song plays, wondering not of the countless versions of me that exist out there but of the decisions that brought me here. Everything Everywhere All at Once almost does not feel real in the sense of the traditional movie experience. As thousands of reviews have stated, it felt like an acid trip of a movie, one that bombards you with beautiful scenes, thrilling action, and genuine heartfelt sentiment that has but vanished from movies that reach a broad audience. While the film takes you through a whirlwind of universes and concepts, the heart of the story lies in its simplest and quietest moments, of a family understanding one another, of love and affection that transcends worlds, shown with an almost overwhelming amount of style, yet those concepts never leave the screen. With outstanding performances from all the cast, with Ke Huy Quan especially. As the song states, This is Our Life.

It is great to see a movie that steps outside of the standard boundaries of normal film.This film can be a metaphor for so many things spiritual and what can represent meaning in our lives.I would thoroughly recommend this to anyone who has not seen it and who also has an open mind.I'm surprised not to see this on the top 250 movies on IMDb. Since I believe it's a passes, so many of the other titles on the list.Hopefully we can see more from the producers and writers who have helped put this film together.I really have nothing negative to say about this film hence why I have given it the score 10 out of 10.

reviews.review_title: A Philosophical Art Dramedy of Matrix + Cloud Atlas + Sorry To Bother you
reviews.content: Well.... What did I just watch here?.... That's certainly what a lot of people will be feeling, after seeing this movie...no..sorry... "Piece of art" I should say, that meets silliness on an abstruse level. Rarely did I ever experience such an emotional rollercoaster, where it goes from silly stupid joke, to intense philosophy, back to an obscene joke, reverts back to social criticism, building up an intense emotional fraction, just to rip you out of this again with a dumb joke.I love movies, that are dark sheep, disguised in Pikachu yellow cotton candy, so you really need to wait for some fine British drizzling, to see the actual dark core of the satire here.The chemistry that Ke Huy Quan and Michelle Yeoh have is simply amazing and I would be VERY surprised NOT to see her winning an Oscar for this, even though dramedies tend to get robbed at the Oscars! This goes as well for an INSANE amount of editing work, that needs to be appreciated. With only 2h17 runtime it does feel almost twice as long though, which is not a bad thing, it is a long journey! You could probably write your master thesis in philosophy and social psychology completely based on those two hours, there is so much you could write about this, but I'll end it here, just go and watch it for yourself and form an own opinion.This is the most bizarre movie you have seen in the last decade or so and the bold level of abnormality this movie delivers, while still being so meta....that's simply an accomplishment of art!

reviews.review_title: Hilarious parallel universe movie with a deep message & kung fu
reviews.content: This is a unique sci-fi/action/comedy, with a captivating twist on the parallel universe theme. Incorporating several Kung Fu action scenes which also come with unusually comedic twists. The story is pretty deep but not in an overly pretentious way, and while there are a few brief moments where the writing crosses the line into cringe, for the most part the story is excellent. It's definitely helped by the superb acting by all of the main characters, and in fact the entire cast of this movie did a great job.There's not really a single slip up from any actor in the entire movie. This may be, at least in part, due to the director being able to bring the best out of the actors. Cinematography is also great although it's clear to see the directors have experience in music videos so expect a little bit of that aesthetic at times.If you've seen parallel universe movies before, you'll already know it's best to just go ahead and watch it instead of hearing about it described in a review.This review was written using precisely-squirted ocean water on the blazing hot sand of a nudist beach. It was later transmitted to this universe for the sole purpose of appearing on this website.Now back to the beach..

This is a super unique movie which fits the usual A24 style. Lots of humour throughout but there are some other more personal and emotional moments throughout.Do be vary of the audience you bring in as the movie of course contains humans with hot dog fingers, people who fight to death just to get a chance to get a buttplug stuck up their ass and of course a super talented racoon who controls the human by sitting on their head and pulling their hair to make them superior cooks.

reviews.review_title: The best movie of the year
reviews.content: 2022 has almost come to an end and Everything Everywhere All At Once is without doubt my favourite movie of the year. A24's new masterpiece definetly deserved the hype. It ranges from hilarious to extremly emotional. It is the funniest comedy of 2022 whilst also being a wonderful story about a small family. The action scenes are incredible and the music is used very well.In addition, it is definetly the most creative movie I have seen in a long time. The whole cast is awesome. In my opinion, Michelle Yeoh should be nominatet for best actress.The multiverse is handled much better than in other movies that came out this year (e.g. Dr. Strange). The attention to detail impressed me as well as the wonderful use of colour and sound.Unfortunatly, the plot in the second half of the movie is not as focused as it is in the first one.Nevertheless, the movie keeps you at the edge of your seat until the credits roll.After Swiss Army Man I had very high expectations and I am happy to say that the Daniels easily subverted them.

reviews.review_title: This is a Love Story, a Mind-Bending Love Story, Told Through Many Lives and Many Loves
reviews.content: This movie is about a woman who is a wife and mother. She is also a daughter to her aging father. It's about her struggles with all of these roles in differing universes.This movie is about life and lives that could've been and maybe are. It's about love that should've been and maybe never were.It's told beautifully and interestingly in such a way that just as in the film, time itself has no meaning or concept as you sit in your seat in the theater watching the screen.Also, just as in life, in this movie, all is shown here but it is told is three announced chapters: Everything, Everywhere, and lastly, All At Once.There are tremendous action sequences, laugh out loud comedic scenes, and dramatic dialogue-driven sequences that are needed to propel the story forward like a slingshot, that are needed make the heart soar just as much as other times it can make the heart break.This will be one of 2022's greatest films in a year that has thus far been unexpectedly packed early on with some fantastic titles.Everything Everywhere All at Once has it all. And you should be there to see it all. At least once.

I've wrote so many bad reviews the past couple of years cos it seems everything that has comes out over the last 4 years is either; terrible boring ideas & stories for a film that should of never being greenlit or just unoriginal rehashes & full on remakes that just utterly disappoint. Bad writing & average direction everywhere. They all seem to have the same message aswell. Everything over the past few years is the same crap with the same message. The exceptions have been few & far between. Directors like Denis Villeneuve & Alejandro González Iñárritu have been a breath of fresh air in this otherwise stagnated period. However thankfully this is very much an exception & something completely unique, inspired & totally original. So what are you waiting for? Go watch it.

reviews.review_title: So many questions and no answers, but that's OK
reviews.content: We don't know the rules that the world in this movie operates. As information and scenes are presented, it clarifies and confuses us all at the same time. Is the movie playing by its own rules or is it being sloppy? Even if you pay attention, you won't be able to tell. But maybe that's the point.If you were to ask: What is this movie about? I could give a pretty long list. It's about love, family, suicide, life, pain, confusion, the meaning of life, anger, happiness, kindness, being OK with imperfection (see title).Relatively early on, we hear the phrase "Nothing matters" and we feel how true that is. Then, the movie tries to convince us otherwise. Successfully? I don't know. But it makes us feel that in this one moment in this character's life, some things matter even if in the infinite span of the universe it may not.I feel that I should not be rating this movie, but instead giving it a N/A rating. It's not perfect, it can't be, but it does make the viewer emotional and think. I've watched a ton of movies in the last couple of months/years and my first reaction is to point out all the things wrong with them. But with this one, I feel like that's not what it's about. But I'm not sure I can answer what it's about in a way that gets to it's essence (see title, "everything"). But let me give it a desperate attempt.Life is hard. You're not perfect. Don't give up.

reviews.review_title: Weirdest Most Entertaining Movie I've Seen In a While
reviews.content: This is strangely one of the rare movies that can make you Laugh, Cry, Jump Off Your Seat and Scratch Your Head. There's incredible action sequences where some really creative fights occur. There are some really funny moments, really sad moments, and overall, it is a well-thought-out and well written thriller/mystery. It explores some scientific concepts in a really nice way, and at the same time, takes the viewer through an emotional experience.It's not your typical movie, it's very weird, but very very entertaining.

Strange to say this film is too frantic for a tad too long. Wouldn't say incohesive but there seems to be parts that are a tad over(zealous) while others under(achieving).The overall idea and execution is good but the major theme of kindness, family first, mother daughter is rather hammered through. At running time of 2.20, it could use some critical editing.JLC is hilarious here and so is KHQ as the male lead. Michelle Kwan still got it to take the helm and the daughter is a good surprise.

At the beginning I was really bored, but I can't deny that it got better and more interesting later, but still, eleven Oscar nominations for this? Nah!The movie obviously had some impressive scenes and dialogues but they were really a few. And as the title of the movie says it is literally about everything all at once, but is that a good thing? I mean mentioning so many concepts at a very superficial level? Is it good? I think that is why I couldn't emotionally connect to the movie or it didn't make me think that much. Adding so many ingredients to a salad doesn't necessarily make it delicious, maybe you can show off with that but still it's not delicious! I feel the same about this movie, it was just too much and not that enjoyable and not that deep. One other thing I didn't like about the movie is that I think it was like a collage of many other movies and animations. There were many scenes that they reminded us of other movies, (Rick & Morty for example) which I don't think is a good thing. Also sometimes during the movie I thought it doesn't make any coherent sense that I felt like the directors must had been on drugs. :DBut I kind of liked the way they showed parallel worlds, it was a bit overwhelming at the beginning but I think this theory itself is overwhelming so they did an okay job on this, even though I'm waiting for a better movie about multiverse! (Haven't seen and impressive one so far)
And the humor was not bad (not that impressive either). It made me laugh out loud at a few scenes.Overall it was okay but not great.

There's really something for just about everyone in this movie.
