It's part Kung-fu action, part absurdist comedy, part cerebral sci-fi, and part indie family drama.Everything, Everywhere dazzles with its creative vision, but it marries the bizarre and magical with the mundane and the ordinary to make a statement about human potential and how often we let our daydreams - what could have been, should have been, will or won't be - roadblock who we are. The movie obliterates the veil of ordinary to reveal the extraordinary, but it never loses itself within its relentless, wacky, metaphysical vision.

reviews.review_title: The Weirdest Movie I Have Ever Seen
reviews.content: There are no rules in this film. Absolutely none. In the middle of the movie, I thought, "this is bananas. Where is this going?? This is the craziest thing I've seen." And honestly, I stated getting tired of it after a bit. But just when I started to become weary of the films wacky antics, it started to come together! And by the end this film shows that it has some solid, solid heart. Between its laughable hilarity, and managed to be extremely relatable. It's about finding meaning in the events of your life, it's about accepting your choices and accepting your family members. The acting absolutely sold it. Every single actor in this film to the stunning job. Wonderful, weird, weird work all around.

The crux of it boils down to "Choose the Present" and "Choose Love". Explores existentialism in its essence and takes you to insane places only to stretch your imagination. Is a true homage to human creativity and it's made it into my top 5 films of all time.

It has been 36 days since I first watched / experienced Everything Everywhere All At Once for the first time and I haven't stopped thinking about it since. I've watched it a second time in the theatres since and I'm already planning seeing it as many times as I can before it exits.It's just a testament to how beautiful and life changing art can be. It can encompass profound truths; wrapped in comedy, absurdism, philosophy, action and drama all at once. It is brutally sincere in the best ways while stretching comedy and taste in the complete opposite direction. It is a movie that wears both its title and it's heart on its sleeve in a way no one could possibly predict.At this stage it is almost impossible to talk about its influences or compare it to other works of art, authors or directors because the influences are both overt and subtle. Yes it is if Douglas Adams wrote a script about the motherwound directed by Michel Gondry. But it's also Ang Lee directing the Matrix as if it was a parable of generational trauma instead of coming out as trans. It's an insanely wild ride that has the power to heal and change the people watching it for the better.It's almost impossible to overstate its power. I have personally seen it help a hardened friend come to terms with their depression and loneliness, and soothe the grief of a couple losing their first born to a miscarriage.It's art at its most life changing purest and that's the highest recommendation I can give.

reviews.review_title: Went in with no expectations and was completely rocked!
reviews.content: This movie was above and beyond what i expected going into it. The premise was really interesting and well executed. They managed to talk about some deep concepts of humanity while still keeping it light hearted and comical. One of those few movies that actually manages to achieve serious with comedy at the same time without destroying the story or pace.Definitely 10/10!

reviews.review_title: Words cannot describe what I watched but what I do know is it is a chaotic messy masterpiece!
reviews.content: This movie had me laughing during multiple parts, had me sad in others, if you've ever watched an arthouse film this one by Daniels is truly a beautiful one! I wanted to see this for the past 3 months now, I finally got to see it last night because they opened it up to more theaters this is truly a crazy film. With an extremely unique way of addressing the multiverse and in a way I feel it pokes fun at marvels multiverse which is ironic when you see who the producers are (spoilers it's the Russo brothers the men behind Endgame. Which was the introduction to the multiverse in the MCU) as the film was about to end I had the question "is that it?" Not because it had a cliffhanger ending as a matter of fact it's ending feels like a closed book. But because I wanted to keep watching the reality jumping chaos.One thing that should be noted is that everything that's happening on screen through every reality is happening at the same time as each other. Go see this film and you'll see what I mean. I truly loved this film and I will probably go see it 3-4 more times before it leaves my theater.I should give a warning to some people who have troubles with seizures. This movie has a lot of flashing lights that may give you some trouble.

reviews.review_title: Be Kind, you don't Know Everything
reviews.content: Out of all the universes where we could be anything, be kind.This movie was extremely confusing even for the most brilliant people on this planet. I attempted to understand the entire plot, what was happening, and I was completely lost. But that's okay. At the end of the day.... You do not know everything about what someone is going through. Whether it be your Dad, daughter, or even a complete stranger, you can't even begin to comprehend. You're lost. I'm lost. So just be kind.Amazing representation of characters, stunning performances, beautiful costume design, crazy transitions, and thoughtful messages all combine to make the best movie of 2022.

If this movie is not a 10 out of 10 then I don't know what it is! We need to get over our sales comparing everything to marvel! They did this movie with half the budget and this movie is astounding! 10 out of 10 must watch. This movie is the matrix all over again!

I won't pretend I know what the creators we're trying to express here; I gleaned my own interpretation-which is the hallmark of a great film, book or piece of music.This felt like something similar to the matrix/sliding doors/twilight zone on steroids, except the central premise here is the idea that we live amongst a multiverse with any number of random and incredibly weird actions sending the characters along an almost infinite number of possible futures like branches.What I saw was the interplay and conflict between metaphysical philosophies.Centrally is the idea of scientific realism coupled with the concept of a multiverse - with its centre a representation of Nietzsche's 'eternal recurrence/return' as the bagel.This naturally leads to nihilism-'nothing that we do matters'.As the central character battles to come to grips with this new reality she discovers a dizzying array of wild, outrageous and at times downright weird aspects to her new existence.Eventually she realises that her once loathsome normal, boring mind-numbing existence is where the ultimate change must take place: she must embrace new themes like authenticity, kindness, tolerance, compassion and the usual run of the mill trope about loving and caring for the simple things-and people in your life.This is why I didn't give it a higher score.However there are some amazing sequences and a sumptuous balance of violence, humour and just plan weirdness that makes for a great ride.This film deserves all the accolades heaped upon it-it is a true work of art.

There are a lot of multiverse movies recently. Many are full of inventive visual ideas and special effects. Most cost a fortune to make.This one was cheap. But it beats the Marvel multiverse movies that cost 10 times more. And the reason is simple: the script is better. The characters have emotional arcs that mean something. You really don't know how the tension will resolve until the end. And the end is moving and profound. There is real feeling here and believable, imperfect characters.The multiverse isn't just there for inventive, fun visual effects. It is there to allow us to explore character, motivation and, remarkably, deep philosophical choices. Somehow the characters explore deep issues of free will, choice, alternative paths for their lives and whether all those infinite choices mean absolutely nothing is meaningful. For a moment, the lead characters flirt with a nihilist resolution. But choose something different. Not a trivial resolution where good things happen and everyone lives happily ever after, but a realistic acceptance of the good things in a flawed, imperfect world.The first time I watched it I thought it was a great movie. The second time I realised it was also a deeply moving story. The third time, I realised I had still missed a lot and it deserved an unequivocal top score.It reminded me of some of my other favorite oddball movies. Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind, Being John Malkovich are good company for it.Any move that just keeps getting better after multiple viewings has got to deserve a top score. And this is one of those movies.

This is one of those special/rare movies that we only get once a decade. To not watch it would be making a huge mistake. There are so many layers to this movie.... the storytelling, the cinematography, the perfect editing, the incredible acting, the perfect dialog, the amazing effects, the topics that it explores, the lessons it teaches, the widsoms it shares.... and that's just the beginning of it. There is so much more in this movie. It's the kind of movie you have to watch at least a few times. Once is just not enough.The scene with the two stones was probably my favorite one. So incredibly original.This movie breaks all the molds and completely shattered all my expectations. I was constantly on the edge of my seat. I didn't know what to expect next and I knew that it wouldn't be more than a few seconds before something wild, crazy, totally unique and unexpected happened next.This movie is truly "everything, everywhere, all at once."

reviews.review_title: Trying too hard to be quirky?
reviews.content: Sorry, I kind of feel crazy for not loving this film as much as the masses do. It definitely was interesting and highly original and a lot of it was fun and I thought the ending was particularly moving.....but a lot of it just also felt like it was weird for the sake of being weird. Like, did we need to have so much focus on hot dog finger world? I can get the irony of the mom's relationship in that universe but it otherwise didnt really serve anything narratively. It felt like they kept cutting back to it purely because it was ridiculous. I just didnt find the scene where Jenny Slate swings around a dog to be particularly funny. I liked the visuals in the movie and Stephanie Hsu wears some pretty rad costumes. But overall, it felt really long and overstuffed and like it was trying too hard. It certainly wasnt a bad film. Just not my cup of tea personally.

Had such high hopes for this movie. It's one of those that the title just grabs you without knowing anything about it. Almost convinced my wife to watch it with me. Well, I'm glad I didn't. The movie had so many awkward moments and it tried to send a message of some kind the whole time, but somehow I did not buy it. It reminded me of some other multiverse movies(it borrows from them too), but does its own, I call it goofy version, which I did not enjoy at all. I haven't seen it mentioned here, but there's something about it that made me recall Cloud Atlas. Maybe because it involved same characters in different scenarios? I can see the effort put in it and the acting was quite good, but after it was over I felt like watching some random fan fiction parody. To me it does not feel like a complete movie and it is understandable considering the smaller budget. However, there should be a fine line between cheap production and just having low budget. A real masterpiece is the one you can never guess the budget for it. The movie is okay to watch even if a bit long, but doesn't come even close to TOP 250.

reviews.review_title: Incoherent, meandering, babbling waste of time
reviews.content: Oh my the amount of effort wasted here on great performances will make your head spin more than the completely useless fairy tale sci-fi sequences themselves. One of the worst movies I've ever seen. Nothing sticks. Nothing comes together. I can't remember a more annoying movie.

MIND-BENDING, BRILLIANT, BONKERS, GENIUS, ALL AT ONCE!!!The film is the b@st@rd child of Sliding Doors (the concept anyway) and The Matrix with more than a sprinkling of acid after a whole bag of magic mushrooms but somehow the cast and crew hold it together to deliver a genuinely mind blowing and entertaining movie. It is both poignant and laugh-out-loud funny. It was definitely NOT what I was expecting BUT in a good way!Michelle Yeoh, is even better than her ever amazing self and is supported by Ke Huy Quan (Short-Round) and (is that?) Jamie Lee Curtis (yes it is!) as you've never seen her before. Stephanie Hsu is outstanding in her role as Yeoh's misunderstood daughter.Do not miss EVERYTHING, EVERYWHERE, ALL AT ONCE whatever universe you are from!

Everything Everywhere All at Once is most definitely a highlight of this years catalog of cinema releases despite its flaws. Its wildly imaginative and has a radical new take on the multiverse concept. Its endlessly imaginative and really feels like a film where literally anything could happen. Its also really well crafted, especially for its budget. Its even more of an achievement given that it was made during the pandemic. Despite this I did find myself wishing there was more use of animation perhaps with the racacoonie sections.Its by no means perfect though and has some significant flaws. It at times, like with the films of Wes Anderson, finds itself stylistically being quirky for the sake of being quirky due to a desire to have a unique and signiture auteurist style. This maximalist, post-modernist fever dream aesthetic is at times quite detrimental to the experience. One find themselve overwhelmed and confused, and the swifty pacing can makes it difficult to keep up. This sensation is also contributed by it being bursting with too many ideas and I think it should have been cut down. It definitely feels detrimentally long which is in part contributed to by in the third act every scene feeling like its the grand finale.Overall its a brillianly funny and imaginative film which poeple will be talking about years from now. Despite its flaws I would highly recommend watching it. There really is nothing like it.

reviews.review_title: The most imaginative film you will see all year
reviews.content: Everything Everywhere All At Once is more than likely one of the most imaginative movies you will see all year if not ever. The way in which it delves into the concept of the multiverse is truly breathtaking from both a visual and symbolic standpoint. All of the costumes and locations are vibrant and meaningful to the main characters in more ways than one. This makes every setting and every decision these characters make feel extremely important throughout the entire movie. There's a ton of multiverses that are explored too and the same can be said about the symbolic messages and "hidden" meanings behind this film. The story was executed so brilliantly that there's plenty of time for audiences to adore every single character, provide intense sci-fi action, tons of humor, and serious tones/themes together seamlessly. One minute you might find yourself laughing pretty hard, the next you might be trying to hold back a tear or two. Everywhere All At Once has a lot to say regarding the human condition yet somehow manages to still be a sci-fi epic. A24 movies aren't for everyone but the originality and amazing execution from a filmmaking standpoint is simply undeniable here.

A totally crazy and highly original film carried by a Michelle Yeoh (Tomorrow Never Dies, The Lady) at the top of her form. She is simply sublime.The cast is excellent. We are pleased to see Ke Huy Quan (The Goonies, I. Jones and the Temple of Doom) and an unrecognizable Jamie Lee Curtis as a tax inspector.The editing of the film is extraordinary and deserves to be rewarded. Moreover I would see this film nominated for editing, screenplay, directing and acting at the next Oscars.

This film is just noise on the TV screen with a very mediocre plot.The next generation may have a low attention span, so it feels like they have catered for that. They have tried to juice up the plot with a feel good experience, but it it feels like it they are just jamming it down my throat.The film pace is completely wrong. This film leaves know time to feel, and imagine. I guess it goes with the title.The only thing they have done of interest is cast a older Asian lady as a protagonist in a big budget pile of garbage.Save your eyes for something that's worth savouring.Best film of the year it wouldn't make my top 100.
First Michelle Yeoh. I love her. She is awesome. The movie is weird and confusing and different and delightful. Be prepared to be confused for a bit then relax into it.

Imagine that an intellectually and emotionally gifted 10-year-old had the greatest epiphany about the meaning of life while in the middle of a clown fight on his birthday. That's this movie and more!Best movie of 2022 (it's just June, but no other film will be better than this).Just watch it.

reviews.review_title: Everything except a story and everywhere but an ending
reviews.content:
Actually started strong and was pretty original first Act. Michelle Yeoh is always strong
I thought this was definitely her best role in a decade but once we got to about the halfway mark it turned and by the third act it was completely off the rails. Another example of style over substance and leaning on the special effects and martial arts choreography. It was fun seeing "short round" all grown up but he was pretty flat, he had a couple moments but not enough to win me over. Worst role I've ever seen Jamie Lee Curtis in and the actress that played the daughter not dynamic, seemed like she was way out of her element. Pretty alarming that a film this bad has been nominated for this many Oscars. This is how far we fallen In our film going expectations, If "the room" was released now it would probably have about five nominations.

reviews.review_title: No need to read review, just go watch it
reviews.content: This movie is by far the most unique movie ever. Just go to cinema and watch it. Any review cannot describe how next level it is . Because just like the name , it contains every human emotions all at once.

reviews.review_title: Worst multiple universe movie to date.
reviews.content: I had high hopes for this movie but was ultimately disappointed. I thought i was dissatisfied with the newest matrix until i saw the 1.5 hours of nonsense in this film. The first half hour was decent but then it just became a circus. I guess people laugh at things like a universe full of people with hotdog fingers but I cringed and figured out it's ultimately a kids movie. I would probably even choose some meta/multiple universe B rated movies over this unless i'm trying to keep a child under 5 occupied.
Most of these reviewers must have watched a different version of this movie from the one I saw. I would sum up my experience in two words...bored and confused. Not a great movie.

I loved this film. It's a fun manic ride, with excellent costume changes and sparks of humour. It also has a great cast of well written and played characters, with an underlying drama of real depth.One of my favourite films of the year.

reviews.review_title: Not the worst movie I've seen but it's up there.
reviews.content: I had to finish the movie to figure out why it has such good reviews. I'm still trying to figure it out. I truly believe the world has gone crazy if they think this is a great movie. Don't waste your time. Wow what a disappointment And waste of money.

reviews.review_title: Best movie I've seen in 6 years
reviews.content: A true masterpiece. It leaves no stone left unturned, I would recommend it to anybody. It's funny but also sad, and leaves the watcher wondering how to feel. There is no other movie like this and I think anybody should watch this. Top 5 best movies for me id say.

Strap in and hold on. Excellent film with a lot of depth. Can't take your eyes off the screen. Original and fresh, might need and second watch as it's so deep. Actors playing the Wang parents are exceptional. This is a real brain-twisting Gem in a time of brittle lacklustre overly PC movie options.

People who jokingly call cinema "Kino" often wait on releases by the likes of the Von Triers and Gaspar Noe of this world to be "wowed" by their next masterpiece, give it a 10, and go to wait again.Rarely do a movie surprise you in a way that is so unexpected, so cleverly delivered and so beautifully written and directed that it immediately puts its creator on the maps of "those to watch" - Dan Kwan and Daniel Scheninert somehow captured lighting and delivered it in movie format, ignoring all conventions, mixing all genres, unhindered by convention.While the movie is evidently not perfect (the lead 'villain' would probably have been better interpreted by the protagonist, and they know it), it's a masterpiece in its own right. What differentiates this movie from say, a movie like "the matrix" is that it's as profound as any, say, Dogme 95 film while keeping the fantastic imagery top notch throughout.The movie reminded me so much of "mother!" by Aronofsky, it had some big shoes to fill indeed and filled them very well. Outside a few "oh-hum" over the top vfx shot, EEAaO is powerful throughout its three chapter and paced to perfection.Probably the best surprise of the year, and a must watch for ... anyone really. True to its title, the movie has something for everyone, everywhere.

This is the type of film that only comes out every couple years or so. Imagine Charlie Kaufman meets The Matrix. It's ambitious in scope and complex, yet somehow easy enough to understand on first viewing and unpretentious (unlike a lot of Christopher Nolan's work, which is complex for the sake of it, without much payoff). All this while being fun, funny, and emotionally captivating. There are even callbacks to humorous moments, both comedic and dramatic, that still manage to heighten the stakes. The scope of the story is ultimately small; at the end of the day it's about a family dealing with financial difficulties, a possible divorce, and a distant daughter. How the rest of the events unfold is up to the viewer's interpretation, but I like how it works on multiple levels like that. I really don't want to say much else, just go see it. There's something for everyone and it's hard for me to think of another recent movie that works so well on essentially every level. It may sound clichéd, but I laughed, I cried, it got me thinking, this is what cinema was made for. That's saying something coming from me. I bounced back and forth between a 9 and 10, but with the last couple years being pretty meh for movies, we need something like this right now.

It's unexplainable and I don't know where to begin but it was great. I think. Definitely different and ORIGINAL. I was lucky to be in the States when this came out and all I can say for sure is its expertly done and the three main character are really excellent and full of charisma. But I still don't understand what was actually going on. Maybe that's the point?? Or was it too much of everything all at once??

I watched the movie after it won the best actress Golden Globe.I had high expectations.I read so many great reviews, people saying what a great movie this is.Unfortunately it is only a great mess.The only positive thing I can say about this movie is that it is somehow original.But it was unbearable. Terrible plot,terrible cinematography.It looked like a fan made movie.Some scenes were totally awful and hard to watch.It was quite gory and disgusting.I could not watch it until the end ,and even if I did, my opinion would not change. No ending can save an unwatchable movie.I suspect that many people were paid to leave great reviews.It is trashy.

I'm not going to get into symbolism or break down the themes of the movie in this review. All I have to say so that this movie has everything you could want. Great acting, directing, visuals, HILARIOUS comedy, beautiful drama, stellar action, fantastic fantasy, amazing commitment to quirky weirdness, original and captivating creativity, beauty in the benign. This film made me cry twice during the runtime and then it had me literally crying in the street about 10 minutes after I left the theatre from just reflecting and taking in what I just saw, I even cried while trying to have a sit down lunch with my partner and the beauty and emotions and themes from the movie were just so visceral that I couldn't keep in the tears. It's so beautiful and it takes you on such a ride and you feel every emotion. When nothing matters, you find out what truly matters.Michelle Yeoh is someone I've always admired for her baddassery and talent, and here she is at her best and she shows that she is a versatile and incredible talented actress to the world that might not already know of her amazing abilities. This movie is special, and entertaining, beautiful, meaningful, and such a fun ride. I can't rave about it enough. Just go see it! Let it take you on this journey and you maybe you will also cry on the street and while trying to order lunch after the movie. I'm eating a 10/10 which I RARELY do! I usually save 10/10 for just my personal faves that I love. This is my new favorite and I don't know how or if it'll ever be topped.

This movie is not about a SF topic, don't be fooled by the multiverse topic. It is nothing but a movie about some mother - daughter trouble, which resulted in some psychological breakdown of the mother, imagining some strange story about her daughter being the biggest villain in any universe.Lots of fast paced camera and visual effects shots.There are funny and hilarious parts, there are just silly, illogical and even awful parts. And certainly there is a lesbian couple... No movie is possible without any gender message these days. There are also some strange, ugly sex scenes, that are completely unrelated to the story and are absolutely superfluous. I did not understand what they were meant for.A must see? No, not at all.

See!? That's all I'm saying. Humanity is overrated. We're smaller than we think...
I always impress by this kind of movies & series like Westworld.I love the casting of the movie especially Ke Huy Quan but I couldn't get in touch with Stephanie's acting.The story was beyond my imagination. Maybe the first hour of the movie was kind of boring but it was totally worth it. Only problem that I have with this kind of movies is that most of them have a happy ending. I don't know maybe eventually we have to enjoy little things in our life and say: yes we know that we are nothing in this universe and we can't do anything, but we're happy!...

Do you want to watch a movie where a guy fights with a trophy up his ass while also being well made and emotional well the Everything everywhere all at once might just be for you.This is what you get when you say "a good multiverse movie" definitely better than doctor strange 2.The Problem I had with this movie was with the third act, it should have had one ending and not a bunch of em but nonetheless this might be the best movie of 2022.

I don't see what people see in this movie. I was in an audience that was mostly 20 year-olds. What I found gross and offensive, a lot of the audience found to be funny. To use violence and sick humor to make points about how to treat others correctly and compassionately just doesn't do it for me. It's trying to please viewers' in a sensorial way which is totally contrary to the feeling, gracious way of creating a lasting worthwhile message in a film. There's just too much emphasis on sick, sensorial thrills in this. Let's make better movies, filmmakers that really touch and audience in a genuine way!

Total Wasting of 2 hours!At the beginning, it felt good, but too much talk, which made this movie so boring. And they try so hard to make a story, at the end it is hard to understand what is going on!. Dumb everywhere, like 15 minutes in single movement!

I watched this after all the hype so maybe my expectations were too high, but this movie wasn't for me. I thought the acting was great and I did like the message of it, but it had too much going on without enough explanations and character development. It really is everything all at once and not in a good way. The concept of the multiverse and what was happening sometimes in scenes were not explained in a way to make everything conducive. I saw some reviews say the idea is kind of like the Matrix and I do agree a bit - full disclosure, I'm not a fan of the Matrix either. Maybe I just don't like these types of movies lol. I felt like I needed to be drunk or something to enjoy the ride to be honest.

reviews.review_title: If a character has to explain the plot then the film fails
reviews.content: I was curious to watch this movie because I had heard good things about it and I am a big fan of Michelle Yeoh. I was very disappointed by this mess of a movie. It started off well enough but then devolved into a series of jarring story shifts that overwhelmed any coherent story being told. Several times in the movie Evelyn's guide in an alternate universe delivers a rambling summary of what is going on. If a character in a film has to explain what is going on in the film then the filmmaker has failed in their primary task: making the film coherent to the audience. There is way too much dialogue attempting to describe what is going instead letting the story unfold on its own. The premise of the plot is interesting, but the story in the mind of the director was not translated before the camera effectively.

Started with an interesting premise of multiple universes but dragged on interminably with repetitive fight scenes triggered by a fall into ( or from) another universe. By the time it finished it was hard to tell what was the point of the movie, apparently a mother - daughter relationship.

This Film is able to unite slap stick with real deep philosophical topics and a really beautiful romantic family story. Daniel Scheinert and Daniel Kwan are able to put really funny scenes in the film to get the perfect pacing between a heartwarming story and the sense of life from the point of view of very old Asian culture that ist still a great view on the things. If you are unsure wether you should go in this movie or not I can just tell you to definitely see that movie.

reviews.review_title: Could have been a great movie
reviews.content: The premise of this movie is great and I really enjoyed like the first half of it, despite some flaws. But then it completely loses its plot and falls apart. Feels like this was even written by an AI, making it an incoherent mess.Weirdness is always fun for me, but it needs to be coherent. Douglas Adams or Terry Pratchett were masters of coherent weirdness and it feels like the writers were going for something like that here (especially thinking of the Improbability Drive). But the difference here is that the weirdness isn't smart. They could have come up with so many strange and wonderful universe ideas which could have had at least some logical explanation how they evolved. But what they did was three or four ridiculous throwaway gags like hotdog fingers or a stupid Ratatouille spoof which make no sense whatsoever and which they loved so much that they repeat them over and over and over again throughout the movie when they could have explored endless possibilities. And no, a universe where life didn't evolve has no telepathically thinking, moving rocks with googly eyes or even a blue sky.Then they introduce the very dangerous antagonist who can mix universes at will, giving her incredible powers with awesome on-screen effects. The heroine then, against the pleading of the people who gave her the ability to jump universes, intends to learn the same powers, but not falling into the dark place where the antagonist went and using them to stop her.Which is a nice concept and completely forgotten for the rest of the film. Don't know if the budget was gone or if the AI who wrote the movie just doesn't have long-term memory to come up with a coherent plot over +2 hours. But the antagonist basically doesn't do anything from then on and they just talk, jumping between the few universes which have already been introduced. Which has some interesting philosophical thoughts thrown in - after all I went into the movie expecting some philosophy and meaning behind the craziness - but they could have done that while keeping the plot alive.Then, after lots of talking and jumping, the relationships are kind of fixed (or back where they started) and the movie ends. If this isn't the most anticlimactic last half of a movie I've ever seen, then I don't know.All in all, it's a very frustrating movie. I love the basic concept and was looking forward to what the Daniels would do with it, especially after I loved Swiss Army Man. Very disappointed.
The prefect amount of humor, positivity, sadness, and action. Nothing on this movie feels forced, the pacing is perfect, and the acting is outstanding. Bravo.

reviews.review_title: No shrooms needed for this Flick!
reviews.content: Loved loved loved this movie. Omg, talk about mind blowing. I can't wait to see it again. The creators flew way, way outside the "box" for this one. I especially loved the Depiction of the Chinese culture, and all the details. Be prepared for a new version of reality. So fun, so wild, so imaginative, don't want to spoil it with details, but must see on big screen if you can!

reviews.review_title: If "Sorry to Bother You" was actually smart.
reviews.content: I had seen STBY in an advance screening and was immensely disappointing. Having a "twist" came at the cost of its characters and plot being half-baked. Not so here. This film is hilarious and visceral from beginning to end. Its absurdism and sci-fi elements enhance the story rather than serve as a twist. The cast is stellar throughout and clearly had a blast making the film. This is a prime example of making a script that is truly designed for a visual medium - you could not tell this story outside film, and that's a good thing. Clever and fun action paired with sincere dialogue and stunning visuals, EEAaO is a tour de force of high concept filmmaking done without sacrificing humor or entertainment for the sake of being "art."

reviews.review_title: If three people told you what they saw, you'd think they were talking about different movies
reviews.content: You aren't going to see anything resembling what you see here. I have seen it once, and when I choose to see it again (and I will) I am sure to see things with a new perspective.The Sci-Fi is the hook, but the story or more specifically stories develop at different yet compelling paces. I was 20 minutes into the drive home before I began to recognize how it all comes together.

This movie is as entertaining, as bizarre and as nuts as the title sounds. At the same time it's a movie that will make you reflect on a lot of things. This might be my favourite 2022 movie. I'm so glad I saw this in a full theatre.This is a proper multiverse movie. When you see the idea of multiverse in superhero movies, it's cool and all but it's never the main focus of the story. This movie on the other hand, really explores what it means for a person, if the multiverse really exists. It asks you, how would you deal with that fact? Let's say every choice you make just creates another universe where you, and everyone else live with that choice. Let's say there are millions of versions of you who are much better off than you are today. Maybe, because of some bad choices you are where you are today. How would you deal with it? Or does it even matter what choice YOU make anymore? The movie brilliantly nails in this feeling of "Nothing matters" into it's characters, and it's viewers. And still, it gives out a very optimistic message. It redeems those emotions in a satisfying finale.It might sound that this is a very serious movie. Trust me, this movie is hilarious for 90% of the runtime. It asks all these serious questions in the most entertaining, hilarious way possible. It's full of jokes and has some intense, dark yet ridiculously funny action sequences with great stuntwork too. It's the sort of movie where you'll think "what's even going on anymore?" and not in a bad way, in a very funny way. It's like whatever bizzare, offbeat thing came to the director's mind, he just did it. And I love when creators fully express themselves without holding back. The movie is very fast paced too, full of energy. The editing in particular, is very, very creative.To make this masterpiece with just 25 million dollar budget, it's a rare feat.

reviews.review_title: Maybe the most perfect movie I've ever seen
reviews.content: At first, I was a bit apprehensive that it would live up to the hype. But then it kept giving, and giving, and giving. I bought popcorn but a quarter way through the movie I was so choked up that I barely ate any of it. It's almost every genre wrapped in one--I laughed at some parts, hid my eyes behind my hands at some parts, and held back tears at others. It was a rollercoaster. The main character is like Neo if he were to be reincarnated into an old Chinese woman. Just go see it :)

This movie is overrated and pretentious. It's also a Matrix ripoff. Take away the overdone kung fu fight scenes, CGI, PC messages, and incoherent plot and you're left with a half-hour melodrama about a dysfunctional family that runs a laundromat. Now it's beginning to sound like a bad dramedy TV pilot that was never picked up.I love weird, dark comedies and dramas. But this movie can't decide when, or how, to incorporate elements of those genres. Hot dog hands as a serious plot point? Raccoon-head man as an empathetic character? Waymond as a 007-type? A floating bagel that represents Jobu Tupaki's nihilism and yin and yang? Where is Keanu Reeves when you need him?This movie is The Emperor's New Clothes; someone has to say it.
I don't even know what you could possibly take issue with in this film. It is the greatest of all time. Go in blind and let it happen.Also I am gay for Stephanie Hsu.

This is not Matrix, not Steins;Gate, but a comedy that fits every person.This movie really work is its underlying storyline even as reading subtitles and trying to understand what is going on during the first half of the movie takes a bit of mental endurance.

How can a film make no sense at all but make complete sense at the same time!!!The cast is terrific and will have you dying with laughter!Definitely recommend seeing this in the cinemas.Best film of the year so far!

This film was amazingly executed, with a film that has so much ground to cover it is very easy to run the story too long, but this film has the perfect run time for it. The acting is outstanding as well.Overall, 8/10.

reviews.review_title: Definitely does not deserve the hype but its Okay to watch.
reviews.content: I am guessing most reviews must be biased in one way or the other. It s not that great but its "okay" as a weekend entertainment with the family , kind of thing. I wouldn't go to a cinema to watch it but I would watch it if it was on TV .Maybe its because after all the positive criticism I was expecting too much so it was a kind of disappointment . However 4/10 points is still being generous about it. Its not that great , just barely good enough to watch it.

This is insanely one of the best movies ever made.It takes you in a world that you can definitely relate.A movie that connects family and teaches us to cherish what have. A human can be anything he or she wants but kindness is what makes all the difference eventually. And it does not cost you a penny.Engaging, excellent performances, beautiful hair and make up and some mind boggling time paradox.Watch it or miss something really about you.

reviews.review_title: Not perfect, not for everyone, but definitely an experience!
reviews.content: This is a film unlike no other, it's up to you to decide if that's a good thing or a bad thing.In my case I absolutely loved it, the humor landed with me every time there was a joke and the heartfelt moments were tastefully done in my opinion. The characters are there and they aren't just empty vessels for the action, the main characters all get fulfilling character arcs and even side characters get to have their own backstories developed a bit across the multiverse!There are a ton of little cues, details and foreshadowing that pop up upon a rewatch and to someone like me who loves rewatching the movies I like, it adds a ton of value and makes for a better experience.The movie is weird and convoluted, hard to follow at times and at some points I heard people near me in the theater say: "What are we even watching?" However if you're able to embrace this uniqueness and immense creativity, it becomes an experience like no other. So many things happen during the runtime of the film that there's always something to love, and you'll come out with several memorable moments to joke about.The title Everything Everywhere All at Once describes the viewing experience perfectly. Some might hate it or feel overwhelmed, I loved it start to finish, nonetheless it is undeniable that its a unique experience and for this reason I consider it a must watch.

This film is one of those rare beasts that really is as good as everyone says. The hype is most definitely worth it.It boasts a truly wonderful, poignant, crazy and colourful plot which has everything from drama to comedy and incredibly fun action scenes.The performances are all terrific. Michelle Yeoh is a real force in this film, and Stephanie Hsu as her daughter steals the show in a fantastically well crafted role.The visuals are all spot on. The pacing brilliant. The costumes and score are perfect.A truly wonderful, wonderful film.

A movie that makes you think that maybe, just maybe you can still do it. You can still live in this world and not just survive.The deliverance of the plot, cinematography and visuals are stunning. The message behind this a tender subject rooted in generational gaps and delivers it to the targeted age groups flawlessly.An amazing film, truly.

reviews.review_title: The best multiverse movie to come out in ages.
reviews.content: Multiverse stories are all the rage right now. While most of them seem to be relegated to comic book adaptations (like Loki, Spider-man: No Way Home (2021), and Dr. Strange and the Multiverse of Madness (2022)), by far the best one to emerge from this pile of parallel universes is Everything Everywhere All at Once (2022). It is the most bizarrely funny movie I've seen in some time, which just goes to show how films released by A24 are of a higher caliber than anything else.Most multiverse movies play it pretty safe when exploring branching paths of the known universe. Everything Everywhere All at Once throws literally everything at the audience, and the result is hilarious. Office equipment mechas, Human Ratatouilles, Rocks, Bagels. I honestly can't come close to describing the rapid-fire series of absurdist realities. Some moments were straight laugh-out-loud funny to me, and others were...a bit more adult in their ridiculousness. I definitely suggest going in sober for this film, as you'll need all your mental faculties to absorb it.At its heart, Everything Everywhere All at Once is a movie about family. Mothers and daughters. Spouses. Grandfathers. The only reason I don't give this movie a full five stars is because the core of the movie is a little lost by the end. After all the weird stuff thrown on the screen in two hours, coming back to a semblance of a normal reality felt hollow, even if it was necessary to tie everything from everywhere back to the plot that started the movie. Yes, it is a heartfelt ending, but it's difficult to take it seriously after dildo fights and hot dog fingers.The best multiverse movie to come out in ages, I give Everything Everywhere All at Once 4.5 stars out of 5.

reviews.review_title: Everything I Wanted, All At Once
reviews.content: I haven't felt like this since watching Being John Malkovich over twenty years ago. What a fantastic and deep movie which explores existentialism, nihilism, and regret. However, it really is a story of a mother and spouse's relationship with her husband and daughter, particularly the latter.Michelle Yeoh demonstrates a new side of an overstretched parent who also chooses not to see her daughter and is losing her. She is incredible in the first twenty minutes of giving off the day-to-day chaos energy the universe throws at her.I'm sorry, but not surprised, to see so many negative reviews here. This is a purposefully chaotic, strange, and whiplash movie that so rarely graces the screen these days and is so refreshing to see Hollywood still has some originality. Kudos to the producers who green kit this, I can't imagine the gut wrenching of that decision. I hope it pays off in spades at the Academy Awards.

reviews.review_title: Someone sat down and said "what does doing taxes really mean"
reviews.content: The movie takes you on a journey with a family who is getting audited. There are so many layers in which the story works, and it's executed beautifully to keep you hooked from the opening shot to the credits. (No joke the audience could NOT get up after).The movie does not throw everything at you at once, it initially shows you what it is, slowly, it teaches you how to process it's story, and when you're ready, it dumps reality on you in such a brilliant way that you will feel every emotion possible.The acting was brilliant from everyone involved, the writing is so real considering the topic and genres explored. The cinematography served the story perfectly, almost guaranteeing you not only witness it, but be a part of it too.The film manages to establish the most grandiose of themes with the most relatable characters, showing the story not just through the characters eyes, but our own eyes.It sounds cliché, but very few movies, if any, captures me the way EEAAO did.The film, in its core, is trying to take the load off our shoulders, the current world we live in has been traumatic for most, and this was just a little reminder to take a step back, breathe, and enjoy the time you have with the people you love.I can go on and on about the different meanings, but do yourselves a favor and watch it.

reviews.review_title: The multiverse of madness we deserved!
reviews.content: Everything Everywhere All at Once tells the story of Evelyn Wang(Michelle Yeoh). Evelyn is a Chinese immigrant who gets catapulted into an insane adventure spanning different universes. She learns that she is the only one who can save the world & the multiverse.Everything Everywhere All at Once is a mind-blowing film. Directors Dan Kwan & Daniel Schienert have given us a one of a kind cinematic extravaganza that will take you on a wild ride. The action set pieces are some of the best to ever be put on celluloid. The visual effects are awe-inspiring. The comedy makes you laugh raucously, almost throughout its runtime. The emotional scenes are the perfect foil to the non-stop action and comedy of the movie. Michelle Yeoh is spectacular as Evelyn Wang. Yeoh has given her career best performance here & she definitely deserves an Oscar nomination. Stephanie Hsu is outstanding as Joy Wang. Hsu holds her own in all her scenes with the legendary Michelle Yeoh. Ke Huy Quan is brilliant as Waymond Wong. Jamie Lee Curtis is fantastic as Dierdre Beaubierdre. James Hong is unforgettable as Gong Gong. Everything Everywhere All at Once is a must watch for all the fans of the big screen experience & flawless films. Go and have an insanely enjoyable time!

This movie was chaotic and even annoying at times. It will turn some people off for sure. But it still allows us to feel our own personal chaos and reflect on our relationships. These are close relationships, and even obligatory distant ones like the bureaucrat that frustrates you to the point of near madness.The enormity of everything is ridiculous. We are ridiculous too, of course. Responding to hostility with kindness is not in our nature.Fantastic performances all around, most notably Ke Huy Quan (Waymond) and Stephanie Hsu (Joy). Waymond symbolized the heart of this movie and Joy the turmoil. It was great seeing Quan, who had to be one of the greatest child actors ever on the big screen (The Goonies, Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom) return and claim his stardom like his co-star Michelle Yeoh. Hsu killed it from start to finish. Jamie Lee Curtis kills it too.The essence of the Chinese family worked here for me, they represent humanity colorfully and fantastically. These, and other thoughtful details throughout this wild trip make it evident that the writer/director team of Dan Kwan and Daniel Scheinert are confident and on top of their craft, blending visual elements of the absurd and those with great depth. Swiss Army Man is a great example of this. What will they create next?

It is hard to review this film without diminishing it.The plot - which makes perfect sense as it unfolds - is actually insane. At several points I stopped and realised what I was watching was just BONKERS.Yet still, I loved it.And despite how bonkers the film is. And how deeply philosophical it is, it remains a very emotional film. A very sweet-natured and kind film. That's partly the script, partly the wonderful performances.I genuinely cried, I uncontrollably laughed. And when the film was over I thought about what I'd seen. And so I had to watch it again. And that time I saw even more and loved it even more. And now I want to watch it again.This is a rare gem. A film as close to perfection as is possible. It looks stunning. It will make you think. And it just made me feel better for having seen it.It's my new favourite film. And it's just EVERYTHING.

I would have given this 10, as its a beautiful art house style film. Its a piece of art and artists and masters will love it. BUT, for the fact all the advertising lead it to be more straightforward, I wasnt prepared nore anyone else in the theatre. I was tired about halfway through. Disappointed in the false advertising, as I didnt enjoy this as much as I would have if i had been able to emotionally prepare myself going in. This is the type of film you can watch maybe, maybe once a year or every two years. Its very good, but very draining, although not in a bad way is you are lrepared. Such as qith Amadeus.

reviews.review_title: The most overrated movie I've seen in my life
reviews.content:
Incredibly Overrated
If you think you are going to watch something like a great movie like Parasite, you are wrongThis is a directorial show, as if the two directors were waving their hands to Marv and saying, "Look, we're good at this." Accept us into the company's teamdry music.Weak scenario.In some emotional times, someone throws a disgusting joke that is of no useAnd I don't want to talk about the long fingers that were in a universe of universes so that my blood wouldn't boilBriefly and with complete objectivity.

reviews.review_title: Could not enjoy it, but really tried
reviews.content: I saw the high rating on here and figured it would be great. I found it was too ridiculous to enjoy. I kept wondering if I was just tired or dumb, while I kept telling myself how ridiculous this movie is. I took a nap and tried watching again and it didn't help. It did help me fall asleep though!

A total waste of time. Another one of those forced woke films with asian cast. Every culture is different and they should have a decency to respect that. I don't understand why does all recent movies have to be about LGBTQ themed?

reviews.review_title: What a wild roller coaster ride!
reviews.content: I entered the movie knowing nothing about the movie. I barely even knew the name! All I knew was that my buddy told me he heard good things about so we made plans to see it.WOW!!!!! What a roller coaster ride! Some may criticize the plot as too chaotic but considering that chaos is a major theme for the movie, I find it most appropriate. I loved the creativity, the editing, the characters, the plot, and the philosophy at the core of the film.It has the laughs, the action, the drama and weaves through emotions seamlessly.10/10 GO WATCH THIS!!

All the choreographed fight scenes reminded me of another great film, "Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon." And just like "Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon", this film didn't forget that at its' core, it's a love story.It's extremely confusing at times but it's great fun to watch.

reviews.review_title: 1/10 because of your stupid reasons and not for the movie??
reviews.content: If you rate a movie because you're too dumb to understand it or are confused about it. Go watch a movie explanation/analysis from someone before coming here to give your 1/10. Come on, giving 1/10 because the movie is too long for you? Do you even know how to rate a movie?With that said, I think this movie was very well made. It's a good twist to some of the multiverse ideas. The movie was full of all sorts of emotions. The acting allowed me empathize with the characters. It brought forth some underlying issues in our current society. Insane sequence. Well choreographed "fights". Support characters in the movie dramatically enhanced the story and it wasn't just about the main character. Many of considered confusing ideas in the movie are also explained well in the movie.
Genuinely one of the best movies ever made. I've seen most movies that are considered as the best of the best, and this one is still in my top 3 movies of all time. It's unbelievably well made.

Marvel: after 14 years of building our
cinematic universe, we are finally ready to dive into the madness that is the multiverse. Can anyone make it cooler than us?A24: hold my googly eyes 👀I don't think I could explain this movie, but I cried when I watched it. This movie is something you experience, not watch.The cinematography and editing are phenomenal! ✨I think there might have been a bit too many fight scenes, but it is an absolutely fantastic film with so many wonderful lessons to be learned. Inspirational and moving.It's a unique experience that I'm very grateful for me in this universe that I chose to see it.

I guess I don't really know what I was expecting... I came to this movie on the recommendation of a movie influencer I follow but purposefully didn't look into it much. I knew it was about exploring other universes and that is usually right up my street.I was expecting something like "About Time"and "Butterfly Effect" - quite moving storylines with real substance.Unfortunately I found this verged on the ridiculous. Which I know you have to expect a little with a 'time-travel' style film, but there's ways to it without it becoming silly.I'm sure some people will find some scenes moving or emotional but I unfortunately I didn't care about the characters enough. It did make me laugh in parts big overall, it was a miss from me.

Among the greatest cinematic accomplishments of all time. Creative genius. I have never seen anything like it. At the same time, its incoherent and senseless beauty also make it virtually unwatchable. Go see it. The experience is worth it, even if you walk out halfway through.

reviews.review_title: The title of the movie says it all
reviews.content: Well, the title of the movie is not just about the movie. It makes you feel a lot of things simultaneously. Here let me just make it bit clear. At times in the movie you will feel great, energetic, motivated about life and what not, but at the same time few dialogues or scenes would make you feel exact opposite of it. I am not saying its depressing but it brings up the question "nothing matters?" and it makes you feel hopeless, useless but in a good way. Yes you heard me right but how can someone feel hopeless in a good way. Hence watch the movie, you will know what I am saying. I didn't knew the cast or anything about the other crew but everything was perfect.It's that movie when you get out of the theatre and wonder what just happened. Am I doing the right things I must do.

reviews.review_title: Authors must've went on an acid trip - and came back telling about it but so that you can understand.
reviews.content: To keep the repetition among reviews brief: most creative movie I have ever seen, crafted well from overarching storyline and philosophical messages down to tiny details, very compelling character development, flawless acting, visual feast, fast-paced and complex but never overwhelming, utterly hilarious, applied humour ranges from flat-out college humour to subtle situational comedy - very brave, bold, heartfelt, relieving and intelligent.The movies effect of flipping the viewer between laughing, crying, thinking and awe continued for me after I left the cinema: Sat in contemplation at first, then cried - and went on to have the happiest night of this entire year. This movie can change your life and your decisions.To add something new: Why is noone mentioning the incredible job that the costume designer had done here?

Go see it to believe it! This was the most fun I've had in movie theatres in years! Michelle Yeoh absolutely nails her part, the movie being super original, at times super funny and very touching too. Van hardly get better than this! 9.5/10.

A truly bizarre mix that I guess could be sold as Matrix meets Parasite. A hardcore acid trip with hilarious scenes (Jamie Lee Curtis is stunning), great acting and dialogue, and a head scratcher bonkers story. The only thing that could've made it a perfect 10 for me is if they tightened up a few scenes (they really threw everything but the kitchen sink into this everything bagel). I laughed out loud several times, got emotional, cried, and screamed during a few scenes. That's all you can ask for in a great movie. See it on the big screen.

Everything Everywhere All at Once, the latest offering from A24, is set to go down as one the most innovative, heartfelt, and nonsensical movies of the year. Starring Michelle Yeoh, the film follows Evelyn Wang, a woman who learns she has the power to exist in parallel universes tasked with stopping the person trying to destroy them all. Evelyn is feeling an increasing amount of pressure as she preps the paperwork for her and her husband's dry cleaning business to go through an audit while also prepping for a Chinese New Year party as well as dealing with her distant daughter. When an alternate version of Waymond appears to tell her the multiverse in trouble and she's the only one who can save it all, Evelyn is swept up in events beyond her control as she finds a way to save everything, everywhere, all at once.While the premise may sound outlandish (because it is), at the heart of the movie is the generational trauma and interpersonal drama between the Wang family. Evelyn's rejection of her daughter's modern sensibilities, her ever-growing distance from her husband, a looming threat of suicide, and the baggage of any number of past decisions haunt the film from the first frame to the final one. All this is balanced deftly with the sci-fi elements of dimension hopping and universe-spanning adventures. The best science fiction is that which uses the genre trappings to tell a human story and directors Kwan and Scheinert have managed to weave a story that is exactly that. Is the science part of the movie a bit wonky and hand-wavy? Absolutely. But using it to tell the tale of a family on the verge of shattering that is funny, shocking, emotional, and impactful while also finding clever ways to pay homage to classic movies like 2001 and In the Mood for Love makes Everything Everywhere one of the year's best movies.Michelle Yeoh finally found a vehicle where she could let her talents fly, and fly they do. Without a doubt, Everything Everywhere is firmly her film; all the elements and themes flow through Evelyn Wang and directors Kwan and Scheinert have given her avenues to show both her comedic and dramatic chops. While we've seen these before (think Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon or her role on Star Trek: Discovery), it's rare we get to see such a substantial amount of both at the same time. Her martial arts acumen is well documented; seeing that combined with the dizzying array of other gifts she presents here reminds us that Yeoh has been a consummate performer for three decades and while there isn't a weak link in the acting in this film, no one else is holding a candle to her.Stephanie Hsu comes pretty close, however. While Yeoh is the film's main focus, Hsu's Joy is handling a lot of the subtle work throughout the film. In a movie that can only be described as ostentatious, Hsu's muted performance makes Joy one of the standout characters. Carrying the brunt of the film's anguish, Hsu is marvelous as she traverses through makeup and costumes as both Joy and the antagonist Jobu Tupaki, the person willing to burn it all down. Hsu and Yeoh's chemistry is electric as the two play off each other, ending in an aching moment of emotional catharsis that is equal parts relief and revelatory. Yeoh and Hsu sell these final moments, the crux of the entire movie, and thanks to their performances, the film rockets from good to great.Ke Huy Quan, better known to some as Data from the Goonies or Short Round from Indiana Jones, has less to do in the movie than Yeoh or Hsu but is no less important. A main part of the cause of the breaking family that is the Wangs, Quan's Waymond is the paragon of hope and optimism. Contrasted to Evelyn's depressed where-did-it-all-go-wrong mentality, Waymond's ebullience is both infectious and nauseating. While both Evelyn and Joy get multiple opportunities to shine, Waymond gets one great scene with Eveyln towards the end of the film that makes his character's entire trajectory worthwhile. Jamie Lee Curtis appears throughout the film as well as Deirdre, the IRS inspector set to take all that the Wangs hold dear. As a constant antagonist through the film, Curtis is great in her I-could-really-give-a-shit demeanor as a woman who's just doing her job, albeit at the expense of the Wang's livelihood. While the Wangs are the centerpiece of the movie, Curtis manages to compliment them in every scene she's in. James Hong, in less scenes than Curtis, is a delight to see as always as Evelyn's dad and brings a sorely needed gravitas to his scenes that are necessary to keeping the movie anchored.Directed by The Daniels (Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert), Everything Everywhere is a follow up to their equally inventive Swiss Army Man. Whereas Swiss Army Man presents a more surrealist type of story, Everything Everywhere pushes the envelope even father in terms of inventiveness and creativeness. The main strength of the film, and in The Daniels' storytelling, is the focus on the main issue: a dysfunctional family. Regardless of every bit of nonsense the directors throw at the audience, from our characters portrayed as rocks to a world where everyone has hot dogs for fingers, the story always reverts back to the Wang family and their interconnected struggles. Technically, Everything Everywhere is a masterpiece, managing to consistently shift through genres without losing sight of the objective. Be it the brilliant makeup Hsu's Joy is decked out in or her outlandish costume designs, the level of detail that went into creating the film reveals how well thought out and meticulous The Daniels and their crew are.Overall, Everything Everywhere All at Once will go down as one of the most impressive displays of creativity and imagination on screen. Daniels Kwan and Scheinert's ability to pull off a zany, darkly comedic sci-fi movie while interweaving a poignant family drama is nothing short of amazing. By far Michelle Yeoh's best role to date (as well as Stephanie Hsu's), Everything Everywhere shines a dazzling spotlight on the actress' myriad talents and specialties. An outrageously inventive premise, combined with strong acting and brilliant direction makes this a phones down, all senses dialed in must watch immediately.

If you don't like jim carey type of comedy, then this movie is not for you. But You can't deny, the directors put so much effort into this movie. The story is Obviously creative. Yes, if you are not smart Enough, some plots you may not be able to Understand on your 1st watch.

Spoiler free review-
Visually stunning, just the right amounts of just about every film genre... every. Film. Genre. Hahahaha! The comedy was outstanding and the entire cast pulls off even the most ridiculous of it. This film is very enjoyable on the big screen and it doesn't take itself too seriously which makes it that much better.

What a triumph of a movie.Entertainment, fun, pathos, laughs, surreal elements and a kookie unique story that suprises with every turn of the script.This movie dosen't take itself too seriously, its aim is to entertain with a brilliant cast who outshine in bringing it alive, with keeping your attention as you ain't quite sure where things are going to in this rollercoaster ride of kinda everything all at once.They've managed to create a great balance and thought deeply about what they are doing, bringing in their own enjoyment, cynicism, fun and double edged meanings to things, very impressive stuff that sadly makes much of the current Hollywood offerings seem banal and dry in comparison.

reviews.review_title: Cool, unique and family drama under sci-fi
reviews.content: It might be the first time i cried since spirited away. I despise rating system, and i don't normally do this. Cause reviews are subject and sometimes way too personal.But Everything Everywhere All at Once is just built different. I didn't expect to get that much experience watching a film with the tacky multi-universe sketch. But i'm genuinely surprised and overwhelmed by how good it helps the plot. This design is not just used to create a Nolan-ish crazy high-budget scene, but serves as a perfect bridge to the ending.The ending just makes me bawl like a baby. Again, any asian child or any child can relate so much to this movie. Wonderful, wonderful job from the two Daniels.

It is quite rare that narrative techniques are not only perfectly utilised but invented for a film that does not stand upon nor shed the light on such techniques for the sake of positive critical appraisal but rather to immerse a wider range of audience ending up with some sort of family movie.The risk lies within the fact that this could have been taken for what it really wasn't. The narrative 'mistakes' used on purpose were hit or miss, but in my opinion, work on so many levels.It never relied on ironic humour but rather 'silly' humour which was not amusing to a lot of people. Now, my take is this was not part of a comedy bit but a meta bit. The whole movie was actually meta, referencing many sci-fi ideas commonly used and turning this from just a fun movie into much more than that, for those who are into it anyway. It was messy as Joy said; it was really weird how every adjective that could've been used to describe the narration was mentioned by someone in the movie. I'm kinda sure they did it on purpose.A take from the story was that it's okay to be okay with silly. Silly and simple is okay sometimes and so were the jokes. A silly husband like that one may not be someone we meet every day, and those are not the random jokes expected to be in a sci film, but here we are. We understand how silly this whole situation is, we understand how silly everything is.The movie was messy just like Joy and Evelyn but it was consistently so. It consistently delivered imperfections that were already vital takes from the story.It could be argued that there was no specific point of climax but more like half an hour of a climax and it is a valid point but also valid for the writers to execute. They did an incredible job at delivering an experience of everything, all at once. It is what life is like after all.This was somehow never confusing at any point which many directors could have taken an advantage of the feed those who are satisfied watching complicated non-linear storytelling but they didn't; they took the risk to take it further. They took the risk to turn it into this bagel of a project of a film.I loved how the stories or realisations of mistakes blended in together so seamlessly. It was so many genres and ideas in one simply made and easily-understood movie. This, somehow, worked?Profound. Tremendously relatable. Absolutely real.This is a 10/10 not because it's perfect for perfect does not exist but because it's beyond original, it's here to revolutionalize the film industry.Will be deserving next year's best picture.Absolutely Phenomenal.

Brilliant writing and acting but not a fresh idea despite many saying. It has joy, laugh, comedy action, drama and important messages but for me it gives a scense of over do in some parts that throws the audience off & feels like too much! Maybe a different director could made this a masterpiece but anyway, really enjoyable and definitaly worth your time.

I loved this, but don't watch this while you're trying to do something else. At least not unless you are a) VERY good at split attention and b) speak Chinese fluently.The show bounces back and forth between English, Chinese, and heavily accented Chinese. This is not a criticism, this is just the result of the setting of the movie, and that's fine. But if you are trying to watch it while looking down at something you are working on you will miss important elements, and that would be a shame.The acting all round was superb, serious where it had to be, exasperated, incredulous, sympathetic, angry. Just about every actor here put in an above average or incredible performance. Some bits were, well weird as hell, but that was really just to make a point. And even those weird bits were often of high emotional impact.The directing choices were on point, the pacing was neither to fast or to slow, and the character development was well done without making anyone a caricature of themselves. A much better approach to cross-reality shenanigans than other movies that came out at about the same time.It's good to see some older actors seriously kicking arse on screen. And not being afraid to be vulnerable at the same time.

EEAAO totally lived up to the hype for me. Michelle Yeoh was beyond amazing, and the Daniels showed their fluency in cinematic and visual language to the point that every scene begs to be re-watched. Talented, brilliant, incredible, amazing, show-stopping, spectacular, totally unique, never the same, completely not ever been done before, unafraid to reference or not reference...

After what feels like eons of derivative films, sequels of old classics, and emotionless tat, we are thrown into a world where anything can happen, and does, but the characters are well developed, the concept unique, the action is innovative and the ending is satisfying (rather than a cop out). Lovely direction, acting, score. One moment I was crying, the next I was laughing.It gave me hope for the film industry.

My friends were raving about this movie (RAVING!) and I hate to say I was sadly disappointed. I really loved the idea of it, though, and the message it was trying to send. But the story line was so difficult to follow, it led me into instant confusion. My biggest issue with this movie was that it could have done without the ridiculous fighting scenes and universes (a universe where humans have hot dog fingers? And they eat their fingers with mustard coming out?). These details distracted me from the true message behind this film. It could have been so much more, way more poignant, without the overload of stupidity. This inundation kept it from being the true gem it could have been.

reviews.review_title: I'm in the middle of watching it and just come here to check if I am the only one disappointed.
reviews.content: Turned out I am not. I've rolled my eyes, felt embarrassed and cringed multiple times so far. The storyline is a mess. I guess they try to make it philosophical and profound but they really went way way to far into the abyss of confusion and nonsense. I'm Taiwanese so I can understand every Mandarin sentence perfectly and this makes watching it even more painful. I don't think this movie will stand the test of time and I think its right score will be four point something. Hugely overrated. Now I will go back and finish it. This is the kind of person I am but I guess I will have to find creative ways to amuse myself to hang on to the end. To those of you who really finished watching it, you deserve a big hand for your incredible tolerance of bad movies. It's slow death.

An insignificantly movie about nothing. Again, the horrible American way of life and values; Hollywood at its worst. Sprinkled with Chinese martial art, what's the message? Gay rights? Multiculturalism? The good against the evil. I can't believe this movie is nominated for the Oscar of best movie; it's ludicrous. Bad script, bad acting, bad sets, bad effects, bad costumes; this movie as all wrong and I can't believe I wasted my time on that lemon. And i still have to write 123 characters! How painful! And it's supposed to be funny; you know the kind of humour you find in cheap TV soaps in the afternoon. Hope the academy will not fall for this. Yeah, its a melting pot but the result is lame.

A little known piece of movie trivia. For the 1978 film Superman, when Marlon Brando was first hired to play Jor-El, father of Superman, he spooked the producers by explaining that, as a Method Actor, he was not sure if he should play the role as a giant bagel? What is it with Hollywood and metaphysics and bagels? This one of a kind film uses clever writing and excellent actors to explain Quantum Theory. Which, for those who care, is not 100% compatible with Einsteinian physics. The film is a wonderful experience, but is not truly entertainment. For example, it takes an entire half-hour just to connect with the viewer, runs too long, and is not likely to be your first choice for a re-watch. But it does take its special place in film history, and it definitely lingers. ((Designated "IMDb Top Reviewer." Please check out my list "167+ Nearly-Perfect Movies (with the occasional Anime or TV miniseries) you can/should see again and again (1932 to the present))

reviews.review_title: A Masterpiece of Western Storytelling Tropes from a Chinese Immigrant's Perspective
reviews.content: "Everything Everywhere All at Once," is good because it makes fun of every clichéd thought you've had in your head. The film is meant to be in your face. The daughter/mother relationship of love vs. Hate vs. Loss vs. Longing etc. Is universal to all relationships. One thing, however, is clear: it is better to give this meaningless existence a try than go mindlessly into the void. This longing to exist is unique to this sort of nihilistic storytelling.I see... ironically I need more characters because rules exist. I was trying to be concise, which is exactly the point, nothing matters and life is often a chore, but what even is death or non-existence? It's impossible to comprehend truly.

Whilst watching this movie I felt something I haven't felt in a long time going to the cinema. I really go regularly, but this is a movie I would love to see again! Also I need to see all the pictures from the scene in which you see a close up of her in all the different realities!What I noticed during the end of the movie is that the black bagel with the white opening in the middle is the exact reverse of the googly eye. Googly eyes representing the good and the bagel representing the bad (hilarious since I really don't get the point of bagels). All the googly eyes in the whole movie might be representations of acting out of kindness (will have to watch again).

reviews.review_title: Bizarre and Amazing All At Once
reviews.content: What an absolutely thrilling ride!Everything Everywhere All At Once is absolutely bizarre, hilarious but also incorporates a really touching underlying story.This movie is getting a lot of buzz, and WOW is it justified! You've got the stellar acting of Michelle Yeoh accompanied by Stephanie Hsu, Ke Huy Quan, James Hong and Jamie Lee Curtis. A perfectly twisted story that morphs into a very relatable ending thanks to writer/director duo Dan Kwan and Daniel Scheinert.Although it's hard to describe EEAAO without spoiling some fun scenes, I definitely recommend this as a great watch!

reviews.review_title: The movie equivalent of Thumbelina (with kung fu)
reviews.content: This movie started of well with an intriguing beginning and concept, but got too carried away with it's own cleverness. It's like the writers got progressively drunk.It reminds me of Thumbelina, a story with a passive person, which is really just a random string of plots cobbled together and everything turns out it ok because of (insert random event here).It had its moments of laugh out loud wacky but the endless derivative Matrix-on-acid kung fu scenes were actually boring and should have been edited out. We get it ok? They can draw on other universe skills, but did we need an hour of that?

This is one of those movies where it's so ambitious, so much going on that people are afraid to criticize it. I'm not afraid. This movie was a mess. Characters and scenes added with reckless abandon. A plot that went nowhere. The choreography was pretty good. The acting by the daughter was good. That's it. This was a silly movie and it only got an 8.2 because people won't admit how dumb it was. The work that went into it was pretty impressive but wow. Just a dumb movie. Not for me.

reviews.review_title: A worthwhile journey into multi universe of daily lives
reviews.content: Daniels auspiciously implemented parent-child (fam) typical issues into one hell of a show which were silly and sincere in equal measure. Those wildly multi-universe jumps might not be for everyone but Yeoh & Quan made the journey worthwhile.

A must watch. There is really nothing bad that can be said about this movie. Every scene is so deep and can be interpreted in numerous different ways for pretty much anyone to relate to and apply to their own life. It honestly has everything. Humor, heart, wisdom, amazing cinematography and score. The whole movie is rife with symbolism and philosophical concepts - yin/yang being the obvious ones. The existential nihilist concepts explored are unlike anything I've seen in any medium - some feel right out of the page of Schopenhauer. It's a superb film for all, but especially for those who lean toward pessimistic, misanthropic, and nihilistic worldviews, as it's a much needed reminder that there is always another way to look at things. It doesn't always have to be about the negative.

reviews.review_title: I want to watch this movie forever
reviews.content: I bawled like a baby at this movie. Like full ugly cry in the theatre. Go see it a lot of times. I can see myself rewatching this movie over and over.
