45 min in, turned it off as it was getting annoying.Cringe level: high.The premise build is vaguely strung together via flashbacks that are literally flashes. Language is near impossible to follow as mixed with chinese and english and only partial subs (for the chineses).Scenes are very short with incoherent dialogue. There is very little flow in any scene. Granted there is a lot going on, but it equates to a rather incoherent jumble of mediocre scenes and dodgy cinematography struggling to build anything resembling a storyline.The storyline that does transpire is neither inviting or interesting.This is one of those films where you wonder what anyone involved with the production was thinking. If this is what the editors could muster as a final version, then how bad must have the overall direction been?The level of discomfort felt for the actors being required to enact the script, assuming there actually was one, was significant.How this film can receive positive acclaim is bewildering.No idea who is making the 5***** reviews, but they can't be real people.

My instincts told me to avoid after watching the trailer. It reeked of being the sort of try-hard artsy, divisive loved/hated sort of film that happens every so often. I should've listened to my instincts.If you want a "fun, silly" ride, this ain't it, at least not for me. I recommend watching RRR (Rise Roar Revolt) instead. RRR was delightfully absurd and over-the-top but in an enjoyable way that leaves you in a great mood. I was similarly skeptical with that film at first, but before I knew it three hours flew by and I was only disappointed it had to end.I had similar hopes for this film. Nope.In comparison, EEAO is a flaming dumpster floating down a flooded street in a hurricane of pretentious nihilistic post-modern suck, that just leaves you feeling like you finally escaped an intensely exhausting ordeal with someone having a psychotic break.It was painful to watch from beginning to end.The family of characters is introduced, and they are cliche, irritating in different ways, and unlikable. You may hope that will change. It won't. The plot is paper thin with no room or time for them to believably change.The film gradually ramps up with increasing absurdity like a bad acid trip, and once it's fully off the rails, it stays there for what seems like an insufferable eternity.The humor: So outlandish, vulgar, and immature that even my raunchy-comedy/adult-cartoon loving partner grew tired of it very quickly.The action/fighting: Relies heavily on the absurdity of the above humor rather than exciting originality or execution. It's stunningly dumb and unbelievable, which in turn makes it boring and unimpressive to watch. As an action fan, this probably pained me the most. I won't even mention how many films it ripped off, poorly, even as a parody.Take the comedy, the action, and add in an extremely shallow, barely fleshed out concept of a multiverse to disappoint the sci-fi fans, and then beat it to death over and over because apparently the audience is too dumb to get it the first 50 times. It's as if the filmmakers were so utterly impressed with themselves for being 'So creative! So quirky! So edgy!' that they just couldn't stop, move on, and get on with it.Then in the last half hour or so, the filmmakers suddenly remembered they were supposed to be making a movie and clumsily shoehorned in a bad attempt to have a point and character development. But it was too little, too late, feeling completely forced and frankly unwelcome after the pile of garbage I just endured.I've lost a great deal of respect for anyone involved with or involved with promoting this film. I hated virtually every tortured minute of it.

reviews.review_title: I'm ending my aspiration to write films.
reviews.content: I'll never write a film this good. So why bother? I had a somewhat similar idea, but they did it so much better than I ever could. So.. why bother. Nothing matters.

This is the definition of a masterpiece and one everyone should watch as soon as they can as it's the kind of movie that reignites your passion for cinema. There are movies that make you believe in movies. This is absolutely one of them, an original vision in a Hollywood increasingly prone to repetition and redundancy. It may overwhelm lovers of the mainstream, but its peculiarity is also what makes it special. Were only a quarter of the way through 2022, but I am already fairly confident in saying that this is the best film of the year. Not only that, its one of my favorite films of all time.

reviews.review_title: This movie starts off promising and ends up bad 3/10
reviews.content: I truly wanted to enjoy this movie especially after the first 25 minutes, but then it just ends up being trite, boring, pedestrian rubbish. It's not convoluted, it's easy to follow, but my lord it takes forever to get anywhere with substance.This movie could easily have been and hour and 25 minutes long and better for it, though it would still have been childish nonsense in the main.Have to say this; just because the movie is bad, doesn't mean all the acting is, the acting is the best part of the movie.

reviews.review_title: Bucking the all or nothing trend
reviews.content: And saying that this movie is ok. Not great, not terrible. Just ok. Watch half and you have seen the whole. Visually amusing then slightly annoying. Acting great although the squeaky male lead grates after a while and somehow it is difficult to take the 'fat' (using the movie's nomenclature as am sure I would be cancelled if I used it without quotation marks) daughter too seriously. But then not much is too serious about this and that's part of its charm. For my part I felt the message was received way before the finale. To the point where I just willed it to end so I could be done with it and wonder why it was nominated for an Oscar. There are good things for sure but the self indulgence and unnecessary hammering home of the themes just got boring for half of the movie. Shame as the first half was fun.

Too boring, too long. Especially the fight scenes. I just couldn't understand the point. Very few movies that I left before they are finished. There are a few small jokes of course, but they are not enough to save the movie.

It wasn't even fun. Pure nonsense and expensive visual effects. If you know anything about paralel universe, this movie will literally offend you. The LENGHT OF THE MOVIE IS NONSENSE. This could have been told in less than 30 minutes. Popcorn film.

Originally this movie didn't seem appealing to me because of the theme and characters, but I decided to watch it because of a WatchMojo best movies of 2022 video. The plot was a bit slow at the beginning, but it gets really intriguing when all the craziness of the multiverse is shown. I don't want to spoil too much, but the thing that I liked about the movie was how Evelyn could acquire different skills from different versions of herself from other universes. Towards the end it got a little bit confusing, but I understood what was happening just about and was kind of satisfied with the ending, but I do wonder what would've happend in the alternative ending.

I had high expectations for this movie, but it was pointlessly confusing to a point that it got annoying. I can see why some people might like it, but not my cup of tea. I enjoy fast paced movies, but this movie seemed fast paced for the sake of it. I don't get the 8.1 rating, for me it below average, especially when it comes to plot and screenplay. The dialog is just cringy and pointless. The whole metaverse concept seems to be used more and more recently, unfortunately most times badly with the aimjust to impress the viewer.Short review: confusing, pointless, empty, bright, fast paced. A cornucopia of plastic candy, looks exciting from far away, but disappointing when you get closer to it.

This film has everything a filmgoer would ever ask for. It has comedy, drama, action, and a deep meaning. Aside from the comedic aspect of the film (which was extremly funny), I find that a lot of people that has gone through nihlistic depression can relate to the characters and the message of the film. Definitely a film worth your while.

reviews.review_title: REDUNDANT CHAOS FROM BAD DRUGS- Nomination smells fishy!
reviews.content: Everything, Everywhere All at Once. Ya Gotta be Joking Academy "members! This chaotically redundant film has zero meaning or relevance, unless you revel in bad psychedelic drugs & asian anxieties. Is this an attempt to explain asian interpretation of PTSD? Dialogue is discordant plagiarization of old cartoon characters! Lead character played by Michelle Yeoh is screamingly overstressed by failing laundromat business, and, of course, her young daughter is "considering" a gay relationship! Really? Is "everyone" gay now?? Her whiny apologetic husband and obnoxious screeching father would make anyone head for psych ward. Jamie Lee Curtis is reduced to sappy farces now. Sorry, Monty Python this is Not! Who lost their integrity at the Academy Of Arts & Sciences", or perhaps, were offered HUGE "incentives" to nominate this "kung foo fighting" rubbish. What a desecration to "Clair de Lune" in the soundtrack.

The movie had an extremely quick pace (hard to follow) and a lot of cliché meanings.....like we are all insignificant, human relations are the most important part of our lives etc.There were moments that the movie was actually amusing but in general it makes you feel like you want to stop watching it and see something else. The triangle of sadness is actually a better movie or even The Banshees of Inisherin, but nowadays if something differentiate from other movies we immediately embrace it like a masterpiece. Although it will win a bunch of Oscars, actually is like a home movie, the one that you will see while eating your lunch.

Anything above a 3 at best is being overly generous. This movie is a complete waste of time and money. I would have preferred to watch the previews over and over for 2 hours and 19 minutes. Just horrible. I went with a friend who wanted to see it and even my friend said this movie was the weirdest movie she'd ever seen. We should have walked out.

reviews.review_title: Hold on to your hats folks!!
reviews.content: Hold on to your hats, folks, because "Everything Everywhere All at Once" is one wild ride of a movie. Directed by the duo known as Daniels, this film takes you on a journey through multiple universes, and let me tell you, it's heck of a trip!Michelle Yeoh stars as a badass middle aged woman who discovers she has the power to travel through different dimensions. And who knew that power could come in so handy when you need to fight off a bunch of bad guys? Yeoh's performance is nothing short of amazing, and it's a testament to her talent that she can make kicking butt in multiple universes seem so effortless.But what really makes this movie shine is the incredible supporting cast. Ke Huy Quan plays Yeoh's husband/mentor, and He is simply amazing, and of course their daughter Stephanie Hsu? Well, let's just say that if you're looking for a laugh, she's got you covered. Between the three of them, you'll be laughing, crying, and cheering throughout the entire movie, and not to forget about the one and only Jamie Lee Curtis who played completely different character comparing to her other movies and oh my! She nailed it.The special effects in "Everything Everywhere All at Once" are mind-blowing, and the way the film plays with alternate realities is pretty trippy. I mean, there are moments where you'll feel like you're on an acid trip, and that's a good thing! (Not that I even tried it, but I heard from people who did!!) The cinematography is also gorgeous, and every shot looks like it was plucked straight out of a surrealist painting.But what I really love about this movie is how it balances the absurdity with the emotional depth. Yes, there are moments where you'll be scratching your head and wondering what the heck is going on, but there are also moments where you'll be moved to tears. This movie has heart, and it's not afraid to wear it on its sleeve.In short, "Everything Everywhere All at Once" is a movie that defies description. It's a mash-up of action, comedy, sci-fi, and drama, and it somehow manages to make all those genres work together seamlessly. If you're in the mood for something completely bonkers and unapologetically weird, this movie is for you. Just make sure you buckle up, because you're in for one hell of a ride.

Michelle Yeoh: is a bad ass.Jamie's relatively small part was a stroke of casting genius. She smashed it. Literally.Whilst nightmarish in places, the originality is outstanding. I found myself thinking about the person or persons who thought this up, and that they could very well be in straitjacket/s somewhere but, man alive, I am in awe of their talent.A surreal, vast, almost operatic film with beautifully choreographed action, quirky and hilariously comedic throughout 👀.As a person who cannot leave a chemist without buying yet another lip balm (seriously, I've got, like, hundreds of them) I'll never look at them in quite the same way again.What an unexpected gem of a movie. I loved it.10/10.

reviews.review_title: The idea is very interesting but the execution was not
reviews.content: Sorry, 6 out of 10. I don't know what I've watched.Don't get me wrong, The actors were great and I love parallel worlds/timeline stories which I dissect for others to understand. But this one? It was as if a newbie writer wrote a story with all the genres in the world and jammed it into a 2-hour movie with a lot of unnecessary sexual scenes.The constant switching between universes were also very distracting. It is understandable, the idea is there, but they used it excessively. It is fine if done in novels but totally not in a live-action (or animation) show.The comedy. Was it really necessary to add that genre? All the comedy scenes were funny but the tone of the story, the plot, it doesn't fit at all. The excessive use of comedy not only was a distraction but it killed the movie.It started as science fiction, turned into sex fights, became a comedy, then a teenage drama.It was fun at first. Then it dragged on and eventually "what is the show about again?"

I really, really do. Not cause it's bad, boring or pointless. Quite the opposite. It's because it makes me think and because it's so good in achieving what it aims to.On the surface it's an action comedy flick about middle-aged mother struggling with her everyday life and connection that she's rapidly losing with her daughter. All in the pseudo sci-fi theme of multiverse.But that's just the surface.I may be overinterpreting but I see Everything Everywhere All at Once as a trifold... For one, and most of all, a story about depression, struggling with one's identity and acceptance among those who should give it unconditionally. And depression is a difficult thing to live with. Diagnosed or not, it often holds a stigma of an excuse and some of those who lack empathy to comprehend its meaning tend to dismiss it as everything else other than it really is. And then there's also a theme of a change. That no matter how grounded we are in our beliefs, our outlook on life and rules the World is guided with, we should never stop questioning them and looking at every situation from all available angles. Because perhaps, what we consider good, right and appropriate may very well be precisely opposite and just not visible from the bubble of our perception that we're locking ourselves in. And last but not least, it's about dropping all the prejudices, all the opinions based on what we heard, read or saw and just making our own. Based on how things really are and not how they're depicted by others (or even media, but that's more of my observation than what's in the movie). After all, most people are good people who just made the wrong turn, willingly or otherwise, somewhere in their life and even though they may appear to be bad or beyond saving but hardly ever it is the case. One just needs to leave one's own comfort behind and just make that extra effort.So yeah, I hate this movie because of what it did to me. But I also love it for what it may do, what it may mean, if more people would see it. And even if only some of them will take that extra minute or two, to try to understand what they really saw afterwards and reflect. It will be a success. For humanity.

reviews.review_title: What do you ask of a painting?
reviews.content: Nothing. When you stand in front of the canvas it either speaks to you, or it doesn't. This movie is a work of art. It's presentation isn't profound or overly complex, but allows infinite analysis. A remarkable achievement.

Trust me, the first half or even the first 3/4 you might not get this movie. You're going to want to withdraw, but you have to make it to the end to piece it all together. It's a stunningly beautiful movie with some great messages about mother/daughter and husband/wife relationship dynamics... but you have to go with the flow to get there.

It says alot that in the midst of Marvel mania with recent titles such as dr strange and spiderman this film by studio A24 stands out as one of the best in recent times maybe even the best of this year. Everything Everywhere All at Once is a fun multiversal movie full of colour and comedy this film had some truly comdeic moments being and yet kept an emotional story throughout that can truly make you feel for its cast of characters. The story does a great job of setting up each characters story and manages to make sense throughout despite trying (and succeeding) to set up its multiversal rules aswell as a great story and each character in its 2 hour and 20 minute. It is a must watch for evryone this year.

I Almost gave up on this a few times. I don't know what my reaction would have been had I seen this in a theater.Watching at home I had to do it in 3 sittings. It seemed that the only result the creators wanted was to make a movie that appeared profound.I found it very visual and mostly tedious.I made it through the end.I was very surprised it all came together in the end. I couldn't tell you what it was about but I suppose it is all a personal experience.

Dildos, ball gags, hot dog hands, bagels, google eyes, splintered reality & evil IRS. A hot mess. A bad acid trip. Crazy. Put The Matrix, Ratatouille, 2001: A Space Odyssey, Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness, & a few others into a blender and this is what happens. Nonsense. Sure I laughed at a few sight gags but not enough to enjoy this movie. How I wish "The End" was really the end! Then 2 rocks talking at the top of a cliff? What was that about?!Psychologists and psychologists will probably love this movie. BUT when I have to google "everything everywhere all at once meaning" the movie lost me. I wasn't the only one. 2 friends went to bed after only 35 minutes. I wish I had left too.Thank a deity I watched it for free on Amazon Prime.

reviews.review_title: Not what I expected, in a good way
reviews.content: I come to watch "Everything Everywhere All at Once" thinking it is some well-made but run-of-the-mill human interest story of a woman finding her way as she navigates family situations. In a way, it is about that, but a third into the movie, you find yourself catapulted into one of the wackiest rides in cinematic history. The movie tries to answer a lot of our existential questions, and it does so through an outrageous adventure that partly doesn't make sense, partly gives you aha moments, and most importantly it entertains you with the visuals, costumes, action scenes, and endearing performances, especially by Michelle Yeoh and Stephanie Hsu who sports the movie's most memorable scene, confidently twirling those "weapons" in the air. Jamie Lee Curtis nails it, too, as a government Karen. Just sit back and enjoy the ride and try not to over analyze this like you would "Tenet" or "Inception." This is a comedy after all.

All I knew About This Film was it was a multiverse film with ke huy quan's acting return however when I say this film is a much watch it is with ke huy quan and Michelle Yeoh Deserving The Oscar's for their Performances. This Film is Beautiful to watch with Family Drama Between James Hong- Grandfather Gong Gong, Father- ke huy quan, Mother- Michelle Yeoh, and daughter- Stephanie Hsu. This Film Also has funny moments with googly eyes and amazing action people into martial arts/ Hong Kong cinema need to watch. This film also represents The LGBTG and its themes of the multiverse can make you cry #kehuyquanforbestsupportingactor.

I went in not knowing an awful lot about the movie thinking it was going to be some sort of sci-fi Kung fu action movie like those of the 00's, tho it does have elements of this, it was so much more. It was like watching one of the crazy dreams I have on a regular basis on the screen.Acting, directing all great, the action sequences are brilliantly choreographed, dialogue is witty and funny. The acting is phenomenal by all, But the one thing that shocked me the most was how much heart and emotion the film has. Truly outstanding unique film that even tho it's over 2 hours long it flies by and has infinite rewatchability.
Hot dogs. That's all I can say. Amazing film. You'll laugh. You'll cry. You'll want to watch this movie again. You won't look at hot dogs the same way.

Everything silly, Everywhere goofy, and All at Once profound. I have a new second-favorite film. It is inventive storytelling at its best. The Daniels have created something unlike anything in the genre. Michelle Yeoh triumphantly owns this role. She is purely magnificent. See this movie at once.

reviews.review_title: My favorite movie of the last decade
reviews.content: I don't want to give anything away so I will simply say: this movie is beautiful, poignant, hilarious, action packed, well acted, well written, surprising, and an all around pleasure to watch. Favorable comparisons to both eternal sunshine of the spotless mind AND Big trouble in little china (with 90 year old James Hong! Still being awesome!). Do yourself a favor and make time to really take this movie in without interruption!

reviews.review_title: One of my top 5 movies of all time
reviews.content: I went into this movie not knowing what was going on. No idea what the story was, not knowing the premise, and just watching everything unfold throughout was the best way to watch it. It was hilarious, emotional, thought provoking, and it was entirely fueled by Michelle Yeoh's undying commitment to the role. Also, Ke Huy Quan returning to the big screen in years was refreshing. Jamie Lee Curtis being able to adapt to a role, and keep is wondering what's happening with her is amazing. The movie as a whole was a refreshing, original idea, and it dives into the mindset of each character, and what they're going through. It's a phenomenal film.

reviews.review_title: If you get it, you get it
reviews.content:
And it hits you like a ton of bricks, it's beautiful, powerful, heart breaking, warm, funny
Everything cinema should be
A true modern classic, I will never get tired of watching.

reviews.review_title: A tour de force of everything
reviews.content:
I won't offend the absolute work of art that this film is by trying to be a critic...
I simply have nothing to say, other than PLEASE PLEASE watch it.Such a breathtaking experience that deserves every accolade.WOW.

reviews.review_title: An absolute delight, non stop fun
reviews.content: You don't see a lot of creative ideas these days in film but this is one is just delightfully creative. Yes, alternative realities have been explored in other films but not like this. The acting is superb, the martial arts are terrific, I hope the costume designer gets the Oscar this year, but mostly the message is something we all really need to hear these days. Go watch and find out why.

One of the best original movies I have seen in a long time and it goes to show you what can be created when Hollywood studios make way for original content and not just franchise bait. This movie was sci-fi, action, comedy, and family drama all wrapped in one with a fantastic story and great cinematography and lighting. The story constantly keeps us asking what the meaning of life truly is and how our choices can truly butterfly effect something down the road but this movie is one that'll have you thinking about it for day after.

It's very stylish, inventive and very well made, great cinematography, great cast Michelle Yeoh and Jamie Lee Curtis! But at about an hour in and i felt like it's just not quite doing it for me and i found myself wanting to do something else with my time. I'm really not sure why. I'd still rather see more movies like this get made other than yet more Marvel/DC character spin offs, the whole superhero concept is getting extremely tiresome to me. Maybe that's why i just couldn't quite get into this because it still felt a bit like a superhero movie at times. I'll give it another go soon and will probably feel embarrassed about this opinion and delete it. Maybe it's a case of it's not you it's me.

reviews.review_title: I Need to Marinate on This One...
reviews.content: I wanted to like the movie a tiny bit more than I did. I do think it was a bit long, little hallmark-y with certain elements. The amount of work this movie called for is absolutely almost unfathomable.A lot to think about here. I definitely loved how surprised I constantly was, I think everything was incredibly polished: from music to choreography.Here is the moral of the story: I certainly wouldn't mind to seeing a bit more of this originality in media, no matter your thoughts on the movie, this project was a labor of love.I'm a bit surprised that the weirdness factor was cranked waay up and for this to get pretty widespread acclaim.Let's keep this originality and high level of polish with future films, I would tune in.

I've just came out the cinema after seeing this film. Wow. That's all I can say.The BEST film of the decade. Most original film ever. Acting, amazing, storyline, phenomenal.All 140 minutes were magnificent.100% recommend.Loved it so muchx.

reviews.review_title: A fun and unique action movie with emotional underscoring
reviews.content: Stunning action sequences that are much more interesting than the typical action flick are the first that sticks out, but there's more to this movie than that. Each character sees the world in a very different, often conflicting, way. This sets up emotional drama and invited the viewer to actively consider their worldview. There are also some amazing creative decisions that tie this movie together and make it a unique and incredibly enjoyable experience.

This is an absolute incredible surprise, out of nowhere these directors brought us one of the most fun, colorful and "alive" movies in a long while.I'm not exaggerating when I say this movie has the most heart and soul put in it out of pretty much everything I have seen.The creativity, the color, the humor, the wholesome message throughout the movie and pretty much everything is done well hereAbsolutely deserves all of the awards it is nominated for, this is a really one of a kind movie and perhaps one of my favorites everI really can't recommend this enough, an absolute joy to watch no matter on which screen.

It feels like such a long time since I watched a good movie. Thankfully, Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert came to rescue. It has comedy, politics, love, my favorite martial arts, futurism and much more. Acting is fabulous. Everyone is in their character. I was expecting little craziness, because I knew the director haf directed the Dj Snake, Lil Jon music video Turn Down for what and they did not disappoint.

I love this movie. I had to rewatch it like 3 days after the first view so I could feel it in completely.It's the same time a great, time traveling adventure, with a bonkers plot, comedy, and some truly insane sci-fi concepts, but, most importantly, it's about love, caring about the most important people in our lives, the tiny moments, that make up our most memorable memory, and, at the end of the day... depression.Joy is depressed, she's overwhelmed, she's lost, and for most of the movie, the most important person in her life, her mom, doesn't seem to even care, or even acknowledge her presence sometimes. It's imo, an allegory for how we are constantly splitting our focus in a dozen different stuff nowadays, tying to be everywhere, but ending up been nowhere. She is stressed, and out of her mind, that she doesn't even realize what her daughter is going through. And, in a metaphorical way, she needs a interdimensional being to cross the multiverse, for her to finalize realize, she's losing her kid and to help her.Of course, she doesn't do it alone, and, in figure of the father, Waymond, she learns that, she has to stopping fighting people, stop trying to change people, and actually, just be kind and give your love to the ones who need it, however they might need.So, this movie is great, I loved it, as you might have noticed. It's so smart, funny, and out of the box completely with its concept, it's breaking of the fourth wall of sorts, and playing with the audience expectations a little bit too. Everyone is great in it, specially Stephanie Hsu and Key Huy Quan, who have to play multiple versions, completely different, from the same character, and they nail every single one of them. Michelle Yeoh is also really solid here, with by far the best performance I have seen from her.Anyways, I love how it shines a light on mental health. And, at the end of the day the message is that the world is crazy, and most days, it probably doesn't make much sense, but... so what? We should enjoy the moments that do make sense, and share the found memories we have with our love ones.To sum up, Everything Everywhere All At Once, is a great movie, with a complex story, with some serious underlining themes going on, if you want to see it, but at the same time, manages to be a crazy, and innovative movie about multiverses, with great action scenes, production value, and creative. Loved it, and highly recommend watching it. I would sum it up as Pixar movie, but in live action, and that, for me, it's one of the highest complements I could give a movie.

reviews.review_title: Good Film but Trying too Hard
reviews.content: This is a good film, technically it is well made but also the story is funny, the characters loveable and the plot engaging. It does feel like it's trying to hard at points though. Without going into spoilers, there are moments where something weird is thrown in and while at times it is funny, every now and then it feels like the directors trying are trying to make me point at the screen and laugh at how wacky and original they are. It doesn't necessarily take away from the film but I think it does hold it back from being a perfect 10 for me.I loved every performance, stand outs being Ke Huy Quan and Jamie Lee Curtis for me but Michelle Yeoh and Stephanie Hsu were good too. I was surprised at how technically inept everything was, the action all flowed really well and the special effects looked, especially impressive when you see that all VFX were done by the directors and a few friends.This is a feel good film with some big laughs but not quite a 10/10 for me.

reviews.review_title: EEAAO is a 10/10 and a 1/10 all at the same time. How thematic!
reviews.content: This movie is extremely well made, well written, well acted and entertaining.Unfortunately, it's also a thinly veiled attack on the Catholic faith.Say what? Let's see... The most destructive force in the multiverse is a round piece of bread, kept behind a curtain, at the center of an altar-like structure, surrounded by followers with black marks on their foreheads. Gee, what could that possibly represent?At its heart, this movie has the same old boring axe to grind that we've seen countless times before. The small box we've created around "what's right" is keeping all of us from having the one thing that each of us needs to actually make us happy. Especially our lesbian daughter! But we can do whatever we want. So we should open our third googly eye and embrace compassion.I think we've heard this lie before in Genesis 3 where the devil says that our eyes can be opened and we can be like gods, deciding what's right and wrong for ourselves. In reality (any of them), what we really need is the source and giver of all truth, goodness and happiness, Jesus Christ.Sadly, at the core of all the great storytelling in this movie is a lie as empty as the center of a bagel.* Note this review was removed once by IMDB with no explanation offered. Will they do it again? I'm commenting on the contents of this movie, my interpretation of it, and reflecting on the message of it with my own opinions. Is that a violation of terms somehow?

A24 has produced some of my favorite films, The Lighthouse, Moonlight, and Uncut Gems, to name a few. This year, in particular, has been great for the studio. Films like X, Aftersun, and the Whale make up your competition for award season. Then there's this film. The trailers looked interesting, but I skipped it when it came out. When they announced the nominees for the Golden Globes, I decided I should give this film a watch.This film has a perfect cast. I know that might sound a bit of an exaggeration, but it's true. Michelle Yeoh is great as Evelyn. It's a protagonist that you want to root for. Yeoh deserved her golden globe win, but I believe she deserves an Oscar nomination. Yeoh's not the only cast member that deserves all the awards this season. Ke Huy Quan plays the husband, Waymond, and I loved the character from the get-go. Waymond in the home universe is an interesting character, but it Alpha-Waymond who steals the show. Huy Quan's versatility allows him to go from a loveable husband to a man trying to save the universe. When I first heard Huy Quan's voice, I thought, "Where have I heard this voice before." After a little investigation, I found my Data. No, actually, I found Data. Huy Quan is the Short Round from Indiana Jones and Data from the goonies. I love both characters and didn't even realize Huy Quan had retired over twenty years ago. I'm glad he came out of retirement because he should win an Oscar. Jamie Lee Curtis and Stephanie Hsu also deliver solid performances worthy of Oscar nominations. The film appears all over the place, and that's what makes it so wonderful. You never know where things are going; you're always guessing and trying to figure it out. I hope this film wins all the Oscars it's nominated for; it's that good.10/10 One of the finest films released during 2022.

reviews.review_title: Our collective imagination in a movie - hilarious, action back and beautifully told
reviews.content: From start to finish this was nothing short but a modern day masterpiece, albeit very silly kind of humor that may not appeal to everyone or not be your thang depending on how you are feeling on the day. For me though, this movie had everything. Fast paced, intellectual, creatively shot, intricate story line with excellently choreographed action scenes and witty very very funny throughout. The best thing was that the story line all hangs together and comes together beautifully to bring an overall much deeper meaning to the entire premise of the movie. It's about human nature, life itself, what makes us who we are - our collective curiosity, magnificence, darkness, all rolled into one. It's a feel good movie that makes you want to see the bigger picture and not sweat the small stuff anymore. This movie will be watched again and stick with me for a long time. I'll always be trying to imagine what in the universe is install for all of us next ! Go watch this !

I am sorry but this is a poor Kaufman imitation. With much less talent, taste brain power or ideas. It could maybe have worked as an anime, but this is a c-level movie also known as trash. I am sorry i waisted my time.

reviews.review_title: One of the craziest most touching films ive ever watched
reviews.content: All of the critics on here complaining that the concept is unoriginal, that they didn't "get the point of it" and that whoever DOES make their own meaning out of it are just a bunch of mindless followers are so LAME. Why are you trying to find an exact explanation to such a confusing movie? To each their own on the meaning behind this movie, but I enjoyed it because (SPOILERS) I found the connection between the mother and the daughter beautiful. I'm very close with my mom so this movie hits deeper for me. I view it as the daughter essentially thinking her life is too overwhelming (from the overstimulation of so many realities) and that her mom doesn't love her, to the point where she wants to commit suicide (going into the "everything bagel") She is extremely stubborn like her mom, but her mother proves her love by following the husbands words of "be kind", (which the way she discovers that her husband is her soulmate is so beautiful to me as well) and the daughter does not enter the everything bagel. Not only that, but I enjoyed watching the entire family and the IRS lady (Jamie Lee Curtis) grow. On top of the main reason that I found this movie so great, this movie is entertaining, unique, and everyone can make their own different meaning out of it. I really haven't seen such an interesting film that's made me cry this much in a while.

reviews.review_title: Lame moive with lots of Action and Lots of Asian Actors
reviews.content: This movie was trying to supposedly make a simple point. It had lots of action that never really related well to carrying the story. It had lots of Asian actors and the only reason I can see it getting 11 Academy Award Nominations was to try to play to equal opportunity after Hollywood's blatant and recent failures.The cinematography was good and effects good so that can get it several valid nominations (but not likely awards) but it clearly is another over-hyped Hollywood promotion. I would never again come close to this movie even on late night horrible cable and drunk out of my mind. I sat thru it in the theater just to see if anything decent came up and it did not. I will be sure to tell my friends and family.

Without a doubt, this movie is the worst crap I've ever seen in my entire life... or tried to see! A total and absolute waste of time. No wonder how hard I try, I can't remember anything so useless and despicable. Terrible, horrible, ghastly!

reviews.review_title: you had me at everything bagle
reviews.content: What do you type other than the obvious, it's a hit and deservedly so, it is fantastic fun entertainment. I would have given it a 10 had it not relied so heavily on the matrix and influences from sleeper.It is missing originality, no doubt excuses will be made and viewers, producers etc. Will say things like its paying homage to, or that's the point. Whatever... I get that, even so, it is sad originality is gone in all forms of entertainment now. No matter the excuse made, it lacks originality. Or put it this way, if the matrix had never been made this movie wouldn't exist.Bottom line, it is Absurdism at its finest.

reviews.review_title: Words cannot describe what this movie meant to me
reviews.content: And I don't think any amount of words can describe it to you or anyone else.All I hope to do is convince you to give it a chance. Put away your phone, turn down the lights, get some popcorn and give his movie your fair attention that it deserves.I don't think I have ever seen a movie that so beautifully captures the Asian American experience so clearly. At the surface this looks like a silly movie, but to me, it's a historical record of what it was like to live in an immigrant Asian family in America. An accurate emotional accounting of what we experienced living in the 90s and early 2000s. It was a painful and wonderful period of time that America might never have again.Maybe I'm looking into this too much, but it doesn't matter because this is what it means to me and I know I will continue to watch and rewatch this movie probably for the rest of my life. That's how much I love this movie and I'm so thankful to all the creators for making it.

reviews.review_title: A weird movie that tries to hard
reviews.content:
I dont know how to feel about this movie. After I saw it, I felt the need to give it a 8. I also feel the need to give it a 2. What was I watching really?Movie plot and character motivation felt very lacking. Or well, almost non-existant. Story was mediocre at best. Acting was rather good. The storyline was decent but the development and progression of it was awful.This movie mixes 2 genres that in my book wont really mix that well;
Action/sci-fi and drama/deep meaning. Its not awful but it's certainly not a masterpiece either.It relies on an attempt of great mature storytelling, trying to explain the true purpose of life, which is fine. And in the next scene people are jumping on buttplugs or tries to forcefully pee themself.It feel like this movie's audience is either very young people or stoners.

This is one of the most unique movies I have ever seen. Love it or hate it it addresses the idea of a "multiverse" and the ramifications of decisions made in one's life, better than any other film I have seen before it. Yes, sometimes I found the humor a bit over the top and thought at certain times things got redundant but still for a fun, thought provoking, must see in theaters film, I truly enjoyed the experience.

I saw her in the cinema a couple of days ago. It is a visually stunning film; I was kind enough to myself not to read about it so I could sustain the sense of surprise that is mandatory in these kinds of events. His idea is not original and we are used to the self-reference of the producers: the same directors of Avengers Endgame play with the concept of the multiverse in a more humorous tone, obviously linked to another work of theirs: Community. With a reference also to The Matrix we can then affirm that the creative sources are clear. What the film does stand out in is technical and acting. The main cast is competent and stands out with solid performances in what is undoubtedly a high-level challenge; there is material here for several Oscars. But the problem is the script: the youthful character that triggers the delirious arc of the film is severely unsympathetic and the mother's subsequent reactions are terrible. Here the delirium is dressed in morality and it is impossible to accept the sentimental conclusion of the script because it is unacceptable and dangerous. The basic idea is a young woman who wants to be accepted by her family and what follows is a journey of love and relationship recovery. To this sounding boring they added extraordinary elements that fortunately make drinkable something that would otherwise be unbearable. I was happy to see two of the most famous faces of the Martial Arts Club in their roles as security guards. It is a light but powerful film. It can be seen without much expectation.

reviews.review_title: this movie makes the world a better place
reviews.content: This movie is a front runner for movie of the year. I believe it might be one of my top 10 favorite films ever made, I have a list in the hundreds, and nothing gets into the top 20 without at least 3-5 years of withstanding the test of time. Time will tell, and I'll be giving this masterpiece multiple viewings before I dive deep into a review, however I'll leave it with this... I truly believe this film makes the world a better place. Thank you everyone who created this.

The movie is full of absurdities. The movie was very difficult to watch, but it was also fun. Acting was very very good. I liked the movie. Parallel universes were not bad, and traveling between parallel universes was also absurd and fun. Anyway i liked.

In a time where often it starts to feel there are no more good movies being made, or even worse the world feels upside down, this movie gives hope in a very imaginative way. It's like Charlie Kauffman meets kick-ass.Its artful, warm, cosy, funny and profound. And yes, the message is super cliche: "love, not hate" but packaged so well, in an action flick even, it feels new and fresh.Not that the movie is completely perfect, it's not, but it doesn't matter, it's about taking something away from it that made it impactful for me and of course the beautiful arty approach.The biggest thing I got from it is: it doesn't matter. People that make big or small things so important, are pursuing power and wealth etc. What does It all matter If you get sick, die or hurt good people along the way? All the rules people tell you to follow or feelings to feel are just not important. Just love each other for who they are. White, black, gay, it, them etc it doesn't matter if you don't hurt one another. We're all different and the same at once.And yes, I also look at the woke community and the cancel culture they're building. Stop doing that! It's an unfriendly and inhuman approach. People are not out there to get you. One person doing a bad thing doesn't mean they're all bad. We are all victims of bad people. Talk about it, try to change it, but do it right. Don't become "them" that you hate so much.I feel this movie targets everybody. Look in the mirror, try to be nicer. Why do so many people think there's more important things than that?Thanks for this trippy and revealing experience. It's probably a movie I'll only watch once, but what an original experience it was.

The whole movie looks so strange but so reasonable.The whole film will mix laughter and tears, sometimes laughing and sometimes holding back tears, it just messes up your brain.Even the martial arts part is quite smooth, and fantastic but also wonderful. I thought I was watching Tom Cruise's film.Yeoh's acting skills. I don't think I need to explain anymore. We all know that she can act. What I want to talk about is Ke Huy Quan, who plays Waymond. I haven't seen any of his films before or had no impression of him, but after watching this film, I don't think I will forget him again.However, I think there are still some shortcomings in this film. In the last plot of Waymond in multiple universes, he expressed his feelings and influenced Evelyn, which is the turning point that makes Evelyn not like Jobu tupaki. I think there are too many explanations in that plot, which ruins the beauty and depth of the film. Although there is no need for so many explanations, through the accumulation of the previous plot and the connection of their feelings, the audience can understand what the film wants to express. Such overexpression makes the film dull, just like a good joke that doesn't need to be explained.At the end of the movie, one of the scenes is when they all return to the laundry, Evelyn is handcuffed to a chair. She asks Waymond how he persuaded the tax officials to extend them for another week. Waymond says "I just talk", which makes me cry in a heartbeat.I think this is the most amazing part of the whole film. In a chaotic world, there is the most real emotion. In all universes, everything may change, but the emotion will never change. This movie tells us that this emotion is called love.In conclusion, this is a very excellent and epoch-making film.

reviews.review_title: I haven't enjoyed a movie this much in years!
reviews.content: Anyone who knows me knows how much I love Michelle Yeoh, who was my main draw for wanting to see this. An entire multiverse of Michelle Yeoh? Yes, please.And this movie doesn't disappoint. It's funny, it's charming, and it has real heart. I saw it at the drive in with my roomie, my first outing in public since before the Bad Days of early 2020. Unfortunately, some of the subtitles were a little hard to read and blurry on the screen, which wasn't helped with the distance we were at, but despite only knowing a few words in Cantonese and Mandarin and with sorely outdated glasses I was still able to follow the gist with the careful sprinkling of English, body language and tone, when the captions were too blurry.I have chronic pain and fatigue and managed to stay mostly motionless and comfortable in my seat because I was utterly engrossed in this ridiculous, wonderful film.When it's released on digital next month, my roommate and I will be buying a copy immediately to rewatch.

There is a universe with a better version of this movie, but this one is good enough.If you haven't watched this movie, you're just that version of yourself.If you did watch this movie, and it opened some of your eyes, good for you.Now do what you do.

reviews.review_title: Legal weed = love for this movie
reviews.content: Legalized weed explains the love for this movie. Appreciating someones' creation is helped by getting into the mindset of the creators. MJ helps approximate what the creators were on. So inhale or munch down before watching this hodgepodge film. Otherwise you risk being bored. Shallow storyline and message, lots of filler. Rudimentary cinematography and haphazard continuity. Sound editing was poor, and dialogue was hard to hear, frequently. Maybe by design. The attempts at humor fell flat. A movie like Vengeance is tighter, more profound, funnier, witty even, more "current", more relevant and one that will better stand the test of tome - - MJ or no.

Parallel universes, flaccid plotting, over long, poor acting, jokes that don't land, and massive hype. There is so much to dislike about this film. At some point, when all the noise around award nominations and wins has died down, people will step back and take a cooler analytic look at this film and recognise it for what it is: ill structured nonsense. Yeoh, Quan, Hsu, Curtis.etc. Can't be blamed for the mess for they are just fitting into that the director/writers have constructed. Watch the trailer, and if you have even the slightest reservations, don't subject yourself to the whole 2hr 19m debacle. Stupidly I didn't follow my instinct and let someone persuade me to watch this. Oh, but the regret. This film is so, so bad.

Ok for 80 minutes. Then a shoe turns i to a snake (or similar), and the scenery changes, and you have long since understood the concept. And they continue to milk that until the utter is store, and the frustration builds. Then that goes on for an hour. They jump around and fight, ok but it gets old, allthough this raises it from an (impossible) zero to a one ind the rating.Ok fight scenes and good actors.The idea is good, but not revolutionary. Nothing like wathcing fx the matrix for the first time. Its like a dance movie with weird backgrounds and kung fu for the last hour. Horrible. Do not watch, unless you like dance movie, or specifically kung fu.

This move is like hitchhiker's guide to the galaxy on steroids, which seem impossible. I haven't laughed that hard in a movie for seems like forever. Everyone in the movie was laughing. Half an hour later it becomes a ridiculous drama where I had to hold my tears (and I'm not an emotional person). The effects and filming were also amazing, and this is an indie movie! Please see this film.

Know what to expect...the idea is great and wonderful but the practical filmography and scenes that were VERY out there and extravagant is not for everyone. Personally to me it was too much, and I enjoyed some parts but would not necessarily watch it again or recommend.

I concur with the naysayers on this one. It has an unpromising opening, with drab images inside a laundry operated by a Chinese-American woman, who is suffering from relationships with her meek husband, her cranky father, and her annoying daughter who happens to be in a same-sex relationship with a non-ethnic Chinese. You got it. This is a soap opera, but dressed up with a very sloppy sci-fi scenario about time and space travel, alternate universes and such. The main visual inspiration seems to have been "12 Monkeys" but that is a much superior film on every level, including the musical score. The musical score here consists of sotto voce pizzicato strings and randomized sounds with emphasized sound-effects. The problem is, whatever music they could have chosen, likely wouldn't have saved this movie. I walked out after 30 minutes. If you read the reviewers who gave this only 1 star, you'll see they are angrier than I am, because they stayed the length, lol. At this moment, the naysayers on this film seem to be a minority, but that is only among the small number of reviewers; the majority when you consider that most of the public, is ignoring the film; and we'll have to see if it even manages to break even. Not that I believe this is the ultimate arbiter of any film; but it is something to keep in mind. (Even if it ends up doing well, I fear it will not be for me. Chacun a son gout!).

reviews.review_title: its way better than the trailer
reviews.content: If i have to be honest i didn't expect much of the movie and because its 2 hours long i didn't want to watch it but considering it is a 2hours long movie almost every minute of it something cool and mind-bending is happening - as i said based on the name or trailer you can't judge the movie - if you like mystery and sci-fi watch the movie.

reviews.review_title: No one can say it's not original
reviews.content: One thing that this movie can't be accused of is lack of originality, with the movie industry trend being to reuse content until it dries out, for sure a movie like this deserves credit.It's a wild ride, prepare to be open minded during this trip and let yourself go with it in order to grasp the deeper message it conveys. Among all the crazy, it's clear there are some beautiful messages that I took from the film, do not stay stuck on thinking what your life could be and acknowledge its potential, in this mad Universe we are but tiny particles navigating through the cosmos in a rock, put things into perspective and realize that we do not matter that much to the Universe, be kind always and no matter how insane things get we can't help but stay close to the things and the people that truly matter.So this for me was the movie strength, the powerful messages, the execution while original, amazingly well done and hats of to the whole cast, sometimes is just too weird. I get it, the possibilities are infinite in a multiverse concept but for humor purposes they showcase some really weird and nonsense stuff, which personally for me didn't quite work, but still most of the movie is highly engaging and as whole experience I really enjoyed it.Thumbs up for having the guts of making the film partially spoken in a non-English language, we need more of that!

reviews.review_title: The worst movie of all time
reviews.content:
I wasted 2 hours of my time very very overrated my friend rates at 1 and also me
Really bad and that ending is the worse
DONT WASTE YOUR TIME.The worst movie of all time.

I love the directors voice and that they made this movie. They are important for the film industry. My only complaint is that it felt like the slightly to well off mens attempting to make us see something fairly obvious about life. Although, I can't see anyone else being able to make this. It's a one of a kind film, by one of a kind film makers. I wonder what movie a poorer versions of these guys would come up with.

For sale and where to find them, could be the second headline and apart from being a psychedellic bad acid tripped parapsychological mandarin cantonese gem of multiversing at the near parsec speed, a speed that becomes sooo heavy for a grumpy old man like me that any kind of gratitude and admiration of a product like this sits quite far in,even though acclamation is given to main cast and the sabresharp timed editing, because such a multiview process to analyse and simplify that is necesarry due to lack of multitasking training that the digital gen's gets in with the mothers milk, a kinda milk my mum never had even though they had radiotubes for simplecalculating and encoding at the time of my birth.So may i be excused for the slow processes of mind, i give it a 6 after the first view, its loads of lights and movements, also dark and time that spins fast as the tunell of light at the end of your lifes journey.so a spinned around recommend can be given.
You have to see it to believe it. A movie of indescribable and incomprehensible brilliance in all the best possible ways. Stephanie Hsu and Michelle Yeoh give the performances of their career.

The Daniels did it again, an original film that is actually enjoyable and hilarious. This is a better multiverse fiom that Multiverse of Madness itself and that's a rock fact. EEAAO is one of the best films of the year and I hope it wins the awards it deserved.

reviews.review_title: It's not a sci-fi /psychedelic masterpiece, but it is watchable.
reviews.content: This is like an updated version of Brazil, but not as challenging.Watched it because the promotion made it out to be this confusing, parallel universe masterpiece.It's not.It's a comedy. Fun. But if I never see it again I won't mind.

In other realities, this movie sucked. But...in this reality, this movie is rad as hell. It had Kung Fu, piñatas, hot dog hands, and Jamie Lee Curtis. Overall, forget Dr. Strange... this multiverse was maddeningly entertaining.Note to self: I need to find my old Bluetooth headset and start wearing it again.

I rarely stop watching a movie when it only had about 15 minutes left. It was gross, made me sick but at the same time boring. It was way too long! I want that 1 1/2 hours back. Just awful. Worst movie I have ever seen. Acting was good but not worth going through the misery of sitting through that boring, confusing film. I saw enough to know that point of movie is to treat people better but that's not what it inspires. I can't believe this movie is up for best picture at the Oscars. I wanted to like it cause I truly like the actors in the film but sadly nothing can make me watch that film in its entirety.

The cinematography was aesthetically and visually stunning but it didn't save this movie from being an extended Vine. Insulting stereotypes (so much so they had to go back and change a characters name), disgusting sexual gags, and corney morals all mashed into a Hollywood budget (that couldn't save this movie). I had to look up the directors to make sure they were both over 18 because I felt a lack of maturity.I will commend the actors for what they put into it despite all the stupidness going on around them. Still they couldn't prevent it from going off the rails. Great to see James Hong tho'. Like always, he eats up every scene.Unfortunately I can't pull out examples because I really didn't understand what was going on for 90% of the film or what they dubbed "Chapter 1". Then hastily wrapped things up in seven or so minutes in "chapter 2" 😒 See the imbalance here.So yeah, I perplexed at the 8+ rating. Must be a ton of pubescent boys trolling this site.

reviews.review_title: Simple yet beautiful message disguised in overly chaotic plot. Worth the watch!
reviews.content: Amidst all the chaotic scenes and verse jumping through the multiverse, the movie has a profoundly simple message. It's a journey of learning the roles we play in our own lives and in the lives of others close to us. Although the movie definitely was long and chaotic, it had me engaged the entire time. Some of the quotes in the film can hit the spot with the audience on a deeply spiritual level.In conclusion, this is one of the best movies I've watched in a long time. Would definitely recommend this.

6.5 ⭐s
I've been postponing this one for awhile but finally got to watch it. I thought Everything Everywhere All at Once had a nice concept, a really meaningful message, sublime acting performances but it was just too allegorical for my taste. It was also very long and sometimes boring. I like when are movie is so good that even though I don't like its genre I love the final product which here was not the case. Unfortunately my expectations were very high and they're not fulfilled.

This is a movie done right. The main theme isn't original, but the way its told is truly unique. This is a story that cannot be a read because of the visual aspects that go into it which makes this a perfect movie. The cinematography, the chorography, and the visual effects go hand in hand, while being able to be comedic when need be. The acting was also really well done, no one felt out of place and they truly felt relatable in some aspects. I have nothing negative to say about this movie, that's why it is a ten out of ten in my book.

reviews.review_title: Very overrated in my opinion. It's OK.
reviews.content: Although this film is visually pretty amazing, it really needed to SLOW DOWN. By the end I had a better idea of what was going on, but the first half of the movie was so fast and whacky... and in 2 languages. The rules of the story world were explained so quickly that it didn't give us any time to process them. The film had what seemed like 4 climaxes, one with the dad, one with the husband, one with the IRS lady and then one with the daughter. It's an extremely complicated movie, and I'm sorry, just because it's complicated doesn't make it "brilliant". It was EXHAUSTING. I found myself nodding off constantly throughout this film. Kung Fu alone isn't enough to keep me awake. It's like the daughter said towards the end: it's all just a bunch of random stuff flying around that doesn't mean anything. That's the same reason I couldn't get emotionally invested in the film. It was too chaotic to get me invested. So by the time we finally started to try to go somewhere towards the end, it just felt very melodramatic. It's a Wonderful Life knew how do build up to what this movie eventually builds up to, but it prepares us for it flawlessly. This film had a very hard time finding its way getting to that point where it could reveal a much similar theme. It was long and exhausting. Writing non linear stories is extremely tough... and visually, the film is a technical achievement. I just wish it wasn't so convoluted. I see what they're trying to do... in the end I got it, but was it worth it? I'm not so sure.

Dont Waste Your Time Buddies.. Its Not A Thriller But A Package of Meaningless Fights And Conversations!!!!... Dont Watch ...I never knew what this movie meant for...But Seriously You call such S*its As Thrillers???

reviews.review_title: The most interesting movie I've ever watched
reviews.content: This completely lived up to the hype I was hearing about it. It's hectic, hilarious, and moving all at the same time. I don't think I've ever laughed and cried so much during any other film.

What did I just watch? This was a messy, weird multi-verse, time hopping, butt plugged, morass with no plot. Completely over hyped and in my opinion not worthy of the nominations received. Perhaps, for special effects, but really nothing else. My husband suggested we watch this quagmire on a Saturday morning. How I wish I could have those two and a half hours back! I've seen some weird movies in my time, but this just really takes the cake. I truly think the script writers were on acid when writing this. Truly, madly, deeply disappointed in this mess. Watch it if you like, but certainly don't expect much.

I love the movies! But this is hands down one of the best films I have EVER seen!!! I have never ever taken the time to write a movie review about any movie, BUT this movie has compelled me to do just that! It touches the heart, the soul. It was crazy, and funny and beautiful all at once. I absolutely loved it! It was perfection! A must see for everyone! The acting was incredible and every one of the actors is deserving of their nominations! Whether they win or lose, i dont care, they made a movie that in my mind will change people and that is far more important than any award, but they are definitely deserving and I'm rooting for all them!

Everything Everywhere All At Once. I'm a grown man and I cried through almost the whole movie. Maybe a little because their sad little struggling existence in the beginning looks a lot like one I've lived. A lot because the movie has so much authentic emotion and that it breaks and fills up your heart. A lot because it's so imaginative and joyous that it had a profound effect on me that I would just get so overwhelmed watching it I'd tear up. It's so original and on top of it so many Asian faces. It means so much that there's so much Asian culture and experience in such a big movie, but that Asian-ness is no more consequential than if they were Irish. It's a part of who they are, but it's not all they are. It makes us all the more connected despite our differences. But the last thing is the idea that we all have so much potential. So many possibilities. And maybe we always have, possibilities. Shortround, all these years later is BACK. In real life. So that message rings true. And he is wonderful in the movie by the way. After all this time he found his potential again. Everyone does personal best work in this film, especially Michelle Yeoh. One of the great film performances. Ever. The effects and editing weren't more of the same thing we've seen and gotten spoiled by seeing often. All that production and detail instead applied to sights we've never seen in places you'd least expect it. It might not have the same effect and affect on everyone, but I thought it was just beautiful. There's so much humor and originality and unbridled imagination and the ability to take ideas, that like the multiverse has been done many times, but make them feel fresh and new. We're lucky if we have people to walk through the world with, and even at our worst we can remember there's still something to love in us all. How beautiful is that?
I don't often write a review but this has got to be up there with the worst movie ever made. People rating this a ten must be watching something different.

Some Chinese movies are made intentionally complicated and confusing because the directors want to show off their "high" skills. Otherwise they are afraid people will say it's too simple. On the other hand, many good movies are very simple and not much complicated plots. The performing skills of actors/actresses are the key of successful movies. The movie also has a very weak ending. Too many morals mean no moral.

reviews.review_title: The Movie is Good, but not as good as I though it would be
reviews.content: I have seen the reviews and hype train regarding this movie. It's rare for a movie to be rated over 8 on IMDB and not be a masterpiece. However, this movie felt okay for me not as mind-blowing as everyone claims it to be.However I need to give credit where it's due, as much as the plot was just okay for me. The rest of the departments were excellent, the acting, cinematography, postproduction etc. The characters were likeable and well performed, and the story arc for each sort of made sense.The only plot issue I had with the movie was that there was not over-arching existential threat. The fact that the daughter was the "Villain" made it hard for me to feel the impending doom. I will give it a second viewing, but for now it was just okay for me.

I haven't been this transfixed by a film since Parasite. THIS is what cinema needed. So fresh, so unique, so epic. This movie never dragged. It was chaotic, high-energy, perfectly paced, superbly acted, and phenomenally directed/produced.The "multiverse" plot isn't new, but how they navigated this familiar storyline absolutely was. This cast was stellar. Kudos to all involved on the creative side.The comedic flair of the film was authentic and natural. The stunts were absolutely perfect. The score kept us viewers engaged. The costumes were whacky but also spot-on for the periods they were chosen for.I want to see this again! Michelle Yeoh better win an Oscar for this. 60 years old and carrying a martial arts film on her back like this?!

This is one of the best movies of 2022, and can go into one of the best movies of all time. It has a unique way to deliver its message, with scenes that mixed with action, drama and comedy. If I'm going to explain anything it will be complicated, but the movie actually is well explained, that's why I advice anyone to watch it without knowing anything about it. The writing, acting, directing and everything was so AMAZING , special thanks to everyone has worked on this great movie.

I ususlly never write a review, and since there are so many of them I doubt this one will even be seen, but GUUUUYSSSS
THIS WAS COMPLETELY INSAAANEE!I have watched everything from drama to comedy to thriller to sci-fi to detective stuff etc. You got the point.... but this
movie HAD IT ALL!! MUST WATCH!

What an experience. Best movie I saw since 2019, with Parasite. I'm saying, this is cinema in its pure state. It's because of movies like this I love cinema.Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert directed Swiss Army Man, one of the most creative movies of 2016, but in my opinion, it's limited by the need of explanations and very expository dialogues. But in Everything Everywhere All At Once, it's precisely proposed the lack of sense and logic, giving the gap to be debated philosophical questions and develop the relationship between the characters.Evelyn is a tired, exhausted and unhappy woman because of the decisions she made and the life that these decisions resulted. She has many problems and you can understand these problems. And throughout the movie, when she is presented to the idea of multiverse, she realizes that even the worst version of us can be happy.Michelle Yeoh. This person must win all possible acting awards. Yes, I'm talking about Oscar. His acting here is just the most perfect performance I saw in years. The scenes of kung fu, drama, comedy... She is just perfect in everything. With all due respect to Jessica Chastain and other Oscar winners, but THIS is an Oscar-worthy performance.I want to highlight the work of editing, that's very important to organize all this multiversal mess and make that all these scenes in all these universes be fitted and connected by the message the movie wants to pass about identity, purpose, apprenticeship, family, to live the present, to forget the past, to not think about the future, to be satisfied by the life we have.I don't know how someone can have the idea of making a movie like this. It's incredible how Daniels could make all these crazy parallels plots be so well-developed at the same time and pass so many lessons and messages all at once and that doesn't get tiresome (at least not for me). I think It's almost impossible what they make here, just a quite creative and genius mind could make this movie happen. It's because of guys like them that the cinema never dies.A24, make this movie be in the Oscar!

reviews.review_title: Its going to be a while before I eat another hotdog
reviews.content: Pretty good movie, but I wish they would have built up all of these relationships earlier in the movie. They just assumed that we all know these people.

I've never left a theatre so desperate to rewatch something as I did with Everything Everywhere All at Once. From the very first scene, right the way through to the end - Everything Everywhere All at Once is an assault on the senses in all the best ways. It's quite hard to know where to begin; after all, this is a movie about everything, everywhere, all at once.Let's start with the story; this is a movie about Evelyn, and the relationships she has with her husband, her daughter, her father, and most importantly - herself. You see; Evelyn is a woman constantly asking "what if...". What if she'd been a doctor? Or not moved to the USA? What if she'd been more than she is? I guess this doesn't really explain the story at all, but I don't really want to spoil the magic for you. This is a movie about Evelyn, and how she finally learns to love the life she has. Of course, this is a significant oversimplification.Moving on; this movie is a visual treat. The visual effects range from the fantastic to the basic. There's everything from well-choreographed fight scenes (including a very memorable fight where the weapon of choice is a fanny pack), right the way through to a hilariously under-puppeted raccoon. The jarring contrast between the hyperreal and the clearly-fake could've come across as crude, if not unprofessional in any other film. Here, though, it's a well-executed mishmash that works because it's part of a larger collage of pictures equally out of place.I think the other think that helps meld these two disparate styles together is the fact that, beneath it all, Everything Everywhere All at Once is a comedy film. It's easy to focus on the more sentimental aspects of the movie, especially given the main theme of "acceptance", but it'd be a genuine disservice not to acknowledge the movie as a comedy. From malapropisms, to Michelle Yeohs' excellent delivery - this movie is one of those laugh-a-minute types that never quite gets old. Leaning heavily into the absurd, you can never quite anticipate what might come next. Clearly, absurdist humour isn't for everyone, and there'll be more than a few people who come away from it with a bitter taste in their mouth. However, in my opinion, Everything Everywhere All at Once does a fantastic job of delivering risqué jokes without ever delving quite into pure vulgarity. It is, of course, this same absurdity that manages to carry some of the films more tender moments. On paper, two rocks conversing mightn't be the most riveting of ideas; but Everything Everywhere All at Once manages to sell this concept with gusto - to the point where the theatre I was in was loud with laughter most at this point in the movie. Indeed, this is the kind of movie that has you connecting emotionally with two rocks. This, though, isn't the most absurd moment in the film, but to delve too much further would do nothing but dip into spoilers. All I can say is; this doesn't feel like absurdity for absurdities sake. A lot of the time, absurdist comedy can come off very - "hAhA iM SO random RAWR xD". Here, though, it feels much more in service of the point the film was trying to drive home.Ultimately, I really could sit here and praise this film for hours.I guess if I had to criticise any aspect, it'd be the world building, which felt a little thin at times, but once I stopped questioning things, and simply watched it for what it was; I found those complaints dissipate. If you watch Everything Everywhere All at Once with an open mind; you can't go wrong. I can't wait to see it again, and you bet I'll be buying the blu-ray the moment it's on sale.10/10.

* Polarized reviews due to art being subjective.* It's lot of abstract allegorical metaphors to illustrate the extremely intense dynamics in families - between mothers & daughters especially.* If you do not like abstract art, you will hate this. It is basically live action abstract art.* In spite of understanding it, I'm still glad I only spent $2.15 to rent this . . .* This might be a fun one for Mystery Science Theater . . .* Michelle Yeoh is one of my fav actresses . . .*DVD special features were interesting.

Must rate as one of the worst films ever. Totally overrated and no idea how it has become an Oscar favourite! Puerile nonsense. The goody bags provided to Oscar voters must be worth a lot. The plot is simplistic to say the least and looks to end the search for intelligent life in the multiverse. How Jamie Lee Curtiss got involved in this travesty is beyond me. Looks as though the standard of acting required to be an Oscar contender like a lot of todays life has been dumbed down. Thank goodness I didn't have to pay to watch this at a cinema. But it will not be the first time the luvvies and critics have fallen for a terrible movie that has been to say the least poor.

That just about sums it up. Wonderfully acted and directed and shot but I was just bored throughout. It might be the multi-universe thing - how implicated can we be if 'nothing matters'? How can we care about a character if the character is one of thousands of versions of themselves? How can we bothered how a story ends or whether someone dies or not if all possible endings exist in the totality of universes? Well, we can't. And who was 'the baddie' and why were they trying to take over the world (or whatever it was they were trying to do or for whatever reason they had to be fought)? I don't know. As a philosophy BA and a lover of 'boring' films - Antonioni, anyone? - I had great expectations for this one but they simply weren't met.

reviews.review_title: A good movie but not as said
reviews.content: Watched the recommendations which stated that it's the best movie of 2022. With Michelle Yeoh so just gonna watch. The story line is good and there are fun scenes all the time, but some presentation was just too nasty ( the long finger universe...) there are some normal fight scenes but the movie is just too long. The image is that the mother would not dare leave her families though there are many chances (universes) for her. Anyway a bit overrated for me....

Quite entertaining action film that is taking the piss of other action films. Wonderfully technical and very well done. First film in a while i watched without checking my phone sometime inbetween.Loved the acting and the corouge to do something else than the same old hollywood recepie of special effects and little story behind it.

reviews.review_title: The best movie released in the last 3 years
reviews.content: There hasn't been a movie as good as Everything Everywhere All at Once since Uncut Gems and The Lighthouse. This is an amazing movie. It's trippy and visually insane but also beautiful and heart warming. Please watch it.

This is one of the most bizarre movies I have ever seen, but, ultimately, it is also one of the best. Writers and directors Kwan and Scheinert have created a very engaging and creative story and filmed it in a manner that is quite fascinating. It grabs you from the get go and never lets you go until the very satisfying ending. However, it only works successfully because of the outstanding performances of the entire cast. The Oscar nominations earned by newcomers Stephanie Hsu and Ke Huy Quan, and by veteran Michelle Yeoh and the grandest veteran of them all, Jamie Lee Curtis, are all well-deserved. Their faith and joy in the parts they play are evident and remarkable. Yeoh is just terrific and Curtis is a real scene stealing hoot here. The direction gets fast and furious as the rather complicated shenanigans play out, but ultimately, this is a beautiful and moving story about how the human spirit of friendship and family can always survive the worst obstacles that life throws at us. Brilliantly executed and acted by all involved. Certainly deserves its 11 Oscar nominations and its rank as the most Oscar nominated movie of 2022.

reviews.review_title: Exactly nothing special about this one, actually the opposite!
reviews.content: I've seen the rating of this movie and I've though that this must be another one of those chinese movies which are really good, but it seems I've been wrong. The main idea of the movie it's very interesting, although the idea of a multiverse it's getting more common and common nowadays. The problem with this movie stays in the fact that it's mainly a comedy, but it's not really my type of humour.
