reviews.review_title: I can handle multiple universes but it's unbelievable for a Boomer to recognize generational trauma
reviews.content: This film is a funny and filled with striking moments. It has a nicely developed family story to go along with the crazy action and comedic hijinks. But at the end of the day I just don't buy the mother character growing and relating to the daughter character that happens in the end. It is utterly alien to my experience dealing with the Baby Boomer generation.

reviews.review_title: Phenomenal. Unbelievably Great. Top 50 Film of all Time
reviews.content: It'd be impossible to even try to explain this movie. Not just the plot but how many different ways it'll make you feel/react throughout it's run time. I'm definitely not a cryer when it comes to watching movies, at best a handful of movies have made me tear up, this movie did that MULTIPLE times... But also made me straight up belly laugh even more. I LOVED this film.

reviews.review_title: One of the best films I've ever seen.
reviews.content: Don't listen to the negative reviews, most seem to be about length for some reason. I can see this not being everyone's cup of tea, a lot of people have bad taste, but to write a lengthy bad review for this is like criticising a solar eclipse.I laughed, I cried, I left inspired. A cathartic and joyous experience unlike pretty much any other film you could see. The story is captivating, not a scene of hammy acting, stunning psychadelic effects, and it has perhaps the most heart of any sci-fi film ever made.The only reason I would give this anything less than 10/10 would be to lower your expectations so that you were that little bit extra blown away by the experience.I immediately started googling the directors/writers other work, and will be following their future releases keenly.Do yourself a favour and watch this film. It's as close to a perfect movie as you can get.

I finally saw it before it disappears into nowhere and all of a sudden. I think the movie is really about us. Not just Asian women, not just women in general, but also men as well. Just ask any dads to see if not most of them also worry about their sons not living up to certain paternal expectations, which may be some subliminal extensions of their unfulfilled alter egos or selves? That said, I think that male paternal psyche if it exists may be more oriental than occidental in general. Crazy movie. Very funny and side splitting performances from everybody. This may be a new trend in the dramatic structure of storytelling.

reviews.review_title: A rollercoaster of emotions, that keeps you hooked with every second.
reviews.content: This movie broke every expectation I had going into it. Knowing it was about the multiverse you expect a standard action maybe some soft hitting jokes sprinkled in that never really stick with you. However, this movie was a mix of expertly choreographed and performed original action scenes. The plot considering how complicated it was, was explained in a manor making it completely understandable and gripping. The sad scenes hit hard, making you dive dee into personal problems you did not expect to arise during a movie such as this. The performances were immaculate. Adding so much nuance with every version of the characters. This movie is simply a masterpiece everyone should see.

"Every new discovery is just a reminder were all small and stupid"Great movie, possibly the best I've seen since Covid, I truly wished it was on cinema's here so I could've enjoyed the amazing cinematography and background music but Sadly I didn't, but for sure of one of the cinema's buy it i will see it again!The characters are lovely, even that taxes lady I actually didn't hate! The story kinda wrapped itself in the beginning and opened in the second half of the movie and in between the process left me mind blown.The scene fights are hilarious? I know you're not suppose to laugh but I couldn't help myself, because there's a mix of everything in the movie that in a way you cant actually control your feelings and emotions.Maybe the only flaw is that i felt some boredom after 45 minutes? I dont know im not the one to judge watching the movie on my TV screen but what i know for a fact is this movie is a MUST watch!
Extremely creative, the most original plot of last 10 years. Anyone can understand the parallel universe theory with this hilarious e deep movie. It's so involving, you won't blink your eyes.

reviews.review_title: Abominable. A disgrace to the word Movie
reviews.content:
I've literally never written a review and I probably don't even have the right skills to do it but this one has disgusted me in such a way that I feel the urge to write this or else I go completely crazy.Does no one see this has the full recipe for commercial success in 2023 ? Take Jamie Lee Curtis and you have the "big name". It doesn't matter if her role is irrelevant and brings a huge
embarrassment to her entire career. The rest of the actors might as well have 0 acting skills. Add some fancy expensive CGI's that almost require an epilepsy warning. Take a script writer, hit his head on the keyboard until making him unconscious and voilà, your success is granted.I've always followed this golden rule of not making comments about movies unless I watch them until the end. After this one I really need to reconsider this self torturing principle because I honestly felt body pains while waiting for it to end. Just thinking that this stands a real chance to win the Oscar makes me want to projectile vomit until dehydrating to death.The only good part is that I now know not ever to trust the ratings on IMDB because people only want to act cool by liking nonsense, timewasting disasters. This trend needs to stop although I feel it's only going to get worse like everything else on this planet.

Maybe I'm missing something obvious but I thought this was a load of rubbish. I read the reviews before watching and say everyone raving about how great it was. What I saw was the bizarre storyline, characters jumping into parallel universes that were just weird. People in other worlds with hotdogs for fingers, talking rocks or someone with a talking racoon on his head gives you an idea how bizarre it is. The cinema was pretty empty anyway but 6 people walked out after about an hour, that again tells you everything. I stayed hoping it would improve and it didn't. Unless you like these Matrix style, alternate universe style films I would't waste your time.

I will admit I was the target demo for this film. But art in any medium hasn't resonated with me like this film did in a long time. For those that have seen it, I work in a bagel shop which only made it all the greater. Incredible sound design, plot, message, cinematography, just everything was executed perfectly. I hope it gets the recognition it deserves.

What a unique movie, that's the best word to describe it: "unique". It can be a bit heavy, and at first I didn't understand anything, mainly because I saw it in English with subtitles and the Chinese accent along with the times they mixed English with Chinese confused me. But good God, what a special movie, it's so strange that I don't get any adjective other than the one that is unique. I enjoyed the ending very much, it was very well closed and I did cry several times because of the stress of some situations and how well acted those scenes were.

I love anything with the multiverse but this movie was too hard to follow. For me it's just too much action and needed more character development. At the same time, it's very creative and different. Loved the hotdog fingers and butt plug awards. I can see why people either love it or hate it though. I can see this becoming a cult classic down the road.

Exceptional movie that turns a common potential troubling issue into a visual feast of both exclusion, inclusion and diversity and singularity within the stranglehold of monotony and chaos. Where even stereotypes and racism are touched and erased. When you pass all multiverse that are concerned with fundamental issue of life. In all its forms.Nothing has been taboe in this highly entertaining whirlwind of visual excellence.Original in many aspects of cinematic storytellingCould we have experienced the upper layer on a simpler way? Yes ofcourse. But that would not have original nor does that do justice to what most people feel in these situations. Fact and the matter is that most dealing with issues and inner conflict with a rollercoaster of emotions and a storm of thoughts.This film does justice to these periods and in this way all what you weirdly feels very relatable.In short:
Everything everywhere all at once
A 9 from me.

This is a weird movie. Maybe if I rewatched it, it would make more sense, but I have no intention to. Some parts were quite funny, some hilarious in its spectacles rather than the story, and some just plain confusing.It was not the movie of the year as some say, nor the complete mess as others argue. I think it was somewhere in between. I was intrigued throughout the lengthy piece but often wondering if it's going anywhere. I have mixed feelings about it and would rather watch something "normal" next, as much as I loved the talking rocks!

reviews.review_title: In a world full of reboots and sequels, be EEAAO
reviews.content: Usually if I watch a film that is so obviously divisive, I'll expect the mix of reviews but I must admit the reviews here baffle me. I'd love to ask the people rating this film 1-3. What did they see? Because it wasn't this film.It feels so rare to see a film that is it's own thing. Even when paying homage to films you've seen, this film feels completely new. A few reviews try to argue it's ripping off The Matrix, or The One or a film with a multiverse... it's none of those things. It reminds me of Bo Burnham's Inside in a strange way - it felt completely new, and like I can't believe someone hasn't done it before, but also can't imagine how one would even begin to create something like this.I don't understand many of the criticisms, like the plot being all over the place. The plot is really straightforward and clear - I guess some people zoned out.One review even criticises Stephanie Hsu's performance which is baffling - she was exceptional.Some called it toilet humour or crass - I was actually thinking how funny it was to have the occasional sex toy into a fighting scene without it being vile.Maybe it's an age thing. I think I would have enjoyed this film for its creativity and originality in my 20s, but I'm not sure it would have had the same impact that it's had on me now, as I speed past middle age. This film taps into something that so many people can relate to especially as you get older - what if all the decisions you've ever made have led you to the worst possible version of your life? What if you've fallen into the trap of passing down your own damaged relationship with your parents to your child? Does anything actually matter, really?This film asks you to consider all of this and yet it seems some viewers did not - they just checked their watch and waited for the next funny action scene. So much that's glossed over or criticised is a huge part of the point.I'm so tired of unoriginal content. I'll take this over another superhero movie or requel any day. It's not perfect - I think it could have been a little shorter, some scenes could have been trimmed down. But seeing what filmmakers can achieve with limited budget, their imagination and some YouTube VFX tutorials is truly staggering. This film says yes, you could make a live action Lion King or yet another Batman movie - but what if you made something new? Even if the film weren't great, that alone would have me praising it. Fortunately the film is great, and if you want something that's both action-packed and introspective, this will serve you well.

reviews.review_title: An ode to Chinese migrant mothers
reviews.content: This movie was a fantastic telling of a Chinese migrant's story in an English speaking country. It's the story of my mother, and many others like her.These women left all that was familiar and known for a country where they did not speak much of the language, or understand much of the culture. They left when most people are in their prime, when their potential was just about to blossom, and went to run a small business and live frugally so that their children could have a brighter future. But that future is a sea of unknown possibility, one that cannot be controlled, or even necessarily understood.Michelle Yeoh does an incredible job (as she always does) of portraying a woman who is coming to terms with the internal conflicts of her past sacrifices, emotional trauma, cultural expectations, the love for her daughter, her relationship with her husband, and the harsh, unforgiving realities of running a small business in the US. Ke Huy Quan similarly amazes with his acting ability, becoming switching between different versions of the same man at the drop of the hat and portraying the typically misunderstood and underestimated, quietly spoken Asian man to perfection.The story is about how our internal conflicts can both hinder and help us on our path to reconciliation and becoming the best versions of ourselves through choice and acknowledgement.As a first generation migrant to an English speaking country from Hong Kong, I want to thank the entire movie team for their kind, nuanced, entertaining and heartfelt telling of our mothers' migrant stories. For telling this story in its messy entirety, and not just settling for a hygienic, polite version reiteration of migrants achieving the American dream, you have done us all an enormous service.

I gotta say, the film made with such meticulous passion. I think it's a good film, but not a groundbreaking movie with lots of potential. Some emotional heartwarming moments and exceptional choreography. The emotional moments in this film were strong and tear-jerking.It's a cinematic achievement that they made this movie with just $25 million. It looks and feels more expensive, especially the cinematography and the brilliant VFX works.
Gave this movie a watch since it had a good score. But God damn what in the hell is this. Confusing and awful . I guess it could be a good movie if you like to switch of your brain.

reviews.review_title: We are living our best version of life
reviews.content: The film gives the new perspective to think and relfect on our life. We all have imperfections and film has creatively showed we should be proud of ourselves, be kind, appreciate the small things which we easily take granted or ignore. The cinematography, production design, costume, storyline, dialogues makes the experience bold and effective capturing series of emotions entire time. I especially loved the extremely thoughtul multiple universe. They are interesting and answers the 'what if?' but at the end our convense that our present version is the best. Out of all cast the actress Michelle Yeoh is stunning with her emotions and actions. This movie has set a new standard of creative representation of nowadays trending, 'Multiverse'.

In my opinion, a truly great film manages to convey profound ideas and feelings to the audience under the guile of entertainment. It is rare to find a film that manages this balancing act as beautifully as Everything Everywhere All At Once.The film tells the story of a middle-aged woman who is trying to save her business and her family from ruin when the responsibility to save the world from a terrible adversary is thrust upon her. The film makers embrace the absurdity of the premise in a singularly ingenious way. By all means, this is the story of an existential crisis on a cosmic scale, and it delivers an exhilarating resolution to the crisis.Casting in this film is beyond perfect. Michelle Yeoh's protagonist feels real which is the highest praise I can muster and Stephanie Hsu matches her in every way. The cinematography in this film is surreal and trippy which goes with the territory of making a film about existentialism and the multiverse. The film jumps from fast paced action sequences to absurdly calming moments of quiet and calm all of which is made possible because of wonderful editing.In conclusion, there are many reasons why this is a great film but I give it 10 stars because it left me with a deeper understanding of life and relationships. I will eagerly wait for the Daniels to come up with more absurd projects. They have made me a fan for life.

I don't understand Why would a film maker need all this propaganda of shiny clothes, weird makeup, freaky characters, mixed up science fiction ideas to deliver a message to their audience.I normaly root for new ways of filmmaking. Everything, everywhere, all at once is an innovative film. You will definitely not be able to anticipate what's about to happen, but it actually felt exhausting to keep up with it and after a while it wasn't worth it, because you realise it doesn't make sense, it's just for show, it's just to draw this big big attention wave with not much behind it but some simple messages.

reviews.review_title: Felt like an Edgar Wright movie
reviews.content: I enjoyed this movie but there were definitely a lot of moments I felt a little embarriced to be there. The movie itself wasn't anything I've never seen before going off the plotline trend of movies like the matrix, Lego movie, free guy (ordinary person becomes hero and unlocks and learns their full potential through trial and error). The quirkiness and craziness is definitely it's selling point which makes it unique in its own way but gets cringey as it tries to hold its momentum and maintain the chaoticness for the grandiose finale. Felt very Scott pilgrim-ey, Edgar Wright would have loved to make this movie, I also thought the whole multiverse thing was really pushed in the wake of this new marvel narrativev and the Anthony/Joe Russo producer credits make that a little suspect. Overall decent but a little cringe, nice moral of the story (we need more positive messages in films)
A copy of jacky chan movie with a add on of metaverse.If u are a fan of jacky chan, u would think most of the action scenes are so familiar, even the jokes.

This movie is in the top 3 for me this year.Michelle Yeoh is impeccable and moves like the wind.The script is a reflection of diamond minds.The action scenes are finally bright, slow motion, graceful like a dance.But most certainly: the action is meaningful.They tell a story with every movement.This movie is amazing work.It has heart.It has character development for 5 peeps at lest.I highly recommended experiencing this movie.I enjoyed it the 2nd time better.So many details and nuances..

I was excited to see this from the get go (because of my longstanding adoration of Michelle Yeoh since childhood), but I had to temper myself and not get too overexcited to avoid my expectations being too high and ruin the experience of watching it. Overhype can be a bummer sometimes. But I honestly could've doubled it and still be taken aback! This was an effing awesome movie. It was everything I thought it can be and more. It was brilliant. Simply brilliant.

I created this account to write this review. I'm utterly gobsmacked at how many high ratings this film received.Usually a rule for movie watching. No phones. Needless to say I was glued to mine whilst this garbage played. I have to say this. As a movie lover, I'm generally easy to please. This was hands down, the worse movie I ever sat through. Fight scenes were terrible and the story was unoriginal.A fight scene with 18 inch dildos, and two men scrambling to jump onto objects to insert into their a$$? Cmon. Utter garbage. Wish there was a multiverse where I didn't watch this and I could teleport into my own body to save that last 2.5 hours which felt like 5.Do not waste your time. Seriously. Consider this fair warning.

reviews.review_title: Throw everything at every wall, all at once, to see what sticks...
reviews.content: I had heard so many rave reviews about this, that I had to give it a go, but I'm afraid I wasn't impressed.Michelle Yeoh is good, as always, and it was great to see Ke Huy Quan again, who makes the best out of a somewhat thankless role. Beyond that, the movie is a drawn out, somewhat ponderous effort.Have you ever asked yourself, are there only so many stories that can be written and only so many songs that can be sung? Have all the ideas been used up? If so, what is left, and what would you need to do, to grab someone's attention?That's what this movie feels like. When all the ideas are gone, lets throw absolutely everything at the wall in a blinding kaleidoscopic mish-mash of so many half-baked ideas and details, that nobody will notice that there is no real story going on and nothing really happens.I'll grant it a '5', because on first watch it's odd enough to maintain your curiosity, rather than simply switching off. Although it feels at least an hour too long. Perhaps more... It's the kind of thing that would have been better suited to a 25 minute Twilight Zone episode.

We couldn't wait for the movie then our local theater decided not to show it when it first came out. Then a few weeks later they added it. We were thrilled until we saw it and we both thought it sucked. I rated it 3/10 but should be more like a 2/10. A waste of our time. I really don't know how all of you are giving it a high rating.

This was one of the most unique experiences I've had in a movie for a long time. The directing duo of the Daniels follow up their previous masterpiece, Swiss Army Man, with an equally unforgettable watch for any viewer. The film brilliantly combines a bombastic backdrop of multiverse mayhem while also delivering an intimate family drama that will leave the audience in tears of laughter and in emotion. The film is filled to the brim with imagination, creating a world that feels original and fresh. The performances are stellar with Michelle Yeoh delivering one of her finest portrayals providing heartfelt emotion and relatability to her character. The fight sequences are entertainingly choreographed, with editing and vibrant camera movements that allow the audience to be immersed in the excitement. The comedy in the film is also done well, granting the film the ability to be silly and quirky while never overshadowing the overall dramatic narrative. Despite how much of a blast this film is, the runtime may drag in areas making the film longer than it needs to be. However, the film is an overall joy from beginning to end. Telling a story of imagination and an intimate drama, while also providing characters that feel relatable as well as heartfelt, allows for a time at the movies that will be unforgettable by the time the credits roll.

It does not tick any box. There is no plot, the characters are not developed at all, some of them don't have any real reason to be included in the film, such as the daughter. The camera movement is very bad, as if trying to impress and randomly choose a camera movement from a list. Not art at all. Cinematography is quite ok.it's so sad that these wonderful actors participated in this parody. It's not even a comedy. It must have been a torture for the actors, because the characters were meaningless and aliens. There is no message in this film, and it doesn't entertain you, it's just annoy you. The music........... is completely uninspired. Zero talent. And the editor just took pieces and puts them in irrelevant places and they seem ludicrous. This thing is nominated for Oscars, and has won so many awards? Maybe with some laundering ... it is not a good film .

It's hard not to be influenced by the whirlwind of positive reception this movie is getting, whether you're tempted to go with the flow, or be contrarian and denounce it. Yet it's simply undeniable that this is an objectively well made film. It's firing on all cylinders, hitting all the points in the holy trinity of what I think can make art special: it's entertaining, it's creative and there's depth to it's message.Not taking on the dreary, self serious tone of typical award winning films, first and foremost, this is a fun movie. It's loaded with fast paced fight scenes, and jokes that had me genuinely laughing out loud. It's a high functioning adventure comedy that's anything but boring.It may not be the first to explore multiverse themes, but it's wildly inventive in it's approach to them. As proven by Rick and Morty, absurdism is part of package, and Everything Everywhere All At Once doesn't miss the opportunity to get gleefully ridiculous.It's not all just an excuse to be weird though, and all the insanity is clearly intended to have greater significance. The film feels pretty clear in it's intent, though it's open ended enough to allow you to pull your own meaning from it. Whether you focus on the family dynamic and emotional themes of finding love and purpose in a sea of possibilities, or are drawn more to the existential questions of staring down nihilism in the age of the information overload, it's certain to give you something to think about when the credits roll.It's got all the basses covered before even taking into account the marvellous acting, editing and effects on display. It's ambitions are high and it excels at it all. Take your ten you magnificent bastard!

I understand the movie was very creative and was trying to communicate lots of deep statements. However, i just didn't like it. My GF also hated every minute of this.If you are an artist you would probably enjoy this. But if you are not into scifi and lots of craziness then this would not be for you.It was a bit on the funny side though. But I couldn't sit through the craziness.
Best movie I seen in a while! Absolutely amazing! Hysterical! And so damn entertaining! Loved all of the characters! Fantastic acting! I highly recommend this to anyone!

As my ticket salesperson said, "you will experience every emotion while watching this movie." It's brilliant, fun, tragic, hilarious, depressing, redeeming, insane, down to earth, and wholesome. Definitely worth your viewing.

reviews.review_title: Takes a while to explain itself but a fun ride of a film
reviews.content: This is the sort of film you need to watch a few times to actually "get it" and soak in all the subtext missed from the first 2 times watching.The film has more potential than it allows itself to explore. That which borders on deep Existential personal journey allows itself to be dosed with woke and soak with the basic premise moving from the genre of "sci fi multiverse" to "teen emo angst" story rather rapidly, and not in a subtle way.Big fan of Michelle Yeoh since the 80's and definitely this one gets to showcase her multitude of acting scope. Worth watching more or less, but more for the Martial Arts display and less for the Rattatoie references. *

Please don't watch this. Movie is so horrible everything start with no explain. Imagine matrix dr strange Jacki chan Kung Fu together in bad way. If you want sleep watch it otherwise don't . Im begging you.

reviews.review_title: Take a peak at the Bagel
reviews.content: Finally saw this film after a long wait, firstly Michelle Yeoh should be nominated for an Oscar and Stephanie Hsu for best supporting role.Maybe i've consumed too many sci-fi films and it take something utterly strange to peak my interest, however, despite the films plot having a sense of familiarity, there's a ton of originality to scratch the itch of a long-time sci-fi fan.It's not all action tho, a good chunk of the film is a touching story of family and acceptance of one's reality and choices.

Quirky, fun, innovative, and emotionally powerful. This is a ride through the farcical that is firmly grounded in the push-pull of the parent/child relationship. You'll laugh out loud, feel part of the club when you pick up on throwbacks, and sob when it finally hits you that this is your own relationship with your child or parent.

This movie combines The Matrix ( very good), 12 Monkeys (excellent) , Eternal Sunshine of The spotless Mind (masterpice) and Tennet ( also disaster) and puts it into the blender to create an unwatchable spree of nonsense. It tries to be funny in places but fails horribly. The over-acting completes the mess. We turned it off after an hour of waiting for some turn to make it worthwhile to keep on watching, but it only deteriorated into more misery. Strange hat this complete chaos manages to score an 8 on IMDB and is candidate for several awards. I wonder if I saw something completely different or that I had to wait for the end of the movie to move up my score wit 4 points. Or, maybe my signal was scrambled.

Strongly agree with the reviewer that stated the following: This might be the worst waste of time masquerading as a movie that ever existed in the history of the modern world. So bad, so senseless, so ridiculous, no plot, no writing, just nonsense.ALSO... anyone that thought this "movie" was brilliant, great, amazing, etc... SHOULD NOT BE ALLOWED TO REVIEW A MOVIE... EVER.I watched the movie and about 20 minutes in was already not connecting with any of the characters or the plot/storyline. Wanted to be fair so I continued to watch with an open mind and about an hour and a half in just couldn't take it anymore and shut it off.I am in my middle years and time is getting more precious...like others stated....felt like this was just a waste of my time.

I am extremely surprised by how highly most people rated this movie - so I am obviously in the minority with this opinion .I understand that the concept itself was interesting and there was even some funny parts - but overall it was confusing , dirty , stupid and just not good . I was intrigued the first 35 min but after that really forced myself through to the end . There was nothing cinematography pleasing about it.A lot of better movies to watch - my advice is pick something else.

I think this was supposed to be entertaining. Instead, the chucklheads who came up with this disassociation come on camera ... before their movie ... giggling about how many times everyone has supposedly seen the film. Let me put it simply. I'd rather tear off each of my fingernails, one by one, than watch this movie again. Maybe it had potential at some point. Until the same "verse jump" theme is played over for the 35th time and you're wondering how, during filming, that the actors weren't slamming speedballs on top of 5ths of Vodka to stay sane. Maybe they did have unlimited Peruvian flake for the cast and crew. That might explain things. 30 minutes in, I was done. I was seriously contemplating standing up in the theater and screaming something unhinged about 1.5 hours in.Then I looked at the online reviews. I feel like my heart has been forcibly removed from my chest and my eyes have been pierced with ice picks. WTAF is wrong with people??

reviews.review_title: A beautiful journey of awareness, love, and gratitude
reviews.content: This movie is exactly the kind of thing modern day formulaic big box office films and rush produced streaming movies are missing nowadays. A certain special mix of whimsical, unserious, and hilarious absurdity that aims to poke fun at the banality (and eventuality) of taxes and laundry.All while celebrating the joy that can (and should) be derived from every moment of being alive; because we are all tiny insignificant beings in an incomprehensibly large galaxy.This movie uses cultural references and ridiculous humor unexpectedly to provoke the audience to seek self awareness and to live in the moment. Which is precisely the reason why many of the negative reviews I've read here speak more about the viewer than the movie. If you can't find humor, warmth, empathy or just appreciation for the originality of this brilliantly written story - then you need to stick to marvel movies.In short, it's nothing shy of brilliant and for sure one of the best movies of 2022. Worth all the praise.

If you've ever force-fed peanut-butter sandwiches on a group of strangers, you'll recognize that most of the group will consume it as a hearty snack, while a small percentage of them will literally die. The absurdity of that hypothetical scenario is exactly the problem with Everything Everywhere All at Once. Of about 25 people in the audience, 4 left partway through, and after the movie 2 were seen in a comatose state of tears and deeply in need to be held while the rest of the audience was busy repeating the mantra that it was the best movie they had ever seen (in stark contrast). The ubiquitous positive reception by the majority only adds insult to injury.This comedy is a story of nihilism and the mundane constancy of 'laundry and taxes' (aka death and taxes). In the story, a mother who owns a 'laundromat', which serves as a symbolic place for hundreds of 'machines' or 'multiverses' to cycle constantly in a pointless cycle of life and death, is audited at multiple levels for her worthiness to rescue her daughter (and as a consequence the multiverse). It meticulously and powerfully makes a concerted effort to reconstruct the mind of a victim of depression inside the minds of the viewers. It intentionally overwhelms the senses and adds increasing doses of chaos until a conglomerate of elated misery and confusion is fully formed in the mind of the viewer, much like in the mental state of a person who suffers from depressive trauma. It then makes a feeble attempt at dissolving this toxic construct with a caustic fallacy that long term depression can be solved with love. It invites those who have truly felt depression to reawaken any past horrors and then face them with no warning or preparation, and to be left with an aftermath of feeling worthless whilst asking them to contemplate suicide. All within a guise of fast-paced hilarious scenes that make it highly appealing, much like rat poison covered in frosting.Most unfortunately, the comedy is well constructed and the narrative is cohesive, which makes it quite a powerful and well-made story. However, with great power comes great responsibility, something which is tragically ignored. The writers welcome us to contemplate the meaninglessness of life in this free ride to hell. Any who have inner demons will be snatched out of there seats and into an introspective trial with their worst horrors. All else will be able to pass this off as a light-hearted comedy with mediocre story. This is why food with peanuts comes with allergy warnings.

So the acting is awful. So bad. The script and dialogue is for the lowest common denominator. It's so long, and so stupid, and not at all in a fun way. And the videography is so jerky, the editing is so weird like someone from an advertising company edited this. The costumes, the set ups, it's so yuck. And it seems like a high budget movie. Waste of money to be honest. Probably spent most of the budget on getting IMDb likes. I wouldn't have watched had it not been for the 8+ rating. This movie is not good. It's worse than the Bruce Willis movies from last year. Life is too short, don't waste your time and money.
Really this was so good it was about love.this is really unexpected and it got such great theatres. I was blown away. This is a must see and what I needed, what we all need right now.

This is how you make a film. I'm sure I have the same take as thousands of other folks so I won't even bother. If you have a heart and a brain, this movie is for you. It really excels in its transitions from verse to verse. I was never confused or had to do 4D chess to figure out the story, and it's not a simple story. Writing, cinematography, choreography, editing, acting and directing work harmoniously to curate a beautiful, moving film about the IRS and a bagel.

reviews.review_title: Not Everything It's Cracked Up To Be
reviews.content: Michelle Yeoh and Jamie Lee Curtis star, and provide their typical solid perfomances in this (soft-)sci-fi/fantasy about a family which becomes enmeshed in a conflict spanning a multiverse, where all possible outcomes of their past choices and actions exist simultaneously. Against this backdrop, the film explores issues of communication, understanding, and acceptance within family and society.While admittedly ambitious in scope, this effort quickly devolves into a frenzied, farcical, sometimes ludicrous, acid trip of disjointed ideas and imagery, and plays like an exhausting looney-toon mashup of "The Matrix" and "The Mask".Is it creative and original? Certainly. However, these alone don't make a film enjoyable or praiseworthy, and this hodgepodge quilt of interesting ideas, pieced together with duct tape and bubble gum, ultimately falls short of anything which can be called "good". Hardcore cinemaphiles may enjoy the experimental storytelling, but I expect most others will likely be disappointed, and perhaps even disturbed.Due to mostly solid acting, originality, and a few laughs, I'll give this 3 stars, despite its otherwise near unwatchability.

reviews.review_title: The Multiverse We Needed, The Multiverse We Deserved
reviews.content: "Of All The Places I Could Be, I Just Want To Be Here With You"I for one, generally refrain from using the phrase, the word, "Masterpiece" in my assessments of movies; simply cause it's a medium of artistic expressions, and therefore it is very much subjective, so using such a generalized term would pose a few questions against the very conception of having subjective viewpoints. However, in this case, I would like to make a rare exception by citing "Everything Everywhere All at Once" as a Chef-d'oeuvre, a Masterpiece.Not only the concept but the entire demonstration is on a whole another level. Never in my wildest imaginations did I think something like this could ever possibly exist, let alone anticipate. It's just so terrifically done, almost too perfect to believe if any of this was real, or was It all a dream? With great characters, a magnificent screenplay, and scintillating technicalities; It has got everything a movie fanatic would wholeheartedly cherish, mark my words, in the time to come, this will eventually become a cult classic, that would have the power to inspire thousands of other movies.I'm not even exaggerating when I tell that I can't point out any single flaw in it, let alone any kind of inadequacy. The whole movie is just so flawless, like an immaculate endeavor, fraught with the potions of perfection and grace. Matter of fact, I never seen a movie celebrating and taking full advantage of its peculiarities in such an imperial manner. This will mesmerize and bind your conscience until the very last frame. It is very difficult to explain in mere words, what my mind wants to convey at this moment, it is something you need to experience by yourself, only then you would be able to witness what peak filmmaking really is.

reviews.review_title: Hyped spoof ripoff of Matrix + Inception
reviews.content:
Insanely hyped ripoff collage of The Matrix + Inception but in a Steve Martin spoof comedy style.The equation is:
Chinese Kungfu B-Movie from the '70s + The Matrix + Inception - great concepts - the meaningful parts - the great CGI.The film itself is a comedy, so suspension of belief and all, but it's rather dumb, even demented here and there, with a few funny peaks in Monthy Python style. Its attempts at being spiritual, deep and dramatic are but cheesy, silly and all in all the gullible same ol' family issues that seemingly afflict most people out there. Or so Hollywood seems to think anyway.If you love forced tears, hypocritical hugs and last minute redemptions, you are in for a treat. Like, I can live 99% of my life as a complete jerk to everyone I know, but I did that because I was worried about bills. I can always turn into somebody completely different in 3 seconds, share a few tears, hug the people I mistreated for decades and all will fall magically into place. With a hug. A very cheesy one.The film itself is a so so comedy, but I am so annoyed by the insane hype that this is going to be a well placed 1.Yes, I will cheat this time. It's 1/10 and I ain't sorry folks. Next time be more honest in your ratings. If you give this dough a 10/10, what would you give to its originals (The Matrix, Inception)? 250/10?And what about, say, any Kurosawa masterpieces? 3500/10?Get a grip, ladies and lads. Come back down to planet Earth.

reviews.review_title: don't walk! RUN to the theater!
reviews.content: Beautiful movie that takes a look at generational trauma through absurdity. This movie will make you feel like laughing one moment, and crying in another. Everything everywhere all at once reawakened my passion for cinema. A MUST watch !!!

reviews.review_title: A new standard for what film can and should be
reviews.content: Man, this film is literally a work of art. I can't find anything that I didn't absolutely love about this film. It was the most refreshing, original, exciting, funny, touching, creative film I have ever seen. The first true 10/10 for me. How they were able to tell a cohesive story with everything that goes on in this film is completely mind boggling.... please support this film I promise you won't regret it. A24 continues to save the film industry!
We need more movies like this. A highly original and well acted film that lives up to its full potential and then some. Crazier than you can imagine but grounded in an emotionally resonant story.

This is a movie that has had the most accurate review written hundreds of years ago by Shakespeare."It is a tale
Told by an idiot, full of sound and fury,
Signifying nothing."
This movie was all sound and fury without any substance. All of the attempted emotional scenes fell flat and don't connect. It seemed like the writers just threw a bunch of disparate movie ideas at a wall and where they stuck was how it was in the movie. Very visual stylish and meaning nothing.The action scenes were well don but just got stupid and silly almost immediately for no reason. The whole movie was just unconnected randomness with only the most tenuous of connections. It does not hold my attention or interest.I'm a fan of hard sci-fi and martial arts movies and this just missed the mark in everything it tried. The writing seemed like it was written by a stupid person trying to be a smart person. It's transparent in it's ridiculous attempt to be clever and falls on it's face.The acting was very good given the limited nature of the story they were given and can't be faulted for a failed story.This film didn't connect with me on any level and I won't be recommending it to anyone.

It's not perfect, being just marginally too long, slightly repetitive, very nearly dragging in the middle, and not entirely clear about whether we should care about all fates in all multiverses.But there's an awful lot to like here. A brilliantly bold and original concept, decent cinematography and effects, a sharp , nuanced script that both sets up and pays off, featuring well realised and believable characters, with a strong supporting cast. Stephanie Hsu and Ke Huy Quan both have a blast playing various versions of their characters, and James Hong is always great value.Above all though, this film is about the phenomenal, poignant, delightful and absolutely captivating performance from Michelle Yeoh.It's impossible to overstate just how hypnotically watchable Yeoh is, anchoring rather than owning every scene with presence, grace and generosity. Her character act is perfect, and she makes every scene entirely believable, no matter how absurdist the movie gets.The very slight flaws can all be forgiven because of Yeoh's magnificent performance - you'll be utterly spellbound by every look, every gesture, every word, whether she's saving the multiverse, or doing her taxes.

reviews.review_title: Film of the Year so far!
reviews.content: I laughed, I cried, just a thoroughly fun movie! Like watching a 2 hour acid trip you just didn't want to stop. I really hope this movie gets recognized.

Well played especially by the main actresse and excellently staged, but one the other hand exaggrated, confusing nonsence with the simple message to be nice to each other. This multiverse nonsense should disappear as quickly as it appeared. All in all the movie is massivly overrated.

reviews.review_title: Best movie I've seen in years!
reviews.content: This movie seemed to hit my specific brand of weird plus sentimental and I enjoyed every single moment of it. I genuinely spent the last almost 20 minutes of the movie crying cause it hit me just right. Genuinely, I've not seen anything this good in years.

reviews.review_title: I'll never get that time back.
reviews.content: Where should i start? For me this movie was a complete disaster. I went to see it on the ratings from imdb and boy were they wrong for me. 2 hours 20 minutes for a final reconciliation that they could have done five minutes into the movie. I don't usually do "other peoples trips" but in rare instances they can be mesmeric just like Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas or The Matrix 1. But for me this didn't work at all. The acting was seriously poor, the comedy was juvenile, it was difficult to follow rambling from one scene to the next and it was way too long. The worst part was when some of the actors began to put pointed ornaments in their backsides. It wasn't funny but rather childish and crude. But all this is just my opinion. I heard people behind me say they enjoyed it and thats fair enough. Maybe something extra to enhance the experience was necessary but for me im just sorry i actually paid for the experience in time and money. If there were a minus on the scale id give it -10.

reviews.review_title: A wild ride of absolute brilliance
reviews.content: My god. This film had everything I've ever wanted in a film. Absurdity, humor, chaos, depth, science-fiction, emotion, art, sooo many layers. I literally did not want it to end.I went into it completely blind- I hadn't heard anything about it other than the title. And it blew me away.My only regret is that I can't go back and watch it again for the first time. Maybe in a parallel universe ;)

reviews.review_title: Nothing....matters. A beautiful peek into pessimistic vs optimistic nihilism
reviews.content:
First off, I normally just watch The big movies in cinemas, such as the MCU movies. But I'm glad I didn't let this one go under the radar, as small as it is. Because now, it's definitely my favourite movie ever. And that's very rare for me.The movie is about complex topics such as nihilism and family relations, to name a few. The whole multiverse topic acts more as a comedic and symbolic tool to help portray these.To be precise, the topic is a constant tug-o-war of pessimistic nihilism vs optimistic nihilism:
"Nothing Matters."
= Nothing matters, why bother at all?But also,
= Nothing matters, and that is okay! Why not just enjoy the little moments anyway.All this is portrayed through various wacky, comedic and action scenes, with various highly emotional scenes in between. You juggle from highly mundane everyday-life moments, to colorful and over-the-top multiverse-theme moments.To understand this movie and its message, try to think and feel things from both the daughter's and the mother's point of view. What would it feel like to be everything, everywhere all at once?Along the emotional road, assuming you have even the slightest sense of humour, you'll probably die laughing.I must say I'm rather surprised by the barrage of negative reviews on this movie recently. It should easily have a score of over 9.But reading other reviews, I find that the main issues people have are either that they didn't understand it at all, or that they expected something else entirely, most likely some sort of huge multiversal scifi movie.

This is one of the few movies that has everything. Action, comedy, family drama, action, adventure, Sci fi this is a perfect blend of everything. Editing, visual effects and screenplay is top notch. This is what peak cinema looks like! So glad I could witness this marvel.

reviews.review_title: Laughed, cried, was amazed. This movie touched my soul
reviews.content: Saw this with my gf. Starts out simple enough, then things get crazy fast. Then things get hilarious. So much random stuff is thrown about, even R rated stuff. Yet despite all that, the core themes come across beautifully and masterfully. Family. Love. Forgiveness. Self Acceptance.All the other stuff is dressing and entertaining as h*ll. Highly recommend this.

reviews.review_title: Sit down, shut up, strap in, and hang on.
reviews.content: It takes a few minutes to get going, but oh-my-goodness. Michelle Yeoh is extraordinary, but the entire cast delivers a superb performance.Long-ish running time so hit the rest room before and go easy on the giant soda: You don't want to miss a single moment.

This film might be the best I have seen this year. As the theme of multiverses spreads through pop culture and TV like a flame on peat, few manage to flesh out the concept as well as this film. The different universes are so varied that at points it seems overwhelming until you are reminded of the main story and how they tie into it. The writers carefully treaded the line between chaos and order as they told the story of a mother chasing her daughter through infinite realities while maintaining a struggling marriage, running a business, fighting the IRS, and trying to impress her father. The cyclical structure truly shows the change Evelyn went through over the course of the film. In the beginning, she is paranoid about throwing a new years party as she files taxes and argues with an IRS agent. However, as we return to the familiar setting of Miss Deidre's desk at the end of the film, she is still preoccupied with thoughts and is still distracted, but this time she is content with her family and life. The cinematography is amazing. The transition between realities is seamless and not at all like Marvel's flashy CG graphics. The lighting, costume and set design create a malleable clay to forge an incredible narrative out of. I especially enjoyed the brief change from live action to piñatas and crayon drawings and then back. The soundtrack is brilliant and its fluidity accompanies the dramatic changes in the plot. The choice to accompany Deidre and Evelyn's relationship with Clair de Lune was creative genius. Overall, I believe that this film is well worth your time and will satisfy your craving for a great film in a sea of modern mediocrity.

reviews.review_title: One of the movie that so amazing that have a big heart in it.
reviews.content: One of the best film that ever made, i love science fiction film, i love action film, i love romance film, i love family film, and these film combine all of that with grace and coolness, i never found a film like this, Everything Everywhere All at Once is very cool and heartwarming, i never cry so hard watching film except this film, i love how humanly message that daniels give and spread from this film, it's like they made a family movie with science fiction on it, the cast is perfectly complete each other, i never think michelle yeoh can be my favourite actress, and i love how jamie curtis bring her unique personality in this film. I know this film will be remembered in many many years after as a greatest family, scifi, fantasy, action, and mother film.

It struck me half way through this film that the whole viewing experience would have been greatly enhanced if you were on mind altering drugs 😂.From a benign somewhat average start the film quickly descends into a cheap amalgamation of eclectic film genre. Cliche after cliché attempt to sew together sometimes incomprehensible material. Explanations were faulty and hurried leaving you guessing and missing the next hurried onslaught.It was, I can only explain as a poor attempt at combining a Monty Python film with a sub standard Matrix offering that then gave birth to Rom Com offspring.Ultimately empty and meaningless which I believe was the point of the film. Hey maybe that was the intention behind this mess of a movie ??
Too long, seems it doesn't know where to go. Don't understand the hype. Good premise but it really goes "somewhere else" at half of it's way.Clearly not a 8,6 IMDB movie, lol.

This movie felt like a hug for me, for the people who are suffering a lot, asking themselves what would happen if I did this or that? People with existensial crises and people with suicidal thoughts. Even if you think it is all useless, nothing good is going to happen and you have had enough, there is still a way out. When there is an argument, don't just throw fits, but try to understand and try to be kind, because in the end, we are all humans who are going to die one day. We are stupid and nothing matters in this infinite hole. Yeah, nothing matters, but you matter. In our tiniest, weakest, silliest lives, it matters.

reviews.review_title: My Dad just could not remember the title when he was telling me we were going to see this, it was super.
reviews.content: I suppose they thought they were being impressive with their anything-goes, aesthetic.It's all kind of fun. The humor is fresh, the story is actually engaging enough for you to meet them halfway with their internal mechanics and they do not waste the potential to give us a sense of perspective on how no matter how trapping our lives seem, we live in a cosmos where anything might be a possibly.The first three minutes mislead me and for a while I thought that we were watching someone's fantasy or some kind of Family Guy style cut-away that was non-canonical. I was a little disappointed that the whole thing wasn't in Mandarin.The plot element with the taxes was anxiety educing, man.Deliberately goofy and kitsch and not above a joke about situationally necessary sodomy, this was an epic and poignant experience.

Some of the action and fight scenes in this movie are brilliant (some are downright hilarious). Some of the scenes are just weird, and some are awesome. You are either going to like this or not. Would I recommend it, of course, with a warning of maybe it's not for you.

reviews.review_title: A Confusing and Emotionally Hollow Mess
reviews.content: As someone who just watched "Everything Everywhere All at Once," I have to say that I was sorely disappointed by the movie. Despite the hype and the buzz surrounding it, the film failed to live up to my expectations.One of the main issues with the movie was that it lacked emotional resonance. Despite its ambitious story and large ensemble cast, the film failed to create a strong emotional connection with the audience. It was difficult to feel invested in the characters' journeys, making it challenging to care about their struggles and triumphs.Additionally, the movie suffered from pacing issues. The narrative felt bloated and uneven, with some scenes dragging on for too long while others felt rushed and underdeveloped. This made it difficult to stay engaged throughout the film's runtime, which clocked in at over two hours.Another problem with the movie was its overreliance on clichés and tropes. The film attempted to subvert and twist these familiar storytelling elements, but ultimately failed to do so in a meaningful way. The result was a story that felt derivative and uninspired, lacking the freshness and originality that it was striving for.Finally, while the film's visual effects were generally impressive, there were some notable missteps. Some of the scenes were visually overwhelming, with too much happening on screen at once, which made it difficult to focus on any one thing. Additionally, some of the visual effects were distractingly cheesy, which took away from the immersive experience the film was trying to create.

reviews.review_title: Worst movie of my entire life
reviews.content: I don't get it, for me this movie is proof that society have just gone crazy. No way this is a 8 star movie, every second was torture for me.It seems like the director is throwing every single idea into the movie in an outrageous and not funny way. It tries to send a strong message through a bad executed and shallow movie. There's so much information, this movie is a Frankeinstein, just a lot of crazy cuts compiled together, is simply stupid, bad and ridiculous. Honestly I'd rather eat trash every single day of my life rather than watching it again. And the worst part is that it's probably going to win the Oscar for best picture. I'm too old for this, please give it one star.

reviews.review_title: It's just family guy in a different medium
reviews.content: Terrible, convoluted movie, with a weird plot and weirder execution. Not worth the hype it's getting. It takes forever for the plot to move forward. Yeah some visuals are great, but it doesn't offset the other trashy parts you've gotta sit through.

Technically this movie is a marvel, the cinematography, audio and set pieces are simply stunning. But the way it pulls you in gradually, hiding powerful themes that we all can agree on behind it's comedic and action oriented presentation is what elevates this movie to greatness. Come for the action and comedy and leave with thoughtful consideration.Best movie I have seen it 2022.

People treat this movie like it is groundbreaking but really it is a lot of things we have seen before rebranded. It sets up a lot of concepts that it doesn't fully understand, it wants to be like inception or tenet in it's high concept deep confusing layers but it doesn't have the intelligence in it's writing to follow through on it, anyone that really thinks deeply about the logic of it all will feel it fall apart, it feels like someone has tried to write the trippiest thing ever over the top of a really basic story cashing in on gay culture. It has strong themes of generational trauma and having regrets of where life has headed as well as LGBT themes, and it follows through on these themes with very little nuance. A big problem is once things are clear what the metaphors are for example the mother accepting the daughter sexuality or the daughter being depressed it destroys much of the depth the scifi elements created, it removed all tension, I didn't even see the daughter as depressed? But the plot needed her to be to retaliate against her mother, but what was she retaliating against? What nihilism did she feel? They set her up as a character that was comfortable with her identity surrounded by family that didn't understand but it didn't make sense for her to be depressed and it broke the concept really. The idea of an interdimensional evil that took no form and was able to surpass all dimension limits was good, but they didn't know what to do with it. The getting skills idea was good but stolen from the matrix, the multiverse ideas stolen from other films too, really all they did was repackage it and not well. The divorce too felt unbelievable, they layered up all these conflicts divorce and auditing and it was all so intensely forced that it felt shallow and not earnt. They layer on top of all this constant weirdness and sexual humour, it felt like when people say Rick and Morty is the smartest show ever. Just because it's random. Just because it has social issues like sexual orientation. Doesn't make it a good movie. I give it points for originality and visuals, the performances were good too, but overall it wasn't a good movie, entirely unsatisfying but by pushing an agenda it falls in this territory of films like 'Get Out' where they are immune to criticism and don't have to make sense.

reviews.review_title: One of the funniest movies I've seen in years
reviews.content: Be not alarmed. This is not Inception, nor The Matrix (but flavours of both can be tasted.)This is an enormously funny film, with some unexpected weepy feelgood moments.Hotdog fingers - gets me EVERY time.It is destined to be a classic.

Entering the twilight of her underwhelming life, an exhausted laundromat owner finds an outlet. I'm not sure how much more of the plot I can give away, because the shock absurdity of it all is a big part of what makes Everything Everywhere All at Once tick. Suffice to say, it's every bit as oddly, magically confounding as the directors' previous film, Swiss Army Man, which featured a fart-propelled corpse skimming waves and dispensing profound life lessons.Daniel Scheinert and Daniel Kwan, collectively known as "The Daniels," have carved themselves a distinct niche with these two films, alike in their polished visual excellence and strangely potent sense of sentimentality. After the sheer, gargantuan silliness of these concepts has essentially disarmed you, they posit, you're ripe for a deeper, more resonant message or two. In this case, the despondent store owner (Michelle Yeoh, who's fabulous) addresses the strain of a parent-child relationship from both perspectives and comes to terms with her own abundant, unrealistic aspirations and expectations. It's deep, powerful, universal stuff, which just so happens to be spread across a series of increasingly wacky, music-video kung-fu action scenes and random, contorted pop culture references.Put simply, this movie is a trip. The first act is demanding, a dizzying rush of big exposition and long elaboration that whirls between English and several subtitled Chinese dialects, but that lengthy setup is essential to unlock the delightful insanity of the next hour. Once the real ride is underway, it's an uncontrollable snowball of fanny packs and razor blades. Riotously entertaining; you've gotta see this.

This movie has a great mix of drama, action, and comedy! This is what movies should be like. Entertaining on many levels, with depth, character development, a lot of randomness, and laughs. I highly recommend seeing this!

reviews.review_title: All kinds of mad, epic, delightful, and gorgeous! [+87%]
reviews.content: Writer-director duo Dan Kwan & Daniel Scheinert take the simplest of premises (a woman doing her taxes) featuring the simplest of conflicts (the uneasy mom-daughter scenario) and spins a fascinatingly wacky tale out of it. Visually and audibly epic, the film is a near-perfect blend of sci-fi, action, comedy, drama, and fantasy, with the cast and crew entirely aboard the ship of idiosyncrasies. It's the multiverse of madness like you've never imagined, taking you through different circumstances featuring the same characters but managing to stay coherent and engaging. There's no doubt that the film offers a lot to take in a single watch, but this is one of those works that warrant multiple viewings. Michelle Yeoh is genuinely on fire here (be it in handling the drama or the action set-pieces), and so is the entire supporting cast featuring actors from various ethnicities.

I haven't seen a movie with this much thought, heart, and reverence in a long time. Nor a movie actually do gay representation without it making feel like minstrel show. This was great. A little bloated hence the 8/10 rating. The acting seemed good, but not great. I feel like Evelyn was kind of week at the very end, everyone else was good.In a movie that normally is bloated when they literally try to do everything and try 100 different genres/art-styles, it helps when you have one basic message to structure everything. SO in the end it kind of get repetitive when you get the "THEME" of the movie, but it's done in such an enjoyable way, that you forgive the fact that it treats you like a child and repeats the message like 15 times which is how long they say with rote learning it takes to memorize something.Was a great movie, could easily recommend and A24 is really cementing themselves as the new powerhouse for indie. I can't even remember the previous champ, but I do remember there was one, it wasn't Miramax... HMM who was it. EITHER WAY great script, great message, no tokens, and managed to be orderly yet chaotic.

Michelle Yeoh plays a character who blames everyone else for her problems. One would hope the character would grow but just finds someone new to blame. I guess everywhere all at once justifies it taking place on one floor of a building or is 25 million budget not enough to make it visually interesting. The movie is okay and I will finish the last 10 minutes, but it's not impressive.

It's Scott Pilgrim meets The Matrix, with a dash of Konty Python thrown in just for fun. But it's also a meditation on family and finding your place in the world, AND it's a feel good movie on top of that, meaning that you'll want to call your Mom and tell her you love her.I wanted to watch it again as soon as it ended.

This movie was meaningless in my point of view, Actors were OK, Even great, But story was far from it.Don't get me wrong, I didn't confuse by the story, The story was just meaningless and make no sense, After all of that killing "Joy" was forgiven just like that?The story was kind of silly, I like silly/comedy movies like "Date movie" for example, But when you watch a film like this you don't expect to be silly too.

I was speechless when it first ended, so I'm just going to describe it using 26 words in alphabetical order as a cop out... no thesaurus needed (for the most part), lolIt was one of the most absurd, brilliant, crazy, delirious, enthralling, fearless, gaudy, hilarious, impressive, jaw-dropping, kooky, limitless, masterful, noteworthy, outrageous, poignant, quintessential, riotous, silly, thoughtful, unique, vast, weird, x-factor, yearned-for, zany movies I've ever seen in my entire life.

One of the best movies I have ever seen. I usually don't enjoy action themed moved, but this movie is truly outstanding. From the phenomenal acting to the extremely creative story telling and directing, WOW! Just amazing.

reviews.review_title: Instant Classic. Every Emotion All at Once.
reviews.content: Within the 1st 20 minutes I'm thinking this is good. By the end I had laughed, cried, pondered, and was mind blown. I'm not one to give this high of praise to any show or movie. This is a once in a lifetime film though and one of the greatest experiences I've ever had in a theater.

reviews.review_title: Yeoh Delivers on All Cylinders in a Confusing Cosmic Journey
reviews.content: It's glorious to see the redoubtable Michelle Yeoh play so many facets of her considerable talents in one singular film in 2022, but directors Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert (known collectively as 'Daniels ') pile on the intense multiverses on Yeoh's put-upon character to such an excessive degree that the end result was more exhausting than fulfilling. Yeoh plays laundromat owner Evelyn Wang who is struggling with an IRS audit and a disaffected lesbian daughter. Ke Huy Quan and a heavily glammed down Jamie Lee Curtis lend spirited support, though Stephanie Hsu was the standout as Evelyn's frustrated daughter. It's worthwhile just to see Yeoh play such a fully dimensional star role with such panache.

This is a real rollercoaster of emotions. Comedically fantastic, sad and thought provoking. The most I have cried and laughed within the same 4 minutes. By far the best movie I have seen in 2022. The camera-work and editing is also highly creative and well executed.

reviews.review_title: Nothing Nowhere Over a Long Period of Time - most accurate
reviews.content: The Guardian review para-titled "Nothing Nowhere Over a Long Period of Time", remains the most accurate review I have come across to date on this colossal waste of time, unless you actually read the plot synopsis that contains "insane adventure" and "other universes" and then still proceeded to watch two hours and twenty minutes of gen Z hyper nonsense.This failed attempt at inspirational movie making from an industry largely bereft of an original thought, will no doubt feed the coffers of its producers, by those still caught up in over-hyped media messaging, delusional story lines, and possibly kaleidoscopes.Gen Z Oscar bait if ever there was one.
Don't read reviews, just go watch it, then come back and review it. Utterly brilliant, so original and both hilarious and heart-warming. This movie is incredible and deserves all the praise.

reviews.review_title: A grade topuc but C grade production
reviews.content: The core subject to explore family relationships are good but the story telling and presentations are totally chaos. The language switch among English, Chinglish, Mandarin, Cantonese are awkward and awful, especially those two Chinese men. Michelle played with hearts but it is still unacceptable to be produced like this chaotic and cheap looking manner. Mostly the movie is too long, it tortured me for 140 minutes !

Don't waste your time. This movie is nonsensical rubbish. A complete onslaught of ridiculous images that just left us shaking our heads. Certain parts left me questioning why and how they could've been allowed or even entertained to be included. Parts that were meant to be funny were cringeworthy. Parts that were meant to be touching or wise were an ill attempt to add some kind of meaning to the film. I was so disappointed with this movie. It had me saying "what the f%#* was that?" too many times. Seriously such a poorly executed film. I guess the only good thing I can say is that we kept watching until the end.
Excellent representation of human feelings and family relationships. It talks about love and acceptance.It is funny, unifique and weird . The performance of the actors and actresses is amazing.

reviews.review_title: Matrix - meets Alice in Wonderland: Through the Looking Glass - meets A Wrinkle In Time - meets Loki - meets Turning Red - meets Waking Life
reviews.content:
MY OVERALL TAKE:
Overall #EverythingEverywhereAllAtOnce gives The Matrix - meets a matured Alice in Wonderland Through the Looking Glass- meets A Wrinkle in Time - meets the family relationship tension of Turning Red - meets Loki - meets Waking LifeI was excited for this film the moment I saw the trailer back in December (I believe), and it met the expectations I had for the most part..minus some of the comedic choices, which wasn't expected, but was much appreciated.This is clearly one of the most unique and mentally stimulating films of the year (if not The most...), which means it probably already has award slots RSVP'd.OTHER THOUGHTS:Highlights: Where to begin! The visual effects and cinematography pairing was superb and genius for this story. I also loved the symbolism of the Evelyn and Waymond's relationship via Evelyn's uncertainty of the "Waymond" who was present at any given moment. The women all did an amazing job, but Stephanie Hsu was a standout.Could've Been Better: Though easy to accept, I would've liked more space in Act One given to showcasing the tensions and traumas of the family, specifically between parent and child, and parent and parent. This could've strengthened some of the decisions of Acts Two and Three.

reviews.review_title: Most unintentionally cringey movie I've seen
reviews.content:
Pros:
The filming for some parts was very good. Most of the movie was visually pleasing.The idea of doing something out of place to jump between these paralell universes was quite original.Cons:
The world was both overexplained, and not explained enough. It seems like they haven't really developed how the world works, so they just threw in some scientific sounding mumbo-jumbo.It was unbearably cliche at every point, no smart ideas or twists.There were some points where I thought we might get some insight into the mind of either the protaganist or the antagonist, but nope, because the movie couldun't stay serious for five minutes straight without some comedic relief character entering.Now to my main critisism: the humor was awful. Not just simply bad. It tried to mimc "gen z humor" but it was off in so many ways. The absurd jokes weren't absurd in a smart way (by smart I mean a joke that would have surprised me). The best way to describe it is cringey.Who could've guessed that love saves the day?The weirdest part was that almost everybody around me was laughing their asses off. I was with friends and the whole way we were laughing at the people laughing at this garbage. Maybe thats what everybody was laughing at? Its harf to say.

Bit overlong, but trippy weird fun. Leaves a big impression on you in some way or another. Solid performances and lots of interesting concepts and bizarre senses of humour. Nice emotional story giving multiverses a theme of purpose.8.5/10.

reviews.review_title: profoundly deep exploration of nihilism and whatnot
reviews.content: Once a popular film ends up this widely praised for its deep profundity and philosphical explorations one can only become suspicious of what could possibly be hidden beneath such a grandiose pretense.Turns out that beyond the appearance of meaningfulness this picture presents an almost shocking level of narrative conformity. In essence the movies plot boils down to something eerily closely resembling the typical Spielbergian family melodrama which omnipresently haunts the hollywood consumer whenever he feels the urge to indulge in any sort of VFX action spectacle. But unlike the classic action blockbuster this movie (apparently quite successfully) tries to hide its banale message of compassion and acceptance in a contrived martial arts and special effects orgy which despite its obvious attempt at creating some sort of aesthetic diversity feels thoroughly uniform stylistically.Like many recent movies the cold and calculated fast pacedness and incorporation of the already stale multiverse premise undeniably tries to make up for the fact that there is just not that much there. It's a simple story about family and generational conflict which in itself is not a bad thing and could, if well written, undoubtedly provide a template for a good and original story. In EEAAO though, every character seems to be the most unoriginal played out trope version of their respective role. The mother is your typical "strong woman who feels like she could have been more had she not settled for her silly but loveable husband", Said husband, the stereotypical "too honest and friendly for his own good and not assertive enough modern beta male" character and the daughter your run of the mill anxious and mildly depressed teen. Then, of course, the movie goes on to show that all these characters who, in the beginning, feel atomized and alienated from one another, in the end, realize that they are truly "in the same boat" and reach a corny reconciliation after finally talking to one another about their feelings, which of course could only be achieved thorugh an overwhelmingly ridiculous odyssey through the infinite alternate universes of played out hollywood cliches.Sadly this movie is just another addition to the seemingly never ending stream of modern films which don't even warrant the criticism of "poorly written" since there seems to be barely anything written. And it's not that there's a problem with it being focused on appearance ("style over substance") it's the fact that it tries to make you think it isn't. Rick and Morty Season 1 Episode 8 demonstrates how to deal with the same premise in a more engaging, honest and funny way and does so in less than 25 minutes. We seem to have arrived in an era where all the intelligent writing has ended up in the adult fart comedy cartoon sector.

Wow, this was a unique film, entertainingly presented and capitalizes on the amazing talent of Michelle Yeoh, supported by the ever-outstanding Jamie Lee Curtis. Both actors were, as perfectly expressed by another reviewer, "glamoured down", and the film was "often silly, mostly confusing but entirely entertaining". I couldn't agree more, with that spot-on description, and found it thoroughly entertaining throughout its long run time. Worthy to be watched multiple times, I am looking forward to enjoying it again, as there is a lot to be picked up on with repeated viewing. As it poignantly explores the meaning of life, it is hilarious at times, making for an engaging experience.

reviews.review_title: I don't think I've ever given anything a 10 before now
reviews.content: Not a wasted frame, not a wasted moment. I have never laughed AND cried that much in the same movie. Visually stunning, amazing acting, fantastic fights, and a beautiful message. This movie has it all and I can't wait to see it again.

This film is one of the most original films i have seen in a long time. Michelle Yeoh plays Evelyn a mother who owns a laundromat. She is having problems with her husband and her gay daughter. She is then brought into a multiverse that shows her the potential she could have had. This leads to some crazy adventures with stunning visuals. Some incredible action packed scenes with very funny dialogue. Jamie Lee Curtis is very funny in a supporting as an IRS agent. This film really takes you to places that you may never have been in a film before. Which is really exciting to see a filmmaker do something totally original. Michelle Yeoh pulls of possibly the performance of her career. This is one of the best films of 2022.

But this time, dripping emotion, humor, authenticity, and heart.. not a film. A beautiful exhausting experience.I cannot thank the creators and actors enough for putting something like this together and sharing it with the world.

Don't usually feel compelled to review a movie, but Wow!!! Really enjoyed this crazy feast for the brain. The acting, the directing, the emotions...really hit the nail on the head. One of the weirdest movies I have ever seen, but by the end I felt like I had been on an emotional roller coaster. They take a lot of different chances in this one. Most of them work pretty good. If you are looking for something different and don't mind getting hit hard in the feels. Please give this one a chance. Ill definitely be recommending it.

Family issues in the multiverse of madness, absolute rubbish. Recalling, referencing and reusing other great directors work does not mean that you did similar work. However, dancing with IRS agent seems legit.

reviews.review_title: A lot of hiccups here and there
reviews.content: The directorship is not great at putting things, simply poor.The actings were below average! Why they dropped standards?The story has a lot of nonsense illogical here and there, very disappointing when they can easily be better.I can only give 6.3/10 because the special effects just average, story too much hiccups, orientations poor, directorship poor, actings poor,......Watch at home free is recomended!

The overall theme of the film was good But it was very badly made that I did not enjoy.It was not funny at all, was not even possible to get the right result from the film. The writing of the film was very poor and confusing.
Way too long for my liking and difficult if impossible to make real sense of. Full of symbolism, multiverses and fantasy worlds. Just too much for me to enjoy the film.

I can imagine that some people would really like this film. I mean, it has a lot in it- action, comedy, wildly unexpected twists.But personally, I need to really understand what's going on, and be invested, to sit through a full 2 hour 20 minute film. It took me a while to get my head around what was happening and by the time I did, I didn't really care.The characters were alright. They definitely tried to flesh them out, but with the exception of Joy, the daughter, I didn't really care about any of them.Overall, it just felt very average and I was checking how much was left to sit through from the 90 minute mark.
