This movie was just perfect! It was full of heart and emotion while still adding in comedic elements. The whole theatre was laughing. The emotional parts really got me to fall in love with this movie. Not a movie you expect to make you tear up but it definitely had me. All the performances from the cast were exceptional. I hope to see them in more films. This movie does odd and weird amazingly. It keeps you engaged the entire 2 hours and 19 minutes. A lovely and heartwarming story and message is tucked into an action packed comedy and they did it so well. I'll recommend this movie to basically anyone it was PERFECT.

"Everything Everywhere All at Once" is a unique movie, everything in it is perfect: the performances of the entire cast are wonderful, from leads to supporting cast, especially the performances of Michelle Yeoh, Ke Huy Quan and Jamie Lee Curtis. The script is innovative, deep and crazy, touching on dramatic elements and absurd comedy with a result of life learning accompanied by laughter. Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert's filmmaking is bold and effective, proving that two directors can make a quality film without a disastrous clash of ideas. The editing, costume design and production design are of remarkable quality. A modern classic!

reviews.review_title: This movie will be a classic
reviews.content: Its hilarious, euphoric, meaningful, etc. Words cant describe how amazingly beautiful this movie is. Go see it...NOW. Saw this a week ago, and it still resonates. This movie caught me off guard. I just thought it would be a bonkers ride (which it definitely was) but it was SO much more. The balance of humor, action, exploration of family/generational dynamics and heartfelt message was astounding. As great as I found it, I know it won't be everyones cup of tea but I also can't help but recommend it to everyone.

reviews.review_title: The real multiverse of madness that Marvel failed to make. If Nolan was asked to make a high-concept absurdist sci-fi flick, he would have made this film.
reviews.content:
Everything Everywhere All at Once (2022) :
Brief Review -The real multiverse of madness that Marvel failed to make. If Nolan was asked to make a high-concept absurdist sci-fi flick, he would have made this film. Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert had an idea for a multiverse flick way back in 2010 - the same year when Christopher Nolan made "Inception". However, it took them a long time to gather things, and then we saw Marvel entering the multiverse zone with one of their most popular superheroes, Doctor Strange. It is strange that Everything Everywhere All at Once released in the same year when Doctor Strange and Wanda decided to go bonkers in the Multiverse of Madness. However, the film couldn't live up to the hype. But if you are amongst those who weren't satisfied with the Strange vs Wanda battle due to weak writing (like me), then make sure that you catch this high-concept entertainer. This absurdist sci-fi flick is expectedly weird, wild and awfully rubbish, but doesn't fail to entertain you with some crazy ideas and amazing sequences. The film tells the story of a Chinese woman who discovers that she must connect with parallel universe versions of herself to prevent a powerful being from causing the destruction of the multiverse. There is much more to it that can't be spoiled, but yes, you can be warned and made prepared for emotionally intellectual topics like existentialism and Nihilism, with some absurd and yukk-ward moments. Michelle Yeoh, Stephanie Hsu, Ke Huy Quan and James Hong have given good performances along with the brilliant supporting cast. Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert deserve a big round of applause for their out-of-the-box thinking and audience-friendly vision. Neither Nolan nor Marvel could manage to deal with this high-concept topic by arranging the comedy in a perfect manner. The 2 Ds have done it. Except for children, this one is strongly recommended to everyone who loves watching unique entertainers.RATING - 7/10*By - #samthebestest.

LOVED this movie from the acting, cast and the visual effects a movie that really cares about the story its telling i also loved that instead of the movie being about the multiverse its about the characters family trauma and also makes a good argument against nihilsm. I will be watching it again.

reviews.review_title: It's ok if you don't like it, this film doesnt matter to you
reviews.content: I knew very little about this film before watching it, all I knew was that it starred MIchelle Yeoh as a woman who learns about multiple universes containing multiple versions of herself.I'm a big fan of Michelle Yeoh, so I was keen to see her in a film that was so unlike anything else I had seen her in.Eventually I found myself in the right mood to watch a multiverse film, and oh my lord I'm glad I did.I knew this film would be about roads not taken, about choices and consequences and about our personal insignificance amongst our reflections, it's what we expect from ideas that revolve around the multiverse.What I didn't expect was a film that explored the nihilism that the multiverse concept evokes, a film that challenges that nihilism in the most beautiful way by saying "if nothing matters, then all that matters is what matters to you".I need to explain here: My mother recently passed away unexpectedly, and I have found myself drained of everything except nihilism and anger, nothing mattered and I hated the world for pretending that it did.This film threw my own nihilism in my face and made me look at it with the character of Jobu, a personification of nihilism/sadness/rage.And as I watched the film I nearly fell into it, I nearly fell into the same logical pit of pointlessness. But just before I did, the film offered me a lifeline in the form of an idea:If Evelyn can choose what matters to her, if she can choose to find significance in the connections and compassion of her loved ones and their lives together, why can't I?This is the message in the film that resonated with me, but read these reviews and see the other messages that resonated with other people. See how other people choose/find significance in the nihilistic chaos and how it is different for each one.For some people the message was about the selfishness of our world/culture today, with a message of hope that we are all human, all with our struggles and successes and a reminder that kindness breeds kindness.For others the message was that when we are spiraling out of control with too many things to think about or focus on, focusing on one thing that truly matters to us can help us regain our control and find some peace/power in our lives.See people choosing what mattered to them.TLDR:First, this is a film that requires you to be in a receptive/reflective frame of mind to enjoy it fully, if you aren't there or not that sort of person then you probably won't enjoy it as much ( I am so glad I waited until I was in that frame of mind).Second, Everything Everywhere All At Once will ask you questions, the answers you find will probably change your way of looking at the world and yourself.Third, even if the film doesn't connect with you on a deeper level, the comedy, action, and dialogue are all top notch and I would recommend the film on those alone.Nothing matters, but it's ok, because it doesn't matter.

Everything Everywhere All at Once is excactly what the tittle says. It's difficult to discribe this film A) without spoiling it and B) giving a right account of what is happening. Nothing makes sense and yet, in the end, everything does.To the core of it all, it's a woman, living a life that she doesn't anjoy, being someone she doesn't want to be. Thus, the movie has this melancholic feeling to it, along with the philosofical questions that raises about family, romantic love, choices, control over our lives as well as the lives of those around us, etc etcThe performances is another killer point of the drama, smooth, without overdoing it even though it was so easy to do so considaring the crazy plot.So, overall, eight out of ten.

I happened to watch this on my last fight because I'd been hearing so much buzz around it. And WOW it really is as good as everyone has been saying. Over the 2 hours I laughed, I cried, I saw so much of myself in these characters. The gags, effects, and editing work flawlessly together and are a breath of fresh compared to other movies lately. It takes silly absurd concepts and made me openly weep, so much of this film resonated with me in such a deep existential way. It definitely felt like a labor of love by everyone who worked on it and I really think everyone should experience it.I'm definitely going to try and see it in theaters before it leaves.

Everything Everywhere All at Once is a fantastic movie. The multiverse premise is utilized extremely well, as each universe is meaningful to the story. Beyond delivering great comedy, these variances all bring a respectable amount of heart to the arcs and themes developed within. The writing is therefore brilliant, as the filmmakers even stick to the established multiverse rules. This being said, the suspension of disbelief is stretched thin by some moments where the fantastical abilities start to feel overly-numerous. Fortunately, this does not impact all too much of the awesomely creative plot. The film is otherwise comedically, emotionally, and technically proficient. The humor throughout is hilarious, from how lines are delivered to the wackiness of the many universes shown. Nearly every joke works and simultaneously aids the emotional caches of the plot. What makes the story feel so wholesome, though, are the performers and their respective characters. Yeoh is amazing in the lead as the flawed protagonist who profoundly, yet genuinely grows. In support, Curtis, Hong, Quan, and Tsu are very good. They seamlessly go from one variant to the next, somehow proving convincing in each role. All of these characters are highly likable, too, especially as the story progresses and motivations are made clear. Even the villain is sympathetic. The dynamics between all of these characters is what ultimately produces such an emotionally resonant picture, though. Various themes within result from how these relationships are resolved so thoughtfully. The resolution is therefore quite satisfactory. However, a somewhat major flaw is apparent in the closing sequences. The universe the plot begins in is most certainly not the one it ends in, which does take from the impact the movie has. More so, it is disappointing not to get a true resolution to this original universe. On a technical level, though, this film is perfect. The editing is expert, between the wonderfully cut action to the overall pacing. On that note, the set pieces are excitingly choreographed and highly creative. Cinematography is just as inventive with such colorful backgrounds and intriguing shots. The score is fitting to every moment, too. Ultimately, Everything Everywhere All at Once is a great film on all fronts, only featuring a few missteps.

What in this Universe made this bloody and violent creation earn 11 Oscar nominations is beyond me.Maybe the creative variety of violent tricks and methods of destroying and maiming human bodies appealed to many viewers, and yet I found non-stop creative bloody violence on the screen exhausting.It is surprising how unconvincing and simple the idea behind the many minutes of loud senseless fighting turns out to be.I haven't remembered leaving the movie theatre feeling disgusted and nauseous ever until today.I gave the movie two stars though I feel the actors deserve much better ratings than the movie itself.

How come things that are so chaotic can translate into something beautiful and profound? I guess the Daniels know its perfect recipe and then bake that madness of the multiverse immaculately. Everything Everywhere All at Once is not only a love letter to Michelle Yeoh, but also to love itself. Hilariously silly, yet genuinely touching.

I thought this movie was so stupid and boring I only could watch 30 minuts and I quit a little after the absurd Jackie Chan fight. By the way, it was dificult to understand most of the uninspiring actors bacause of their thick chinese accent. All in all, they tried very hard to make a very original movie, but the outcome is a huge and depressing failure.

reviews.review_title: A real work of genius in my eyes
reviews.content: Possibly the best film I've seen & I've seen many. So much is going on from kung fu ballets, multiverse story, NSFW visual jokes yet emotionally deep & engaging. A real work of genius in my eyes. If only I could give it 11/10.

reviews.review_title: Beautiful, hilarious, and meaningful beyond words
reviews.content: Absolutely sublime yet action packed and wildly funny and outlandish! Hands down one one of my best movie going experiences ever. It is rare for me to laugh so hard or cry so often during a film, let alone both simultaneously. Thought provoking and beautiful in its presentation of optimistic nihilism. Great stunt work with wide action shots. Wonderful performances from all the actors. Surreal, unpredictable, and perfect!

reviews.review_title: I cried at the end (in a happy way)
reviews.content: Probably not for everyone but this movie reflects on life, and in particular relates to people with sore estranged relationships with their parents as they get older. The plot can be a bit all over the place but I think that's part of the movie's charm.I think I would recommend it to those who are willing to experience a seriously life reflecting movie, that also doesn't take itself too seriously. You don't really know or have certainty on what is going to happen next. Except constantly expecting the most ludicrous scenarios like (a universe with people having hot dog fingers lmao), but it is an emotional theatrical masterpiece. Very well made special effects, lots of funny scenes and it's ultimately a movie about life and the choices we are too afraid to make.Again probably not for everyone but I typically like action films and enjoyed the fight scenes. I really think this movie is underrated and an amazing job in making me feel deeply. Very few Hollywood movies are able to do that for me. And why it gets ten stars from me.

Every scene and sequence connected to the next one in this exceptional movie directed by Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert. Both also sat on screenplay, adding to the consistency and clever plot-layering that can only come from minds who vibe in unison.Son Lux's musical scoring was an underrated gem in this title. Larkin Seiple's cinematography was great. Paul Rogers's editing worked wonders. Jason Kisvarday's production design was noteworthy. Amelia Brooke's art direction was quite good. Kelsi Ephraim's set decoration had a lot that needed balancing, and she did.Shirley Kurata's costume design was aces. The hair-makeup and stunts teams did outstanding work in "Everything Everywhere All at Once". The VFX and special effects teams are deserving of high praise.Michelle Yeoh as Evelyn Wang was everything I never knew I needed. Her performance was amazing, versatile, natural, and memorable. I've always been a fan of her work, and it was nice watching her do something so different yet so ideally tailored for her.Joy Wang, played by Stephanie Hsu, was perfection. Waymond Wang, played by Ke Huy Quan, was another underrated talent in this production. Chad, played by Harry Shum Jr., was notable.Playing Deirdre Beaubeirdre was none other than Jamie Lee Curtis, who was splendid. She was funny in a subtle way, and compelling in every other.I was surprised when veteran Chinese actor James Hong came on the scene. He played Gong Gong, and it was great to watch him do something distinct from his usual work."Everything Everywhere All at Once" covered the travails of what it means to be a Chinese immigrant in the United States of America. A fantastic twist, and quite literally, came about where Yeoh's Evelyn had to save the world, again quite literally.The visual precision of scene-work in this film was akin to the sharp cuts of a master couturier. Not a single boring moment prevailed throughout, which itself was a testament to Kwan and Scheinert's direction.A layer of original storytelling was spread carefully, almost lovingly, through the script. There was action, drama, humour, love, family, and fantasy all in one neat package. It was also one of the most deeply philosophical films of the year - of the past few years, even."Everything Everywhere All at Once" has to be seen by movie enthusiasts particularly because of how skillfully it managed to evade clichés - despite the underlying 'Matrix download' and 'dark Alice in mad-land' elements - and provide viewers with one of the most thematically satisfying movies of 2022.

reviews.review_title: This movie does everything everywhere all at once
reviews.content: Once in a decade movie. Every single moment is filled with overwhelming attention and should be considered for top 10 greatest movies of all time, anyone who says otherwise was probably raised the critic from ratatouille. But believe me when I say this is the movie that made even that guy feel like he's eating his mom's cooking.

If I'd only watched the first 2/3's of this movie I'd probably give it like an 8 or 9.The final 1/3rd is shockingly bad, starting around we get some smarmy textual dialog spoken by some rocks(supposedly on a planet without people, but you can see a road in the distance...)After that it just degenerates into random nonsense and over the top feel good garbage trying to cram its dull message down your throat.I didn't even want to finish it by the end, it was so uninspired & boring.Wish the movie had stuck the landing, but oh well.

I finally watched it and I can only say ... damn, I'm not sure what to feel after this movie 😄 absolutely original, absolutely crazy. There were ingenious things, as well as totally stupid ones, but somehow they all work. Definitely not a movie for everyone in my opinion. Just like the dualistic style in which they shot the film, (something like a mix of commercial and indie cinema), the content is just as bipolar, ranging from touching and quiet moments and total stupidity and weirdness.The beginning hooked me a lot, drew me into the story, the multiverse, etc., somehow the gas pedal wasn't pushed yet and everything that was happening was easier to follow, more natural flowing. That's why I really liked the first half. But towards the end, Daniels retreated too much and hampered the situation a lot. And the climax wasn't strong or interesting enough to justify the weight in which the third act was burdened. It's just that a hell of a lot of ideas, one after the other, a hell of a lot of dynamic editing, jumping in different scenes, places, each one more and more crazier than the other and it exhausted me. The bombastic length of 2 hours and 20 minutes didn't help either. At one time I was so exhausted that I seriously was wondering if ot would end soon, I had the feeling that the film lasted 5 hours, although I was fascinated by what was happening.For me, if they had cut at 15-20 minutes, there would not have been so many stretched plot threads, excessive use of slo-mo, etc. The film would have been much tighter and have more punch. But in the end, in terms of authorship, originality and imagination, they just killed it. Great study of a family relationship, mixed with crazy multiverse story. An original idea, which was shot with incredible splendor, mastery, love and heart. Special praise for the editor, because his work was definitely not easy at all 😄 I don't want to see the film file, because it will definitely give me a headache. I also don't know how much their budget was, but it was definitely very well balanced in terms of CGI, practical, etc.All in all, a wonderful job for Daniels. If they continue in this way, they will surely become powerhouse directors. And once again, I'm super happy that so many original and relatively indie films are appearing. Lately, there seems to be a renaissance of auteur cinema that can only make me happy.Rating: 8/10
P. S. - Quite an interesting coincidence that we have a second film in a short period in which there are so many similar elements. The multiverse , I understand, it's not a very out there subject, but the third eye puzzled me a little. Somehow I'm still fresh from Strange and now seeing it here again... I got a bit of a dumb feeling, even though I realize that they are totally different movies. Perhaps, unfortunately, we will continue to witness more and more such coincidences in the future, and it is becoming increasingly difficult to be surprised by things.

It's rare that I think about a movie for days after seeing it. This is one of them. What a wild, enthralling, thought-provoking, emotionally stirring ride. I laughed, I choked up, I had my mind blown. This one will stick with you and I hope it sticks with people in charge of honoring unique films when the time comes. Writers, editors, costume designers and actors - every element of this film is a masterpiece. Enjoy!

I have left reviews on countless films that I have called "quirky", "unique" and "ridiculous". There is no film that first those descriptions more than Everything Everywhere All At Once. While the film is hilariously shocking, it is also action-packed and incredibly heartwarming.This film has one of the most beautifully crafted messages that I have ever seen in film. I honestly cried for most of the last 30 minutes. If you can embrace the absurdities (or at least look past them), you will find a marvelous story about inner peace.Best Character: Waymond
Best Scene: The Fanny Pack Fight
Best Quote: "I will always, always want to be here with you." - Evelyn
Best Piece of Score: "In Another Life"

reviews.review_title: This flick may not feature as many catchy tunes as . . .
reviews.content: . . . the Book of Norman, but it's clearly based upon the principles of the most rampant American-bred religion. The whole concept of multi verses originated with the self-styled saints, as the dioramas in their Salt Lake City visitors' center attest. Though EVERYTHING EVERYWHERE ALL AT ONCE tones down the more outrageous aspects of the latter daze golden tablets, sorting top hats, magic underwear and multiple spouses by substituting worlds of hot dog fingers, talking boulders, bagel idols and gargantuan sects toys--perhaps to avoid being sued for copyright infringement--the spirit of "One man, one solar system" is omnipresent. Though it's always problematic to drag religion into U. S. multiplexes, EVERYTHING seems far less controversial or potentially offensive than FATHER STU.

A genre bending movie that will go down in history books as one of the most brave and unique movie of all time. Michelle Yeoh delivers her career best work and is the heartbeat of the movie. The plot is so absurd that we forget the premise of the movie and just enjoy it's robust visuals and crackpot comedy. A movie that should be truly enjoyed in a cinema.

reviews.review_title: Entertaining and fun, but not much else for me personally.
reviews.content: Okay i decided to go see what's the hype around this film.I wasn't super excited from trailers so i didn't really have expectations at all.But where is this all hype coming from?Is there some kinda Tiktok trend about this or something that i don't know because i don't have Tiktok?Or maybe this just wasn't for me.Yeah this is very fast paced, fun and entertaining action comedy.Not probably my favorite genres.Multiverse story that to be honest would've been much more exciting about ten years ago.Some nice relationship drama between characters, but in the end that felt quite shallow.Now this basically is like Marvel movie script that was just polished to be something little more unique.There definitely is certain strangness in this that was fun.But still suprisingly conventional story.Great performances definitely.Visually beautiful film.Attention to details was really good thing in this definitely.Very entertaining and fun movie, but sadly not much more for me personally.I'm happy that some others liked it more.

Nothing Matters
You've seen it all you've felt everything on the edge of nothingness but in this world there is someone or something for every one of us it will be there sooner or later.

This movie is one of the best of all time. When I saw it was about the multiverse I was a little disappointed as I think that kind of movie often fails to be emotionally profound and good beyond action. This wasn't the case here. The action of this movie is levels above any other movie I've seen in the last five years. The comedy is on point and is well done so it doesn't take away from the films drama aspect while still being hilarious. All of the performances are great, especially Michelle Yeoh and Le Huy Quan. 100% would recommend.

reviews.review_title: Cinema Omnivore - Everything Everywhere All at Once (2022) 8.2/10
reviews.content: "All hell breaks loose in the IRS building, Evelyn the launderette has no sooner disabused incredulity than minions of Jobu Tapaki start their offensive. Levity bursts out every time when a character must do something utterly ridiculous to acquire a particular skill belonging to their counterpart in another universe, for instance, "butt-hurt" has a literal signification here. The universes imagineered by Daniels range from small variations like Evelyn the movie star, or the martial artist, or the opera singer, to absolute bonkers, like Evelyn and Deirdre become a lesbian couple in a universe where human's fingers are supplanted by hot dogs, or Evelyn is a teppanyaki chef and her younger colleague Chad (Shum Jr., a droll eye-candy!) is puppeteered by a Ratatouille-like raccoon, to the utter abstract, eons later, humans have devolved into stones."read my full review on my blog: Cinema Omnivore, thanks.
I cried, I laughed, I was confused, scared, curious, hooked! I loved this movie! Such an experience! I hugged my parents after seeing this :))) I feel like no movie could top this one!

reviews.review_title: Love - Family - Multiverse Concept with Messy Storyline
reviews.content: Love - Family - Multiverse Concept with Messy Storyline.Wait storyline? It barely has a storyline. This movie only wanna show how good Michelle Yeoh fighting skill. Fight here and there - no strong concept. And I just waste my time to watch this. I don't know why this rated 8.5 but it is definitely only a 1 star for me.Trailer is good. Interesting but when it comes to full movie? Very bad and so beyond absurd. I will skip it if it runs in local television..... just when i thought Kill Bill is the worse movie.

Yes, that's it. The worst movie of the year and I don't even have to wait for the others to compare. Boring, pointless, confusing, just choose one (or all) and you will no be wrong about the adjective. Meh.

Few things in life are certain besides death, taxes, and maybe the never-ending task that is doing laundry. At least that's where the characters in writer/directors Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert, collectively known as Daniels, new film "Everything Everywhere All at Once" find themselves initially. That is, until they take an emotional, philosophical, and deeply weird trip through the looking glass into the multiverse and discover metaphysical wisdom along the way. In this love letter to genre cinema, Michelle Yeoh gives a virtuoso performance as Evelyn Wang, a weary owner of a laundromat under IRS audit. We first meet her enjoying a happy moment with her husband Waymond (Ke Huy Quan) and their daughter Joy (Stephanie Hsu). We see their smiling faces reflected in a mirror on their living room wall. As the camera literally zooms through the mirror, Evelyn's smile fades, now seated at a table awash with business receipts. She's preparing for a meeting with an auditor while simultaneously trying to cook food for a Chinese New Year party that will live up to the high standards of her visiting father Gong Gong. On top of juggling her father's visit and the tax audit, Evelyn's sullen daughter Joy wants to bring her girlfriend Becky (Tallie Medel) to the party and her husband wants to talk about the state of their marriage. Just as Evelyn begins to feel overwhelmed by everything happening in her life she's visited by another version of Waymond from what he calls the Alpha verse. Here humans have learned to "verse jump" and are threatened by an omniverse agent of chaos known as Jobu Tupaki. Soon, Evelyn is thrust into a universe-hopping adventure that has her questioning everything she thought she knew about her life, her failures, and her love for her family. Most of the action is set in an IRS office building in Simi Valley (which, as a Californian, had me in stitches), where Evelyn must battle IRS agent Diedre (Jamie Lee Curtis, having the time of her life), a troop of security guards, and possibly everyone else she's ever met. Production designer Jason Kisvarday crafts a seemingly endless cubicle-filled office where everything from the blade of a paper trimmer to a butt plug shaped auditor of the year awards become fair game in a battle to save the universe. Moments of love and camaraderie. Sometimes they happen over time. Sometimes they happen all at once.

I swear I will never get this title right. It just doesn't flow right in my head. But that is par for the course of the feature presentation.I really loved Everything Everywhere All at Once, but it's super hard not to. While I admittedly didn't get it all with this viewing, I felt this movie is special. There's so much more I didn't see and can't wait to upon inevitable multi-viewings. This is why I'm glad I chose to purchase this (unseen) vs. Renting it or getting a free trial/one month of Showtime just to see it. Now I *can* rewatch this enough times to absorb it all.Hard to describe the plot, but it boils down to an everyday Mother/Daughter/Wife with extraordinary worries/responsibilities/troubles and her unexpected journey of self-discovery through...the multi-universes. This could be the unofficial Scott Pilgrim vs. The World sequel I've always wanted.It's also like The One and, of course, Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness. It is better than Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness and a hundred times better than The One, but I still do prefer Scott Pilgrim Vs. The World more.Everyone in the cast is excellent - not one single bad performance, but I will give the most kudos to both Jamie Lee Curtis and my personal favorite of the cast/characters: Waymond Wang played wonderfully by Ke Huy Quan. I instantly felt his warmth, charisma and boy, was he adorable. Plus, a good fighter. And OF COURSE, Michelle Yeoh did great. That 100% goes without saying.One thing I did not expect: this is a straight-up comedy first. I did laugh out loud so...many...times. Sure, there is action. Beautiful, exciting, fun and wonderfully choreographed fighting. And there is heart. Like a ton of it. But, overall, I really saw this as a comedy-drama with some incidental action.I don't think I'm gushing over this as much as I believe I will with additional viewings. There's a LOT to take in. Like more flashes/subplots/characters/directions still dancing across my brain from this and the movie ended a while ago. It is one of the most original pieces I've seen in a long time. And it's not just the script. Everything Everywhere All at Once...on the screen.Jury's still out if I'll raise my initial 8/10-star rating as I've been known to do. But this I know: I will be revisiting the Wang's multiverses again soon.***Final Thoughts: Naturally, I'm not going to spoil the ending, but it was 100% the ending I was hoping for. I didn't expect it would happen and I was so very pleased with the payoff. I cannot wait to see this again.

reviews.review_title: Never related so much to a movie!
reviews.content: Wow! I read that Daniel Kwan had ADHD and that the movie somehow was going to represent this. I was convinced when I decided to watch this that I would not like it, and afraid that it would be another disappointment, trying to depict the craziness that goes on inside the head of a person with ADHD on the big screen. But man was I wrong!What a beautiful film, with a strong message and crazy scenes. I felt like they took my ADHD-head and made a movie out of it, just added some extra action and sci-fi.Everything was perfect the way it was, and it should not have been made any other way.Everywhere they went in the movie was so beautiful, smart and very well thought out.And last but not least the craziness of this movie worked so outstandingly well together all at once!

reviews.review_title: Whoa. What did I just watch?
reviews.content: Whoa. What did I just watch? I'm not entirely sure, but I do know that I enjoyed most of it. Everything Everywhere All at Once is a bizarre, creative film about the multiverse. I honestly did not know what to expect the entire time I was watching it. Michelle Yeoh really shows her acting range in this movie, I loved seeing Ke Huy Quan again, and Jamie Lee Curtis was almost unrecognizable. However, the runtime is a little too long. Even with all the madness, it tends to drag in parts. And I also feel like they relied on hitting the shock humor button too often. Still, this was a fun, wild ride.

Thank god for subtitles in a universe where I don't speak Mandarin or Cantonese, but there is also plenty of English spoken."Everything Everywhere All At Once" by the Daniels, Kwan and Scheinert is the most trippy movie I've ever seen and that's saying something.I'm glad I was only on prescription drugs and multi-vitamins that night.So many movies are referenced during the 2 hours and 19 minutes of screen time, including: Stanley Kubricks' "2001: A Space Odyssey", "The Matrix", "Groundhog Day" & "It's A Wonderful Life" and Anime.Imagine that you alone could save the world, but you can barely do your taxes or save your marriage and family.The movie plays out like a book divided into 3 chapters.The first is "Everything" and starts after the initial set up.It's a great excuse to film the most brilliant choreographed fight scenes since Tarantinos' "Kill Bill" & "Old Boy".Don't be fooled by the fake end credits after the first chapter wraps.The second chapter is "Everywhere" and the final chapter is, you guessed it "All At Once" which features the denouement.IMDb's synopsis refers to the films star Michelle Yeohs "Evelyn Wang" as an ageing Chinese immigrant".Fair suck of the sauce bottle IMDb we are all ageing, but this actor is only 2 years younger than this reviewer so please call her middle aged if you must!Whereas the man who plays Evelyns father can wear that title of senior proudly.James Hong as "Gong Gong" is one of the most prolific and well recognised Asian-American character actors of movies and television.At 93, he is still actively working, mostly as a voice actor.Essentially this film draws on a mother and daughters relationship/love which knows no boundaries.Stephanie Tsu is perfect as Evelyns daughter "Joy"...even though rapper/actress Awkwafina was tipped for this role.One of my fave visual moments is "the handshake" between mother and daughter.It's really the ideal Mothers Day movie.Evelyns husband "Waymond Wang", Ke Huy Kwan, is better known for his work as a child actor "Short Round" in "Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom" and "Data" in "The Goonies".In fact, its been over 20 years since he's appeared on the big screen and that was in "X-Men".Jackie Chan was originally destined for this role.Watchout for: Jamie Lee Curtis ("Halloween") as an IRS agent with a Buddah belly who gets her tax cheats.She apparently was the funniest actor on the set...even though Curtis only got to deliver serious lines.One of the best scenes is silent and involves no spoken aloud dialogue, just superimposed lines from the two central characters...brilliant cinema."Everything Everywhere All At Once" is an insane, existential, comedic, adventure that is so close to perfect."Dr Strange" is going to have a lot of competition from the visual stimulation that's both funny and at times sad in this low budget Multiverse movie even though they have the power of MCU versus just 25 million dollars and a handful of geeky tech people.This movie will help you see meaning in a universe where you sometimes feel nothing matters.

reviews.review_title: This film raises the bar for best movie ever.
reviews.content: This is no knee jerk reaction, I'm no novice to film, It is spectacular from start to finish, it is the best film ever made in my mind. Everything about it is beautiful, perfectly wacky, perfectly executed, and the story is incredible. No film can be compared with this one, as they are all vastly inferior to this masterpiece. The acting was all phenomenal. The audio is so good it is inexplicable. If you haven't seen it yet, do not watch a trailer, just hit play and enjoy the awesomeness.

This film is crafted done production wise to the T - I imagine the directors would be A class advertising and music video directors. But come on, the story here is so underwhelming. Mostly just action scenes and cool FX. I was very bored and felt no emotional connection whatsoever. The acting is phenomenal although.If you're expecting some sort of breakthrough you're not going to get it. The trailer says enough: the universe is a big place so nothing matters. Just do you.

reviews.review_title: In another life, I would have loved doing laundry and taxes with you"
reviews.content: A profoundly touching take on nihilism, a roller coaster of emotions that films rarely scratch the surface of. In the end, it's all worth it.The only reason I did not give it 10/10 is I did think the sentimental bits were a bit drawn out, but it's flawless in every single other way. Absolutely incredible.It will make you feel everything everywhere all at once.

One thing for sure, it is very accurately named indeed, but Everything Everything All at Once amounted to not much as far as I am concerned.It's definitely a "love it or hate it" flick, unfortunately I leaned on the latter and couldn't keep watching beyond the first hour. The progression of the story is just too erratic and the pace too exhausting without much to keep my curiosity entertained. The quirkiness didn't grow on me at all, the humour fell flat at my feet and everything (all at once) felt rather forced.If I were generous I'd say it's a movie that wasn't made for my generation, but since I'm snobbish I'll rather assume that 15 years of formulaic Marvel franchises have severely lowered viewers' standards for this movie to receive such rave reviews.

There's little to say when a movie so absurd manages to not break the fourth wall. So. Here's some bullet points:
1. The editing is crazy good, and so is the vfx(the latter having been made by only self taught people is just crazy to me)
2. The writing is very good. After someone said something and there was some silence, i thought "how would I write the rest of this conversation" and found it incredibly hard, but when the conversation actually went on, I was always surprised
3. This movie has let me give a definition of surrealism/absurdism: "saying real things with surreal events", and I think this movie is brilliant in this aspect: it tackles emotions (and philosophy, and love) without being sugary.

reviews.review_title: You get it or you don't!
reviews.content: You get it or you don't! I think it's a marmite film, you either love it or you hate it. I'm the former, I love it; especially the rock scene.Do I understand it, not a chance.. but I think that's a good thing. Bonkers, brilliant film with no solution.

This movie is beyond amazing, like literally everything about it is just flawless. Okay, there were a few scenes that had some funky out of wack shutter speeds but that's more of a opinion rather than a sin on the film, I genuinely didn't care for those type of shots. Other than that the movie was, down to the bone, extraordinary; the overall message, the writing, the acting, AND GOOD GOD WAS THE EDITING TRULY EYE CAPTURING. The beginning was a lil wonky but once you caught on you were in for the ride for the rest of the film. FUNNY. The film was very funny, filled with an evenly amount of on-the-edge-of your-seat tense moments, and a heavy, impactful ending that can make even the most toughest minds to crack and shed a tear.

This movie captures all the pain and angst and joy and absurdity of life all at once. I'm not even sure the writers meant it to be such an existential experience but it was for me. They break our lives down into the relationship within this one family but it's goes so far beyond the obvious need to heal relationships and let go of unfulfilled expectations that get in the way of loving one another. The movie speaks to our current pain. Our hopelessness. Our disconnection as we fight over our truths. It speaks to finding hope in the absurdity of our individual lives. Meaning in the meaningless. And of living life within the paradox of death. Were you listening? Or do you need to watch it again?

reviews.review_title: Fresh take on the timeless "alternate universe" theme
reviews.content: This movie is a journey that takes us through the life of Evelyn, an overburdened, stressed-out middle aged mother, wife, and business owner that simply can't catch a break. Soon after the start of the movie, we are transported into various alternative universes in which she resides, all of which are created by the decisions previously made in her life. Essentially, the setting in this movie is similar to a choose-your-own-adventure book.Evelyn is called upon by people in other parallel universes to defeat the villian, who is eventually identified as her own daughter. As Evelyn moves through various universes, she sees how her life might have turned out had different choices been made throughout the years and millennia. The movie is filled with irreverent humor that had some moviegoers belting out hearty guffaws! There are elements of the over-the-top type of martial arts scenes you might find in spoofs of kung fu movies. But at this movie's core, we find that it is a story about how you can choose to love the life you have and embrace it completely. As Evelyn is shown all of her different realities in the parallel universes, she still comes back to love the one she is currently living in with all of its problems and flaws.The movie drags on just a bit long. Jamie Lee Curtis's role in this movie adds to the quirkiness. The visuals are presented as a sort of dream sequence at times and they provide constant stimulation.It's definitely worth a watch and is truly a unique movie that incorporates a lot of common thematic elements.

reviews.review_title: For me it's a 20 out of 10
reviews.content: I love this movie, it almost feels like when you have a chaotic crazy dream where everything randomly happens but somehow all comes together and makes sense.I love the acting (It's excellent really), the storyline and the humour are on point and the final message behind it is beautiful!It's really a very clever way to storytell and the transition required to make the story believable are beautifully done!Excellent work, 20 out of 10 from me!

Everything Everywhere All At Once has successfully done a very rare opportunity. This film gets to call itself the best film of its genera. To me, this is by far the best multiverse film I have ever seen by a long shot. Everything Everywhere All At Once I'd A24's adult Pixar film. To me it reminded me of a pixar film but for adults. The themes and lessons learned in this film were brought perfectly to light. The comedy was always on point and hilarious. And the special effects feel like a new look over other effects. A24 has done some terrific things but this was one of there best. Overall the action, comedy, emotion, and visual and practical effects were fantastic along with all of its actors and I will love to see it again.

I was slightly annoyed or at least a bit impatient to begin with, whilst Michelle Yeoh plays a kind of frantic, slightly mad character mixing up languages and basically everything in her life, like a postmodern Duracell rabbit version of a noblewoman from a Dostoyevsky novel. But eventually you realise that what is thematically a most banal, simple plot folds out as one of the greatest cinematic achievements of the century. It is one of those rare cases where a film can give you so much that a book cannot, as the surrealism eventually grows on you to become a condensed hyperrealism that nails you to the seat for an emotional rollercoaster ride of an experience. Fantastic.

Very interesting concept, very well presented, this is something new I must admit. Some kind of psychedelic-bloody-slightly perverse atmosphere works here with some kind of forced and partial perverted comedy that is not funny at all. There is some action throughout the film, if we can call it action at all, the description says it's an adventure, but I didn't see any trace of adventure here. It's immediately obvious that this definitely is not for everyone taste. I'm bothered by the bilingualism that drags through the film, it's somehow disorienting and uninteresting. The actors did their job properly, the only thing I don't like is the portrayal and characteristics of the character played by Stephamie Shu, that role sets the film back quite a bit and makes it uninteresting in parts and boring. All in all, I partly see why the rating of the film is so high, but I think that the rating is definitely not fully justified, this is a mediocre time killer with some boring and uninteresting scenes and nothing more.

The film's incredible importance lies in its unintentional depiction of what it means to be lost and confused (both artistically and practically) in a world of destabilized values.Along the "whacky" journey, certain themes emerge: histrionic pity/compassion, tawdry humor, fragile weakness, the exhaustion of spirit, and the frightening, crippling fear of characters partaking and marginally succeeding in barely achieving the average/mediocre life. In essence, it therefore represents a narrative that dangerously projects a common ideal as if it is superior and noble.In all the commotion, tiresome tricks, and "shocking" artistic choices (rocks, shameless sexual humor, etc.) the narrative does not fail to argue for its own set of specific values (weak kindness, categorical acceptance/tolerance, passivity, etc.). These values do not reflect courage, to me, but rather the voice of an exhausted nihilism.As a whole this film desperately searches and lunges for something meaningful among the "wild" (not that wild) "multiverse" (not that multi). However, it forgoes any chance for meaning because it does not take the time and energy to create meaning itself.Instead it shuns the responsibility of meaning to the viewer: please make something of this madness for me! In my opinion that is its appeal. But, the meaning made, the final conclusion of the audience is ultimately one and the same: there is no great standard for judgement anymore.Perhaps worst of all, this film fails to realize that the inclusion of all things is precisely what it partially argues for. But, the inclusion of everything is itself the creation of meaninglessness since distinctions and judgements are necessary for making meaning. Ironically, that very meaningless it unintentionally creates is also what forces it to settle for the average as its goal.Finally, its main contradiction is the second thing the film argues for: its own exclusive ideas which I touched on above (kindness, etc.). Therefore it rejects any complete concept of "everything." For example, it has a tendency to include the loud, unpredictable, overly-sensory, etc., but excludes the subtle, graceful, patient, delicate, confident, proud, healthy, tasteful, or beautiful.In the end, despite its rowdy favoritism towards 1) over-stimulation 2) timid adventure, 3) cheap novelty, 4) the debasement/confusion of the human, and 5) alcoholic escapism, it only drifts back to common conservative values. In that it resembles an accidental advertisement for conservatism.

If your mouth wasn't open for 20 minutes straight, while you are trying to process what happened 5 minutes before the current scene, you weren't paying attention. No one has given me more fun since Bernard Black started his story trying to do his taxes.The randomness of all of this has taken the monty python to another level. If you feed a successful ai all of the british comedy tradions of absurdity and the great martial arts movies of the far east together. You will get a bad version of this movie because it won't be directed and written by these brilliant directors and scriptors. Thank you, you have brought 2 hours of straight excitement, fun and energy to my life.This truly everything everywhere all at once.

How many of us would have liked to be still at some point in our lives, amidst all the action? How many of us have wished life would slow down just a little for us to be lifeless rocks staring into a canyon?How many of us have wondered how life would have turned out if only, what if, we made that other choice, took that other job, married that other person? How many of us have wanted to shake hands with ourselves who have made those choices and see in our eyes happiness or regret?And how many of us have struggled with the bond with our mothers? A bond which is both life-giving and endlessly annoying, which can be controlling, demanding, misunderstanding, yet which we know deep down ties us to a woman who will follow us to the abyss?Everything Everywhere All At Once explores the above themes. It is also deadly funny in addition to being relatable on so many dimensions. Definitely give it a watch.

Everything Everywhere All at Once! The name of the movie is actually the most exact spoiler to itself. Haven't seen anything like this for decades. Shallow but deep, hilarious but touching, cheap but worthless!!!!!!!! Really requires some heart n sense to appreciate this gem.Haters always hate, period.

With the recent oversaturation of Marvel Movies, that I'd hardly consider art (as In no real deep telling of a story, using filmography to tell said story etc.) I think this is a good sign for a return to the idea that Films are in-fact an Artform.I haven't laughed and cried as much over this movie than I have over any other one.I went into this thinking it was some goofy action/comedy and the first 2/3 of the movie are mostly that, but the last 40 minutes or so, I was constantly in tears.I wish I could honestly experience this movie all over again, with no prior knowledge of the story and what happens near the end, I'd say its one of the most sweetest and "emotionally realistic" endings I've ever seen to a film.

reviews.review_title: This made me feel everything everywhere all at once
reviews.content: I laughed, I cried and I had an existential crisis. And now I am so very happy. This film enriched my life and I was incredibly insanely well done.Whoever is debating watching, I highly recommend, don't hesitate for a moment longer!

reviews.review_title: Beautiful Exploration of Humanity and Reality
reviews.content: This film takes risks and they truly pay off in the best way. With breathtaking visuals, performances, and ideas this film will make you laugh, cry, and wonder what you have been doing with your life. Give it a watch with the people closest to you and get a rare opportunity to get to know them better.

reviews.review_title: I made an account just for this movie
reviews.content: Incredible movie. A better multiverse movie than Marvel could ever dream of making. Thrilling, philosophical, and yet touching; never have I seen so many people in the theatres consistently emotional in the middle of a movie. It's a hidden gem for sure.

The story of this movie explores the nature of self and being through the story of one family, and the multiple lives they lead in the infinite multiverse, ultimately helping our hero find joy in her (meaningful/meaningless?) existence. I'm not a huge fan of the multiverse in film, but this movie brings entirely new elements to the table, and the set of rules introduced to jumping from one universe to the next keeps everyone on their toes. The value of the serious and silly is evident here and balanced in a way that is rarely done well. The filmmakers took on so much, and pulled it off so well.

I watched about half this movie before I gave up. It's garbage. It's stupid. It's so American stupid, it screams American stupidity at every corner. I don't know where to start. The constant switching between Mandarin and Cantonese is so confusing to people who understand one but not the other language, like myself. The story makes absolutely no sense at all. It's a collection of offensive scenes designed to shock and confuse the simple minded; it's amateurish nonsense at the worst high school level you can think of. It's shameful to subject anyone to watch this nonsense. It has no bearing on anything that matters, it's a waste of time and a waste of money. And, I am fluent in Chinese so I can only say that I thought the Mandarin dialogues were understandable but did not add anything to the story. This is not about Asian American anything. It's dumb.

It's wacky, unique and a fun movie to watch that ventures into some of the bigger questions in life. It uses itself as a joke to promote a way of thinking in life that we don't often achieve.One of the most unique, profound films I've ever watched, a true leap of faith by the creators with superb acting.

Tldr; Everything Everywhere All at Once is basically a Matrix Multiverse Comedy. The humor can be a deal breaker.The amount of creativity this film is oozing with is amazing and it even has some great touching moments near the end relating to "the everything bagel."But the deal breaker won't be the main villain's and main protagonist's acting (because they nailed it) or the well done cinematography. The deal breaker for most people, who decide this is a terrible, average, or GOAT film is the Comedy!If you don't find yourself laughing at the constant humor throughout the film. Trust me, stop watching it, because it won't get better for you. You would be better off watching Matrix. Which is just as action packed and mind bending, just without the humor.Other than that, as previously stated, everything else about it is perfect.

It's films like this that keeps my faith in the movie industry. This film won't be for everyone. May be too much going on and too many sudden changes but it's a journey and an ultimate journey with an amazing cast of actors. An element of over the topness to the average eye but deeply satisfying and invigorating to the seasoned movie connoisseur. It's a non stop mind tickler that keeps you gripped to the screen.I wonder if Michelle and James had chats about the early Carpenter days...Movies like this should be on the Oscar list along with All quiet on the western front and Licorice pizza. Easily the best flicks this year.

Once every 10 years I see a film and wish I hadn't bothered. I am afraid this is one of them. It was styled as a comedy, bonkers it might have been but funny no. Maybe the comedy worked at a different level to me, and everyone else in the auditorium but no one was laughing. 20 minutes in, I was trying to see where the film was going, 20 minutes later , i gave up and went home. Did I like anything about it, nope. Give it a miss.

I rarely write reviews but this movie is so dope! Its what weve needed during these times of negativity and crap. This movie has Everything, everywhere and All At Once! Storyline, visuals and it makes a very valid and Incredible point! Its a breath of fresh air. 100% Loved it and glad i paid a dub for it.

Looking at the other reviews, I have to wonder: did we watch the same movie? Or some people are paid to talk sense in something that has none?I haven't seen such a bad movie since Predestination. And that was f-ed up pretty nicely, indeed.I want my time back!
It's funny, it's got amazing acting and it explires the core concept in every way it could think of.My god I had no idea I could cry for so long in a movie theatre.

Wow! Hands down, the best movie I've ever seen in my life. It's not like anything else you've ever seen, nor what you expect from the trailers. It's incredible how the Daniels have managed to capture the messy yet beautiful experience of being a human into this 2 hour masterpiece. Do yourself a favor and watch this if you haven't already. Then watch it again so you can understand how tightly written and acted this film truly is. Seriously, movies like this is why movies and theaters will never go out of business. You need a big screen and a live audience to truly appreciate the bonding experience of artistic accomplishment.

reviews.review_title: I cant stop thinking about this movie
reviews.content: I cannot begin to describe how excellent this movie was, I have never wanted to purchase a physical copy of a movie before but when it comes out I will be buying one.

I was drawn into the story at soon as the movie start. It does take you on a crazy ride but the message is simply the love between a mother and her daughter and it seems to be a metaphor to represent it.The cinematography was very well done as well as the acting.I saw it in a regular cinema and was very bothered by the switch of aspect ration from 1.35 to 2.39.It's like watching a trailer for almost two hours.Similar to what Christopher Nolan did with the dark night.

Film makers tried too hard with this one. The plot was random and made no sense, the entire multiverse but was loosely connected. A valiant yet pathetic attempt to do a drama movie differentely.After looking at all the good reviews, i feel that it's cool nowdays to appreciate anything offbeat and absurd. The plot is so silly and unreal that it makes Marvel movies look realistic and possible.Michelle Yeoh was good, apart from her acting it was a pain to watch the entire thing. Rest of the casting was poor, screenplay was chaotic, don't watch this one unless it's a matter of life and death. ..

reviews.review_title: Looked cool but I just didn't care
reviews.content: Had I known it's the same dudes who did another 'critically acclaimed' and 'highly original' film, namely the utter shower of 's' that was Swiss Army Man.... I'd have just swerved this one.Everything started out quite well and I was patiently waiting for the jumping to show it's purpose to the plot, so I could ultimately give a damn about what was going on. Sadly this didn't happen.When the reason was ultimately revealed I was underwhelmed, and checked out.The ending is sappy nonsense.It's a mess and I just didn't care what happened to any of the characters.4 out of 10 for some cool visuals.

This is one of the worst movies I have watched and I sat through "Doolittle".I got a free advance screening to this and I still feel like I've been robbed.Honestly just avoid at all cost, during the screening we watched 4 people walk out and my only regret is not following them.

Only just streamed this last night after missing it at the movies.Man, what a rollercoaster ride!There isn't a whole lot it doesn't have: there's tonnes of action, drama, & comedy, all expertly blended together with fast-paced editing & mind altering visuals. So, so random but so very good as well. What a triumph!There's so much going on in this movie that I'll have to re-watch it a few times to really appreciate all of the small details that were lovingly & painstakingly put into this.I read somewhere that the movie was shot in just over a month, too, which is mind blowing in itself, given all the different sets, costume changes, re-shoots of same/similar sequences in completely different settings, etc...The acting all around is great & the action is, likewise, amazing. Such a fun, seemingly chaotic but actually well thought-out storyline, but the editing really brings it all together. I'm glad the directors had a clear vision of what they were doing as I reckon the actors would have been pretty confused most of the way through it & probably only pretended they understood how it would all pan out, until all the madness was finally stitched together for the theatrical release.Great movie. Go & see it.

2hrs36mins in the cinema, wasting my life at a film I can say is the only one that did less for me than Tenet. I didn't follow it, stopped wanting to and kept nodding off. This was the 're-released' version which basically had the additions of the Daniels' introduction where they came across as two spoiled students trying to be funny and 8 minutes of very boring and unfunny outtakes following the credits. It seems like these are two trusted filmmakers who have had money thrown at them and been allowed to indulge some drunken student fantasies. Definitely not for me.

I cant believe that this film was nominated for 11 oscars including Best Film. It's a mess. It's not a comedy nor scify nor action nor kunfu... it confused me and i was thinking to go out and finish my torture. It reminds me another really bad film: The avengers of Sean Connery but in thar case the critics were honest an was very low rated. I recommend you dont watch it if you usually like common films. Im expected wating the awards: i cant believe if it is going to win any Oscar, the members of the Academy should be sincere and forget this film forever or something has washed their brains. Ugg.

Seriously one of the strangest movies that I've ever watched and yet it had me in tears by the end of the second act where the meaning of the entire movie is revealed. This movie is like if you took the Matrix, Secret Life of Walter Mitty, and Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon and mixed them all together to create a quirky thought-provoking film that has you cheering for Michelle Yeoh (CTHD) and Ke Huy Quan (of Goonies fame) if each of the multiverses in which they exist. Is it for everyone...probably not. Could have easily seen Awkwafina in Stephanie Hay's role but the latter did a great job as the daughter. But, I won't be surprised to see Yeoh, Quan and Jamie Lee Curtis (in a role so far removed that she is largely unrecognizable) receive Oscar nominations come awards time. Suspend your disbelief before watching and then sit back and enjoy the ride.

reviews.review_title: A Wild Ride That Is Sure To Entertain Everyone
reviews.content: Everything Everywhere All At Once is an absurd adventure, which somehow teeters on the line between Asian arthouse, and accessible adventure film. Daniels manage to coordinate action, suspense, and comedy in such a way that flows flawlessly, and allows each element to compliment one another. Every decision made is purposeful, and every technical element is strong. Michelle Yeoh puts up what is perhaps her best performance to date, and is supported by a slew of spectacular co-stars, such as Ke Hua Quan and, Jamie Lee Curtis. This is a film best analyzed after a second watch due to its relentless action, and chaotic atmosphere. The set design, hair and makeup, visual effects, and cinematography will undoubtedly warrant this film consideration come Oscar season. Everything Everywhere All At Once is a film that will be enjoyed by everyone, as it's artistic elements are sure to intrigue any cinephile or film student, and it's accessibility is sure to entertain any average movie goer. Daniels have proven their range, and genuine talent with this film, and have managed to make something unforgettable on what is only their sophomore effort as a duo.

Telling a coherent story and building emotional connections with the audience are at the bottom of the list for this twisted raunchy trek through what is essentially one long stylized action scene. Combining themes from horror genres and low-brow humour, this is one film that attempts to mash a Christmas carol with nihilism and sex toys.The writing is deliberately bizarre, with a story that is too convoluted for most, but don't mistake this for a deep philosophical film, nay, to the contrary, it has a social agenda (It's hard to find a film that doesn't these days). If you find plot devices like people having to do statistically improbable things like inserting a butt plug in the middle of a fight scene, or beating someone with a pair of oversized artificial genitalia funny, then by all means you may find this entertaining. If however you find such things deeply offensive, or pretentious, then this is one film probably left alone.
This movie is a trip and I'm pretty sure I'm wiser for it.I think I feel better about life after watching this.Please give it a chance. You will not regret it.

Stale plot with action-packed visual give rise to a movie that aims to simulate the audience. The goals of the writers is to explore the unimaginable... resulting in weird things and ideas.There are aspects of Asian-American lifestyle that I experience myself. The characters also act in a very raw manner. Blurting out words and phrases in Chinese for example. I thought the beginning of the movie showcases the Asian-American lifestyle.But, the film does downhill from there. The pacing increases, visuals pop-up, and the film ends with some open-ended idea.Who knows that you are supposed to learn from this?

Evelyn (Michelle Yeoh) leads a hard, somewhat complicated life with her argumentative daughter, Joy, with whom she does not gel, a disappointed and demanding father who she still seeks to impress and a crumbling marriage to Waymond, Ke Huy Quan. She is also in trouble with the IRS regarding her laundromat in the shape of IRS auditor Jamie Lee Curtis.Suddenly a version of Waymond from the Alphaverse tells her that Jobu Tupaki is out to destroy her and the universe, so she must draw on her skills and powers from the many other Evelyns across the alphaverse to defeat her.It would be meaningless to try to explain or indeed do justice to the many elements of this bizarre plot. Often very funny, sometimes quite sad, it for the most part travels at incredible speed, featuring endless amazing and bewildering images that feed, ultimately, what this is about - there's no place like home. In watching this highly regarded, popular and soon to be ultimate cult film, it is perhaps understandable why some will find this a pretentious mess, but for those that do like a film on the edge that you are unlikely to completely take in on your first viewing - you do need to concentrate - it's best just to sit back and let it wash all over you and enjoy. There are no films like this - I did briefly feel it might be a very distant cousin of 'Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy' but it is definitely its own beast and incredible to think it came out of America.

Movie seems like someone's drunken acid trip. Couldn't focus after halfway through. Starts off being weird and tolerable but by halfway you've had enough. Reviews are misleading. Gets slightly better at end.

The most unusual movie I have seen, I think. Yes, it is long, but so worth taking it through to the end. Visually it is spectacular, the story is constantly in motion, the special effects amazing. A difficult movie to explain, an element of science fiction, but ultimately a movie about the human heart. If there is a flaw,it is that it is really very, very long, like all modern movies the makers don't seem to understand that sometimes less is more, we actually paused an hour and a half in, and went back to watch the last hour a few weeks later, not sure I could have watched it at the cinema. But ultimately a really worthwhile movie.

The story is talk about the relationship fixtion between the mom and Family member. In hollywood directors usually didn't to direct such movies Which talk about the chinese cultures and families opinion. So a lot of people didn't know about the feeling in the movie. But this movie is different. Actually i can see this movie is fantastic. Because this movie can talk clearly about the real chinese mind. They think the family is a priority thing.In the movies the mom always care about their daughter's feeling and try to help him although sometimes the way is not good enough but the heart is the genuine. That is a true portrait as a Chinese mom.So if you want to fix the relationship between you and your family member. I will recommend this movie.
I haven't watched a movie this good in a long time. It's a trippy, action packed, mind blowing, and heartwarming adventure that will leave you stunned. I can't wait to rewatch.

It turned out to be one of the most trippy movies that I've watched in recent times. Interesting that it came out of A24, that's usually known for indie-movies.The trailer made it seem like it's a sci-fi "Shang Chi meets Dr. Strange & Wanda" kinda movie but nooo, faaar from it.I'll admit that I had to do some reading/research after to movie to make complete sense of the the plot, people's interpretation and hidden meanings, but without all that, you can say that it's a movie a...family portrait (?) told in the context of a sci-fi multiverse in the form of an action-comedy-drama about self-reflection & healing.That kept aside, the acting by everyone was really good. Michelle Yeoh finally gets a chance to do something in addition to just action and she delivered; comedy, drama, sadness, everything! So does Ke Huy Quan, but the standout IMO was Stephanie Hsu, the daughter. *slow claps*The cinematography, editing and sound design deserve special mentions.I still have more reading to do about this lol but if you want to watch something totally out there and yet entertaining & moving, don't miss this one. Watch it in the theater to experience the trippy journey that this movie will take you on.

I think it's a Perfect Multiverse Storyline. Beter then other movies. The explanation was very well i think the written was excellent. The movie plot was very very well and the way of writing was too good. The way handle the story of screen play it was brilliant so the movie was totally too good. You have see the movie in at-last one time in a lifetime.

reviews.review_title: This is a wuxia film in disguise
reviews.content: I started watching this thinking this was going to be one of those melancholy nonsensical "arthouse" science fiction dramas. Boy was I wrong. This is a wuxia film in disguise (if you don't know what wuxia is: think Jackie Chan).It's action-packed, hilarious, and insanely absurd. Genuinely funny. Like one moment I'm laughing at something, and then it becomes even more ridiculous, and then EVEN MORE RIDICULOUS. Like fever-dream ridiculous.It also reminds me of Scott Pilgrim vs The World. Same campiness of the humor and similarly action-packed.Underneath it all is also a story about generational divides in immigrant families. Filial piety. Acceptance. Marriage. With the central themese being nihilism and the "what ifs" that we all think about.

reviews.review_title: Incredible. 1 of the BEST MOVIES I'VE EVER SEEN.
reviews.content: I just finished this. I knew nothing about it going in. That was perfect because I had no idea what to expect. I don't want to give away anything about the plot but let's just say, every actor is incredible in this. Every character is written exceptionally well but these actors in the movie and their chemistry together bring the excellent script to life. Clearly it's directed brilliantly. I've never seen anything like it. This movie is brilliant. It made me feeeeeeeel. Deeply. Everything about it is perfect imho. I wouldn't change a thing! Masterpiece! I hope they win everything.Why are my reviews always too short? I feel like I've seen shorter reviews on here but they always tell me I need more cha.

It seemed like this movie was written whilst the writer(s) were on drugs. Cheesy sets, incoherent dialog switching back and forth between (I guess) Mandarin and English. Only second movie in my life I walked out on.. wasted 10$

reviews.review_title: All At Once Everything Everywhere Was Original But A Lacking Let Down In Its Visual Flow!
reviews.content: Hollywood has drifted into another phase of repetitive story plot films, the "Multiverse" era. In the superhero fantasy world it works tremendously (and may do so in non fantasy films of the future) but, it failed totally in this films story. I love Michelle Yeoh as an actress - I have followed and watched her screen career for many years - and it made for the only reason I watched this; having read the film synopsis in the press outputs, I was not impressed and would have given it a miss but for her being in it.The trouble with the film is that we are given no reason whatsoever (neither at the start and right to the finish line) as to why everything was happening and, the causes that led up to it. It just jumps straight into a 3 parts cacophony of riotous confusion. The comedy throughout was very few and far between, though a couple of scenes gave rise to a big smile from me, and therefore, I can only assume that all the reviewers are very easily amused by scenes that were meant to be comical but just lacked that sincerity and timing. With the complexed plot it was attempting to draw the viewer in with it should have had a far better explanation.I was also very disappointed to see Michelle Yeoh in a film with the "F" word in it (she never does that kind of film work as far as I am aware) and, to be honest there was no real reason to use it here; something like, "Oh crap!" would have sufficed instead!I, if asked by my circle of friends, would only tell them to not expect anything hilariously funny, logical or reasonably enjoyable and, to forget about any forewarning insight into the unfolding plot. Its a very well presented digital visual of technical excellence (the reason why I have given it a 5 star) but, its a dull 2hr:12mins and the worst film I have ever seen Michelle (Yeoh) act in.

reviews.review_title: 2 hours of Martial Arts in the Multiverse; Brilliant Last 20 Minutes & Michelle Yeoh
reviews.content: You have to get through the first 2 hours of Martial Arts in the Multiverse to get to the last brilliant 20 minutes of Everything Everywhere All At Once. But in the end, it all makes sense and ties things together. Fun seeing Jamie Lee Curtis in the role of the IRS Agent. I had no trouble in 1 viewing of the film understanding its general concept of family and the conflict that often exists between Mothers and Daughters. Might require a 2nd viewing to figure out some things I may have missed in the movie's first 2 hours. Michelle Yeoh as the Matriarch is outstanding, she carries the full intensity of the film with Oscar-caliber accomplishment.

reviews.review_title: What an incredible mess!! (in a brilliant way)
reviews.content: Oh my gosh.. what did I just watch? Absolutely genius! An absolute rollercoaster of sight, sound and emotions..This could be the best movie Michelle Yeoh has done. All the other actors were equally awesome!Brilliant.. just brilliant..

reviews.review_title: I liked it. However this movie has some nasty issue with pacing.
reviews.content:
This movie is quite wild. And, overall, it's only flaw is the kind of pacing that tires watchers out.It's something more or less like this:
20 minutes of slow
20 minutes of non-stop action
30 minutes of action with small breaks
30 minutes of mostly nothing with some action breaksAction is great, but when the movie slows to "lets talk" part.. it gets tiresome, because it either doesn't end or the topic is eye-rolling'ly lame.The final message is strong, but because of the pacing i felt simply tired to really care and think about it. So i just accepted it as is, while rushing out of cinema.Humor is mostly good, there were some scenes i openly laughed. For all the runtime my focus never waned, so that's good.Should you watch it: If you like Rick and Morty, this show will most likely feel familiar and fun. If you like "weird" movies, then this one should also be fun experience.

This is the story of a woman who faces a person who looks like his husband but from an alternate universe. The man from another universe mentions that there is someone who plans to destroy all universes. The story is very innovative. Director did a really good job in this movie. The acting crew is amazing. Ke Huy Quan, Michelle Yeoh, and Stephanie Hsu are wonderful in this movie. The special effects were very nice. The fighting scenes are nice and full of Kung Fu. I recommend watching this movie to comedy and adventure fans.

reviews.review_title: An iconic and incredibly unique film.
reviews.content: Everything Everywhere All At Once (2022) follows a woman struggling with day to day life, who soon finds that the fate of her universe, and all of the multiverses, are in her hands. I enjoyed this film a lot! It was so much fun and had a lot of emotional weight to it, I'm glad it's getting the attention it deserves.The cinematography for this film was truly brilliant, and I can't even pick some shots that stuck out simply because ALL of them did! It's so visually pleasing and really pops, definitely worth seeing in cinemas for the visuals alone. I really used the advantage of having different cinematography for each universe very well.A big stand out for me were the characters and their actors. The film is packed full of character development that is well written, and realistic relationships between them. Ke Huy Quan absolutely stole the show as Waymond, his character was so pure of heart and it was IMPOSSIBLE to dislike him.The humour is very slapstick and silly, which works most of the time! However, some of the jokes got a bit repetitive for me. I understand how people may like this though so I just think that's my preference!The score was amazing too, and so energetic! I loved listening to it, it added so much chaotic energy to the action sequences and really helped to keep my interest constantly. It's used very tastefully too, with more slow tracks used in mellow scenes.Lastly, the pacing is good and is king enough to flesh out the story and plot properly! I liked how it was split up into sections that explain the title, and it was very clear in it's storytelling. It dragged a little bit, but I wouldn't say it's much of an issue at all.

reviews.review_title: Best multiverse experience in any timeline
reviews.content: If you love your multiverse travelling tales then this is for you. If not, this is still for you. With the conedy, the family, and the scifi, there is something for everyone and for me it's just all fits together.Thr cast is a delight. The Special and Visual Effects are amazing. The plot is on piint. Without going into more detail a d spoiling anything, let's say you have to watch this movie. If not you, at least an alternate version of you.

reviews.review_title: Escapism--a sci-fi/action packed version of Pan's Labyrinth
reviews.content: Of course my opinion doesn't matter. They've swept the awards season just like Squid Games did last year, and Parasite did the year or so before, and Crazy Rich Asians did the year before. (Noticing a trend are we?)Scratch that. Who cares if they won awards! My opinion DOES matter!Now I am reviewing this as I watch. Currently, the film gets 10 out of 10 because I think I understand exactly what it's saying. So far, 30 minutes in, I think we are looking at this film from the main character Evelyn's perspective. She is a detached daydreamer.
