She has an intense inner world, she has wishes that her family members were saviors and adored leaders, when it reality they are the banes of her existence or vice versa. In the other dimensions or "verses", her daughter's alternate versions existing in every other dimension has killed every version of Evelyn, and the final one is the version we see, a worn down Chinese-American immigrant and mom and pending divorcee with insurmountable debts and a laundromat that is about to be foreclosed (or something like that). I will change my rating as the film goes on if necessary, if it gets too messy and makes this more complicated than what I think it is.I also give the movie 10 stars for its perfect coloring, thus far. One thing that annoys me is when a movie has saturation and a color palette that doesn't match the energy or plot or characters (for instance, if a movie is about--I don't know--teenagers running away and encountering dangers in a big city while on acid trips, I'd expect a very colorful and heavily saturated movie with sudden cuts and zapping imagery etc. The movie would be boring if it were in black and white). However the colors here were great. It made the film look literally "cool" with its cool saturation yet not boring due to a colorful wardrobe from bold yellows to vivid patterns to earth tones to pastels in one frame.This movie is very intelligent, but its fraught with pretentious sci-fi jargon like "alpha, omniverse, cosmic, variations, matter" and other scientific mumbo jumbo and philosophies. I can imagine that its default target audiences (sci-fi fans--and Asian Americans being stereotyped as the nerdy high achieving model minority) totally understand it all, and so the film was unapologetically stuffed with the same information and vocabulary that had everyone else running screaming out of every science and math class in our past, while the target audience and it's bystanding social justice warriors rave to everyone else head scratching. And out of that, the film created this concept of "verse jumping to another version of yourself." But all of that is neither here nor there and very unnecessary and an overly complicated way of showing us someone who daydreams all day, maybe driven a little mad by the sudden realization of what her life is. Right in the elevator, right before she heads to the IRS office to learn her fate, her life flashes before her eyes. It's a moment of providence. She wonders and can suddenly see--how she ended up in mountains of debt in the USA. But the movie shows it, instead, as illusory "verse jumping." It's not. The visuals make it seem as if this is another superhero movie with divinely intervening alter egos that are whipped out right when they need to be. But I think this is satirical. The film takes place at the IRS office, a place where I'm sure anyone who winds up there wishes they could teleport away, of course, or inconsequentially beat up the facility staff and security, and disappear in time during the manhunt, and have their rebellious, wayward and maybe even broke or criminal relatives who you normally are ashamed of just swoop in and suddenly save the day and make you proud finally. Or, during an uncomfortably difficult discussion where the truth hurts too much, and you never have a reason to escape without looking crazy or making that person angry, but then suddenly you can "verse jump" or teleport away and proceed in another life as a better or just different you. Something you can only daydream about. I don't need the silly sci-fi storyline. Maybe other people than just Michelle Yeoh's character are also "verse jumping", creating the film's universe, a "multiverse" of everyone's daydreams/alternate versions interrupting or intercepting.The movie decided to explain these feelings scientifically with action packed visuals and heavy synth action music and FX, rather than tell the same story spiritually or philosophically with whim and fantasy and atmospheric, natural orchestras--such as what Pan's Labyrinth did in a far less confusing and complicated way. It, too, in a more noble way told the story of someone who juxtaposed daydreams with reality during moments of fear or helplessness.While people are wowed by the graphics and the adrenaline rushing pace, they don't seem to take any food for thought. Of course I'm still only 30 minutes in, but I can tell already what's going on. Her daughter is a professional verse jumper, and thus a force to be reckoned with in every world, in every dimension, in every universe. Whereas in the universe we all know about, her daughter is an insecure, grungy, depressed, inarticulate outcast. The fact that her daughter is an unstoppable verse jumper means two things: that her daughter must be so depressed that she daydreams A LOT, and/or that her mother is so ashamed and unhappy with her daughter's outcome, that she daydreams up a better daughter.There was one moment where the film crew must have either been either so aware/worried that the film is in fact confusing regardless of your level of intelligence that they figured we'd need an analogy of omniverse jumping to toppings on an everything-bagel... and while the following moments were weird, I think they needed to be, to depict just how bizarre our daydreams and dreams can be. At least I hope that's what they were going for, and not that they actually took that moment seriously and thought it would be "deep." Because I'm currently unsure, I bring it down to 8 stars.Ok. My interest level has diminished. Ironically, the zane and absurdities can't keep my attention. The moment they got hot dogs for fingers and some of the guys had to sodomize themselves with random office objects in order to "verse jump" is when I've decided to put the viewing on pause for another day. I will now submit this post and verse jump to another movie.Side thought: I was just going to comment that her husband Waymond sounds just like the kid from The Goonies. I looked it up, and it's the kid from The Goonies lol all grown up. How cute.

There wasn't a single thing that made sense at any point, which I understand was the movie's intention, but then its impossible to have any sort of plot. The whole movie is so contrived and stupid it becomes frustrating to watch after 45 minutes. No character has any meaningful motivation, in part because it's impossible to determine which character is which as they become alternate universe versions of themselves, and therefore the movie itself gets lost in who's who. Dozens of attempts at jokes but unfortunately none of them were actually funny. Do not watch this, the reason for the high average score is a complete mystery to me.

reviews.review_title: What the hell did I just watch!!!
reviews.content: O-M-G!Really, what the hell did I watch for 2 hours?? Total mess and complete waste of time with enormous confusion on my face whole time! Really, what was the message of the movie that dictates us? Tax law? Family? Love? Parallel universes and weird characters? Costco hot dogs? Not really sure if the director was trying to point out something else but I am still lost.

reviews.review_title: After the Hype-Just as Good as Everyone's Saying
reviews.content: After hearing the immense amount of hype for this film since March, I wasn't sure if it would be as good as many people were saying. Now, the hype has died down, and I finally got the chance to watch it.And from what I've say, it absolutely lived up to the hype. My only few problems were that it became a bit too wacky at points, and I thought the misunderstanding between Evelyn and Waymond about the divorce papers were a bit contrived. But besides that, this film is an absolute spectacle.The Daniels did a phenomenal job directing the film. So many scenes and shots throughout the film are shot with attention to detail, with so much personality throughout it. The editing is the best I've seen this year. The visual effects are great, especially for a $25m budget. It also manages to utilize a minimum number of sets, and still manage to utilize those sets to their potential.The movie is also immensely clever, both intellectually and emotionally. The writing for the multiverse was very well done, introducing many concepts and ideas, such as the verse-jumping, flawlessly. And I adore the many messages of the movie. My interpretation of the theme was how even if life does seem worthless, and doesn't make any sense, the one thing that we can find sense in is the people close to us, and embracing each other.Overall, my few gripes with the film hold it back from a perfect 10, but it is an amazing film, with fantastic directing from the Daniels, a profound message, and while I didn't mention it, Michelle Yeoh, Key Huy Quan, and Jamie Lee Curtis are all able to deliver subtle nuances in their performances, and I feel like all of them at least deserves a nomination.

reviews.review_title: Future Nostalgia in a Chaotic Universe
reviews.content: I remember coming into the cinema with high expectations. I had avoided the trailers like the plague for a blank canvas experience. And it just blew me away.The editing and storytelling in this movie is incredible! The story is chaotic but fast paced and has just enough of a red thread to keep you hooked.The chaotic energy feels like a longform improv theatre show where you never know what to expect and random ideas keep making this universe you've been invited to more and more layered.The use of VFX feels fresh and creative. Watch the interviews with the Daniels - hearing them explain the VFX creation added another round of enjoyment and reminds me of a time when VFX were a more creative exercise than just overlaying CGI.The performances are great! It is so lovely to see Michelle Yeoh brought to the spotlight she has always deserved.Everyone in our group of friends was feeling inspired after the film, even though we all focused a slightly different aspects of it. Wonderful cinematic experience!

Started well but finished as an acid trip! Common we need movie not just a reminder that we live in a reality that everyone is high and hallucinogenic !Wake up people, these kind of films just put you in a comatose state of mind , so you can 't really understand that at the end of all this mess you have to deal with all the consequences of all of these BS!May be look fun , but doesn't end well!))temporarily relieve yourself from the burdens of your everyday live, but when you really need to.

reviews.review_title: Astonishing!! This is not just a movie, it is a cinematic experience!
reviews.content: Oh, wow, where do I even begin with this movie? When have I ever seen a movie where every single scene surprised me, and almost every scene had some sort of shock factor. 'Everything Everywhere All at Once' is not just a movie; it is a cinematic experience!Evelyn (Michelle Yeoh) owns a Laundromat. She lives with her husband, Waymond (Ke Huy Qua) (who wants to divorce her), her Father, Gong Gong (James Hong) (who is very sick), and her daughter, Joy (Stephanie Hsu) (who is in a lesbian relationship). On her way to tax inspector Deirdre (Jamie Lee Curtis - like you've never seen her before!), Evelyn's life is about to change. In the blink of an eye, her normal existence spins out of control and she finds herself in an alternate universe, being called upon to save the multiverse.If you thought 'The Matrix' was complex and confusing, just wait until you see 'Everything Everywhere All at Once'. The difference with 'Everything...' lies in its presentation. This film is so incredibly unpredictable and every scene is absolutely magnificent! The stunt choreography is jaw-dropping. The visuals are mind-blowing. The costumes are amazing. The editing is inane!!! Editing this film to obtain the desired effect must have been an absolute nightmare. But it looks STUNNING on screen.As Evelyn jumps through the multiverse - referred to as Verse Jump - she encounters characters out to eliminate her, and in the process she must protect those she loves. The fact she can't trust anyone - not even her own family - makes her task a daunting one, to say the least. The film's antagonist is Jobu Tupaki (who is Joy in another universe), who could destroy the entire multiverse with a black hole she created.There honestly was not a single dull moment here. This film surprised me every step of the way. Never before have I seen a film with so much going on - non-stop - and entertained me every single second. There's some really funny humour here, and then also a dose of slapstick. But the presentation was so astonishing that the slapstick didn't bother me as it generally would. The funniest thing by far, was the fight scene with huge dildos, and the butt plugs!!!! Absolutely hilarious!! The 'talking rocks' scene was just as funny, but also thought-provoking.I'll admit, I didn't understand everything here, but hell, from an entertainment perspective, I was so entertained that it didn't matter. I will no doubt be watching this again several times, and I'm sure it will make more sense with every repeat viewing. I was completely and utterly enthralled by 'Everything Everywhere All at Once'; I was glued to the screen for its entire running time.

reviews.review_title: This generation's next visual spectacle, and that's not even the best part
reviews.content: There are times when a film can be so unabashedly creative and original that it can be hard to collect your thoughts or even pigeon-hole it into a genre. Sometimes, perhaps with films such as "Swiss Army Man" (2016) or "The Lobster" (2015), the creative overflow can convolute the tone and diminish the overall impact of the storytelling. However, when filmmakers can strike the perfect balance and deliver something that is a visual spectacle, gut-wrenchingly hilarious, and emotionally impactful, it can be true movie magic. "Everything Everywhere All At Once" is of the latter and it is one of the best films that I have seen in years.Michelle Yeoh stars as Evelyn Wang who, in a day where her family's laundromat is being audited by the IRS, is sucked into the multiverse where she must work with other versions of herself to save the world. Multiverse narratives seem to be the new hot writing trend in Hollywood and can been seen everywhere from superhero flicks to sci-fi dramas. I think that it will be a real challenge to find one more masterfully created than "Everything Everywhere All at Once".The film was written and directed by The Daniels and if sci-fi, comedy, drama isn't the best word to describe the film then how about this: CRAZY. We are talking dildo nunchuck-wielding, Mad Max on crack level of insanity, but, they somehow make it work. The action is beautifully helmed, the editing is perfectly chaotic, and the explosion of creativity is expertly realized. I have never seen a movie like this in my life.Perhaps some of the action relied too much on slow motion and perhaps the first act was slow to start because of exposition but, honestly, the more I try and nitpick the more I realize the choices all serve the tone of the film. The real magic of "Everything Everywhere All At Once" is not the impressiveness of the Multiverse storytelling, but how it is used to serve the overall theme of the narrative. Family, marriage, maturity, parenthood - these are all themes that have countless films under their umbrella, but none of them are like this. Get out and support this film - it deserves your attention.Grade: A+

reviews.review_title: Everything Everywhere All at Once, but a good movie
reviews.content: It's been years since I have seen such a bad movie. Everything is just a nonsense with a ver infantil humor. It tried to be a philosophical film with a deep message but it just a great waste of two hours.The original idea is great but,ñ the execution is horrible: it's s not funny, it's not deep, it's just plan boring. Right know I'm written this review while the movie is still running but I could not care less about losing some of it.I give it a 2 instead a 1 because Michelle Yeoh does a great role.I wish I can see the reviews of the users which have given this movie a 8.2 so I can avoid their future recommendations.

Yep. That sums up this movie. It is definitely polarizing. It's a movie that you either really like/love or hate. There is no middle ground. I'm only giving it a 7 because there were parts that were just ridiculous. And, I, a person that appreciates ridiculous in movies found it a bit much. Not going to say where because without those ridiculous scenes the movie would a guy it be as good, or more to the point, it would make far less sense. My suggestion just watch it. Even if you hate it, there is a strong message here. Honestly, the movie has a really straight fit and simple message: nothing matters but love. Yes, it is absolutely hokey, but it works.

I felt this movie was more of an experience than just a movie, I did enjoy it especially the start but towards the end it lost me a little.It's quite hard to explain the concept, I went in knowing absolutely nothing about the movie, I hadn't even seen a trailer. The fight scenes were beyond creative and fun, the drama in the second half of the movie kind of fell a little flat for me.I would definitely recommend watching it, it's good but a lot of reviews saying it's the best movie of the year and even in years are a little much in my opinion BUT I can see why people do really like it, it's definitely refreshing to see this kind of movie in the cinemas. Have some fun with it, I did.

Enthusiastic performances by all but jeez is this hard to follow. Definitely for a young audience. It's like a zombie apocalypse movie without the zombies.Glad to see the guy from Indiana Jones doing stuff again but Jamie Lee Curtis , come on.Michelle yeoh is good and I appreciate the efort involved but after half an hour Michelle says this doesn't make any sense and I know how she feels.I wasn't sure what universe each character was in . It's pacy but unintelligible. Judging by the rating it must excite and please some people but for a 50 something it comes across as the kind of film my 9 year old would dream up . I mean what the actual frack is going on.
It's a fantasy sci-if romantic family comedy drama that would have been perfect if just a bit shorter. I'm not sure why people don't understand it; it's blatantly clear. Oh yah, stupidity.

Never have I ever seen something as stupid nor profound as this. It's like Matrix meets Bill and Ted meets something you need to be high to watch on Adult Swim. But it works. I think the pacing isn't perfect and why god why did it have to be hot dog fingers.

reviews.review_title: Is this movie great? Yes, at least in our universe!
reviews.content: "Everything Everywhere All At Once" is a fantastic movie, with a lot of strengths and without major issues. It's difficult to talk about the main plot without spoiler and avoiding to make a disservice to the film, and so I will not try do that. What I can say is that "Everything Everywhere All At Once" is very entertaining, has good jokes, some clever and inspired action scenes and other crazy ideas that are not out of place. But that's not only that. I found out some days before going to the theatre that the directors are the ones that made "Swiss Army Man", a great movie that was able to explore the sense of life in a very original way. At that point I didn't expect to find profound themes in "Everything Everywhere All At Once", but I was open to the possibility. And it was the case. Indeed the multiverse is used also to have the possibility to talk about love, family, life, choices and so on. Some moments were truly impactful and moving. In order to get this final product the direction was fantastic, but the performances by the main cast were excellent. In conclusion, though it is a particular movie, I suggest it to everyone because I think it can be highly appreciated.

This is a must watch movie for everyone including old and young. It is so interesting to watch such a masterpiece created by two "evil geniuses" as quoted by Michelle Yeoh.This movie has been a multi universe kind of a gig that shows us about family, love and kindness. All the characters are just so amazing to watch and as well they brought their best acting.It is one of a kind movie which I think comes out like every 10 years or so. So please if you can go watch it, it is worth it and again, two thumbs up for the actors and directors and producers and everybody who took part to create this amazing and fantastic movie.

reviews.review_title: An interesting and artistic take on mental health.
reviews.content: Jackie Chan?! I thought that more than a few times.The concept of the different worlds colliding is interesting. The movie can feel slow at times and the story a bit convoluted. Everything is pretty random and most things won't make much sense. It's okay, it's meant to be fun and lighthearted.The main thing to take is the message. The rest is just a fun play and visual artistic representation of mental health. The main one being kindness and how it affects our daily lives.Overall an enjoyable movie that felt a bit long and cheesy in some areas. The acting was fun and many scenes were funny and well done.

This was one of the most ambitious films I've seen in a while it's funny is sad it's confusing, it balances it's humour with sadder tones, it has some great fight choreography and it is with no doubt everything everywhere all at once.

A very refreshing take on concepts which we are already familiar with, the secret ingredient here is that this movie is made with LOVE. This movie spreads out passion and love the film makers have for it. The screenplay had all my attention and never slipped anywhere during the whole runtime of the movie.Michelle Yeoh is a star. Action sequences are spot on. Great acting and story telling. Can't believe a team of 9 people pulled off the VFX work, it seemed so real and fresh. After the usual marvel and dc movies this is definitely a refreshing concept and beautifully created.A must watch, it won't disappoint.

As the title reads; This movie in an unique piece of thoughtful art, made with lots of love. A movie you shouldn't look too much into before watching, to experience this: in it's full potential.I'm extremely grateful to have watched this masterpiece, it will forever stick with me.Everything Everywhere All at Once.

reviews.review_title: I get it, I get it, and then I get it again and again and....
reviews.content: This movie could've been told in half the time. It is the definition of self indulgent. There are a couple lovely sequences, but this film could have been told in 35or 40 minutes and not be over two hours it is. If I was in a theatre I think I would have walked out. Although I love the actors, and the ideas I cannot recommend this film.

I'm starting to think that somehow people fake ratings, there is no way this movie is anywhere close to 8, I give it 5 stars only cuz I stopped watching it half way with my girl cuz we got bored, I don't know who finds this movie good. It's just bad, we started watching with high hopes cuz of rating, but we couldn't watch past half. Lately Asian movies are really good, specially South Korean, but this was just a mess. We love to watch deep movies, movies with strong story, character development, good conversations, this one was just cheap stupid and not funny movie! Hell, I would probably enjoy watching kids Marvel movies than this.

reviews.review_title: I was blown away by the creativity of this movie.
reviews.content: It's hard to describe this movie because it's so over the top and weird. But I really like that. It's also so interesting, colorful and creative, funny and in some moments even sad. It really makes you think.Never would have thought that a dialogue between two freaking stones could be so emotional.I Want to see the "Raccacoonie Movie" so much.
Like doing drugs without the hangover. If you've ever wondered what doing psychedelics is like, watch this. These writers deserve an Oscar. They probably have twelve in another universe.
Completely pointless. Baseless Storyline. Endless loop of confusion. You never quite know what's happening in the movie. Don't quite understand why it is being given such good ratings.

I went to see the movie because of the superb ratings. I guess this is another case of paid comments and critics. This movie does not deserve its current 8.8 rating - should be around 6. It has a simple good idea but tweaks it too long and its emoltional message its thrown at the audience's throat. Honestly, whoever is giving this a 10 rating, will you ever re-watch this? I doubt so...

Truly, this movie is beautiful in every sense that it exists.From the message of the film to the editing, the comedic timing to the gut punching moments, it's a movie to remember for a lifetime. Already with two watches in, I can say that this movie really has become a new favorite.An absolute beautiful experience that's worth watching anywhere you possibly can.It is everything everywhere all at once but never does it feel too much or lost at all, it all makes sense.

reviews.review_title: This will win best picture next year
reviews.content: One of the best films I've seen. If you see a rating below a 7, the reviewer is trying to make it about themselves. It has everything one would want in a movie and will leave you feeling happy.

I love it, some actions or decisions are just like collision of Mars and Earth, same as the encounter between me and you. Nothing matters means NOTHING matters, to love is to embrace the NOTHING, embrace the chaos. Novalis said that we may never understand each other(just like the mother-daughter in this film), but we can go futher more than just understanding each other, it happens only when we are in a decisive moment, where nothing matters.By the way, the settings of the multiuniverse are better than that of Doctor Strange 2, the former makes me feel the director being high.But I dont like the ending, the reconciliation of this east asia family seems too simple for me. It gives me a feeling of just covering up the contradictions, not solving them.

This movie is really mindblowing. The scenes, the script, and the acting is top tier and on point. It's weird and crazy and scrumbled with madness, but relatable at a lot of things. I really like how they interpret little things in daily life into the movie.I also looove the clever jokes and all of the references from each scenes. This movie is really one of those movie that sticks with you for a long, long time.Moral of the story? Cherish the moment with your surroundings.

reviews.review_title: DON'T EVER BELIEVE THE OTHER SHALLOW MINDED REVIEW THAT GAVE 5 BELOWS
reviews.content: Other reviews are pretty stupid and aren't helpful at all. Their minds are just basically shallow and can't comprehend such deep thoughts and creative ways to made a movie. They pretend to be know it all types of people but in real life they aren't and just pathetic who can't just simply enjoy such beautifully made masterpiece. That's all and Thank you.

This movie moves through through everything, everywhere and all at once. It seems like an orchestra of 1000 different instruments all improvising at the same time, but somehow through an amazing script, wonderful acting and Oscar-worthy virtuoso directing makes a coherent, original piece of Art.It is a parable, it uses humorous and ridicule to comment on the most important life's aspects.A must see.

When a writer has apparently thrown every conceivable idea at a screenplay it's an incoherent mess. This film works so perfectly that by the time a small dog is being used as an assault weapon and inadvertently gets stuck in a fridge, even this dog-lover and his also dog-lover wife were howling with laughter and joy. What a deliriously inventive and fun film this is.But, of course, it's not only that - as if that wasn't enough. It's also got much to say about how we see ourselves, each other and our relationship - and manages to do so without feeling overly sentimental or heavy-handed.The performances are whole-hearted and spectacular, with inevitable special reference to Michelle Yeoh and Jamie Lee Curtis. The direction and writing are similarly superb; really there's not a department of this film that isn't working brilliantly, in sync with all the rest. It's a more warm-hearted, emotionally connected Inception; it's life-affirming and hopeful, whilst true to pain. We all need it in our lives.

In one sentence: The worst movie I've ever seen in my entire life. For about fifteen to twenty minutes it looked promising. Then, all hell broke loose. Random action and violence with no purpose whatsoever. There was no one to root for, no good, no bad, just random action with ZERO tension.

I watched the movie with my friends and some of them liked the style, but in my opinion the movie was way to frenetic, the script development was so fast that all the information given had no time to be processed by the audience.Also, the narrative started to get so boring because the history did not evolve or catch.The movie is funny but one time watching is more than enough, I would not recommend this movie.I miss a bit of history character, and more explanations of the parts connections, felt 3 movies in one without sense, made the story loose and boring!Resume: Funny and cool action, but boring and weak narrative.

reviews.review_title: Sadly I can't give this zero stars
reviews.content: I'm only writing a review to try and bring the overall rating down to something more representative of the lack of quality of the film. This started well, but after the first 40 minutes or so the jokes were flat, relied on crude humour, and it just kept stretching out every scene. With a universe of possibility at their disposal they chose to put on screen tired, and not funny options. Recommend switching off after 40 minutes and leave yourself imagining what it might have been. There is some timeline in some universe where this turned out to be a good film. Sadly in our universe we got the worst of all choices.
This film hits one with everything from everywhere all at once.You will laugh, you will cry, and mostly you wont believe your eyes.This is modal realism.

Worst movie. I tried to sit through it but it gave me a headache. Too much chaos. It would have been better if they just told the story about their lives running the laundromat without all the science fiction crap added to it. They could have switched to different scenarios a better way. I don't get all the hype. I think the actors were good for what it was but they wasted their talent on a loud obnoxious movie instead. It started out ok and then the whole virtual reality stuff just ruined it for me. Seemed like it was going to be a great storie until it wasn't. Please do not waste your time on this.

I have been a fan of Michelle Yeow ever since Wing Chun. That being said, this film was PHENOMENAL! I remember seeing the preview for it and thought "hmm, this looks interesting" then I totally forgot about the film until I saw it. If you're someone who is fascinated with the possibility of there being multiverses, this is the film for you. I don't understand all the 1 star reviews. Reading them just makes me think those people just hate any movie. Anyways, one of the scenes in the movie was just like a scene in Kung Fu Hustle and I really enjoyed that. Bravo to everyone who was involved in making this film!

A Chinese family in America is disintegrating over the stresses from a strained marriage, generational differences, and looming tax issues with their small business, all overshadowed by the spectre of unfulfilled dreams. When the boundaries keeping the multiverse apart begin to collapse, however, all possible narratives begin to not just bleed together, but collide with spectacular effect - both cinematically and narratively.This film reminded me of all the great reasons for being a cinema reviewer - not least opportunities like this, to get to see wonderful cinema before almost everyone else - and then write and publish exhortations to SEE THIS FILM!!Not just for the spectacle - which is considerable - but also for a wonderful, heart-warmingly, human story of love and misunderstanding, that will have tears in your eyes even while you are laughing in disbelief at some of the colossally humorous and wickedly painful pratfalls that populate this enigmatic sci-fi-slash-martial-arts flick.The cast were absolutely splendid and I loved absolutely all of the characters - however I will make special mention of both Stephanie Hsu, who was able to demonstrate a massive yet seamless range all within the same shot - in multiple scenes - and Jamie Lee Curtis, who brilliantly pulls off what is without doubt the strangest character portrayal of her career.This is the best film I've had the opportunity to review in quite some time and I'm very keen to see how it fares in the awards season.Bottom line: I thoroughly recommend you see this film, so you can decide for yourself whether it's worth the second viewing I know I'll be making.

reviews.review_title: A feat of cinematography and storytelling
reviews.content: Great family-centered sci-fi with cool action sequences! Should watch if you like somewhat whimsical movies with positive undertones.Also great for angsty young people who love, but struggle with, their parents.In "Everything, Everywhere, All At Once" the Daniels accomplish an achievement akin to "Cloud Atlas" and the works of Christopher Nolan. Their film dauntlessly travels where few have gone before tackling life's hard what-ifs through manifesting different versions of self across an infinite multiverse in this reality-bending opus.Michelle Yeoh's dynamic acting brilliantly captures the choice to face life's many questions with turmoil and love rather than frustration at lack of answers. Alongside Ke Hay Quan and Stephanie Hsu, the trio of lead actors provide inspiration for any family member faces growing pains.

I don't understand what the director or writer was thinking. There are 3 main people the story is based on. Each of these characters have 3 or more stories explaining their stories and they keep jumping for story to story to story. Confusing the heck out of you. And then a couple sub-characters also have stories going on. After the 1st few minutes you are so confused. If you like multiple storylines running all the same time. Then this movie is for you. Personally I like a more direct simpler storyline. Maybe the director was trying to explain everything but having over 10 storylines running at the same time. Is a bit much for me.

The Daniels have already showed their promise with Swiss Army Man years ago thanks to their fearless, weird story telling along with tackling such themes like nihilism, alienation or making peace with oneself but with Everything Everywhere All At Once they took this to a whole another level.Not just funny or weird but it's also so emotional and heartwarming at times while pushing the boundaries of creativity.I could write tons of paragraphs praising the cinematography, choreography or acting and directing in this movie but one filmmaking aspect that took my utmost curiosity was the screenplay.I can't wait to get my hands on one copy as I think it is such a great tool for aspiring screenwriters to examine with its multiple transitions, various dialogues and etc.I can't congratulate the Daniels, cast and the crew enough with this one. Amazing!

This is what going to the Cinema is all about. Great story, great acting, great action! I laughed, I cried, and I cheered. Please support this film and watch in the theaters, such an amazing experience.Stephanie Hsu is becoming a breakout star in my opinion. She absolutely won me over in Mrs. Maisel and in Everything Everywhere All At Once she was easily my favorite part of the film. She carries with her perfect comedic timing but also with her serious heartfelt moments.10/10.

reviews.review_title: So this is what an acid trip is like
reviews.content: I've never dropped acid, but I don't have to now. This movie has to be safer than psychedelics. What a crazy, wonderful trip. It's like Monty Python and a grown-up Alice In Wonderland had a baby, this movie. The genius is in how the creators comically weave the nonsensical, shattered pieces of a life into a beautiful mosaic. It's in how meaning takes shape stepping back to gape in wonder at the way chaos connects, or the way you choose to believe it connects. It's as much a poem as a movie.

reviews.review_title: Weird as hell and all the better for it! Michelle Yeoh is a revelation!
reviews.content: It does all become a bit too much on more than one occasion, threatening to be sucked into its own literal bagel of ridiculousness.But it's really just, such a pleasure to watch filmmakers genuinely passionate about their craft craft, delivering what may be the biggest and boldest...um 'absurdist multiverse-comedy/martial arts action-adventure/family-drama with I think some musical in there, ever made.No one can accuse this team of not knowing EXACTLY what kind of movie they are making and beyond that... it's actually quite hard to define just how Goddamn entertaining it all is. Laugh out loud hilarious, weird as hell, action-packed bonanza with superb storytelling and characters.Michelle Yeoh is outstanding as Evelyn (every version of her), Stephanie Hsu is an intoxicating delight and the entire team commit 100% to this ... LITERAL BAGEL of freakin' what.Though where it holds strongest, from start to (almost) finish is its journey through the complex and unyielding dynamics of mothers and daughters. The times 'Everything, Everywhere' wants to hold your attention most, is when all the bells and whistles and sausage fingers are lowered and it becomes about two people, trying to make sense of it all.

reviews.review_title: Jackie Chan TYSM fir rejecting the role!
reviews.content: This film was refreshingly silly, inspiring and entertaining. Yeoh is such a brilliant multi-coloured talent, I cannot get enough ofher brilliance. The plpt and the silly bits were not just copy-padte from other comedies. We need more projects like this. I thought that the age of comedy is over. But no!

reviews.review_title: What the hell did I watch?
reviews.content: Having read a very positive review of the movie, I started very positive, while my wife was sceptical from the beginning. She fell asleep after the "The End" and I know now that the time was by far better spent than watching this movie. I will admit though that it made me laugh a few times, if just from the absurdity of it all, but mostly watching this movie just hurt.Maybe I've gotten too old, maybe this just wasn't my kind of humour. But honestly the hot dog fingers romance and the butt plug Kung Fu scene, I'm not even sure if that would have been funny as pubertal humour.All in all the movie felt like a cheap Kung Fu Hustle knock off from wish.

reviews.review_title: In Contention for the Best Movie of the Millennium
reviews.content: As. Advertised. This is one of the greatest movies I've ever seen.It has everything you want in a movie: action, humor, strong interpersonal relationships, and an absolute feast for the eyes.There are a couple moments where if have Purtannical sensibilities, this movie is probably not going to be for you. Otherwise, enjoy the ride. It's Matrix meets Ladybird meets Scott Pilgrim meets Rumble in the Bronx.A loveletter to possibility.

My first review! Well because everything everywhere touched places in my heart that I didn't know exist! It is a movie about all those broken dreams and desires that we keep telling ourselves before giving up. All those parallel dimensions where we could be anything but this present version of ourself, where we feel so trapped that unknowingly we keep pushing our loved ones away. Letting go or not, and how sometimes expressing love can heal or start the journey towards healing, is shown through breathtaking graphics and beautiful acting! Very rarely a movie makes me this happy and this joyful!

Absolutely gripped, fascinated and thrilled by this entire film. This film was creative, action packed, funny, very well acted and put together. The writing was excellent, the dialog AND story. The acting was perfect, no one was lacking and no one over acted either. To top it off it was casted perfectly, Jamie Lee Curtis is amazing, it was funny to see her take on a more light hearted role in this film. Michelle Yeoh, what a star, her career is making a come back and this film is proof that she is deserving of it.Great cinematography and film sets. I loved how the film majorly took place in about 6-7 rooms in total but it felt far more than that.Such creative ideas for all the fight sequences and designs. When it comes to the story it starts off making you think it is just another typical storyline, the big bad wants to kill the main character. But it turns Into something far more powerful.9.0/10 from me.

You will either love this film or you will hate it.I've never watched a more polarising film before, both my girlfriend and my friend were unable to watch this film, whilst I laughed, cried and loved this movie.You need to get through the 1st chapter to unlock the true joy of this film. And I recommend doing some back reading of the other ways to see this film when youre finished.All I can say is you need to try this film, and you need to hold on as long as you can.I though top gun was sweeping a way to be my favourite film of this year, but this film has surprised me in the best way possible.You might not love this film. But give it a try, and if you don't hate it, you'll be unable to do anything but think about it.

I really wanted to like this movie more than I did. It was very original, had decent acting and interesting effects. It was also unnecessarily confusing, too long by about 40 minutes And from what I can figure out quite illogical in its use of multiverse theme. It also didn't help that the hardware they were using to zip around the Multiverse looked like it was from a 1980s science-fiction movie. Some of the fight scenes were cool, but had a lot of unnecessary slapstick comedy thrown in which really doesn't work for me and seemed very out of place. Worth a watch though.

This movie is not for everyone. Those viewers conditioned to accepting the usual fodder of simple plots with black & white cardboard cutout characters could be stretching their tiny peas towards potential brain aneurisms. But the imagination shown by the creators is simply astounding. Not since Ken Russell or Quentin Tarentino has there been such a unique, quirky universe as this one created by Dan Kwan & Daniel Scheinert. Is it a dream? - a hallucination? Maybe, but it's a philosophical roller coaster - with an extremely emotional conclusion! Every actor in it delivers their best performances. With the extraordinary Michelle Yeoh at the helm this movie offers a more spectacular ride than what Disney or the blockbuster franchises could ever hope to create.

This movie had everything that I like about movies. Comedy, action, sci-fi, trippy and a pretty good story line. I thought the acting was great and the costumes were good. If you want to see a great movie and laugh but it also makes you thi k a little then give it a try.

Review Title says it all. Unique, New and a must watch.Very funny. Very cinematic. Have not felt this way about a movie or show since squid game.....
....
...

reviews.review_title: Well, i wanna praise it too, but...
reviews.content: I must say we dident really enjoyed watching this, and waited it to be over. We went after to eat burger, and was too tired even to talk with eachother. This movie is off course well directed and well everything, and it is brave, genius, etc etc. BUT, it's exhausting, pressing on the same button, same button chrlie kaufman pressed on in the 00's, telling the same jock, and the plot is 1/4 interesting, swallowed by extra enthusiasm. Well, i can see its the "coolest" kid in class, but what can i say, i dont really wanna play with him, he is trying too much.Jaime lee curtis though- wowwww. And also the stones scene- veryyyy zen. Go watch it, BUT... its ok if you dont love this flavor.

This movie had great reviews and a great cast, but was awful. It kept trying to tell a good story, but never did. After more than an hour of trying to get to the point, with numerous attempts to explain and re-explain how the universe connection (verse jumping) worked, they still didn't get it right. Then, there was the blatantly foreshadowed and vigorous fight over trying to sit on teleporting butt plugs (yes, that is correct) and sucking on phallic fingers that were supposed to be hot dogs. What an utter waste of time and talent. Whoever said that this movie was "flawless" must have fallen asleep.

reviews.review_title: Full of creativity, but probably not for everyone
reviews.content: Many people complain that most current movies are formulaic. Well, here is a film that is most definitely not.Bursting with creativity and ideas, ranging from the heartfelt to the absurd, it occasionally presents the viewer with a formulaic setup, only to pull the rug from under your feet and shout "fooled you" with manic glee.It is this strategy that may also be its weakness. I really liked the movie, but my wife hated it. It is definitely not for everyone. If the viewer wants a clear, straight-forward narrative, then they will be only find frustration here.If I had one criticism, I believe the film to be about 30 minutes too long. But in the great scheme of things, it is a small gripe.Please go and support film-making that breaks conventions. With an open mind, you won't regret it.

I'm 10 minutes in and it's brilliant, loads of energy and dialogue. Great angles and movement, I know I'm going to love it because I already am...the shift in focus to direct your attention and the editing is very sharp and adds to the movie. The cuts, pans, tilts, zooms that have a sound effect are brilliant.

Not as good as they say.First hour is okay-if you decide to ignore the blatant lgbt propaganda shoved into your face as early as the establishing shots.The gradual introduction of the multiverse will leave most viewers confused, since we never get a clear idea of how things work.It simply is a plot device which allows the filmmakers to get away with anything.From sixty to ninety minutes the action kicks in and things get better, but it does not last for long. You will know when the good part is over because The End is going to appear on the screen.The trouble begins after the fake ending credits. The remaining forty minutes are the most goddamn awful thing you've ever seen. It was excruciatingly painful to deal with those. Each second was a masterclass in cringiness, sappiness, and ultra boredom. Kinda like a Chinese blockbuster, only worse!

Everything Everywhere All At Once (2022)(8/10):Before the year closes out I thought I'd see what all the hype is about and it's warranted,fantastic film.It's visually stunning and filled with so much creativity that it's concept could be milked for endless sequels,yet I'd prefer it as a standalone film.It's got a great cast in Michelle Yeoh,Jonathan Ke Quan (most famous for his child roles as Short Round and Data),Jamie Lee Curtis and James Hong, who I absolutely adore.My biggest issue with it is it's pretty long,being almost two and a half hours, but it's proof that originality isn't dead as it has enough ideas for one or two dozen different movies.The acting is solid and the comedy sometimes hits its mark sometimes not, but comedy is not this film's strong suit,it's purely its visuals and seemingly endless amounts of ideas.The film is separated into three parts or chapters which does help break down the pacing a bit,which is nice but it still started to feel a bit sloggish as if you're not completely down for the length of it and completely invested then it feels very much it's length and begins to drag about halfway in.It's pace feels fast yet it still feels long.Issues aside I think it's a very well made film that still feels like an indie project despite it having some big names and a big budget.The fight scenes are very interesting and well choreographed and the costumes are excellent.I think out of every movie I've seen to come out this year I'd recommend this one the most as it's fun, creative, original and a visual treat.

reviews.review_title: Eccentric, exhausting and overwhelming adventure of sheer madness, but with a solid message at its core
reviews.content: An Asian woman who owns a laundromat that is dogged by tax auditors abruptly finds herself at the center of the most large-scale battle ever between good and evil spanning an infinite number of universes and alternate realities, one which ends up intertwining her meek husband, critical father and estranged, rebellious daughter. To go into too much detail about this extremely unusual plot would be unwise; it's best to go in cold and with no expectations. That way, you just might get the full effect.For the most part, it's a fun film to watch, with surprising effects, jumping through different alternate realities coming together into one big plot. This movie keeps you on your toes with surprising ideas and sometimes unwanted or try-too-hard jokes, which can sometimes go too far for the average taste. The film's weirdness is its proud ethos; the mayhem and anarchy are the film's heart and soul. The meandering, unwieldy narrative actually fits in with the unstructured multiverse. But underneath the film's chaos, lack of logic and unapologetic absurdity, lies a twofold wholesome principle: believing in the strength of the mother-child bond and finding the good in every individual, in spite of the world's cruelty and insanity. For all the film's unruliness, there's nothing remotely misanthropic here. Far from being a grim morality tale, it's more along the lines of hard-earned wisdom. Once you understand it in that regard, it's safe to say it will stay with you.Michelle Yeoh as the protagonist Evelyn just crushes it again; she has proven to be one of the most underrated actresses for quite some years now and with an incredibly vast range of acting. In this film, she turns an unremarkable, workaday character into a bona fide superhero whose abilities might have no limit whatsoever. Fair warning: This film will be an endurance test for some, but not without a hilarious and/or philosophical respite here and there. Recommended for everyone who wants to stretch their comfort zone of the familiar way of movies and is up for something truly different and off the beaten path.

reviews.review_title: An All Time Classic... And Cinematic Miracle
reviews.content: "Everything Everywhere All At Once" is a cinematic miracle...Its not only the best film of 2022 by far, its one of the greatest films of all time. This is the best original film IP, that I have seen or experienced, since the first Matrix film came out in 1999 ( for different reasons of course ). Now it shares a spot in my Top 5 films of all time ( right alonside The Matrix actually ).I can't say the film is for everyone, as I've already seen some saying they "walked out" of the film or "The film sucks" or "its overrated" or "Its ass". These people are completely missing the incredible storytelling and social commentary of the film. Its a Multi generational family drama, that is placed inside of a euphoric, wild, insane, action packed, and visually stunning multiverse film.The films deeper story and meaning, touches on real life subject matter and themes such as LGBT, Depression, the curse of comparison, family trauma/relationships, Existentialism, Nihilism, and Asian-American identity. Michelle Yeoh leads an incredible cast of people, who bring this storytelling masterpiece to life.As someone that has been a fan/mark for Michelle Yeoh, since first watching her 1985 martial arts classic "Yes Madam", along eith all of her Hong Kong work in the 80s & 90s. This is the magnum opus performance of her career and that is saying alot! It would be the stunning robbery of the year, if she's not walking home with an Academy Award for Best Actress.All in All this is all time great cinematic film, that deals with alot of real life subject matter and delivers one of the most insane and emotional trips in decades ( and for sure should win Best Picture ). An easy 5 Stars and then some...

This is the first film since 2019s Parasite that left me speechless as the credits rolled. An incredibly original film that uses the concept of the multiverse to its fullest potential. It's bizarreness can be off putting a times but Daniel keeps you grounded with a relatable story of what if's and powerful performances. Every time I started to feel like I was being taken out of the movie, I was drawn back in.In a lot of ways this movie perfectly capture the pandemic era existential anxiety and depression I've experienced recently as well as some of the complex and deep rooted frustration I've had with my family. I cried, I laughed and at times I cringed. But I have to say this was one of my favorite theatre experiences. Whether you'll end up loving it or hating it, I recommend everyone experience it.

reviews.review_title: The Multiverse of Madness we deserved!
reviews.content: Perhaps no film has electrified audiences and charged up movie groups all over social media in recent times than "Everything Everywhere All At Once", an phenomenally deranged sci-fi epic that catapults a heartwarming family story to cult status thanks to its cutting edge visual imagery and unexpected narrative quirks. The moment you think you know where the movie is headed is exactly when the makers will pull the rug out from under you, creating so much hysteria and mayhem that you are rendered as confused as the protagonists on screen.We follow superstar Michelle Yeoh, who seems to be a bored laundromat owner called up by the IRS for a tax audit, only to have her world turned upside down when she encounters a mysterious, multiversal version of her husband who asks her to join him on a journey down a rabbit hole of epic proportions. Tasked with taking down a seemingly megalomaniacal villain named "Jobu Tapaki", Yeoh's character traverses the many universes using a technique called verse-jumping, rendered immensely believable and enjoyable by the cutting-edge CGI and visual effects employed by the makers.The immensely relatable Ke Huy Quan is terrific as Yeoh's ever suffering husband while Stephanie Hsu is a revelation as her troubled daughter, who constantly disappoints her mother despite her best efforts. Yeoh's world renowned martial arts skills and prowess as a decorated character actress are harnessed with equal aplomb by directors Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert to tell a core story of the lengths a mother will go for her daughter, albeit with multiversal consequences at stake."Everything Everywhere All At Once" is an absolutely mental sci-fi adventure that blends comedy, fantasy and heart to serve up an immensely entertaining mashup that achieves the multiversal aspirations which "Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness" set out to accomplish and failed. Michelle Yeoh makes a triumphant return to a mainstream role, with a performance for the ages. Highly, highly recommended!

reviews.review_title: A movie that tries to be everything, everywhere, all at once - and succeeds
reviews.content: Instantly in my top 10 movies of all time. It's rare a movie manages to be as absurd as it is heartfelt and as whimsical as it is thoughtful. Some things you see coming from a mile away - and still love them when they happen - and some things just hit you like a ton of bricks. This movie *will* require repeat viewing, but it's just so incredibly fresh that it feels like you want to watch it again as soon as it's over.

reviews.review_title: Truly spectactular, a once in a lifetime movie experience.
reviews.content: I have watched the movie 3 times now and have enjoyed every experience. A completely frenzied, chaotic take on comedy, action, sci-fi and drama.Fantastic acting by all three leads.

reviews.review_title: Wanted 'Internal Sunshine Of The Spotless Mind'...
reviews.content: ...but got 'Guardians of the Galaxy 2' instead. Don't get me wrong, it's a good film and most likely you'll enjoy it. But I guess it left me wanting more. It's funny and very clever but the storyline was lacking and there was only so many scenes with hot dogs for fingers that I could take before it felt very repetitive. It was in need of some heavy self editing and they could have knocked 30 minutes off the run time and not really have lost anything story wise. Is it the best film of the year, maybe. Is it my favorite film of the year, I hope not.

reviews.review_title: much more bonkers than a james gunn movie
reviews.content: I complain that they don't make anything good outside comic book movies, so when they try something different i have to judge it differently. Its an immigrant story that just goes of the rails in weirdness, get more and more weird as the movie goes on. While i like the weirdness that they tried, i didn't love it so i gave this movie an average score.

I recently watched a movie that has received mixed reviews from the audience and I must say, I understand why. When I first started watching it, I was drawn in by the visuals and the ambitious editing style. However, as the movie progressed, I found myself getting more and more confused. The storyline lacked coherence and meaning, making it difficult for me to follow along.The long running time also didn't help matters, as it made the experience even more tedious. What was particularly frustrating was the awkward explanation of the filmmakers' intent, which only added to the confusion. I couldn't help but feel that the movie was trying to be too pretentious and showy.Another issue I had with the movie was the characters. I found them to be annoying and uninteresting, which made it even harder for me to engage with the story. The ending was sentimental and, in my opinion, a way to forget the painful experience of watching the movie. It felt like the filmmakers were trying to wrap things up quickly and make the audience forget the confusing and lackluster journey they had just gone through.Overall, my experience with this movie was negative. I wouldn't recommend it to others and would suggest they look for a more enjoyable and coherent film. The visuals and editing style were impressive, but they couldn't make up for the lack of coherence and the frustrating storyline.

Well what can I say our should I say what the hell did I just experience.Everything everywhere is definitely a original movie I don't think I seen anything as bonkers as that!I hope other directors will follow I like to see more of this type of movies.

reviews.review_title: A Landmark film brimming with creativity & heart
reviews.content: Films like this remind you why Cinema is such a magical form of art. Exploding with originality & creativity, so many times I was stunned by how they were able to pull off some of the scenes. Its a story of a chinese immigrant facing financial crisis, who is suddenly tasked with the responsibilty of saving the multiverse. The comedy in this film is bonkers and so weird & I loved it, reminiscent of those Stephen Chow's legendary Hong Kong films. The action brings back the flavor of Chinese KungFu movies, so well choreographed. So many philosophies are discussed, the multiverse becomes a reflection of a human's unfulfilled hopes & dreams & possibilities. It dwells on nihilism, absurdism & depression. And all these are bound by strong emotional familial ties and superb performances. Ke Huy Quan is the heart of this film, playing a goofball husband who always disappoints his wife. His words make us realize where the value of life lies. And obviously Michelle Yeoh, what a performance !! She is perplexed, bitter, funny, awkward & so loving. The direction, editing & VFX are revolutionary. This is the film of the Year & You dare not Miss It.

Wow! That's all I can saw after watching this movie. It is outstanding. A lot of movies have a really creative, original story but this is one of the only movies I've seen with a story like this that actually nails it. The concepts can get very complicated but the movie shows and tells you the rules of the universe jumping in a way that everyone can understand. There is a lot of comedy that works very well in this movie as well, the entire theatre broke out into laugher over 15+ times which is more than every comedy movie that has come out in the last 10 years. This movie is very emotional as well, I won't lie I shed a tear. I could also hear others in the audience sniffling. I would say this movie hits on every beat, I honestly cannot think of a single bad thing to say about it.

I don't really need to say anything. The other reviews say it all. Amazing film. The best one of 2022 and probably 2021 at least. An all time great. The characters are deep, the nuances are thoughtful with brilliant representations of the films themes of throughout.

reviews.review_title: A serious movie disguised as a silly movie:
reviews.content: Wow. I rarely leave reviews but this one absolutely deserved one. Kudos to the directors for writing such a stunning movie. I'm a 58 year old, white, grandmother of five and I could relate to every.single.character.It's a story of parent/daughter relationships sprinkled with remorse for dreams not fulfilled, paths not taken, focusing on the wrong things in life, and, eventually, realizing that Be Kind/Accept People For Who They Are is what everyone should strive for in this blink of an eye existence we all have. Each and every actor was excellent. In my opinion EEAO should win all the awards.

Wow, this is a cinematic adventure to say the least! Being an A24 film is what initially intrigued me about this film bc other than SLICE and The Blackcoats Daughter, I've really enjoyed this film company's films. It's title is BEYOND appropriate because it encompasses soo much. This must've been an actors' dream job: showing so much range and wearing soo many different costumes. Yeoh is outrageously great, Hollywood should've put her in more varied roles previously. The humor could come off as juvenile at times (I'm personally not into anal play) and as others have said, the 3rd act is slightly long winded, but if you're open minded you definitely check this out!

If this movie wasn' so overhyped and so overrated, I would just dismiss it as a meh kind of movie. But as it is so overhyped and overrated, I kind of start to hate it.But to not waste a lot more time on this nonsense, I will just point out the main reasons why the movie failed for me.1.) The movie failed to establish an emotional connection between the viewer and what is happening on the screen i. E. in the movie. One of the reasons for that being: the movie was driven by nonsense. Whenever the main characters are stuck in a situation, the have to perform some nonensical bullcrap, so that they can crazy-deus-ex-machina their way out of the situation. Again and again and again and again and again.2.) The other reason for the failed emotional connection is that there were no sympathetic characters given to connect with. Everyone is just a self-absorbed a-hole or douchebag. What they are fighting for is a chaotic piled up mess (because they are unable to fix anything and to improve, so they prefer having a meanignless mess to having nothing).So, my main problem was: I just didn't care for anything happening in the movie.If you think that it is a profound philosophical question to ask how your life would be if you would have sausages for fingers (just to give you an example), this may be a movie you. But if you think that such a question is just stupid and stopped being funny since you turned 8 years old, maybe you should avoid spending timeor money on this movie.But there are some few reddeming qualities of this movie, hence I did give it 3/10.Which are:
The cinematography isn't bad.It doesn't look like a trash movie production-value-wise.Some of the acting wasn't too bad, if you can look past the garbage mess the actors had to work with.It has some funny moments, if you can take the nonsense and the stupidity.But again, at the end of the day, I didn't care for the pile of nonsense that the movie is.
Garbage, Garbage!!! Definitely THE WORST movie I have ever seen in my life. I still can't believe the rating on IMDB! Are you serious? What a waste of time and money. Seriously!

This film is quite literally every single genre in cinema blended into one. It's a Kung Fu sci-fi action comedy drama mind bending craziness of a movie that just keeps getting more and more insane as it goes on. But it's absolutely incredible and quite possibly the most unique piece of cinema that's ever been created.

The three stars are for imaginative. But I think at some point the creators of this film couldn't tell the difference between good creative ideas and bad ones. To me it was a mess, it was throwing everything onto a canvas, paint, feces, glitter, ground beef, spit, glue, and melted crayons, then smearing it around and hoping the audience decides to make more of it than it really is. Yes, the movie has a message. And it's a good message. But how a message is delivered matters, and this one was delivered through an unpleasant, loony movie.

The two stars are for Ke Huy Quan's acting. He was really good in all his different roles and his whole aura changed with each personality.The only thing that kept me watching till the end was the thought that surely it would get better. Well, to me it didn't. It was just all random rubbish thrown together. I like and admire Michelle Yeoh a lot, so I'm disappointed that she got involved in this. There were so many points when I really physically wanted to throw up because of what I was seeing on screen.It was awful. It made no sense. It was like the writers just tried to find things that were as stupid as possible to put together. Why did such big names sign on? I don't know. Don't waste your time.

So, this has to be the first A24 movie I have not fallen asleep to and actually enjoyed. I have noticed that the A24 movies are more for the younger generation. I love action and adventure, this movie was amazing! It was like art in a movie. Every move, every motion, precisely calculated. Not only was the story a grabber, the acting was incredible! This was not your typical movie and for that alone I cannot wait to see what this director will do next! I highly recommend, but not for children's eyes, there are a few adult things in this movie. Such as dildos and a few bad words. More for grown up teens. I will definitely be watching this one again, just to count how many times Joy changed clothes lol.

This movie was done SO WELL. It was thought provoking AND had a fantastic family message. It's definitely for adults and not for young children - but as a parent this movie really got to me. It was done so beautifully. Best movie of the year!

The values brought by this movie is certainly holy and important to make life more vivid and harmonious. However It was not easy to focus to the plot of story. Too many roles, too complicated story, back and forth. Make a lot of time watching the movie distracted by the plot.Good effort by all the team to produce this different kind of movie. However need to make it easier and ligth eri to be watched at the week end...

reviews.review_title: A movie for the woke generation
reviews.content: Well where do you start, could write an essay but will not give this my time. If you think kindness and acceptance is an issue in this world it is time to stop watching movies like this and get off social and mainstream media. Whatever your belief system is kindness and acceptance is a given don't believe anything else. If you are confused by this then i suggest you learn about the Abrahamic faiths and realise where humans came from and what their purpose is.Other then that this movie is okay for entertainment purposes.

I went in with no expectations, and I was completely blown away with how well written the story was. From the acting to the directing, cinematography to the fight choreography, this masterpiece is a cult classic in the making!! To put it into simple terms, this is what Hollyweird can produce and create in 2022 if you just let the talent be talent by taking off all the restraints and the leashes.

reviews.review_title: An emotional and philosophical ride on the roller coaster that is life
reviews.content: "Everything Everywhere All at Once" takes its unsuspecting viewers on a soul wrenching journey and takes no precaution in warning them before taking their beating heart right out of their chest, throwing it down on the floor, stomping on it and then putting it back into their chest and giving them a peck on the forehead.This magnificent piece of art perfectly captures the essence of life. It does so in a subtle and elegant way. It lets its audience guessing the meaning of its scenes and events without ever saying it outright.It was the first time I cried in a movie theatre. "Crying" being an understatement as I was literally bawling my eyes out multiple times throughout the ride. I was not an exception, people were as devastated as I was.Although "Everything everywhere all at once" makes you go through the roughest of journeys, it makes sure to make you leave the movie theatre at peace and ready to conquer life. As people left the room, I heard nothing but praises.I do not want to call this masterpiece a movie as it would minimize the life-changing power that it holds. This is, without any near competition, the best cinematic experience of my life. I had never experienced something so deep, emotional and philosophical adressed in such a smart, subtle and elegant way. Its mere existence baffles me as it exceeds my high standards and earns itself one of the very few 10/10 I've ever given.

The Daniel's are a pair of directors who need more love in my personal opinion. This being their third feature length film, it is absolutely bonkers. Having been a fan of their work for a while after seeing "Swiss Army Man," I was anticipating this movie. I had high hopes and they were exceeded. The cast is absolutely fantastic, the script oozes with complex themes of generational trauma, existentialism, and most importantly creativity, and it's an overall intriguing watch. From an outsider's perspective, the movie is nothing more than some weird, dumb movie. However, it's completely the opposite. Never have I seen a movie so perfectly balance so many genres in one film and not seem overstuffed. The Daniel's are extremely creative individuals and it shines all throughout this movie. If you haven't already seen it and you're still on the fence about this movie, go and watch it. I highly recommend this movie.

This film intrigued me as soon as the trailer for it came out in December 2021. I was curious how they were going to handle their own multiverse concept. And the fact that the film was actually produced by MCU's Russo Brothers made me even more curious. And now having watched the film, I can understand why this film was produced by them.For an A24 produced film, this film actually feels more like a blockbuster film rather than an indie film. The plot was fast-paced, the action choreography shames even most of the other recent summer blockbuster films, and the vfx were well done. Hard to actually believe that the budget spent was only in the region of $14 million. But I guess it makes sense when you look at the small number of cast, which was integrated nicely into the story. And also why it's currently A24's highest grossing film ever.They didn't even waste any time in moving the plotline. For a film this long, it's actually refreshing (in a way) that a film uses all its allocated time without lingering too much on anything. The film's plot is also quite easy to follow, even though the concept is supposed to be complicated. I was not confused once while I watched the film.I love all the homages they managed to place in the film. From the action choreography scenes (which was surely inspired by Jackie Chan's films and old kung-fu films, probably even Michelle Yeoh's own Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon) to romantic scenes that is obviously a nod to Wong Kar Wai's films like In the Mood for Love, for instance. It is definitely a love letter to the Hong Kong film industry.I guess if there's a weakness in the film, is that for a film with a multiverse concept, it's actually quite simple and shallow. I mean, I'm not saying it is shallow. But it isn't as complicated as, say, Predestination. The message is powerful, sure. But it's the usual feel good message you see in almost every film. It kind of makes the film feel a bit lame.But that doesn't take away the fact that this film is a good film. In fact, this is a great film. It's a joy to watch from start to finish. And it will make you experience a ton of emotions throughout the film, albeit a little brief. This film has a pretty high mass appeal. It is the most accessible for anyone who hasn't seen an A24 film. A jumping pad, if you will *wink wink (if you excuse my pun).

Well I just buyed this and it was worth it it was absolutely funny and amazing fighting it's like a gory version of doctor strange into the multiverse of madness but more funnier hope everyone enjoys it 10/10.

Wonderfully charming. Yeoh is fantastic as usual. The actress playing the daughter was amazing. Shortround/Data was superb and well casted. I feel like Ive seen that grandfather too.Topic hits home. Absolutely laughed out loud many times. Thought the plot was deeply thought out not too hard to follow. Give this movie ten stars. Probably best film I've seen in a decade. Extremely original.

reviews.review_title: Best movie of 2022 I've seen so far
reviews.content: A must watch, not only was the cinematography a stand out for me, but the heartwarming and beautiful story was a refreshing take on relationships and identity. Sublime performances from all. A definite 10/10.

reviews.review_title: One of the best films i've ever seen.
reviews.content: In all my years this colorful extremely funny mind bend of a movie is an instant classic and one to remember a story that at first glance seems like a cheesy action multiverse movie becomes a complex family story where each character gets their spotlight and show out. Highly recommend this film to anyone who needs something to watch. I watched this with my girlfriend and she cried i almost did too this movie hit the right feels. But it almost had its moments of being very cheery and fun. Please watch this movie whenever or however you can.

reviews.review_title: Acid Trip Experience with a Great Message
reviews.content: One of the best movies I have ever watched. It was insane and awkwardly entertaining. I have never seen such a beautiful mother and daughter relationship story. The movie really loves family values. It also was aware of everyone's mental health.The daughter felt ashamed of who she was and was scared of what her family would think of her. Since she has a girlfriend. Thus creating a villain origin in her point of view.The mom is stressing due to responsibility of being a mom, managing her laundry business and of course doing her taxes.The father is always kind and warm-hearted. He is also persuasive and cares a lot. Thus saving the mom from headaches from the tax person.Yes we fight, we mess up, we feel guilty and ashamed but in all this chaos, we can still love and be kind to each other no matter what happens or how ugly we can be.Despite our differences in how we see things, this movie has shown its compassion throughout the chaos in the multiverse. Great movie!

Love, love the first third of this movie. Such great characters, interesting buildup, terrific interaction -- and then main character basically drops acid. For the rest of the movie, we more or less take the trip with her, with this and that hallucination (or not), characters seeming one way or the other, changing personality, dress, etc., midway and back and then again, then back. By half way through, it stopped holding me and I found myself becoming rather bored. Would have been much more interesting if it was my own trip but it wasn't, and I started fast forwarding little bits to see if I could see something else developing besides more hallucinations (or not). Effects were great, but to me was hard to make it to the end. Surprised at all the hype and best this and best that with exception of best actress.

I went into this film with no idea what the plot was other than "multiverse, bad guy, and bagel" and had no expectations of having any kind of emotional response. The movie was weird, and beautiful, and I cried three separate times, and stayed teary eyed through the entirety of part 3. 10/10 recommend, and I'll definitely watch again. The writing, the performances, just absolutely perfect. (And any film that can make me read text on a screen for 5 minutes with two rocks and a canyon as the background and keep me engaged the entire scene, is a film I will cherish for the rest of my life)

I'm looking forward to sharing this strange, surreal tale with my friends! Exactly my type of humor and randomness. Douglas Adams would probably have had a great time watching such an irreverent reflection of humanity. 10/10 easily, and I'm so excited for the future movies that Daniels make together.

reviews.review_title: Disjointed, perplexing story line makes it a disappointing, difficult watch.
reviews.content: There are two reasons why I wanted to see this movie. One, it had a high rating of 8.1 and two it was considered a high probability of being selected for the award of best film, for Michelle Yeoh for best actress, for Jamie Lee Curtis for best supporting actress and for Ke Huey Kwan for best supporting actor. While the acting awards seemed justified since the acting was good, I have very strong reservations about the best picture bit. The movie described in Wikipedia as an "absurdist science fiction comedy drama" is extremely difficult to sit through and a torturous watch for most of the time. It can be described as inane, bizarre, aweful, nonsensical, chaotic, crazy, strange, trite, mind numbing, cringe worthy and basically an assault on the senses which drains you physically and mentally. After the first 40 minutes starts the madness which gets worse with time. The fights, the VFX, the fast paced martial arts, the high decibel music are okay for some time but it gets excruciating if one has to sit through for 2 hour 19 minutes of runtime. I was disappointed big time. The background of a parallel universe with virtual reality didn't help to make things interesting and made it look strange. The disjointed, meandering and confusing narrative and the superfast editing pace had me flummoxed. What a mess it looked.

reviews.review_title: Matrix/Being John Malkovich on Robot Chicken
reviews.content:
Hi,
I work in film/tv. If Michelle Yeoh doesn't bare minimum receive an Oscar nomination along with the Writers and Directors and Editing for this film, then there needs to be some serious discussion about what we are all doing here to begin with.This movie makes you feel and also helps people understand other people on top of this being incredibly entertaining. It is hard to put this into a genre.
