I was blown away and walked out crying because it was so great from the theater.How much genius can one film project???And Yeoh, there is also awesome martial arts!!!

reviews.review_title: This movie made me ugly cry at rocks
reviews.content: This is my favourite movie of 2022. It does what Multiverse of Madness failed to do, which is present an interesting multiverse tale, while never losing sight of the emotional core of the movie AND exploring deep philosophical ideas at the same time.Everyone on the cast and crew of this film brought their A game. It's incredible how good the visual effects look when you learn that it was all done by a team of 5-ish people. It made me ugly cry at rocks. There are certain scenes that will stay with me forever, especially when it comes to the character of Waymond Wang. (If you're a Superman fan, Waymond is probably the best "Clark Kent" character that I've seen on the big screen in years. He proves that being kind and believing in the best in others has never gone out of style.)I don't want to give away any major details since half the fun of this movie is being pleasantly surprised at all of the things that happen in the film. Please go watch this movie!
It really is Everything Everywhere All at Once. Michelle Yeoh, who I know from Crazy Rich Asians, stars as "an asian immigrant trying to do her taxes"

I watched this Jay night because if the 8+ recite it got here on IMDB. If only I'd read down through the reviews and sage the more realistic ones.I did enjoy watching the film recuse of the style but it all fell apart towards the end. It didn't make much sense and it came to a pretty stupid conclusion.This isn'tscience fiction. It's science crap. A load of rubbish with poorly explained rules and the rules that were interested didn't seem to really apply anyway.The movie needed to be shorter. It felt way too long.The redeeming feature was the decent kung fu but there wasn't enough of that.Waste of time really. I wouldn't be bothered watching again and will say that if you aren't feels good vibes after 30 minutes, watch sobering wise because it really doesn't improve.

3min30 before the first gay scene, this movie set a new record. Who can beat that, hum ?Overall, the movie is bringing nothing new, the so what factor is still not there. I do believe this movie is totally overrated and I have to admit that I stopped it somewhere in middle, as it is another 2h20 movie leading nowhere. Maybe I am too old for this kind of topic.
The worst movie I have ever seen in my life. A bad version of Nolan who is also a bad filmmaker. People think it's a masterpiece because they don't understand it.
It crushed my expectations and I had high expectations. It hit about every emotional note possible in the best possible way. And of course, Michelle Yeoh was fantastic. Favorite film of 2022 so far.

I will proceed by saying the actors were phenomenal especially Yeoh and Quan, however the actual story was booty. Honestly, I did not see the hype or creativity behind this movie. It was fake creative and a fake original that is geared towards the type of youth who think they're edgy and cool saying nothing matters we are pointless small specks in the universe. That trope is old and overused. & rlly, this movie is as deep as elmo's voice.I walked into this film purely because of the high ratings and had no expectations. It was not it. If you think randomness equates to funny and liked Pulp Fiction then maybe you'll like this film. As for the plot, this felt like the adult and more chaotic version of "Turning Red," it's the same general message about the mother daughter relationship. But just overly chaotic and definitely and made me not see the value of this movie.

Plot that doesn't lead anywhere, poor acting, more than 2 hours of a complete chaos that leads nowhere.If you watch it, I can pretty much guarantee you won't watch it again. Ever. If this movie was meant to be a joke I didn't get it. And the fact that this movie is in the academy awards is a shame.Since I need to write 600 characthers, I will simply rewrite what I wrote:Plot that doesn't lead anywhere, poor acting, more than 2 hours of a complete chaos that leads nowhere.If you watch it, I can pretty much guarantee you won't watch it again. Ever. If this movie was meant to be a joke I didn't get it. And the fact that this movie is in the academy awards is a shame.And that's it.

The comedy hits, the drama hits, the action hits. This is easily my favorite film of the year so far. It is also such an original concept it's like nothing else I've ever seen before. The exploration of unique multiverse concepts and unique themes about how each decision we make in life lead to big changes and there is a universe out there where your dreams have been achieved. It's inspirational stuff.

As an avid movie watcher, I will say that this movie does in fact have everything, everywhere all at once. A two-hour movie that hums along and when I got to the end, I was out of breath. This movie has it all: rich characters, a solid plot and cinematography that blew my mind. On top of all this, there's a simple, yet profound message for all of us.I can't say enough about this movie and how, after a few hours, it still resonates. I might have to watch it again as I know it will be time well spent. An absolute fascinating film that I didn't want to end. I rarely say that about a movie.We will see these folks (everyone from director, cinematographer, producer, actors, editors) on stage come Oscar night.

reviews.review_title: A truly special, once in a lifetime film
reviews.content: This movie was truly something else. I had heard much praise from so many people, and I've been wanting to watch it, but I kept putting it off and putting it off. But tonight I sat down and said, "okay, I'm watching this dang movie", and an I so glad I did. From the beginning I had a feeling the movie was going to be good, even as it starts a bit slow. But it's just.....wow. There's so much I can say, but just do yourself a favor and watch this incredible movie. I don't understand how it only has an 8.2 on here, but do yourself a favor and ignore the score and just watch the movie.

reviews.review_title: Things are happening and then it's over. Not.
reviews.content: No characters have any genuine wants or needs. Especially not the main character. Things are happening and then the movies fakes out the ending several time. Just finish already. Nothing makes sense, nothing is interesting, there is nothing at stake, no goal. It's not even especially pretty to look at (although it think it is).

Not like anything you've ever seen. Imagine Being John Malkovich made by a mad and warring combination of Monty Python and Disney. And it's even more gonzo and weird and wild and original than that.Unfortunately, just as you feel drawn into the existential complexities that one half of the creators are trying to explore, the other half interrupts with this godawful family values sugary nonsense. A touch of the Disney idiocy that infects and ruins an awful lot of modern cinema.And yes it tries too hard and tries to push too many things into a too small container and goes on too long. But unlike almost all modern cinema it actually tries to push the boundaries . And succeeds in many places and many different ways.And you simply cannot miss it. Miss Yeoh is truly spectacular. A depressed and anxious middle aged owner of a failing laundromat with a husband who wants a divorce and a daughter who seems to hate her, harried by the IRS in the person of Jamie Lee Curtis (worth the price of admission all alone), she finds that she exists in a parallel universe where she is the glamorous, rich, uber successful Kung Foo goddess Michele Yeoh. And exists also, somehow, in many, many other universes as many of the paths not taken in her life.And it is hysterical in parts. In fact it is so good so often that one is forced to think the family values jam larded over much of it was forced upon the directors by the studio or the backers.

It has been a long time since I've watched a movie that made me feel as though originality wasn't dead. This movie did that for me. It was an experience! The movie was visually appealing, well acted, well written, a bit bizarre but in the best ways possible and at the end of it all, it was deep.

This movie nominated for oscar ?Its a very bad joke
its totally insane.If you can say a word simply you must say it simple.Saying a drama concept with action and fantasy and comedy! Is unaccepted.From past years there was a path for asian movies however some of the were good but many of them were under average
my score is 0 for this movie because have not anything to teach me
best name for this movie = anything nowhere all is sh**t.This movie nominated for oscar ?Its a very bad joke
its totally insane.If you can say a word simply you must say it simple.Saying a drama concept with action and fantasy and comedy! Is unaccepted.From past years there was a path for asian movies however some of the were good but many of them were under average
my score is 0 for this movie because have not anything to teach me
best name for this movie = anything nowhere all is sh**t.

Seriously the reviews have to be paid for bc this movie is a headache to watch. Weird and confusing. I wouldn't force my worst enemy to sit through the 2 hour+ run time. Spare yourself from this trash!!!!

reviews.review_title: Not sure what I just watched, but I liked it.
reviews.content: There aren't many movies that manage this level of absurdity. There are even fewer movies that manage to stay coherent throughout.Everything Everywhere All at Once sure does manage both. It's hilarious yet touching. And so, so absurd.There are pop culture references, but not too many of them; it most movies these terribly annoy me, but they were oddly fitting here.The dialogues are often hilarious, making me laugh out loud.The action is fun, the VFX are surprisingly good (even though apparently done by amateurs?), the props are... deliberately terrible, maybe?I'd almost consider this a perfect movie, though there were a few times where the silliness was a bit much, and a few other times that felt a bit long. It's still a clear recommendation, though.Not that I have any idea what I just watched. It's really quite weird.

I was very surprised when this got 11 nominations.I watched movie a few months back, and I considered it cute experience, but nothing more.I watched it like some lighthearted comedy.But now - nominations didn't give me rest, and I wondered what did I miss the first time around.I watched it again now, with my full attention to get everything I can from this movie...I was blown away.Watching it seriously, trying to understand and comprehend everything - this is completely different movie.At the end I was left speechless.For everyone like me, who wonders what's the deal with this movie, watch it again with full focus. Maybe you'll change your mind...Just like I did...

I dont usually write reviews for movies but I felt i needed to after watch this gem. I am a very depressed and sad person who has a hard time see the good in life and the future. This movie made me realize that all of us need to open our minds and start to enjoy life and all we have. We as a human race need to start to come together and love one another again. We need to see what we have right in front of us and enjoy life because it will be over before you know it and we have wasted our whole lives worrying and complaining when we should have been doing what we love and bringing love to our whole. Please see this movie and take it to heart.

If we strip all the complexity that seems to have confused some in the reviews. There is one simple truth that can be taken from this film; love is everything, it's everywhere, and it's all at once. The message, be kind and loving. It's a tale as old as time, and it's timeless in the infinite wisdom of the multiverse.
This is a terrible film. If you find the idea of having hot dogs for fingers and eating them with ketchup and mustard hilariously funny then this is for you.

reviews.review_title: A dizzying whirlwind ride with a lot of heart
reviews.content: There's no better way to describe this film than the title itself, so I won't even try. It's a refreshing escape from the boring, mundane problems of life that just so happens to also be about the boring, mundane problems of life while somehow never becoming boring itself. Quite the opposite, this movie is a powerhouse freight train experience unlike anything I've ever seen or probably will ever see. And I've seen A LOT of movies. Imaginative, funny, moving, profound... while also frantic and almost seizure-inducing. It deserves every award it will probably win and I don't often say that about the big award contenders. The story is original, the characters feel like real people, the performances are incredibly moving and funny, and the direction is otherworldly...I have so much more I want to say about this film because it absolutely floored me, but it also left me discombobulated and I can't put all of my thoughts into comprehensible sentences, so I'll sum it all up with this: It's a heartfelt film about what beautiful messes human beings are... and how that's okay if we're okay with it.

reviews.review_title: Good beginning. Good ending. Mess of a middle.
reviews.content: Good beginning establishing the characters and a glimpse of where the story was headed. Good ending tying things up and brining their point to bear. Mess of a middle that needed serious tightening up and editing. Was all over the place caught up in visuals that while interesting did not further the story. Way too long. Could have cut 45 minutes and not effected the story. Michelle Yeoh did an amazing job as she always does. Jamie Lee Curtis did a great job in her offbeat role. That being said, outside of Michelle Yeoh the characters were underdeveloped. I wanted to like this film. I had been looking forward to seeing it. And I did. Once will be enough.

reviews.review_title: Read nothing but praise and wasn't let down
reviews.content: I watched the movie in cinemas twice, and didn't finish my snack on either occasion. Every moment and little detail was thought out. It was original, funny and touching at the same time. I get why some people rate it poorly, I guess it isn't everyone's cup of tea. But if you like it, you probably love it.

Absolutely Beautiful. Just beautiful. It reaches a range of emotions that are not usually felt while watching a movie. Some of the most purest feelings you can feel as a human are being displayed in such an authentic and mesmerizing way.

reviews.review_title: Therapy would have been easier and less destructive
reviews.content: Instead we're treated to this rather contrived plot pitting mother versus daughter and daughter versus father. Throw in some marital dysfunction and self-loathing and viola.

reviews.review_title: The heart has its reason that reason knows nothing of
reviews.content: If you open your mind and your heart, u can see the film's meaning. It's a message of love in a land of war, a scream of unity (as family, friends, humans..) in a society of individuals, an hymn to the failure in a world of forced success. It's human and should be more intimistic or more adventurous, but it's what we are & what we should be. The better version of us is inside & not outside: changing is possible everytime, everywhere & all at once!Sorry for my English but I only want to add my little voice at the others that describes with better words this incredible, beautiful, lovely & gorgeous film where all is one & one is all!

reviews.review_title: If marvel made a R rated movie:
reviews.content:
Fun fact: the 5 people responsible for the visual effects are SELF LEARNED!!..
the movie was nice visually and well written, although the comedy ruins it sometimes and the hotdog part was disgusting i had almost thrown up in the movie but i can tell you it's a MUST WATCH. Enjoy.

My husband and I tried to like this, but it was all over the place. Hotdog fingers, dildos, googly eyes? We can't understand all the great reviews and nominations. We love movies of all genres , but truly didn't like this one. The acting was good if there is something nice to say. Jamie Lee Curtis up for an Oscar for her role? Weren't there other roles more worthy? We didn't understand that either.We kept watching as the beginning held our interest, but it just got too silly and crazy. It was just a big ridiculous mess. How so many others can claim this movie is a masterpiece is a complete mystery to us.

reviews.review_title: This is by far the best movie I've ever seen
reviews.content: Nothing is even close. This film is an absolute masterpiece. It is captivating, exciting, visually stunning, funny, original, and deeply moving.The concept is not like anything I have ever see and at no point did I see where it was going. The action sequences are extremely fun and well done and the storyline and writing are genius. And to cap it off in the end they managed to bring it all together with the painfully universal feeling of futility in trying to find purpose in the pointlessness of humanity.To come up with something this unique and make it connect on every level a movie can is a remarkable achievement. It is as close to a perfect movie as I've ever seen. The filmmakers made something truly special that sets a new bar for excellence in film for this decade.

reviews.review_title: I wasn't impressed... then I watched it!!!
reviews.content: I heard mixed reviews when this was released, with someone saying this was the best movie they have ever seen, which sounded ridiculous and my more balanced friends telling me it was absolute rubbish. It looked rubbish so I gave it a miss on the big screen. I couldn't understand the fuss and the reason it got so many oscar nominations until I watched it on a flight just, and it is absolutely...brilliant!!!!!!!! It is in fact a masterpiece... if you follow it, and understand it, and I guess if you understand human nature, human experience, heartache, frustrations and human experience. Which is what the movie is actually about. It's about one person's journey through all of this, which appears, and i use that word carefully - to take them through this multiverse of madness to bring them to a real life epiphany, a realisation of who and why they are. It is absolutely brilliant if you understand that. And probably very grotesque and annoying if you don't get it. I can see why some people hate it. You need to watch it again. It is such an emotional joy. Wow. Applause all round!!!!

USA is not.perfect but this is definitely a message movie for China more than America. Traditional Chinese values, pretty much a LOT of places, don't accept gays and a lot of things. Very traditional people. So I felt I was being preached too. Outside that it was a bit weird and hard to follow sometimes. Crowd laughed and seemed to enjoy it. For me it was silly, weird, hard to follow sometimes, and Iover cooked on all the messages.

As a Asian, I can relate the family in the film with mine, great plot with lots of climate and funny scene. Really put me in to though about many stuff, I would recommend go and watch as blind as you can, really great movie, would go and watch it a few more time.

reviews.review_title: If you want to get dizzy watch this
reviews.content: This is one of those pretentious drivel that everyone is keen to gulp down and rate 10/10. The speed of things going on is ridiculous. Then you have scenes where the lights are flashing as if to induce a seizure. Lastly, you have long drawn out scenes in either slow-mo or super slow dialogue. The movie is way too long for its own good and loses its charm by the 30 minute mark.

reviews.review_title: One of the best films in recent memory
reviews.content: This lives up to its name, takes you on an emotional and thought-provoking journey that keeps you glued to the screen. This made its way into my short list of best films ever watched, highly recommended.

"Exhausting" is the one word review that I wanted to leave here but am not permitted to because of the minimum character requirement for these reviews. But "exhausting" really does say it all. From the get-go this film assaults you with input from a thousand directions. You feel as though you're being overwhelmingly battered by two or three prize fighters at once, but the rounds aren't three minutes, they are more like 120 minutes. So, no respite or opportunity to regroup. It just keeps jerking you around without mercy. I was able to stay with it for about thirty minutes, then I had to just turn it off. I'll say it again, it's just simply exhausting. Good luck to you if you want to give it a try.

reviews.review_title: All the Feels all at once
reviews.content: I laughed, I cried, I felt everything at once! Sharp absurdity with heartfelt acting that melts the most cynical of hearts. Buckle up and enjoy the entire ride into the multiverse!

reviews.review_title: I'd like the salt bagel instead!
reviews.content:
Everything Everywhere All at Once (2022)
Directors: Daniel Kwan & Daniel Scheinert
Watched: 12/19/22
Rating: 3/5 starsToo much all at once
Googly eyes, hot dogs, and rocks
Absurd time travel
Profound fun with keen acting
But I'll take a salt bagel!#tanka #reviewpoem #SAGAwards #A24 #AsianAmerican #assimilation #auteur #familysaga #LGBT #motherdaughter #multiverse #nihilism #philosophy #sciencefiction #styleoversubstance #timetravelThe tanka is a thirty-one-syllable poem, traditionally written in a single unbroken line. A form of waka, Japanese song or verse, tanka translates as "short song," and is better known in its five-line, 5/7/5/7/7 syllable count form.

reviews.review_title: PURE CINEMA - EVERYTHING IS A WINNER
reviews.content: Oh my, what a wonderful film. The performances are off the chain. Mostly though, THIS is the type of film that we used to GO TO THE MOVIES for. It is an escape, it grabs you right away and takes you through its multiverse on a joy ride AND on its terms. It is PURE CINEMA. I can see why it is getting all the praise and accolades it has already gotten, and I couldn't be happier for Michelle Yeoh, who I have been watching for decades FINALLY getting such a prime role. So fabulous watching her on this run right now. If you are really deep into this film like I was, check out the link and look at all the trivia already there. This is a complex art piece, but the trivia gives a ton of insight into the ins and outs of their world. A lot went into this film and it packs an entertaining punch. One for the ages. It really is that great.

reviews.review_title: The result of a big blender of ideas
reviews.content: This film certainly lives up to its title, almost resembling the dense but vaguely defined bagel of doom featured so heavily in the story. In an impressive act of creativity and filming techniques from a limited crew, Everything Everywhere All at Once features an incredible myriad of visual ideas and alternate characters that all serve common themes. Near the beginning, the execution was nearly flawless - we get to know Evelyn and her daughter Joy, there is a palpable sense of mystery and creative fight scenes bring in the multiverse concept. Later on, however, the film gets bogged down with too many sides to each fight, very slow pacing and weaving too many thematic threads back together. One theme is intergenerational acceptance, which has been common in recent films like Encanto and Turning Red. Another is battling nihilism by choosing to love specific individuals, much like the rose in The Little Prince. Others include enjoying the surrealism of the universe, being comfortable with our choices and exploring the opportunities in front of us. By the end, the bagel that is Everything Everywhere All at Once has become overloaded.

Originally when I first went to see the film I really didn't expect much of it, I just thought of it as another film of the bunch... how wrong I was about that. This movie has a heavy underlying theme while still managing to remain comical and interesting from the beginning to end, it manages to be funny, while sad at the same time and through the use of a semi erratic cinematography it manages to convey that chaotic feeling on which the film is based about. Truly a spectacular film that not only deserves the recognition of the academy, but of the public altogether, truly an enjoyable near perfect film.

reviews.review_title: Not sure if I liked it or hated it
reviews.content: This was undoubtedly fun to watch. So many vibrant and interesting scenes. Great concepts, great acting, and some of the best fight scenes i've ever seen. However, this movie was almost too fun, it made the dialogue scenes boring and out of place. I would probably love this movie if I were 10-12, but I definitely saw some scenes that were out of place and did not add much to the story. Again, great concept and a super fun watch, but was a bit over the top for my liking.

Inventive thinking. It's like the matric universe jumping into multiverses. However it needs getting used to with the Chinese dialogue. Its a fun concept but I don't think it's a movie for me. It's an action movie. .

Everyone speaks different dialects or languages. No one seems to express everything they feel. As a result...chaos. Of course, this representation of chaos is extreme and fun/crazy/over-the-top! But it's all about family and I loved every dysfunctional second. As a mom, is the great evil the power of our children? Are we parents the great evil in our children's lives? Probably.This movie is so brilliant that I had to watch it twice. I actually don't love all the martial arts fighting but it still works. Fantastic!

reviews.review_title: Interesting but way to long , was bored after an hour
reviews.content: Very interesting concept and story digital effects and everything else about the movie but was bored around the hour and 10 minutes mark. Could of been extremely good but it carried on alot!

reviews.review_title: Unique, creative and simply a masterpiece
reviews.content: Storyline and plot is 10/10, very deep and relatable. Acting is good and editing/clipping is some of the most creative and visually appealing i've ecer seen.You must watch this, and pay attention to details.Ps. You are beautiful 👌

Ok I'm still trying to work out if it's the antibiotics and night nurse I'm tripping with or if that film is just insane. Egotistical rubbish that is trying to be 'different'. Much better films out there that do it so much more creatively. Didn't realise until I read a review after and it's by the same people who did the Swiss Army Man film with Daniel Radcliffe. That was tripe too.1 star for costume and make up
1 star for the chap from the GooniesWatch it but be warned you will not get 2 plus hours back of your life.
Funny movie but I feel it could have been much shorter as it became very long to sit and watch this to the end. They could have cut about 30 minutes of this movie and it would have been better IMO.

Not just one of the best movies of the year, but one of the best movies of all time. The fact that it is nominated for 11 Oscars is not surprising at all and I really think this movie will go in the history of cinema as one of the best, because it really is. The film is very powerful and impactful. After watching, you want to sit down and think again, what if nothing really matters in the end? But it is very good that the end of the film answers this question, that everything matters and any change affects the fate of people in different universes, but the most important thing is that there is love and joy in everyday life that is worth living for.The film evokes a lot of emotions and makes you think about it a lot. Watching the whole movie is like feeling all the emotions - from laughter to tears, but those moments that make you cry are very effective. For example, Evelyn tells her daughter, "Maybe it's like you said. Maybe there is something out there, some new discovery that will make us feel even smaller. Something that explains why you still went looking for me through all of this noise and why no matter what, I still want to be here with you. I will always, always, want to be here with you." Joy tells, "Here, all we get are a few specks of time where any of this actually makes any sense." But Evelyn refuses to let go of her daughter and says, "Then I will cherish these few specks of time." And it was after this moment that I couldn't stop crying.Actually, a lot can be written about this movie, but no words will describe it, because it is not only a movie, but it is like an experience that will remain in the memory for a very long time. So if you haven't seen this film yet and are wondering if it's worth watching, trust me, it's worth every minute you spend watching it.

This movie is over hyped. It is a cheap cheesy version of The Matrix. The plot had been used several times in other films. It is also very long and should have been edited. It is very Confusing at times. I did not like it at all. The movie is special maybe because it has diverse characters with more Asian representation. It is trying hard to be like The Matrix infused with family/ mother daughter/ father daughter drama with a touch of gay story.Nevertheless, Michelle Yeoh is great in here except for corny seen before misuttered English words. I like her better in Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon.

reviews.review_title: About as well-rounded as films come
reviews.content: I can't remember the last time I saw a film where it was so clear just how much effort had gone into it. The amount of costume changes and set designs and work put into a tenth of a second shot in this film is incredible. There was a lot of care put into 'Everything Everywhere All at Once'.This film reminds me of what the MCU films could be if they were actually interesting. The concept of a multi-verse (for lack of a better term) is such a good one to base a movie around. The possibilities are endless.I was surprised by just how funny the film was capable of being. I could tell immediately how smart and clever it was going to be, however I didn't expect the amount of laughs I got.The film is long at around 2 hours and 20 minutes and it can get a little overwhelming if you switch off even for a moment. Otherwise though this was a thoroughly enjoyable experience. One of the most well rounded films I've seen in a long time. 8/10.
My new favorite movie.As a asian in closet and living in US right now, there are so many things in this movie that I feel related. And the movie tells all that kind of things in a really funny way.

reviews.review_title: So Terrible - I'd give a zero if I could
reviews.content: I don't get the hype surrounding this film at all. Eleven! 11 Academy Award nominations, really?I suffered through the entire movie hoping it would improve and wishing it would just end. It is the visual equivalent of a bad LSD trip . I wondered what kind of drugs the writers were on when they wrote this. I wanted to like this because I like Michelle Yeoh; I typically like SciFi movies; and I'd read that this was much better than Dr Strange MoM and it absolutely is NOT better, which is saying a lot because MoM is a chaotic mess.I also asked my 30-something son to watch it so I could get the opinion of someone else who I know for a fact has common sense and who is not narcissistic or nuts like many of his peers. Looking forward to his comments.My advice, don't wast your time.

Blows away my prev fave..Crazy Rich Asians. Randomness of Family Guy! Slapstick action comedy like Kung Fu Hustle and Shaolin Soccer! Addresses the Asian Am experience of Tiger Moms/parents. A love story! At the end of the day, a family movie!

Michelle Yeoh is up & front & center in this unwieldy inter-dimensional comedy which finds a harried laundromat owner going through the motions as everything seems to be going wrong for her (she's being audited by an overzealous IRS rep, played by Jamie Lee Curtis, her hubby, Ke Huy Kuan, is about to file for divorce & her gay daughter, Stephanie Hsu, wants to show off her girlfriend to her family & possibly bigoted grandfather, James Hong). The pressure becomes so paramount Yeoh is visited by another Kuan from another universe who explains her heightened state may fracture time & space as she knows it. Fighting both physically & emotionally to keep it together soon runs the gamut of the film's run time (a bit too long for my taste but my viewing partner loved it) as the inventive directors, the Daniels (Swiss Army Man), throw everything & the kitchen sink at the screen (love the parody of Wong Kar Wei films) to bring this phantasmagoria to existence w/all the actors game for the lunacy (especially Kuan who pretty much retired from acting but came back for this) w/a nice showcase for Yeoh who steps up to the challenge to steer a picture by herself. Also starring Jenny Slate as a customer (identified as Big Nose, sheesh!) & Glee alum Harry Shum as a chef.

Everything Everywhere All At Once perfectly manages to tell a multiverse story, juggling MANY different genres, from sci-fi, martial arts, black comedy, action and family drama without losing their tone or direction. It somehow manages to tell a realistic and relatable story about family without becoming bogged down by world building when creating its version of the multiverse.Speaking of the Quan family, the film does a wonderful job giving an accurate and all-too-relatable representation of Asian family life in North America. The way Evelyn constantly nags Joy about being "too fat", having tattoos, being rebellious and having a white partner is relatable for any Asian kid growing up in North America. All of Evelyn's disappointments in Joy eventually led to her becoming depressed, hence creating the bagel. Hollywood has a long track record of Asian misrepresentation, so to see the struggles of an Asian American family being accurately portrayed on screen is so refreshing to me.Along with the realistic and relatable Asian representation, there are some heavy themes revolving around depression, existentialism and nihilism. Just look at how the Everything Bagel is treated; it is a multiversal black hole because Joy pretty much had a psychotic break in one universe and came to believe that nothing truly matters in life. I personally saw this as an allegory for depression as everything about Joy's personality was placed on this Bagel and could never find the good in it, eventually leading to her to enter the black hole as a way to find peace and stop agonizing over a meaningless life.These are without a doubt some of the best performances of 2022 so far. Michelle Yeoh was extremely convincing as a woman who's basically always in crisis mode, dealing with her family and business trying to get through an audit. But the true star of the show, is Ke Huy Quan, which is apparently his first movie role in almost 20 years. He is a simple man who is quite happy with his life and is very personable, choosing kindness in the face of negativity and puts everyone else before himself.Everything Everywhere All at Once is one of the most original films of 2022, delving into family dynamics, mental health, existence, and presenting realistic Asian representation for mainstream audiences. An epic and very personal story with excellent acting, gorgeous cinematography and inventive editing created a movie going experience I have never had before. This is a movie that will not be forgotten by the film community for a very long time.

reviews.review_title: Kung Fu action in the Multiverse = Perfect
reviews.content: It's safe to say that "Everything Everywhere All at Once" is a film that fires on all cylinders. It blends together elements of Kung fu cinema and postmodernism in the same vein as "The Matrix" except this film focuses on concepts of the multiverse. Not only is this a great action film but it's one of the funniest films I've seen this year.Michelle Yeoh, a veteran actress in martial arts cinema, plays a housewife whose estranged relationship with her daughter forms a rivalry across the multiverse which causes everything to fall into chaos. Interestingly enough, the mother-daughter relationship is thematically similar to Pixar's "Turning Red" except the plot is reversed. However, in spite of the film's incredibly bizarre plot, the storytelling is done exceedingly well. The film manages to be very emotional despite being surrealistic and hilariously over-the-top which makes this one of the most unique movies of 2022 and perhaps a candidate for best film of 2022. Veteran stars Jamie Lee Curtis and James Hong also make a return as a supporting cast in the film. Jamie Lee Curtis plays one of her best roles yet, an antagonist who's genuinely frightening and hilarious at the same time which matches the tone of rest of the film. James Hong, now 93 years old and still active in Hollywood, continues to deliver a great performance as the aging father of Michelle Yeoh's character who cares deeply for his family yet feels conflicted over his daughter and granddaughter's choices which clash with family tradition.Overall, the film is a story about a clash of generations which is executed surrealistically and in a way that can be described as a perfect mish-mash of Kung fu action and postmodernist cinema.

reviews.review_title: I didn't not expect this movie to almost make me cry.
reviews.content: The makers of Swiss Army Man are at it again. I never expected this movie to trigger an emotional response. It's rare that a film does. This movie is so wild and unpredictable, and unique. The last half hour of this movie was outrageous and beautiful and left me feeling at peace with my own struggles. The acting is incredible, Ke Huy Quan almost made me cry with his ending speech. I expected to laugh, which I did, but I never expected to be emotionally impacted the way that I was. This film is so left field in the best way possible, I think everyone should see it.

I watch at least 200 movies a year, and this is by far my favorite movie of all time. No other movie has made me laugh, cry, and wonder how A24 could make a movie this fantastic. It's so ridiculous and impressive how I could feel so much for a story with a literal everything bagel in it. The cast was perfect, Jamie lee Curtis is a fantastic supporting actor and the leads are amazing. This movie has some of the greatest and most creative action sequences I've ever seen and it deserves a lot more recognition. This movie is in my opinion the great movie of 2022 and is a must watch for anyone that enjoys movies.

reviews.review_title: One of the dumbest movies, kept expecting it to get better
reviews.content: My husband and I watched this movie until the end but kept saying how did it get an Oscar nomination for best picture and 10 other nominations? It has been described as an "artistic" movie but it did not have much of a plot and the whole movie was meaningless. The special effects, costumes and music were not anything special and yet received a nomination in each of those categories. The only nomination that made slight sense was for best actress, Michelle Yeoh.It must be a slow year for movies. We kept watching hoping it would get better since the movie received so many nominations. It did not.

Everything Everywhere All at Once is an experimental, fast and quirky fantasy movie with humorous elements featuring a balanced cast combining veteran actresses and actors such as Michelle Yeoh and Ke Huy Quan with young and talented newcomers such as Stephanie Hsu and Tallie Medel.The movie revolves around laundry shop owner Evelyn Wang who faces quite a few challenges in her life. Her elderly father keeps criticizing her, she fails to show any affection to her delicate husband who wants to divorce her, her daughter feels misunderstood regarding her sexual identity and her poorly aged business is facing bankruptcy. Just as everything seems to be falling apart, Evelyn Wang gets the opportunity to experience different scenarios based upon important life choices she has made. The elderly woman experiences her career as a famous actress, as a martial artist or a lesbian with deformed fingers. However, all these alternative realities are menaced by the anger, deception and despair of her daughter. Evelyn Wang must find a way to connect with her daughter in order to find her way back to reality and solve her numerous problems.On the positive side, this movie convinces with creative, fluid and unexpected storytelling. The different realities are colourful, exotic and funny. The movie comes around with multiple surprises out of left field that will keep the audience watching until the very end. The acting performances keep the movie together as especially the veteran actresses and actors convincingly play characters with depth, heart and soul.On the negative side, the film's storytelling can at times be overwhelming and needs a lot of acceptance, focus and patience to be enjoyed to the fullest. The story itself is walking on thin ice and filled with quite a few stereotypes hidden by the bubbly characters and alternative realities.At the end of the day, Everything Everywhere All at Once is a movie that will divide the masses. Some might call it pretentious nonsense offered at a headache-inducing speed while others will praise its unconventional storytelling and unique characters. No matter where you stand on the issue, one thing is undeniable: this movie is unlike any other you have ever watched and therefore worth everyone's attention. Personally, I'm glad to see that there are still movies that manage to surprise me and push cinematic experiences to a new level.

reviews.review_title: A chaotic masterpiece in which I found my life meaning
reviews.content:
A chaotic masterpiece that heals generational mommy issues and coincidentally the deep pain of feeling unloved, unwanted and misunderstood. This cinematic universe is the definition of not letting them know your next move that perplexes space and time. A simplistic sandwich with unorganized space in between propels us into all the emotions the human body can comprehend.You could sit a million people down and have them watch this movie and you'd get a million and one different perspectives and outcomes from this richly symbolistic experience.I find it quite interesting that it starts with a young girl who deeply feels pain from her mothers lack of acceptance and comprehension of who she actually is. Her deep pain catapults into a whirlwind that sends her mother on a quest to understand her whilst uncovering her own pain within her soul.A canvas of possibilities left me feeling healed, heard and seen with my own life path. For our realities are but a moment that seeps into the continuum of time, whisping by if we float along. I learned these things from such a journey...
1. Do not for a moment believe you are unloved or alone. There is always someone out there who cares, and sometimes that person may be you looking from a different light.2. Generational approval and love is deeply rooted within our emotional human genome. It drives us incessantly in every direction, all at once, even if we may mock our desire for such approval. Think about how you treat those you are closest to, for one small act can change a heart that perceives it's sinking
3. All decisions and thoughts build us into who we are. You are in control of your life. Not in every aspect of our lives but the richness that can be uncovered within, for we are the ones who can control how we act when the world around us moves. It is the human races super power to do so and it's a beautiful thing.4. The fragility of life teeters on everything literally all at once, all it takes to move in one direction or another is choice. And that choice is yours wholly. Make it count but if you feel you have failed, get back up and try again... and again... and again until you have fulfilled your rightful purpose here in existence.5. Do not for one second believe that your efforts are without. You are the one who depicts the outcome, even if it may take a lifetime to unfold. The mothers' efforts were not without. Your efforts are not without and never will be, it just may be that time needs to be fed for the flowers to blossom. Do not lose hope, for that is not a life worth trudging through. Hope is found in all walks of life and in all experiences. Believe in yourself and believe that hope is possible at every turn.A poetic way of showcasing the chaos found within the human experience is simple, unexpected, humorous and beautiful. Life keeps moving past until we are the ones that change its course. That is the secret ingredient for life, making decisions for ourselves to make life richer than before. For we are the masters of this so called world, it's just waiting for us to comprehend the power we have within our being.Absolutely beautiful. Absolutely honest. And absolutely real when we feel everything everywhere all at once.

reviews.review_title: A creative film BUT not worth the hype
reviews.content:
Everything, Everywhere, All at Once is a very deep film that touches your heart. It keeps the audience hooked from beginning to end. However, many will argue with me and disagree but I really don't get the hype over it. I see the film as a very normal film with a typical story, nothing special or new at all. The film has great humor, not going to lie when I say that I was laughing the whole time. A great sense of humor in a great time and in a good decent amount. Not too much but too little at this time, there is a great balance. There weren't any great shots, a film like that can easily be visually stunning as the director had a huge chance to allow some great shots but nothing was there. In addition, the runtime might seem a little bit too long, especially towards the end. I started to struggle during the last act because my attention span was expired.The film has a great plot and the writing is so well done and balanced very well. The script is solid and put together in a way that is hilarious due to the creative ideas the film had in which the things that were included won't come up to any writer's mind. The film discusses the idea of the multiverse in a way that will never be discussed in any other film or tv show which is why it's a unique film. Audience members get to witness a long, funny, and great journey with the characters as they will stay hooked and will want more due to how amazing the story is.A great acting performance from Michelle Yeoh as she plays the struggling mother. She was able to show that struggle in her body language, voice tone, and facial expressions. As well as Ke Huy Quan with his transition from one character to another (I'm not going to dive much into the two different characters that he plays to avoid spoilers). But, his shift from one character to another reminded me of Oscar Isaac's great performance whenever he shifts from Marc Spector to Steven Grant in MoonKnight (2022 - ).In conclusion, I was, unfortunately, a little bit disappointed as I saw the high ratings. But, when I watched the film, I kept waiting and waiting for something special to happen but I realized there was nothing. The film didn't touch me at all and I didn't feel empathy toward the characters or the story. I wasn't feeling the way that the writers wanted me to feel and the same way that else felt while watching it.Perhaps this film needs a second watch (at least for me). It needs to be given another chance as some might get lost in terms of keeping on track with the story or the concept of the film as it explains some heavy stuff in a way that might feel like a fast pace for some.My rating is 8/10
Watched in the theatre.

IMDB ratings usually align with what I like or don't like, but this is unfortunately an exception where I think the imdb rating is way overhyped.First of all, I DO get this movie. I understand what it is trying to express, and I have no problem following the story (if you call it that) throughout the plot. BUT, the story is no doubt weird, and at times, unnecessarily gross and slightly disturbing. I just think the philosophical questions that the movie is trying to explore can be done in a MUCH more relevant way (like, fighting with dildo's? Making universe jumps by poking your own ass? .... really?) ... you wonder how sober the script writer was.And when i watched the movie, I couldn't help checking my watch cause the movie felt slow and boring, and I noticed quite a lot of people left the theater half-way through too. In hindsight, I should have too, now that's 2 hours I can never get back in my life.

reviews.review_title: For God's Sake People, Open Your Gobs And Talk To Your Loved Ones.
reviews.content:
Greetings And Salutations, and welcome to my review of Everything Everywhere All At Once; here's the breakdown of my ratings:Story: 1.50
Direction: 1.75
Pace: 1.75
Acting: 1.25
Enjoyment: 1.25TOTAL: 7.75 out of 10.00.Here's the thing, this film isn't that brilliant. However, what's clever is how the writers and directors wrap up a simple moral premise within an outrageous and semi-entertaining narrative and movie. They then smack you around the head with two iron bars that hold the virtuosity inscribed upon them; just to drive it into your noggins.The moral - Open Up And Fly: open your ears; open your eyes; open your hearts; open your mind; But, most of all, open your mouths and talk to one another, especially your loved ones. This process is your standard fundamental enlightenment, which many of us stupid humans fail at, myself included.Dan Kwan and Daniel Scheinert wrap up this nugget of comprehension in the tale of a dysfunctional family living in America. The mother, Evelyn Wang, is teetering on the brink of a breakdown. She's overworked and overrun by everything in her life. Her sick and dying father has moved into their small apartment. He's an old-fashioned Chinese who always wanted a male heir; a daughter was never good enough. She's unsure of her feelings towards her husband, Waymond; he's changed over the years and is no longer the man she married. Her daughter, Joy appears to be stuck in the teenage angst years, moping about all day and pouting. Even though she's not unhappy about her daughter's sexual preferences, she can't bring herself to tell her old-fashioned father that his granddaughter is homosexual. And then the intimidating, iniquitous IRS decides it's an ideal time for an audit. So things are looking as bleak as they ever could be for poor, ageing Evelyn. And they're not going to get any brighter. Evidently, before enlightenment shines, you need to stand on the verge of, and stare into, the abyss of the obsidian bagel of everything everywhere all at once. To get Evelyn to this moment of realisation and change, the writers bring in a multiverse of other Evelyns and her family members. They brought each of these Evelyns into life by using her choices. For example, in one universe, she ignores her father when he tells her not to run so fast and ends up falling, head and eyes first, onto broken chopsticks, leaving her blind. In another, she chooses not to elope with Waymond, remaining at home with her parents, she becomes a top martial artist and finds fortune and fame in the Chinese movie industry. It's one of these other multiverse hubbies that tack this "Worst Life Ever" Evelyn down, hoping she can halt the disruption Jobu Topaki is wreaking across the multiverse. This initial meeting is the start of Evelyn's great-awakening journey. The two Dan's do a superb job of multiverse building, and though some of them are super-silly, you never feel confused about what is happening in the story. Another bonus is the strong character-building they achieve. Everyone in the tale feels real. Moreover, they come across as believable. I knew this when I began to get the niggling feeling that Joy and Jobu needed a good smack to set them straight in their miss-thinking ways. Getting me to feel this shows the strength of their creations. Well Done, Dan and Dan. However, it's not all light and joy for the double D's. They have a failing - Comedy. There are moments when it works and many when it doesn't. It comes down to one reason, puerility. The story is strong and mature, yet sadly, the buffoonery is adolescent toilet humour and pretty unfunny, neigh, I'll say cringe-worthy. Worst yet, it spoils all the fine work they'd done before and after. I'm talking about the buttplug power to fight better and the dildo slap of death. Both of these could have been funnier if handled better. One element this film displays is America's terrible at double entendres; or that Jamie Lee Curtis's comedic timing and punch are woefully lacking. But I'll put it firmly at the feet of the Double D's as they wrote the truly unamusing and lame "hotdogs as fingers" sketch.That aside, they are entirely different animals behind the lens. And this juxtaposition makes the movie more entertaining and powerful. The two Dans dare to try both simple and tricky camera antics to intensify the viewers' excitement and hold their attention. The fight scenes are beautifully blended. They take the cutting to the next level as they utilise everything. What I admired most is how many fights had pauses dotted throughout them. Making them rollercoaster rides within the major coaster ride of the story. Jackie Chan used this feature a lot in his combat sequences. It allowed the director to add in extra human touches, like running out of breath, feeling pain, etc, which also added humour, before the incredibly breathtaking punches and kicks flew again. The Dans employ them to display a character's thoughts and realisation and multiverse flashes. In fact, the only place they stumble is with the puerile humour. For me, it's shot too crisply and cleanly, which diminished its power to make me giggle.I've always been a fan of Michelle Yeoh, right from her early days when she starred alongside Jackie Chan in Twinkle Twinkle Lucky Stars. And though that movie had some cheesy moments, her performances never stunk. And neither does her portrayal of Evelyn. Everything Everywhere All At Once shows what a dynamite powerhouse she's become. But this movie wouldn't be so enjoyable if we didn't have Ke Huy Quan as Waymond. Quan superbly shifts from cuckold wimp to kick-arse hero mode flawlessly. If he'd been unable to sell the credibility of either character and the transition between them, the film would've bombed, and fast. And I can never say a bad word about the excellent James Hong. He's another stalwart actor who's seldom given a poor performance. The cast would've been perfect had Stephanie Hsu given her character more oomph. Even as Jobu, when she's all peacocked up, she's drab and dull. This fault may stem from the Double D's idea of her characters. However, more personality wouldn't have gone amiss. She's so tediously bland that she's nearly nonexistent - Jobu! The worst villain ever.Remove the horrid humour, and you have an engaging and entertaining moralistic story and film. As such, I'd highly recommend it to both Martial Arts fans and Sci-Fi nuts. I'll be returning to it soon, though it'll just be to watch Michelle Yeoh kick arse. Just remember the moral and open up, speak out, but do it respectfully.Now you've finished watching this self-help picture for the Department of Mental Health, sit down, take a deep breath, and please read my IMDb lists - Holding Out For A Hero, The Final Frontier, and Just For Laughs to see where I rated Everything Everywhere All At Once.Take Care & Stay Well.

This movie is like nothing you've ever seen before, but it's amazing. It's hilarious, it's awesome, and it made me cry. It is not a simple story, and it takes some patience, but this is the kind of storytelling that is truly masterful. To take all of these parts and weave them into such a compelling whole is so impressive. Before I watched it I thought, "140 minutes, really?" And 30 minutes in, honestly I was a bit bored. But I stuck with it, and when I finished I was basically just in shock. Like holy crap, I can't believe how much I enjoyed that insane ride.It may not be for everyone, but from story, to acting, to score, to editing, it's just so well done. Whether or not you enjoy it, you have to at least admire it.
Not a lot of movies can be so many genres all at once and succeed at it. Comedy, action, sci-fi, drama, thriller and a love story; this movie achieves it all. Simply put, this movie is a masterpiece.

reviews.review_title: A incredibly boring and long rip off of any Rick and Morty episode
reviews.content: If you want to watch a super long Rick & Morty episode but with bad jokes instead (jokes in the style of the scary movies franchise) you might enjoy this rubbish. If that's not what you are looking for, don't waste your money or your time. Really really bad.
I don't want to describe anything that happens in this brilliant WEIRD movie. I loved it. It really left me in a better mood than when I started the movie. Michelle Yeoh continues to be astonishing.

I've been watching this movie again and again since it came out last year and it gets better every time. This is the first movie that gives me something more every time I rewatch it. There's a small thing that I see on a rewatch that I haven't seen earlier. It's such an overwhelming experience, it feels exactly like the title says. It's an exhausting movie that leaves you just thinking about it afterwards. You just want to sit back in silence and think about everything.It's so many things all at once it definitely is not for everyone. But for me, it was exactly what I would want from a movie.

All great movies should do 3 things. They should entertain you, they should move you, and they should make you think.Everything about this movie is entertaining. This movie has a plot and action sequences rivaling the biggest budget marvel films and some of the most creative fight sequences ever imagined. The plot and its subsequent action sequences and dialogue is so inspired and endlessly inventive. The filmmakers took the idea of a "multiverse" and used it to craft one of the most entertaining (and hilarious) stories to ever grace the big screen.Everywhere you look, this film is thoughtfully written with profound human experiences, deep, relatable characters and strong moving moments. Throughout the flashes of multiverse madness we are shown such a gripping and powerful story about family and relationships that is so brilliantly acted by a cast that is able to jump from one beat to another, broadcasting a spectrum of colorful emotions all while soaring through character arcs so wrought with emotion you may even find yourself tearing up.All at once, this movie is profound. This movie is as deep and intelligent as it is bonkers and emotional. The centrifugal force pulling all of this together is the movie's philosophy. This is one of existential meaning; touching upon the surface of our daily interactions, all the way to our complex personal relationships, and even deeper down to our universal purpose and the meaning of every one of our actions. This movie is as much a dissertation of philosophy as it is anything else. There are so many movies and shows exploring the idea of "the multiverse" but by far this is the most critical and complex to date. It uses this theme to dive straight into a theory of everything, exploring the age old of why we are here.I can't recommend this movie enough. It's so richly inspired and so delightfully fun, moving and thought provoking. This movie is Everything, Everywhere, All at Once.

Nothing matters whether I review it or not maybe its just this cinema's magic that made me do it. EEAAO takes the viewers on a philosophical genre-blending ride through the multiverse.The fiction of multiverse is crafted astoundingly as an allegory to our mind's absurdity and ambivalence. I am pretty sure it will amaze you, shock you, confuse you, irritate you, make you cry, laugh, and love all at once.The film's introduction to multiple realities of life is in itself mind boggling albeit uncountable questions comes along with which the film answers with different abstract emotions making it more convincing."Maybe the meaning of life is kindness. Maybe we should cling to each other. Maybe we should learn to let go. Maybe it's all meaningless. Or rather... maybe it's everything, everywhere, all at once."

Starts off odd.Gets odder.Gets a bit odder.Just when you think it can't get odder, it does.Characters are likeable.Full of action.Very hard to follow whats going on.Its great fun. Its a full on experience.Little long maybe and not to everyone's taste but fun, and funny.
This may be the most brilliantly written movie I've ever witnessed. It's perfect from start to finish and it will literally make you feel everything, everywhere, all at once.Beautiful film.

Of course there are elements in this movie I could relate to other films, but the way it's put together, the humor, the sincerity, the visuals, everything is everywhere all at once. The title is perfect. The acting is amazing. The story is touching and relatable. Loved it.

reviews.review_title: Stop reading reviews and go see this in the theater.
reviews.content: This movie is unlike any I have seen. I am a 42yo movie buff, so that's saying something. Go in knowing as little as possible and drop all expectations. Enjoy the ride!

reviews.review_title: Too easy to get lost in
reviews.content: It's a good movie. It just tries to do too much and it's so easy to get lost during it. There are so many things happening all the time that I couldn't really relate to or identify with any scene or relationship. I loved the beginning and I liked the end, everything in-between felt too complicated for me to fully enjoy.I liked the exploration of the protagonist's relationship with her daughter, I thought it was an interesting take and the cinematography and CGI are incredible.It just felt too long and repetitive sometimes.Overall it's a cool and creative idea but that doesn't necessarily make it an interesting movie all the time.

This is the best multi-verse movie I've seen. It took a while to get going but it was a non-stop ride when it started. Great mix of CGI & practical effects and the story was heartwarming. This was a fluke watch for me as I had not heard about it and sorta went into it blind. So glad I took a chance on it.

reviews.review_title: An hour earlier would have been a great choice.
reviews.content: A visual overload experience for a popular storyline that neither goes deep, nor is it original in any shape or form. The visuals were great and some of the findings were very clever but the repetitiveness of the same jokes over and over and over again was tiresome. I honestly felt that they didn't know how to finish the film. An hour earlier would have been a great choice.

Just got out from seeing this movie, and I've been scouring my brain trying to think of a film I've seen that made me laugh as hard as it made me cry. The cinematography, set design, and costuming are all so meticulous handled; you can feel the amount of love and attention every aspect was given. The different gags throughout upped the ante every time and rarely missed. The pain was so deep, personal, and specific and yet also so broadly human that it would be impossible not to be moved. I love this movie. I wish more movies were like this movie. Do yourself a favor and go see it.

reviews.review_title: Shang-Chi should hire this fight choreographer
reviews.content: Everything Everywhere is a chaotic multi-genre film. It is partly a family drama (mostly mother-daughter), partly sci-fi/fantasy (jumping between multiple parallel universes), and partly an action film. Fight scene weapons include folded chairs, weighted fanny packs, and office equipment. That brings to mind Shang-Chi (of the Ten Rings), who was supposed to have been taught a variety of fighting methods, but stuck to fairly traditional weapons.Michelle Yeoh does wonderfully as a harried immigrant woman, running a laundry business, dealing with a tax audit, having her estranged father arrive (he never approved her marriage), while being dragged unwillingly into a situation where she found a universe-jumping technique (in a different universe) and created a monster that had to be stopped. The script has the mention-then-use rule. Inadmissible deductions in the audit foresee her alternate realities. A lot of fights in various universes happen in the audit office, and what appears to be butt plugs displayed there are also used later.The problem I have is that the whirlwind of universes left me mentally breathless.

After reading some of the positive reviews I thought what the heck I'll give it a try. I'm always up for a good sci-fi. I personally found it very confusing with a chuckle thrown in here and there. My conclusion is that people that actually liked it must've been drunk or on drugs.

reviews.review_title: Every feeling everywhere all at once
reviews.content: I don't get why people who watched the film for 20-45 minutes can come here and claim it was an unfunny, boring and chaotic movie and people shouldn't watch it.You should watch it, I believe this is a masterpiece that will change how we see things, how we see each other, and most of all, how we see ourselves.I can agree that the first half hour was a bit confusing, but after a while I began to see the connection, the emotions, the harsh reality of how this was so close to my own home. And once I got all of that, I saw a beautiful cinematic piece unfold into an incredible storyline. You must embrace the chaos to get the chaos.So please watch until the very end, you'll like it. And you'll get it.

reviews.review_title: Still processing the fact that I have a new favourite film
reviews.content: If you're like me, you maybe have had a handful of favourite movies in your life, and you hold them tight and close like little personal treasures. It can be hard to demote a film to "second favourite," especially if it's held the #1 spot for some time, but every so often you see something that challenges for that title. I seriously doubt that I'm the only one who has found a new favourite movie after this experience.I do very much mean experience, too. EEAAO will have you laughing, crying, and laughing again on repeat for more than two hours. Every genre imaginable fits perfectly and purposefully into the film, and you never feel like the plot has left you behind. The story pulled me through from start to finish as light speed and left me feeling a mix of sonder and joy.As a clear early front runner for next year's Best Picture (sorry, Dune 2), this movie will make you feel something, everything, everywhere, all at once. Go with a friend, go by yourself, go as many times as you damn well please because nothing matters. Just see this movie.

reviews.review_title: Weirdly Pleasing, But not as Great as Everyone Says it is
reviews.content: Everything Everywhere All at Once literally places everything everywhere all at once. As a result, it's just a big, dizzy and prolonged adventure-comedy with lots of humour, touching morals and imaginative messes. There's also frequent changes between spoken languages that can be slippery to catch up with and it would've been best at a runtime of under 2 hours, but 110 minutes or more would do the trick. So like most people would highly disagree on and be able to make fair points that overshadow the not-so-great things in the film, it's a bit of an overrated movie, but is it worth watching?If you have plenty of free time on your hands, Everything Everywhere All at Once is an action-adventure-comedy loaded with plenty of imaginative sci-fi stuff written and directed by Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert. Their film is very trippy, original and completely weird, which is the entire point. It centres on an interesting but aging Chinese woman who happens to be an unlikely hero as she must fight the creative dangers of the multiverse to save the world. Give it a shot, because it's either something you'll love or hate, and you can usually tell the pacing at the halfway point.This movie presents a ton of extremely weird, utterly strange and very trippy visuals and effects during the main character's insane adventure. And it's really just an adventure film, although there's frequent moments that are brutally hilarious, like the hot dog fingers and the other crazy stuff. Thankfully, the story is original and that makes sure to entertain you. But to look at the touching elements, this movie does shed light on some parent-child issues and leaves very nicely. Watch this film is you are looking for a bizarrely weird adventure-comedy, but it's just overhyped.If you liked this review, check out the full review and other reviews at aussieboyreviews.

reviews.review_title: Go in knowing as little as possible!
reviews.content: This is a film that benefits from knowing next to nothing going into it. It's so creative and strange and comes together like the plot line in a dream. Beautifully paced with brilliant acting from the whole cast who clearly love the concept and the characters and it all forms into this beautiful unique film. There's a lot of love and heart behind it and there is weight to every action. Try and go in knowing as little as possible and allow the universe(s) of the film to envelop you. I hope Michelle Yeoh gets all the exclaim she rightfully deserves after all these years in the industry and Stephanie Hsu shines on the screen getting the opportunity to bring a lot to her performance. Ke Huy Quan and Jamie lee Curtis give so much love and excitement to their performances as well. Everyone is at their best in this film the actors, the directors, costumes, and the score by Son lux (with a great song featuring mitski and David Byrne) brings a lot of dynamic energy to the film. Everyone was truly giving it their all for this film and clearly held a lot of love for it when they made it. I look forward to seeing it again. In a sea of familiar obvious ideas this film stands out as a island of its own.
To the filmmakers an honest thank you. That's all I have to say.It's been a long time since I don't feel like this witnessing a beautiful story being told on the big screen.Thank you, Daniels!

RATED 7/10
Language: EnglishNice fantasy move made based on family sentiments and values evolved in the new culture. Nice try with mixture of all genres including horror. The movie starting was so interesting and it get so much dragged with mother-daughter sentiment towards end.I was expecting some universal war but ended as family war.One time watchable...

reviews.review_title: Superb Originality This is a 21st Century Classic
reviews.content:
My Review - Everything Everywhere All at Once 2022
My Rating 10/10
Thank you to my friend Cherrie G if not for you I may have overlooked this amazing movie.There is already much written about this movie as I have discovered some of it poles apart in appreciation or lack thereof .All I can say really for me if asked to describe my reaction to this astonishing trip between altered states and universes is to quote a Buddhist word Maitri which means benevolence, loving-kindness, friendliness, amity, good will, and active interest in others.I'm no intellectual scholar my literary heroes and life teachers lies more with Aesop's Fables , Shakespeare or the Brothers Grimm than the great Jean-Paul Sartre or Marcel Proust .That's probably why I kept thinking of three great movies while watching Everything Everywhere All at Once .They were Lewis Carol's Alice in Wonderland, The Matrix and L. Frank Baume's The Wizard of Oz .There's the same zany We're All Mad crazy characters in Alice even a drink me eat me scene the Sci Fi film noir worlds of The Matrix and the No Place Like Home journeys end of Oz.Which brings me to mention the humour in this movie featuring Pythonesque comedy fun with raccoons ,butt plugs, hot dog hands ,and pelting pooches and pet rocks.The producers wanted to keep the plot to this film under wraps before release earlier this year so the description just read a woman tries to do her taxes.The woman is Evelyn Wang played by the wonderful International star Michelle Yeoh . This film even features her red carpet glamorous catwalk scene in one of her other famous films Crazy Rich Asians when Evelyn experiences what fame can bring in another life choice.Evelyn Wang is stressed to her limits with her laundromat under audit , her daughter Joy's lifestyle choice a problematic marriage to husband Waymond played by Ke Huy Quan her family woes also include her elderly demanding father Gong Gong played by Veteran actor James Hong.Most of action of the first part titled Everything of this unique Fantasy Sci-Fi Comedy of the Absurd takes place in the Office of the Internal Revenue with Evelyn's stress increasing by the second as IRS Inspector Deirdre Beaubeirdre interrogates her . Deidre the IRS Inspector is played by the wonderful Jamie Lee Curtis in her greatest comedy role since her 1988 role in A Fish Called Wanda.No spoilers from now on
part 2 Everywhere takes us and our heroine Evelyn on a journey to an alternate universe to explore what her life may have been like .This is a world where even her daughter is an alternate character Jobu Tupaki and her enemy also played by Stephanie Hsu giving a superb performance in this dual role .I advise even if you don't like the frenetic first hour of this trip stay with this movie it's worth it. You wouldn't get off a train half way if you knew you were on your way to a beautiful destination would you?Part 3 All at Once is a beautiful and emotional journeys end.I'm so pleased the Daniels replaced the choice of Jackie Chan as the lead to Michelle Yeoh as I think a woman with family and life stresses has a vulnerability that a male character would have lacked.I was very interested to read that the writers directors Daniel Scheinart and Daniel Kwan originally intended for Evelyn to have undiagnosed ADHD.Daniel Kwan researched the condition and discovered that he himself had undiagnosed ADHD.I really loved this movie as it has a strong message for me about the world we live in today where the pursuit of excellence and high achievement seem to have left the battlers and ordinary achievers behind making many doubt themselves and the life choices they've made in other words it's ok to fail we can always have another try . Kindness and empathy for each other are better qualities than prestige and power.I can't wait to see it again hopefully on a Cinema Screen.

The first half of the movie might be some of the best things i've watched in a while. Great acting, Unpredictable, visually stunning, great storyline, actual funny jokes. But things went down after that scene where the movie wants make you think that the movie has ended. (You know which one i mean. That was a good one though. I'll give them that.) But after that it seems like the movie just gets hit by a huge wave of cliche. Too many unnecessary dialogs and scenes. Unsuccessful attempts at making the movie feel thought-provoking and deep. Too much slow-motion (god those parts were exhausting) that i was just waiting for the whole thing to end. And of course the dumb old "don't worry be happy be kind" message (yeah the world doesn't work like that).

reviews.review_title: A uniquely fun and welcomed experience
reviews.content:
It's been over a week since I watched Everything Everywhere All at Once and my mind is still frazzled. Partly because of when I saw it and partly because of how it pulled off a unique multiverse experience that had a strong story, comedy, action, sci-fi and unreal editing/design. It's a film that I'll need to re watch.It's also one of those film that required a lot of thought to think up and just as much work, if not more, to pull it off. Whilst it probably won't click for everybody, some parts are really over the top, it's worth experiencing at some point especially if you are looking for an action/sci-fi film outside of the MCU and DCEU. If Doctor Strange and the Multiverse of Madness didn't
work for you, check this out.That's twice A24 has surprised me this year and their next film, MEN - a horror, is only a week away.

This movie was too much information, too much noise, too much mess. I didn't feel anything: I didn't get emotional, didn't laugh and I got bored. My ears and my mind were already exhausted and bored by minute 45. This is one of the very few times I've hated a movie that is so well rated everywhere. Why did it get so far? I just DON'T GET IT. This is my first review on IMDb and I just wanted to do it because I was so pissed off at this movie.The only reason why I don't rate it with 1 is because I did laughed/smiled a couple of times with some dark humor (which I'm very fond of, but which in my opinion was not enough to save the movie), and because the scene with the stones was worth something.

reviews.review_title: Are people being sarcastic with their reviews?
reviews.content: I'm really confused about all the high ratings for this film, I'm trying to understand why people think this was any good after the first 20 minutes or so. Was I supposed to get high on acid to go see it? Because I felt like I was being punked by Hollywood or something. Did Covid lower our expectations or messed up our brains that we consider this great cinema or are people trying to sound like they got a message that no one else got? I really wanted to like this film but I didn't, so I guess I'm not special but I'm okay with that.

"Everything Everywhere All At Once" is a cinematic masterpiece that stands out among the best films of recent times. It is an absolute gift to the world of cinema, delivering an incredibly creative plot, excellent characters, and outstanding performances that make this movie unforgettable.The movie is an exemplary example of what going to the movies is all about. It delivers an unmatched level of entertainment value that goes through the roof. The plot is well thought out and executed with precision, keeping the audience engaged and entertained throughout the film. The movie is packed with fast-paced fun action scenes, quick jokes, and great characters that make it a joy to watch.What sets this film apart is its ability to deliver both fast-paced fun action while still being a serious Oscar contender. The film's performances are outstanding, and the characters are well-developed, making it easy for the audience to connect with them on an emotional level.This movie is near perfect in every way, and it is hard to find any flaws in its execution. The action sequences are breathtaking, and the humor is well-timed, adding a nice touch to the film. The movie is an excellent blend of genres, delivering a fresh take on the action and comedy genres.In conclusion, "Everything Everywhere All At Once" is a must-watch movie that should not be missed. It is one of the best and most enjoyable films of modern times, and it represents everything that is great about going to the movies. With an excellent plot, amazing performances, and fun action, this movie is a gift to the world of cinema. It is a near-perfect masterpiece that is sure to entertain audiences of all ages.

reviews.review_title: A very wild ride but not a perfect one
reviews.content: Can many brilliant moments in a movie compensate for lesser-than moments of significance?
