I was asking myself that question over and over as EEAaO kept astonishing me with inspired whimsy and outlandish sequences. So, what are the cinematic problems with EEAaO? First, the opening drags and drags. I know there's a goodly amount of setup / intro needed but there's actually too much setup for what's to come and the pace is glacial. This contrasts with many later moments of sublime stillness in the middle of manic action that make perfect sense for overall pacing. Second, there's a Disney-sized dollop of sentimentality and sui generis La Familia a la Chinoise that hits you over the head, particularly later on and it's 100% telegraphed. That said, the movie has jaw-dropping moments of cinematic bluster and choreography. If Michele Yeoh doesn't get an Academy nod for best actress there truly is no justice. So, if you like over-the-top movie moments and can tolerate the underlying family-centric group therapy session thrust upon you, get ready for an amazing ride.

reviews.review_title: A Visual As Well Deep Absurd Story Amazing Performance From Michelle Yeoh
reviews.content: Watched Everything Everywhere All At Once Special Starring Michelle Yeoh(Shang Chi And The Legend of The Ten Rings) as Evelyn Quan Wang/Alpha-Evelyn ,Stephaine Hsu(The Marvelous Ms. Maisel) as Joy Wang/ Jobu Tupaki, Ke Huy Quan(Indiana Jones And The Temple Of Doom, The Goonies) as Waywond Wang/Alpha-Waymond, James Hong(Blade Runner) as Gong-Gong/Alpha- Gong Gong , Jamie Lee Curtis(Knives Out) as Deidre Beaubeirdre, Jenny Slate (I Want You Back) as Debbie The Dogmon, Harry Shum Jr(Crazy Rich Asians) as Chad and Tallie Medel (Fourteen) as Becky Sregor.Yeah Michell Yeoh should win an Oscar as well all of the Awards Sorry Cate you already have one also Quan is making waves being more than Short Round he was great in his Waymond both versions also loved how deep and personal it was a Trademark 0f A24 Films and loved the representation and diversity as well we all Waymond in Our Lives Hope this Manages to Win Best Picture definitely in My Top 5 of 2022 Best Films.Musical Score By Son Lux, Cinematography By Larkin Seiple(Luce), Direction By Daniels(Swiss Army Man) A Visual As Well Deep Absurd Story Amazing Performance From Michelle Yeoh. 9/10.

Every once in a while, the film removes you from your comfort zone. If you "stick it out," you are rewarded(awestruck, moved). At that point, it's not just a movie; it's your movie; all because you gave it a chance. Add epic fight scenes, eye-dropping costumes, multiple compelling stories: the same originality as Daniels' other work, "Swiss Army Man" (2016) - loaded into a Gatling gun.

I really don't know what I just watched, but it was so creativ, so original, so absurd, so funny and so serious. This movie lives up to its title, it really is everything, everywhere and all at once. Sometimes so much it was hard to proces it all, but I have never seen anything like it, and I don't know how a few people can come up with so many creative things at once. I mean a universe with hotdogfingers, fightscenes with large dildoes and a fanny bag, and all the other colorful stuff they managed to put in it.This movie made me feel good, and I have a feeling that it's gonna be one I remember, thats why I gave it 10 stars.

I get why some may find this isn't for them. However, to me this film works on several levels for different audiences. It can be deep if you want it to be or a movie that has people with hot dog hands. I enjoyed it tremendously even with its quirks and even agreeing that there are things this film does completely wrong. I think this adds to the statement it is trying to make. Appreciate it as it is not as you would want it to be. Yes it's a mess and that's the point.The cast is outstanding. Quan and Yeoh work well together and show range. Stephanie Hsu holds her own and steals many of the scenes.

Surreal sci-fi action movie with lots of lol and wtf moments with time for great character development. Glad to see an 80s child star return to the big screen. Michelle Yeoh and Jamie Lee Curtis are perfectly matched supported by the legendary James Hong Stephanie Ann Hsu, but Stephanie Ann Hsu is awesome. She is one of the new generation Asian actresses that can play multifaceted acultural roles like Awkwafina and Gemma Chan. Hopefully they will get more roles that do not pigeonhole them into just 'Asian' characters.

This film was too overrated. Whole film was too messy, confused and in chaos. I've no idea what's the whole thing is about. Every time when I thought it was going to end, I felt a relief, but worst is yet to come.

Bananas is the word that comes to mind if I had to describe EEAAO in one word.This film gets all its 7 stars for acting, originality, and frequent bouts of bonkers hilarity. I haven't cried laughing in a long time and kudos for having a scene good enough to get that out of me. It was the score in that scene that actually put it over the top for me.That's a good transition. "Over the top" is the best way to describe the 3 missing stars. It tried to take itself way too seriously at some points for something so zany overall. In my opinion if the heartfelt scenes and the moral messages could have been less heavy handed, I think it would have had a better impact.I hate to say I found myself bored at times and the run time could have been shortened. It tried to tie up literally every single minute storyline and character, except for some reason with Big Nose, who should have had a bigger role in the plot I think.Overall it was a really fun experience and I'm glad it exists in this universe.

I can't help but mention The Lobster since I don't remember disliking a film as much since The Lobster . And I sat through this one thinking the same thing.. are we there yet? Will it ever end ? What's it about anyway? Did someone slip her a drug I didn't notice ? Was it caused by one of those games you put on your head and on her it triggered an unending distortion of reality? How about a nervous breakdown ? But then I'm told to not take it too seriously ??!! In college I never understood the books we had to read on symbolism. Is this a dose of that?? I give credit to the actors but that's where it ends . I hated it just like The Lobster .

Everything Everywhere all at once is phenomenal. During my watch, the movie has surpassed my expectations multiple times. The movie has shown stuff beyond my imaginations but also holding a deep emotional core of a storyline. My mind is blown.For comparison, Multiverse of Madness does not even come close by a mile to 'Everything Everywhere all at once'.

The opening shot is a cluttered living space above a family laundromat. That clutter defines the film for me, while the two-fold adjacent universe of life/work offers a simple hint of adjoining "universes" to be explored through-out the long, but enjoyable movie.My 19 year old boys loved the film, I appreciate how it flirted with philosophies, before finding a pretty safe space in humanism. Although the existential rock by rock shots had an extra appeal for me. Wong-Kar Wei fans will be happy here, and while my kids might not want to hear it, this film stretches quantum and cinematic strings to connect to the superhero genre and MCU.You want CGI and choreographed fight scenes, you got 'em. Jokes are very carefully thrown and land gently. The use of a surreal gesture for escape velocity in channeling between universes might have been a bit overused. Perhaps the filmmakers subscribe to ultimately to the Cosmic Joke.The universe(s) here are big, and beyond those for me the film tries to do too much, for too many people. Both my kids and myself really enjoyed the director's previous foray, where they were mostly confined to an island grotto. Yet there was still plenty of room for the outlandish in that smaller but purposeful "Switchblade" of a film.The notion of a metaverse seems to be ramping up more and more these days in various forms, whether to feed a supernatural hunger for teens weaned off religion, or offer some sense of justice that too often feels pay-walled off for those imprisoned here in the lower quanta of society. I feel an agnostic reaction welling up inside me.Probably overthinking it, but the film does invite such overthinking...even if it serves best as a giant mental rollercoaster, and you wind up exactly where you started.

Well, Marvel Studios did a good job with Doctor Strange, but this....whoa whoa whoa.It's one heck of a ride!I was expecting something gnarly. But this was rad!!Michelle Yeoh shined all the way through the end and I'd say, it's Michelle Yeoh in the multiverse of madness!!!

I usually read the review and the score and it is pretty much fit my score. This time it was totally off, no way near 8.6...
In one word, the film is a total mess. Kind of disrespect to viewer intelligence. My recommendation find yourself some better things to do and don't waste your time on this one.

reviews.review_title: A Big, Underwhelming, Cheesy Ball of Spaghetti Mess
reviews.content: Asian Canadian here. I heard lots of good things about this movie from my friends and decided to give it a shot and even took my parents to see it. I must say my parents and I all came out of the theatre utterly disappointed. The movie does not live up to the hype by any means. This is yet another movie conveying little depth while perpetuating archaic, hackneyed Asian-American stereotypes. Not all of us live in Chinatown, work at Chinese restaurants or own laundromats. It's time we move on from these stereotypes already.The cinematography is absolute chaos. The plot is a drawn out drivel filled with predictable, schmaltzy dialogues and trite themes. The director might think he is putting on some splendid display of avant-garde post-modern artistic ingenuity, when in reality, what I see as a spectator is a big ball of spaghetti mess that is lacking in both creativity and sentimental depth. There were too many moments that were unoriginal, unfunny, and downright cringeworthy. The whole "love saves all" theme was delivered in the most cliche way possible. Not only so, the movie was fallacious on many levels. Just because Joy is a lesbian doesn't mean she needs to adopt a nihilistic view toward life - those two things are completely unrelated and the movie didn't draw a logical connection between the two. The movie may have turned out to be better if they had focused less on all the silly and childish zombie fight scenes and more on exploring Evelyn's alternate realities and how things might have unravelled differently for her.The only scene I really liked was the rock scene. I thought that was quite clever.I should have just gone to see Top Gun next door instead. There are far better films in this world, you do not need to see Everything Everywhere All At Once unless you want to waste 2h+ of your life. If this is what people deem to be a masterpiece, then I weep for modern cinema - we are at a cultural dead-end.

reviews.review_title: All these ridiculous Low raters lol
reviews.content:
If you check all the 1 Ratings reviewers at least 75% of them has only reviewed 1-2 things ever, kinda makes u suspicious if its the same person lol
Anyone to rate this below a 5 is insane and has no idea how to rate movies/shows.Rating a 1-5 is like those D Lister movies with poor filming crews n terrible camera quality and middle school style CGI.The lowest you should ever be able to rate a movie of this video quality, acting quality , creativity, CGI quality should be a 6 .If people rate this a 1-5 then what they rating movies like Anaconda sequels ? Or any Mockbuster movies thats a low budget version of a big name production movie ?This Movie was kinda confusing here and there but when you reach the end it kinda hit me that this movie can be a metaphor for multiple things related too Real Life and a very good one. It was well directed with amazing Marvel movies style CGI quality and great acting with some nice fight scenes. It might seem very random of things occurring as you watch this movie but everything connects in the end and the creativity was amazing.

reviews.review_title: This movie truly is everything everywhere all at once
reviews.content: It is hard to imagine a movie that is comical, funny, cool, chaotic, dark and refreshing all at once. Yet the creative minds behind the scenes was able to pack this majestic roller-coaster all into one movie.This one-of-a-kind film is able to hold up to its ambition of paying homage to multiple genres across the mutiverse and delivering on multiple themes while not feeling disjointed, and the experience just gets better for the Chinese audience who understand the language. Although the movie crumbles slightly at the end under its own weight, and some themes could be developed more profoundly, with strong visuals, cleverly designed gigs, eccentric acting and immersive editing, this textbook version of cinema has excelled in all technical aspects of achievement that few other have achieved.

reviews.review_title: Only one actress took the film forward and saved it
reviews.content: The different story of the movie is something that has made many people mistakenly give it a high score. I have reviewed many movies here and many times I have seen a film that has a score below six than the films that some people give it 8 was so much better. This is not just my personal opinion and many people agreed, enough, but just take a moment and think about a **** donut really?

I could not believe the positive high ratings for this movie. My spouse and I walked out of a theater half way through this film because it was so awful and this was before it became noted. We tried to watch it again online after it was nominated for a best film Oscar thinking we had missed something. It is even worse on a second viewing. If you hated this movie you are not alone. You are simply guilty of good taste. This movie deserves a Raspberry not an Oscar.This is one of the worst films in cinematic history. Avoid this travesty at all cost. I cannot describe how terrible this film is. Under Thr Rainbow and Mr. Mike's Mondo Video are classics in comparison. Ed Wood deserves an Oscar before the director of this movie deserves one. Awful film. Avoid.
Love this movie! There is so many layers to it and I am still figuring it all out. You don't realize it at first but trying to stop generational trauma was so powerful. A must see.

This is the first time I'm writing a movie review. But look. This takes first place for my absolute favorite film. It's goofy, daring, moving, thoughtful, thrilling, mindbending and it all works so well. It makes light of the dark and dark of the night and climax so good you'll have to change pants.There are moments where you're like "I cant believe this is happening in a movie" yet it makes sense and os such a memorable theatre experience.I might go bankrupt buying tickets to see this daily.

Especially all the many jokes throughout. The production is totally trippy to the point that you need to watch it several times to really catch everything. The imagination in bringing this to fruition is amazing. The actual theme is very sweet as it is cleverly revealed at the end after all the marvellous shenanigans. A very smart classy film that may go down as a turning point in years to come, really hard to categorise although having much of the mysteriousness and imagination of a Matrix film, at the same time as very exquisite comedy. Full of surprises and delights. One imagines Terry Gilliam being a bit jealous he had no hand in it!

reviews.review_title: The story is pretty stupid, but pretty genius
reviews.content: The title says everything you need to know about the story. The cinematography was pretty impressive though. Shooting on Panavision I think was a smart choice specifically for the colors the sensors provide. An interesting and really good choice was the DP switching between anamorphic and spherical glass to differentiate universes. Very subtle, but had a huge impact on the visual story. The lighting was alright. There was the one cool effect that was achieved by triangulating Astera's Titan Tubes which gave quick-moving light that keyed different parts of the face. Other than that, I thought while stylistic, the lighting lacked originality. Besides the Triangulation of the Titan Tubes...that was cool, and definitely a striking catch-light in the reflections in the eye. I liked the use of soft lighting mixed with hard back lighting. It made the fight scenes pop and feel "marvel-esc" out of nowhere. Overall, great work by not only Larkin Seiple, but the entire G&E and PD.

reviews.review_title: Just may be the greatest movie of all time
reviews.content: Just may be the greatest movie of all time, I didn't take too much thought after leaving the theater speechless until I got to my car. There were so much to process and this is the first movie that I want to go to the movies to see again.
I don't know what the high rating for!!It is boring and chaotic. I've wasted 2 hours from my life watching this movie. Don't bother yourself. It is utterly wast of time..

One of the most creative and revolutionary movies in years. Usually I am not the biggest fan of surreal or experimental movies that completely go wild. But this one worked brilliantly. It was the mix of dark humor and the film not taking itself too seriously in some dimensions(....) but taking it seriously in the right ones. Its a fantastic screenplay and one that will be hard to beat this year for sure. Seriously I dont know on what substances the writers were but it was the right mixture.The acting was outstanding as well. Michelle Yeoh has never been better and for a veteran actress like her that says a lot. I really hope she gets her dues this year. A great discovery was Stephanie Hse, who surely will go her way after this film. A great supporting performance that is memorable on many different levels. It was great to see Ke Huy Quan return with to the movie world with a bang like this. Many remember him as Short Round or Data in some very famous 80s classics. He turns into a very versetaile and demanding performance as well and manages those challenges fantastically. Last but not least there is Jamie Lee Curtis who obvioulsy had a lot of fun playing her role and puts a lot of energy into it. She was great, as she played against character. Sometimes a bit too cartoonish, but then again... thats the character.The cinematography, the score and especially the editing were top notch and make this a visual masterpiece. It works on so many layers and the re-watch factor is very high as well. I did not expect that I will love this movie is much as I did. Glad there is still braverty in the movie work to produce a wild ride of creativity like this.

I adore absolutely everything about this film. It was an utter delight to watch.It's a rollercoaster of action, comedy, drama, bonkers madness, adventure, sci-fi, introspect, discovery and human nature all rolled into a stunning display of cinematography with very strong performances from everyone.All cast members were superb and Michelle Yeoh delivered the performance of her career.I honestly cannot fault this film.P.s. Not a fake review. Seems some people can't handle a film that goes over their head getting good reviews.

reviews.review_title: I hope I never see another movie as bad as this
reviews.content: I agree with all the other 1 ratings. (Wish I could have rated it a 0!)This movie had no redeeming value. And, the only reason I sat through the whole, excruciating, 2 hours and 12 minutes of it was because I thought my friend wanted to. (Turned out she thought as little of it as I did.)How anyone in their right mind could find anything interesting about this film is beyond me.I'm no aficionado of martial arts, but even that didn't seem well done, to me. Years ago, I saw several Jackie Chan movies, but, as I recall, the martial arts scenes were captivating; the ones in this movie just seemed like senseless violence.

reviews.review_title: everything in my body went everywhere for 2 hours
reviews.content: My god this movie was a piece of work. The daniel's have a knack for weird content and peculiar style of direction but just the though of this movie get made and the amount of work went into this with camera work and editing alone is mind bending.

"I laughed, I cried" is a cliche but this movie actually did it. I haven't had so much fun watching a movie in a long time. You can tell in the first 60 seconds how much love has gone into this movie. Every frame, camera movement, speck of light, facial expression has been agonized over. This isn't one of those movies where they just shoot generic coverage and throw it together in an editing bay. This movie understands the human soul. I've seen complaints that the humour is too "lol so random" at times. These people don't get it. This is a movie about the absurdity and infinity of reality. The strangeness is necessary and re-enforces the themes of the film. The Raccacoonie gag is about how we create our own world, sometimes by accident. It feels like a modern myth, a story that tells everyone something about themselves. Well done.

And yet so unexpectedly good?!? First of all, Michelle Yeoh is just AMAZING in this role. Her best yet i would say! Watching the trailer I really didn't think I would enjoy this movie, but i was super curious! This surprised me where rigght off the bat it starts with a big punch, fun characters and HILARIOUS INSANE moments.Not to mention the metaphor was a nice touch!Overall felt it was bit long for what it was, a good 20-30 mins could have been cut imo.

There were so many accolades and awards for this movie, I was compelled to watch it. I'm actually only 45 minutes in, and I'm forcing myself to keep it on. I guess it's an either love or not love situation. Maybe I'll need to watch it 2 or 3 times. I can't imagine doing that. To illustrate complex personal relationships , life lessons and choices in such a visually discombobulated way, is just exhausting and annoying. An acquired taste I guess, but definitely not mine. Weird. Going to read all the glowing reviews to try to understand what I'm missing.I do applaud the filmmakers, editors, special effects crew though....would have been as exhausting to make as to watch.

reviews.review_title: Acting and action were great, the Trippy, only so so
reviews.content: I like A24 for 2 reasons"!. They aren't afraid to take chances2. Everything they put out, even if it doesn't hit spot on, is still more interesting than most modern films.Lots of people are talking about how mind blowing the FX and concepts in the film are, but if you're into Sci-Fi the idea of multi-verses isn't all that new or original. And the message, well i don't want to give anything away but that particular sentiment has been around for years. It's a nice one though and quite timelyWhat makes this movie great is the acting. It outshines the " acid trip experience" by far, especially Stephanie Hsu, who was required to switch from a harried twenty-something to an Interdimensional Empress at the drop of a hat and pulled it off exceptionally well. While all the Space/Time stuff added a couple levels of fun, I would like to see these actors perform in a movie with some of the same themes in a more realistic setting sometime. They had great chemistry.Of course, with Michelle Yeoh on set, the action was superb.Side note, there is a scene where a woman uses a small dog as a weapon in a fight. While the dog used in the fight scene is obviously a stuffed animal, it's something to be aware of if that sort of thing troubles you.

Michelle Yeoh is a spectacular actress as seen in this film, knowing that nothing was done in one take, and her myriad of expressions and countless character shifts are truly unique. But this crazed film defies easy analysis. For a fantasy time-warp / character-switch-around, adventure-swirl, this one defies clarification. A 'fantasy', if this is one, must have a kernel of truth from which it moves, even 'Godzilla' or 'Back to the Future' or 'SpiderMan-No Way Home'...or...you-name-it. This one starts with taxes and failing business with a subplot idea of the daughter's live life. It ends with the daughter again...creating the question 'Why did we go through all of this in the first place?' Editing is mammoth with even rocks cascading down on the audience. It runs about eight (??) hours or seems to be even more!! You can try to play the game of 'What's it all about Alfie?' but I am one who just doesn't care. Just save Ms. Yeoh!

Fantasy, sci-fi, action, Chinese on the surface. Immigration, generation gap, family reconciliation, relationships, life philosophy underneath.As if the crazy front part has nothing to do with the realIty part, but they connect somehow. Be patient for the plot to get clear.

reviews.review_title: Not sure I've ever seen anything quite like this
reviews.content: A highly original piece of film construction with an obscure title that ends up being quite appropriate because that is what happens. I loved Michelle Yeoh and Ke Huy Quan in the leads, was sort of amazed by the ninety something James Hong and Jamie Lee Curtis seems to be having a great time, much more than I did, though a lot of it is funny, some of it exhausting and nearly all of it is eye-popping non-stop happenings. Kudos to Dan Kwan and Daniel Scheinert for another truly original film. After this and Swiss Army Man it cannot be denied that these writers/directors have truly unique visions. I look forward to what's next. However, this is the most immense production to get to the simple, basic premise that life would be much happier if we would accept and appreciate what we've got and be kinder and nicer to each other. Others may view it differently, but that's my take on this very unusual film.

YES YES YES!!This is a movie i will never forget. I am Asian and related to this on so many levels... the intergenerational trauma, the motherly things Michelle Yeoh does, the language, the fighting, the everything!Literally after the movie, I chatted about it with my partner and we both cried because it brought out in us something deep and difficult to talk about.. and that was how much our parent's traumatised us and led us to feel like worthless pieces of sh**s.In a landscape of superhero movies, remakes and sequels, this movie was like a breath of fresh air.Will be looking forward to more Dan & Dan movies.

What can I say that hasn't been said before?Just about everything in this movie is top-notch.The acting - from every actor -, the directing - which I've only seen their Swiss Army Man when it came out and had a lot of fun with it-, the visuals and especially the editing is just amazing in this movie.It has a really good story and it's funny as hell, like I didn't expect it to make me laugh this much. It's definitely one of the best movies of these past couple years.I enjoyed it very much, but the only reason I'm giving it an 8 and not a 9, is because I didn't really have the emotional connection that people seem to have with the ending of this movie, and the ending, although great, I didn't find it mind-blowingly amazing to warrant it a 9.I usually cringe when a conflict, especially a world-ending one, is solved by the power of "love"! And I really hate it when this trope is used to end a story. But in this case, it really worked for this movie and I have no complaint about that aspect of it. Just that I wasn't too emotionally invested in their relationship, or better to say that the mother-daughter relationship didn't resonate with me that much. I don't know, it probably would've worked for me better if it was a father and son. And I'm not saying that just because I'm a man, I'm saying that because I know that that worked better in a movie like About Time. Or maybe it's because they showed that father and son relationship just a teeny bit better that made me invest in their characters and relationships better.I probably will change my mind on a second or multiple viewings, but for now, I think it's a solid 8. Although it's automatically a 9 since we hadn't have a movie this good in so many years. (Except for Parasite)
And it looks like that a lot of people, understandably, compare this to Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness, but I don't think it's comparable. One is a stand-alone movie that wraps up its own story in the runtime it has, and the other is like an episode to a cinematic universe that should be watched like a tv show. So why not enjoy both?And it's fair if you don't like how Marvel movies work and that you have to watch lots of other movies before a "sequel" to a movie that came out in 2016, it's your choice and opinion, you don't like the way they do movies or you don't like the movie at all. But let people who enjoy both movies enjoy both of them and don't start a war over it.Although if we were to compare these two movies with each other, EEAAO is definitely the superior movie. It has better visuals and editing, and the story and how it is told is definitely better here.But I enjoyed the horror and gothic aspect of Doctor Strange too and really had fun with it, and even though I gave that one an 8 too, it's actually a 7.5 for me and obviously lower than this movie, but I still enjoyed both of them for different reasons.One thing I didn't really find that great in this movie though, was the score. Now, the music and the sound mixing was great in this movie. But for some scenes, especially the ending, I thought the music could've been used in a better way. It's the only thing I think this movie is lacking. And like I said, it might be become better on a second-viewing.And although they did a good job of explaining how the multiverse jump work, I am still confused about somethings, especially with the Bluetooth headphones they have.All in all, it's a great movie and definitely the best movie since 2019. (of the ones I've watched)

I went in ready to like this. I love multiverse and creative movies. After seeing this, I can only assumed this is all marketing hype and critics getting a nice paycheck. The movie has boring characters, overstay it's welcome, and is boring. Go watch into the spider verse again and skip this one.

This film can make you laugh out loud one minute and genuinely bring you to tears in another. Genuinely a miracle how something this incredible got this wide a release, go and see it, you owe it to yourself.

Wow. It's been a while since a movie blew me away as much as this did. This has to be by far one of the best movies I've seen this year. And I wish I saw this in theaters but never went for it. Go into this as blind as you can, it's worth it.The mix of adventure, drama and comedy is so well balanced, it's inspiring. The acting is phenomenal, the score and music is top tier, the vfx, the directing.. I could go on praising this movie and to be honest I guess I'm just on a high a.t.m. And can't so a lot of faults. But are there many? Besides the whole multiverse complexity, sure it becomes so complex at a point you have to really remove logic from the equation. At first you try, but it quickly tells you to just accept it.The only negative I could notice whilst watching where some blatant ''telling the viewer what's going on'' moments. With the complexity it's understandable why they did it, but to me it felt like ''yes, I know already'' This was in the early part only though. But that's like... the only thing I could find and imo is nitpicking.It's a 2+ hour movie and it feels like that but also doesn't feel like that. Because of it's unique moments and editing choices it will make you aware of the time. Which leads to it. I loved the choice, but it also had it's repercussions.Special shoutout to the VFX work and directing/editing. It's so incredibly creative, the backstories, the methods of how they show things, the simple but brilliant scenes. Conceptually this movie ranks extremely high. The main story is touching and emotional, but the movie never forgets it's a comedy, but you'll hear tears in your eyes and laugh at the same time. It deals with Chinese parenting traditions/stereotypes in quite a obvious way but the dad made all the difference in it becoming repetitive.I have yet to see other works from these directors but I'm acing to watch anything they come up with next. This movie truly felt like a work of art and passion.This is a special movie, and up there to be watched again.

reviews.review_title: Made me question my love of movies
reviews.content: Look, there's always some offbeat movie that gets plenty of play around Oscar season. This isn't an offbeat farce. It's a calamity of plagiarism. If you took a bunch of stories from and references to good films and threw them against a wall, you could get this movie. The fights were tired and unimaginative. The dialogue was confusing and disjointed. By the end I was questioning how this was nominated. Is there something about movies I don't get? I thought I liked movies. I'm willing to compensate for the fact that every once in a while there will just be a movie I don't like that will win Best Picture; too artsy, too smart, stuff like that. But this isn't that. It's just bad. And everyone down to the caterer is nominated and I have no idea why.
Jenny slate uses as wepon. Also quality cinema. I think heroic trio might be Michelle Yeoh's best film but this is up there even though she can't Kung fu any more.

For entertainment, this one is totally wasting time. Poor structure. Hopeless storyline. It doesnt draw any attention but confusing constantly change screens. How could they expect any entertainment there.They are Chinese, obviously. The mixed with Chinese-English lines with Malaysia-English accent plus Mandarin and Cantonese together. Even a Chinese wouldnt understand this mixture.The actors and actresses are good as expected. Probably they would be much more presenting in anything else but this movie.

I have about twenty minutes left of this movie and to be honest, I've been wanting it to end for about an hour or so. While I do applaud the filmmakers for creating such a unique world and overall, story...A lot of the times, the film appears to try too hard; you know to be creative, different and overall, experimental. Sort of feels Oscar baity at times.The action scenes are impressive and it is neat to see a bad*** female lead. The performances from Michelle and Jamie are STRONG. But I think Ke is the true scene stealer in this entire film! I enjoy his scenes the most; his performance is a great mix of comedy and drama.I'm not surprised if this film scores a lot of Oscar nomins but in the end, a lot of moments are confusing and difficult to follow/

I usually write these reviews the day I see the movie on Instagram. So I'm just going to repost it here.I usually write these from the parking lot of the theater right after I see the movie. With this film I needed time to digest everything.........cause its a lot. On the drive home I was deep in thought wondering how I was going to write this.First some background. Before Wednesday this week I didn't even know this film existed. I didn't see any trailers, I didn't know what it was about, I didn't even know who starred in it. I went into this movie COMPLETELY blind. A dude I work with invited me out to see it. (Thanks man)#EverythingEverywhereallatOnce is the story of Evelyn, an over worked wife and mother who runs a failing Laundromat, while taking care of her elderly Father. Her life takes a sudden dramatic and unexpected (in every sense of the word) turn when while at the tax office she is contacted by her husband from an alternate universe.This movie is Bonkers, balls to the wall insane, 0 to 100 in a millisecond, turned up to 11 crazy ride. It has the feel of a #EdgarWright film in some parts a Mark Neveldine and Brian Taylor film in others with some #WesAnderson sprinkled in. This movie is Hilarious, irreverent, touching, insane, hopeful, gross, confusing, and moving, throughout.The performances from the Actors were all top notch most notably #MichelleYeoh, #KeHuyQuan and #StephanieHsu. I've never seen Michelle Yeoh in a film like this before and its so cool to see that she's still got it. Ke Huy Quan's character is easily my favourite of the three. The heart of this movie. It was also cool see #JamieLeeCurtis on screen again this time as a minor villan. Last movie I saw her in was #KnivesOut. Great performances all around.While the story is hard to follow at first, and the transitions are very quick and jarring I have no problem recommending this movie. Its an gem of a film and I'm glad I got to see it. I enjoyed watching this and had a ton of fun. Movies like this remind me of why I like watching movies in the first place. High praises all around.

reviews.review_title: An unparalleled bizarre cinema masterpiece that approaches the multiverse in a fresh, new, ingenious way.
reviews.content: I have no idea what I just witnessed. Everything Everywhere All at Once is unlike anything anyone has ever seen before. This brilliant goofy, zany, ridiculous genius movie will fry your brain cells. This film instantly establishes itself as a necessity for any true cinema lover. Ground-breaking writing that feels like a Christopher Nolan script with no limits and some eccentricity mixed in. I'm not sure if I fully enjoyed the movie, but I also can't say I fully understand everything Everything Everywhere All at Once is. Not a film for everyone but an absolute must for movie fans or sci-fi enthusiasts.

reviews.review_title: One of the few films that I watched for the first time and rated it A Must-See tier.
reviews.content: This year, I might find movie of the year sooner than usual. This kind of taste is my personal favorite. A complex plot that encapsulates a simple story. Stunning visuals, profound music, and a unique storytelling technique. It's like watching Inception or Eternal Sunshine for the first time, it's very unique.This story's narrative and character development are appeal to me. I was smiling, thrilled, and weeping all along the movies. The film uses the endless possibilities of the multiverse to teach the protagonists to understand, appreciate and accept who they are, what they have and those around them. The exterior shell of the movie may be weird, but the interior flesh is kind and humanThe production was exactly as bizarre as everything else. The film has a budget of around 1/8 of the Multiverse of Madness. And they managed to make their multiverse as madness as Marvel's. So, if you've been considering whether or not to see this film, now is the time to do so. Perhaps you will discover one of the best films of your life like I did.

reviews.review_title: The clash of two alternative nihilist perspective
reviews.content:
1) If nothing matters, then all the pain and guilt you feel for making nothing of your life goes away..
2) The only thing I do know is that we have to be kind. Please, be kind. Especially when we don't know what's going on...
---Everyting everywhere all at once
The clash of two alternative nihilist perspective, If nothing matters, if evrything is pointless should we be self consumed and care less about anything, or should we care about the relations we have and be more kind because afterall it gives atleast some meaning to our life? The concept was really a unique one but I really think this movie could have offered way more. It had all the ingredients to be a cult classic but turned out to be a draggy film with confusing storyline, the humors were unfunny most of the time. I wish Christopher nolan directed this film. Still I will recommend this film just because of the underline concept as there are very few films which can actually challenge our sperficial idea about life.
Everything that came out this year, this has to be my favorite movie so far.. it has a deep story and I related to the characters so much. Don't wanna spoil anything but definitely a must see!!

reviews.review_title: Don't take LSD. Watch this film
reviews.content: Let me start by saying, there were eventually a few redeeming factors in the end. However, this seemed like It was written by a drug addict while high & sober.It means much more if you're married or a parent. There were so many confusing, fast paced scenes of ridiculous vulgar comedy. The sexually overt comedy was confusing & hilarious. They were honestly unnecessary to the main plot , which I had to piece together. I'll be called a blind knuckle dragged for this honest opinion. But these obtuse art films only impress the high & mighty pseudo intellectual.

It's a movie, not a book. Give your audience some credit. We understand that the characters are speaking in other languages.Couldn't enjoy the action, effect and story because in reading the subtitles so much of the movie is missed.Very dissapointed!

reviews.review_title: It's good, but just unique good
reviews.content: Yes, maybe I'm just someone oblivious to the genius of this film, or whatever everyone else seems to see in this film. Yes, the Asian inside jokes, random references to films of the past such as The Matrix, to 2001: A Space Odyssey, acting, comedy etc. Yes all were amazing. With many novel ideas, most of which are good, there is much to love(especially the rocks). But with so many verses, the attempt to tie everything together left a few loose ends. Some areas felt too rushed, preventing one from really soaking in the moment.Looking back, in theory, this would have been a film that I loved very much. It checks most of my boxes, but alas, at the end of the day, the film simply does not speak to me. Simple as that.

reviews.review_title: A24 Movies like this is just outta this world
reviews.content: THIS MOVIE is freaking fire and beautifully made. I just don't get the stupid reviews and rates of 4 and 5 below. Are their minds shallow or something that they can't understand and comprehend such beautiful deep thoughts and creative ways of making a movie. I guess they just pretend to be know it all and just pathetic types of people who can't appreciated sheit. All i can say is this movie deserve not just 10/10 it deserved 15/10 or so haha and This movie is such a gem protect this at all cost. Don't fall for stupid reviews like the others gave and rated. Thanks.

If you enjoy movies with lots of action, this movie is for you. If you enjoy movies with lots of emotion, then this movie is also for you. If you enjoy movies with well-written characters and a moving plot, then this movie is for you, too. This movie is pinnacle cinematography, from the special effects and costume design to the camerawork and acting. Every minute detail is purposeful, which can be somewhat overwhelming near the end. However, I promise that no matter what kind of viewer you identify as, there is something for you to love about this film. The cinematic experience offered is unlike anything you have ever witnessed, and if you are sensitive to philosophical and profound concepts, then you will dwell on this for many years to come.

reviews.review_title: Watched it and moved on. No repeats.
reviews.content: Wife and I watched this but she left at the first THE END. I pointed out that this was just the first part of three acts. She didn't care.I continued to watch this sci-fi, kung foo, universe jumping tax audit waiting for the pay off. There wasn't one. The tax audit turns out with everything being OK. The best part of the Movie is Jamie lee Curtis. She makes a truly believable tax auditor. It could have been her calling if she didn't get pulled into acting. Turns out that no matter where life takes you and the choices you make it still works out the same. For everyone, everywhere, all the time.

reviews.review_title: it's not a movie it's a movie imitation
reviews.content: There is intense pollution, and the references to other films are extremely careless, both in terms of color and sound. It was almost like throwing a randomly prepared dish in front of us with a pot.I perceive this movie as a criticism made to the audience. It is an imitation of a film devoid of aesthetics, devoid of pleasure, full of messages. If there was a rating lower than one star I would give it. Everyone can be sure that even if this movie gets a single Oscar, I will lose my respect for the Oscar.Here, I also offer my condolences to those who praise the film with such conspicuous effort. It's clear that some of us who don't like it, or you, don't understand the movie.

Once I was able to let go of the fact that I couldn't follow what was happening beat by beat and just surrendered to the experience, I had the most wonderful time watching this film. Bizarre and profoundly moving.

reviews.review_title: Eternal Sunshine, The Matrix & Being John Malkovich meet.
reviews.content: The title says it all, this is an inter dimensional love story between a mother and a daughter. By the end of the film you realize why she prioritizes one alternate reality over infinite others. 8/10.

I just watched the film and it was a totally experience from beginning to end, I just love how original is, finally I can see a really multiverse and it was sooo good, the brutality of the action scenes were just perfect and also I love how In spite of the madness that contains the film they conserved the concept of FAMILY, the relationship mother-daughter it's just like the cherry on the cake cause is so well developed, the movie makes easy to understand it cause they explain so well everything without being bored, I just wanted to watch more and more, all of the actors are just amazing and the costumes especially the costumes of joy were such a masterpiece, nothing to say about the visual effects cause they were really great, A beautiful movie that you just have to watch.I got to watch this movie again with my family and maybe watch it again alone and again and again...

This movie doesn't deserve 8 star rating at all. It's a confusing story and it's really bad, don't waste your time like i did. Too much annoying conversation and overuse. You won't understand a thing about this movie. The casting also sucks. Looks like the story writer was very high when he was writing this confusing story. The writer of this movie tried to make a story like the matrix but it failed. Totally waste of time. When i saw this film has 8.1 rating i wanted to watch i thought it would be a great movie but it turns out the rating was fake and it doesn't even deserve 1 star. Don't waste your time.

reviews.review_title: It's everything, everywhere, all at once. And it's remarkable.
reviews.content: The Good: You know a movie is special when the impeccable action scenes, unmatched creativity, and incredible performances aren't what stands out. It's the deep, unapologetic humanity and character dynamics - so realistic and raw - that really puts Everything, Everywhere, All At Once over the top for me. It's also a film that reminds me of what science fiction is really about: using these out there concepts to comment upon the human experience. This film is really a metaphor for adult life; how we often have to juggle so many things pulling at us and lose sight of what really matters: people, relationships, and the time we have with them.To say Michelle Yeoh is great here is an understatement. She's truly remarkable and excels in every role she plays in this movie: she's funny, she's a fantastic martial artist, she's glamorous, she's relatable. Maybe the Daniels had some fairy dust in their pockets or something, because almost every actor here - required to play multiple versions of themselves - are OUTSTANDING. Key Huy Quan's Waymond is perhaps my favourite character of the year so far; he's so effortlessly lovable and brings so much pathos to this role. I also want to shout Stephanie Hsu out; she's not getting a ton of attention but her performance is so good the scenes of her and Michelle Yeoh almost brought me to tears (I'll freely admit Quan and Yeoh's scenes LITERALLY brought me to tears).But, of course none of this is what people are *really* talking about with this movie. This movie's energy is on another level, I've never seen anything quite like it. It's both quick and snappy, but makes complete sense. Just when I was getting a bit bored with the setting, the film transitions at the exact right moment. The ending feels earned and in line with the film's themes. Everything just clicks...everywhere and all at once.The action is next level. This movie was apparently written for Jackie Chan and I have to say, Yeoh and Quan are amazing stand ins for him. The influence of Hong Kong action films is palpable and unmistakable. In an era where I usually go into passive mode watching action scenes, EEAO had my eyes glued to the screen. It has some of the funniest, most interesting, and dynamic action sequences I have ever seen. Every time I thought I knew what was gonna happen, something entirely different did.And if this movie couldn't be even more intricate and well made, its very existence if reflective of the Asian American experience. You couldn't have this movie without China, yet it's still clearly a very American movie. God, I freakin' love this movie.The Bad: Honestly, this is one of the movies that I'd be nitpicking if I had to go through what was "bad." Maybe one or two scenes i think didn't need to be there, maybe some dialog that's a bit on the nose. But nah, this thing rocks.The Ugly: 2022 is shaping up to be a truly amazing year for film. I'm so happy that we've seen a new generation of visionaries take centre stage, and I can't wait to see what the Daniels' do next. If Swiss Army Man was the appetizer, Everything Everywhere All At Once feels like the main course, a statement film that (I hope) elevates audience expectations as to what mainstream film making can be. No scratch that, it elevates expectations as to what life can be. I felt myself just a little happier, just a little more appreciative of my life and the people who are a part of it.With all the stuff happening in the world, I'm happy I'm in the universe where this film exists.

reviews.review_title: Everything Everywhere.. thrown in one big bowl and try to eat that soup
reviews.content: Too much of everything. I couldn't take this movie not even as an improvise, parody, rehearsal, nothing. It had too many ideas and chaos that weren't really making sense. Too overrated for me. I liked some of the moves, but it wasn't enough. This seemed like a big budget Netflix movie, put them in one place and see what happens. I'm sorry, but this is a no for me.

I really enjoyed the film, it had a great concept, I really liked Michelle and Ke performances but people out here are saying is a master piece of cinema. I think they are not used to watching many truly good films for them to put this movie in that spot, and come on 11 Oscar nominations? Comparing it to other movies that came out this year it really surprised me, personally I wouldn't have nominated it for anything, from my point of view you get an Oscar nomination because you are the best of the best and for me this movie falls short of thatIt's a good entertaining movie about family but nothing more.

reviews.review_title: My favorite movie of all time
reviews.content: There is no denying that this is a crazy film. It seems to greatly resonate with many and completely miss the mark to others. I think to enjoy this movie you need to let go of your individual world view to really let it take your mind on the ride. Take your mind out of its box for a bit and launch on the adventure of a lifetime. This is a movie I will want to watch many times over and I have already told everyone in my life that they *must* watch it.

reviews.review_title: The real story: Solipsism on Steroids
reviews.content: "Look at me! I'm Evelyn! I might seem like a bland middle aged woman, but I'm the center of the universe. I'm the center of universes-ses-ses! I create universes. With every decision I make, another universe is born. In one universe I turn out to be a piano wizard, in others I'm a knife wizard, a martial arts wizard, a wizard of wizardry. There is an endless amount of glorious roads my life could take and thanks to the invention of parallel universes, some version of me is taking each and every one of them. But still, I, myself, I am the most important one. I didn't achieve much in my life, all my potentials still lie dormant, an explosive mixture, just waiting for a spark to ignite it.I'm a quirky person. People love that about me. Sometimes I start to sing, sometimes I start to dance, or whatever. This movie about me is a quirky movie. Lots of fun stuff from science fiction movies, horror movies, kung fu movies has been thrown into a blender to create something that is as multi-faceted and fun as I am. So don't you dare to nitpick! Don't be a smart-aleck! This movie is not about logic. It is not about you!This movie is about me realizing that even if I didn't do much with my life, I'm actually everything, everywhere, all at once.My name is Evelyn, God of Gods! Look at me, you mighty, and despair!"---As I'm not Evelyn, I found the whole thing a bit boring, actually. This crazy, trippy, far out stuff wasn't my cup of tea. But obviously there are lots of Evelyns out there who really love it. So just ask yourself one question: Are you an Evelyn? Well, are you ...?---The funniest joke of this movie is the cardigan with "PUNK" written on the back that Evelyn wears. Vivienne Westwood, eat your heart out!

reviews.review_title: Ke Huy Quan is SO amazing in this film!
reviews.content: He literally steals every scene he is in and I hope this vaults him into more acting gigs finally! Hell, they should do immediate rewrites on the new Indiana Jones movie and get him in there! Yeoh is also equally incredible. I mean overall this is probably the most creative piece of cinema I've seen in ages. I really do hope it beats The Fabelmans for Best Picture. As much as I love Spielberg, he's won enough. Not only would it be great for the Asian community but this film had a ridiculously low budget and small team and that kind of originality from a small group of creatives needs to be supported and awarded for all to see. I seriously look forward to awards season this time! Go short round!

Bear in mind I normally hate sci fi......It more than passed the 6 (or 10) laugh test. I kinda loved it at times and at other times I was bored. Crappy but great. Deep but shallow. Ridiculously stupid but genius. Mind numbing but thought provoking. A contradiction of a film. I kinda hated it and kinda loved it. The best sci-fi movie I've seen for years. 7 out of ten.

Humor. Heart. Humility. Michelle Yeoh is as baddass as she is loving. I'll never look at trophies or googly eyes again. 15/10.This movie handles the multiverse better than any Marvel film has as of yet. And with more humor through the entire ordeal. And as insane and kookoo bananas is, the movie is just about love. Loving your daughter, your husband. Love your chosen family. Love those you'd never choose. Fight with love.

I must say out of all Michelle Yeoh's films that I have watched, this was her best portrayal to date. Not only did she embody a desperate protagonist very effectively, she also made it her own and very unforgettable. The style of direction and writing was not exactly my cup of tea but it was definitely interesting to watch. It was a fusion of comedy and sci-fi and drama and each has its own way of making it into the story in a sophisticated and creative way. It was almost impossible to categorize the movie. It was not only Michelle Yeoh that highlighted the story, it was also the supporting characters. This film was definitely one the year's bests.

Not sure how this got such a high rating. It's weird as hell and it made no sense whatsoever. The visual effects were somewhat ok that's why it gets a 2 but man, I think you need to be high off your mind to appreciate something like this. Really can't understand how people can enjoy this, I stopped after 1 hour watching. I can that it has Asian characters and that it shows real life situations: taxes, stress, business etc but I don't think it deserved such the praise it did as I saw nothing special about this movie. I'm not a cinema connaisseur by any means so maybe I'm missing the art in this movie but I was hella not into it.

Inventive. Unique. Creative. Bold.Also over the top. Repetitive. Bloated. Silly.Hard to tell at times whether it's a work of pure genius or genre blending abursdity.It's neither. It's a mix of both. Mostly on the smart side. And it's mostly fun.Definitely different which in today's safe cinematic world of proven brands in the way of endless sequels, spinoffs, reboots and remakes is an absolute godsend. It deserves an Academy award for Originality.Sadly the Oscar's are now only about virtue posturing and not quality filmmaking.One thing is for certain, any film over 2 hours better have a damn good reason for doing so. This type of film would be far better served being under that benchmark.The first hour particularly, is quite repetitive and would have made a much better and more enjoyable experience if it were more concise. The second half works much better but still it is over long and ultimately damages the film as a whole.Still very enjoyable and quite funny. It just doesn't always hit the mark and can be tiring at times. In others, it really is impressive.Great acting chops for all the leads. Jamie Lee Curtis was a riot. Great to see Short Round back too. His character actually had a lot of charisma and it's a real shame he hasn't been on screen as much in recent decades as he really lights it up every time he opens his mouth.Kudos to the filmmakers. I especially love the rocks sequence. Better performances than most Hollywood tossers.

This movie is amazing. It is one of the unique movies I have watched in my life so far. The story line is super refreshing. It's very interesting and mind-blowing. This movie also relates to our lives and existence. Very entertained. Go watch the movie with an open mind.

The main point of the story, that is, the hypothetical existence of multiple universes with all the lives you could have lived and being able to jump from one to the other, might be the basis for a good story. However, they decided to make a 100% wacky movie, with loads of visual effects, totally implausible endless kung-fu fighting, and very very little story. The sub-plots get also lost here: the gay daughter coming out of the closet to her conservative grandpa, the immigrant Chinese family, who had to adapt to the US and is struggling with the IRS. There's stuff here to tell a real story, and no need to flashy visual effects.Add to this dubious production choices. Both main characters are portrayed by actors who are Cantonese speakers, but in the movie they are depicted talking in Mandarin to each other and in Cantonese to the grandpa. This won't impact English speaking viewers, but it only makes sense to add more confusion to the Chinese audience.

This is one of those movies which is supposed to be good because so much is happening (Everything) no matter which universe they are in (Everywhere) and it never stops (All at Once).Sorry, action alone does not make a movie good.The plot is about a harried wife/mother/small-business-owner/accidental-super-hero who who gets the job of protecting not only this universe but all universes in the multiverse because there is some supervillain who is corrupting the entire multiverse, and it has fallen to this woman to save everything, everywhere, right now. The title of the movie is actually pretty accurate given the story line and the very thin plot.It turns out that the problem with the multiverse is that this very harried mother is ignoring the feelings of her daughter, not to mention claiming a whole lot of improper business costs on her Federal business tax returns which somehow makes the IRS examiner an evil ally of the all-powerful daughter.Huh? What?If the script writer and director were TRYING to make the audience as confused as the movie's heroine then they succeeded.Sorry, confusion does not make a movie good.This movie is not like a mystery, tho, where you somehow follow clues to the solution at the end of the movie. Random random stuff keeps getting thrown at us because our housewife heroine is constantly being attacked by random forces which pop out of the multiverse. There is no time to try to think along with the plot. It's just attack, attack, attack . . .In the end and just in the nick of time, of course, our heroine gets it and starts paying attention to her daughter's feelings and the multiverse is saved.Probably there is supposed to be some sort of metaphor here about the multiverse being contained in a single soul, so upsetting that soul throws the entire multiverse into chaos. Blah, blah, blah.I had to sit through an entire movie to see something which should be taught in Parenting 101, namely:Pay attention to your children's feelings. Those feelings may or may not be reasonable given the child's circumstances, but the feelings themselves are very real and need to be taken care of with love, truth, and care.Too much action. Too much confusion. This is not a movie I will watch again.

The plot is really in sane. Is watching the movie similar to the illusions that somebody could get after consuming drugs? The high-level idea seems to be a presentation of family relationship matters. But the scenes seem a completely random collection of effects and fights with super limited connection to cover a broader purpose.

reviews.review_title: The intersection of dad jokes and things a teenager thinks up while high
reviews.content: Is this a bad movie? No. Is it a good movie? Not really.At its roots, the story is fairly simple: a woman finds out that she's the only one who can stop an evil(-ish) force. And she learns how to be a better person along the way. There aren't really any surprises as far as the story goes; it's a series of cliches that don't add up to much.The action is basic. Nothing special, nothing particularly interesting. The humor is uncreative and lame: there's a Ratatouille spoof called Racacoonie (it's a raccoon); in an alternate universe, people have hot dog fingers; there's a bagel with literally everything on it... it feels like there's not a single idea that wouldn't fit on a Venn diagram crossover between dad jokes and things a teenager would think up while high.The ending is the worst part. We know what's going to happen. We've seen it a thousand times before. But it just drags on and on and on. It could've easily shaved ten minutes off in the last half hour. Hell, maybe the whole last half hour could've been skipped.I'd most recommend this for the "film bro" type and people who are shallow but think they're deep.

reviews.review_title: The worst movie I ever saw
reviews.content: I watched a lot of bad movies but this one takes the cake. Everything in this movie was everywhere and nowhere all at once. The plot was really messed up and the twists really confusing. I still don't know how I managed to watch it till the end just to see what the real plot was. And to be honest I wasn't impressed. I feel like there is a better way to show the damage that the parents can cause to their children with their ambitions. I never thought that I would dislike a movie as much as I do this one. I still can't comprehend why the critics are so imprest with it. The worst few hours in my life.

reviews.review_title: rollercoaster ride of images and ideas for five movies
reviews.content:
This is what a Doctor Strange-Multiverse movie should have been like:
complex,
witty, intelligent script,
excellent performances,
hillariously strange humor.This movie is like a orgy in storytelling containing a lot of themes and delivering at each of them.The hero of this movie is Michelle Yeoh that gives the performance of her lifetime.Another excellent actress that will we remembered: Jamie Lee Curtis. Just hillarious.It's nearly impossible to describe this movie. You have to see and experience it.Why not a rating higher than 8?The movie gets exhausting after the first twothirds, it's a little bit overlong, confusing and loses its pace by the end.But, nonetheless, it's one of the most visionary, entertaining, strange and hillarious movies of the past years, I just say 'the stones' and 'sausage fingers'. Wow!Highly recommended.

reviews.review_title: Everybody needs everyone to love everybody everywhere at all times!
reviews.content: There aren't many action films depicting the mother/daughter bond, so this welcome addition surpasses everybody's expectations. But that isn't even half the film's draw!Finally back on screen, my personal favourite sidekick or comic relief in big action-adventure blockbusters, Data/Shortstop from the unique Goonies and fun Indy films comes back with a bang! His bag of tricks on show for all to awe at! He's the North to Michelle's Crouching housewife, Hidden talent in the Laundry, midlife wife-crisis. And it's not "just the taxes" that turn the struggling business owner into a force to be reckoned with! Without giving much away, one woman must traverse multiple timelines of her life where every choice she's ever made has created a new version of herself. As we are products of our society, each version of herself has different skills. Before time runs out, she must learn to use her skills to fight off evil doppelgangers of her friends and her IRS officer (a hilarious turn from True Lies' Jamie Lee Curtis) from other universes!Doctor Strange could take a lesson or two from the mouth-dropping visuals this films throws at the viewer, with the CGI and SFX blended seemlessly between quick, witty and relevant dialogue, majestic fight scenes, and surprises behind every turn! A feast for the eyes!The cast playfully carry this film on their comedic, dramatic and kung fu-trained shoulders, all at once! After so many father- son bonding films, or son looking for approval, this alternate view of a parent/child relationship may be foreign to many, but will hit home to those in the know! As a son of migrant parents, the critical parenting style sure rings true!

reviews.review_title: A heartfelt tale told in the most insane way
reviews.content: This film manages to balance out so many things that I think a multitude of people will appreciate. You've got a likeable cast with a creative concept that grabs you and doesn't let go for the duration of the viewing. I believe there is a high chance you will walk out of this film feeling good and find yourself pondering the type of lessons imbedded in the story. One gripe I had, which I guess you could call a nitpick, is that it felt just a little too long. Perhaps ten minutes could've been cut so we could get to certain points faster. In the end, Everything Everywhere All at Once is as down to earth as it is ambitiously creative and is a viewing experience where you may take away more than you thought. One of the best films of 2022 so far. Verdict: 9/10.

reviews.review_title: Nothing Matters Everywhere All at Once
reviews.content: Haven't been this emotional during a movie for a long long time.Amazing how 'Nothing matters' seems like an extremely negative thought at first but gets a whole new positive meaning at the end of the movie that makes so much sense.Very well put together and hits on all moments perfectly. This was way more profound than I suspected this movie to be and hit home quite a lot on some aspects for me. Very glad I watched this!

Best movie of the year, this was an amazing movie, though not everyone will like it. I just loved, it had an original story, great cast, good performance, great music and amazing action scenes, also it was damn funny. The whole movie felt like a roller coaster. What I loved about it, is that they didn't cast any of those high list young hot looking sp called actors, which is the trend lately. The director or the writer is heavenly influenced by Matrix, specially the action scenes, that were just amazing. All in all, very entertaining movie, also it got a good story. To enjoy this movie, you need to enjoy the ride.

reviews.review_title: One of the greatest films ever made
reviews.content: I have seen A LOT of movies in my life. A lot. I've laughed, I've cried, I've been scared. I've seen it all. No movie, and I mean NO movie, has ever made me feel the way this movie did. And it's a feeling I can't comprehend yet. But I'll get there, and it will be all that more rewarding. One of the greatest films ever made, and A24's best film to date. See this movie.

It has its moments and entertaining parts. But this movie was over-hyped and in the end, is not a must-see movie. If you happen to catch it playing and there is nothing better on, then you may find some scenes here and there as fun and interesting. But overall, this movie will fade into obscurity because it's just not that good.

Went in expecting this to have been overhyped but surprisingly, its really great. Everything works. Its well acted, directed and written. Incredibly well paced. Its probably the most entertained I've been at the cinema in years. Go and watch it.

I thoroughly enjoyed the film but it might not be everyone's cup of tea. If you come in from a night out that included alcohol, leave this film until another time!Seeing a Jamie Lee Curtis as the Tax Inspector, plus others, was shock. Well the whole film was a shock.I summed up the film at the end, with that was weird - but I liked it!Some funny bits in it, and some touching scenes too.

Everything Everywhere All at Once is near impossible to describe. The plot is eccentric, complex, thought provoking, and emotional at times, and while it may be confusing throughout there's nothing in the film that keeps the viewer from wanting to see it again. Aside from countless wacky and over-the-top ideas stuffed all through the movie, the biggest shine is the performances from the cast and their clear devotion to the interesting characters they play. Above all, this movie is without a doubt one of the most original pieces of art ever put into cinema.

Taking an unconventional family friendly approach to it's theme. EEAO's novelty and artistry is incomparable. Masterful performances by the cast. A plot with a bold statement enclosed in a vibrant lovs story.

reviews.review_title: A fantastical work of modern surrealism
reviews.content: Everything Everywhere All at Once takes you on a ride you wouldn't want to get off anytime soon. Combining different elements of slapstick comedy, deep philosophical themes, family and life as a whole while delivering one of the most jaw dropping visuals in recent cinema history.

Gilda Radner said the first write is the barf , the rewrite is when you pick out the pieces of corn. A rewrite would make this movie more lethal but I don't know if the overall impact on the audience and therefore box office receipts would be that much different. This movie is a significant event in the world of indie movie production as it demonstrates the importance of balls in making films happen. There's a lot of talent and texture here if not cohesion. That's Hollywood, thank god.

I'm still thinking of this movie days after watching it. It's one of those movies you want everyone to see so you can talk about it. They did a great job creating the alternate realities and keeping me interested the entire time. So much humor and creativity in one movie. Perfectly executed. Great acting and so fun. It was phenomenal!

reviews.review_title: A Masterpiece, breath of fresh air
reviews.content: Einstein illustrated relativity with an example of a hot stove and that special girl.In 2022, this concept is probably best illustrated by the comparison sitting through one agonizing episode of She-Hulk that factually lasts somewhere between 15 and 30 minutes but feels like an eternity that you are forcing yourself through.And then there's this original movie that's not based on a franchise, objectively lasts 2h 19m and feels like it's barely been more than an hour after you're done.And yet this movie didn't leave me desperate for more. I think this movie has accomplished a very rare feat, especially in the current day and age: Finding the perfect length for the story it is telling.I'm for sure going to rewatch this movie many times, it's just such a joy ride and yet it managed to bring tears to my eyes. It's deeply meaningful and absolutely silly. It's original and raw, wild and meticulously crafted. It's literally everything everywhere all at once. Well, except for boring or predictable.Best film of 2022, and it's not even close. This film deserves nothing less than Academy Awards for best picture and best original screenplay.

Probably my favourite movie of all time. It's the only movie to have ever had the power to tame my bladder for over 2 hours. I could not disengage. This movie has EVERYTHING.And the message behind it is astounding and makes sense in every way in my opinion.

It seems there would be a lot of ways to tell a story of a woman learning to appreciate her life and that kindness and understanding can have a positive impact on those around her. I really liked the actors and where this tale ended but my gosh what a long, repetitive, flashy two hours to get to that point. As others have said: I was done with the Marshall arts, universe travel, "comedy" after about 20 minutes. It went on so long that I barely made it to the end. I wondered how people would choose this movie over Banshees of Inisheren or The Fabelmans as the best film of the year. It was too much!

reviews.review_title: Everything that I love in a movie
reviews.content: This is a brilliant masterpiece! This movie blends action, comedy, and drama so effortlessly. I was blown away at the multiverse created by the writers while keeping the main theme of the movie.I'm not gonna give any spoilers but this movie is probably one of the best ones I've seen this year, Oscar worthy no doubts.

I really like the actors in this film but this was bad. I watched it twice in hopes that the second time would be a winner. I thought it was me but after speaking with other movie lovers in my circle they felt the same way I did it was a waste of time the only exception was Jamie Lee Curtis she made it bearable and brought some humor to an otherwise bad script and a couple of good fight sequences. I felt that it was confusing at some points and very slow at others. It appears that they were working to hard at trying to get a message of acceptance across. I totally was cool with the messaging but they over did it and it went left and got boring.

reviews.review_title: Insanely Good! (I never leave a review but this film needs to be watched!)
reviews.content:
Its as if Rick and Morty's interdimensional cable and The Matrix fell in love and birthed a heartfelt arthouse sci-fi film baby....
....and it's AMAZING.I hope this movie is as commercially successful as it is critically acclaimed because it deserves it. And Hollywood needs to invite more bizarre ideas and bold filmmakers like this to make more creative works on the regular.There's no way to accurately describe it in words and do it justice.It's something new...which is refreshing in a sea of reboots and rehashed ideas.It dares to be different, and earnest, and silly, and vulgar, and genuine...all at the right moments and often all at the same time.Remember that incredible dream you had one time but can't fully explain to everyone how it made you feel because it defies words?!Well here it is on screen! You just need to go and WATCH IT!!

reviews.review_title: A triumph in big and small scale storytelling
reviews.content: One of my favourite films of 2022. The story is astonishingly well crafted managing to be both totally thrilling to watch on face value and also completely captivating to see the bigger themes unfold. A multi generation chinese-American family are struggling with their lives and relationships and get the chance to explore alternative realities where their lives have taken very different directions. The film is a triumph of both big and small scale story telling while never feeling trivial or pretentious. It was fun and action packed, showing off mind-blowing editing and filming techniques as well as spectacular martial arts amongst some truly surreal ideas. The ambition and expansiveness of this film is huge and somehow expertly woven together into something that not only makes sense but is a real wonder to behold. There is also a really powerful emotional core to the film, particularly with the mother daughter relationship as well as proper laugh out loud comedy moments. The cast do an incredible job with so much to do and multiple characters to play and I hope Oscar nominations are on the horizon.

reviews.review_title: BETTER THAN YOU CAN ASK FOR
reviews.content: THIS MOVIE WAS BEYOND MY EXPECTATIONS. WHEN I WATCHED THE TRAILER I AM CONVINCED THAT THIS WILL BE A GOOD MOVIE BUT IT DELIVERS MORE THAN IT PROMISED. THIS WAS ONE OF BEST MOVIE I HAVE EVER WATCHED IN 2022.

reviews.review_title: A Complex Plot, but not Really
reviews.content: An easy-to-watch fantasy/sci-fi/fairy-tale movie. Basically... actually, I can't summarize this movie easily. There's lots of multi-verse hopping, and the movie needs a lot of exposition to explain it. Go look at the IMDB summary to get the gist. The plot really doesn't matter too much; the movie does offer a lot of explanation, but I think you could turn your brain off and not think too deeply about the plot and still get the gist of the movie. The setting and acting are fantastic: a laundry-owning chinese immigrant on the brink of divorce having to save the multiverse from her family feel incredibly original. There was a lot of special effects in this movie - most of it CGI - and most of it really great looking. The sets (especially their house, with all its knick-knacks) were incredibly ornate; I feel like I could have paused in some scenes and just spent hours looking over the scene. The acting was top-notch; I would never have guessed that the main actress was 60-years old. There were some references to other movies and lots of comedy; a lot of it didn't land for me. Most of the humor is a bit too Marvel-ish (goofy/campy) for me. Overall it's an easy movie to watch; might be worth rewatching in a few years to see if it holds up.

Prologue or important clarification:
I don't recall ever giving a star on any review. Please don't think this is hate or something. I don't know the actors or the directors, there is nothing personal. I even had high hopes for the movie as it was highly recommended to me, but I don't see how this movie can have more than one star.Also, maybe some will want to call me a boomer or something. To them I would clarify that I have seen quite absurd movies before. From the top of my head I can think of: Pink Flamingos, Begotten, Nirvana, Crash, A Serbian Film, Ebola Syndrome, Even Dwarfs Started Small, Mermaid in a Manhole, Riki-Oh: The Story of Ricky, Nekromantik, Schramm, La Matanza Cannibal de los Garrulos Lisergicos...
Okay, I don't find them good, but I think they are better than a star, well, maybe not the last one...Going back to the movie in question, some say it is deep and meaningful, but there is certainly nothing deep in the pseudo-philosophical and pseudo-scientific plot.
