There is not the slightest hint of a new idea or a new perspective, never mind a good exposition of what it purports to be.The argument is tedious, absurd, illogical and also predictable. The way the creators of this movie want to avoid the above is by introducing absurd elements that want to distract you from the childish plot. The film ends with the classic Hollywood cliché where love finally triumphs.If you want an original movie, you won't find it at Everything Everywhere All at Once. If you want a pretentious, nonsensical plot that aspires to be edgy or deep, you might be in the right place. This movie is completely forgettable and I'm sure no one will talk about it in the future. It's just a gimmick that will pass with the tide.The only reasons I could give another star is the original music and the acting. The acting is heroic considering how bad the movie is. It's fascinating how well the actors managed to do ther job, so kudos to them. Maybe I could give it another star, but the movie is too bad for the reasons stated.Anyway, I find it fascinating to read the comments, especially those who say that it is one of the best movies ever and that it is in their top 3 or 5 of favorites. I bet they'll almost forget about this, their 'favorite' movie in a couple of years.

I was very impressed with the acting of the 3 headline characters. They would each get a 9. Unfortunately, there was no story. It was all random, senseless, activities. Sure, you can figure out the "plot" - but why bother? The entitled producers of Hollywood owe the paying public more than this.

The moral of the story, you can fix your relations with your family members, on several plains of multiple universes, you can get away with plenty of murders and get forgiveness, you can defeat an undefeatable adversary, but you can't escape taxes. That's a strong message. Apart from that, only clichés stolen from another movies, Matrix, Scary movie 5, all the other multiverse movies. Too long on the morality scenes, too boring since we knew how's gonna end a mile away. A solid 5, but far from "The best movie of the year". Women power, of course, It could not be the other way. My 2 cents. 4 stars.

So I'll start by saying I haven't given this film a high review because I wanted to give in to all the hype surrounding it. I can understand that this film may not be to everyones taste, but how some reviewers have given this only a couple of stars is beyond me.EEAAO is one of the most original and fun films to have been released in recent years. I must admit as a huge fan of action I thought the multiverse idea blended very well with the action scenes, and of course with how the plot unfolded.But the main focus for this film is the character development and I guess you could say "message" that makes it stand out amongst the crowd, and I think this was written very well as the multiverse idea was explored.Also the fact that the production had only a handful of VFX artists is absolutely mind blowing with how the effects were done.Overall I would highly recommend EEAAO for it's originality and style.

reviews.review_title: Original? Yes! But this was SUPPOSED to be the baseline, Hollowood!
reviews.content: Don't get me wrong. This movie had its moments and had me laughing my axx off quite a number of times as well as clap sometimes.. but hey, that's because I was still coming off of sunken cost fallacy and what an utter garbage Gerard Butler's Last Seen Alive was (last seen movie before this...) so there's that.My first reaction to it after finishing it was 8 or 10, but then when the buzz calmed down and the lights faded, I realized we might have been duped.This movie felt like Shen Yun-meet-Mission Impossible or rather a Jackie Chan Kung-Fu movie. There are some absolutely amazing cinematography and fine editing skills... but that's about it. Some of the lines were cool and many scenes funny .. and that's it.It's like a big ol hot fudge sundae or whatever.. which you relish only once. I cannot for the love of my life imagine rewatching it esp. With the DISGUSTING bloody dildo scene.And what was the raison d'etre for it anyway? To 'shock' viewers? Really?And true to Hollywood they have to insert some woke meme about a lesbian female teenage daughter. Jeezus Christ.I might be unduly harsh, but I just want to balance it out. Had it came out in late 90s or early 2000s it would be considered "competitive". I mean this is what Hollywood (Hollowood?) is supposed to be!! THIS should be the baseline. This is the orignality and creativity we expect with ALL movies.Guess public is numbed out by dumb boring ditzy Marvel movies and boilerplate formulaic action movies like Grey Man with Ryan Gosling and Last Seen Alive, that we are acting we saw the promised land. Halle frikkin lulah indeed.If you wanna be pretentious and watch philosophical movies and write pretentious reviews then there are in spate.Tree of Life, Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind, Pi, Stranger Than Fiction, Truman Show...This is not one of them. At least not miles by my "rewatching" standard.

With all the buzz around this movie I expected something bonkers, creative, refreshening, new. And well, it was nothing of that.First let's start by the most obvious and what apparently people do not understand - this is not a movie about the multiverse and alternate realities. This is a movie about the joy of family and being together. All the alternate realities are just an allegory and I think clearly in the protagonist head, a way to cope with her sad life. It helps her remember that relationships, her husband, her daughter, her father - that's what is important in life and moments of kindness.This is the whole story. A nice message but really not very original.And regarding the "bonkers" moments and aspects - there was nothing I had not already seen in another movie.Sorry did not work for me.

Interesting: so many 1 and 10-star reviews... but it's not perfect or terrible imo. The great part is the production, which is interesting but waaaaay too fast for old people. It's a good story, but oddly "king fu scifi" which is a bit of a turnoff for me (as a scifi lover) and for people who would enjoy the movie more without the fighting, which didn't seem like a natural fit for the plot. But it's Michelle Yeoh so...Not much needs to be said with all these reviews digging in to details- I'll just add that the reasons people gave it 1 star seemed to have a personal problem with it, especially its style and ideas coming from the Matrix and other movies. Yes, so it's not a completely unique or original story, but that doesn't make it bad. That's just kind of how storytelling works : )

GO SEE THIS MOVIE. Saw it today with my fam and it quickly became our favorite movie of all time. So much deeper than what you can even imagine. Brilliant masterpiece. Prepare to laugh hard and possibly even cry hard too.

reviews.review_title: Yeoh really don't want to miss this
reviews.content: Ten minutes into Everything, Everywhere All at Once you already know all you need to about Evelyn Wang and her life. She runs a struggling laundry mart and is in some way estranged from every member of her family. She is a dissapiontment to her visiting father, resents here carefree husband who's cheery outlook on life she sees as weakness and while she worries nothing she has done matters she struggles to connect with her daughter who worries nothing at all matters.Broadly speaking the movies follows Evelyn working through her family issues via Kung Fu, universe hopping and confronting a reality threatening bagel. If that sounds crazy its only scratching the surface, the film packs in a lot. It also a masterpiece. From Uncut Gems style stress to melancholy to exhilaration, the directors make you feel whatever they want on a whim and while Michelle Yeoh is the undoubted star of the show every cast member is outstanding. Really saying anything more (other than everyone should see this film) could only spoil things.It'll make you gasp, it'll make you laugh, it'll probably make you cry. It'll make you want to hug your kids. An instant all time classic.

reviews.review_title: Was Not Expecting This At All
reviews.content: I don't ever write reviews but this one needed one. 10/10 perfect like omg, compared to the trash that has been releasing lately this movie is a movie of the decade.

I read the blurb and watched the first few seconds of the trailer before deciding I'd probably be best to just dive right in. That was an excellent decision, even if I do say so myself.I'm not really into action movies, and despite this being full of action sequences, it's not really an action movie.I loved the fact that essentially this was a film about people and the expectations they put on themselves and others, how they think others see them and how they see others.The importance of needing to stand up and fight, but to also be kind.I started crying with bemused laughter at the hotdog sausages and I knew then I was watching one of the best films ever.I loved it. Brilliant.

Basically an exercise in post-modern cinematography, "Everything Everywhere All At Once" lives up to its tenet that "nothing matters" by ignoring elements such as a plot. Character development is dispensed with by giving each actor multiple characters with both good and evil qualities. Watching this picture could be dangerous for those susceptible to epileptic incidents or subject to migraine headaches.

Weird trippy movie, very well scripted, excellent writers. Very funny. Must watch movie. I don't think i've laughed this much at a movie before. The visual effects are amazing, a lot of love was put into this film.

The movie tries hard to seem interesting but at the end of the day it's just another take on multiple universes that Hollywood is currently obsessed with. The humor is cheap, the main villain is poorly acted / casted, and the general 'message' of the movie (we are insignificant but it's still important to love) is unoriginal. But the biggest problem with the movie...it's just boring! The fighting scenes are repetitive (the solution is always to do something random and learn a new skill), the characters are not likeable, and the obsession will dildos in the movie is just odd. I kept thinking it would get better...it didn't.

Behind the incredibly imaginative visuals and the 'out of this world' editing, is a movie that knows what it wants to say/be from the beginning. It never loses its way. All this spectacle wraps beautifully around a simple yet touching story.

I heard good reviews about this. And usually when reviews that are this good, it is bound to be overhyped. But I gave it a try anyhow to see if it lives up to the hype. Not going to lie, it started off kind of messy, and I had a hard time following the story switching between the english and chinese language. The scenes in the first half of the movie appeared incoherent and it was hard to understand what was going on. But then I discovered that this incoherence was consistent, like some mathematical constant and came to realization that maybe I should not approach this movie with logic and I should not try so hard to understand it, but rather let the movie take you in for the ride and get into it for the sensation of it all and see where it goes. And oh my, how it delivered. I wasn't expecting such an epic emotional rollercoaster experience, even with all the crazy over the top things happening on screen, it blended very well together. It literally included everything, everywhere, all at once that you ever wanted in a movie. This was a masterpiece of a movie. Instant timeless classic, and topics touched upon that are very relevant for our times. This also shows you that representation matters! It gives us a whole range of new and interesting perspective and content we never knew we wanted! My compliments for the script writers and producers for giving us this gem of a movie and it certainly lived up to the hype and more!

A Chinese immigrant finds himself experiencing adventurers he cannot avoid and imagine, traveling to another universe that has a different storyline of life to himself.Everything Everywhere All at Once is a film that really features a story with a universe feel (this is because it is screened close to the Doctor Strange film). Everything Everywhere All at Once presents a family drama story wrapped in a fictional story of the journey of the universe. The family drama that was brought is a story related to how the life of a Chinese immigrant in the face of changes and cultural differences in the culture in which he lives. The plot of the story actually has a simple story. However, it is wrapped in such an intricate adventure. The conflict that occurs is also a family conflict that is being hit by a period of disharmony and lack of happiness. That's the point made in this film. This film wants to bring us to experience the conflict that occurs with some questions if only. With the depiction of the reality of life branching out becomes an affirmation to understand the conflict felt by the Mother in seeing her family's problems.Everything Everywhere All at Once has a unique story. This film presents an adventure film with a combination of drama and comedy which becomes a unity of films that are fun and fun to watch. This film also does not forget to present good visual effects. The image of the formed universe appears with colorful and diverse visuals. The Cast lineup also has a nice charm. Michelle Yeoh, Ke Huy Quan and Stephanie Hsu performed amazingly and well.

reviews.review_title: Michelle Yeoh and the Multiverse of Existentialism
reviews.content: Does anything that has happened, is happening now, will or might happen mean anything on this small speck of dust in the tapestry that is our universe? No. No it doesn't. And if it doesn't, then what's the point of it all? Why are we even here? What does it matter what we do with the time that we have?Existential questions like this have been plaguing me since March of 2020, and they are at the very heart of Everything Everywhere All At Once-a whacky, over-the-top, surreal masterpiece of an action-adventure-it dares to ask these questions, it doesn't pull it's punches, and apologetically answers with a tale as old as time:Love.And that is the word I have for this marvel of a movie. And, like Marvel, the plot takes us into the Mulitverse, but not with grand spectacle and superheroes, but with the mother of a teenager.I've said it before, and I'll repeat it now-Michelle Yeoh, isn't just a national treasure for those countries she holds citizenship in, she's simply a treasure and has delivered, probably the best performance of the year in this movie.The Daniels (Dan Kwan & Daniel Scheinert) continue to hit project after project out of the park, and I can't wait for what they have in store for us next.There's one last person I need to talk about, and that is Ke Huy Quan, who returned to acting after finding fame as a child star in movies like The Goonies, and Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom, and he is brilliant-and deserves all the awards as well.On a scale of 1 to 10, 1 being "don't see this movie," and 10 being "you should buy stock in it," I give it a 15.

I've just watched the movie. Twice. Had never done that before. And probably will not either. Time will tell, but right now it feels like the best movie I've ever seen. And probably the best one I will ever see.It's not superficial. If you just want to relax with some popcorn then this is probably not the best thing for you at the moment.I think the movie has many layers. For me, it is about the meaning of life. Why live. Very deep and brave.And it's not boring either. Without that frustrating "just accept things and be happy". As if that's easy!!!Even more, the movie has quite a bunch of fun action.It is a very wholesome, multi-layered and rich piece of art with a life-affirming message, especially for the brave ones.I feel deep gratitude to its creators.Will definitely rewatch. And show it to my son when he grows up a bit.I would rate it 11 out of 10.

Went to see this with Craig and we laughed so hard on numerous occassions so it was certainly an enjoyable movie.That, and the initial story telling, were definite plus points and everything was trending up - until everything started getting a bit surreal and disjointed. Not everywhere all at once though ... just the third act (whatever that actually is) ... or the last third of the film, let's say.We both lost grip of the 'sense' that the film was doing a good job of explaining (and making) so far. But then ultimately it's not clear exactly what the black bagel is ... but Joy seems to have created it and it will destroy all the multiverses. Is this planned or what? Not clear. At least not to us.Then ... why is the Evil Joy searching for the specific Evelyn (mum) that we are following and trying to kill her. Then, when she does find her, she's not trying to kill her now?A confusing but entertaining film, so for that reason I'm giving it a seven.71/100.

A tale as old as time and a completely predictable ending. That said, the journey from beginning to end is absolutely the most fun I can ever remember a movie taking me on. It moves you continuously between drama, action and comedy. What a blast!!

reviews.review_title: I will never get over this movie
reviews.content: Hilarious and action-packed with one of, if not, THE most emotionally resonant message I've ever seen. This movie is well paced, well acted, well edited, well everything, everywhere, all at once. I'd just about say it's perfect, it's so polished. The last 30ish minutes were emotional blow after emotional blow, with well timed little pauses for a breather and joke in-between. I love this. I won't be able to stop thinking about this anytime soon, if ever.

I must admit that I had no preconceived notion of the plot, so there was no layer of expectation guiding my viewing experience. What I did know was that the movie was being considered for several Golden Globe awards and starred a talented cast. I love Michelle Yeoh, the return of Data, Po's dad is always a joy, and the mom from Freaky Friday is my secret crush, what is not to like.The minute Waymond, the young patriarch of the Wang clan, starts his parkour across the family-owned laundromat, the viewer gets a glimpse of the impending frenetic multiverse that guides the movie for the next few hours, helping it live up to its title... it really was everything, everywhere, all at once.Throughout the movie, the director quickly and sometimes confusingly trapses through familiar plot elements that will resonate, if the viewer can pull back the curtain of the hyperactive and manic effort from the characters at play. We get glimpses of family strife, parental discord, personal discontent, disappointment, resignation, joy, redemption. To this concern, viewers, please be warned, in an effort to stay in line with the quick moving story or to just relive some of the more bizarre twists, you may need to be prepared with a thumb or forefinger ready on the pause, rewind, go back 15 seconds button. One might offer that it, in fact, adds another level to the multiverse experience. In the end, the movie slows down enough to allow the viewer time to catch-up with the plot and message before the credits roll.For some this movie will be an exciting ride, one in which the viewer will spend with their hands in the air, exhilarated at every quick twist and turn. Amazed at the intense action fight scenes, giggling at the absurd and over-the-top visual elements chosen for various alternate worlds. For others, it will lack the needed depth to stay connected to the characters and storyline, instead wishing they could opt for an alternate universe in which the viewer decided to skip the movie and catch-up on some streaming binge worthy show.

reviews.review_title: This is rated an 8.2 out of 10?
reviews.content: I rented the movie and just watched it after hearing great reviews on it. I have to say this was one of the silliest hard to follow movies I have ever seen. They kept switching from Chinese to English which made it hard to follow. Then you had universes where people had hot dogs for fingers and at one point you had two rocks talking to each other, are you kidding. Then the movie just got long and drawn out. The villain was just silly and not scary at all. The villains main motivation is a "bagel"! It was just too silly and, in my opinion, it shouldn't be rated that high.

EVERYTHING EVERYWHERE ALL AT ONCE (Dan Kwan and Daniel Scheinert, 2022) is, above all, a breathtaking cinematic experience, which summons almost all of our senses to enjoy it in its fullness.Michelle Yeoh leads with unshakable mastery the group of no less efficient actors who transpose the Daniels' vision to the big screen. Newcomer Stephanie Hsu is surprisingly convincing in the role of Jabu Tupaki; Ke Huy Quan (the boy from INDIANA JONES AND THE LOST TEMPLE and THE GOONIES) proves to be a talented and versatile actor; in turn, the legendary James Hong, who is already 93 years old, and Jamie Lee Curtis, who manages to be, at the same time, hateful, comical and touching, show that without committal and without complexes, as in any profession, there is no way to get good results.The film itself requires concentration and open-mindedness, as it is unlike anything I've ever seen. Assuming that there are several universes and that it is possible to jump from side to side, accessing the selves of other universes, the story unfolds at a hallucinating, captivating, touching and even philosophical pace, launching lines of thought such as "Nothing matters" ; "kindness" as a form of struggle; see the good side of things as a life strategy, not necessarily as naivety. Almost from an existentialist or Beckettian perspective, we can consider that what the film proposes is that at the base of our existence there is nothing and it is our choices and the freedom to choose some things over others that define the human condition.The film uses impressive special effects, which serve the story, but without neglecting the message it intends to convey. And here, the one that seems to me the most profound is related to the fact that the protagonist believes that she has done nothing with her life, because when she gets to know her other selves from other universes, she considers that they had fuller and more interesting lives (although they lacked the most important thing: a family). In fact, when someone tells the protagonist "in another life, I would have loved to do laundry and taxes with you", we have the film deciphered.

This movie is a organized mess, everyone in this movie did a perfect job from the actors to the editors, they created the confusion of the characters and how scared they are, it let you ask yourself what's next and what's going happen, how they are going through this , jumping between the scenes is spotless, it's like organized in messy way .The only thing that have little set down is the propaganda they are sending and the predictable of the ending wish is not so much to be honest.But Definitely one of the best movies i watched in 2022.

reviews.review_title: Do I live in a alternate Mulitiverse?
reviews.content: Went in with high expectations but unfortunately this movie dissapointed me big time. The best part was the beginning but as soon as the action started and the so called plot thickened I ended up being rather dissapointed. I was really expecting the best movie of 2022 so far. The trailer was promising and after Rotten tomatoes held a poll on their Instagram page about A24's best movie ever , this one came out as a winner beating The Lighthouse and Uncut Gems, movies which I enjoyed.Too much action scenes. And what's up with the bagel? And what about all the crazy costumes? After I read the positive reviews again I slowly realized; Do I live in a Multiverse?

You can expect everything in this movie.The action scenes are really well done! The CGI is perfect. The acting is brilliant, the plot is surprisingly gripping considering how frequently movies these days just throw in the word "multiverse" and expect it to make sense, this movie respects that word and presents it in a way that makes sense in the movie's context.The comedy is simply top level, I was laughing every time there was joke or when humorous contexts came up. It doesn't go out of its way to be funny, the comedy is presented in a fluid way.The other thing that this movie does excellently is presenting the female protagonist! They, not once, shove it in the audience's face that she's a woman, they simply present the character and their path towards strength. So many directors mess this up and use exposition or arrogance to make their point about a female character, but here, it's characters being portrayed perfectly, even the old people are portrayed well.10/10.

reviews.review_title: Must see movie - but there will be many who miss the detail
reviews.content: Stunning movie but many details will be overlooked...carefully detailed underlying messages. Googling eyes and character names add to the obvious but also layered themes. I thoroughly enjoyed the storyline, scripting, characters and acting. This is visually entertaining...comedic but also theological - pulling together quantum theory and spirituality. Everything everywhere at once is a display of balance in action. Duality in depth....wrapped in a bit of silly to make it easily digestible. Another clever aspect was the use of subtitles and language...for most viewers that draws your attention. You cannot be distracted- you need to pay attention. Thoroughly recommended viewing - best movie to come out in decades - iI consider it to be must view...

reviews.review_title: One of the best movie of the year.
reviews.content: Not only this is the ultimate movie on the multiverse, even better and more powerful than Marvel and Netflix movies and series on multiverse (Dr. Strange, Loki, Umbrella Academy, etc.). And I am a great fan of that fantastic stuff.Not only this is the ultimate cinematic trip: visionary, crazy, with such a lot of creativity at its best and many ideas that you won't believe they belong to only a two-hour-and-a-half movie. You will leave the theater with the head upside down.This is also a great, beautiful, inspired and inspiring movie. The Daniels are in a state of bliss. Someone gives an award to those writers and directors for this masterpiece.

reviews.review_title: Everything going downhill and you throw up, smiling.
reviews.content: This is the best proof that fast pace and great look are for music clips. One should not call it a "movie". Specially when characterized as " fantasy, comedy, action and sci-fi", all at the same time. Nonsense , made for the TikTok generation. Comes from nothing, leads to nowhere. Shows how a high note on IMDB does not necessarily leads you to a great experience. Thankfully there are a lot of good movies been made nowadays. This is not one of them.

reviews.review_title: Great message regarding compassion in the face of nihlism
reviews.content: The movie has a lot of heart. It has a low budget but everything is executed so well from the special effects making good use of the camera, the few settings used in such creative manners, and the few actors that portray the variety of roles so well. The movie is a joy to experience.

It was a string of weird images and ideas about the multiverse without having a strong, engaging storyline or complex characters.I was very disappointed as I love this sort of thing and the reviews were so strong.

Fantastic story about a woman doing her taxes!Really funny, visually stunning and something totally different for a change.I cannot believe so far two people have complained about grass?Go and watch it.

reviews.review_title: My opinion on the other reviews
reviews.content: I read the good reviews, bad review and out right rude ones. The pattern I've been seeing with the bad reviews is that they call the movie confusing, boring, and someone even talked about the outfits??? The thing about this movie is that it's made to confuse the viewer!! It's a multiverse movie and if you have to have everything spelled out for you watch a documentary instead. It's not mind boggling, head spinning confusing either! Even the 'strange outfits' are symbols of what they are feeling or what universe they're in!! It's very obvious that at the end Stefanie hsu's character is dressing in her emotions, weather scattered and confused, or depressed. They implement these emotions in her outfits that's why they're 'strange'. Now i must admit the beginning is 'boring' but it's starts like that because there is not yet a conflict and it's even said in the movie that she is living her worst version of herself ! This movie doesn't outright spell things out for the viewer but it doesn't hide them from the viewer either. This movie is incredible to watch but it's for the more excepting open minded people. I personally don't really write reviews but this movie broke me emotionally when i thought it was going to be bad due to these reviews.If you watch this movie brace yourself emotionally because you will cry.Also don't watch if you're close minded and don't pay any attention to detail.

reviews.review_title: What a load of old nonsense
reviews.content: It seemed like a good premise at the start and the performances were good, but it quickly became too ridiculous. The attempts at humour were lame and not at all funny - like elementary school playground humour.I find it hard to believe all the 10 and 9 star reviews are real reviewers and not Mechanical Turk. No 6s, 7s, or 8s? Just 9s and 10s! I'm adding this review in an attempt to redress the balance.I went into this movie with high expectations but was severely let down. There's a false "The End" part way through the film and I thought, "Thank god this drivel is over", but then there was more.It could maybe have been a good movie if they just dropped the juvenile comedy that didn't work and either replaced it with more grown-up humour or just left it out.
You don't really understand whats going on at first, but it's absolutely hilarious and full of creative and imaginary scenes which you can never expect.

I have never seen a movie this original and this creative. It was on thing after the next, somethinf totally unexpected. First your crying, screaming laughing, confused, then laughing some more. One of the best movies i've ever seen.

Remarkable film about the power of acceptance, understanding, kindness and love portrayed in a unique way. Totally original story. A reason to believe that there is something new under the sun!! I love this film!!!!

This movie can be a little over the top for some, especially if you don't like confusing moives. But if you like movies what you need to move your braina little bit, you're gonna love this one. It's not too much if you pay attention.Beneath all this mess there is a valuable lesson in here: Nothing matters. Nothing what we do or have done matters because it's all going to be forgotten at some point and the world will end. So why bother? Why try to enjoy anything? The solution according to the movie is, because we can do it together. And it does have some truth in it. Even the worsts things are better if we have someone to lean on.

reviews.review_title: The most brilliant family drama movie ever made
reviews.content:
This movie shouldn't work. The pure insanity this movie is at times should not make it any more than a cheesy action movie but it is so much more than that. The themes that it is able to extract through the pure stupidity and joy of it makes it so absolutely incredible to watch and view and the journey it took me on was one I will never forget.The plot of this movie is so incredibly convoluted and so much is action is packed into this one film but the way the story progresses you truly never feel lost. This is absolutely insane to think about considering how this movie is shot and how quickly it moves but it however a plot that anyone can reflect on and examine for how incredible it is
Plot:2/2The ability for the actors in this film to shift from serious to funny roles is absolutely amazing but the most major props must go to Michelle Yeoh and Stephanie Hsu. There constant clashing weather as mother and daughter or as mortal enemies creates such a wonderful dynamic and one that everyone watching can feel drawn too. However, major props must also go to Ke Hyu Quan whose role as Waymond may be one of the best as well. His ability to quick witted and campy whiles also being one of the biggest drivers of the plot during the third act makes him as well every other minor character so incredible and crucial to the plot of the film.Acting:2/2This is the absolute craziest story I have ever seen and what I should have been throughout the entirety of the film was confused, grossed out, and bored and yet I was captivated for every minute of the film. This film gave so many incredible camera shots and artistry throughout the film that it just keeps you on the edge of your seat and brings you closer to these wonderful characters whose lives you feel so intwined with.Storytelling:1.75/2This film has creativity in spades. The simple family drama mother daughter story has been told so many times but this one did it in such a unique way that it can and will never be replicated again. The fact that someone even thought of a story like this and to tell it in this way makes this story so absolutely wonderful to digest
Creativity:2/2From the costumes to the music to the cinematography, every little minuet detail of this film bring it to the next level. You can tell that every decision was purposefully placed in order to make this movie the absolute best it can be and while there are so many moments when this movie shouldn't work but everything is done so particular that it ends up being perfection
Other Factors:2/2This movie should have never worked and yet it might be the greatest family drama trope ever told because everyone can relate to this film. Everyone can relate to asking why are we here and why this life and that's what makes it so wonderful. This movie shows our purpose for why we live the way we live and the over the top campiness only adds to the overall enjoyment.Overall:9.75/10.

reviews.review_title: One of the great movie of all time ...
reviews.content: Wanna laugh, think, cry, love all at once .... This movie is for u... I always admire Chinese metaphor. They are vey deep and thoughtful. Not very fond of gayism. But apart that thing the mother, daughter relationship was a big hit for me. All the universe she find her mother for a reason!... This one got me... I will wonder if it's not a Blockbuster...

I loved it! Gives vibes of Kurt Vonnegut/David Lynch/Thomas Pynchon. This movie has a great mix of imagination, humor, and clever dialog. It has emotional appeal, but is in no way sappy. I think the filmmakers took a lot of chances in the making of this film, which comes gives it a freewheeling, unpredictable quality.The only criticism I have is that it was a little too long, and some scenes could have been eliminated or shortenedI'm sure that many people will not like this film, because it transgresses many of the formulas of filmmaking and its effects are low-budget and silly. Some people will simply not want to stick with it, but those who do will be rewarded.

I've had really high expectations before watching the movie because the cast and the plot seemed really interesting.Well, the first 15 minutes were interesting and promising. And then I suddenly it turned into a storyline which I couldn't follow anymore. I really wanted to be sucked into the whole plot, but it didn't work out. I had a feeling that too much attention was put into the costumes and action moves which resulted in the lack of any depth. I couldn't connect to the characters. It felt like they were having the same dialogue over and over again, although the scenes were changing rapidly. All in all, I was bored and couldn't wait for the movie to end.

reviews.review_title: As weird as mainstream film can get
reviews.content: It may be a bad idea to do a brief review of a movie this nuanced and deep, but I'll give it a shot.This Sci-Fi Comedy takes you on a journey of a Chinese family in America, jumping between alternate realities and timelines. Ke Huy Quan's character calls upon Michelle Yeoh's character to save the multiverse by defeating a dimension-hopping being hunting her down and attempting to destroy all of reality. Michelle's character might defeat this being by jumping between parallel realities - becoming different versions of herself in different timelines. And that's just the setup.The first thing you'll notice is that this movie is filled with lovable actors playing endearing characters. Michelle and James Hong are legends of the screen and effortlessly pull off their action, comedy, and dramatic sequences. Ke Huy (the Asian kid, now adult, from The Goonies and Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom) oozes kindness and charm. Jamie Lee Curtis also brings her experience to this movie as her presence is always both ridiculous and intimidating throughout.This is significant because these actors play at least 5 - 10 different characters in the movie, spanning every mainstream Hollywood genre. There were artistic liberties in some of these alternate dimensions Michelle goes into. I wish this fictional world had more rules so it isn't just "Anything can happen, so let's throw up whatever we want on the screen!". It's fun but also seemingly art for art's sake.The real story is a family drama caught up in this dimension-hopping chaos. There is meaning in pondering what could have been if you had only made different choices earlier in life. This movie challenges you with accepting the choices you've made up to this point and enjoy your current life despite the mistakes you think you've made. Michelle's character is faced with this challenge multiple times, and it's truly a wonder to watch.Enjoy the acting, the colorful visuals, the action, the comedy, and the philosophical and thought-provoking dialogue all at once. Or not. This isn't your all too familiar genre film. But I'll thoroughly enjoy watching all the awards this movie will inevitably get.

reviews.review_title: Kung Fu is in everything, even Cookies
reviews.content: I saw this Sci-Fi Kung-Fu Comedy last night and enjoyed it.The humour is a quite deadpan but I laughed out loud a few times.Its well made, well acted, visually very interesting and fun to watch. This is certainly not a huge budget blockbuster. It sits more within a decent budget indie film.The Chinese elements of the film ring true in terms of family and tradition and it would seem the idea was to give it all a bit of s slap around the chops. ( With a dildo ?.)Some of the ideas used are truly absurd and silly which may be too much for certain audiences whereas others will revel in them.I was somewhere poised in the middle thinking " well thats new ".There are however deeper meanings to the movie to ponder and the issues sit real and are presented with integrity even if they are not world changing ideologies they are certainly relatable.The science presented in this film is not to be taken seriously so try not to take it as so.Overall this was a fun and enjoyable Chinese centric romp about family choices and destiny.

reviews.review_title: Give me more crazy multiversal films
reviews.content: This was not the action adventure movie that I went in expecting, but something so much better. It was a family-centric comedy, with some fun action tropes sprinkled in. There was so much I enjoyed/appreciated about this film; the camera work, the lighting, all the unique little quirks that set it apart from other cliches, and the fact that there were DIFFERENT ASPECTS RATIOS IN DIFFERENT UNIVERSES. Waymond was easily my favourite character, just because he's really the kind of person I want to be. Although, I think my favourite scene was one of the few with only Joy and Evelyn. The scene in the rock universe. It felt similar in tone to Spirited Away's train scene (with a hint more comedy) just because it allowed us to breath and reflect on how the characters have grown and changed. The comedy was pretty hit or miss for me, and there was some that was just a little too much, and I am sad that it fell into some of the chosen one tropes that I'm just a little too tired of but overall it was a really fun film. 9.3/10 live like Waymond.
Wow , this has to be one of the greatest films of all times . Just wow . Storyline, characters , very powerful , everything just syncs well. I'm out of words as to how brilliant this movie was.

reviews.review_title: They just had to make it about The Message
reviews.content: Some fun effects from an amateur crew, weak acting from some seasoned (and not) actors, and unfortunate Hollywood spin make this both an entertaining yet regrettably stupid film. It's comical - and not always intentionally so - but the goofy and dumb performances can't be carried by the special effects, and neither can the story, which doesn't quite stretch the imagination enough (which tops it off with "Asian grandpa must accept granddaughter is a lesbian"). Nice imagery and neat Matrix spin, but I'll pass on watching if this kept rolling past the credits.Rock universe, piñata universe, drawing universe exist... where everything is lifelike. Lesbian granddaughter central plot point.... Yep, 4 stars.

Deep story telling, hilariously unthinkable comedy, and good editing. One of the movie that I stood there watching without a blink and dont feel bored easily like other films so far. This is kind of movie that any directors should direct, with no cliche comedy, no cliche drama, and to much CGI just to backup bad story telling.

reviews.review_title: Craziest movie I have seen in years
reviews.content: This was the craziest film I have seen in a long while. What a complete trip. Michelle Yeoh is utterly brilliant in this. After all of these years of her being around, it's nice to see her get her time in the sun.The movie is bonkers though and I don't think everybody will enjoy it, it's relentless in its quirkiness and I think you definitely need to be in the mood for this kind of film else it will most likely fall flat for you. I recommended it to my family (mom and dad and my sister and her husband) and they all stopped watching it halfway "calling it the biggest load of rubbish".There is a scene mid-way that made me tear up with laughter. I laughed so hard I though I was going to have a heart attack. I can't remember laughing that hard in a movie in donkey's ages (it involves phallic looking objects )If you are looking for something really creative and fresh I would definitely recommend this one. As I mentioned its a trip. It felt like I had taken some hits from the good stuff.

reviews.review_title: In 30 years the humanity moved from "nothing else matters" to "nothing matters"
reviews.content:
The movie is in its own cathegory, therefore no rating should apply. Compare it with classical movies, it is nothing, gets a 1... Compare it with modern martial arts movies, it is brilliantly reverting to martial arts essence and gets an 8... Compare it with revolutionary Sci Fi franchises, like The Matrix, it is an upgraded version, that is and is not new in the same time - not sure what rating applies.The thing is this movie is a bit of every of the above, and others more, therefore should probably be rewatched, and what glues it together and allows a possible rating would be the note that is most constant in the aftertaste, repeatedly, and its value within that cathegory, if it is not one completely devoid of competition. The producers have however mentioned Rick and Morty, and there are other movies concerning multiverses, or game universes, so maybe it is a cathegory in the making, being populated as we speak.What can I say, without rewatching?*for the moment I do not know if I even want to rewatch it, the feeling can be described as sort of a brain hangover
*it aims to help with some of the disaster felt by young generations, like giving instructions on how to deal with chaos better, because chaos itself ain't gonna be solved soon
*it provides similar help for older generations that served as a bridge towards what is going on, although in the story, it was their fault for rushing things and in fact they are the ones who caused chaos and all the pressure the young have today
*it feels more like a family centered drama, or a generations centered one, than a Sci Fi
*could have skipped the sex-related elements, but I guess they are sending a message for all those who went to this extreme in their quest for meaning and purpose, or just for effing feeling something again in what they perceive as a world devoid of sensorial stimuli
*brilliant reintroduction of martial arts, after the mess made by all the commercial movies depicting them - martial arts are NOT originally sports, but energy manipulation, triggering physical effects
*lots of concepts from India and Asia mythology and spirituality, weirdly unexplained - I saw interviews where the movie team claims certain names, visuals and gestures are just gamified, jokes or creative randomness - why do they lie?! Mythological motifs of chaos and certain entities that rule it, or generate it, abund, and the movie's elements can be traced back to some of these. And it does not just happen, because they have details - the way Jobu steps aside her mother's head on the stairs, in closeup, is a reminder of how Kali stopped in her destruction after stepping with her right foot above her husband... but I am not completely familiar with these motifs to be able to understand exactly how they used them.. Just noticing they are in the movie, and not "by chance". Also the Indian movie playing on the screen, I would have to know what movie or story is that, to understand a bit... so, more things to find out. Maybe they claim randomness because the young would turn away from "we're repacked for your understanding some very very old things" - maybe...
*someone here concluded that the message is "set aside what could have been, and just strive to be happy with what you have, even modest". I think not! There is a complicated explanation in the movie of why this Evelyn is the one needed to solve her daughter's entanglement with the chaos, and it is completely different. I am making an effort here, but by abandoning one dream after another, this Evelyn lives her "failure" version of a life with her eyes wide open, making herself available to see it all from the outside, being herself mobile in concepts and strong when it comes to aknowledge other versions exist. She is un-lodged in one type of life, non attached or less attached to a fixated truth, as her better more successful versions are, therefore open to seeing the possibilities and able to understand her daughter's story
*the message IS an empowering one, although hard to pin down; what do you do when there is nothing stable, secure, predetemined and calming around? And it is a fact, beyond the bull*it of "you are just troubled because you have to change the way you think" psychanalytic mantra... what do you do when the world is bluntly going down the drain, as you used to know it? What do you hold on to? The movie wants to help with getting an answer, which could be, I imagine, understood by each viewer in its own way.

... cause there's pretty much a bit of everything. Everything Everywhere All At Once is a genre-bending multiverse film, it's a non-stop action, comedy, drama, fantasy, sci-fi, thriller and a little bit of romance. It's the kind of film that you're not really sure how describe it to your friends when they asks what it's about. It's definitely a fresh, eccentric out of the box film of its genre.It has decent story and very well acted but what strike my attention is the visual. It's definitely has the most extravagantly colorful striking cinematography and editing. Especially with the little budget they had (from what i heard cmiiw). It's definitely a strong OSCAR contender.But with all that being said, with all these overtly colorful strong visual and heavy drama, at times it feels a bit too...much(?) Don't get me wrong, it's still an extremely well made film, but it feels a bit overwhelming to watch, even with only 2hr19min runtime.Anyway, definitely a must watch.9/10.

Everything Everywhere All at Once is a movie that starts by painting a lot of chaos around you and makes you sit exactly at the center of it. Right off the bat, it introduces too many characters which then introduces the plot which then pushes the story forward and it keeps going on unless it overwhelms you with its sheer size of concept. Actors starting from Michelle Yeoh to Ke Huy Quan to Jamie Lee Curtis and everyone else have done such a phenomenal job with their performance that it just makes you want to focus on the story going forward and forget everything else. The story itself from start to end stays very chaotic but even among that it manages to express itself beautifully. Editing, cinematography, and other departments have put in so much staggering work that your wondering just doesn't stop at all. Directors Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert have created a harmony that has too many things stacked and packed in it but the way they have delivered it on the plate with a desert, in the end, is enough to keep you sitting until the end to taste it. All in all, Everything Everywhere All at Once is a movie that you will probably witness once in your life but you will surely don't wanna let that be your last time.

Well, I laughed, I cried, then I cried while laughing. I'm not sure how they managed to reach so many emotions, all at once (pun intended), but it definitely worked. I literally sent a message to my wife, who was travelling, after one scene where they were holding hands. I started watching this film without knowing exactly what I was getting into but was completely taken by the simplicity and complexity of this story. Every aspect of the characters serves a purpose to the story and moves the plot forward. The humour is so silly but amazingly funny. I guess funny doesn't need to be too complicated. What a masterpiece.
There wasn't a moment during this movie I wasn't completely engulfed in the story or its mechanics. I loved the trippy nature of exploring the many "verses". Definitely recommend. Would see again.

It is disgusting. Senseless, tasteless, talentless, animelike, over the top stupid, naive, degenerative, unfunny and boring. I heard that people talk good about this movie, that they admire it, but i don't have a clue what they've found in this vomit. Seriously, even considering most people like and call bad movies 10/10 masterpieces, this one is even worse. People just can't stop happily eating excrements.

It could have been 30 minutes shorter, but OMG what a ride. Makes you think about life. Action, comedy, emotional. Highly recommend! I go to the movies about once every 5 years, but I am glad I went to see this film.
Absolutely brilliant.Crazy, out there, silly... and then unique and beautiful.The kind of movie you really hope wins Oscars to get the kind of recognition it deserves.

This was a fun, visually exciting but certainly not mainstream action/comedy whose main characters are female. The story arc considers what matters most to women in general. This includes love, success, relationships, fulfilling one's dreams and being our best self. It offered fabulous performances from all cast members with special mention going to Michelle Yeoh, Jamie Lee Curtis and Stephanie Hsu. The husband and father roles performed by James Hong and Je Huy Quan were equally strong. The film both mocked and praised the action world of super heroes. Ultimately admitting that stories about alternate universes, like our own daily lives, make little sense. It encourages us to admit that we have little control over what works and what doesn't work in business, relationships and love. In the end Evelyn (Michelle Yeoh) must learn to stop fighting and pushing others away in an attempt to achieve standards of middle class migrant success. There are some wonderful gems stated about the role of middle aged women at the end of the film with the best dialogue occurring between the female leads. Go with an open mind and enjoy this visually impressive film.
Though it's incredibly inventive with the visuals and narrative, it's still grounded by the amazing performances from all the actors and plenty of relatable moments.

If you're looking for something different that's still incredibly high quality, watch this movie. It's a very impressive masterpiece in every aspect. I will say no more than I feel confident that it'll be my favorite movie of the year.

reviews.review_title: One of the best movies I've ever seen
reviews.content: I loved how smart, silly and moving this movie was. I laughed until my stomach hurt and cried until my eyes were red, and through it all I was contemplating the meaning of life while exploring the idea of the multiverse. This movie is truly Everything Everywhere all at once.I believe it to be one of the greatest films of the past decade, without a doubt. It is an exciting mixture of emotional ups and downs, and every scene has a deeper meaning behind it.This movie is a must-see for every film buff, especially if you enjoy delving into a variety of concepts and find the notion of the multiverse particularly intriguing.

I didn't know much about this movie going in, but I've now seen it three times and intend to watch it over and over again. Probably one of the best movies I've ever seen! It had me intrigued, laughing, and even crying. I recommend everyone should watch it at least once.

Well, the movie of the year will not be a $100+ million budget movie, but a smart, funny, heartfelt, creative piece that will take you to other possible outcomes of our lives, teach about family relations and roles. Gosh I love this instant classic and makes me want to watch again and pay more attention.It will make you wondering about "what ifs", your choices in your past and your future possibilities, trick you into believe that nothing means anything, but at the end, where everything comes together you realize that in life, it's really you and here and right now.

Everything everywhere all at once is a truly heartwarming film that surprised me with how hilarious it is. Wonderful cinematography from the get go. This film is very wacky and weird at times, so if you prefer a straight-forward plot, maybe this isn't the film for you. But for those who can sit back and enjoy the madness, give this film a go, you won't regret it.

This should have had a 1.5 hour runtime to cut all the needless repeat and retreading and it would have been a possible 8/10.Now, be prepared to get bored halfway through it and waiting for the final act to conclude its message.Missed opportunity.

reviews.review_title: This is a very fun movie
reviews.content: It's about an Chinese imergrant family that runs a laundromat. The Members of the Family are Eveyln the mother, Joy the daughter and Waymon the father. They are throwing a party at the laundromat and the daughter Joy wants to invite her girlfriend and she keeps asking her mom if she could come. The mother Evelyn is a bit of a closeted homophobe. When she introduces Joy's girl friend Becky to the Grandfather she says they are good friends. And the daughter Joy is heartbroken. Evelyn's husband Wayman from the Alpha verse. Warns her that Jobu Jokai is after her. In an alternate universe. Eveyln is a scientist that discovered how to "Verse Jump" into other universes. Verse Jumping is when you are able to gain the abliites of another version of yourself from another universe. You have to do something improbable in order to hack into the other universe. If she does something odd and presses the button on the fancy headset she can get abilities from another version of herself from another universe. She was training people to verse Jump and she over experimented on her daughter Joy. Joy decides to go rouge and destroy all the other universes. The twist is the daughter Joy is the villian of the movie Jovu Japaki. It's an insane, goofy, emotional movie.

This is a film about subtext taken to reductio ad absurdum levels, which by definition, are philosophical 'failures' of the proposition(s). But this is all to the good, and I did enjoy it immensely. Everything taken to its absurd logical conclusion is by definition a failure.What I didn't enjoy is the kung fu. At all. I usually love long films but this is padded out by far too much kung fu nonsense, IMO. Though perhaps this is the ad absurdum subtext of that particular theme in a film that reductios all its themes - evidenced perhaps when credits roll halfway through, conning the viewer into frantically summarising the experience so far and questioning the sense of an ending happening at this point.The early eruption of casual violence also jarred and reminded me of the essential dilemma of Hollywood's glamourising of violence and guns, the easy and compulsive recourse to violence instead of action, depicted by those who often speak loudly from the other side of their mouths about gun control, violence etc. But I might be mentally concussed by all the screen violence though, and 'it's all good' - somehow.Having said all that, I loved the carnivalesque feel, the hurly burly family framework, and of course, Michelle Yeoh. Her gritty portrayal as the alpha female is great, drowning in duty yet somehow staying afloat. It's a tribute to her that she is exposed so relentlessly and exhaustingly throughout the film, seemingly never giving up. The ad absurdum of the sausage fingers timeline is interesting - their first scenes contrast to their recurrence later when Yeoh and Jamie Lee Curtis as lovers are using their feet - as if a mid project focus group had suggested that the absurdity needed to be clawed back - although why I am not sure, considering the hit and miss two boulders timeline - but feet playing piano - sure, ok . . .James Hong is an absolute legend. And interestingly, while the portrayal of the husband as a beta underperformer is the post modern standard for Hollywood, in other timelines he is a successful identity, so they did create a measure of complexity for the much maligned male stereotype. In the end though, the promise of the start seems to diffuse out into excessive kung fu and portrait art, long after we have grasped the 'message' that is being transmitted in sometimes epilepsy inducing cutting. I did like the crayon art scenes - very nice and totally reductio.For many not into hypermanic and infantile Pixar nonsense, (sorry fans!) the racoonie bits don't work. At least the bagel harks back to medieval Poland, apparently, symbolising a long life and good luck in childbirth.That's the beauty of a good film. You watch it, don't get some references, do some research, watch it again with a greater appreciation, noticing all the effort going into the art work and the role playing.

Many questions of my own mental health Answered, stirring up a few newer questions albeit as well. Love it. Michelle Yeoh gives a master class along with supporting actors bringing their very best. If you enjoy Krazy and cool movies. You might just enjoy this one. If you are more into the size of the magazine the bullets fit in. You may not. This one causes thinking so enter at own risk. Hope you dig it.

THE DANIELS IS BACK!Wow wow wow! The Daniels is back, and once again deliverd a phenomonal movie.Everything Everywhere All At Once is a totally bonkers and just an amazing movie. This movie really has it all, great comedy which made me laugh out loud a couple of time, the action sequences in this movie is great with some really awesome choreography. And the story is really great with a really beautiful messages.This is just a phenomonal movie that really caught me. This is one of the best movies of 2022. A24 has done it again.

reviews.review_title: Cab I give it a negative rating?
reviews.content: I was completely confused by whatever that was I was watching. I had no idea what was supposed to be going on, or what all the fuss was about. The fact I made it 15 minutes before shutting it off surprises me. I wanted to stop sooner, but kept waiting for something, anything, to keep my interest. Unfortunately that never happened. I'm upset I wasted that much time on this mindless nonsense. It did leave me with one great hope. If this piece of garbage can win so many awards, whats to stop me from writing the next great piece of mindless drivel and becoming rich? I'll tell you what. I will look at it again, just to see how easy it can be to come up with a nonsensical idea that will win awards and fool people the world over!

One of the greatest and deep storylines with crazy mind-boggling scenes. It literally changes my opinion of the world.Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry. Lorem Ipsum has been the industry's standard dummy text ever since the 1500s, when an unknown printer took a galley of type and scrambled it to make a type specimen book. It has survived not only five centuries, but also the leap into electronic typesetting, remaining essentially unchanged. It was popularized in the 1960s with the release of Letraset sheets containing Lorem Ipsum passages, and more recently with desktop publishing software like Aldus PageMaker including versions of Lorem Ipsum.

While reading others reviews, is that we perhaps saw different things, but still this story seems to have opened many hearts, like it did mine. Absurdly funny and transcending, hope you'll rewatch it sometime if it did not land on first viewing. "Be kind, especially when you don't know what's happening".Other words about things: taxes, family, friendship, inherited brokenness, family bonds, transcending pain, transcending nihilism. Googly eyes, above all. Kindness above all, love as the tool to wield against aggression, never seen it so sweetly expressed, although the concept is not new. Sausages. It's a wild ride, and gives so much to reflect upon.

reviews.review_title: Bagel, hotdog fingers whatever all at once.
reviews.content: A Chinese immigrant discovered the possibility of connecting with other universes and use her abilities in these universes to save the world as her "alpha univers" husband claims to be the chosen one for this mission .This film is an example of how good reviews and high expectations can ruin the experience.For me this film is adopting a new idea and create a big mess, the multiverse principles in this movie are very interesting very creative to be honest but the execution is messy in a weird way.I'm still asking myself what is special about it, and the only answer is the directing, a decent cinematography, colors and costume designs...every frame was visually stunning.Turning those creepy ideas into an actual film isn't that easy, that's why I'm appreciating the technical stuff and their efforts.But, it can't be enough, it's other missed opportunity about the multiverse.

Obviously this is a film you either love or hate. I am the latter. Ok, some of the acting may be brilliant and the special effects good. But the story is disjointed to nonexistent and at times really stupid. An existential bagel, hotdog fingers, living rocks. I ask you! This was either thought up by people with warped minds or on drugs. I'm now looking for a quantum physicist to explain the plot and a psychologist to help me get over it
This film has already scooped numerous awards and will no doubt do well at the Oscars. As a mere movie viewer I'm very pleased I saw this free on Prime Video rather than fork out my hard earned cash at the cinema.

Overrated, boring, a cheap movie with novice actors. If you want to lose 2 hours of your life, you can watch this mixture of pointless scenes filmed in a so-called original movie. The action is far from being original. It's more an absurd parody, good for children (a couple of scenes are quite funny and could make a child laugh). The actors performance is also overrated. The "Ratatouille" scene is ridiculous. I read, as usual, the storyline, and although I was not very convinced, decided to watch, thinking it is a good one. I just hope this production will not set a new trend in cinematography.....

reviews.review_title: Of all the places I could be, I just want to be here with you.
reviews.content: Hotdog hands down, one of the most creative and well executed movies I've ever seen! Everything from the visual storytelling, to the acing, to the score, to the choreography is a joy to watch! I think the story has the potential to resonate with anyone who can imagine a more exceptional version of themselves. I cried multiple times and can't wait to watch it again!
Boring and confusing at the same time. I kept waiting for some coherent plot to materialize, but it was just a ridiculous mess, that didn't make much sense. I couldn't finish.

All this because they wanted to make a film about stress, dissatisfaction, and teenage angst?Geez.It was a nice ride for a while, a bit of fun, then it got old and silly really quickly, and then I longed for the end.The quirky and real bits were far between and lost in the madness.It didn't make a lot of sense, which was the fun part, but then it was supposed to have this big preachy moralistic message, and then I'm just out. I am unmanipulatable.Everything was predictable, and the ending had me completely uninvolved. Hollywood kitsch.This was NOT an exploration on a multiverse, this was just a therapy session for mother and daughter.Be kind, be understanding, thus avoid the multiverse. There, and without dildos.

This was a weird, funny, and moving, movie about a woman who wanted to do her taxes.It is significantly better than the majority of Marvel movies, that start with CGI and make a movie around it. This movie put the story first, and used CGI as needed.

My gosh words cannot express how flipping awesome this movie is!It's like The Matrix meets David Lynch. A scifi psychological thriller,
With lesbian representation!And the dad is super cute I am crushing.It also deals with mental illness in a really good way.Highly recommend!

I love everything about this movie! The weirdness and the seriousness behind it..
The focus is a lot on generational trauma..
Best movie I watched in years, I hope people will recognize how genius it is...

reviews.review_title: A film that really captures your mind!
reviews.content: I love Michelle Yeoh! Her performance in this movie versus her performance as the mother in Crazy Rich Asians proved how terrific an actor she is! I also enjoyed seeing Short Round (Ke Huy Quan), From Indiana Jones and the Temple of doom, as an adult.In an interview I read with Jamie Lee Curtis, she mentioned how great it was not to have to suck in her gut, for a change. Her performance as well, was fantastic.I saw this movie with a fairly large group of people and they all agreed with me, that this was a great film!

reviews.review_title: Most original well thought out movie
reviews.content: So original, quirky, weird, funny and emotional! The storytellers brain must be so unique to imagine this up! It was a joy to watch at every moment! Great acting from the cast also! Would love more original pieces like this.

reviews.review_title: not for every one, if first 20 min don't grab you-drop it.
reviews.content: Not sure if it is "A must see". First attempt-fell asleep like at 30 min. Next day decided to finish it no mater what, only cause of high rating. Wanted to drop after 15 min. Was hoping it'll get better , it didn't. I'm very open minded and SiFi leaning, can tolerate a lot of outside the box thinking, but this one is not my cup of tea, fer sure. Mix of Matrix+Kung fu Hustle + Spider Man multiverse + sprinkled with trivial message : love each other, be kind. I love all of those individually , but this hush push was not a winner to me. Maybe I Had to smoke something before watching it, but i didn't, lol.

"So, even though you have broken my heart yet again, I wanted to say, in another life, I would have really liked just doing laundry and taxes with you."A marvelous masterpiece that is both entertaining and thought provoking. This movie touches on so many points that I can't be bothered to list them all. But most importantly, the film is about the comparison of nihilism and Confucianism. The rock scene was amazing. Without a doubt one of the best movies of the 2020s. Very well thought out. I really liked the visual effects and was shocked when I read the note in the trivia section. Incredible work. I really appreciate the directors and actors.

reviews.review_title: The Dissection of story by story
reviews.content:
All stories are told in someone's perspective. Perspective is always limited. As a result, it becomes incomplete and factually incorrect.In this film with the, common events and choices of daily life had been shown in multiverse theme .Already there are films which are made with similar theme. Like The Matrix, Mr. Nobody, Dr. Strange. But this absurd comedy film is more complex, chaotic and multi-dimensional.Based on many variables, we come to the conclusion what happened with us either good or bad, right or wrong and so on. All such conclusions are irrelevant and don't matter in cosmic scale.Philosopher Alan Watts said,
The meaning of life is just to be alive.It is so plain, obvious & so simple. And yet, everybody rushes around in a great panic as if it were necessary to achieve something beyond them.

This movie is incredible. Everything about it is just perfect and the shots are amazing. I love all the visual effects and that this movie is definitely one of the best movies this year and might be the best this year. Very great film.

reviews.review_title: A very fun take on the multiverse
reviews.content: Honestly with all the dirty jokes and how it all comes back full circle, movie could have used some more comedy. I noticed that there was a lot of dark scenes too, some more color would have been great as I do not own an oled or HDR monitor/tv.Music was absolutely gorgeous.Romance, if I were to compare it to Dr Strange multiverse of madness, is all the more present here than it was in MoM, really liked it.The whole family theme was slightly odd but fit very well with the whole setting.

I've only seen this film once and that was shortly after it was released in theaters for the first time. Almost a year later I'm still in awe of the brilliance that this film is and the Daniels are two truly brilliant directors that deserve all the praise and accolades they are receiving, same for the rest of the cast and everyone involved. The film had me laughing, crying, and feeling so much hope and joy and I truly believe it will go down as one of the best films of the decade. This will be the film you see added to the Criterion Collection years from now, and will definitely be in the top 100 films of all time list. To put so many moving elements together (comedy, sci-fi, action, drama, mystery) all in one and make it work shows how talented the directors are and the cast was a cherry on top. Ke He Quan's performance was heartwrenchingly beautiful and what a truly wonderful comeback for him after a 20 year hiatus. An Oscar would be the most deserving award for him, especially after he thought his acting career was over despite being a child star. Stephanie Hsu is truly pheonomal and as her first major role, she takes the spotlight and gives so many layers and dimensions (literally) to her character which really showcases how talented she is and I hope she too can get an Oscar win. Lastly, Michelle Yeoh is brilliant. Perfect casting and I must give credit again to the Daniels for making a 50+ woman the lead protagonist in the film and really showing the world what a talent she is given her longevity in the film industry. This is the first film I've seen of hers but I have so much respect for her. While the lead actress category at the Oscars has some strong contenders, she too is worthy of the award for her performance.

The film Everything Everywhere All at Once is the trippiest, most confusing movie I've ever watched in my life. There is so much bouncing around, and it requires a lot of thought and attention to understand it enough to enjoy it. And those are my only real cons. It's a great movie, and it does have a pretty depressing tone with a lot of scenes having a sense of hopelessness. There is still plenty of moments with a great sense of hope, but I wouldn't recommend to those who struggle mentally. Michelle Yeoh always nails her parts, especially as disapproving mothers for some reason. It's a bizarre film with a crazy new angle for the movie industry. I wouldn't mind seeing more like this, just maybe with a happier tone. A lot of visuals are really cool but also really trippy and hard to watch. The action is also really good, and the movie is full of it. So while it's a really depressive movie, it's also a whole new crazy A24 movie with lots of new, creative things brought to the table that I wouldn't mind seeing a whole lot more of in other films.

reviews.review_title: A philosophy course that painfully drags.
reviews.content: Sorry, I couldn't get into it. It's like picking thru the mind of an elderly Asian woman and learning why she hates her life, why she can't figure out her lesbian daughter, then blames her dad for it all. That's it in a nutshell. If you got the time to sit down and go thru their philosophy, this is your thing. I've heard people mention "nihilism". Nah...it's "absurdism" all the way. People walked out, not to come back, just to walk out.... I cheered them on. It was an experience..that, ultimately, wasn't my thing. I'm not glad I saw this.

reviews.review_title: So overrated I cringed through the whole film
reviews.content: I watched it because of the high ratings. I cringed physically throughout the whole film, literally face all cringed up and body sitting sideways towards the screen in disgust. This movie has no storyline at all just a bunch of lame jokes put together. It looks like a middle school student's project done with his childish buddies as a joke. Are people just afraid to say what they really think? Just having the multiverse concept doesn't make a movie good. Stick something up your ahole to teleport to another universe wow real funny you got me... and also what's up with the lgbt agenda? You have to guide your child on the right path that's literally the job of a parent. I rate this 1/10 just to bring balance to the ratings it really should be around 3 or 4 at most. The dad did well tho he's a good actor.

reviews.review_title: A wonderful and funny film that explores every possibility/outcome
reviews.content: Going into this movie I had no idea what to expect at all. I mean sure, from the description of the movie I was kind of expecting chaos but what I got was chaos and then some... This movie was indeed Everywhere All at Once.I honestly loved it. I thought it would just be a plain old boring run of the mill time/dimension story but it turned out much MUCH better than I expected. The comedy was on point, the acting was superb, the plot was very intriguing and fun. I mean what was there not to love about this? Dan Kwan and Daniel Scheinert did a wonderful job directing this movie.And usually with these type of movies, the ending is always open for interpretation and left very open but I thought "Everything Everywhere All at Once" did a perfect job wrapping it all up in a nice little box leaving us with a very satisfying ending.

I usually only rate titles on here for the algorithm recommend me things I haven't seen yet. I felt boarder-line euphoric leaving the theatre after all the emotions this film made me feel. Go to your theatre with an open mind, embrace the chaos and enjoy.

I dont often give a film 10 stars, but this was superb. It was an intense and bizarre ride, with the strange concepts stretching so far out there at times, it was as though they made more sense. It was visually stunning, the costumes were epic, and the balance of humor and emotion was perfect. LOVED IT. No one else was meant for this role other than Michelle Yeoh. She brought the lead to life in the most beautiful, meaningful, perfect way. This whole movie was mind blowing.

reviews.review_title: This felt like a catharsis of an asian kid.
reviews.content: If you want to understand what it's like growing up in an asian family, this movie is everything from the disappointing realty to the hopeful dream. At least, that's what I got from an asian american point of view. The jumping around subtitles and the disorienting way the movie is shot can turn off people but I think that it was meant to make to make the audience feel disoriented. On a more general themes, this movie also touches on grander philosophical themes of nihilism and conflict vs interpersonal relationships. As cheesy that may seem, I thought it pull it off very well.
Walked out of the cinema after 30 minutes. Looks like the screen play was for Jacky Chan in A spy kids remake "kind of" movie directed by someone who did Dogs's Cats.

This was supposed to be good? LOL
its like a rip off of the matrix with family drama lgbtq agenda all over it.There were sooo many exact lines ripped from the matrix...not to mention the fact that the directors claimed they were the only ones that made the movie LOLsave your time and money find something else to watch this is a complete garbage canid rather watch a garbage can roll down a hill than watch this againsave your time and money find something else to watch this is a complete garbage can
save your time and money find something else to watch this is a complete garbage can.!!

reviews.review_title: What were the Critics Choice Awards thinking?
reviews.content: One of the absolute worst films I've ever seen. I couldn't get through half of it. I don't understand the high ratings it has received. Am I watching the same film? Not only is it NOT funny, but it's far-fetched, ridiculous and doesn't even have a good plot line. It put me in the worst mood bc I will not get that hour back.The acting is way over the top. I'm surprised Jamie Lee Curtis agreed to this film, but then again, she did Halloween, so there you go. Save yourself two hours and do not bother with this film (if you even want to call it that), unless you enjoy the genre that "Attack of the Killer Tomatoes" falls in. What a waste!

I can't believe that this movie has 8,2 score raiding. Really????I tried really hard to watch it but thankfully i only wasted 40 minutes of my life.This is probably one of the worst films i have tried to see.PS. I can't believe the comments I have read about it.The only laughable thing about all this, is the comments. This film should not be excised.

reviews.review_title: most annoying movie I have ever watched
reviews.content: It was so incredibly bad.
