The linse were terribly cliché, the 'humor' was for 12-year old permanently online "random = funny XDDDD" kids, the 'philosophy' was the most drab and overused optimistic nihilism, the ending was one big eye-roll fest ("family and love saves the dayyyy"), the characters were incredibly ugly and uncharismatic, the sci-fi gimmick makes no sense and is inconsistent in its own universe, it is intentionally filled with cringe, the plot is just all filler and the end is very drawn out, the action makes no impact because everything is possible so the audience cannot care (if they think for just a few seconds), etc...

reviews.review_title: How a complex concept should be portrayed
reviews.content: This is one of the most interesting and complex movies I have ever seen. No other films have taken the idea of the multiverse head on and displayed it with accurately. You become immersed in the idea of an ever expanding multiverse each with its own side plot. It is not only the concept that is engaging but the directing and storytelling is peak. At first I thought the cast was mid but after this film perfectly characterized each person so well I actually came to really like them. The only thing that I would've liked/ preferred is if the film didn't act as a comedy so much as some of the jokes came off as cringe or unnecessary. I can not think of any other films to compare this to this is truly one of a kind and a much watch to anyone who can comprehend complex ideas such as this. In reality the concepts portrays are way more complicated than what was shown the film does its absolute best with the format its given to expand while staying consistent tot he main plot as possible. The film seems more as a summary since each alternate universe could be its own side story but the movie does. This can easily be a film series or a TV show on its own but compacting it all into one movie while also getting your message across is near to an impossible task for most people which is why I believe this movie should be made mandatory to watch by everyone.

We finally found out what happened to all Bluetooth devices that we discarded in late 2000s hahahaI have never seen such a good, goofy, action packed with martial arts, hot dog-gy, "google" eyes such this movie.A delightful surprise to start the year on a high note!!! This movie deserves so many Oscars, including Best Editing! I cannot emphasize how good and imaginative the editing is.Everyone, everywhere all at once should see the movie. The cast alone is worth the ticket. Michele, Jamie Lee and co do a great job. And the outtakes on the Blu-ray edition makes things funnier, nice touch.

reviews.review_title: Genius, Brilliant... Film of the Year
reviews.content: This film, very unexpectedly, blew me away. In one fell swoop, it also ends all multiverse story lines Hollywood can ever come up with, and forever will be number one in it's field. It's that good.I will not and cannot tell you the plot, you'll have to experience it yourself. But I can tell you this film is about love, regret, making peace with one's choices, and also... taxes. And it does so in the most absurd, endearing and laugh-out-loud way possible, kung fu style, in a freaking launderette.Quick fire on the production: it's top notch, the special effects are bang on point, the performances could not have been better but most of all, the editing is beyond fantastic.I laughed, cried, then absolutely bellowed from all this awesomeness. I cannot wait to see what this production team comes up next. Do yourself a favor and take one good decision in this universe: go for it. Hands down, film of the year.

My wife and I waded through about 25 mins of this horrid mess, just waiting for a movie to appear, it did not.Why this poorly scripted waste of talent was labeled in part a comedy / adventure is no more than false advertising.To say this movie is a disjointed mess is a compliment. We are still trying to understand why it was even made and whether or not the writer was high on drugs when writing it.A real stinker in every way.

The worst movie ever !You feel like the time stops while watching this movie ! It just never get to its end!! The story line is very hard to follow though I guess it doesn't have any ! To complete this tragedy piece in cinema history, the actors have also contributed their share and you totally can see everything is fake although the director of this so-called movie has failed to observe it apparently.

reviews.review_title: a Marvel movie done by Satoshi Kon
reviews.content: EEAaO is a great movie for a new generation, I wouldn't necessarily recommend it to folks who aren't into high paced movies where you have to pay attention. People who aren't unsure should maybe check out the music videos those two guys directed first to give you a hint. I'm saying that only because I have seen audiences leaving the cinema halfway through the movie, which is a great sign in my opinion. But it is also a double edged sword: it cuts really deep, but sometimes less is more. There are a lot of over-indulgent parts, especially when it comes to running jokes and the 4th act. I think this could have been edited down to a good half an hour, since the catharsis overstays it's welcome.It's still a great movie regardless, since I always prefer highly original material. Although there is a huge amount of hommages from many famous movies, one that stuck with me after the movie is the editing. There is an element of Satoshi Kon's editing style in how previous scenes are being re-contextualized in a collage of time and space. It's a concept Kon was famous for and Nolan seems to be still striving for. It's really interesting to see other diretors applying this concept. Since I watched Doctor Strange Multiverse of Madness two weeks ago, the comparisons came up necessarily while I was watching. And I was wondering why this movie feels so much better than Doctor Strange in that regard. Obviously there are characters you truly care about here who amount to more than quips.I honestly prefer Swiss Army Man over this one, but I'm glad that DANIELS is back and hope to see more movies from them in the future. It is truly a great ride once you embrace it.

Might as well have been Nothing Nowhere Sporadically. If you can tune yourself to absurdism, this movie is a great watch. Michelle Yeoh Choo Kheng plays that role exceptionally well in that role in a way that is absurd, funny, and down to earth at the same time. The bagel, however, was way too absurd for me. The role of Joy Wang could have been better portrayed, while Ke Huy Quan gives a very decent supporting performance. The combination of multiple roles and capabilities of the main character, and the swift switch between those roles, sometimes with absurd overlaps, makes this a worthwhile watch even if absurdism doesn't interest you.

reviews.review_title: Did someone put drugs in my beer?
reviews.content: I'm still reeling from having seen EEAAO. There's almost certainly a parallel universe somewhere where Old McDonald had a film called EEAAO, as the old nursery rhyme has it. If I had ever taken mind-altering drugs before, I might have been on familiar ground, but as it was I think the film makers took those drugs for me. I don't know they were on something at the time, but how else do you explain this incredible concoction?One of the things I liked best about it was the unashamed willingness to be a vehicle for monumental silliness. If you don't like ridiculous humour, this film might wear thin very quickly. Luckily, I do enjoy it when done well, and for much of the middle act of the story the ludicrous spectacle was relentless, and hilarious. You just never know what's coming next.But happily for some there's much more to EEAAO than absurdity and comedy. It's also quite touching, and charming, and has a few serious points to make about life, which avoids being mawkish or overly sentimental (just), thanks in part to leavening with the aforementioned silliness.It's also incredibly imaginative. To combine the mind-expanding elements with the utter mundanity of a woman struggling with her taxes, and make a coherent story that ultimately pulls all the loose threads together for a surprisingly satisfying conclusion, is quite an achievement.There's also quite a lot of subtitled Chinese dialogue, which switches back and forth from Mandarin to English and back to Mandarin again, because the main characters are all Chinese living in America, and speak both languages. This can make it hard on the brain at times, but stick with it; it helps to expand the mind!Oh god, I've just had another flashback! Excuse me while I try to explain why I'm pissing myself laughing out of the blue again.....

This movie was one of the most mind bending and original movies I've seen in a long time. The music, cinematography, and acting were all top notch. I recommend going into this movie with as little understanding of it as you possibly can, and be open minded. This movie made me laugh, had great action, and also had an emotional core. I love that this movie wasn't afraid to not take itself too seriously, allowing itself to play around with some completely absurd concepts, and having them work perfectly. I also think it's important to go out and watch creative and original movies like this to encourage more directors to follow suit. I'll end with my only criticism of this movie, which is that it did kinda start a little slow for me. Other than that, I highly recommend everyone go see this movie.

reviews.review_title: I am glad I watched it but it was heavy handed
reviews.content: Glad I watched it. I enjoy seeing a slice of life: how other people deal with the aggravation of life. Especially with all the lying via social media..And the message here was a fine one. I do like the underlying premise at the end that due to the treatment of the daughter by the mother, the mother will have to work extra hard to win her back. I think that is a lesson a lot of parents of teens and young adults should heed especially since having teens is like a "get out of jail free" card that parents can use to shield their own crappy treatment of their teenage kids.However, the fight scenes wore thin on me. I liked the beginning as we got to know the world and the "technology". It took me a while to figure out what was happening. But then we had too many fight scenes and too pat a wrap up.

reviews.review_title: Just give this movie an oscar!
reviews.content: Mind blowing. There is not much I want to say about this movie except EVERYONE EVERYWHERE should watch this movie and have a blast!**********************************************************

reviews.review_title: Creative and entertaining,or atleast the first part is
reviews.content: Movie starts pretty strong,you get pulled in this crazy story and it sure is memorable but the second part felt pretentious and pseudo profound and that quickly put me to sleepso 7 points for the first half and i remove 3 points for the woke scenes and the boring second part.
Great movie. Just adding a review to get the rating up. Probably one of the best movies that have come out in the last few years, and can't recommend it enough.

Everything Everywhere All At Once, 2022, 139 minutes. Script and direction by Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert. The cast includes Michelle Yeoh (Evelyn), Stephanie Hsu (Joy), Ke Huy Quan (Waymond), James Hong (Gong Gong), Jamie Lee Curtis (Deirdre) and Tallie Medel (Becky).The hype surrounding this film has been huge, with many social media posts about it. I didn't want to see the trailer, reviews, or even read its synopsis. I went to check it out knowing nothing about Everything, Everywhere All At Once. By the end of the projection, I was impressed. It's a great movie.Anyone who knows me knows how much it costs to rate a movie a 10. Everything, Everywhere All At Once was the eighth film that deserved a 10 for me out of the nearly 3,000 films I've seen throughout my life.The film is perfect in every way. Original script, although with the feeling that I had already seen a lot of the things that were in it. It also could, because the writers-directors mixed several genres in the same film. There's adventure, there's kung fu, there's science fiction, there's comedy, there's drama, there's suspense, there's blood, there's beating, there's melodrama, there's everything. And this mix works really well. Everything connects.The cast is fantastic, with an emphasis on Michelle Yeoh, who should appear on the best actress candidate lists at the awards for the 2022 films. Jamie Lee Curtis is a luxury supporting actress, which works very well to increase Yeoh's brightness in the scenes where the two are together.Costumes, makeup, hair, production design, soundtrack, everything connects to form a uniform whole. Even the exaggerations in Joy's costumes have a reason for being within the script and don't bother.The script still plays with this year's recurring theme in blockbuster movies: the multiverse. The story takes place in several parallel universes, where Evelyn assumes different identities, such as a chef, a singer or a laundry owner.I also highlight the insertion of inclusion and diversity in history. There are Chinese immigrants who are small businessmen in the United States, there are LGBTQIA+ characters, there are elderly people, there is female empowerment, it touches on the importance of maintaining cultural traditions of a people (there is a Chinese New Year party).The directors show that they understand a lot about cinema and that they are passionate cinephiles, as I identified several references to successful films, such as Kar-Wai's In The Mood for Love, Tarantino's Kill Bill, current Marvel movies, Brad Bird's Ratatouille, Hong Kong kung fu B-movies, Kubrick's 2001 A Space Odyssey, Forbidden Desire (film with three stories about lesbian couples), horror B-movies, slapstick comedy, John Carpenter's Halloween ( just having Jamie Lee Curtis is already a reference to this horror classic), among others.And the ending reminded me the ending of another film that scores 10 in my evaluation, Blue Velvet, by David Lynch, with a happy ending that can be interpreted as an irony by the directors.It's a movie to watch and review again and again as there are so many layers and nuances to discover.

reviews.review_title: An imaginative exploration of the human condition
reviews.content: Everything Everywhere All at Once creatively flutters around two contrasting themes: meaning and nihilism.What is captivating is the film's relatability. With age, nihilism is growingly attractive. As the film suggests, this is generally associated with a myriad of potential causes. Whether it is because you perputually feel unloved, or suffer from a chronic medical condition, or if you were never accepted for who you are, or if social expectations are excessively overbearing. Most will generally yield to life's difficulties where comfort is sought in the meaninglessness of existence. And owing to the precarious circumstances that such attitude sometimes creates, some will gravitate towards questionable, rule violating choices, whether that is tax fraud or something other.The film's commitment to portraying the extremities of existence inspires many to do better, in an emotionally intense, and compelling way.

Now, this is a movie that in a perfect world it would have been one of the biggest bix office hits of all time. It is incredible touching and everyone can relate to it even though it talks about something crazy as the multiverse.Marvel wishes they did this, even the third eye was better. A movie with heart and soul, please watch it!
The biggest flaw of the movie is that it drags for so long becoming repetitive and always following the same narrative over and over. 1h45 would be ideal.

I should say that I didn't really like Slaughterhouse-Five much, and while watching this movie I didn't like it much either. But while by the end of Slaughterhouse-Five I still didn't really like it, I did end up liking this movie by the end! They are similar in the sense that our main characters are faced with an entirely new view of the world as if they have ascended to a higher dimension they can freely traverse, and they must grapple with the idea that nothing truly matters. I feel both don't really reach their full potential mainly because they make themselves too chaotic to truly enjoy, but this movie certainly still worked. And so this review isn't just reviewing a movie and a book at the same time, the visuals were also spectacularly beautiful and the acting was quite great mainly from the Joy character(s). Overall glad I watched.

We need more movies like this - a memorable mix of heart and insanity that will keep it in your psyche for months. Daniels manages to take a narrative seen by many as "culturally niche" and make it resound with thunderous relatability.
Centuries from now this movie will be known not as a cinematic treasure, which it is, but as a cultural keystone of humanity's early understanding of its own consciousness.

I turned this off with an hour to go. I was bored stiff. It was like watching the matrix on crack, except that the matrix is a good movie. This was all over the place. I am dumbfounded as to the high score. I think it's from people who aren't used to non-english speaking films and just assume a film is good because it has subtitles.

I don't understand why so many users find this movie amazing, it's alright. Nothing really special, effects are cool, acting is ok. There is so much cringe in some of the scenes. Standard is so low these days because of all those superhero movies...
Movie is 6, 7 at max... -5 stars for lgbtqtv agenda.

We're living in a big multiverse, where people like Evelyn (Michelle Yeoh) and her other multi talented variants, have lived by one goal and mission at every other life is to love her daughter, like any other mother would.

reviews.review_title: The best quality of this film is ignoring every genre convention.
reviews.content: In general though I think the sum of its parts is greater than the whole. I do admire it's fearlessness and willingness to put on the screen anything that seems to pop into their head sort of like a stream of consciousness film making. At times it makes for a very entertaining watch but it relentlessly keeps you in sort of a confused state that sometimes I think is a bit too much. I recommend this film for its uniqueness and I think there will probably be other films that are inspired by this and try to imitate it in the future.

reviews.review_title: the worst kind of good movie
reviews.content: Everything Everywhere All At Once is a family movie (not family in the prurient PG sense, but in that the movie is about family).Creative, zany, brilliant in the 1st act. An hour-and-a-half of ridiculous, laughable, juvenile hi-jinks with solid philosophical backing. The last 45 minutes are a redundant bore.The best movies are ones you can relish repeatedly, that improve with multiple viewings because of details that enrich the context, and you can appreciate how well the story hangs together (even when it might not seem so on the first viewing). The title Everything Everywhere All At Once fits the content, in that you get it all in a single viewing, and there's no reason to see it again.

reviews.review_title: Clearly a movie made by Rick & Morty fans.
reviews.content: If you like Rick and Morty then you'll like this movie. All I could think of was Rick commenting throughout the movie. I'm not sure how original the script it is based on all the reviewers saying so, but Rick & Morty fans know, this is extremely familiar.

I am really fussy and critic with the movies, so it is really rare when I can enjoy a movie fully and not see the mistakes.I am so glad to see such a good movie finally!Chinese film style is not my favorite, but in this case this is the best I ever seen! Well done:')Only back side is the Hollywood action scenes, but luckily well balanced with good dramaturg, interesting story and good acting.I wish to see more from the Daniels.

reviews.review_title: the most amazing thing i have ever watched my life is changed
reviews.content: My life is changed forever. Not only was this a cinematic masterpiece, but also tackles so many emotional, physical, and physiological challenges in a complex yet communal manner.

reviews.review_title: So much fun, but so long
reviews.content: This would have been outstanding if it had been less heavy handed and self-indulgent about the fight sequences and multiverse concept. Ok, I get it, get to the point, I was thinking after about 90 minutes. Lots of great stuff here, but ultimately, like, learn to edit.We also get a lot of exposition through chaotic flashback, but the daughter with whom Evelyn's relationship is ostensibly the focal point gets essentially no backstory. Yes, accepting her daughter is about accepting herself, but how are we supposed to see the parallels when we see nothing about Joy as, like, a person.

reviews.review_title: Its not good and nots bad either
reviews.content: Ive noticed alot of the one star reviews and i get it, if you don't pay attention to the dialogue then you get lost in the big gumbo of a script. It means well but its so messy. I wanted to stop watching the movie because it felt pointless to watch at one point but i contined throughout the cringeworthy film.Also did anyone notice the kink in this movie? The daughter used dildos as a weapon, the security guard uses the trophy that looks like a butt plug, and the sausage fingers exploding with an orange substance? Did some watch porn before writing the script?Overall watch it and never watch it again.

reviews.review_title: The most perfect movie I've ever watched
reviews.content: This is the only movie I have ever thought completely deserves a 10 star rating. I cannot find a single flaw in the film.Be prepared to laugh so hard you'll have tears streaming down your face. Be prepared to be so awed by the incredible soundtrack that it feels like ever cell in your body is vibrating. Be prepared to have an almost spiritual experience in the final two parts.This may not be the best action movie. It may not be the best comedy. It may not be the most profound film. But it is the most profound action comedy I have ever been blessed to witness. 2hrs 30mins of pure perfection.Will be watching this again and again for a long time.

What a movie Amazing down to the last minute, Fight scene amazing, story amazing, Start to end fantastic you will not get bored, the multiverse concept in this movie is just phenomenal. For me is just one the best movie it literally have everything, go watch on Prime Video you'll not regret it there is no Time waste, The Details in the movie will not confuse you. Overall I'll give it 9.5 out10. And the Acting of everyone was the best especially at the end loved it.I want more movies like this, as this one did not disappointed go watch it On Prime Video now you cannot miss this masterpiece of a movie.

I came to this movie as a thing for me to do rather than something I was looking forward to go out and see since I just heard it was really good but my god I'm glad I did and I'm upset I didn't see it before. This film is astonishing from the editing itself, the structure of the narrative and how the edit lets that flow, to the fun and laughs as well as the beauty where no one else can see it the sheer creativity and amazement that comes out the visuals and message behind this film is incredible. And the script. THE SCRIPT! There are so many iconic lines that have still stuck with me and impacted me with the delivery of its message even in its ridiculousness. Anyone should watch this film it might not be for you but at some point in life you can appreciate this film for some reason or another.Truly a masterpiece.

Really awesome. One of the best movies that I have seen this century. I wish there were more movies like that. Reminded me of the Matrix. It combines so many different genres, it's both philosophical and funny.
No spoilers here. Only thing I can say is, it will not disappoint. Confusion that unravels into understanding. Action where it needs to be and a lot of dark humor.

reviews.review_title: "I Got Bored One Day and Put Everything on a Bagel."
reviews.content: One of the most intriguing facets about the brave new world of film currently being pioneered is watching history repeat itself. Specifically, watching studios become prominent markers of a film's quality, second only to the filmmakers at the helm. In the early days, audiences knew what they were getting just by looking at the opening logos: the MGM lion signified luxury, the Paramount mountain meant a foreign touch, the Universal globe predicted cheaper productions and monster movies, etc. Etc.Although the trend certainly isn't as strong as it was, there are a few studios synonymous with the films they make and distribute. One such example is A24, a studio known for some of the most creative, complex, and outside-the-box fare today.It's not that A24 films are universally beloved or hyper-consistent; they have their share of duds and usually cater to one niche or another. Rather, the studio is a prominent signifier of quality to cinephiles because the films they make and distribute never pander to a broad market or tick boxes on an executive's soulless list. The passion of the filmmakers involved is always evident, and a purposeful vision usually drives the creation of the art. This is more so true for A24 than any studio today, and is most evident in their biggest, brashest, and most successful film to date, Everything Everywhere All at Once.The film follows Chinese immigrant Evelyn during the course of a very unusual day. While turning in paperwork for her accountant to comb through, Evelyn is suddenly thrust into an adventure concerning the multiverse, a concept involving the existence of an infinite number of universes. She must learn about all the possibilities the multiverse presents while battling a great force that threatens its existence, all while trying to connect with her teenage daughter, Joy.It's easy to see why the film has been universally praised. There are hundreds of different effects but little CGI, resulting in a breathtakingly grounded film. Everything, Everywhere is a grandiose and complex film, a patchwork constructed and assembled with invigorating passion. Many of today's superhero films are just as visually dense, but Everything, Everywhere doesn't boast a room full of animators to yell at and whip for faster, grander results.With respect to CGI artists, who are woefully overworked and underpaid, this film isn't just digitally synthesized - it's filmed. It's impossible to state my feelings of gratitude when a film feels like it's truly unfolding before your eyes, when it boasts a concrete foundation of verisimilitude, and Everything, Everywhere clears this benchmark with a story that seems like it never should've. It's resoundingly refreshing.A24 deserves its praise, but the impetus for Everything, Everywhere's creative explosion comes from Daniels. Daniels (Dan Kwan and Daniel Scheinert) are young, but they're already blazing a path for uncanny, surreal filmmaking, demonstrated in their freshman and sophomore efforts Swiss Army Man and The Death of Dick Long. Their direction is kinetic and all-encompassing, a veritable barrage of places, characters, ideas, and impressive action that assaults the viewer unrelentingly.One of the film's most special characteristics is the scale of its time; most of Everything, Everywhere takes place during a full day, but also, as the title suggest, transcends time and space, reaching into infinite worlds to set up several intrastory vignettes with their own structure, stakes, and pacing. Daniels do a remarkable job keeping focus and clarity despite the explosion of storylines and emotional stakes. There's a pristine clarity to everything, everywhere, all the time.The film is chaotic and explosive, but it's the editing which truly sets it apart from other equally boisterous fare. While the overarching story moves at lightening pace, it's also allowed to breathe and steady itself, further orienting the audience during the calamity. Nothing is too stylized either, like, say, Run Lola Run; there's a nice balance of quick cutting to maintain the kineticism and longer takes to envelope the viewer into the world. Whatever editor Paul Rogers was paid to work for Daniels, it wasn't enough. Everything, Everywhere has been lauded for a smattering of reasons, but I truly think the film lives or dies by Rogers' hand - it lives.Everything, Everywhere is the grandest, most elaborate, most painstaking film of the year, no question. It's size and quantity are easy to admire but it's not without its hiccups. Because of the film's size, scope, and genre-mashing, Daniels can't avoid giving viewers whiplash across the film's many storylines, emotional arcs, and tones; they go about eight layers deep and no moment is anything but fleeting. The lulls are brief but so are the film's many highpoints.Giving proper credence and pacing to the material would take approximately five hours of runtime, and the film is whittled down to an explosive two and a half. Because of this problem, and not despite of it, the film feels overstuffed. There's so much to get to and so much crazy, random nonsense happening at any given time that Daniels feel like they're rushing to give everyone and everything their due.A golden film rule for creators is "kill your darlings," which is shorthand for "delete every millisecond of material not essential to telling the story". I can't even comprehend that there were scenes deleted here, either from the film or the script prior. There's just so much of it...probably about fifteen percent too much.Speaking of the script...it's a bit unwieldy. The story begins relatively slowly and quietly accelerates, a nice method to introduce the context and subtext of the madness before fully diving in. However, the film also lacks structure, eschewing satisfying cause and effect to instead introduce random concepts and characters throughout. The practical use of the multiverse invites a strong inclination toward randomness, but Everything, Everywhere sometimes oversteps the boundary, hurtling, at points, into the arbitrary.In a macro sense, the viewer rarely knows where they are in the runtime or how much of story is yet to play out. This lack of sense is most clearly demonstrated during a clever gimmick in a theater, at which point Everything, Everywhere feels like it's finally winding down and will be over in the next five or ten minutes...it then goes on for another forty-five.The performances are pleasant all around. In the spotlight are Michelle Yeoh and Stephanie Hsu as Evelyn and Joy, the mother-daughter duo at the forefront of the conflict. Each plays off the other nicely and they establish a tense but loving chemistry.Key Huy Quan plays Eveyln's husband Waymond, a sympathetic figure who walks a fine line between put-upon and pathetic. James Hong plays Gong Gong, the patriarch of the family. Every actor also plays a plethora of other roles from other universes, staying grounded and convincing in all manner of costumes and characterizations.Altogether, Everything Everywhere All at Once is a ridiculously large and raucous film. It maintains impressive focus on character and theme, never letting its central conflict become rote or lost in the hyper speed of the action. If it's ultimately too much of a good thing, it's still the most unique, creative, and ambitious film of the year, and the Daniels deserve significant praise for dreaming it up. I'm sure every eye will be on their next project and there will be considerable attention on this one throughout the year and into awards season. The film has been met with a startling amount of hype, but mostly delivers on every piece of praise it's received. Absolutely worth seeing in theaters.

reviews.review_title: I made an account to give this film 10 stars
reviews.content:
Title.I mean it, with 100% sincerity that this is one of the best movies ever made, and will go down with the greats of the genre, along with Interstellar, the Godfather, The Dark Knight, Shawshank-
It'll be remembered for many, many years. I can't even spoil it because going in blind is the best way to see this film.Dear God, just do yourself a favor and watch the film.

I thought I'd love this movie but ended up leaving overwhelmed and at odds with the nihilistic message. It is unique, and it looks like it has a much higher budget than it had, but ultimately it felt like a tornado symbolizing the supposed joy behind embracing a collective loss of meaning. There were a huge amount of cuts in the film making it seem like a music video more than a movie in some places. The action was well choreographed and there were some genuinely funny moments, but it felt as though it was selling and celebrating a nihilistic philosophy that assumes that all of one's actions are of no importance. That said, I predict that this will resonate with many people, and will become a modern classic as it is quite original, as well as acting as apologetics for postmodern living. There was a lot to like about the film, but I couldn't like it overall due to its terrible messages.

Just to start this off I want to say that this is for sure the best movie of 2022, I have two problems with this movie one of them being the beginning starts off a bit slow but it was quickly paced much better. The cinemaphotography is amazing, comedy was great and perfectly timed, and the action scenes were near perfect. The actors were chosen well but the character writing made the movie 10x better. The plot was tackled beautifully, almost better form than an NFL player. Another complaint was the ending was a tiny bit drawn out and they should've ended it right when they hugged before all the sentimental talking, but of course it is my opinion and you are entitled to your own. 9.4/10, a24 did an amazing job once again.

Best movie of 2022 nothing. This is an easy candidate for one of the best movies EVER!The best way to explain what I just saw is a perfect collaboration of brilliance from every part of the production - writing, acting, wardrobe, FX, directing, just damn all of it.I like never wanna STOP watching this!

reviews.review_title: Unlike any movie you've ever seen
reviews.content: Phenomenal. The only word I have to describe it. This movie is funny, sad, empathetic, brilliant and unlike anything I've ever seen. I can't remember the last movie I cried and laughed at so hard. And that remains true on my N-th re-watch of the movie. I continuously notice things I didn't see before.I feel bad for those who can't see past the surface plot of this movie. This is not an action film, or a martial arts film!! Those who give it a low score are clearly missing the META points of the movie. Yes, it can be cartoon-ish, but that is not the point of the movie. If you've seen anything by Daniels, like Swiss Army Man, you would know that.

I thought this film would be right up my street. Multiverse - check. Michelle Yeoh starring - check. Kung-fu action - check. Sadly, the childish toilet humour grated and the film just became increasingly surreal. It's like a film Terry Gilliam would make on a bad acid trip. It was too much. I might have tolerated the surrealism but then we add the extra ingredient - the 'humour'.Some of the humour was hitting the mark - like Jamie Lee Curtis's accountant/assassin - but when the childish humour started, I was struggling to remain engaged.The first example of this was Michelle Yeoh's daughter using dildos as nunchakas. OK, fine. Mildly amusing. But it didn't stop there.People can jump into alternate versions of themselves by performing certain actions. In one scene, we see these jumps taking place as one person relieves themselves sitting on a toilet pan whilst another is masturbating. Then another 2 characters insert objects up their backsides. Honestly, maybe I'd have laughed if I was a giggling twelve year old but I'm not and this was crass.Buried underneath all this there was a heartwarming story with flawed characters finding a way to become better people. It's just a pity the story was undermined by all the bottom of the barrel comedy and excessive surrealism going on around it.

Liked it more than I disliked it but it was too long 6/10. Movie could of been an hour shorter and it would have been better for it.Not sure why everyone is raving about originality, the movie is an edgy take on It's a Wonderful Life with violence and depravity (if you know you know).All in all I don't think I'm going to be recommending it, there were a couple of times I thought I was gonna turn it off out of boredom.Best view scenario: You're sick or bad weather cancelled your plans and you don't know what to do with yourself. Some mindless entertainment with a surprisingly wholesome message.

reviews.review_title: This is how to use CGI!
reviews.content: Absolutely unbelievable special effects and CGI! Stunning camera sequences. The cinematography is gorgeous.The casting is superb. Michelle Yeoh absolutely excels. The back-up casting is fantastic too. The kung-fu sequences are excellent. The script and dialogue is articulate and mature.Cinematography just absolutely blew me away. Some of the best camera work i've seen this year. The CGI aspect is stunning. It's an absolutely bonkers film with a heart-warming message! Easily the best movie out this year so far!Off to seek out the directors other works and to look up the cinematographer. An absolutely superb film!

Plot: 10/10
Acting: 8/10
Cinematography: 7/7
Score: 3.5/5
Enjoyable: 1/1
= 89/100Favorite Character: Waymond Wang (Ke Huy Quan)Favorite Scene: Waymond Fight, Hot Dog Fingers, Ratatouille with RaccoonsFavorite Quote: "When I Choose To See The Good Side Of Things, I'm Not Being Naive. It Is Strategic And Necessary. It's How I Learned To Survive Through Everything." - Waymond.

reviews.review_title: 7.5 Just for the absurdity and dirty humor
reviews.content: Some very funny moments if youre a fan of dirty humor and of the absurd.Great directing, but the script story wise falls short. (my friend actually noded out for a few minutes a few times during the movie, two and a half hour movie, more or less runtime)

reviews.review_title: Very good story packaged with endless garbage.
reviews.content: This won't take long.It's a very moving story about the aging protagonist and her crumbling relationships with her closest people (husband, daughter, father).The cast is excellent, the emotions genuine and the cinematography beautiful.My problem is the fantasy garbage nonsense this movie had to be packaged with to resonate with the popcorn audience.There is good weird and there is Tenet weird. This is the later and that is bad for my tastes..

reviews.review_title: Best I seen at a cinema
reviews.content: Definitely the most entertaining movie I seen so far at the cinema. It was a little confusing at the beginning but it does get much better later. Funny yet touching, definitely recommended! This movie might not be everyone's cup of tea, in my opinion, it is a 9/10, but this movie is definitely deserve more than a 1/10 ! I give it 10 to protest against the 1s (:

The first 45/60 minutes was just crazy but a lot of fun.The next hour+ was surely written by a guilty mother tripping on acid. I wanted to leave but stayed until the end just in case it got better. It didn't.

reviews.review_title: Can't review it without some spoilers
reviews.content: Firstly if you're expecting a movie about a laundry lady defeating a great evil in the multiverse you'll be disappointed. There's no great evil here in spite of all the fighting between her and an unknown bad guy. There is an enemy but not a great evil. I can't reveal any more without giving away the ending. Now it is a fun movie and you get a kaleidoscope of universes and some enjoyable fight scenes. Sometimes it's a little much to my mind but you do get a happy uplifting ending and some funny bits. I particularly liked the Tax Auditors award. The only other thing I will mention is often in the movie they are speaking Chinese. Suddenly you have to read what they're saying. I notice they didn't show any of that in the trailer. I would suggest if someone is making a movie for both English and Chinese markets why not overdub or even do some manipulating so you can have both a fully Chinese and a fully English version.

What a load of brainwashing garbage.It's literally using the textbook. Rapid screen change tacticsIt's a real concern that so many people can't see what the film is trying to do.It doesn't matter. Whatever improv you put on display the usual brainwashing message was the same.Anyone could make this plot and hand it to a great team of CGI and special effects.

reviews.review_title: Generational trauma hits different in film and tv lately huh
reviews.content: Brilliantly made movie in every step of the way. I'd wanted to see it ever since seeing the trailer in theaters. Watching it was a rollercoaster of emotions, and I mean seriously, because one moment I'd be sobbing and the next Evelyn would be chasing after a raccoon chef. I cried, I laughed, etc etc.. Really though, this movie is beautiful, from the writing to the special effects to the acting. The way it plays with different universes really hits the spot, especially when we saw the 2D one or the rocks-- don't get me started on the rocks! The relationship between the family is really heart-wrenching and relatable. While I wish Evelyn could have become the perfect doting mother by the end, the more realistic ending we got makes the conclusion all the better.

reviews.review_title: Nolan's level of storytelling just marvelous
reviews.content: Everything everywhere is just.....there's no word to describe it, it just felt like a Nolan as great of a ride and as complex to understand but you can't take your eyes off the screen no matter how long...I couldn't believe it was a 2h movie cause it surely didn't feel like it.It's by far the best screenplay of 2022, the best in developing the multiverse since Spider-Man into the spider verse and yes I've seen Spider-Man no way home and Dr Strange in the multiverse of madness both of them weren't even close to be as good as those 2.The cast in general was just perfect, you could see all the shades of Michelle over the years she was just perfect for the role, best I've ever seen her.This movie deserves everything everywhere all at once 😉....should be at least nominated and win for best screenplay at every award show next year, literally the only movie of 2022 I was proud to watch on the big screen...it's been a long time since I've worked out of a theater feeling I've seen something great something that I'm gonna think about all night until I fall asleep.

Perfect mix of familial drama, comedy but not too mutch it can be serious when the film need it to be and also a lot of KUNG FU !!.Marvel movies should have looked like that instead of overdoing the jokes part and not being serious at crucial moment...This film will make you laugh, cry and think. I love getting out and keep thinking of a movie i just watch even the next day or week. It's refreshing and i hope the producers will make more movies as good as this one for the futur.For sure top tier for this year very refreshing and it hard to describe but it's everything everywhere all at once ;)

Everything is more joyful and better than see this a second time. It's tedious, is sometimes annoying and it's extremely ridicoulous.But.Everywhere is in the right place. The warm that You feel in your hearth after saw it. The creativity and originality of it, the incredible battles, the amazing humor, the complexity of it but also so simple. It doesn't has shame of being dumb sometimes, laughing of it's own tragedy it is
All at once this made one of the greatest movies of the 2022 this deserve to be watched.

I mean seriously? What's the hype for? What are they winning awards for?I so desperately tried to watch this movie with diligence, patience and an open mind. I so desperately wanted to love this movie. But it's sad that I didn't even like it.Did I watch the same movie as everyone else? Because it's so hyped. Omg. I cannot believe it.I went back to the movie and tried to see what others could. But I fail. The story is fine. The acting is fine. The costumes are amazing. The direction is below par and the editing ughh. So what was great about this movie guys? Please someone explain it to me.

reviews.review_title: Absurd in all the right ways
reviews.content: This movie is difficult to describe. It is better just to experience it because no description could do justice to the experience that it brings. It is just absurd and crazy with excellent direction and acting. I cannot for the life of me figure out why the emotional beats didn't resonate that much with me, for I have no idea what I'd do differently or better. Alas, the lack of emotional resonance and a bit bloated runtime are the reasons why I choose not to give 10/10 but rather an 8/10.The movie is full of fun references that probably demand multiple viewings. At it's core is a very personal story to carry the crazyness trough to the end.There is a lot to praise. The pure imagination and originality. The direction and cinematography. Abiding to basic dramatic concepts such as Chekhovs gun (or should I say 'plug'). The Acting. If the runtime were a bit tighter or if the movie made me care about the characters a bit more I would have been awesome. Still, it is very good and very recomended, though probably polarizing. My wife for example didn't care for it at all and I can't see some of my friends enjoying this. Give it a chance.BTW. The 'Husband' seemed familiar the whole time and I couldn't figure out from where do I know him. I never realized I was watching Shortstop from the Temple of doom :D.

reviews.review_title: There is so much to write
reviews.content: Its just pure perfection. Ah frikin.... I tried to write but I just cant... there is no words other as to call it perfection. This movie shortly is messed up as me and the world is, I dont know I never felt like this before but I felt 1st time in my life movie with my soul. Something like that happened few times for me before but this time, it felt something life first love but watching this strange movie. Ah whatever, im trying to say something but no idea how to express this feeling. This movie is beautiful, funny and epic. PURE PERFECTION!!!Just watch it, its silly, looks stupid and banal for brain off watching but its different if you read it deeply. Maybe im to drunk or whatever, but this movie is Perfection!

reviews.review_title: One of the best films in decades!
reviews.content: I am too stunned to write much. But this is amazing. All the naysayers miss the point the the film is a gorgeous tribute to Michelle Yeoh. It is a love story to her, and as such takes it's place in the great movies that do this (Fellini's La Strada comes to mind). To watch this movie, you need to dig it like a great jazz concert: full of intensity and improvisation. Thank you.

This movie spent tons of time having to explain itself and in the end couldn't make up its mind what the story was supposed to mean. A movie that goes for style over substance, melted down 3 Stoogies slapstick, and retred Jackie Chan fight stunts. Pass.

I do not want to go into too much as it really is worth viewing blind. I will say it gives me faith in fresh ideas and revamped concepts in new exciting ways. The amount of creativity is staggering, from the plot itself to the cinematography. It is worth seeing even if in the end you don't love it, you walk away with something to mull about in late night parking lots with friends eating leftover popcorn.

First things first, if you want to watch something while turning off your mind. You will hate this movie. But for those who just love to watch anything that forces you to think. It's for you. You get lots of philosophy in this movie, And let me tell you. It also has lots to it meaning some action, drama, science fiction and comedy. It is a kind of movie I would think would win many awards including best film as the featured award. The acting is amazing. With an open mind the movie pulls you in and takes you so many different directions. I highly suggest this movie! Just a eclectic piece of art.

Your life will never be quite the same again, in a positive meaning.What a rollercoaster ride through the full specter of emotions, stunning visuals, awesome characters and refreshing dialogue.Should be seen without too much prejudice, but bugle up to be mind blown, followed by days trying to rationalize all the intelligent nuances and creative details compressed into this very masterpiece.Some scenes might initially rub off as too grotesque, but when your mind catches up, you will realize the symbolism and they suddenly make sense and importance.Defiantly the best movie for a long time.

Never have i seen a movie as beautiful as this masterpiece. If you want to watch a movie that makes you question life itself then I highly recommend watching Everthing Everywhere All at Once.P. S don't watch whilst high.

In the first 30 mins, I thought... hmm.... Low budget and crazy movie, but funny, ok, I can continue. I did not pay enough attention at the beginning but just casually watched it.Then, I found that there are so many messages and meanings inside. I was so touched at the end.I love this movie so much, I watched a couple times and found that I missed a lot at the beginning.Highly recommend u to pay more attention to all the details. I think I need to watch it again.Thanks to the 2 Daniel boys as what James Hong said.Thanks to Jackie Chan for not taking this movie. I am sure Michelle Yeoh and Kwan play way better than him.

The core concept of the movie is Multiverse and Family. Movie is well made , there are so many great scenes which are a visual treat. The only problem i had with the movie is that it felt like dragging on and on for so long rather than ending it . Overall a good watch.

reviews.review_title: When you put everything on a bagel it collapses on itself.
reviews.content: The essence of this story is quintessentially absurdist. The void is everpresent and the lack of any meaning or sense of purpose destroys one's desire to live.Albert Cammus actually gives three solutions to the problem, but we see two of them in this film. One is to be destroyed by the void and accept how meaningless everything is. Another is the very poetic desicion to deal with existential dread through love. Not very original, but very wholesome nevertheless.There is also a lot of physical and slapstick humor that doesn't really work. They reference a lot of films and we even hear a little something from Zarathustra. What would Nietzsche think about this film?Loved the scenes with the rocks, the crayon drawing and the dolls hanging on a tree. Talk about character development. How often do you get to be a rock?In the end love triumphs in this movie. What is better than that?

reviews.review_title: I don't get it at all ...
reviews.content: I saw this film being nominated for an award, so I thought I would give it a whirl. Jamie Lee Curtis and Yeoh plus a recommended story line, I had high hopes. It was over 2 hours of my life I will not get back. It is confusing, difficult to follow and exhausting as the film jumps between subtitles and English. I guess that the story was well intentioned and there is obviously a huge following who enjoyed the film and its randomness. It certainly ranks high in the 'weirdness' scale. Somewhere in the multiverse there is a version of this which I will understand, but I fear that no matter how times that I watch this, its popularity baffles me.

People were raving about this film and seeing it now I can see why. I was very pleasantly surprised to enjoy this film as much as I did. As far as I knew it was a weird multiverse film but it was so much more. As I was watching and quarter of the way through it I was like damn this is weird this can't be a masterpiece surely (not in a bad way just weird). I don't mind being proved wrong sometimes. Not only is the movie about the multiverse but also about emotions and family. Michelle Yeoh was great in the movie along with her on screen husband and daughter. The film makes you relate on levels with all three characters and feel what they feel. It's a very deep film that will make you think hard after about what you saw and how you feel about it, in my personal opinion you could learn some lessons from this film about life. It's so unique and stands out from any other film it's guaranteed to make you think and feel something. The visuals in the movie are also stunning it's an absolute visual feast! So the end of the movie, after watching the main character jump universes and kick ass, the end of the movie was so unexpected. I really did not expect the movie to hit me so hard. Probably the most I've cried in a cinema, tears going down my face as I was watching it all unfold with the emotions with the characters and hitting me so hard even when I don't relate with everything it is just so human which was so surprising going into the film. Definitely check out this one for sure cause you'll get something out of it.

What a waste of time....seriously...it tries to tackle some very serious things in a funny way...but after half an hour all the fun feels old..repetitive...and overlong...the absurdity of life can be fun...but this movie tries to tackle them with cheesy old clichesThe movies highly rated by critics these days are just like this...in order to be politically correct and to break new ground...they just end up inane , stupid and absurd...How on earth this movie has an 8+ rating on IMDB is beyond comprehension...Just watch Michael Gondry if u want similar mind bending plot but with a lot more fun and sense...Kind of wasted my 2 hour.just avoid.

reviews.review_title: Hold the hot chilli sauce - I can't taste the meat
reviews.content: The title doesn't lie. It just doesn't tell you what happens when you have "everything everywhere all at once"...you have a mess on your hands!I can see it lighting up the eyes of a jaded script reader. I'm sure there are not many scripts like it.But on-screen? It's overwhelming. It's ambitious. It has promise. A heart. But it's all too much for my lil brain to take in and digest at once. We may live in a multi verse but I'm no multi-tasker and this film demands me to be.Michelle Yeoh is great. There's a lot of messed up stuff going on around her that I don't think was needed to tell the story it ultimately delivers.Hold the hot chilli sauce a little next time I say.

reviews.review_title: A great story of mother's love.
reviews.content: In this movie there is something present, absent in many other movies and that is a moral lesson, something to learn, something to take as happy end lesson.The movie is average 7.5/10 to be more correct. It's great average family (almost) movie that can be enjoyed by everyone. Nothing spectacular, but not a waste of time if you decide to watch it.

Is this the craziest movie with the craziest story of all times? Maybe.Is this one of the best movies in the last ??? Years? Maybe.Is this a one-star movie? Maybe.Is this a ten star movie? Maybe.Is Michelle Yeoh sure to win an Oscar with her role in this movie? Definitely maybe.Is this movie the first one ever to leave me sitting confused in my chair, not knowing wether I saw a masterpiece or a way over the top movie? Absolutely!!But go see for yourself. You certainly have to!

Looks like a great movie, but it's impossible to watch for vision impaired. They speak English 90% of the time, but just randomly slip back and forth with subtitles. Those of us that have impaired vision skip movies with subtitles. But the worst for us are movies that randomly go subtitles and foreign language off and on. Probably doesn't matter to most, but unwatchable for people with vision problems.

This movie is a strange object. Visually impressive, original in its form but also convoluted and overwhelming. The form precludes the depth (if that sentence does make any sense). The goofiness is too strong and emotionally distracting. It's not that funny nor that touching because it tries too hard. Yet there are beautiful moments amidst the sheer chaos.Michelle Yeaoh is a great actress, really.And the rest of the cast was very good, especially Ke Huy Quan and Stephanie Hsu. Jamie Lee Curtis was having great fun.(why does imdb requires 600 characters for this review while there are many shorter reviews posted for that same movie?)
It's hilarious, touching, zany, thoughtful, just rent it or see it in the theater. Finally an excellent movie in 2022. Filling in more space for space.

This movie is amazing. I laughed, I cried. It really made me appreciate The little things in life. Michelle Yeoh knocked it out the park with her amazing performance, and Stephanie Hsu, Ke Huy Quan, Jamie Lee Curtis were also fantastic. I really love this film and it's by far my favorite movie in the 2020s.
It's a fun ride, with great acting all around, but some cringe-worthy moments! So, it's not for everyone, everywhere :-) Another multiverse of madness!

reviews.review_title: Absolutely 💯 the MOST original film I have EVER seen!
reviews.content: EVERYONE NEEDS TO WATCH THIS FILM!!!!!!! I do not even know where to begin or what genre this film should be categorized in but just go with it. Don't ask questions or think too hard the first time you watch it. Just sit back,, open your mind, and enjoy this once in a lifetime ride. The entire cast is superb and the themes, editing, storyline, and cinematography are hands down freaking amazing. I've watched it three times and each time I catch more and more nuances and thoughtful details that I hadn't seen before. I can honestly say this is my NEW favorite film of all time. Go Evelyn! <3.

Amazing! Brilliant! Funny! Unexpected! I have never seen anything like that movie, ever! From the great casting of the protagonist and the side characters to the imaginative story and the hilarious-at least for me-jokes, this movie easily climbs to one of my favourite movies. I don't think anyone can describe this movie to a friend and prepare them for what they are about to see... It's madness and I think more people should watch it! This movie didn't get the attention it deserved.

reviews.review_title: Not sure what gives but unimpressed
reviews.content:
It was similar to listening to a mediocre song on an AM radio station full of static. The acting was good but the premise seemed chaotic and admittedly dumb. I'm all for action and sci-fi but it jumped around too much to get into it. I don't get all the the ass plugs and dildos either- humorous
at first, but overvuse made it annoying, and showed lack of imagination. I get people go for shock value, but that was the stale icing on a moldy cake. We only got 1/2 way through. I like the premise, but could've been delivered better. If you enjoyed it in any way, Hardcore Henry is much, much better..

reviews.review_title: My Favorite Movie of the Year!!!
reviews.content: This movie is summed up in one word: AMAZING!It is a definite, must-watch, need to pay attention to, much needed fantastical film of this entire year! I love this movie so much! It struck a chord with me and I have laughed and cried and stared in disbelief at the screen and felt my soul moved by the entire performance of the actors and actresses. Please watch this movie! It will touch your soul too.Semi spoilers ahead!*******This movie centers around an Asian American family: Evelyn, her husband Waymond, their daughter Joy, and her father who is named Gong Gong which is the Chinese word for grandfather if I'm not mistaken.Evelyn is a stressed out, hard-working mother who owns a laundromat business. She is burdened down by her father disowning her for marrying the love of her life. Her father, in old age, is sent to America to live with the family. Waymond, however, is seeking a divorce that Evelyn is unaware of yet. Their daughter Joy is gay and has been dating Becky for three years and wishes nothing more than for her mother's approval. And in all this chaos, the family business is being audited by the IRS, the agent assigned to them is the incredibly talented and amazing Jaime Lee Curtis.On the way to the IRS agent meeting, in the elevator, Waymond suddenly acts weird and tells Evelyn he's from another universe and that he needs her help to save the multiverse. She doesn't believe any of this, of course, but during the course of the meeting, Evelyn's curiosity takes over and she reluctantly follows the set of directions that multiverse Waymond tells her. Evelyn finds herself split into two as her mind is in two universes at once and meets with multiverse Waymond who explains what's going on.Multiverse Waymond is actually from the Alpha universe. He explains to Evelyn that there's a great evil they're seeking and he believes that Evelyn can help them balance out this evil and destroy it with good. Evelyn, not believing, sees the IRS agent, Deidre, kill the version of her in the universe where she spoke with Waymond. Terrified, Evelyn makes decisions and mistakes that lead her on a path of experiencing other universes in order to fight this evil.The movie is amazing. The cast and characters are well written and thought out. The movie is perfect, in my opinion.You see Evelyn, who gets to see the different life paths she lives because of the choices she's made. She gets to see that every choice leads to her having a better life than her current one.You see Waymond, who is a goofy but loving husband who is seeking a divorce from Evelyn. There is an understanding that he loves her very much and desires to grow old together.You see Joy, the daughter who is never good enough in her mother's eyes. Filled with depression and hopelessness, Joy seeks for someone to tell her that she matters, that her life matters.You see the grandfather, someone who spent a lifetime being upset at their child so he chose to abandon her. Yet, in his late life, has to depend on her to take care of him.You see Deidre, the IRS agent who somewhat gets a sadistic kick out of making other peoples' lives miserable because her own is pretty miserable.And you see how each decision, and each indecision, has led to something different, to a path that spawned an infinite multiverse.This movie deals with several issues that human beings have: why am I here, why do I matter, and can my life be better if I did things differently.I don't know how to explain it, but the movie makes you ponders these questions and answers them for you. You're here because you're important. You matter because you're worthy. Your life can always be better.But the focus is greatly upon understanding that in all the infinite multiverses, the one you live in, the life you live, every decision and every choice you made, all of it, everything, matters. The appreciation that you learn to have for yourself, your life, and the lives of others around you, helps to establish that this here, all this, is important. You see your life in a different way: not in all the failures and setbacks you had, but in all the achievements and the life you have.This movie is amazing for me. It's so much and nothing and everything all at once. I have a deeper understanding and appreciation of myself and others around me since watching this. I suggest everyone should watch it at least once.

reviews.review_title: The most relatable movie I've seen
reviews.content: I've always had the ever growing feeling of nonsense of everything surrounding me and my life went a bit out of its way to enforce this feeling throughout the years - I'm sure a lot of people feel the same way. I think I found my own, little, artificial sense of life and though it's no guarantee things will be easy, it's up to me to cling to it and hold on. This movie encourages me to do so, for which I'm very thankful.It's humorous, wittingly constructed piece of beautiful and magical cinematography, to which I can relate on very deep level and which has moved me like maybe no other movie ever. It's cinema magic at its finest. I've never cried so much on a movie before, but it felt good, it felt cathartic. Though the actors and creators of this movie will never read this, I wanted to thank them, this movie has a soul of its own.

It is everything: hyperboles and metaphors; layers and chaos; anger and kindness; regret and acceptance, relationships and disconnections, multiverses and life decisions; imagination and reality; contrasts and parallels; silliness and practicality
it is everywhere: love in different forms: familial love, mother-daughter, father/daughter, romance and friendships
it is all at once: the range of emotions the film expresses and the vast emotions you feel as a viewer and as a human being.

reviews.review_title: It's a stylized cross genre film with non-Anglophone protagonists with Michell Yeoh.
reviews.content: I wasn't even gong to look at the trailer. The overlong title and the psychedelically jumbled cover screamed, "Silly, self-indulgent screenwriter".However, the high reviews AND the inclusion of Michelle Yeoh, Malaysian action actress first notice in the West as a Bond character, and then noted for her role in Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon, and, more recently, Crazy Rich Asians.It was not to be.First of all, the casting reinforces popular depiction of Asians in the US as a) first generation immigrants, b) speak like demented cookies, c) are usually laundrymen, and d) come from very old-fashioned families that stifle their US born children.The reality is that Asians now represent some.5.5% of Americans, a proportion greater than those who self-identify as Jewish. In terms of representation, the first is greatly underrepresented, and the later over represented.The Census also includes Indic origin people (Indians, Pakistanis, Bangladeshis, Sri Lankans, and other nationalties like South Africans, Britain, Malaysia or the Caribbean with Indian ancestry), and who make us about 21% of "Asians". Apart from Mindy Khaling, Kumar and the actor with Sheldon, there is no significant role in popular media. I don't count Prianka Chopra who is more "Indic" in cluture but only portrays whitewashes characters with a foreign accent.About another 4 million Americans list Asian as part heritage, which isn't surprising since the rate of intermarriage between US-born Asians and other is about 50% for females. So, if further immigration from Asia were stopped, within 3 generations (grandchildren) there would be no discernibly distinct group of Asians. Philippinos who make up the next largest group often intermarry with Hispanic Americans, and highly educated immigrants of any race, tend to marry White Americans.Yet, only stereotypical of "fresh off the boat" portrayals of Asians in the US persist. It's as if one continued to portrays Jews as they had been in the 1940s and 1950s, or Blacks cast as servants or tribal Africans until the 1960s.So, I have an issue with the casting of an American film with no lead character who speaks English well. While Michelle Yeoh has a foreign accent, she is nowhere as clueless and inarticulate since she is Malaysian, where schooling is in English; she is illiterate in Chinese and had to learn her lines phonetically for HK or Chinese films. Her husband who played the annoying Chinese boy in Indiana Jones, also seems tongue-tied, despite the actor's US background.The psychedelic, multiverse, implausible plot also is un original.Why on earth did Michelle, and, I believe, Jamie Curtis, agree to this film.

I do not exaggerate and I do not lie when I say that this film is the greatest film I have seen in my entire lifetime. The term "Must See" is a phrase that gets used incorrectly way too many times; but, "Must See" in my personal opinion now only applies to this film. I undoubtedly believe that this will be studied at the collegiate level for years to come. Nearly every emotion is felt while watching this film. From the action, to the laughter, to the sorrow, to the intellectual depth of this film, it's a ride you won't want to get off of. No other actress in our current era could have done such an extraordinary performance as Michelle Yeoh.

I watched this movie whit my friend and we both really enjoyed it ,it was funny,entertaining and had lessons in it and the fights and VFX was really good i wish we could see this kinda movies every Year.

I came coming into this movie with a low expectation, but was found breathe taken, and speechless for days. Thinking, and dreaming, and experience life for what is was, and when I say this movie will change you. This movie represents love, grief, family, pain, heartache, and life all together in a unique and beautiful experience that's breath taking. The directors unique style can bring comedy, and true feelings of sadness and grief to the screen and make you able to connect to the characters and story. I've never EVER seen a. Movie quiet as breath taking as this one, I highly recommend this film, and I thank you to the creators of this for the experience it gave me.

Ok. So this felt like a very long movie that is probably 30 minutes too long for comfort/entertainment. But it is ambitious and doesn't fail on that count.What it also does is take you on a rollercoaster ride. So be prepared to keep up!Quite enjoyed the premise and Yeoh is, as always, playing a character that demands your attention. Loved her acting in this! Jamie Lee-Curtis is hilarious and added some brilliant acting chops to the story.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely insane movie that's unique in all the memorable ways
reviews.content: What a wild film, even by A24 standards. Despite reminding me of a lot of films and filming styles, I haven't really seen anything like this movie before. It feels like what A24 was born to make and reminds me of the energy in Swiss Army Man if that movie were good.Movie's a wild mess and I think it's more confusing than some Nolan films, but it works. The colors are vibrant, alternate realities imaginative, and characters interesting. It's also way funnier than I expected, both in dialogue and physical action humor. Really brings the action comedy of Jackie Chan into a contemporary reimagining.Cast is solid, with the actress for Joy being far better than I expected. She demonstrated a wide range in this role and nailed every end of her emotional spectrum. Michelle Yeoh, Ke Huy. Quan, and Jaimie Lee Curtis also do an equally commendable job, but that's not as surprising coming from seasoned actors.The movie's long and though there's little fat & all loose ends are tied up, you're still left wondering how far into the story you've gotten at every turn. There's not exactly a definite fix here, but it was one of the few things I think this film could have improved on.It's a creative story even if it was confusing for me, solid action, great comedy, fantastic actors, and a reasonably compelling set of character arcs.

reviews.review_title: Felt like my insides exploded on screen in a good way
reviews.content: LOVED EVERY BIT OF IT WITH EVERY FIBRE OF MY BEING 💛I didn't watch the trailer, I didn't know what it was about, the title sounded catchy and it just looked like something I would enjoy. So I went with no clue and zero expectations.And this movie was such a revelation. It's all my depression and anxiety accumulated during many years which peaked during the pandemic expressed in a super expressive movie. It's hilarious, it's deep, it's sad, it's dark, it's annoying at times, it's colourful, it's relatable, it's hopeful, it's just everything. It allowed me to let some feelings and thoughts that had been buried deep down back to the surface again. It's given me some hope and comfort.It's not just me and that's comforting. Maybe more people than I think are feeling like this. Maybe there's still hope of making some sense of this meaningless strange existence. Maybe there are no rules and we can embrace googly eyes.I absolutely loved the message and the form and the actors, this movie touched me more than I can say. I will make everyone I care about watch it. We need more stuff like this in our lives!!!

reviews.review_title: if you do anything this weekend- make sure you go and watch this film, my new favourite movie. incredible.
reviews.content: I went in with my mind completely open and ready to receive this totally bizarre and imaginative movie, i've been thinking about it for months. I actually can't speak enough about michelle's performance. She is unbelievably talented this incredible woman moves through this film like a champion. Michelle yeoh is my new idol. Honestly, i'd almost advise you to not learn too much about it before you see it. It's so mega. And so meta. And so expertly made. It's kind of a fun ride just watching it without any background knowledge.Trust me, it's wild.

It sucks, three points. Bad script, editing is a mess, and the sci-fi elements inserted are very embarrassing... The male protagonist is Jackie Chan 2.0, and it can be seen that everyone's impression of Chinese martial arts male stars is Jackie Chan. And know that the director has seen a lot of movies such as "Inception", "2001 Odyssey in Space", "Regeneration Edge", nine points to Yang Ziqiong's acting skills, the acting skills of the little heroine are also good.

reviews.review_title: You don't watch this movie, you experience it.
reviews.content: You don't watch this movie, you experience it.I watched this movie on Friday and was completely stunned. It was like for the first time in my life, I was seeing a real movie. Everything else, from the Godfather to the Titanic had been a nice story, but at the end of the day, just a story..about people often very different from me.This on the other hand, was something deeper, some more real. It perfectly brought to life one of the deepest, most personal questions we ponder in life: am I living my best life...or wasting it?It is the first movie I've been to where when the lights came up at the end, no one got up to leave. People just immediately started excitedly talking about what they had just experienced.Image if Picasso made a film that combined the Matrix with Cloud Atlas. It tells a very profound but relatable story about the importance in a seemingly meaningless world of valuing kindness and family/friends over all else, even if it doesn't always make sense.It does this by shooting a firehouse of storytelling twists and visual imagery at you for 2.5 hours that at times starts to feel exhausting but in the end...you realize was a necessary metaphor for the complexity of life and the infinite set of choices we make in life.This is a kind of movie that comes along once every 20 years. Go see it folks.

I've seen it twice now and loved it both times. It's both so creative AND so accessible. My dad died recently, been having all the existential thoughts, this movie made me feel better. And not because it's heavy! Although it kind of is but it's also hilarious! I don't see how the acting could have been better. May see it again before it leaves theaters and who knows how many times streaming. Just wonderful.

reviews.review_title: There's a fine line between ambitiously bizarre and simply dopey
reviews.content: And this film sits perilously close to falling on the wrong side of that line.First of all, Michelle Yeoh is worth every moment she is on screen. Easily the best part of the film, she is spectacular in every scene, with every motion, in every universe she inhabits. Truly a magnificent performance. Ke Huy Quan is also strong in a mostly meek, often comic, role. Beyond that, well, it's a lot of overwrought emotion and bad martial art set pieces. Not a particular fan of sci-fi or martial arts films myself, I can only surmise that the slo-mo and sped-up fight scenes could not possibly represent state of the art technology, as it was more cartoonish than action packed.Given this kind of science fiction film, with its unabashedly childish conception of what the constitutes a 'multiverse', a significant heap of suspension of disbelief is required. But even at that, the weirdness-for-weirdness sake (which the film freely acknowledges) just kind of falls flat. Even as the film shares a wink with the audience at its own absurdity, the humor plays more as mitigating audience expectations. As if to say 'we're really just joking about his schlock'. And after it all, the message is essentially the same as you get in reading Kurt Vonnegut, but with fewer laughs.I would absolutely recommend for anyone who wants to see Michelle Yeoh in a beautiful performance. She is absolutely a treasure in this role. For story, stunts or special effects, not so much.

Please make more movies like these. This is the most creative and plot innovative film I've seen in a long time. The movie perfectly balances the line between being a trippy, hyperactive, dimension-hopping sci-fi adventure and a surprisingly resonating comedy-drama centered around a dysfunctional family near perfectly. It takes concepts and tropes you've seen a million times in other movies and puts a real spin on it, often leading to unexpected twists and turns that keep the narrative engaging despite its somewhat perplexing universe jumping plot. This movie is not going to be for everyone but it deserves to be seen by everyone at least once. Also, please avoid spoilers for this movie if you can. Some movies are just meant to be seen going in completely blind. Trust me, you'll be setting yourself up for the best viewing experience.

This movie can be described as being the most original movie so far in the 2020s. I would love to describe it as an experimental film, an invention, an innovation in cinema. The title describes every thing the movie stands for " everything " and " everywhere " which includes the travelling through the multiverse in an omnipresent state.Produced by the Russo Brothers of whom are prominent directors in the Marvel Cinematic Universe we see certain visual effects that spring up like movies based on Marvel Comic characters. Like Matrix film franchise which came before it we see originality. The screenplay must probably characterized by smash cuts and jumps. The stunt choreography is impeccable and would be cherished by all. Going by a word from the movie's title " everything " we are met with various genres everything from comedy to action and even Science fiction. Giving a positive remark may not be all that good for this day and age as the film despite it being original is not that unique in it's own path but however we all learn or derive our objectives from learning from others.Its a wonderful movie despite it made for fun it addresses the subject matter of LGBTQ lightly. The movie to my mind is not an " Actors Movie " but rather a " Director's Movie " as the actors must rely primarily on the Directors vision to put their roles to screen.

reviews.review_title: Lives up to its name: A perfect mix of every genre
reviews.content: I have never seen a film so trippy, hilarious, action-packed and deeply moving all at the same time. This was truly a cinematic masterpiece that will last through the ages. Bravo.

This movie is just wowwwww....!!
