I don't really know how to react to the plot, but despite of all the casts are playing their role, the main character of this movie is "complexity".I can't imagine how to write a script for a movie with such complexity and also for the casts to play the role, and that is why I have to give 9/10 score. Creativity and imagination over the roof...!!Multilayer plots like this is sometime fun to watch although may give you headache, but for this movie, just don't question the timeline, don't question the tech, don't question the other details and just enjoy watching it.
I just watched this movie. It blown my mind. I laughed i cried .It made me all kind of feelings. One of the best movies I have ever watch. Masterpiece.

I think the rating of this film depends a bit on the angle that one wants to emphasize along some traditional rating axes: In terms of a story, the narration disorients the viewer constantly, baiting them into believing "the movie is about *that*" and then taking it away again. In the end, some viewers might find that it wasn't really about anything, in a straightforward kind of manner. In this regard I might give it a 7.From a novelty standpoint, I think it's really a fantastic piece of art, somewhere at a solid 9. We've seen multiverse stuff going to the extreme, e.g. In Rick and Morty, where nihilism, metafiction, and identity play a role as well and the "everything happens" part is interpreted in a very, very literal way, but much more doesn't come to my mind. Moreover, in non-cartoon cinema, it really feels like a first. The shots where they cycled through what felt like a good 100 frames of different incarnations of the main character where crazy, not just from an editing point of view but just as the experience of the viewer. It literally feels dizzying to watch it, particularly on a large screen.For the themes, the directors didn't shy away from ambitiously trying to incorporate many layers (as far as I interpret it). One obvious aspect is the Asian-American experience that is highlighted a bunch in the beginning. As Anne Anlin Cheng put it, the movie plays with the Asian pendent of Afro-pessimism (which has gained some traction recently), Asian-pessimism. I'm sure she would have a lot to say about it, and I can only figure how in analogy to Afro-pessimism, the confrontation in the film tries to stipulate the 'yellow woman' as Cheng might posit the Asian body as she does in her work, as a mode of transport of vaguely liberal identity-based analysis (similar to the slightly topical book by Charles Yu, Interior Chinatown, 2020). This mode of transport is questioned and in the film ultimately left only touched upon (e.g. The scene of the hot dog universe where the main character has a relationship with the tax accountant), emphasizing the internal redemption with her daughter.Another more or less straightforward interpretation is the depression mother and daughter go through, most of the imagery serving as an underscore of the various facets of said depression. Not only does nothing matter, but while it seems to matter, we witness its decay, the horrid circumstances that lead us down the path to death (the bagel as a dadaist-nihilist image), even making redemption ultimately impossible. Unless, well, spoiler alert, in the end redemption was possible in some sort of Dan Harmon-esque "let's watch TV and not bother" way.One last bit that I really liked was the metafictional scenes, where the main character was playing herself, dragging me, the audience, literally into the boat, making us think about our own place in the multiverse. Ending the film with some credits in the middle of it (as did The Simpsons in the The Simpsons movie) was great and works every time for me, even though some viewers might find it a bit trite.All in all it's really worthwhile, even if you are not into (vaguely) experimental stuff. There are so many themes going on that there will be enough to talk about for everyone. And if you hate overinterpreted/overinterpretable postmodern cinema, watch it for the crazy-ass pictures and fantastic soundtrack.

Is this the favorite for the academy award this year, really??!!! What's special about this movie?!!! There's no plot! The movie is boring, confusing and slow...there's no bottom line! There's nothing but a few action and fighting sequences. It's impossible to tell the movies story because there's really not one. It's just a bunch of people from an Asian family in US that own a laundry and l from there the movie turns in and I'm incomprehensible story and nonsense fiction and confusing dialogues that lead nowhere at all! It's hard to believe that this filme can get that attention it has been getting. It's boring and in a year or two no one will watch it.

Once in a while there is a movie that you know from the first 15min it will be a masterpiece for a long time after maybe for many many years.Rarely but yet luckily for cinema enthusiasts there is a movie that keeps your attention attached to the screen 100%. Such a well done and great movie.Once again Michelle Yeoh proved that she has a great bandwidth as an actress.Stephanie Hsu is a very promising in this movie, loved her costumes.

Profound, heartfelt, surreal, absurd, and hilarious. Acting is top-notch. Absolutely worth the hype.A beautiful look at relationships between people: the complexity of mother/daughter relationships, the wonderful love story between Evelyn and Waymond, the fraught father/daughter relationship Evelyn has with her own father. Waymond (in his many forms) was a standout character in a film full of standout characters - he's an important re-definition of both Asian male masculinity and what a good life partner really looks like.EEAAO captures the immigrant experience perfectly (there were multiple times where I felt "yep, that's exactly it!" while falling off my chair laughing), interweaving universal themes of regret, nihilism and love (both familial and romantic). Its central thesis is that 'life' is less about the destination than it is about the journey and the relationships we build on that journey - a point the film underscores in its constantly self-reflexive arcs.Standout scene: Waymond with the bum bag and the chapstick. I can't say more, it'll ruin the scene.Every actor is phenomenal - Ke Huy Quan as Waymond zips through different Waymonds without a hitch, carrying the heart and the strength of the character in every iteration of Waymond. I read that Quan went into production as he struggled to find acting roles for Asian men in US cinema - given his performance in EEAAO, it's truly our loss that we've missed his talent on our screens for a few decades. Michelle Yeoh, of course, carries the weight of Evelyn's story with sincerity, ease and gravitas, while also being incredibly funny ("very busy today!" will never not be hilarious). And Stephanie Hsu as Joy really makes you want to cheer her on: balanced against the depths of her despair is a chaotic exuberance and a wild hope that really builds depth of character.I enjoyed the casual queer relationship and how it both mattered (eg. In terms of Joy coming out to her grandfather, in Joy and Evelyn's interactions) and didn't matter (Joy and Becky's relationship is one of the few solid and unchanging parts of the story). Yeoh and Hsu, as Evelyn and Joy, completely sell their complicated love for each other - alongside the powerful medium of classic Asian mother nagging, of course.This film, its actors, filmmakers/directors, and VFX artists deserve an Oscar nomination - both for the importance of the story they're telling, and the powerful and entertaining way in which they've pulled this off. Can't recommend this more.

reviews.review_title: What a glorious, entertaining, profound and enjoyable mess!
reviews.content: I will be extremely short, I don't have too much time but I just wanted to tell people: just watch this movie. Nothing like this ever existed before, it is the most original movie I've watched in years of repetitive plots.It also manages to be a movie that touches the LGTBQ+ in a purposeful way - and this is coming from someone who hates the recent wave of wokeness.It's just a GREAT GREAT movie and super fun to watch.Unfortunately it's not kid's friendly, although I can't wait my kids to be adult enough to watch it because it's too funny. :)

reviews.review_title: Everything, Everywhere, Tupperware, we don't care
reviews.content: A film that is somehow incomprehensible, stupid and contrived at the same time.Virtue signaling, mediocre sci fi elements and joyless jokes that fall flat, in a weird soup of a movie that alienates everyone.And no, it doesn't help, just adding meaningless fight sequences.Those don't even work in Rick and Morty....Have people become dumber? Watching movies like these certainly makes a case for it.Hollywood... Stop making multiverse movies if you don't have an original idea, or even a new thought.Stop trying to please fans. Stop trying to calculate what the fans want, and instead make something you really, HONESTLY, Love......

reviews.review_title: There's a great movie in here somewhere, but I struggled to make it to the end.
reviews.content: I'm giving it a 6 because I think it's worth checking out and it deserves praise for trying to do something different. My personal rating would be lower.Which is unfortunate because there's a truly great 100 minute 10/10 film in here. But it's ruined by pacing issues and a mix of alternate reality shenanigans. Half of which I loved and half of which I hated. And when you're switching from great to terrible to boring and back again every minute you just end up with whiplash.-------------Part 1 has by far the worst pacing issues. At 85 minutes it could be an entire movie by itself and you really feel it. It takes far too long to get going, has a really good middle third, and then starts getting lost again.You could cut half an hour out and the film would be much better for it.Then as for the shenanigans. Some of them worked for me and some of them just did not. At all. And they kept taking me out of the great experience I was having.The sex toys in particular I would remove entirely. For a movie that gets surprisingly mature and profound, they were immediately jarring whenever they came up. It didn't come off as whacky and absurd, just juvenile. And incredibly overdone.The rest I could probably live with if the film weren't dragging on so much, but if I was going to vote I'd also get rid of the hot dog universe and the raccoon. Both were fun, for about a minute. And then just increasingly annoying whenever they came back.So maybe it's back to pacing issues as the #1 problem from which all else stems.----------------------Ultimately then, an interesting but frustrating experience. I'm glad I saw it, and I'd like to see more films try and do something different with the formula.But thanks to the editing and the pacing, it's a film that I appreciated more than I actually enjoy watching.

This is such an unique cinematic experience that some of the dialogues, the scenes or just the tones of the movie, still linger even after days after you're out of the movie theater thinking about watching it...

reviews.review_title: If movies could be theme songs...
reviews.content:
This is mine..
I new it would be good from the trailer. Did I expect to laugh my ass off. Or expect to relate deeply with characters, feelings, and situations. Or see visuals and ideas seemingly snatched from the most inner workings of my imagination. Did I expect, me, a grown ass black man, to sit there UNABLE to hold back tears. Absolutely not. Only 3 movies have connected with me on a level that felt damn near personal. This is number 3.Exceptional. Emotional. Thought provoking. Visually stunning. Ingeniously edited. A masterpiece.I've seen alot of movies...... I experienced Everything Everywhere All At Once.

reviews.review_title: Daniels's humor got me and Michelle was the star
reviews.content: I thought the premise was original to an extent. I enjoyed the humour of the Daniel's working together. Great concept, vision and humour. I think I suffered seizures from the constant camera cutting and this time, there were no warnings. A veteran director working with the Daniel's might have helped the final edit of the movie.

Being an Asian who grew up with immigrant parents who came to a Western country to seek a better life, I could put myself wholly into Joy's shoes and my mother into Evelyn's shoes. The story captures all the dissonance I have with my mother.I went into this movie completely oblivious and was completely blown away by the concept and the themes explored. The main cast do such a wonderful job and they work so well together and all elevate each others' performances. Quan brought his A game to this movie, after having not been in the spotlight for a while and I think his performance knocked it out of the park. There is a really heavy and emotional scene which he delivers so beautifully, I was quietly sobbing away in the cinema.
The multiverse story lines have been fully used to it's absurdity in this movie. Hilarious and heart touching. I laughed as hard as I cried, and a beautifully acted piece of cinema.
...absurd, awesome, beautiful, brilliant, crazy, hilarious, mystical, revelationist, sci-fi fantastical and totally original!!!I haven't laughed this hard all friggin year!Thank You!!!

reviews.review_title: This film is an absolute masterpiece.
reviews.content: This film is an absolute masterpiece. In a world that feels dominated by algorithms and low-effort money grabs, this film feels like a massive stop sign planted miles deep in front of the film industry -- a clear paradigm shift in what is possible when you care about art. It exudes effort. It is meticulous in its story telling and cinematography. It plucks the best parts of action, comedy, sci-fi, and drama, then it presents them to you in a stunning bouquet. This movie loves you and it wants you to love it back. Amazing.

WOWJust, WOW.Really didn't see this coming, what a fantastic movie, with a extremely beautiful message. Spent the first half laughing, the last minutes criyng, and ended up realizing how beautiful the most simples things in life can be.Very well directed, acted and with great special effects.To top it all it succeeds to give a excelent and simple explanation to the multi-universe concept, in a way that i have to call it a must watch before you watch any movies with that thematic (and there are a LOT this days).

reviews.review_title: Be everything everywhere all at once
reviews.content: Love is something that is everything and that is everywhere and that happens at the same time.You need to love not fight and make people fill the reason of it.You have learned to fall in love and that is what you have to show everywhere, show them everything. Who goes away will always comeback because love is the answer.

Have you ever felt like you don't understand what the hell is going on, but at the same time understand everything instinctively? That is HOW good this movie is at portraying the most insane of ideas! If you haven't watched this, you're missing out on a piece of cinematic history, and that isn't some exaggeration. Happy watching!

Hard to please people it seems. We thought this movie was fantastic and creative. It's a bit of a breathe of fresh air as you don't really know what to expect. The movie keeps you guessing pretty much the entire time and has the mind bending moments that make you go what the f.. a great watch and enjoyable film which is what it sets out to be.We do however agree that there is some minor issue with pacing as for some parts it would have been good to flesh out some parts more story wise. Potentially like Kill Bill and do several parts to really get a truly satisfying ending.

reviews.review_title: WELL.. Possibly the greatest dream I ever had!!
reviews.content:
I will always try and watch anything with Michelle Yeoh in..and this has to be up there with her finest work! No spoilers here.It was Beautiful, sad, crazy, deep, funny, polished, euphoric, dreamy, .. but most of all an epic story about the loves we have.To quote the great Ke Huy Quan. ." He who loves the most, regrets the most ".This really really resonated with me.The editors and costume need a massive congrats on their work. The director also really deserves a pat on the back for holding this all together...because it must have been a tough job.I always score as honestly as I can ... unlike the political or fan girl/boy reviewers who score their favourite actors/political motive movies 10/10 even when its a terrible movie..
But this IS a genuinely solid 9/10.. sit back, put your phone down and watch this crazy masterpiece before the USA makes a mainstream copy as per....

reviews.review_title: Not the best film ever made or anywhere near it, but it has some entertainment value, it's a little too long and the action ends up being second fiddle later on...
reviews.content: This movie is a mess and it almost works. But with a title like everything everywhere all at once, it's bound to be false advertising. The directors really didn't stick to a genre, which is what makes the film so unique. Would I rewatch it again? No, it's too long and in the second half it kinda drags. It starts off with funny action, but eventually turns into a mother daughter relationship story and the action becomes not interesting. It's very philosophical in nature, asking the "why are we here?" Type questions, but never really answering them. With the action it's a really funny idea, they have to do random acts that they normally wouldn't do, to initiate a "jump" to get the knowledge of their alternate dimension selves. Which is a promising premise but ultimately fails to deliver. Wait for the video, you might love this movie or you may hate it. It's a mess, but a funny and dramatic mess.

reviews.review_title: This gave me Everything all at Once
reviews.content: This is one of the most creative fun movies I have seen in a LONG TIME. There were moments that made me laugh out loud and cry out loud. The story has heart and is rich with creativity (in cinematography and writing), you can tell the writers had a blast making this. It is such a fun rollercoaster of a movie that makes you want to get back in line and enjoy the ride again immediately after watching it.To compare to a movie like Christopher Nolan's Tenent where it is 100% based on ideas and plot and completely forgets heart or soul this movie has so much plot and so much heart leaving nothing behind.This movie is so dense with amazing ingredients. I have seen it multiple times and I'm still picking up new things to talk about and discover. It is sad to say that I felt more in this stand alone movie than I have with many saga movies or tv shows.It is true not everyone will like the same movies but if you enjoy movies with meaning, heart, creativity, action, comedy and everything else then Everything everywhere all at once is a movie absolutely worth giving a shot.

Indeed, it was everything, everywhere, all at once. Great story, top-notch acting and awesome direction. I laughed and cried, get scared and amazed, and felt many other emotions during the short period of time of the movie.The story progress well, not too much introduction or too long ending. Although story evolves around a Chinese family, but the events should be familiar to most of us.The VFX was not fancy, in a good way. It was not unrealistic crazy visual effects that we see in the other movies, it was there to complete the story.Kudos to the creator and the team behind this movie.

reviews.review_title: It's a marmite film... and I LOVE marmite!
reviews.content: The pace is insane. The plot line is proposterous. The cinemotography is gorgeous. And certain characterisations are bizarre.EEAAO is certainly a one off, and needs to be watched and embraced with an open mind. I totally get why there are haters but I loved it. The film is deliciously layered and Yeoh supported by a middle aged Short Round are superb. And Jamie Lee Curtis looks like she is having the time of her life.I cant remember a recent film where I was moved, laughed or intrigued in equal measure. There are no spoilers here. Let's just say that this unique film stretches your intellectual and emotionally intelligence and if your mind is up for it, you're in for quite a ride.Magnificent. I can't work.out what this film really is but I love it all the same.

This movie is around average, I really couldn't connect to the main plot. It uses some exaggerated multiverse concept that none can actually understand, inorder to try to solve a family crisis. The jokes are pretty awful, idk maybe they'll be funny in another universe 🤔I think most of the high reviews are from people who want to think that they are some big shot philosophers who have just witnessed a movie about the infinite multiverse, which apparently (according to the movie) the same infinite multiverse can fit in a floating donut.I really wanted to like this movie, and to be true, it's an experience. I won't advice against watching it but if you do watch it, make sure there's lot of popcorn and be prepared for shallow jokes and ton of weirdness.Good luck !
The film stands by itself, and that's a good thing. It's like Hong Kong done by Terry Gilliam flavored with a bit of Douglas Adams. Let it be it's own thing, and have fun!

reviews.review_title: one of the best movies to have a great time in cinema
reviews.content: With a quite silly and absurd scenes full of jokes and symbolism i really liked the movie. Very catchy sci-fi scenario with cool effects was such a blessing moments that i had in the cinema. Although i do not like absurd comedy i did really enjoy those scenes too. During the movie jumping between multiverses and the chaos and thrilling scenes was incredible. I really like the idea of how different the verses of the Evelyn in the multiverses just because of very small things. But at the end she knew that she just want to be herself even though in other multiverses she would've had a better life. As we see the main character as the worst version of herself indeed it was the most powerful one. There is no white or black there are just a lot of options we have in life . Although sometimes we thought that nothing really matters it's just wrong the moments that we're living and the things that make us different from the others and family and relationships they are really matters.

To hand in your taxes and visa applications in time.That was the message, right? /sVery good movie during which you will think: "Wait, what's happening? Did I took too much?"But the message in the end is worth the watch.

reviews.review_title: If Edgar Wright and Charlie Kaufman made a Multiverse film...
reviews.content: As someone else commented, the most comparable film to this very original experience is Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind...or if Edgar Wright directed a script from Charlie Kaufman. That's how crazy and original this film is.I do get some of the negative reviews, as this film isn't for everyone. But, if you're into multiverse type films, it's easily one of the best. There are so many Multiverse ideas packed into this film, it will be hard to catch them all in the first viewing.I've been a film buff since a child so have pretty much seen everything there is. This is one of those films that will blow you away with its originality similar to Eternal Sunshine, Her, Being John Malkovich, Mr. Nobody or other films of that ilk. Easily a 9/10 and will watch again to catch everything missed on the first viewing.P. S. For other films about the Multiverse and alternate realities, there's a good list of films at kneelbeforezod.io/tag/sci-fi-alternate-history-films/

This movie didn't go the way I thought it would. It can be interpreted in so many ways. I believe it would represent different things to different people. Don't worry about all the theatrics. Lol it has a lot of that . But there are so many lessons. From how a mothers loves runs deep, how parents should not give up on their kids to how children will push you and test your patience. Just be kind to people, you really do not know what demons they are battling.....I kind of saw the kid committing suicide, just a child misunderstood.I loved every second of it and I cried a lot at the end.Absolutely worth it. And great acting from the Chinese ladies and gentlemen.

I've always curious and wondered how would my life have been if I had made a different choice in the past? What would my life be like? Will it get better? Am I happier?This movie conveys way better than the version of the multiverse of madness.I just liked that part, because the rest was so everything everywhere all at once that I didn't get it. It was just fine and I would have liked it a lot more if I had gotten to the overall point of the narrative sooner, that being her connection with her daughter.

It is sadly quite common for new movies nowadays to be politically correct in a forced manner. Token racial characters are inserted into movies without any real reason than to diversify the roster. This is not the case here. This movie has Asian culture and philosophy onboard not just token Asians. Furthermore, it is not politically correct, as it makes fun of stereotypes and in general it does not take itself too seriously. This makes for an entertaining watch, that is filled with funny action sequences and all kinds of dark humor.In a multidimensional universe where everything and anything that can happen, will happen, is there a reason for morality? Is there even any kind of meaning? The simple answer is no. This kind of nihilism manifests in the postmodern world through the philosophy of existentialism. In its foundational premises the philosophy revolves around the fact that existence comes before essence, and thus no true meaning is a given for one's life but must be created through culture or other means. Nietzsche took this premise to question the nature of morality itself and how it is built artificially and can't be espoused rationally and universally. First, one character who grasps this lack of meaning and purpose struggles in mental anguish and adopts Albert Camus' absurdity ideals, just trying to enjoy the ridiculous nature of the universe. As this gets old though, the character begins to adopt Kierkegaard's idea of the abyss and despair in the form of the abyssal bagel. A multidimensional entity that acts as a black hole that swallows everything, created by the character to help end the suffering of the meaningless world and the hopelessness. In terms of overall message, it does not try to be subtle, the message is kindness and love. The way to best nihilism and answer the existential question, is not to answer it, but to dodge it entirely and focus on each other; the fellow humans that we can help ease their suffering through acts of kindness and compassion. Although a pretty standard good message, it is delivered in a captivating way and in an entertaining envelope.The cinematography is quite intriguing and done in a very cool way. With striking visuals that capture the absurdity of multidimensional existence. The CGI here serves the movie, rather than take away from it. The cast is brilliant and really carries this movie in terms of humor delivery and emotional release. That is except for the daughter, Joy, who I personally found irritating and too cliché in terms of her character design (the teenager trope is really overused). Other than that the movie is quite solid and I would definitely recommend for others.

Acting, writing, production all great. Watching this reminded me of films like Eraser Head, Blue Velvet, Clockwork Orange, ...Green Night? Etc. Where you walk out trying to digest what just happened. I love a good formula but I think now we lack the off the wall creative pieces that this is. Pretty entertaining and really a solid message. Enjoy the mayhem!

reviews.review_title: I created my IMDb just to give 10/10
reviews.content: This movie was absolutely fantastic.The comedic aspect was absolutely nailed, it kept the movie feel very light and funny while having actually quite deep message.The plot was well thought through and made perfect sense (even while being crazy) which is very rare to see in modern movies, especially comedic ones. The characters seemed very natural and fitting, nothing felt forced in any way.My personal taste is that I usually don't like comedy movies from China because they tend to be over the top crazy and not make that much sense but this one really changed my opinion. It is crazy, yes, but in a good way, I would say really on the line of being too crazy but not yet. Most importantly the plot wasn't hurt by the craziness in any way so it is still briliant movie story-wise.As critical as I usually am to movies, I am honestly giving this movie 10/10 and ranking it among my Top 5 movies while being the Top 2022 movie (and I watch a lot of movies).

The Good reviews for this has to be robots because that movie was not very good. The concept was great but the delivery was not. Hot Dog Fingers, Really? Racoon chefs, Really? Everything Bagel Black Hole , Really? When i watched the preview, this nonsense was not part of it. If it was i wouldnt have gone. Best summed up by my wife who after it looked over at me and gave me a dirty look and said , there is 2 hours of my life ill never get back. Believe the people who gave this a 1 over the ones who gave it a 9 or higher.

reviews.review_title: It's not a movie it's a legend
reviews.content:
It's not a movie it's a legend
It's the most absurd movie I've ever seen in my life, but it's a movie that made my imagination feel so high, and there were scenes where I cried. I finally woke up with an incredible feeling and it became one of the movies I will never forget.

This movie was incredible, honestly I don't what to write to give it enough praise. Every other review you have read already or that is already here it's true. Such a gem of a movie, such a nice story that I think everyone can relate, thinking about what could have happened if we took different road on every crossroad we ever been. Definitely a top 3 movie this year and everyone should watch it, entire cast was great Michelle especially, but everyone else did great work as well. Loved everything about this movie, it will make you think and about your life in the end and when a movie does that then you know it was great.
Seriously the stupidest movie of all time. I didn't even find the humor in it. Nothing deep just plain stupidity here and there and everything and everywhere.

reviews.review_title: The best movie I have ever seen
reviews.content: The title is not hyperbole. I don't think anything tops this masterpiece. Art films get too boring, and blockbusters get lazy. This is maybe the most entertaining but excellently written movie that I'll ever see. The humor is great, combining both slapstick and observational comedy. The action scenes are just standalone masterpieces. The cinematography is just refreshingly good. But I wanted to basically talk about two things here, the acting and the message.First, the cast is just plain awesome. Everybody has already heaped praise on Michelle Yeoh's outstanding performance, but I was more engrossed in Stephanie Hsu's Joy. She has easily secured her place as the best antagonist I've ever watched. Not only is she brilliantly written and acted, I just found her way too relatable. She is maybe one of the best teenage/Gen Z antagonists I have seen, and I was honestly rooting for her the entire movie. Also, they make a very adorable couple(her and Becky).Finally, the message. The movie does something most movies don't even think about. It works hard to resolve it's conflict, which is basically existentialism. It somehow manages to put a optimistic spin on such a nihilistic concept, and makes it satisfying.Also, this movie made me laugh and cry with just two rocks. No dialogue, no music, just two rocks at the edge of a cliff. So if you haven't watched this yet, just go see it. Pirate it, buy it, idc, just see it.This is the true Multiverse of Madness. The 1 minute shot of Evelyn across thousands of multiverses is the best shot in entertainment history. THE BEST!

It is difficult for me to overstate what I think of this film. The script is creative, fun and original. The direction is energetic, clever and tight. The cast is too notch.I mean Michelle Yeoh is a fantastic actress but the rest of the cast (special mention to james hong) is on par with her.A must see. For me the best of 2022 without a doubt and possibly one of the best for a very long time...
The only thing that keeps this from being a 10 for me is: it gets sentimental at times but that is also more of a break of from the fun. It's an early favorite for favorite movie of 2022.

At first i did not get the hype or the idea an hour in i was having fun and as soon as we got to the middle of it i realized what the art behind is,Its that no matter how many times we regret things or wish we done things differently it does not matter,We are in the best verse possible and have limited time so we shouldn't care that much and take it easy.This movie made me laugh, giggle, cry my eyes out and it calmed me down at a time where i really need it because im so stressed with my graduation from university and a new chapter in my life..One of the best movies of 2022
And a must-watch!

reviews.review_title: High hopes but I didn't enjoy it at all.
reviews.content: I thought it was basically daft. I could see there was imagination behind it, but I just wasnt engaged with any of it - characters, storyline - nada. I cant think of any other film I have picked and paid specifically to watch that has been allowed to meander on over a couple of sittings, over a couple of days. And that's because it didnt interest me. Sorry. Im suppised to wax lyrical for another 300 characters, but I've nothing more to say. Cccicitxti igciycoh doycyivohv xoyciycig doyciyckgcouigxicihxohcig i. Ugxjgx gigxjg jgcic. Igxig jv igcigcoh ufg. Ckgkgcigc gjgx I'll kgc mvkckgx km jgcitcig khvykycigvkgkgcigc km citckycitc. Bye.

The film's title is intriguing and definitely draws you into a film that involves everything, that goes everywhere, that happens all at once.It's a wonderfully executed web of ideas and it's stunning that they've squeezed it all into two glorious hours.

reviews.review_title: Omg! Everything you wanted in a film, including a raccoon!
reviews.content: Words can't explain it, you have to experience it. It's like I ate a can of Kodak and this was what I fever dreamed. Absolutely unexplainably brilliant.

There are so many opportunities to fantasize (daydream) in everyday life (when you are working, when you are driving, when you talk to a friend or a colleague, when you watch tv, and so on) that if you allow yourself to be overwhelmed and invaded by phantasms, it can become complete chaos in your existence. And with the metaverse, it's worse. Congratulations to the scriptwriters, directors and actors for translating that chaos into a seething and swirling movie. More than ever, we must follow the Latin advice of Ignatius of Loyola (founder of the Jesuit order): "Age quod agis": = do what you do. And stay focused on every task, even the smallest and simplest. This is the only way to avoid chaos.

reviews.review_title: Can't run, can't hide: Can't escape myself.
reviews.content: None of us can. Daniels and the Russo Brothers collaborate in a mind-bending film bringing together the legends Michelle Yeoh and that one kid from The Goonies and Indiana Jones all grown up. Polarizing forces in the life of their daughter. Movie is really existentialist and nihilistic at times, and I love it! Does any of this life actually matter or is it just what you choose to do with your time? Is there any innate reason for us being here or do we just make it up as we go along? I understand exactly how the daughter was feeling as if she was just so tired of going on and on in a box, all for it to end with so little having been accomplished. The visuals in this movie are eye-popping, and this was a fun adventure with parallels to The Matrix, but way cooler! Made me wish I could escape from my life and hop into another me in another universe. I guess we just need to understand and love the people in our lives for who they are. Take it or leave it, all or nothing. Use what little time you have together and make the best of it while you can. What else is life besides what we make it? Put everything on your bagel, or eat a plain one if you wish, nobody can tell you how to eat it. Superb acting and an overall beautiful movie that is a definite rewatch for me.

Wow, this movie is an crazy thrilling wonderful experience. One minute I was in awe, the next minute I laugh, and then surprise then cry. Such an emotional roller-coaster and the movie did it so well. The movie is so creative and so much fun. Jumping between universes were effortless, I never got lost and some universe is so crazy couldn't stop laughing.They manage to put so much story in such short period or time and manage to give back stories to so many characters. Everyone was great. I love it.I wish I watch this masterpiece in the cinema. Didn't even know it was released. It is easily the best movie in 2022.Wow.

That was simply horrible and at times disgusting and for absolutely no good reason. This movie had such good reviews that I kept waiting for it to get better. Unfortunately, I am still waiting. Just mentioning the Multiverse a few times does not make something science-fiction.

I think it's probably one of the best films I have ever seen. Photography great , direction excellent . The actors are also really something else but the epic thing is the storyline . I thought I was high on drugs while I was watching the film . Honestly I cannot explain nor understand the level of masterminds that created this movie . It's so creative , so random , so amazing and yet so extremely simple and human . Everything in life is choices . Honestly I've never said that again but it's probably the best film I've ever seen because it amazed me at many levels . It's so original , new and extremely unique . I highly recommend watching this, maybe even more than once .

Powerful on so many levels. The real multiverse of madness! Nicely developed characters you actually can connect with. Funny, great fight scenes, and heartfelt movie that will make you feel everything everywhere all at once.

reviews.review_title: Messy, disconnected concept that doesn't work
reviews.content: There are some good parts. Conceptually interesting and starts with promise but gets more disconnected and messy as the film progresses. Some acts are just pointless showing of of directorial skills, some to fit in fights scenes perhaps. Some I can't fathom their purpose. I get the central concept that life is messy and so the film tries to convey that in its structure but it's really over done.It's a shame as somewhere in this mess there is a better film trying to get out. One that is probably 30 minutes shorter. Perhaps one day we'll see it although I'm not sure having lost over two hours of my life I'd be willing to risk it again.

With all the pathetic attempts of Disney to make movies for China that are patronizing head pats...here is a movie with all the main characters as Chinese American actors where not once does that matter....the are simply great characters/actors and an amazing plot. I cant stress enough that actor Identity doesn't matter. The story and characters do. There's so much fun and joy in this film as well as a couple of hard hitting emotional moments. I had a blast watching this. The music and cinematography were incredible as well.

reviews.review_title: Hi-yah, asian matrix meets rick & morty plus LSD
reviews.content: First of all, you must be comfortable with chinese style cinema or you plain just wont like this film. Demons, possession, extremely fast paced, literal good vs evil etc.The pacing in this film is incredibly quick, with most hollywood films being too slow, this film is too fast. So many different ideas, so many different thoughts, all whizzing past you at a tiring speed. Although its fast with many moving parts, theres zero depth, like a rambling schizophrenic going 1000 words a minute.Coming back to the crazyness, this film goes full on 12/10 in wackiness, bizarreness and other abstract outside the box ideas. Just like the pacing, its more schizophrenic randomness rather than having rhyme or reason.The martial arts are good, the technical side and minimal CGI is always nice to see, but its all rather simple with zero depth. This film displays more like a live theatre production, with you constantly wondering when the literal curtains will fall and youll have to start clapping, instead of being a well shot, well planned, well thought out film.If youre looking for a super random, almost psychedelic, asian stage show experience, this is it. But if you want anything resembling a coherent film, you will be disappointed. This experiment also runs way too long at 2h20m, we all enjoy some crazy, but not for that period of time.

Honestly was not sure what to expect from this. Was told it was good and to watch it, and went in without knowing much at all about it.Well, heck. It starts out a little slow but builds non-stop and by the time it was over I didn't want it to end. I won't go into the details of the movie or voice my opinion on the acting or science. Who cares?It was very entertaining and worth a look for quite literally anyone. That's saying a lot about any movie out there. Easily in the top 5 of movies I've seen in the past year and I recommend you watch it. Any issues that other reviewers will bring up simply cannot justify not giving it a view. Wanna watch a movie and not sure what to check out? Watch this one. It won't disappoint.

I went to watch this movie with my family on my birthday. I've been wanting to watch it for a while, but I thought it left the theaters, as soon as I saw it was still in theaters I said we needed to watch it. First we went to el con and mid previews the entire theater shut down. Because of this we were forced to rush to the park place mall and we snuck in the popcorn, and drinks from the other theater. Actually watching the movie was a great experience, everyone thought the movie was okay, but I thought Hereh movie was really good, funny and creative. They lost me at parts, but overall I had a great time watching this movie, and I hope to see it again.

reviews.review_title: Holy Hole in a Donut, Batman!
reviews.content: This is a hyper-magical postmodern fable, akin in style to the most recent Marvel multiverse schlockfests, but with more heart and a lot more hilarity. You're most likely to enjoy this if you are already comfortable with jarring technicolor visuals, haphazard editing sequences, unlikable characters, loose ends, inexplicable chaos, etc.. this film exhibits a potpourri of sweet, sweet mania rarely seen in the cinema. Highly recommended for fans of the following: The Wave (2019), The Fall (2006), Paprika (2006), Adaptation (2002), Holy Motors (2012), or Scott Pilgrim vs. The World (2010)... ok be safe out there, I love you, see you later!
A breath of fresh air and an incredibly accomplished film. Like watching the Matrix for the first time. Can't wait to see what this team do next. Highly recommended.

I felt drawn into this movie from the very strange beginning. From there it got stranger and stranger and disturbing. As soon as I saw the "awards" I knew there would be something bad on the screen and I wasn't wrong about that. If I had known that scene was in the movie there's no way I would have watched it. I don't think the alternative lifestyle theme took the movie anywhere either and was more of a distraction than anything else. The actors themselves were absolutely fantastic. I really enjoyed all of them. I'm giving the movie a 5 out of 10 because it was very well made but ultimately disturbing. Time for some mental bleach.

reviews.review_title: This is... MADNESS- Everything Everywhere All At Once Review
reviews.content: I literally just got out of seeing Everything Everywhere All At Once, and this might be one of the most underrated movies ever! Michelle Yeoh crushes it as the lead star in this movie, and has a performance that is super memorable. Now, let's get to the main part of this review because DANG!!!!!!!!!! This film is Madness, and it's bonkers! Depending on how Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness goes, this might be the most bonkers multiverse film of the year! It goes into many spots which are weird, and that's this movie in one word: Weird. And not only is it a great multiversal superhero story, it's a family movie, an adventure movie, a thriller movie, and a emotional movie. It packs a punch on what it does with the plot and villain and characters, and the surprises this movie has in line for the audience is so worth it!I know you probably didn't have Everything Everywhere All At Once on your movie radar to go watch, but your going to be doing yourself a MASSIVE favour if you buy a ticket and go see this masterpiece!8.5/10.

reviews.review_title: i think i just watched my life on screen. though its still on part 1
reviews.content: It spoke for me. Its like seeing myself on screen. Seeing my mom and me onscreen. It was supposed to be me and my mother watching but as I was checking the movie (as what i do to all movies to see if theres any gay stuff because Im in the closet) I see Joy and Becky and decided not to. So instead I watched this alone 1am because everyone's asleep in the house. It was confusing at first, did not expect the plot to be like that from seeing in my twitter timeline..... But being in an Asian household, being in a closet and always in pain because of how your own mother treats you. GAH I CANT EXPLAIN IT PROPERLY BUT im glad I watched this movie.

reviews.review_title: Pretentious, simple, hollow, and empty, disguised as profound for those not familiar with the subject matter it's barely scratching the surface of.
reviews.content: Time/space/world jumping mixed with existential themes was done better in movies such as The Matrix, Inception, Interstellar, Edge of Tomorrow, Eternal Sunshine, The Fountain, Mr. Nobody, and Predestination, for starters. Considering, some of these are my favorite movies, and the early high praise I saw for this movie, I thought I would love it, but it was awful and I kept waiting for it to get better.The main character is having a mental breakdown/existential crisis and hallucinating solutions to mending her personal relationships with her husband and daughter, while going through a tax audit. In this hallucination, she jumps to different multiverse versions of herself, through random achievements, which most often come in the form of self-harm or an emotional act. How does getting an object stuck up your butt get you your black belt multiverse version? Some writer came up with these completely arbitrary jumping achievements and I was consistently pulled out of my suspension of disbelief because of how ridiculously hard they were trying to make it funny through absurdity, but it fell completely flat for me.Similar to how "Joker" was praised by many as amazing by those not aware of "The King of Comedy" and "Taxi Driver," this movie is getting the same praise by those that haven't attended day 1 of Philosophy 101.

Paid to watch on Amazon with family expecting a real treat. Not sure why there are so many rave reviews, the film was like a bad trip, or as someone succinctly put it like surfing several channels until you get a chaotic storyline which makes no sense.When it got to the bit where people had hotdog fingers we gave up.Is like a bunch of teenagers on amphetamines brainstormed ideas for a movie, with one suggesting Kung fu, another suggesting South Korean family with predictable issues, another suggesting multi verse theory, and some suggesting a nod towards something profound which film goers will feel obligated to mention although they have been sold a dud.A bit like the story of the Emporer who wore no clothes.Everybody hyping it up because so many others are doing it and they don't want to look as if they have missed a trick.So bad.

reviews.review_title: It's worth watching for those interested!
reviews.content: Im gonna be totally honest in this review, I did not love this movie. I appreciate it's originality and wacky concepts within the multiverse and sometimes it's pulled off very well but in my honest opinion I think this movie is a little messy. Now that could have been Daniels intention, they are the dudes who made Swiss Army Man after all which was weird as hell and an amazing movie that executed it's weird concept in a very thoughful and emotional way.They go for a similar approach here with Everything Everywhere All At Once and some of the family drama does work very well in this film but I dunno, I didn't fully connect with this one in the way that i'd hoped to after all the rave reviews. They are brilliant filmmakers but I just didn't fully connect with this one in the way I would have liked to. Im still looking forward to what they bring out next and im sure whatever it is will be just as weird if not more.

I'm sure this will win Best Original screenplay at the Oscars. This was the hyped movie of the year.Yes, it was good. But, that's all it was. It was just good. It was by no means the best film ever as I have seen/read being claimed.The main thing of the film: you may not have it all, but more likely than not: you have all you need.The filmmakers just chose a fantastically strange and drawn out way of putting that on film.The performances were all good. Michelle Yeoh has never not been great. Same with Jamie Lee Curtis. James Hong is always a delight. And it's great to see Ke Huy Quan is a role other than The Goonies and Temple of Doom - I honestly think he deserves consideration for Supporting Actor here.

reviews.review_title: Mess, Over hyped and Over rated
reviews.content: I really don't get any points of the movie. Why is this so hyped about? Why is this in IMDB top 250 movies? Please enlighten me this crap. This is full of visual effects and CGIS, helluva technology doesn't make you a good movie. Is there Anyone out there who didn't understand the philosophy of the film?

reviews.review_title: It truly is everything, everywhere all at once
reviews.content:
I've been excited for this film as it's gotten great reviews. Whilst the plot is hard to describe, it's the type of film where you just have to trust that it's going to be good and enjoy the madness as it happens.It's a film that manages to cover every genre there is, which is something i don't think I've seen before.I admit that it was very confusing, but I think that's intentional and it's so wild that it makes it that much cooler.Michelle Yeoh is a great lead and there were some minor roles and cameos that would have been fun for the actors to be involved in.The action scenes were amazing, which were reminiscent of films like Kill Bill and The Matrix (minus the butt plugs of course). Top marks for visuals, music and costuming too.An extremely imaginative film that is both quiet and chaotic, interesting and entertaining, it's all
of those things, everything at once.

reviews.review_title: I wish I liked it more
reviews.content: True to the name, it was a two+ hour of everything mixed up in everywhere and all at once totally chaotic! This movie was one of the worst movies I've had to give up 2+ hours of my life to watch. I was expecting a comedy, instead I got a mish-mosh of everything and anything. After an hour, or so, I was still asking what the point was to the whole thing: Even my wife, who's not quite as critical of a movie as I am, agreed.

Complete chaos, hard to catch what's going on, poor acting. Very obscure plots, monologues do not know who to understand. Although i like fiction, here it is weird. Watching is only possible due to the good work of the operator.

We were all been waiting for a movie with this kind of greatness since The Joker, other people had mentioned in their reviews that the multiverse concept has already been completed with Spider-Verse, Doctor Strange, etc. I have watched all of those movies and they are great and original, but the difference between them and this one is that you can't find any kind of flaws in Everything Everywhere All at Once , this one is just perfect in every way ( the acting, the screenplay, the directing, the creativity, the emotions and the philosophy behind the plot). This movie is an epic masterpiece.

I felt everything everywhere all at once. I laughed and cried at the same time. I pondered over the importance of life and at the same time felt everything is meaningless.It's a crazy bizarre thought-provoking sad and funny masterpiece that will be talked about for generations.

reviews.review_title: That was the most unexpected movie I,ve ever seen
reviews.content: I even dunno what say, It was magnificent!!That movie became quite popular and my friend and I we were going to watch it. And that was unexpected experience. I liked each part that masterpiece. I even decided wrote the review in non-native language for me. I guess that the review can seems no use and may it is. But I at least tried.

I've been watch those two "Multiverse" genre movies and this one is the true multiverse of madness. Visually pleasing, great acting from all actors, great concept, great choreography, simple yet great storyline, packed in one of the greatest movie ever made.It's like a huge portion of sandwich, but they didn't put with what it left, THEY PUT EVERYTHING WITH WHAT THEY HAVE yet still managed to make it look like sandwich and taste like a good sandwich.The multiverse itself might be a huge distraction for a simple storyline, but it's the essential part to make a great world building unlike *cough* Strange *cough* that's just passing by and gone.Overall, best movie in 2022.

I didn't have much of an idea of what I was getting into when I went to go see this but I was pleasantly surprised with what a wild ride it is. It's packed with a great cast and an interesting concept.

No spoilers, it's a great film across so many genre's and it's going to make you feel good. No one could possibly not enjoy this movie and I usually hate most films for trying to be something they're not, this film managed to be so much without even trying.

The movie at times feels like it is written by 12 year olds that have taken the pills from limitless and have unlocked 100% of their brain. The whacky, strange beauty of this movie means the more and more you try and work out where you are narratively, the further away from the truth you'll find yourself. As the film states, you have to just be a rock and observe as it works its multiversal magic. Everything everywhere all at once is bombastic, beautiful and surgical in its precision, it will make you laugh, it will make you cry and it will make you question if you are the best or worst version of yourself in the vast multiverse of possibility. 10 stars. End of.

reviews.review_title: EVERYTHING EVERYWHERE ALL AT ONCE: A HILARIOUS COMPLEX JOURNEY
reviews.content: I have heard so much hype coming from this film even before its release. As I have finally gotten to watch it on the big screen, there are so many words that I can use to describe my experience towards the movie. And that is mostly positive things that are hard to be put into words due to how Everything Everywhere All at Once is a confusing yet a thrilling and entertaining film that I will never forget. To A24 pictures, this is probably the best that I have seen from you yet and here is why I loved it.Michelle Yeoh, who is best known for her role in Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon, is an absolute blast to watch. She is by far the most standout but even the whole cast as well delivered when they are given screen time throughout the film. I love the fact that her bickering and being confusing makes a whole lot of sense to her because I too, as an audience member, was very confused at what's really going on. But by the time she eventually learns to acknowledge her problems and flaws towards herself and her family, she becomes a lot more relatable.And yes, as I have stated before in the previous paragraphs, the film is absolutely confusing. In addition to this, it was a non-stop rollercoaster of craziness and off-the-top humor, particularly sexual jokes, that added more fuel to the fire of confusion that I am getting. The action sequences though are also cool and not to mention how funny the jokes delivered by everyone in the cast, in particular is Jamie Lee Curtis who I was surprised was part of this movie.I am also happy that this is one of those films that does feature the element of the what-if routes. Seeing what Michelle Yeoh's protagonist could have been in other universes is a great and also relatable way to the audience because we also imagined what our lives would have been if we took the other choices in life. For instance, I am currently taking political science as my program but never in the back of my head would stop thinking if I took up film studies or even journalism. Or what would happen if I was married or just stayed single for the rest of my life.Remember the iconic quote of Spike Spiegel from Cowboy Bebop "whatever happens, happens" - this basically sums up my love for the movie and interpretation to reality. Just like the movie, sometimes there we always be moments that you will face a difficult situation and as you start to think that it would have been better if I lived another life, always remember that sometimes, living your life to the fullest in all the mishaps you experienced with the people you are stuck with is better than regretting everything that made you come to this point of your life.So basically, even though I said Hustle was my favorite movie of 2022, it seems like Everything Everywhere All at Once has just topped my list. Please Oscar, nominate this film for Best Picture and give Michelle Yeoh her very first Best Actress nomination because she literally carried the film the entire way through. Yes, there is more to come in the second half of the year but I bet no film can be as standout as what the Kwans did. If you haven't seen this film, I would be very jealous of you because you are going to have an exhilarating yet memorable ride with the movie.

This movie had so many twists and turns, it was an absolute joy to watch, an emotional rollercoaster. The whole movie you felt as if you were the one living it.The cinematography was breathtaking, every scene felt unique, every transition flawless, every moment special. The people who worked on this movie really put blood sweat and tears into it and you can feel it throughout the entire film.The movie has so much more depth to than it seems at first, it takes you on a wonderful ride with great acting, a breathtaking story and all in all feels very complete and well planned.The only negative in the movie was I'd say some of the humor, it felt slightly forced but still none the less it is a must watch movie which might just help you search for a way to relate to some situation in the movie.The movie told a lot of small stories in a very well designed manner.As a final note I would like to say that I went into this movie expecting a simple, generic comedy movie but I was extremely surprised by what it is.

This is a singular, messy, fantastic, beautiful, human film. There are moments that are literally a dozen thing/feelings/thoughts/stories/histories all at once. The story is so universal and so essential with extraordinary performances by everyone in the cast.

reviews.review_title: The Tale of the Absurd Hero
reviews.content: Beautiful movie that combines comedy, absurdism, mind-bending moments, growth, love, and meaning. One of my favorite movies of all time; A24 has done it again!

reviews.review_title: The best film of 2022 so far.
reviews.content: This film is everything.It's Ejzenstejn, it's Kubrick, it's Godard, it's Fellini, it's Wong Kar-wai, it's Kurosawa, it's Kobayashi, it's Lucas, it's Spielberg, it's the Wachowski sisters, it's Anno, it's Miyazaki, it's Kon, it's Bong Joon-ho, it's Wright, it's Nolan, it's Tarantino.It's Daniel Kwan, it's Daniel Scheinert.And it's also Marvel, but better.It's really the film about the multiverse, the one of the weight of choices.Through such an absurd and surreal story, life is told in its most realistic nuances.Through the regret of not having lived a life that for a single, different deviation does not belong to us.Believing that absolute nothingness, being stone, is the solution. A simple and appetizing solution, like the Bagel.The absolute nothing to avoid the suffering of appearances, or the frustration of our present.Making the mistake of not being grateful for the here and now, the present, which along with feelings are the only things that matter.You just need to be kind in this life or in the other one.It's the only way.One of the most beautiful and important experiences of my life.

reviews.review_title: Weird, strange and in need of some good editing
reviews.content: This film was not just odd, it was disappointing. Disjointed and at times a bit cringeworthy, it just seems to not be able to make up it's mind. With really weird potty humour sprinkled throughout- seriously embarrassing in the absence of actual funny material. There were a few laughs, and at times it felt like there was some point being made? It was a movie that had an interesting concept handled in a heavy handed, disjointed and confusing way. It is like a production where the director keeps changing his mind halfway through a scene and the stage manager forgets to take notes, I can't imagine being offered this script as an actor, and then agreeing to do it. I also agree with a prior reviewer - there absolutely needs to be a flashing light warning with this film. I think part of the confusion may be to reflect what is going on in the lead character's mind - just a bit overkill. This could have been a wonderful film if the editing had been handled differently, and if the really BAD potty humor scenes had been left on the cutting room floor.

reviews.review_title: What if "Rick & Morty" and "Matrix" had a child?
reviews.content: I didn't know anything about this movie at all, just found it and watched it, so I wasn't hyped at all.Can't deny the visual work is very good, costumes, scenarios, special effects, etc. But it's excessively ridiculous, to the point it feels more like a long YouTube meme video but a movie.Most ideas were already used in Rick & Morty, and the baseline of the movie is Matrix. The beginning of the movie was pretty interesting, but after 1 hour it became boring and repetitive.It's been a long time since I felt this way watching a film and wanting it just to end. This is a perfect example of how a good idea can turn into a waste. I really wanted to like this film but unfortunately I felt frustrated, irritated, disgusted and bored all at once. I even made an account on this site to rate it lolOf course it is worth to watch, there are really worst movies out there, but this is not what people are praising it to be. If you like this genre, just watch Rick & Morty, or even The Midnight Gospel.

I don't know where to begin or how to describe this film without doing it an injustice. It needs to be seen, it is sad, laugh out loud, trippy, thought provoking, beautifully acted by all.It has suffered from poor advertising and I had no idea what an absolute gem was hiding on streaming. Like a lot of other perfect films cinema bank doesn't do it justice, I hope that word of mouth, home video and streaming gets it the views and appreciation the love and act put into this fantastic film.I don't know how the film makers made this, and kept the viewer in touch and not lost in the mind bending tale. I'm so much better and happier for watching it, thank you.

Well acted, indifferently written screenplay, alternately intricate and shabby production. Difficult to understand this movie's high ratings.Don't get your hopes up. The cast does the very best possible job with a screenplay that feels like it was written stoned by amateurs with good imaginations and too much time on their hands.You don't need to see this one in the theater. Watch it at home, stoned out of your gourd. Take breaks when you need them; things will be much the same by the time you get back.

reviews.review_title: Very Similar to Dr. Strange Multiverse
reviews.content: It has a very similar plot to Dr Strange and the Multiverse because of the people traveling through universes through their own body in that universe and also the mother valuing her children theme.The movies are so similar I seriously wonder about plagerism somewhere. The executions of how this took place was didn't. In Dr Strange it was witchcraft and in Everything Everywhere it was science that looked very low tech. Just headsets.In addition though, this movie explores family relationships and the importance of them and how we hurt each other as families. And how we give up a more successful life for families. Just how we learn to value love and relationships over world success and personal achievements. That having a family with pain of poverty and failures can make us not appreciate our families and relationships.How to repair the damage done to family relationships through mistakes in the past.It just seems so easy to repair? The world and failures don't matter as long as you succeed as a family and relationships.The movie was messy and all over the place but still easy to follow. It has interesting imagery but also looked low budget. But it looked high tech with a budget.It looked indie and campy and unique without being unique. It felt like it answered everything but answered nothing. It's a movie of contradictions. So oddly, I find myself really unable to complain about it.

This movie was definitely a trip like others mentioned, but one I would've walked out on if I wasn't with friends. The sheer amount of ridiculous and juvenile humor would've worked a lot better when that style of humor was popular in the early 2010s, but now it just seems too cheesy and annoying for my liking. The last act of the movie is definitely more enjoyable than the rest of it and the overall message was good, but I can't see why people thought this movie was one of the greatest of the decade. To each their own I suppose.

Where to even begin with this pile of nonsense. Let's be honest. If this story didn't have the "Asia" element, no one would have bothered with it.Sub-par storyUnnecessary antics and story elementsToo much filler (especially the fight scenes)Anything really menas nothing is clearly the teachable moment in this movie since everything is just unnecessary even the movie itself.Physics makes no sense and the "acquiring of skills" makes no sensesome of the timelines are just plain idiotic and too far fetchedCoulf have had potential but then they rather decided to make the movie a comical eyesore.2 hours i could have better spent lying on the grass outside.

reviews.review_title: If you want to play Multiverse, you must achieve this level.
reviews.content: The movie is full of crazy fun that kicks in every minute. You can laugh and cry over and over again. This is the multiverse that I want. It has to be like this.For those who can read subtitles slowly. There may be some problems at the beginning of the movie.But believe me, this movie is f...k..g insanely fun.

At first I got confused on what's happening then as the duration of the movie goes towards the end, it does make sense, it's like "Inception" meets " Marvels Mutiverse" Some scenes are a bit dragging but there are lots of moments that will make you laugh out loud weirdness! If you want to see something unique and creative, go see this with an open mind!

reviews.review_title: Don't listen to the bad reviews!!!
reviews.content: Just made an account only to say the people giving bad reviews are weird old people caught up politicizing or overthinking the whole thing. Definitely one of the best movies EVER, almost undeniably destined to becoming a classic. Go see this movie so you can brag to people you saw it when it first came out!

reviews.review_title: I'm definitely going to watch this again!
reviews.content: I saw this while I was on an airplane the other day and I loved it! There is so much to appreciate about it that I am not sure where to start. The visuals were incredible. The colors popped in every scene and were a lot of fun to look at. I heard they a lot of the effects were completed by only a few people who learned how to do them over zoom during this pandemic. It's so impressive. Not only was it fun visually, but it was also funny! I laughed so many times during it I will probably laugh again when I rewatch it. The performances were also fantastic with the standout being Ke Huy Quan. It's awesome to see him in a production such as this again and I hope he will appear in more films in the future. This is my favorite movie of 2022 so far and I think everyone should watch it if they are able to.

I first watched this in the theater. It became my all time favorite movie. Now i am currently watching it because i have been so depressed about the direction our world is going. I realized it would boost my spirits to know that there are people in the world who still care about humanity and love. Please watch this movie. It is necessary for everyone to know that everyone is just who they are. Everyone is what encompasses our world. Not just one group's beliefs. Its what i thought america was supposed to be. But now so many of our ideals as the nation we were supposed to be are being systematically destroyed.

reviews.review_title: everything great everywhere great happens in one movie
reviews.content: First time got a hangover after a movie. Either someone sat near me gave me Covid, or laughing a lot caused me a lack of oxygen to the brain.Multi-universal theme sounds a bit cliché, but the writers, Daniels, are absolutely brilliant and on something. The whole movie is like everything good about making a movie crashes together from every direction...Btw, good luck, dr strange. The bar is high.

reviews.review_title: This is a movie about being a bored God who is done.
reviews.content: Imagine if you were a God that could make anything happen (more or less), you could travel to any instance in time at will to any part of the multiverse do anything you wanted. Yet you felt unfulfilled by these powers and you became destructive, not having anyone around to share in your powers.It would become terribly frustrating, this movie is about a version of a person who becomes a God and has decided that enough is enough, she is checking out into the void but wants someone to share this experience with her. But in embarking on this journey to find 'another Godlike being' to share this new desire for oblivion she finds that the other Godlike being doesn't believe in destruction and the futility of it all, quite the opposite.This is an incredible movie and for me at the end was quite moving. I've not seen anything so good and inspiring in quite a few decades to be honest.

The movie overall was good I liked it as a mom I felt the movie but if you think this movie is not bad it is very and let me say it again very inappropriate do not do the mistake I did when I took all the family it would be nice for some of age 18 to go watchtower the movie or you and your husband or wife but it was a good movie.

Imagine Kill Bill meets The Matrix. My eyes were glued to the amazing cinematography and Oscar award winning acting by the entire cast. This is hands down one of my top 10 movies of all time. Every single character has their own gift that they bring to the context of the story. Simply awesome movie, I'm still smiling after seeing it days ago.

reviews.review_title: This movie is about the "human" in HUMANITY!
reviews.content: This is the most amazing movie I've ever seen. Parallel lives, parallel universes collide in this family story filled with love, hate, shame, laughter, regret, karma and enlightenment. All these emotions in one beautiful film.

I have high expectations about this movie and certainly it was quite a ride. This film is like "Sliders" meets "Quantum Leap" with a touch of "The Matrix". It's an exciting experiment where you can find almost any main movie genre along the story. Where action and sci-fi are key genres but it's family drama what makes this film something outstanding and truly unique. A great performing cast merging Asian talent with American in the front of the big screen showing a balance with the work behind the scenes where East meets West as well. Definitely, I have no doubt that this is one of the best ten films of 2022.

reviews.review_title: Don't learn anything just go see it.
reviews.content: Michelle Yeoh is fantastic, the writing and action sequences are great and it feels like.a movie. Something to be seen in around two hours in a theatre and to be experienced in this format. A great mix of funny, poignant and dramatic with a satisfying conclusion.

reviews.review_title: Great Movie: Have an open MInd
reviews.content: When watching this movie have an open mind. It's a great Sci-Movie. It's adventurous. Has action and drama. Something for everyone in this movie. Don't go in with too much expectations. Go in for the experience. Pay attention to the movie, but don't over think it while watching it. ABSORB as much as you can. It's a great ride and I don't want to spoil it for anyone. Like anything in life there will be people who hate this. Half of them just want to complain about something or perhaps this genre is not for them(why see it then?) Anwyays. Don't pay attention to the detractors. LIke I said. Go into the movie with an Open mind. Go for the experience. This movie may surprise some while for others you will get a lot out of this movie. It's very very entertaining movie but at the same time very very very very..................Profound!!!!!!Enjoy!!!!

I never write reviews, but wow. This movie was incredible. It was fresh, funny, heart warming, visually stunning, and whatever other adjectives you want to add. I genuinely loved this movie and can't stop thinking about it. After only one watch, I can easily say this is one my new all-time favorites. I can't recommend it enough!

This felt like a mash up of the Matrix, Mr nobody, hitchhikers guide to the galaxy and 2001 a space odyssey. But with lots more violence, stressful situations and a journey through someone's bad acid trip.2 and a half hours and all that intensity just to tell us to love our family more? Could have spared us all that time and energy and just focused on the love from the start.

I originally left the theater dissapointed but I couldn't figure out why. I came to realize that I went in expecting a movie heavy on intense action sequences, and was instead given an equally intense drama about life and out purpose on Earth. Rethinking my opinion, I believe I really liked this movie. The little action in it was great, the multiverse hopping was very cool and there were many emotional moments. This is a good one and maybe top 5 of the year.

I had the urge to resist the movie at the beginning because it was hitting too close to reality. I forced myself to work through the inital dread and anxiety and found myself immersed in an exercise in finding acceptance. The overall theme of the film is an important one we need to face as people and as a society overall. Can we just be ok with being ordinary? Can we heal and let go of our regrets and past mistakes to live for now? I found this movie wildly thought provoking and emotionally exhausting. Great fight sequences are always a plus for me, and there was some good ones here. Even the multiverse aspect which is overused lately was used in an inventive way. I wasn't into some of the crude and juvenile humor though which is why it doesn't get higher marks from me. (And there is A LOT of that.) Still a great film that demands a watch even with the step down humor included.

reviews.review_title: A lot of hype, but not great.
reviews.content: I kept hearing how great this movie was and that it was ground-breaking, best movie since the matrix. I realize people have different tastes, but this movie was not for me. It was so bad that after about 40 minutes I could not force myself to watch anymore. The reviews are also artificially inflated on amazon as well...Amazon doesn't let you review the movie unless you watch the whole thing, so guaranteed there are other people who would rate it low but their reviews are not allowed. For reference which movies do I like: Fight Club, The Matrix are probably my favorites. TV series: I loved DEVS and Breaking Bad.

reviews.review_title: Probably the dumbest movie of the century!
reviews.content: I really enjoyed watching every single scene of the movie. I think it portrayed a real family. I wish everyone enjoyed being together with the religion of this film, instead of all complaining about why our life is not as it should be! I wish parents would learn to be friends with their children instead of hacking their country's religions by force! I wish we had true love for our families, instead of fighting all the time, and the adults should not just teach their children the things they love! I wish we were wise! ....

reviews.review_title: Best film of 2022 and Best multiverses film
reviews.content: I will never understand why people hate so much this masterpiece. It is sad how Doctor Strange Multiverse of Madness get lots of recognition just because of fan service and popularism but this amazing show gets hateful comments. Multiverse connected with great messages at the end makes this film outstanding. I even dont want to talk about details on this film. Eveything everywhere at all once based on love , respect , emphaty. They are key factors and important emotions and the only way to change the world in all multiverses. So it doesnt matter in which multiverse you live just be kind , respect other and make an emphaty. That is what you help to create your difference and change you and people around you.

This film is the perfect mix of heartbreaking, hilarious and mysterious. Full of convincing performances, it carries a heart through the whole thing which you don't see in many films these days.The first time I watched it I was slightly confused but now I see how that makes sense to reflect Evelyn's (Yeoh's) position in it. The second time made more sense and I picked up on more, which is what a lot of directors want from their movies so well done to the Daniels!Definitely one of the best movies of the year and I am sure that I will be watching it again in the future. I highly recommend it, and it's also a good film to watch in a group of friends/with your family.

reviews.review_title: That "rocks on the cliff" scene should be nominated by any screenplay award
