reviews.content: This movie carries elements of best movie as well as best story, character that leads audience to the story, conflict that build every subsequent scenes and the continuity of cinematography captures the complexity, chaos, parallel crosscut scenes, I admire every works in this masterpiece, not to mentions the art production brings out the theme and emotion, including one of the most impressive scene I've seen in years, that "rocks on the cliff" scene, it really gets me, IMO It should at least be nominated by any screenplay award.

reviews.review_title: Magnificient, Insipiring, Tender, Daring, Fun... All at Once
reviews.content: First off, this is my first IMDB review. I've wondered many times when would I finally publish one but I always felt the movies spoke for themselves, and also that there are so many people around the world reviewing here that it would simply be 'a waste of time'. Not for this movie, it isn't.Second of all, I am a fan of old school cinema, even though I enjoy a modern flick from time to time. However, in recent years I don't think I watched anything that really moved me or made me care. That means when I actually watch something beyond the year 2000, I go in with extremely low expectations, basically that I will be watching trash. I would definitely describe myself as a pretentious viewer, meaning I really need substance in a movie to really like it.Third, this movie inspired me to a degree I literally feel I am just a bit better as a person after watching it. So this is more of a praise than an actual review. I won't go into detail about any facet of the movie; just go watch it. What I want to share is the overall impact it had on my as a viewer. So here it goes:My first impression was basically boredom. I didn't really understand what the writers were getting at; it this a comedy, a superhero flick, or what? All I knew going in was the movie is supposed to be 'great'. The movie starts out slow, which in hindsight is good - the pacing is on point as the viewer is slowly eased into the characters and story. I don't watch trailers, so if you're like me, you're lucky to watch this not knowing what a wild ride you are in for. The whole 'multiverse' concept is simple, yet overused these days and I was very, very disappointed with how it was handled in, say, Dr. Strange: Multiverse of Madness (yep, truly maddening plotholes and zero logic in that one). It's also not so easy to pull off the visuals, SFX and the whole narrative around that sort of thing. However, in EEAaO, it's handled brilliantly, in my opinion. Without taking themselves or the movie too seriously, the writers and the director manage to masterfully engage you in an almost real-life scenario where endless possibilities exist. Most, if not all of the visuals are breathtaking and mesmerising, taking full advantage of the multiverse concept inside the confines of the story, without exaggerating too much or keeping it too low-key for such an ambitious idea. The kung-fu elements I felt where spot on, not relying on 'magic' or 'superpowers' (even though we get a taste of that too, at one point).Smart and grown-up humour is all over the place too, adding a lighter tone yet not sacrificing the overall atmosphere which is still serious enough to get one thinking and feeling more deeply. The humour itself is definitely a breath of fresh air - it's weird and at times - even kinky, but it does not cross the line too much, it's just enough to be different and really funny at the same time. It's adult aspects are not hard to draw parallels to, say, Deadpool type humour, but of course Deadpool's is way over the top, which is a sort of trademark there, but not here, thankfully.Speaking of depth, I felt this movie is not brilliant or profound, but still manages to pull intellectual and emotional strings enough to intrigue all types of audiences. It has everything for everyone (pun not intended), from teenagers to grownups, from the casual viewer who seeks only spectacle to the more refined one that needs a bit of flare and meaning in every scene. The overall message is so sweet and simple it can appeal to anyone - perhaps only the people looking for completely empty films would not understand or care what the movie is really about - which I feel is Love, Compassion, Connection.Trying to dig a little deeper, in a world where metaphysics and now even science are bringing us ever closer to the idea of multiple, perhaps infinite universes and alternative dimensions, quantum fields and so forth, it's a really intriguing and interesting topic with a fresh spin to it. It also has very valid moral questions inserted into that, again, in a world where definitive moral and even existential values seem to be blurring more and more.Now, about some key elements of the movie - plot (script), direction, dialogue, acting, Action/SFX, sound/music:I found the plot quite well constructed and executed, it handles both the story and multiverse concept quite well. Maybe multiple views and a more detailed analysis will no doubt reveal inconsistencies - the movie is so coherent and satisfying overall I believe such will be completely inconsequential. Character development is good, if not great, basically only the two major characters transform during the movie but it's still well thought out and executed. Maybe developing more secondary characters would have muddled the overall progression of the movie, so no real criticism there. The length of the movie is ideal - not too long, not too short, and to be honest, it felt longer than it was, in a good way. The ending was not spectacular but wrapped up things nice and neat, focusing on the message and not so much on the metaphysics, which I felt was a good choice. * 9/10 *The direction I found masterful, really impressive shots, having to combine elaborate action sequences with steady, almost slow emotional moments. * 10/10 *The dialogue is by no means brilliant, and I found it possibly the only element a bit lacking, especially towards the end (mainly some unnecessary repetition); however, compared to some other modern movies it outshines them all in this aspect. * 8/10 *The acting is really solid here, most of the central characters are Asian-American, which is a breath of fresh air as far as I'm concerned, the main character is an Asian woman and I thought she did a great job, she is by no means a Mary Sue character, she has her flaws and builds on them how it should be. Even the smaller roles are really well acted and filled with substance. The stuntmen and body doubles deserve and extra mention. Basically, everyone is really into the project, which can be felt and is always a very good sign. * 10/10 *The action bits are well choreographed, awesome to watch and never dull (compare that to John Wick, for example - the action there to me *looks* good but is very monotonous and overall, boring). Here, the kung-fu elements combined with the madness of the multiverse come off real well, are blended well and are always fresh and interesting, often funny and wild. The SFX only add to this feeling as they never felt cheap or ripped off - there are even some obvious nods to the Matrix movies which I think was very nice and respectful, again adding an extra layer of fun while not ruining the originality or freshness of this film. * 10/10 *The quality of sound effects and music was really high, I felt engrossed by every hit and every note, the music does not lead or distract but amplifies what's happening on screen. There is some more originality here, but I'll leave you to explore that for yourself. * 10/10 *Overall judgement - this movie left me feeling inspired, refreshed, and most of all - entertained. I find all this to be rare in recent productions. The movie is certainly not perfect, but I think it's really close to perfection for it's genre and the message I felt it tries to convey. In a few words - go see it if you already didn't, it's worth every minute!!
This is brilliantly crazy and beautiful. I wish I could see it in theatres, but this is the kind of film that deserves an Oscar. It's hard to say this, but this might be a perfect film.

reviews.review_title: A movie that is a visceral experience in a cognitive shell and it works
reviews.content: This more than 2 hour movie is the length of a War and Peace novel. Many of the actors are recognizable from other roles and are true dynamos and professionals in their field. The movie initally appears quite disjointed and confusing but as it progresses the emotional connection takes over and the inticacies of each character in each timeline becomes part of the whole and one processes it as such. I really enjoyed this movie and would highly recommend it. Truly excellent! Michelle Yeoh as the main character is a "shape shifter" in the sense that she can change her demeanor and physical actions as she progresses on her journey. James Hong seems to have been around for ever as an actor and he adds a familiar face to the scene which incorporates drama and comedy in a seamless fashion always taking you to another level. Jamie Lee Curtis is magnificent in a role that you would never expect her to play yet she pulls it off with a memorable performance. Ke Huy Quan who plays the husband from different timelines also brings a believability to the movie and Stephanie Ann Hsu who plays the daughter is able to morph personality and bring shock and awe to the situation. I highly recommend this movie.

The characters are EVERYTHING!The plot is EVERYWHERE!As it happens ALL AT ONCE!The main lead actress, Michelle Yeoh, steals the entire show, perhaps being my favorite role she's ever done right along side "Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon", with a great supporting cast that at some points in the film, they take center stage along with Yeoh.Speaking of supporting cast, Ke Huy Quan absolutely dominated with the screentime he was given and a wonderful and emotional triumph return, from "Indiana Jones" and "The Goonies" to a now Oscar Nominated feature film.As this being a story about the multiverse, it succeeded far greater than "Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness". Which was overall a missed opportunity and a disappointment. The film brought more and clear understanding about the concept of the multiverse instead of complicating things to connect with a broader and wider universe like the MCU. The film also stands out more from other versions and takes of the concept of the multiverse due to its standalone nature and its own take on how the structure of the multiverse works.To wrap this up, "Everything Everywhere All at Once" is an achievement in filmmaking from its cast of characters , story and its many themes and connections to the real world, to the shear insanity of weirdness that it gives, only to keep it contained, only pushing the boundaries when it needs to.This is a MUST see for movie fans.One of my favorite films of last year.

Wow! It was so bad I threw out my popcorn and almost walked out of my own house! Read the Sex & Nudity section...you'll see. I felt like it was also all over the place and didn't get anything right. This is my first rating ever and felt I needed to rate this. If I could given it a big goose egg, I would have. Other reviews compare to being on acid trip...three words of wisdom. Say no to drugs, and say no to this movie.

reviews.review_title: I want a husband like Waymond
reviews.content: Some of the scenes are just so awkward to watch although extremely funny. The movie is a mix of everything, it's a very modern Asian take on things. If you watch a lot of Malaysian and Singaporean chinese movies, they have the same vibe of comedy mix with family tragedy. This movie adds on to that with superpowers. Like super serious, emotional, silly to the point of mega trolling, like what the heck, jumping on a dildo, how are they still able to walk? And the hotdog fingers, dancing and eating the hotdog fingers, omigosh I can't, this is Rick and Morty level of silly, I can't help but relate to it. So freaking random. The movie has everything and basically roll with tragedy is comedy. I love it.

reviews.review_title: Unexpectedly hilarious and an emotional roller coaster
reviews.content: I went into this movie thinking it would be emotional and thought-provoking. So, I was pleasantly surprised when the comedy showed up. This movie is so ridiculous that you can't help but laugh, so emotional that you can't help but cry, and so sublime that you can't help but want to rewatch it over and over again. The soundtrack is an ear massage. The visuals are good. The story is chaotic and strange; it's everything. The setting spans multiple alternate realities; it takes you everywhere. I imagine that people who prefer an "organized" movie may find this one difficult to watch and understand. The first 1/3 of the movie raises so many questions, but don't worry. Everything comes together at the end, all at once.

I had high hopes for this movie. I grew up watching Michelle Yeoh before she broke onto the Hollywood screen. The plot is interesting and creative, but the execution was poor. It was hard to make heads or tails between scenes once I got to the second half of the movie.There are several entertaining scenes on each of their own, but overall as the movie progressed it got kind of ridiculous and melodramatic. I found myself sighing and rolling my eyes then checked my phone to see how much longer it had left.Despite how much I like Michelle Yeoh and how glad I am to see an Asian-American movie making it big in Hollywood, I kind of hated this movie. Sorry not sorry.

reviews.review_title: A open mind is all needed.
reviews.content: I watched it twice inside theatres, bought the Blu-ray and watched a ton of reactions. People might think one must be smart to understand and feel the film. But I realised that an open mind to accept how a story is told in a not-so-traditional-in-a-good-movie way is all you need.Some scenes may seem extremely absurd and not needed, but they have their meanings. I think the hot dog finger universe and Racacoonie universe are regarded as unpalatable and useless the most, but they do have a role in the film. For example, the hot dog fingers universe is required for Evelyn to accept her daughter's sexuality and realise the usefulness in everything. And for the Racacoonie, it is important in the sense of not feeling shameful to depend on others when one is in need and giving back when one is capable. People tend to disregard these scenes too soon because of their absurdity.Open your mind, and I am sure you can feel it. (I cry even by watching reactions, it is how powerful it is).

reviews.review_title: Beautifully Absurd. I loved every minute of it.
reviews.content: It seems impossible to describe this movie, but wow it was something else. The cast, cinematography, set designs, costumes, ridiculous plot, it was awesome.

This movie was amazing. Great characters, great acting, a highly entertaining and unique storyline, fun action scenes, and plenty of bizarre and unexpected humor scenes that had me laughing out loud more than once. Some touching moments as well. I'm glad I saw it in theaters. I'll totally watch it again when it's available to stream.

This movie is BONKERS, but in the best way possible!!!Some people cannot suspend their disbelief for 2 hours but for any sci-fi junky or average person, this movie will really make you reflect on your life and FEEL so many different things! Some people don't like being made to feel things that they'd prefer to ignore, I get it, but again for the mature viewer you will truly appreciate the ARTISTIC manipulation of your emotions. This movie takes you on a journey that few films ever will! I loved it and this is a tour de force for Michelle Yeoh.

I rarely write a review for a movie but feel this one deserve it!It is a messy, noisy, long movie. Maybe not for everyone.But I just love it. Laughed loudly and cried tons at the same time.Still think about the scenes the next morning when I woke up.Haven't seen a movie like this in years!!You have to go to the theater to figure out whether you love it or hate it :)

If u hate urself andwanna ruin ur night and CRY, then go ahead. B****. They said my review needs to be 150 characters so im adding extra text. B****. Why does it auto capitalize these gusy r weirdos fr.

Very ambitious multiversal drama. I honestly was not expecting this movie to be built around a family delivered through a multiverse of astounding scenes and imagery but I was pleasantly surprised and intrigued by it. Particularly impressed by the brilliant Michelle Yeoh and the underhyped performance of Ke Huy Quan.However, considering the high standards the movie sets for itself - despite the brilliance of its characters, how the story is told, and how the movie's plot unfolds, and - if Everything, Everywhere, All at Once is perceived as the fast-paced drama it is albeit set across a multiverse: The movie underdelivers. To be clear, yes, the movie borrows a lot from multiple genres but at its core it is mostly a drama.In that light, it struggles to provide sufficient emotional fulfillment by the end of the movie and all the brilliance of the movie's methodology amounts to little. It also fails to deliver anything new or unique to match its multiversal ambitions, undermining its brilliance with a bagel. Point being: The movie shows that it can tell its story across a multiverse but ultimately does not prove that it has a reason to do so.Also, while Stephanie Hsu was good for the most part, I think she perhaps lacked a functional range to portray the varieties of her character. Thus contributing to the emotional gap at the end of the movie.Overall, it's a mostly superb movie, seriously original and put together with Oscar worthy editing. If there was one Oscar this movie would easily win, it would have to be for the editing work.

reviews.review_title: MAY BE BEST MOVIE OF OUR TIME
reviews.content: I don't wish to write too much about this film in my review. Just go see it, and please share with family and friends. I'm a film-lover, i adore movies like "eternal sunshine of the spotless mind" and "interstellar", so based off of the trailer, i was sold. I think i left the theater a different person. If you're someone who has ever dabbled with psychedelic medicine, this is a must-see for you. If you're someone who is struggling with depression, this is a must-see for you. If you're someone who is looking to reestablish bonds with family members or friends, this is a must-see for you. For lovers and nihilists alike, this film tells the story of LIFE, in all of its chaotic glory. I can't say enough about this film, and it had me and my friends speaking for hours about existence and how we felt touched forever. 10/10 film. Has something for everyone (of legal age). I'm seeing it again tonight and i will be purchasing this dvd when it's out. Absolutely absurd, but comforting enough to make you cry. Masterpiece of a film and unforgettably unique.

Just when a you thought the farting corpse of Harry Potter coming back to life to learn about what it means to be alive would be the weirdest thing created, comes a film where a Chinese mother is able to tap into any one of the infinite number of versions of herself to fight an evil threat to existence. And it's good. It's really good.You already know that by the time two rocks appear and have only a subtitled conversation for 10 minutes that this is a masterpiece.It's got a heart at the center of the madness that conveys its message with such genuine writing that you I can't help but feel for each different multiversional character you meet. It's a try celebration of the people who make cinema and the people who go to see it and cherish it forever.Everything Everywhere All At Once is one of the only films ever to make sense because it has ideas and scenarios that don't make sense making sense for the story. Does that make sense?Go see and go see again. I already can't wait to own this movie at home, but until that day comes the theater experience is the best possible way to truly feel this movie come to life.

reviews.review_title: Very boring, don't waste your time and money.
reviews.content: I didn't get it. It made no sense to me. I walked out after an hour, and I've never walked out of a film before. Save your money and time and see go something else instead.

reviews.review_title: A therapeutic psychedelic trip that might change you forever
reviews.content: Honestly, I never write reviews for any films but this one might stay in my mind for a long time. This is what aliens should see if they come visit us, or what people will watch in 100 years from now to understand the origins of our culture. Being the closest I've ever experienced to a psychedelic trip, the film immortalizes how it feels to live right now, at this exact moment, in such an entropic world like ours. I have questioned countless times the meaning of life, been close to suicide, suffered from constant depressions, and wondered how life would be if I had chosen the other path, or any path at all. But nothing hits deeper than the sense of nothingness that comes up when you get a glimpse of all the alternate universes you could've experienced, which is also a real math principle given the infinite size of the one we live in. Everything, Everywhere, All at Once will relate to each of your life memories and draw a picture to the frightening feelings the anxious, unstoppable and unforgivable world has put you through, but to say CHILL, LOVE and DONT WORRY TOO MUCH. Because nothing matters, nothing can stop you. Nothing is too important to prevent you from enjoying this one shot you get that's called life.

reviews.review_title: You just know the Daniels are going to give us something unexpected
reviews.content: I really enjoyed this and wasn't necesarily expecting too. A very clever film about our emotional pain and the power of kindness- I found it fantastic. The film touches on so many bases and had me thinking about it in the days to follow. You know the Daniels are going to give us something unexpected and incredibly entertaining. While I hear Awkwafina didn't make the final cut due to scheduling conflicts, the cast still boasts Michelle Yeoh, Jenny Slate, and Jamie Lee Curtis. So you just know there are going to be some comical moments as well as incredible fight scenes. And there are. Well worth checking out, I think one of the top ten indie films of recent time, without a doubt. Check it out and tell your friends- you and they won't regret it.

reviews.review_title: I had a lot of fun watching this
reviews.content: Minor spoilers ahead.This film is very random. The core idea is that every tiny decision in our lifes changes the course of everything. In this film, every decision was taken, and as soon as that happens, multiple timelines are created. Some people in one of these timelines found a way of moving between timelines, which makes a person remember everything that happened on that other timeline as well. To travel between timelines, they need to do something extremely random and unexpected, which is the best mechanism to kind of... bring proximity between those timelines to make the jump easier.Behind all this madness is the delightful Michelle Yeoh, who plays Evelyn Wang, a Chinese expat trying to make ends meet in the USA. It turns out one of her counterparts is the one who have found out about the dimension jumping and because of that, things went pear-shaped really quickly after a traveler started becoming too powerful. Evelyn is suddenly approached by a husband from another dimension and give the unlikely task of fixing everything. Why? Because since she is the most hopeless version of Evelyn ever, she is the best candidate to be successful.Brilliantly fresh and weird. I highly recommend.
A really well made multiverse movie. But the core of the movie is the family dynamics and their seach for emotional connection with each other. Michelle yeoh daniel.

It's a really nice movie and I love Michelle Yeoh in this. I found it original and entertaining. The only quibble I have is that the pace of the action is so high from the beginning and along the whole movie, with no respite, that I was a bit tired of it by the end.

The first 80% of the movie was a 10/10 ''nearly a masterpiece'' , but the cliche drama ending ruined everything , truly cringe-worthy , a 2/10 at best , so giving this movie 7 stars is already forcing myself just for the sake of the good part.

reviews.review_title: The people who get it, get it. The people who don't, don't.
reviews.content: This movie was fantastic start to finish. It tackled some really intense emotions especially between a mother/daughter dynamic that I could personally resonate with (it was very art like and abstract but that's what makes this movie).The emotional moments were well balanced well with absolute chaos humour which almost in a way made it feel more realistic - think "if you don't laugh about life sometimes it's going to make you cry"I think the more negative reviews are honestly people who just didn't understand the deeper meaning behind the film.It was about a mother coming to terms with the decisions in her life and how it's affected her, how she projected her expectations onto her daughter which in turn made the daughter feel like she was constantly disappointing her mother and not being respected as an individual with her own choices. Furthermore it tackles the dynamic rollercoaster which is marriage, good times and bad and how if two people really love each other they always come back to one another.

A delightfully peculiar and absolutely incredible I didn't watch a movie as awesome as this one for a very long time. EVERYTHING EVERYWHERE ALL AT ONCE! Was absolutely funny and amazing. This is the most fantastic movie I've seen in a very long time, but I was engrossed from beginning to end. The tale is intriguing, and the visuals are amazing. Those who enjoy American absurdist comedy-drama films should absolutely see it! A movie about a Chinese immigrant finds herself involved in a crazy adventure. You should watch this movie and then get your friends to do the same. We need more movies like this.

I liked this movie. Really nice editing, production design, acting, creativity, costume design and cinematography. It was fun to watch and engaging. That being said, it was a little forgettable. Maybe it's because the story is too predictable, the lessons too cliched and the character arcs too overused. It comes down to discovering the importance of relationships through magic (in this case universe jumping). From It's a Wonderful Life to Turning Red, it's been done over and over. The bottom line is, this movie is cool looking, fun to watch and pretty funny while not leaving a lasting impression on the viewer. It's a good picture but far from the Best Picture.

There were times when the human got a little too silly, and even gross. I could have done without the sausage fingers or the fight scene with the trophies, for instance.If it weren't for those bits, this would have been a 10, but it took me out of the deep thoughts and major feels. My wife thought it was disgusting and wanted to stop watching a movie that she otherwise enjoyed.

Where to start with this masterpiece!!! You laugh hard, you cry loud, you think deep and you get a visual array. I still don't know what this movie was about but I can tell you what it's about! Family values, personal strengths and hurdles, heart ache, love story, fantasy and journey. This is what the world needs after covid, something that pushes the boundaries of all things left and right with balance. People and friends have asked me what is it about and the only answer I give, and in awe, is - "Everything Everywhere All at Once." A - MAY - ZING.

reviews.review_title: Ok to watch on streaming channel
reviews.content: I won't exactly say it's overrated.Firstly because I didn't read much of the online reviews. Merely knew that many considered the movie quite favorably. The narration of some symbolic themes was something new to take in, so I can't say I had wasted my time.It was ok to watch overall despite not really being able to relate to some of the humor (sausage fingers and the butt powered theatrics) and events.Not really keen on recommending a second watch but if you are interested in revisiting the philosophical take, it's alright too. No need to feel weird or uneasy.Enjoy the humor, the dramatic gestures, and the everything everywhere all at once family reunion.

reviews.review_title: Quite simply the best movie ever made.
reviews.content: Maybe there are comedies funnier. Maybe there are dramas more emotional. Maybe there are sci-films more intriguing, or action films more thrilling. But no other film in existence does them "all at once" quite like this. If you've ever felt plagued by lack of meaning in your life, or burdened by existentialism - Daniel Kwan has blessed you with an antidote. Enjoy.

reviews.review_title: One of the Best Multiverse Films
reviews.content: Something I thoroughly enjoyed about this film is that amongst all of these fight scenes and action there is a grounded storyline, a clear lesson, something to take away from that movie. Many action films released as of late lack substance, which gives the action no meaning or emotion, leading the audience to become disinterested. I had heard very positive reviews about this film, people saying that after they had watched it they believed it to be their new favourite film. I enjoyed this film, it was imaginative, created and portrayed the idea of the multiverse in a way that I had never seen before. This film uses editing, costume, and colour, effectively, in a number of ways to tell this story in the best way it could.The choreography in the fight scenes were fantastic and even highlighted this film's creativity, executed in such an elegant fashion to where the movements of a character is seamless, effortless yet still convincing enough to a degree that matches this film's tone, in terms of realism. Furthermore the cinematography, together with the composition and use of levels in this film, specifically the use of push ins, created and maintained that cinematic and exciting feeling needed in scenes of action or even emotion. The story of this film touches on many themes and subjects, such as: coming of age, finding yourself, and even having pride in who you are. This relatable storyline of a parent raising their child would gravitate to the majority of the audience, from either the parent or child's perspective. Because ultimately the story is the most important component of a film, the quality of a story absolutely cannot be hidden by an excess amount of CGI or acting, which doesn't apply to this film at all.The acting of this was great, comedic and gave me a sense of Back to The Future with the actors playing themselves across different time periods, or in this case universes within the multiverse. I want to mention a specific moment where lighting/ colouring further immersed me in the film which is where The mother and her husband are staring into each other's eyes in her moment of realisation, there are an array of lights shining on both of their faces which could be interpreted as a representation of their feelings to be the rekindled optimism and realised affection. It could also be a method to show all of the multiverse in chaos and prosperity, contradicting the nature of this scene to be soured by one feeling; love. I believed the ending to this film to be perfect, it shows that although life may continue as it always has, your entire life would have completely changed, being more reassured, and happy with your life. I thought the dialogue was written very well, and thinking about it the entirety of this film could be a metaphor for this relationship between the mother and daughter, as well as, this period of change they are both going through at different ages. This film teaches the audience to be grateful for the place you are in, rather than wishing you were this or that, or wondering 'what if?', learning to be happy and embracing change whenever it may hit you in life.

This is the best movie of 2022 for me so far. I'm saying that and I've watched Multiverse of Madness, The Northman, X, The Bad Guys, Sonic 2, and some good ones. From the first minute it hooked me and it just keeps getting better and better. I feel interested and mesmerized each time. I love the incredible acting of each of the cast especially the daughter and the father.I just don't like some of the sexual jokes as it felt off. The movie also should have been shorter. The movie dragged on near the end and my enthusiasm since the beginning of the movie vanished.Overall it was an amazing experience. Amazing visual effects and I'm glad that it didn't flop at the box office.

I simply can not rate this film highly enough. From the bizarre, yet hilarious, sense of humor to the exquisite over the top action scenes this film simply excels in everything it attempts. It's difficult to categorize just what this film is exactly about: Is it about American-Asian mother daughter interpersonal relationships? Is it about how we handle our own trauma and pass it along to our children? It is about hilarious riffs on a variety of genre movies?Yes. It is about all of the above and so very much more. In an age where Marvel comic book movies seem to define the big screens, this movie stands out as a reminder of whet the media used to be and could be still. The movie quite literally made me laugh and made me cry. I can't recall the last time a movie did that.Just be kind to yourself and go see this movie.
Deep, loving, action, a lot of universe!. It never bores me. I believe this is a better multiverse than what the recent doctoe strange madness brought. Strange and wierd.

I love it when a writer takes an idea, considers the many and varied consequences of it and weaves a story around it that captures the imagination of its audiences and forces you to watch it through to a conclusionFor me that's what Everything Everywhere, All at once does.When you can get over the absurdity of the premise, which is served up piecemeal as the seemingly banal scenario of a failing launderette plays out in the beginning you'll be rewarded by the beauty of its execution, the hysterical outcomes and finally, the deep, deep, deeeep phylosophy its grounded inAbsolutely brilliant.

reviews.review_title: Felt levitating watching it and had an amazing euphoric experience
reviews.content: I am too lazy to write reviews on every good movie that I watch, but this one is the very few that deserves to write a review about. First off, this movie is a perfectly timed release; a blessing gift for the post-pandemic era. This movie was damn brilliant; one of the most unique, complex and beautifully crafted movies I've watched in a very long time. On a technical level, this movie is a masterpiece; I felt levitating watching it and had an amazing euphoric experience.It has a phenomenal screenplay, embodies multiple genres and it balances everything. It was overwhelming from the beginning, moving, had a ridiculous twisting plot and it was terrific, beautiful, funny, emotional and deep with a perfect ending.As soon as it ended, I told my movies buddy I needed to take a break to have it sink in before we talk about it. Then, we started talking and found it very complicated at the beginning but simple at the end, detailed and scattered at the beginning but wisely connecting the dots at the end and as we kept thinking, we soon noticed the depth of the message this movie conveys. It kept us engaged at every scene, we were laughing, we were crying, and thinking and it had incredible levels of emotions with some heart-warming moments. Michele Yeoh has delivered an Oscar-deserving act and the supporting cast has done an amazing job.It is my top 2022 recommendation, go watch and you will thank me.

I suspect that if you 'get' this film, you'll love it. If you don't 'get' it, you'll find it quite painful to watch. I didn't get it.Yes, it's an assault on the senses and those describing it as an acid trip are likely quite correct. But for me, those are not positive qualities.

I went and saw it in theatres and I was a bit young when it initially came out but still loved the movie. It has such a mind boggling theme too it that you are always questioning everything all at once. Plot was easy to follow if you are paying attention, and felt like a physiological challenger. Now that I look back on it I hear "this is a life" everytime I think about the possibility of what could have been in my life. I would love to rewatch the movie but don't have prime and I also feel that I would get more emotional the second time watching than the first. The full circle moment of just peacefully living doing laundry and taxes fills every part of my heart that it could possibly have filled. I will forever love this movie as it made me mature and I find myself questioning everything, everywhere all at once now.

I find this movie Highly overrated, I had big expectations due to the 8+ rate. But after having watched the movie for half an hour I got bored already. The first scenes are pretty good, the introduction, the family and the busy chaos is drawing you into the movie but when the multiverse thing starts it is getting bad, the movie itself becomes a chaos with tacky and cheap scenes which make no sense at all. This movie is from that moment onwards really a mess and especially the fragmented and bad storytelling makes that I lost interest. I find this movie worth no more than a 4. Also I regret to have spend al, that money for the tickets.

And low budget meaning - they saved on every possible aspect of a movie - plot, story line, dialogues, acting, consistency, logic, while being generous with fight scenes, ridicoulous costumes and scenery, 'vilians' for sake of having vilians so somebody can fight, you name it.And it narows down to family relationships and dynamics that could be placed in completely different context and without unnecessary accelerated shots, multivereses (and interesected with slow motion fight scenes).All in all, it looks like super long SNL skit, and not a funny one.

That is what it really is in actuality.Nevertheless, the acting, the music, the visuals are all top notch despite its ridiculousness.A movie that can make you cry & also feel stupid at the same time. Some side stuff promoting lesbians & bdsm.This is coming from someone that is not particularly interested in family drama & teenage/young adult genre.If you're used used to reading comics/manga/animation & a movie enthusiast, you would probably not be blown away by this movie as much as the hype would suggest.My mistake was going into the movie with very high expectations. Regardless of that, I still enjoyed it though at the same time felt bothered.

This movie is.something else, it is a cinematic experience over anything else but the realisation and acting are all top notch.Reading the rfeviews I can see why there so few people rating is average since it is either a 10 because you understood what the movie is about (it is NOT a comedy or a sci-fi movie) and will rate it 9 or 10 and the people who just did not get it and give it a 1 or 2.If you rated this movie 1 or 2, you're just not ready, that's fine you might get it rewatching it in a few years hopefully because when you do this is one hell of a ride!

This film is pure art. Michelle Yeoh is incredibly wonderful, and I believe she should be nominated for Best Actress for her portrayal. You will be amazed, you will chuckle, and you may even drop a tear or two. The action is also excellent. In a world when you believe you've seen it all, this utterly off the rails treasure shows you that there is still some creativity left in the world. Michelle Yeoh, the writers, the director, and the rest of the actors have a lot to be proud of with this film.One of the oddest films to begin with, but the three-part act of everything everywhere at once is one of the most authentic, original, and heartfelt films of the year, if not ever. The supporting cast is fantastic, but no one can compete with Michelle Yeoh as the powerhouse that she is. As a sci-fi lover, it is unusual to come across such a mind-bending premise paired with such an emotionally gripping tale. I couldn't get a certain timeline- noir-esque, fuzzy, rainy- out of my thoughts for weeks after watching. Laundry doesn't seem so horrible now.

The best thing about this film is its quirkiness and its visual inventiveness. It works very well at the level of comedy and surrealist science fiction. However, the core of the story is a family drama which is absolutely shallow and cliche. The characters become omniscient demigods putting at risk the existence of the multiverse due to them being hung up on daddy/mommy issues. And at the end, everything is resolved by the characters simply telling one another how much they love each other and how good life can be if we are optimistic. I kid you not, half of this film is an over the top melodrama, with the philosophical climax of a tumblr post. The movie takes itself too seriously, and drops all the fun of the multiverse for the sake of a generic "heroine beats bad guys with the power of love" action and some LGBT positivity message.And did I mention how many dildos, butt-plugs and BDSM jokes appear for no reason?

High concept, faced paced and thrilling are accurate words for Everything, everywhere all at
Once. This movie feels like CRANK with Jason Stratham; once the plot begins, the viewer better hold on. A roller coaster of emotions, but none so powerful as the climax. It's easy to relate to every single one of the characters. This movie will enlighten the audience whether the movie's message is revealed or not. Amazing acting from the leads, with undeniably humorous moments. Absolutely worth a watch and post discussion with friends and family.

reviews.review_title: One of the greatest films I've ever watched
reviews.content: Wow, this film is truly magnificent. The meaningful messages it carries and the way they deliver them is brilliant. Even though the film runs for over 2 hours there isn't one moment where you as the viewer is bored or feels as though it is slogging along. 10/10, watched it once and I think it's already in my top 5 favourite films of all time.

Unlike Shunichirô Miki's wild passion project Asatte no mori (2011) that was perhaps produced just for his personal viewing and a select few film festivals. EEATO is just as bonkers, but it's clear in its objective, and was made for everyone. This film deserves it's own rollercoaster at a theme park. Crazy it is 140mins long.. I can't remember taking a breath. It's as original and clever as you can get in 2022. Crouching Tiger, Hidden Pinkie Finger. Just give me Ke Huy Quan young or old, all at once.

reviews.review_title: Not for people looking for a serious logical slow movie
reviews.content: This movie is fast, it goes full throttle at the beginning and it never stops I understand how some people may be confused about it I can see my dad not understanding a single scene in this movie for example and call it rubbish but that is the case only for people that are just not capable of understanding or absorbing the randomness of this movie, not that it has a complicated plot, it is simply too random, and some people like random, some people don't, it's fine.If you don't like random, skip this one it will be a 5/10 at most for you, if you do get ready for one hell of a ride, 8.5/10 for us.

I found the film to be very lengthy and would have preferred to leave the cinema earlier. The plot was just done on artful, but there was nothing behind it. The pseudo-philosophical interpretations could have been brought across better than these constantly repetitive and boring scenes. You could hardly build a relationship with the characters. The emotions were completely absent.

reviews.review_title: What is happening with these reviews?
reviews.content: I was really looking forward to this movie based on early reviews and I have never been so disappointed and confused by the end of a film. This movie starts off really promisingly,solid character work and an intriguing plot. Then everything goes off the rails at around the 1 hour mark. This seems to be the main praise from all the 9/10 star reviews, but I have to ask whether these people enjoyed what they were watching, or simply want to support creative cinema despite how watchable it is. Im all for expression and out of the box ideas, but the narrative completely falls apart by the last 30 minutes, recycling the same "epiphany" type scene over and over again until the point of complete boredom. Iv never wanted a film to end more whilst being in the cinema as I was so frustrated and burnt out by the end.

reviews.review_title: this is the worst movie I have ever seen
reviews.content: This movie is extremely stupid and extremely pretentious at the same time. The humor in this movie is stuff like eating boogers and sticking things in your butt (the humor in this film seems very aimed at preschoolers. Like 4 and 5 yr olds) to gain superpowers and then there's this alternative dimension where people have hot dog fingers and it keeps bringing that gag back over and over. There is this daughter that becomes a nihilist for reasons that don't make any sense of you think about it for a few seconds (assuming your brain hasnt gone numb at that point in the movie) and she tries to suck the universe into an everything bagel. An "everything" bagel.... womp womp... the movie thinks it's very clever but it's actually just very cringe-worthy.The fight scenes are very poorly done. The movie is incredibly ugly looking (shooting the entire thing in an office building definitely doesn't help). The narrative of the family completely fails to tie in to all the multiverse crap. This is by far the dumbest movie about multiverses.The raccoon joke and the fanny pack fight were the only funny things in the movie. Other than that it was a grueling cringe fest that went on way too long and failed to tie together the drama with multiverse and Matrix powers and the booger eating. Very poor narrative that was very poorly explained in the movie. The scene where the husband has to explain the premise is so poorly written that they had to spread it out over several scenes when it was completely unnecessary. Everything about this movie is sloppy.This movie is nominated for a bunch of oscars which just shows you how pathetic the Oscars is now. Who actually watches the Oscars anymore anyway? If you still watch that garbage, I pity you.

This movie literally evokes every single emotion in such a beautiful way. Overall the cinematography is amazing!!! It gives a great look into generational trauma while also being hilarious at parts and later switching to a more heartfelt, emotional journey. The whole theatre went from collectively laughing to sniffling trying to hold in cries. Would definitely watch again!

reviews.review_title: Best movie I've seen in years
reviews.content: This is an absolutely must watch that I've been telling all of my family and friends about non stop. The plot was spot on, just the right amount of comedy, a extremely well developed and thought out multiverse. I wouldn't be surprised if this were to win movie of the year.

Ohh WTH did i just watch. This is a really heavy movie to finish. There are a lot of things happening throughout the movie. It's actually the multiverse of madness.I don't know where to start. But one thing i am gonna say is you might actually not like the movie but you would appreciate what they have done with it.I just wanna say kudos to the directors of the movie. It's really not an easy movie to make and they handled it pretty well. There are so so many scenes to shoot and edit & add & they actually did it and they deserve all the praise.In the end all i will say is watch and decide if you wanna like it or not,but appreciate it.

How do you think that we will suffer an unjustified setback in the generations.. Well, in your opinion, we are turning into worse than we expected.. The solution is not to live with what we see as abnormal.. We must solve our problems without looking for lust.

Journey from trying to find what you love, to trying to love what you find :-)
Imagination, beauty, questions about self and existence, and realization of it, magically weaved into a wacky story.Never easy to bring a refreshing take on this topic without saying what has already been said or done before, hence this is truly well achieved, this was refreshing, funny as well as thought provoking.Michelle Yeoh is just amazing, I grew up watching her, so it's always a pleasure see her again, cannot imagine this movie without her. And so goes for rest of the cast.Need more of this, art of serious reflection without being serious 😊

reviews.review_title: Best picture science fiction movie for the first time!
reviews.content:
Where do I start?I could write a lot of words who could try to the describe this movie but I can assure you that I wont
Succeed.I will start with the most significant saying.This movie changed everything that I taught about science fiction movies.I always assume that although science fiction movies are fun to watch it will never give me feelings or will get the impact that a drama movie will give me but this movie is the evidence that this stereotype, about science fiction movies, is wrong.It's funny that although the plot looks so tricky and complicated at the end the plot describe something very simple (or actually more complicated), mother and daughter relationship and add some generation gap for the twist, yeah probable the meaning of the universe is simpler than that topic.Beyond the magnificent plot we have the two main role actors.Both of them gave us an outstanding performance
And even made me pour some tears at the end.I have to say that in my opinion the actor who played the dad will get an Oscar for his performance.

reviews.review_title: Being John Malkovich meets Crazy Rich Asians
reviews.content: Finally a movie that has restored my faith in the movie industry. Best movie I've seen in a theater in 20 years.Any movie that puts a 59 year old Chinese speaking actress in the lead role of an action movie in definitely willing to take risks.It is the most absurd, entertaining, thought provoking, Meta, truly original movie to come out in this century.

Stunning images. But in the end this film has far too much of everything while it would benefit from just a little bit of good old storytelling. It is so colorful, fast and full of incredibly creative details that you will definitely feel dizzy after 2 hours and 40 minutes of massive non-stop brain stimulation. Make a wise decision when choosing snacks and drinks before watching it.However, everyone who likes martial arts movies should watch "everything everywhere all at once". It probably takes this genre to a completely new level. That said, it's actually pretty impossible to place this movie into a particular genre.

1 - An absolute stinker of a film, with no
redeeming features. It's unlikely that any film will
receive this score.2 - Oh, not great at all. Amongst the worst films
ever made.3 - I won't be back, and am less than pleased
I've just spent time watching this.4 - Very poor effort. Struggled through.5 - Mediocre. Nothing special at all, but not
completely unbearable.6 - Tries hard. On its way to worthwhile.7 - Solid viewing. Can't complain - would
recommend.8 - Cracking. Enjoyed immensely. But it takes a
lot to get 9.9 - It takes a lot to get 9.10 - An absolute banger of a film. Couldn't be
better. It's unlikely that any film will receive this
score.Home.

This movie was none of the things I thought it would be. Completely beyond me how this is receiving high ratings.It's all over the place related to the rules it establishes for it's universe. Without spoiling anything there is no way you could randomly evoke an instance of yourself with specific sets of skills. It would take a million tries but with this... no.If you put even the slightest thought into this it falls apart.The other thing is they often go quite low brow with the humor and its usually not very funny. I did laugh a few times at random but most of the bits missed me.

Absolutely Balderdash. Everyone's recently trying to join the multi-verse bandwagon... no harm done if it is properly executed. In case of this movie it is very poorly executed. It's a complete waste of time I feel. I really don't know how this movie got so many positive reviews. It is just total chaos.

reviews.review_title: Kung Fu Hustle meets the Matrix.
reviews.content: This one had me laughing from the comedic timing, giggling with delight at the fight scenes and crying towards the end. Michelle Yeoh and Jamie Lee Curtis are amazing as always. Ke Huy Quan's comedy timing and fight scenes are outstanding. I'm ready to see it again.

This is clearly one of the most overrated movie going and thus a huge let down. The movie is only barely watchable because of a great performance by Michelle Yeoh, otherwise it would be a flop. Watch it but wait until it's available for free.With so many "best movie" ever type reviews attempting to drive home the exact same point, it is very much suspected most are bots or those trying to monetize the film.The Good: Michelle Yeoh turns in an award worthy performance. Kudos to other cast members for keeping up with her.The Bad: Thd film is overly complex, cold at times and an assault on the senses . It gets lost in the weeds mid way through and ultimately takes the writers over 2 hours to tell you what you should be feeling as a human. Fail! Ultimately the film overstays its welcome.If you like indie style films this "may" appeal to you. However, if you want to sit back, relax and just be entertained there are better options available.

reviews.review_title: The trailer was far better than the movie, but sums it up fine, confused? You will be!
reviews.content: A few funny moments, some Scifi inspired elements, and insane violent action scenes that distracts you from the deeper meaning, if any. You can always find some lessons from certain parts, but you have to do the whole work yourself.If a movie has to be explained and be watched with a guide to be able to follow it and get it, then I don't care to watch it.I like to watch a movie where we have to figure out things and they don't overexplain every detail, but here I got the impression that the more confusing the made it the better they felt it would be, like the whole goal was to only be artistic yet pointless.I felt a huge let down from a over hyped movie, I expected some universal qualities and didn't find then, when the movie finished it was a strong anti climax, just wasted an evening with that nonsense.

With the. Eccentric theme it gives important messages for modern life dillemmas. It is attainable to.make inferences like multiverse is sc fi of the post truth era, and movie delivers modeest view to deal with that mass. I think message was original and simple and not reluctant. Found myself in between mother and daughter (even I am man), it was not clear to which side is the appealing one.It combines a lot of movies, and yet protects its originality love that.The lgbt thing is not bothersome at this form (form that creates conflict not just normalization thing) . Another thing politically correct holywood movies makes a rule that no man can hit to any woman soo I cut one star because of that kept. Yet character growth is was well written.

This movie made me laugh and cry! It was beautiful. The acting was amazing and scenes that out of context are bizarre were truly gut wrenching. Often times there are movies I love that I know a friend would loathe but I can't picture this movie not being beloved by anyone. Harry Shum Jr crushed it his role.

The fact this movie has such a high rating makes me wonder how so many people thought this was a good movie. Did we even watch the same film?The highlight of the movie is the ending (it's not great but at least there is a positive message) but everything else is just not good. The over the top aspects littered all in the movie just didn't do it for me. I'm not opposed to weird things and odd stuff happening as long as it makes sense or at least enhances the movie. This movie just had weird and, to me, very corny and cartoony things happening that made the movie feel lame and not intelligent, which a complex storyline should have. Just putting weird stuff for the sake of it doesn't make it work well and doesn't make the movie good.I went into the movie not hearing about it from anyone who had seen it so I guess my expectations of the direction they were going to go was not in the right mindset. There were even a few parts that probably would have been funny if I wasn't so unimpressed with this film and that I spent over 2 hours on another movie that is hyped up and again was not good.I give it 4 stars just because it is creative and the directing must have been difficult with so many odd things changing and happening all at once. But that is really being generous because I just didn't like the movie. The basis had potential but I think the director just really fell short on his delivery of concept. And if that is what the writers were going for then I am surprised people wanted to make it.

Simply an astonishing masterpiece. The perfect multiverse movie. Kudos to the actors and production team.I mean what an amazing performance by the actors, just incredible to carry it through with so many different versions of themselves as characters.This is a MUST SEE movie for anyone and everyone.

I've watched a lot of good movies over the years. I have watched a decent amount of great movies as well. I have watched very few perfect movies, and this is one of them. From the opening scene I was hooked. The characters were so beautifully written that you fall in love with them instantly, especially Waymond. It starts out by introducing us to Evelyn, Waymond, their daughter Joy, and their laundromat. They have some issues with their taxes and have to report to an IRS examiner. From the moment they arrive at the examiners office and sit at the desk the movie changes genres completely. It goes from a movie about a small business owner and taxes to a fantastic sci-fi adventure. It's a lot to take in all at once, but that's what makes it even more interesting. We are thrown straight into the adventure just like Evelyn is. Boy, what an adventure. I won't go into detail, because honestly it's too much to explain. Behind all of the amazing special effects, action sequences, and hilarious jokes, this film is a wonderful story about family and appreciating the little things. Watching this film helped me to realize how much I have to be thankful for. It impacted me enough to make me reevaluate myself and I think that makes this a perfect film.

"When I choose to see the good side of things, I'm not being naive. It's strategic and necessary."I believe this line carries the entire message of the movie - optimism does not equal naivity.This movie does more than just giving us thrills and laughts. It also teaches us how we should think of our lives. You may believe that alternate universes do exist. You may think that our lives are pointless because we could have lived in any of these universes and lived through all the ups and downs. The movie tells you that you are wrong.We humans possess a natural instinct to render positive meaning to what we sense. That is why everything we have experienced seems to be real. Think about dreams. When you are having a dream, you never realize that you are dreaming regardless of what you see inside the dream. It is this very instinct that makes life possible. We take our life seriously and try to make the best of it because we believe it to be positive, real, and worth-living, otherwise there is no way we can survive.It does not really matter whether the world we live in is actually real. In a Matrix-sense way of thinking, we may all live in a virtual reality and everything we feel is nothing more than electrical signals in the brain. What matters is that even inside this virtual reality we can render meaning to our lives and treat it as if it is real. This is the persistence of the survival instinct - it drives us to secure the best ourcome in whatever circumstances we find ourselves. It is this spirit that makes us human beings.Next time when someone calls you naive because your are being optimistic, tell them you are not being naive.

reviews.review_title: REPLACED MY ALL TIME FAV MOVIE KILL BILL COLLECTION
reviews.content: This is a must watch and you will love. Its hilarious and conceptually amazing. Very artistic movie matter and gives you many realizations to great storyline mixed with hilarious emotions. Throughout the movie I felt like my mind was awakened. I hope the creator puts out more work because we need content like this in the 'universe' :)

reviews.review_title: Disappointing -- good message buried in MOUNDS of rubble.
reviews.content: Serious disappointment. Considering the cast drawn together for this film, It had such potential, especially considering the concept behind the story. It takes a grand concept and falls victim to the challenge of trying to do everything everywhere all at once. If you're familiar with the movie "Up", just imagine "squirrel" distractions 96% throughout the film. There is an element in the movie the characters seek to avoid (unless you've been drawn in and then they are driven towards it: a bagel - yes a bagel. Mushrooms would have served better because consuming bagels before making a movie never ended so badly. The story -- the core of it -- could have been relayed in about 12 minutes. The rest was belabored. The acting was notable, especially by Quan. Hsu and Yeoh have the standout moments as well where they either are on mark or draw you in to the story, but this movie is ridden with so much that weighs it down -- who knew fluff could be so heavy?? Do yourself a favor and go buy a bagel instead - don't get sucked in. Either that or eat some mushrooms (not recommended) and make your own movie... it can't be any worse.

reviews.review_title: Trying to hard to be deep
reviews.content: I don't understand the hype. It's confusing and trying to be so deep that it doesnt make sence. Its the perfect movies for hipsters trying to be cool and tell you " its to deep you wont get it" and talk about utter nonsence for an hour. Its underwelming experience.

reviews.review_title: Very very very Random, Weird, Funny and Wholesome Film
reviews.content: The first part of the film is fast paced, very random and weird. But in the second part, events took an unexpected turn. The film suddenly makes you question your purpose on life. You realize that the universe is immensely vast and nothing matters. Then the film strikes the final blow and your heart is filled with emotions.Easily one of the best films I have ever watched. The creators were very successful in reflecting the soul of 2020s. This film is like a full feature film version of the popular videos titled "Never let them know your next move".Quirkiness of this film may not be for everyone, but I think everyone must watch this film. 10/10.

reviews.review_title: I REGRET WATCHING SUCH NONSENSE WASTE OF TIME!
reviews.content: I came from the future to save your time. Avoid watching such garbage. It's for your good. I just finished the movie to know how it ends. Otherwise I should have stopped from the early 20-30minutes.

When Dr Strange Into The Multiverse came out, reviews kept popping up on YouTube saying "Everything Everywhere All at Once is the better multiverse movie " so we were really excited to watch it. I like the multiverse concept, love Michelle Yeoh, James Hong, & Jamie Lee Curtis, it sounded perfect.It *was* entertaining, and quite fast paced. But it was just too weird. No it wasn't confusing, it was quite funny & quirky, but ultimately a little too bizarre for me. This had more heart than Dr Strange M. O. M. Though.I think the best multiverse film that I've seen is Into The Spider verse.8.0/10, B.

That was one of the most different things that i saw in my life. It had so many new colors and shapes.the fantasy in this movie was so different (i mean joy put everything in a bagel that's so silly ) from other fantasies or universes that i saw i really recommend this movie cause it was new experience for me and i guess for many people and it made me to think about new things in my life like how is my life in other universes or what decisions I've made on those worlds.

reviews.review_title: Great emotional beats, but for many just too weird.
reviews.content: Overall I did not love this movie, but the strong emotional ending and ambitious story telling was enough to pull me to a positive review. I thought the hotdog fingers and everything bagel were a bit much, and the villain was uninteresting for me as well. Overall a movie that will get bombarded with negative reviews if it makes it to the general public but if you are a movie lover, this one is worth checking out.

Plenty to froth about here. It's a movie you know for sure will have many mixed opinions. A cocktail of movie genres in one. Die hard action fans will love the action and scratch their heads on everything else. Comic fans will drool with a staring gaze until they choke on a hilarious scene. Romantics and those seeking emotion will find it here , just have to wait till the final 20 minutes or so . Personally, thoroughly enjoyed it. I would put it in my top 5 for 2022. I found some deep moments I related to and I'm sure at one point or another everyone will find a deep connection somewhere at least once as it touches on such a broad spectrum of life experiences.

reviews.review_title: Now this is how cinema should be!
reviews.content: Like it's own Chinese name: "horses flying in the sky". Which is a mandarin idiom that shows unlimited imaginations and absurdity, so is this film.It's been a long time I had ever watch a film with like pure talent of imaginations, not just in settings or plot, but also in cinematography and the use of sound! After watching so many mainstream films nowdays, I had already forgot that cinema is actually a form of art. And this film, it shows us how creative cinema should be.However, after the unlimited amount of hustle and bustle in the film, the main theme of the story root into the theme that most commonly talk, but everyone has been missing out in normal life: love.The main character is a pure loser in the start of the film, in crisis of divorce with her husband, having a rebel daughter, a father who disappointed in her, and of course: unlimited amount of taxes.... If you ever live in this kind of world, you might be wonder what's it like to live in the other live, where you can make a different decision that might lead you to a better life.But what if all you can do is just loving what you had now? Like take a good care to people surround you? Take a good look at the washing machines that you had been bothered to see everyday? Instead of wasting time to regret your decisions in life, which lead to a more regretful life.This is definitely a film you should watch as early in your life as possible.

Absolutely amazing film, and probably the most original I've ever seen! It's humor, storytelling, cinematography, and raw emotion are on point. At certain points, the whole theater was laughing. I was surprised at how the movie was so chaotic and all over the place, yet managed to pull everything together so neatly to create a fantastic piece. Especially as an Asian American, it was so relatable and moving as well. This film didn't just feel like a story, but an emotion, and I absolutely loved every moment of it. Truly a work of art.

This is one of the best science fiction movies of this year. Unlike so many other mind bending movies(which I totally enjoy) they have tried to keep the concept very simple and easy to grasp. Direction is just amazing, be it fignting scenes or Psychedelic jumps between multiple realities. Every single person has done a fabulous acting, there isn't a single character that I didn't like. A must watch for all the science fiction fans, you will definitely enjoy it.

Wherever , whenever there is a movie or any piece of art , you meet those guys that pretend to be know it all , nothing impresses them , just negative vibes , THE MOVIE IS GREAT , by watching it you ll feel satisfied , for me , thats the most important , and let the critics who got paid to just criticize do their jobs .

reviews.review_title: Lovely piece of art ! Fantastic movie.
reviews.content: I enjoyed this movie a lot because it really does resonate with how I feel with life. It also plays to the phrase you can't runaway from your problems regardless of how short the distance or how vastly extensive the multiverse is.Just also want to praise the entire cast as they were all amazing. It felt like everything hit too close to home and all of the stylistic choices and mix of drama, comedy and action were perfectly tailored to make this an instant favorite for me. 10/10.

This is what we call golden movie
in particularly the soundtrack is amazing.The editing the acting the Illusions the experience everything it's golden.I truly believe there is no movie better in 2022.

reviews.review_title: You get a lot of everything..
reviews.content: This movie offers everything.Loads of humour.. loads of meaning.. loads of symbolism.. loads of drama and emotion.. loads of beautiful visuals - just everything.Best movie of 2022 and certainly belongs in IMDB top 100 hall of fame. Score is currently way too low.

reviews.review_title: This is only based on the first
reviews.content: 1 hour and watching it at home I have to say this is the kind of movie that happens when people take too many drugs. Maybe in the second hour going to begin to make more sense but as of right now I have no idea what's going on. Yes it is very creative I can see why people might think it's a wonderful movie but I just don't grasp it's meaning.

reviews.review_title: WOW, just woww, NEAR PERFECTION!!! TikTok kids (won't understand it
reviews.content: This movie is nearly flawless. Great acting, story, stunning visual effects. Sorry to hurt some of those who didn't understand the movie and gave it low rating because their IQ is only mtach for TikTok videos and content. Also for those who just gave it 1 or below 5 they mostly and simply didn't watch the movie.

I might have enjoyed this movie a bit more. As it was, they are not. And I did not... enjoy this.It's a mess! It really is everything, everywhere, all at once. But it's one of those movies where it seemed the shoom rip fell off and they tried to remain edgy. Until it reached a point quite beyond "Really? This is not an organic mind altering/expanding experience."Maybe the people just failed to properly translate their trip. Like a song in a dream. Or like when I actually was able to translate my dream songs they ended up sucking quite badly.In any case, this experience failed for me. But the core message was nice. However, a majority of the theater left mid-show this time. And I had no questions on why.In IMDB, 6.x means something to see, if not memorable. This - for me - was not a slight fail, but a rather big fail. So -2.

reviews.review_title: A movie about one girls journey to have her sexuality accepted by everyone, everywhere, all at once.
reviews.content: Yes...my description might seem extreme...but that is what this movie is about.Its actually a very symbolic depiction of what our generation is currently going through ...and what certain individuals are prepared to do if their "identity" is not only accepted ...but acknowledged by all...on their knees.That said...other than some rather extreme scenes involving plugs and other sex toys, the movie was certainly entertaining.Some great action, good acting, fantastic humour and also a very emotional story about being accepted and loved by the ones closest too you.This will not be a movie you will soon forget.

This is one of the best movies I've seen in a very long time. This movie is so creative I'm just lost in words. I highly recommend watching this movie especially with friend. It's worth watching. This movie had me going you want to regret it.

reviews.review_title: I went in with low/average expectations
reviews.content: And was completely surprised by just how good the movie was.Every joke landed, every emotional moment felt touching, and the message came across as meaningful without being patronising.Highly recommended.

reviews.review_title: Just give it all the Oscars already
reviews.content: I mean, when you think this movie can't get any more crazy, it just does.The story is amazing, original, deep, moving, hilarious, boinkers, endlessly entertaining.The 2h19m run time is just too short. Or maybe it is just perfect?Just watch it!I can't remember when I watched a movie this good before.

Wow. Wow wow. I have seen this in theaters over 4 times and I still laugh, cry and feel every emotion possible every time. Michelle Yeoh and Jamie Lee Curtis better be Oscar contenders this year. This is one of my favorite movies ever made.

I see it goes over some people's heads, don't let that scare you. If you like intelligent funny movies then this movie is for you! The cast is just amazing the story is interesting and weird. Where Cloud Atlas was about reincarnation and taking itself seriously, this movie is about multiverses and not taking itself seriously. I wish there were more movies like this!

reviews.review_title: Title of the movie It's just so perfect for it!!!
reviews.content: I have to say this movie was really inspiring to me the acting was phenomenon,story was good,and the title of the movie was soo accurate, it deserves Oscar.

You know it's not massive acting talent. But I enjoyed this movie because it really provides some interesting perspectives on quantum reality. But moreover, the reflection on what's important is appreciated. People, love and family are always more important than any quantum reality. Like they say, "nothing matters." But ironically, the movie highlights the importance of being together, loving and accepting each other as we are. In the multiverse, there is a version of you that has done everything you ever wanted and dreamed of. So none of it really matters. But people and relationships do matter.

This movie was really fascinating and once in a lifetime experience. First of all, it's mesmerizing how the movie sets the mood from the beginning and maintains for the very end. Simultaneously, while the plot about the different universes and characters of the protagonist could be very confusing to the audience, it ends up being very easy to follow. Finally, the photography and the editing aspect of the movie is simply breathtaking!! The only negative thing is that you can't experience it the same way as the first time...

This movie is indisputably creative. It's been done by true cinematographers and only cinema could offer such an experience. The formal originality and the involvement of the actors are real and strong. But... and there is a but...The story is weak. You can try it from any angle and this movie beats a record in the number of angles used in any movie before, the story remains weak.Yes it makes sense in the end. Fortunately. Because the beginning is a happy mess. But when sense appears, the magic goes away.The movie is powerful. It has been carrying a lot of spectators and let them with a sense of joy and freedom in the end. But this joy and this freedom won't last because the movie will not reveal anything to each one of the spectators. And that is where its failure stands.In this, Everything Everywhere All at Once is not a masterpiece. It is an original take, for sure. But it misses it fails in revealing important things in people and in becoming timeless despite it really trying to.When reaching this level of formal achievement and creativity, I really hope the "Daniels" will improve on their depth and finally reach their goal someday.

reviews.review_title: One of the best movies I have ever seen
reviews.content: This is easily one of the best movies I have ever seen, definitely the best movie I have seen in the past few years.I try not to go into movies anymore with any sort of expectations as I've been let down quite a lot recently. I heard great things and decided that this would be a movie for me. I have never been so engaged in a movie as i was to Everything Everywhere All at Once.This movie should be regarded as art. It is so well done as a comedy with a sincere message that had me nearly sobbing at the end. Movies don't make me cry.I will forever cherish this movie and I recommend everyone give it a shot, even if the message doesn't come through to you, it's still a fun ride!

Don't think I've ever intermittently laughed so hard / cried so much while watching a movie before. Without a doubt one of the best movies I've seen in years. So many different layers and and so so much heart. What a masterpiece.

Really wanted to enjoy this, love this. But it crossed over the too silly to enjoy line a few to many times for me. Entertaining but forgettable which is a shame because the idea is really cool, wanting it to do the universe thing better than Marcel but ended short.

It's obvious that the movie's themes resonate with a lot of people - lost opportunities in life, bad choices, wanting to change everything, or destroy it all.I didn't relate to a lot of those themes personally, since these days I basically just go with OK, this is what you got into, so how do you move on from here? Yeah, there was a period where I looked back and reflected on a lot of things and how they could have been better, but whatever, time to move on now.Anyway, I do respect what the movie was trying to say, as chaotic as it was presented. The flipping around between multiverses reminded me most of "Cloud Atlas", but magnified tenfold.

I have formulated an overview on society today and what it embraces as deep, meaningful and true: the Emperor's New Clothes syndrome. This movie, and the multitude of praise and hype it has garnered, reflects just how shallow, sophmoric and unthinking our society has become. Some of the acting was good, but the pretentious premiss was totally lacking in coherence and credibility. It was, however, a nice assembly of costumes which in themselves might garner an Academy Award, but that would be about it. The amount of time and money put into the brief displays of costuming don't translate into the disjointed undeveloped plot, which boils down to nothing more than a display of bloody martial arts with lots of high-school-boy-humor. Even Michelle Yeoh couldn't transcend those low moments...which are pervasive if you sit back and analyze the proceedings.I felt no emotional connection with anyone in the film, despite the many tears milked in the hope that the audience would care enough about the characters to buy into them...which apparently a majority of reviewers did (!) Nothing deep or meaningful transpired in this movie...just the Emperor parading naked in front of his bamboozled subjects.

reviews.review_title: You either get it or you don't. I'm glad I did.
