reviews.content: If you don't get it, you'll hate it and you won't understand why anyone would love it. That's okay. It happens. Not everyone understands subtext or allegory.If you do get it, you're in for a masterpiece of absurdity, surrealism, existentialism, comedy and ultimately, humanism.This is one of the most insightful and realistic depictions of ADHD, depression and anxiety I've ever seen. Yes, I used the word realistic about a film where characters may have hotdogs for fingers, or they may be a cartoon or a rock. Because it's not supposed to be taken literally. Everything is subtext. Everything is a metaphor. Everything is an illustration of absurdity to make a point.The way this film handles the subject matter and delivers its message is a masterclass in using over the top silliness as a way to convey something subtle and nuanced.It's insanely creative and beautiful. It's one of the best films I've ever seen.

I love science fiction (plus other genres) and I understand the concept of multiple universes. I also understand human emotions and relationships. I don't watch a lot of movies so I was excited to sit down and watch one that was being reviewed well and sounded like something I would like. The movie started out promisingly for me and my partner, but as it went on, we became more and more disillusioned with the frantic nothingness of it. So much that was supposed to be "funny" was actually crude, cruel, violent, and sophomoric. The story line was simple yet still not well explained. The acting was not subtle or masterful. We watched the whole thing and in the end could not believe that this is a highly rated movie. This movie is an example of why I rarely watch award shows. Award shows are mostly the privileged patting each other on the backs. But I digress- this movie is not good. This movie is massively overrated, not because I didn't like it, but because it stinks. Every time I see a mention of it somewhere I get sick to my stomach- hotdog fingers, etc. Yuck!

Terrible movie, disappointed that I had to pay to rent it, reviews said it was great, far from it. Don't waste your time, money or energy.It drags around the same environment continually, for the first part of the movie, after a while I had to turn it off, it was going nowhere.

You would have to be a secret shifu to foresee that Evelyn, the middle-aged laundry woman, was about to be launched on a hero's journey arc in this kung fu-magical realism comedy. Everything, et.al. Is genius in defying expectations. Evelyn's is a journey of constant time leaps, martial arts spectacles, tasteless comedy, characters with alternating personalities, and uncountable weird planes of reality where our hero discovers and hones her unknown ability to master the multi-verse. Merging multi-genres, this unique movie has something for EVERYbody, sometimes to the point of exhaustion. By the end what glues the whole frantic mosaic together is its unexpectedly poignant message on the need to prioritize relationships and family.

I just finished watching this movie and I'm at a loss for words. I hadn't seen a good movie like this since 2019.The whole movie was awesome. The acting, the story, the production and the cast were just perfect.The whole movie was like an acid trip for me. Slowly building up and feeling amazing after a while and finally coming down slowly.It was just this perfect thing. I just made an account so I can rate this movie. Highly recommended.

It didn't shatter.First off, some of the best acting I've ever seen. Truly, it seemed so realistic for how bizarre and out of this world it was. All the characters, all the changes - it was seamless.This was a WILD ride as a whole. I've never really seen anything like this. The concept is amazing.However, the ending - as I alluded to above - just didn't break that ceiling. I can't really pinpoint why I feel that - it just felt like an epic movie that deserved an equally as epic ending. The ending was good - just.... Not what I expected. I never really felt the "evil" was really "evil" - just, there.All in all, it is absolutely worth the experience.

Let me start by saying that I loved all the actors! They really did a magnificent job with the material they had. Frankly, I wish I could see them more often in more movies because they are real good.I literally do not understand why this movie is considered as "great, amazing and revolutionary". It's really a disjointed story with no plot. Some even called it "eccentric"!, But it really reflects on today's moviegoers attention span to follow a story, or have patience on how it builds up. The way it was edited, it was almost like scrolling through Instagram!Wait until it streams save your money.

I give it one more star for being creative and trying something new but the film is disjointed, unfunny and cringy. I can't believe the reviews are so high for such a stupid movie that thinks it's better than it actually is.

reviews.review_title: Hilarious, Heartfelt, Relatable, ALL AT ONCE!
reviews.content: A truly incredible piece. Dan Kwan and Daniel Scheinert absolutely knock it out of the park with superb writing and fantastic direction and action that is just bonkers enough to make sense and yet imaginative enough to keep you thoroughly entertained.The movie is a fresh breath of air amongst the recently developing crowd of multiverse flicks. Never does it shy away from the weirdness or trying to offer complicated explanations which gives room to explore the core characters and the underlying story. This movie will leave you playing out your own What If scenarios in your head, and how the slightest decision can lead to drastic differences in life. Its not a new concept but never has it been explored from the perspective of a relatable story of an ordinary household with common problems which are very much at the heart of it all.The performances explore the widest range of emotions I have ever seen. Michelle Yeoh gives a career best performance in the role of Evelyn, who is trying to be a good Wife, Mother, Daughter and laundromat owner. Trying to be Everywhere, do Everything all on her own which later ties very well into the multiverse concepts. This is a character she plays to perfection and in my humble opinion is definitely worthy of an Oscar nomination at the very least if not a win. The support cast Stephanie Hsu (Joy) also gives a well layered performance. She flushes out the nuances of being different in a conservative family very well and beautifully channels the frustrations. Ke Huy Quan is also a great support.To sum it all up, the movie is Hilarious, Heartfelt and Relatable, ALL AT ONCE.

It's just amazing, i dont know what to say, im crying real hard
it's also telling the nihilsm nietzsche wants, when everythings dont matter anymore well, just do it, why should we care, keep moving forward and do what we want because it's doesn't matter anymore, it may be frightening, but go on and maybe we dont know what going on ahead, but still, be kind, values the others.And also, i really like how the movie telling us how a random things that happen everywhere in life can change everything.

This movie is the reason I believe Marvel movies and shows have been on the decline in recent history. This is not any better. All over the place with the jump cuts. Don't know why the theme of alternate realities is such a common theme these days. To each their own. I personally wish I watched something else with my time.

This is one of the best, most beautiful, most emotional films I have seen in recent years. Beyond Kung fu, beyond incredible special effects, beyond acting that's better than you would expect, you find pure emotion. You find the essence, you find the beauty, you find the secret of humanity. You even find the key to happiness, through simple acts. By simply listening to those around you. By simply trying to make others happy. And in my opinion, the 11 Oscar nominations are more than deserving! It is pure beauty, from start to finish.Or, of course, you can just see it as a martial arts film. The choice is yours.

reviews.review_title: Never knew SciFi could take such a 'familiar' turn
reviews.content: This movie has been hailed as a redefinition of the sci-fi genre, a masterfully crafted family drama, a visual eye candy, and all I can say is that this movie goes beyond these reviews. The cinematography is perfect, the score is lovely, the actors are at their best, and the theme makes this a mind bending, but wholesome family watch. This movie is a reminder for us to be kind, to be understanding and caring, and to be open to new possibilities. In today's environment, this message, which is beautifully and subtly (maybe not subtly) portrayed in this film, is crucial. Easily one of the best movies of the year.

What took longer i wonder, the making of this film or the editing?MichelleYeoh Jamie Lee Curtis and Stephanie Hsu were simply brilliant in this. Michelle Yeoh is amazing in whatever role she is given and is always a pleasure to watch.So many messages are in this movie..did you catch them all?

Sorry it's kind of a long review I apologize in advance.I'm not really sure how to get into explaining the deep thought put into the movie. The way I interpreted it may vary from your opinion of it. There are some parts that seem a little far fetched but the main idea behind the movie in my opinion more than makes up for the parts that seem to drift. It probably could have been delivered a little better in parts.A little more in-depth on my idea of the meaning of the movie.In my opinion the idea of the multiverse that exsists in this movie is something that differs from our current idea of the multiverse from Marvel as an example. I believe it's more of an idea of what you could have become had things been different in life and a way to connect with those lives, where things played out different. Just the idea behind that is intriguing to me.Overall a movie I would recommend you watch. But also go into it with an open mind and allow yourself to enjoy it.Thanks for taking the time to read my review....

reviews.review_title: Not out of good ideas just yet...
reviews.content: In the bevy of remakes, and remixes and sequels Hollywood pops out, there are still diamonds in that rough.This movie is in everyway an absolute diamond. It is a brilliant story of finding the shine in an ordinary life. And yet, it's told in a way that is visually engaging and so original, you almost forget what the point was.It's funny, it's weird, it's heartful, it's serious, it's amazing in that it strikes so many chords, and makes them all sing so wonderfully together. The casting, the script, and the performances simply make this a must watch for anyone dying to find something original to see.

I saw this on cinema and I cannot believe this movie has such a high rating. I went to see the movie because it was recommended by friends but I mean this is so silly, the whole idea is sooo silly. What's wrong with people nowadays, we had so many western flops that we ended up liking these terrible movies. My partner wanted to go before the film ended but until the end i tried to make it look good and i added as many positive comments as i could. This was a punishment, torment ment to punish you. The only feeling i felt after i left the cinema that day was disappointment and low energy. Have a good day.

I'll keep this short at to the point without any spoilers.The movie was so good it compelled me to write this review when I should be working, but this was good enough to impart a small reflection of this classic to be.This movie is a work of genius, a true masterpiece with a brilliant core message of the power of imparting kindness over violence. Of listening and understanding our place in the cosmos.The acting is flawless as is the casting. The visuals are absolutely mind blowing.As my review title states, the movie reminded me in part of the Matrix but better and yes, on an acid trip. I loved the action scenes and the humor throughout. It would be cool if they created a 3D version as well, but it's not needed.One of the best movies ever made in my opinion. Kudos to all involved. This is the pinnacle of cinema.

"Everything Everywhere All at Once", directed by the Daniels duo (they're both named Daniel get it?) is an interesting, if messy experiment that starts out promising but turns into a convoluted mess.Evelyn (Michelle Yeoh) runs a laundromat with her husband Waymond (an excellent Ke Huy Quan) and has a distant relationship with her ironically named daughter Joy (Stephanie Hsu). They are about to be audited by an IRS agent (a saucy Jamie Lee Curtis) when all of the characters seemingly enter a nonsensical "multiverse".The first 20 minutes are so solidly written and acted that I wonder what the final result would have been had if just abandoned the absurdist concept and presented a straightforward narrative instead. Of course, that's not what this filmmakers are trying to do, but at 140 minutes it wears it welcome quickly.While I do admire the film for it's originality, it becomes so entrenched in its own over the top silliness you almost wonder what the point of any of this is.

Eccentric, inventive, insane.I don't know how they convinced Michelle Yeoh and Jamie Lee Curtis into this one but so glad they did.Tight script, wonderful direction, majestic cinematography and art direction, story of a girl, a travel between multiverses of genres with HEART!Truly loved it!

I was all hyped up for this movie not gonna lie, I saw the trailer once and I was hooked I finally got to watch this movie and I can definitely say it is a good plot, nice story, great ending but for some reason it was boring. I watch movies a lot, even the classic ones but this movie for some reasons made me sleep. I don't sleep while watching movies.. I never sleep. This movie made me sleep twice, I wanted to give up but then like I said it's plot was good and I was all hyped up. All in all, watch this movie, I recommend it, it's nothing like what you've watched but then you better prepare to sleep.

For the first 1-2 acts of this movie, it's intentionally very confusing and hard to follow. But slowly, everything begins to click into place, and when it does, it couldn't pay off better. With exciting, tense scenes, ridiculous situations, and hard-hitting emotional exchanges, it has it all without feeling cheap. I'm not even afraid to over-hype this movie because I hyped it up for some of my friends, and they still loved it.Be warned though: This movie doesn't really fit into any genre, and will be wildly different from almost all other movies out there. It's like an art movie that also has an intensely heavy-hitting story line(s?). So good, if you get a chance you have to watch it.

reviews.review_title: Turned it off with 20 minutes to go
reviews.content: After seeing the high rating on IMDb, I've been wanting to watch this. Finally got a chance this weekend and... Unless I'm missing something... It was meh.It was just not intriguing enough to keep watching. Then 2 thirds in it got downright wacky. Did they BUY these great ratings?? I was getting sleepy and honestly didn't care how it ended, so I turned it off. I did love the actors though.

Easily the most entertaining movie I've seen in years, and I watch a LOT of films. Extremely well executed, easy to follow, visually stunning, and probably the best movie about the multiverse that's been made so far.In theaters, every showing in the last few days has been packed, and for good reason. The jokes had the audience roaring, and the ending had at least 4 people on my row wiping tears from their eyes. Haven't heard that much applause at the end since Endgame (and this was easily better than any Marvel film!)Overall just a vividly creative and original movie with an ambitious plot.

reviews.review_title: Mediocre Attempt at Philosophical Cinema with Many Flaws.
reviews.content: This movie was too long it got me weary and movies are not supposed to do that. This movie is not for general audiences that was clear. It is for a segmented group and even then, many may not see it for what it was; a cultural fusion of Asian / gay with a twist of alien philosophies that are based on a chaotic take on multiple universes. Think of this as two camps; one born out of Atheism and the other from religion. Religion views it as one universe that is orderly while the other chaotic. But this movie falls flat on its face because it proposes that from viewing / participating from a alternate, chaotic universe you could solve your earthly problems. This is not impressive philosophy but rather bland and flawed and the creators tried to make up for it with some feeble comic elements. Another nuisance was the constant barrage of fast cross cutting and cutaway in and out of parallel universes. This is only done one or 2 times preferably in the 3rd act to tie loose ends to give audiences insight into the character's feelings and thoughts, but here it felt like we are engaged in a video game.

This movie of genre bending madness is probably the most life changing movie I've ever seen. The visuals, beautiful, the score and sound design, fantastic, the acting, phenomenal, and by god the perfect writing. This is a movie that is utterly hilarious, with extraordinary action, and thematically it's one of if not the most beautiful film ever. It's messages about life are so powerful, that love and joy is the thing persevering throughout all universes, and that sometimes a meaningless life is what gives life meaning. It's not just about the meaning of life but also the meaning of living. It's acing the messiness of life and man it's just a perfect film. It is not for everyone I will say, it is dirty, fast paced, and very flashy. But nothing will takeaway from the fact that this movie is utterly amazing.

Best movie I've ever seen! Literally shook my badussy to the multiverse and back never cried my big masculine self so hard. I could never write a movie this good. It literally rocked my soul. I will never watch another movie ever again 🤤🤤🤤

Boring and random,
What is the deal with the stupid bagel?I have no idea why the rating is so high, it's basically an ok film, with many scenes I had to fast forward due to its boringness and predictable scenes.I was waiting for something to happen, but, nothing happened for over two hours in. I read people say it's soooo crazy but it's not "crazy" it just feels very random and idiotic.Was really waiting for it to be over just so I can see something else, they could have made it much better and less childish, I guess people liked it because of the whole multiverse idea, but this movie is just bad and a waste of time.

reviews.review_title: I laughed; I cried; are you not entertained?
reviews.content: It's a remarkable flick.Cloud Atlas meets The Matrix meets The Fall meets Nietzsche meets existentialism.A heady experience, fraught with the emptiness of being, punctuated often by absurdity, levity, playfulness, sorrow, compassion, and hope. You never get to wallow in the fact that nothing matters; you're having too much fun.I realized long ago that anything is better than nothing.This film imports a lot of meaning from familiar places, like the love between a mother and child (not questioning the ultimate meaninglessness of kin altruism), so it only skims lightly on the implications of nihilism, but it speaks to us in ways we can understand., and if nothing matters, then why not choose to smile about it? Your sadness is just another petulant mythology.I choose to enjoy the ride. What a neat film to remind us all of the possibilities to experience, and the privilege that it is.

I honestly love the plot and how touching the movie is. Like the movie was honestly relatable. I love how the twist, that all she ever wanted was a mom to understand her. I love the makeup and cinematography.

reviews.review_title: Not sure what other people see in this movie.
reviews.content: This movie does not know what it wants to be. Poor dialouge, universe jumping, forgettable characters. It has the makings of a low brain but high budget sci fi thriller. It was hard to watch all the way through and continually lost interest with so many fast cuts. I do love sci fi and even much slower paced films like Stalker of Blade runner 2049 but those had an intriguing story that really carried the plot along. It almost just seemed like the director was just trying to cram as many random things and plot elements in at once to wow the audience. Like this movie was made for a tik tok attention span. I just don't understand the appeal of this film.

An hour in and I couldn't figure out what all the fuss was about. I just about stopped watching. I think that's where the majority of the bad reviewers stopped too.Around the nth ending I finally saw the light. It was around the same time I finally figured out that was Jamie Lee Curtis.It ends way better than it started and the start could have been cut by a good 20mins.I'm glad I watched it. I won't forget it. It made me think about it long after I watched it. What more could you want in a movie. Seriously, it had butt plug fu. How can you not smile after that?

Great watch!The movie started out slow to set the scene. The monotony of life had caught up with the husband and wife of the story. From this monotony hysteria was born. The entertaining action scenes left me in tears. Within the action sequences the heart strings are tugged whilst the ridiculousness settles in.All in all, a great watch and worthy of every dollar spent!

I thought it was a normal comedy
But it also opened a lot of eyes
very interesting movie
.We all have more identities in this society
There are many scenes in the movie that resonate with people
Recommend you, maybe it can change your view of certain things.

reviews.review_title: Would have been better off taking LSD
reviews.content: WTF. Absolute garbage. Waste of 2 hours. Would have been better off taking LSD. Impossible to follow. Probably the single worst film I've ever watched.

reviews.review_title: Huge Douglas Adams vibes, loved it!
reviews.content: You don't see movies like that very often, it was refreshingly awesome! Fun, and smart, and emotional, and action-packed, and thoughtful, with a great message, and perfectly executed too.
Very creative film and intentional making process!. The story opener is full of question marks and doesn't make sense but is explained to the fullest in the middle to the end of the story.
Just go see it. I cried so much but left so happy. An amazing funny deep moving emotional weird hilarious film. I'm telling everyone I know to go see it. I'm about to go watch it again in theaters.

reviews.review_title: I don't get why this is so highly rated
reviews.content: I don't get why this is so highly rated. I love indie films but honestly after 30 minutes I was losing the will to live. Very disappointing. Maybe the chaos was just not my cup of tea. I appreciate others love it, but I don't get why, so rather than sitting through all 2 hours I gave up. Maybe it would have become the visionary masterpiece others believe it to be. Or maybe it's best appreciated by people with first hand experience of psychedelic drugs. I feel that the actor's talents are wasted, but if they enjoyed making it, good for them. I realise I'm in a minority, but that's ok. If you insist on watching it some really good snacks will help!

Take a lifetime of ideas, and a whole lot of money, then fail in so many levels to get it right. This kind of film has been done so much better elsewhere. You see the kernels of good ideas, but they fall flat way too many times. Nice try in doing something that isn't just sequels or marvel movies, but you get the impression that they are desperatley trying to make a movie that will be heralded as the new cult movie for this decade. Set pieces lack the impact you would and should expect of a film with this amount of expectation they have given themselves... a strong 12 ot of 10 for trying too hard.

Didn't understand it. Didn't like it. If felt like a huge 140-minute crazy nonsense videoclip. Or perhaps a collage of multiple disturbing TikToks. There's no need to accumulate reels to reach 140 minutes in a movie! I stopped watching it at the half, which I do very rarely. The other Best Picture movies of this year are way better than this one. They have pauses, they have a script and real life elements. I tried to get the modern acid trip this movie tried to propose but I just couldn't grasp it. If this is the goal, Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas is better than this, just as a quick comparison. Bottom line: don't waste your time with this.

Cinematography was stunning - a feast for the eyes visually. I was immediately captured in the beginning, but I'll admit that this film got weirder and weirder to the point that I almost stopped watching it. Without spoiling anything, let me just say I'm glad I stuck with the film until the end. Despite the over the top ridiculousness of some of the scenes, this film successfully told a contemplative story that'll surprisingly tug at your heartstrings and keep you talking about this movie long after you've left the cinema. The cast was great. I'm glad I stuck with it, but I also don't see myself watching this again. The movie seemed longer than it actually is.

reviews.review_title: A proper title "Everything Everywhere All at once"
reviews.content: A good mixture of sci-fi, drama, comedy and action. Good story line may even make you think about your own life; it can be a bit complex but not hard to follow. It was able get a good laugh out of the audience without ruining the intensity of the moment. Overall, its the best one so far this year.

reviews.review_title: philosophically great, but partially a hard watch
reviews.content: So, as someone who is deeply interested in philosophical questions, questions of depression and anxiety, this film should have been perfect for me. It actually is, in terms of asking and answering the big questions of humanity: Where are we ? Who are we ? Are we alone ? How can we go through this ? Alone ? As a family ? What are feelings ?I think the Daniels answer these question very easily, not cheeky at all, we are humans and we've got emotions, desires and wishes. It's what makes us human, our feelings, and we can live through these emotions and make connections to other people. It's how we can overcome anxiety, madness and desperation. It's a beautiful message and the film explores these themes with undeniable power and maturity.In addition, the film is a great production, it has some of the best fighting scenes I've seen in recent years, strong acting by its lead cast. It comes with clever dialogue, with beautiful pictures (as I'm referring to two stones talking to one another right next to a cliff), costumes, design, special effects - it's all there. A beautiful piece of art - and that what it really is in the end - a piece of art.But this piece of art comes with some cost. Really, I love the messages behind the movie. But I think that in the end it, of course, it can be an artwork, but it's also still a movie. And in-between all these multiverses, we sometimes don't know where we are. Humans, or as I should say -especially myself - still have the desire to know where we are and to hold on to that world we are living in right now. The film floods you with pictures, images, changes, fights, explosions, madness. Of course, this whole thing here is madness, our life is absurd. But in the end I watched a movie of which I expected to be entertained. And I was entertained, but it felt stressful. Almost exhausting. It was just too much. The pacing was too fast in my opinion. I would've needed more time to take a deep breath and ask myself what the hell I just saw. I also feel that the 140 minutes are too much. Don't get me wrong. I liked this, but I didn't enjoy the watch as much as I did it with other masterpieces or artworks, because there is still an opportunity to create these kinds of movies AND deliver an easier watch.I also want to mention, that I cried multiple times, especially in the end, where I think the film rewards the viewer brilliantly. But that reward was not enough in comparison to the demanding but also tiring parts in it.

reviews.review_title: A unique story set in the multiverse
reviews.content: It's difficult enough to set the things you did wrong right in one lifetime, she managed to set things right in all her lifetimes, in all the universes. I'm not a huge fan of the multiverse (which is often nonsensical, coupled with lazy storytelling), but this film actually has a message for the viewers: Don't ever give up, it never too late to start. You'll get there eventually.

reviews.review_title: Exaggerated "comedy" scenes that make you rather roll your eyes
reviews.content: I cannot agree with the overall rating. The beginning was promising and it was a good intro, but the plot got really messy and you could barely follow what is happening. The movie was overly filled with exaggerated scenes of cheap humor that rather triggered a reaction of "Oh, come on". Possibly more entertaining for youth rather than people in late twenties or older.The idea itself is good, but it wasn't very well put into the movie. If I wasn't watching this movie in the cinema, I would stop watching it in the middle of it, but I am, in the end glad that I saw till end because of the last scenes, which were actually alright and earned one more star for the rating.

Not sure how to rate this film, perhaps it was to much for my simple mind to comprehend . Was enjoying it immensely for an hour or so until the first end. Second half just lost me completely, think I may have to watch it again. One tip is do not get distracted or you will lose the plot completely, which clearley I did ,

Look - it's a good movie okay. But listen, this is the perfect example of how strangely movies have come to be made today and why it might be worth questioning.Back in the day we have The Godfather and Memento for example - very focused on story and character arcs. No one single scene doesn't serve the higher purpose of the story. Each action scene carefully designed, again, to serve the story and perhaps even the catharsis of the film. And today we have the Super hero flicks. And Everything Everywhere All At Once fits into this superhero structure.It offers a concept, a world, a story, only to throw it in the bin in the 2nd act and do a bunch of actions scenes for no greater purpose than generating a dopamine rushed audience. The tempo and flickering lights and action is so very millennial. It's clearly made for a generation that is used to having their brains reward system massaged every millisecond by rolling screens.Everything Everywhere All At Once is like a half baked The Matrix on drugs with unicorn sprinkles all over it. Maybe you like that, and then that's great for you!But I was disappointed. The pace is too fast, the characters are underdeveloped, and the original concept stops developing early on only to be replaced by trippy action scenes. It's a video game kind of movie. Another one of many in these times.

This is a film masquerading as a deep film, but whose depth is only apparent to someone who has only ever watched childrens' films.40 minutes too long. Laid on far too thick. It's an allegory, we get it.

I hardly know what to think about this. It was surreal, it was science fiction with time travel, it was a martial arts film in the comedic style of Jackie Chan, it was a romance, it was a story about a mother and daughter. I liked the film, but I didn't always know what was going on. I cared about the characters (in some timelines) and wanted things to work out well for them.One complaint I have is that the science fiction part is never resolved. People from the future(?) or at least a different timeline are trying to get Evelyn to help them, and they are important in the first part of the film but not later. That part of the story just ends, and maybe we're supposed to conclude that their timeline is fixed by what happens to Evelyn, but I would have liked more clarity on that.

reviews.review_title: It didn't need to be so bizarre.
reviews.content: A good story doesn't need to be told in such a bizarre way. For me, sometimes this movie resembles me an option for the culture of ugly. Still, It's a good and refreshing dive into movie possibilities.

We had a few good laughs, but the movie is too slow, too long and very repetitive. Acting is good, but the story does not merit a 2 hours movie and endless martial arts exhibitions. A movie that is a satire but unfortunately takes toooooooo long to tell a simple story.

It's genius, amazing way to portray such a complicated topic: the multiverse. Even though there's a lot going on (as the title suggests) the movie manages to keep a clear storyline, which is original, entertaining, and meaningful. Its humor is so different yet so on point with the tone of the movie. And the visuals, gosh I enjoyed them so much.

As other reviewers have highlighted, this movie is a trip. It truly exemplifies the mental gymnastics your mind sometimes has to go through to come to a simple realization.I loved the concept of this film and the overarching themes are deep, emotional, and powerful. It explores topics like love, mental health, regret, and how simple, seemingly meaningless decisions have a butterfly effect on outcomes. For this alone, it is absolutely worth a watch.What didn't land for me, personally, was the attempt of comedy- mostly in the first act. It just felt too slapstick and ridiculous. Juxtaposed to the deeper themes I mentioned above, it just felt like it didn't mesh and cheapened the experience a bit.The second act got me back into the movie and I think it didn't a pretty good job and tying all the chaos together to show the viewer what this movie was truly about.Kudos to everyone that worked on this movie. It was chaotic for the viewer so I cannot even imagine the monumental effort that was put into directing, costume design, and editing this film.In conclusion- This film was a wild viewing experience, truly everything you've heard it to be. I wanted to like it more than I did, but I felt like it pushed me away at times with how ridiculous it was. Thankfully, it pulled me back in to appreciate the beauty of the film was trying to say.

While this movie has obvious references to other movies, it is fair to say it is quite unique and unlike anything seen before. It mixes many genres making it impossible to describe in one sentence.Michelle yeoh's performance is great as well as the other actors in the movie.To me, the movie is pretty much an instant classic but I can imagine that some people might not appreciate the level of crazyness (genius?) in this movie.

The first movie that I walked away in the middle from cinema.I just wanted it ends, but it is so long. Stupid and doesn't make any sense.Very confusing, loud and ridiculous.I truly regret to pay the ticket.

This movie is funny, action packed, trippy, deep, and uplifting. I don't think any movie has ever made me feel such a roller coaster of emotions.Not sure why this review is saying it is "too short" lol i have nothing else to say. Kinda wack that they do this. Read the above paragraph, that is all you need to know. Go into this movies as blind as you can.This for me is probably a top 10 movie ever. The character development is pure class and very well acted. The husband in particular, is basically the best human ever and i have written down words he said to help me live a fulfilling life.Finally, "minimum character limit met" lol.

reviews.review_title: Too Much In Too Many Places In Two-and-a-Half Hours
reviews.content: Probably better than "Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness", which is by no means a great feat. A plethora of "cinephile" references do not achieve much in strengthening a very weak (and exceedingly naive) story. And it would be too much to call the performances great.

I went into this film with high expectations already from the reviews alone. But holy moly. This film exceeded every expectation. First of all the acting was superb and i found every character likable in different ways. The strange and wacky humor just made it that much better. Overall i would give it 10/10 hot dogs.

Is it possible for a movie to completely change your perspective on life and make you question just how you have been living yours up until this point? Because this might just have. It might be the fresh afterglow of having just seen it and I might go back to same ol' life tomorrow morning but boy does it affect you! It FEELS like it's complicated but it's not. It's so well made and simple yet profound at the same time. Hats off to everyone involved. It's evident how The entire cast and crew have given it their all, a true labour of love. Special shoutout to Stephanie Hsu who is as brilliant here as she was in Mrs. Maisel.

Nothing good here , it was terribly over hyped. It uses too much effects in too little of a time just to confuse you and people may think wow this is so different when it really is for people with attention span of less than a gold fish. It plays emotional music. The movie starts really slow that many will quit the movie in 30mins. Also some disgusting parts too in the movie , which we are supposed to laugh at but feel really bad.

reviews.review_title: Just good composition; the ideas aren't theirs.
reviews.content: The film is entertaining because it is definitely absurd, and it's fun, but it's deeper elements are a composition of other people's ideas. Especially part two. You would think that either Daniel would be able to discuss the origins of the philosophical sentiments expressed in the movie if they were their own... but in any interview, neither can touch on the detail relating the concepts being tied together, not even remotely. But, somehow miraculously, they can present them in film? How is that? Because the ideas aren't Daniels'.Because of that, I don't see them making another philosophically compelling movie after this. Kwan already admits this in his interviews, and it's likely for good reason.

reviews.review_title: So many feels and so much fun!
reviews.content: I just came home from a trip to another dimension. This movie IS AMAZING! It brought out so very many emotions. I laughed, cried and was gripped in the heart. At first I thought, "The Daniels are really bazaar!" (which may very well be true) but when it was all put together this movie was about what has been going on inside most of us and they found a way to let it out. I highly recommend "Everything Everywhere All at Once" at least see it once (I feel that I need to go again.) And, I want Evelyn's red sweater!

reviews.review_title: If one can get past the first 30 minutes it all ends in a brilliant mess!
reviews.content: In the first 30 minutes, I considered leaving the theater disappointed (the trailer made it look like an awesome film).I've seen most A24 films, and all have been quite amazing in one way or another.I'm glad I stayed in the end, though there were points where I did think, "is it over yet?. This is usually only a feeling I get if it's not a very good screenplay or the director has no idea how to end it, or Hollywood decides to take over an ending.Michelle Yeung is an excellent and brilliant actress and now has shown she can be quite hilarious too.The daughter in the film I was very impressed with as a young actor with her many different takes on her character, and halfway through, I realized the dad was the kid in the 2nd Indiana Jones film!The costumes and sets were amazing, and some only appeared for 3 seconds! The directors get high props from basically everything all at once in the editing and filming, except the kitchen sink, as the saying goes.The screenwriters get props as well with some great comedy hot dog hand universe, and one of my favs was the bagel of existential despair.There are great moments of Zen-like silences of contemplation in the chaos, like the "2 rocks" overlooking the immense canyons of the creation scene.However, at its heart, it's really about family, unconditional love, the fears of losing out on something that passed us by when married, but foremost was the bonds of love and hate that all mothers and daughters struggle with we find comes universally, no matter what culture you come from.A must-see but not perfect or a masterpiece, but I do not believe that was the intent in the end. It's meant to be chaotic, silly, and philosophical.Sadly with way too many tv and films blasting multi-universe themes these days, I hope all can catch this film before it's too late, like when our pop culture ruins such brilliant ideas and themes if it hasn't already. It may be too late anyway but perhaps not in an alternative A24 Chinese family experiential film universe!

reviews.review_title: Nothing, nowhere, all over the place!
reviews.content: This was a frustrating nonsensical seven shades of weird way to spend an evening. The opening scenes are boring and elongated waffle and then the film clumsily transitions into a pseudo wacky tacky kungfu psychedelic mess. The rave 10 out of 10 reviews have a whiff of the Emperor's New Clothes about them. Given the repeated Laundromat scenes you would expect that bad smell to go away but the film gets worse the longer it's allowed to go on. It's not arty it's just odd and poorly put together with crap characterization and zero screenplay. A dull scruffy dull scrappy disjointed nonsense. At the end of my days my Tombstone would read "May have lives a little longer but was robbed of 2 hours of his life back in January 23. Oooof.

Trying too hard to be the Wachowskis by stealing all their ideas, except for bits they lifted from Buckaroo Banzai. Overlong, unoriginal and dumb. It might have been okay as a 90 minute movie, but to pad it out there is repeated scene after repeated scene. An hour in and the plot simply bogs down and never gets going again.

I don't normally write reviews, but this movie was something else. All biases aside, I think this film is special in so many ways. It nails almost everything you want in a film. From the cinematography to the visuals, and even to the acting it was top notch. It depicted what could be so well. The notion that we live in alternate realities, and can change all of them was extremely well done. I really hope this film gets the admiration and accolades that it deserves.

reviews.review_title: This is how you do a Multiverse movie.
reviews.content: Unlike the misleading titled movie Dr Strange, Multiverse of Madness which shows 3 different universes for any real length of time and shows some weak cameos for 5 mins or less.This movie. THIS is how you do a Multiverse movie. You really believe and feel how infinite the multiverse is when the protagonist travels among different universes.The story is compelling and honestly I haven't been this pleased with an action adventure movie in years. Check the movie out. The run time is a bit long but you never feel like the movie is dragging.

Behind the absurdity and chaos at the surface of this film is a beautiful story about a family's desire to connect. The acting performances are spot on and the attention to detail is incredible. I think I experienced every emotion while watching this movie. I've never seen such bold concepts portrayed in such an abstract way while staying so accessible. This is a must watch, and in my opinion, a true masterpiece.

I've seen this movie 5 times now, and I still don't know how to sum it up. But I'll briefly try, just enough to meet the length requirement 😉.This movie is about despair, love, faith, nihilism, and the unrelenting human spirit... but it's also gag comedy, unflinching absurdity, and visual cotton candy. It's a lot (hence the title), but it somehow works.And it really gets better each time you watch it - for me, the 5th watch was the best so far. I don't think I can say that about any other movie.One last thing: you ought to watch this movie with friends or family - if not on your first watch, then the next time you watch it. Trust me. It's a conversation starter.

A thoroughly fun and entertaining movie, beginning to end, but lacks depth. The core of the movie is a pretty cliched story, treading on very, very well-worn ground.It tackles a lot of big, weighty questions: the significance of our lives in an uncaring universe, midlife crisis, generational differences/overbearing parents, etc. But doesn't seem to have anything new or interesting to say about any of them. It just tells the same basic story with a new and flashy sheen.The humor is also hit or miss. It takes a lot of shots and some certainly land very well, but much of it also is in the "OMG RANDOM!!1!one!" school of humor, which I find grating but may work for others.The action choreography was very well done, and all of the fight sequences were a blast.I'm also not a big fan of it pushing certain stereotypes, such as small business owners talking trash about their customers whenever they're speaking in their native language.
It was beautiful, wild and so entertaining. Just way too long.. couldve been done easily half an hour less with no impact on the meaning, plot and quality.

Despite some pacing issues, which made the movie feel a lot longer than it actually is, "Everything, Everywhere, All At Once" is a wildly imaginative , original and funny movie. It succeeded at making me question every single important life decision I've ever made, as well as making me laugh hysterically in a few parts.Excellent.

This movie took my breath away. I truly was not prepared for the bizarre ride this movie would take me on. It is such a beautiful take on mental health and depression that doesn't come off as preachy. With such an intense topic they added humor, beauty, and just pure insanity that really makes this movie exceptional. It takes you through loopholes and just keeps getting more and more unbelievable and bonkers. The cuts through different realities and so many different possibilities of what the world could be like is really remarkable. Somehow it was not confusing, I mean granted when the introduction to the alternate realities happened I was a little bit taken aback because the start of the movie has such a different feel from where it ends up going. But nonetheless it was easy to follow for the most part and when it dawns on you what the truth behind all the alternate realities mean is just so extraordinary.Not only was the writing behind this movie so clever and intriguing, the acting was impeccable. Not one moment where I was taken out of the film from poor acting, I honestly felt like I was in a whole different world myself. One thing I absolutely have to address is the silent scene, everyone was holding their breaths in awe during the rock scene, so beautiful. The silence creates such an impact for the audience especially since everything surrounding it is pure chaos. But chaos in the best way possible.Watch this movie. It is incredibly written, acted, and edited. Even with the silliest of concepts it still came across as beautiful, this is a game changing movie.

reviews.review_title: Messy, Reactionary, but Good in Parts
reviews.content: This really is a film of two halves. The first half is great fun - the cast are excellent, there is plenty of visual flair in the direction and some excellent gags are delivered along the way, but beyond its mid-point the narrative discipline disintegrates and the film spirals into a disappointing mess. There's also a real problem with how reactionary this film appears to be in terms of how it represents women.Part of the problem is simply with the writing. The central conceit of the narrative proves too complex in its implications for the screenwriter to really make any sense of it. Essentially the central character finds herself skipping between alternate realities in a multiverse of infinite possibilities, where she is able to connect to alternate versions of herself in order to tap into skills (martial arts, gymnastics...) developed by her alter egos, and thus fight off a supervillain bent on the destruction of the whole multiverse (or something like that). The mechanics of this process are utterly confused, however. Initially she connects to alternate realities with the aid of a computer operated by allies in parallel world, but when they are wiped out she continues with this power even though the mechanism that makes it possible has apparently been destroyed, leaving us in a world where anything can happen as long as it serves the narrative, Whether it actually follows the narrative rules or not seems to no longer matter. All this is very frustrating - you can't establish rules in a fantasy narrative like this and then show so little concern for them as the narrative develops; its just lazy writing!Another issue that emerges is the mawkish direction the plotline takes. The second half of the film becomes largely focussed on fixing the dysfunctional relationship between the central character and her husband and estranged daughter. The reconstruction of the divided family is such a tired old trope in cinema and the way they handle it here feels incredibly sentimental, predictable and hugely at odds with the cine-literate wit and invention of the film's first half.All that is irksome enough, but what bothered me most about the film was its attitudes to gender. Superficially it might seem pretty empowering to have a female protagonist and antagonist as the focus, but this soon unravels to reveal a worryingly traditional/sexist world view. Michelle Yeoh's character is a dissatisfied mother and wife running a traditionally "feminine" business - a laundromat. These traditional limitations on a woman's potential and aspiration are clearly felt as exactly this by the central character, but unlike a film like 'Desperately Seeking Susan' (where resolution is delivered when the heroine rejects and escapes her patriarchal constraints), 'Everything, Everywhere, All at Once' delivers the opposite conclusion/message. Here we celebrate a woman coming to see her desire to break free of the domestic sphere as an unhealthy and unhelpful fantasy. Instead we see her giving up on all her dreams, rejecting her instinct that she could be more, and learning to settle for the very things she is so unhappy with at the start of the film. Is it just me, or is it like the feminist movement never happened?Certainly worth a watch for the hilarious Jamie Leigh-Curtis and all the fun and invention of the opening forty or fifty minutes, but beyond that don't expect too much and prepare to be at least a little offended.

This movie is the weirdest movie i have ever seen. I feel like it has the same level of weirdness as wandavision. Maybe it is just movies with multiverse theme always this weird. I never thought i will enjoy it till the end.

reviews.review_title: Original plot, original film, stellar cast
reviews.content: Incredible movie, with a very original plot. Never seen a movie with such a great story, a mind twist, action packed, drama, and comedy all at once. What a great experience that is unforgettable. A gem of the decade.

reviews.review_title: All over the place but I liked it. :)
reviews.content: It's a very thought provoking original movie and for much of it - I don't really understand what is going on with the multiple universes and where the plot is all going.You are somewhat just as deeply confused as the protagonist yet at the same time, that is what is so amazing about this movie. It makes you both confused yet engaged with the movie every step of the way in a beautifully emotional yet ego-confronting , and at times, humourous way.Some of the fight scenes are fairly funny and odd. It reminds me of a classic (life reflecting) supernatural film where it takes somewhat supernatural powers and experiences, for one to learn ab ultimate fact about life. I find this movie both well made, with obviously high quality production for the elaborate special effects and the plot is so original, that it's out of this world. I really enjoyed watching this from beginning to the end, and glad to have seen it.

It's interesting how a film can explain better than ayother film the meaning of multiverse.A roller-coaster film that will make you cry & laugh.The characters are very well written and the crew was phenomenal while acting.Its a new era of different type of movies that are super sophisticated yet amuzing and simple to the audience.I loved the name, and I understand now why its named like that.Visual effects is taking it to another level of simplicity and smoothness.There are a lot of details that will amuse you. Some ideas are bold and needs a lot kf courage.I love the films that are a 10 for some people and a straight zero to some others..
This is one of those films.. And unfortunately its a 10 for me.

reviews.review_title: Great idea, bad presentation but original
reviews.content: Something different and unusual.Bringing consciousness of the open-mindedness is really good point, but this presentation was very bad and boring.The scenes are constantly exaggerated without any logical sense except representing endless imagination but there was missing an dose of balance and down-to-earth thinking.

reviews.review_title: it really is everything everywhere all at once
reviews.content: If you're reading this before seeing the film, go in as blind as possible. You *need* to see this movie. It will make you laugh, it will make you cry, it will make a confusing arrangement of both come out of you at the same time. It will feel personally tailored to do this to YOU ALONE. It contains a little of every story, every conflict, every problem you yourself are facing, and addresses all of them from a place of empathy and love.Don't expect anything specific. It won't matter, though. You won't expect any of it. I've seen this film 4 times, once in Finnish, and each time it made me cry in a different way for different reasons. It will require multiple viewings, and it will feel like about 20 movies at once. And it is. It's a beautiful amalgam of so, so, much. It's a story about a laundromat owner doing her taxes. And much, much more.This is a beautiful film. It's the best film i've ever seen. In addition to the important emotional stuff, it's also a pretty movie, with wonderful cinematography, lighting choices, vfx, all that stuff. That's not why you'll watch it so many times, though. You'll be peeling back layers, both of the film and of yourself, learning more and more about how to live empathetically and be the best possible version of yourself (or, as it may be, live with being the worst). You will find yourself in this film. And it knows that. Knows you. Let it in.

We were massively disappointed by this film after seeing the glowing reviews.... It's one of the few films we nearly turned off half way through. It wasn't funny, the action was stupid and the story was dull. 2 hours wasted.

reviews.review_title: You could be anything, anywhere, why here?
reviews.content: Where cinema, feels wonky and lacks heart, everything everywhere all at once, comes to the party crashing its doors.At first you feel like the film is all jumbled and not making any sense, you feel lost, little did you know, thats how you should feel, at this age almost everyone of us is lost and cannot figure his way out, dug down deep in a pit with no way out.Every possibility you made, could have made and going to make is a life changing event,, but really were just little specs living on a floating rock, why should we dwell on it,It all makes you want to cherish the few specs of time you have like Evelyn said!

I loved Everything Everywhere All At Once. I laughed a lot. Loved the IRS Brooklyn bubala. Huge flying dildos will always get a laugh. That slo-mo goosing was a pisser. The movie started out simply. The Chinese mother, juggling 100 things at one time in her laundromat business. The Chinese father, so sweet and caring. Then all hell breaks through. This film had every single feeling, thought and idea that humans ever had in our 200,000 years on Earth. But enjoy!

reviews.review_title: MOST OVERRATED AND DISGUSTING MOVIE OF 2022
reviews.content: The movie is extremely overrated and very disgusting at some moments. It has a lot of nice fight scenes and messages but when the creators want to make movie more meaningful they made it just bizarre.

reviews.review_title: A Fever Dream on Acid...with a Crystal Meth Chaser
reviews.content: If you've never experienced the mindblowing, sweat drenching, intensity and total derangement of a fever dream strap-in and look no further than this sphincter-puckering, multidimensional rollercoaster ride. The title says it all...but doesn't even scratch the surface. I literally had to hit pause to allow my head to catch up, my heart to slow down, and my bunghole not to give out. As crazy as it was watching this story the thought of writing it made me sick to my stomach. Few films dare to go this gigantic and manic. And when they do they rarely succeed. Not so of EEAO. It is disorientingly heartwarming. And it is a film you will never forget. But watch it with a friend. Not only will you need someone to grab onto, but because if watch it alone, you might not be able to convince yourself it wasn't just a dream.

reviews.review_title: Michelle Yeoh's best masterpiece since Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
reviews.content: Unreal and surreal. Like a visual mushroom trip. The singular most original and creative thing I've ever seen on screen. Just trust me on this. GO. SEE. THIS. MOVIE. I could spend 10,000 words describing what an experience it was but just do it. Everything Everywhere All At Once. This is going to change film in the way that the Matrix did.

reviews.review_title: Best film I ever watched after Interstellar
reviews.content: This is the mind blowing things after interstellar.I mean, interstallar is more scientific, this is more sci-fi, but it's absolutely incredible.Fx are perfects, photography and acting too.It's difficult to act differents roles in just one filme, you must be a really good actor imo.Who puts 1/10 really don't understand those films.It was so intense that 2 hours and 19 minutes seemed 3 hours, but it worth it af.The meaning and the speech of Jobu Tupaki is so deep and i agree with almost everything.I love the part in which. She wants to go away from the mother but they really doesn't want.And the love story between Waymond and Evelyn is so much interesting.

reviews.review_title: This is a Multiverse movie well done!
reviews.content: The movie itself doesn't take itself too seriously and neither should you! It has plenty of absurd jokes and moments and some of these might turn you off. But please, don't let those ruin the movie for you! Do watch it with an open mind. This is really a great movie! I really can't say anything about it without spoiling for you but you should give it a watch!Also compared to the Multiverse of Madness, this movie shows that if you know how to spend your money, a great movie can be made! Obviously there's more to that but this shows that you can spend alot of money and your movie can still turn out to be mediocre at best.Like I said in the title, this is how a Multiverse movie should look like! They really captured really well the essence of each universe shown in the movie and this is exactly how Marvel should have done it!Again, words are few to actually appreciate this movie!

Possibly the best movie I have ever seen (and those that saw it with me agree) I don't usually review movies but this was just too good not to.It was hilarious, thought provoking and emotive.Cannot recommend it enough!!!

reviews.review_title: After careful consideration, this is the best film of all time
reviews.content: After having watched it multiple times and thought about it for months, this is my conclusion: Everything Everywhere All At Once is the best film of all time. Cinema peaked right here.Every turn is unexpected, the script is original, the cast is perfect. One moment you're almost dying from laughter, and the next, from emotional pain. The final message, however, somehow seems to have permanently boosted my well-being and happiness in life. Safe to say I have never had a similar experience in the cinema, and certainly, no movie has ever stayed with me like this. Deserves every possible Oscar next year!

reviews.review_title: Panic attack, existential crisis, both at the same time
reviews.content: I can confidently say that this was one of the most insane movie experiences that I have ever been though. The key word here is experience- as it is not a film which you can simply 'watch'.First things first- I can appreciate this as a great ode to filmmaking and a great example of it- it's a stunning work of visual art which twists every rule about film in a bonkers and entirely unique way.Yet I simultaneously felt like I was going to combust with pure anxiety while watching it. Strobe effects warning? I think this film needs a heart condition warning. At one Kubrick-esque moment, me and my friend nearly (literally) pissed ourselves laughing. I involuntarily found myself shouting several profanities in pure awe, chaos, disgust and hilarity. This film had my body reacting in ways that I didn't think a film could, which was easily worth the ticket price and the act of watching it.Towards the end though, I just wanted to get out of the theatre, go to the loo and catch my breath- which I think is both an amazing sign and quite a horrific one. The film's message really didn't hit me- but I don't really mind that it did, and am glad that many people found something within it. Because what I found was one of the most insane film experiences I have ever been subject to.Now, let's calm down and have a nice cream cheese bagel.

It's not lime anything you've seen before.Some will love it and some will definitely won't.But it had such a profound emotional and intellectual impact on me!Wow!I watched it seven times already and it just hits every note. Every time.So moving, so intense.It has everything, just like life.It's brilliant writing and directing, and the cast sooo good!Such an amazing artistic way to tell a family's story, everyone's story. Our story.It's mind blowing when you realised that every choice in life a different path and how much love was needed all the time to heal the hurt.Love is all. Be kind , fight different.Just forgive and embrace change. Well I'm sold
It should take each Oscar ! It deserves it.

reviews.review_title: Frenetic activity and Subtitled so you can't watch the action
reviews.content: While I know a lot of people really liked this movie, it's one major flaw is that for those who don't understand Mandarin and Cantonese have to read the subtitles. Since the action is all over the place, having to look at subtitles to be able to understand what is being said keeps you from being able to watch the movie to see what is happening. It's a terrible combination.I found that after watching for about 45 minutes, I was exhausted and completely disinterested in watching any more of it.They took a high-level topic of a multiverse and made a stupid movie about it. The activities were stupid. Their meeting with the IRS agent was stupid. Virtually everything in the movie was stupid. Not funny, not interesting, just frenetic, stupid, random activities.I'd give it negative stars if that were a rating.I'm glad we saw it for free, so I didn't waste anything but 45 minutes of my time on it.

reviews.review_title: It made me feel all the feels.
reviews.content: Rarely does a movie hit me hard and I go along for the ride. It made me feel all the feels. There so much to this movie. Evelyn and Joy relationship. The relationship with Evelyn and Gong. The relationship with Waymond. Even the relationsonship with Evelyn and Deirdre. Must people could find one of those to relate to.The acting is GREAT. If you like "Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon" meets "The Matrix". I would probably like it. The editing, the writing and the jokes. Are all on point. I can see why some viewers would give it a 1 star. It wouldn't be everyone's type of movie. If you watch it. Just have fun. Its not everyday you will see those type of movie. The Rock scene is great.

reviews.review_title: Stupid and intelligent at the same time
reviews.content: Stupid funny and yet super intelligent script, supported by good acting. Must watch for a sci-fi multiverse lovers.a fun filled sci-fi adventure movie.

I think that this movie is lacking story and plot there is a solid 15 minutes of no one talking just pictures going back and forth I honestly think it's very overrated It feels like the writers took LSD while feaver dreaming woke up and the writers wrote everything they remember and the directors where like "ok ummm this is the draft right" and the writers said "no this is the full thing" and then the directors said " there's no way this is real" it was real, a real nightmare Also nothing on the poster happens and the best part of the movie is one minute of subtitles for TWO ROCKS and the story is so hard so follow Thank you for reading my review Keep in mind I don't know the background but this is the average feeling for a average movie goer rateing everything everywhere all at once.

The idea of a multiverse is nothing new, especially with the Marvel universe these days.However, after reading the synopsis I was really excited to see this, especially after the incredible reviews and Oscar nominations.The idea that different decisions, small or large, can alter your future in different timelines/parallel universes, again, not new but good ideas.That said, watching the film I felt like something more would happen and it just didn't! The action and the 'ear piece' were so dated.Some humorous moments but that was about it. The 'family is all you need' point was laboured beyond feeling and the 'bagel' thing just made no sense.I really hoped for more like Crouching Tiger or Hero style films in terms of action and feeling but it was flat and quite B-Move in terms of dialogue.I've not seen a more overrated Oscar nomination since Gravity, avoid unless you have all the time in the world to spare!

"When I choose to see the good side of things, I'm not naïve. It's a strategic, necessary approach. That's how I learned to survive whatever it is."
"And I consider myself the same. That's how I fight."
"Although you broke my heart again, I wanted to say, in another life I would have liked to do laundry and calculate taxes with you."
I have to share my experience, at least that I can do to make a decent point in the review section of the film.The quote from above reminds me of that which I have lost, an emotion that I will most likely never be able to express to the one I fell for, years ago.Strong and steady as I remember her to be, she represents a clear memory of what I've always wished for. Maybe because it was the first girl whom I may have liked at that moment, as she smiled elegantly at me, the first time our eyes made contact.She has been my source of hope, for years.For a fact, we were never together.Long story short, I hesitated long enough that my mind distanced itself to follow its own course in the world. But I still feel my heart burning with the exact same passion, only by the thought of her.It's a strong feeling.A feeling that gave me too many times the vital energy to move on to what I've had to do, in hopes that one day I may meet her again and talk with her, smile back and have a great day.This dialogue made me think.In a world where I don't get to choose whether my hapiness is, or isn't, that's how I would see myself.The scene immediately left me thinking of what I would say to the one I have dreamed of, for too long, in a future where love did not represented a life criteria and circumstances made us meet, "on purpose".Reviewing the scene: 100/10
Movie review: 10/10 - because, even if I'm not agreeing with many aspects from the movie, getting a promotion on the big screen, movie it's its own genre.Don't forget, you could have been, too, a singer!

reviews.review_title: Loool rick and morty did it way before in significantly less time
reviews.content:
Just go and watch rixty minutes episode from rick and morty it's basically the same thing just in much less time in 20 minutes
I liked the beginning when i didn't know where it's going but as it goes i really knew I'm not going to like how it ends.

I'm only thirty minutes in, and just watched Ke Huy Quan beat down six security guards with a fanny pack full of rocks. This fight scene is better choreographed and presented than ANYTHING in the new Matrix film, while maintaining a comical edge that keeps the brutal concept fun. Quan sells it hard too. I had no idea he could move like that. I decided to give it a watch because Michelle Yeoh is awesome, but I didn't know I'd be getting a long overdue dose of Short Round. . . Lo Pan too. I don't care where this movie goes from here, the first thirty minutes have me convinced this is a 10/10. Perfect blend of cast and genius filmmaking. Highly enjoyable.

reviews.review_title: Trippy and heart warming, altogether at once
reviews.content: We don't go out for many films, so we were delighted to laugh and cry along with this spectacular production. Witty dialogue (even for subtitles) and fantastic costumes contribute to a wonderful cinematic experience. What a delight! We'll be talking about this for a long time. Thank you!

reviews.review_title: Trifecta: Fun + Thoughtful + Oscar worthy script and acting
reviews.content: This movie is best gone into blind. This is a glowing review that promises 3 things: 1. Laugh-out-loud funny absurdist humour; 2. Thought provoking questions on life, existence, and purpose; 3. Fantastic performances plus a script that's sure to get some Oscar nods. You should stop reading and go watch it now, ideally avoiding a trailer as well.For those that want to know more, such as why the script is Oscar worthy, to me this movie is a blend of all movie genres done very well. Similar to how Parasite was a nod to Hollywood stories with meaning and meaning told through film, this is a nod to Hollywood genres and all the ways you can tell a story.The themes covered in this film match the title. It has all the themes. There is something for everyone, whether that is someone looking for slice of life family drama, musings on nihilism and the meaning of life, or how many absurd dick dildo props you can squeeze into a movie that shares scenes set as romantic film noir about missed connection lovers sporting $10,000 gowns and suits.The acting is superb, from both Yeoh and her supporting actor Ke Huy Quan. The range of their performances is surely Oscar bait, but serves a purpose in the story. The protagonist's daughter (Stephanie Hsu) plays a very relatable struggling teen for younger viewers as well. I'm glad Awkwafina had to bow out of this role, it would have been hard to imagine her struggling and seeing her as anything but awkward.Finally, and most importantly, this movie is fun and enjoyable. I avoided this for so long despite glowing peer reviews thinking it would land on either the two extreme ends of a dumb action movie (it's not, it's quite deep) or a way too heavy-handed dry philosophical painful slog (it's not, there is a lot of light hearted fun). Older British thoughtful comedy classics landed in this sweet spot for me; if you are a fan of Edgar Wright's mashing of genres you'll find something here for you.

My pure first cinema viewing notesPredictable yet doesn't bother at the slightest. Different kind of movie. Actorship brilliant. Sound and Cinematography especially good. Life changing meaningful. Matrix like.too many coincidences stuff absurd artistic shootings nice production. One of the best action scenes in movies place jumps great FAMILY DRAMA BUT MULTIUNIVERSAL POWER WAR explains mother ship.

Movies goes no where it's all over the place and makes no sense. Was really excited to watch it and it was so bad I turned it off 30 minutes in. It was so bad this is my first review I've ever watched. Reminds me of the great rating for safety not guaranteed which turned out to be horrible as well.

If Salvador Daii made a full on movie this would be it . Very unique and very very surreal but with a universal message. Than you for restoring my faith in the art of movie making. Genius and superb .

I can't believe the amazing and mind bending story I just experienced. I am just blown away by the story telling and cinematography this effortlessly life changing movie made me question my own reality. It was flawless from the characters to the plot. Everything I have been waiting for and wanting in a movie for so long. It breaks all aspects of how a movie should go from this unassuming relatable family in its own problems and culture, to this unbelievable story that's ripped across all realities past present and future all at the same time.This has the Matrix (the original) feel to it but at the same time Total Rdecall (the arnold version) vibes, with a little new once to make it its own. The character development is standing ovation worthy and keeps you on the back of your seat in fear of what comes next. But leans you forward to hold on for more. I can't believe this is what this movie was. I was expecting a mediocre seen it before tale that had some new twist, but I was pleasantly surprised that I was taken on an original journey through mind altering thought to the point where I was questioning whether I was in the movie or some spin off of reality waiting for my own body to be tagged in and fight.All I can say is it is a must see for everyone who wants a new original thinking journey to ride along with and not think about awards or criticism. Just to take a ride on another state of mind all together. I commend you for reading this but can't wait for you to realize what you are in for within the hours to come in this unbelievable joy ride you are about to partake.Enjoy the ride and please open your mind to what is coming!!!

reviews.review_title: How could you not fully Reunite the Chef and Racoon?!!!!!!
reviews.content: 2 hours you never get back. I have a personal attachment to animals and people who are alone. Like the Chef and the Racoon. How could you as a writer or director not fully reunite the pair by the end of the movie!!???? Seriously one hour in i decided this movie was one of the worst ive seen in years. Then i just wanted to see if Racoonie would be reunited with the chef. Sure you as a movie maker thought it was all just funny but no it sucks to have your best and only friend taken from you to never be fully reunited.. And what, really flying threw the air at the animal control truck is the last scene we get with Racoonie and the Chef???!!!!! Worst job ever. I hate whoever made that scene. Ruined my whole experience. Movie would have been at least 3 stars with the decent camera and 3d but the writer should go get a job bagging groceries cause movie making is not your job. You suck at that. Unless you are trying to make terrible movies.

reviews.review_title: A film for existentialists and young rebels
reviews.content: In the film, grandpa represents authoritarianism, daughter (minority group) represents the emerging generation in today's society (challenging authority), and mother represents a great selfless explorer, and the result is love, which is not satisfactory. Camus fans will love this movie, unfortunately it didn't achieve the leap in Camus' book in the end, but I always think that everyone has a better vision in mind than being stuck on the page of pushing a rock up a hill.

I really like this film and I wasn't expecting to as it isn't my usual type to watch. Jamie Lee Curtis was excellent and looked like she was having fun.I have never seen a film quite like it but I thought the end dragged on too long. Although I liked the film, I was getting impatient for it to end. Sounds weird but it could've ended a good 20 mins earlier than it did.Overall, a great film and I would recommend it.

reviews.review_title: For people who like to think -- Ignore the bad reviews from people who want movies to be easy
reviews.content: In many places, the film confuses -- but only if you aren't paying attention. I'll grant that the one impediment for me was the broken English; it was hard to follow at times and I missed things.But the script was innovative and, yes, derivative (as some have complained), but derivative in that it points out its references, such as The Matrix, 2001: A Space Odyssey, Rick and Morty, amongst others. It's a lot of fun if you stick with it.A few things could be improved/changed, such as the butt plug scene, which made no sense; and some editing was needed for the bagel scenario, which went on too long. The "message" was a bit heavy-handed, and should have been handled in a manner more befitting the zaniness of the film.I'm going to watch it again, to see what I missed, this time with closed captions.Not perfect, but definitely one of the better films of the year. If you like being spoon-fed sentimentality and simple plots, like that found in The Shawshank Redemption, this is not your movie.

This is what happens when you get extremely creative directors and writers together with super talented actors, and give them a project that allows all of them to make career-defining work. Every single aspect of this film is as close to perfect as I've seen. The images on screen are lush and saturated with color and texture, the camera work is kinetic and puts you right in the middle of all the action, the ensemble cast is fantastic (more below), the stunts are mind-blowing (and hilarious), the story is totally weird and original (and a bit mind-bending, but don't worry it all makes sense in the end), the special effects make you scratch your head and wonder: "how did they do that???"A quick moment of focus on the acting in "Everything Everywhere...". The role of Evelyn is very difficult as it carries the weight of the entire film, which is told almost entirely from her perspective. She has to go from a tired, end-of-her rope, slightly downtrodden immigrant woman whose hopes have been dashed by harsh reality, to the saviour of not only our universe, but countless others as well, realizing along the way that the little daily events and love of her family, is what will save her. Michelle Yeoh pulls this off masterfully, letting us see in her face (and whole being) the transitions she's undergoing, at great peril to her own sanity. But she in no way does this feat on her own. The talent arrayed around her is so powerful: an almost unrecognizable Jamie Lee Curtis portrays her nemesis IRS agent; Ke Hui Kwan (known from Indiana Jones and The Goonies) in his first major film role in over 20 years portrays Evelyn's husband Waymond, at once both the ass-kicking protagonist and tender beating heart of the family; the radiant Stephanie Hsu plays Joy, Evelyn's daughter and unexpected antagonist. Even the minor parts (James Hong, Tallie Medel,and. Jenny Slate) are fleshed-out and contribute greatly to the film.The result, is a film that feels holistic, that presses all the buttons. It's by turns hilarious, balls-to-the-wall exciting, devastatingly sad, and ultimately life-affirming and uplifting. One of the best films I've seen in the last 10 years.
