While the movie is very fun, cutting 20 minutes and refraining from this overdose of dialogue and resolutions could have helped a lot. Some images would have been enough to explain - or make you feel - the multiverse and all its facets.Truth is : "Everything, everywhere, all at once" is fantastic because of Michelle Yeoh. She shows an ability to habit emotions that you cannot rehearse, to frame silent emotions as if in her right true life, portraying a character who would not grasp the wild stakes of these events. She made me feel like truth was achievable by an actor with a very deep control of emotions. Her kung-fu education in martial arts surely is no stranger to that ability.I don't think we will remember the movie as much in the future, but we will remember Michelle Yeoh. There is no Oscar night without her kicking Chris Rock on stage in 2023. And if she doesn't win then they haven't understood anything about acting.

In an age of comic book franchises, the art of filmmaking has taken a back seat. This movie is a return to unexpected storylines with glorious acting, humour, action and messaging.Not only were the turns unexpected but totally worth it. A sequel would ruin it but I want a sequel. The lead actor playing different versions of herself from multiple universes reminded me somewhat of Jet Lee's the One but muchuchuch better. Costume was brilliant.The next phase of this review is to somehow meet the criteria of six hundred words when I just want to say the movie was a brilliant breathe of fresh air.

reviews.review_title: Complex and profound without taking itself too seriously.
reviews.content: A farce roller coaster ride with countless awkward unexpected turns around each infinite corner.Original as it is deliberately random, this deeply philosophical journey feels a bit like The Matrix got an "Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind" makeover.The Meticulously planned storytelling is done with both precision, and sporadic slapstick humor.But above all...This movie may be one of the most brutally honest stories about love and family that exists in modern film.

This movie is weird not gonna lie, but in a pretty good way. Its unconventional and interesting and gives a cool perspective on the multiverse. Its crazy and wild but also funny and pretty philosophical sometimes if you ask me.I gotta say it was a good watch, you can even see that making this movie seemed to be lotta fun. The actors did a pretty good job also, and it was fun to see Jamie Lee Curtis playing her role.I mean okay it may have been a little bit over the top a few times but thats alright tho.In conclusion I can say that this movie got me thinking about the decisions that I do and already did. It is a little breath of fresh air and a funny one too.So Id give the movie 9/10 bagels :)
One of the The best since fiction movies ever made . Like the imagination of a true and beautiful modern Story of a scientific and fictional happening that occur in the reality.

Pretty long, messy, and was hard to keep my attention. I almost turned it off multiple times. I almost took my mother to see this. We would have had to walk out. Last 30 minutes of the film hit me pretty good, and that's why it gets a 6. The rest didn't make up for it.

reviews.review_title: One of my all time Favourites
reviews.content: Umm.... How can i say this, I LOVED THIS MOVIE. This was an epic masterpiece, it was funny, sad, happy, intresting and had me hooked. I didnt wanna pause it. This is my favourite movie of all time. Even though only 1/5 of this decade has passed, i can guarantee you this movie will make the top 10 best of this decade. A 9.4/10.

To me this is as close to a masterpiece as a movie needs to get. This couldn't have even been made just a few years back, there is so much to it, effects and all. With it all fit together quite seamlessly. Some people have to know everything that's coming next- a realism movie, but this is the opposite- completely unpredictable. It could be a dream. I also laughed many times at the unending imaginations involved here. A good movie, to see stoned. A clever cult classic. An actor's fun dream role.

reviews.review_title: Don't stop watching until the end!
reviews.content: As soon as I finished watching this film I knew reviews would be mixed and, regardless of the hype, I was right. I can see why some people would switch off prior to the end (I never do) and i was finding it all a bit tedious about three quarters of the way through but then it all started coming together in a most glorious and moving fashion that propelled the film to one of my watches of the year. Its like a giant, crazy, jigsaw puzzle and you only really see how beautiful the picture is when all the final pieces are in place. I get that one of the films themes was "what could have been" but for me it was more about the complexities of a mother daughter relationship.

One of the most original, funny, oddball, heartwarming films I can recall ever seeing. Scenes that stay with you long after the credits, the second ones that is. Visually stunning, comedic yet profound, intelligent yet utterly silly. Somehow all the contradictions work to form a wonderful film which I will be seeing again and again. Bravo to all involved in making the film. Beats the living hell out of that other multiverse film with much gusto and rubber dil.....err never mind.

Overly grandiose plot with a poorly executed third act. This film tries to emulate The Matrix and novels by David Mitchell such as Cloud Atlas but fails miserably. It attempts to pull on the audience's heartstrings by inventing an underlying moral to this nonsense story in the final act.Fails on multiple levels.

Upon first view I instantly thought "wow this is one of the best movies I've seen in the last 10 years."Upon second view i think, "wow this is the best movie I've seen in the last 20 years"After the third view.... I can squarely place this in my top 10 (personal favorite) films of all time.It just has everything.....a beautifully woven story from SUCH a complex plot. I kept thinking to myself "how the hell could a writer pitch this coherently???"As usual....glad A24 was able to answer the call.It's just such a beautiful family film....with superhero/super natural elements that has so much heart, humor and a great message. Entirely unique and unlike anything I can possibly compare it to. I simply can't endorse this movie enough.

reviews.review_title: Feels like a punch in the face-but in a good way-
reviews.content: Well, the movie started out as some sort of a drama, and then drastically changes into the most creative piece of art I've seen this century.From the moment in the ensurance-building, the entire tone of the changes, and just becomes a better version of "Doctor Strange 2", since its just so much more creative.Michelle Yeoh is acting her soul out, and the rest if the cast does as well.This has propably been the most creative movie i have watched in my life, and i dont think that is ever going to change.However, a few friends of mine said, the movie was "too much", which is understandable, but cant overshadow, how fun it is, if you do enjoy it.

I'm at a loss for words. Amazing movie. I hope for heaven sake this wins best picture. The most daring, soon-to-be hit ever. I think this movie is taking a little longer to catch mainstream because it is so hard to describe. I had never heard of it and just went in not really knowing much about it...so glad I watched it in the theater. Amazing movie...insane movie...
...life changingly brilliant movie....a piece of art.

I adore Michelle and this shows many facets of her talent. Just watch & try not to over think it. It's brilliant & the entire cast needs to be recognized for the great job they've done.Its nothing like we've seen before and it's out of this world.

reviews.review_title: What a crazy ride, truly a brilliant movie!!
reviews.content: This film is something special. If there was a blueprint for a multiverse movie this has to be it.The emotional roller coaster, performances from the actors and amazing cinematography was truly glorious. I was in disbelief how crazy (in a good way) this film was. A must watch!!

reviews.review_title: Really good but thought the metaphor / theme was a little weak
reviews.content: Incredible, absurdist, comedic entertainment. But linking the multiverse element back to the main story (family drama) was a little weak and stops this movie from being truly amazing.

reviews.review_title: I agree, that the title fits the movie so well...
reviews.content: As has been said by the other more eloquent reviewers here, the movie was "everything, everywhere and all at once" in how it explored all the different film genres. And in so doing, it was able to elicit a whole gamut of emotions, from wonderment to the profound, from its viewers. I only have a final request from the filmmakers - can there be a sequel where Michelle Yeoh and Jamie Lee Curtis play "fierce lesbian moms"?

reviews.review_title: "This multiverse is more madness than doctor Strange multiverse of madness"
reviews.content: I'm impressed with the multiverse concept that more complicated than doctor Strange MoM, but I still can understand the movie because the movie explain how that's happen with a lot of comedy that made me laugh, and this movie is so emotional sometimes it's made me laugh, sometimes it's made me tense and sometimes it's made me cry little bit, butttt the ending is the perfect one because it done all things that happen in the movie and all the problem is solve in the ending and the ending is mean a lot for a family who need it, but this movie is not for all age because this movie had a adult jokes and comedy, but that's fine.I love this movie soooo muchhhhh.

This movie is one of the best I've seen in a long time. It's probably not for everyone, but if you're a believer in the multiverse, you'll love it. Imagine being able to experience and influence the multitude versions of yourself across the multiverse."Everything Everywhere All at Once" is science fiction, comedy, and drama all at once, but the title suggests that it's a science fiction movie. Therefore, people who do not understand the notion of a multiverse will find "Everything Everywhere All at Once" confusing. Like I said, it's not for everyone. Physics is not for everyone. However, it's also a movie about love, resentment, regrets, relationships between people: mother, daughter, father, lovers, enemies. It's also an action movie! I laughed and cried watching the movie. How can you not love Jamie Lee Curtis's hotdog fingers!In addition, the performances of the actors were excellent! You'll love the chemistry between Michelle Yoeh and Jamie Lee Curtis.Once in a while a movie comes along that is smart, funny, and touching.

A middle-aged Chinese woman, Evelyn Wang, (Michelle Yeoh) runs a laundramat and conflicts with everyone around her: her father Gong Gong (James Hong), husband Waymond Wang (Ke Huy Quan), daughter Joy Wang (Stephanie Hsu), IRS lady Deirdre Beaubeirdre (Jamie Lee Curtis), and customer Debbie the Dog Lady (Jenny Slate). During the middle of an IRS audit she encounters an alternate version of her husband from the Alpha universe who tells her that she is the hero who will free all reality and all other universes from the evil Jobu Tupaki. Unfortunately, Evelyn is the version
of herself who had made all the wrong choices in life, unlike other versions in other universes. She must learn from her other versions, in order to defeat Jobu Tupaki. The acting and conflict between Michelle Yeoh and Jamie Lee Curtis is outstanding. Although, in a distant universe that are friends, and maybe lovers. In this universe, Evelyn Wang seems to bring out the worst from
those around her. Actor Ke Huy Quan hasn't made many movies since he delighted us in the Goonies (1985) and Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom (1984), so it is pure delight to see him again. Evelyn Wang learns love and compassion from a version of Waymond Qang (Ke Huy Quan) in another universe, which becomes the secret to resolve the conflict with Jobu Tupaki. The acting is superb, the photography average and the special effects confusing. But the actors and plot lift the movie above the ordinary.
This film is insane and excellent! When you see this movie, you will never know what's going to happen next. This is a hilarious and impressive movie.

This movie is... okay. Not the best, most profound thing ever. Not the most confusing mess of a story. Just okay.It takes a while to get started, but by the end of Act 1, it *really* gets started. The climax of Act 1 is over-the-top in all the right ways, and had me in tears laughing at certain points. I figured that, although the start is very slow, now that we were in THE action, the rest of the movie would be just as good as everyone was telling me it was.And... it wasn't. This is a movie that really peaks at the climax of Act 1. Everything is absurdist, over-the-top, yet comprehensible, hilarious, and tense. All the pieces were there for a great film. But Act 2... drops the ball. Not hard, but like a gentle fluttering towards the ground, where you watch the ball descending and try to convince yourself that the ball is not, in fact, descending, but at some point you have to admit to yourself that it's far lower than it was before. It goes on an excruciating amount of time, it throws up the husband's idea of fighting as "being nice to others" despite the fact that every alternate husband we've seen so far is essentially a combat master. And apparently that's the key to unlocking the villain's heart, the villain having turned from an over-the-top, enjoyable, yet still sympathetic and mysterious force of nature, to a whiny, depressed teenage girl whose only echoes of the character she used to be are her outlandish outfits in each scene. It wasn't fighting for survival it was just... being nice? I guess?The movie gets unusually predictable from here to the end. The only unpredictable things are the different universes, which remain the most enjoyable part of the movie. But by the time Act 2 gets going, you will absolutely know how it ends: just like any other movie out there. And so it does. They also force a happy ending for one plot thread that seemingly comes out of nowhere. Given a huge message of the film is "nothing matters, but you might as well enjoy it", I feel like it would have been much more powerful to go the direction that plot thread was clearly heading, only for the character affected to be assured that the lack of acceptance she received means nothing as long as she, herself, could be proud of who she is. In a world where being LGBT is still seen by many, especially in traditional culture, as wrong, it is unrealistic -- and unhealthy -- to hope that everyone accepts you as you are. You need to find your own happiness and acceptance, because not everyone will be willing to give it to you.I won't mention Act 3, because it's not even really an act.So yeah, okay film. By the time the second credits started rolling, I didn't even stay to see if it was another fake-out. I was honestly just done with the film. I can't really recommend it. Maybe just look up the action scenes as they are easily the best part of the film.

reviews.review_title: This is not a movie, this is an experience
reviews.content: I saw this movie twice in theaters, the experience was bar none, I would suggest watching it on a big screen or like you would in a movie theater, totally better that way ( I say this as I am rewatching this for the 3rd time on my PS4 on an old TV & it doesn't really make the cut as far as viewing experience wise), but it's still the brilliant movie I remember. Deep & vastly personal, funny & therapeutic, it's not a traditional film, and that's okay, and it's more than okay, but be prepared to ingest it & sit with it for awhile. Not for casual viewing. This is worth a number of rewatches and I plan to own this at some point.

One of the most creative films I know. If you watch this film without any prior knowledge, it will leave you completely stunned, as it is a unique combination of the family drama und sci fi genres. I really love the feeling of seeing something I have never seen before and this is exactly the case in this film. The effects are really high-quality and despite many bizarre scenes, the movie is never ridiculous. The fight scenes alone are an absolute experience. You definitely have to watch the movie a second time. Firstly, for a better understanding. And secondly because there are so extrem many details that are worth to be discovered. In many places you can't be sure why something is happening. But that doesn't matter because what happens is so particularly interesting and entertaining.

reviews.review_title: Too good to put into words.
reviews.content: I'm lucky enough to have seen this with little expectations having not seen the trailer or hearing much about it before I took my wife to see it.To me, this film was a masterpiece. After a semi slow first 10-15 minutes I was on the edge of my seat the entire time completely engrossed in this film. I was hysterically laughing and crying often.After the movie, we sat through the credits unwilling to even move as the profound messages, insanely creative visuals and hilarious comedy were digested. Instantly one of my favorite movies ever as it had so much soul. I question if those who rate this a bad movie have a soul and brain. This absolutely deserves well over an 8 on IMDb and I encourage anyone and every adult to go see it.PS - kudos to the amazing cast, crew, writers and directors. They all had to be at the top of their game to make such an amazing movie.

Tries too hard. It's not as emotionsl as you think, because it never establishes the relationships it thinks it does. Very noisy. A good way to disestablish a relationship is to add noise -visual and aural. Focus. Pare down the story.Ban multiverse movies due to their low signal-to-noise ratio.

reviews.review_title: Drop Acid Before You Sit Down To Watch
reviews.content: Would be one way to watch this movie then again dropping acid as I remember slows time down and this was long enough.Rather difficult to watch to say the least but a gold star for originality.It will not everyone's cup of tea as you will see in the reviews but if you are looking for something totally out there and like the idea of an experimental experience at the movies give it a shot.When the final credits did role I was thankful yet smiling, I do not think the reviews do the film justice.Yes the fight scenes are very "Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon" in there execution but that was all part of the fun in how the film was written.This is a film that you should make an effort to go see just because it a film that is worth discussion as you are walking out of the theater.If nothing else, one that will stand the test of time.
Admittedly, I left after about an hour, so perhaps there was some deeper message or humor later on, but everything until this point was crazy and boring...all at once.
Amazingly intricate movie and novel idea but also like an economy class international flight... too long, uncomfortable, I just really wanted it to end!

reviews.review_title: A bitter pill, but not the healthy kind
reviews.content: In general I didn't really enjoy this.The budget Jackie Chan was my favourite.My overwhelming feeling from this film is that a cautionary tale about being happy with your lot in life and not wishing for greater things would be far more compelling had it not come directly from a company which makes billions of pounds and doesn't have to live by the rules which everyone else does; not to mention it is portrayed by actors who famously are not happy with their lot in life and eternally strive for greater wealth and notoriety.But what do I know, I'm just an extra.The initial notion was good, but the storyline was lazy and poorly delivered.

At the heart of this film is a simple and fairly well-worn story about a mother (Michelle Yeoh) - she of conservative upbringing and strong work ethic - trying to understand her liberal and slightly rudderless daughter (Stephanie Hsu).But how this story is told is a bit bonkers. The daughter manifests as an inter-dimensional being of unimaginable terror, bent on the destruction of the multiverse - and the mother is required to tap into the powers of her various alter egos from across the same multiverse in order to defeat her. Along the way we plumb the depths of the daughter's chaotic psyche and the writers' imaginations, as Yeoh taps into different universes featuring sausage-fingered humans, talking racoon chefs, robot grandfathers and a version of her movie star self. There are numerous homages to different movie genres, from fight scenes straight out of the Jackie Chan school of choreography to extensive comic-book superhero pastiches.The concept is brilliant lunacy and the execution is almost flawless. Yeoh and Hsu are perfectly cast, Ke Huy Quan is a revelation as he switches apparently without effort between his completely bi-polar alter egos, and Jamie Lee Curtis is in equal parts terrifying and hilarious. Surprisingly, for a fantasy film, the cast is able to dictate proceedings without being dominated by CGI and special effects.As is the way of cinema these days, the film is over-long and does drag slightly in the last quarter. But that doesn't undermine what is a funny, imaginative, thought-provoking and intelligent film.

The real picture and the madness in the multiverse is perfectly shown in this movie,
Except some parts felt boring and extra comic like,
The movie is well directed but nothing new were introduced,the transition to the multiverse scenes was really great.

Very creative story line and performant, using a lot gray part in the brain to make the movie so entertaining and have also art in itif you are high than this movie is just right for spend 2 hour and feel good after it.

Great film but the only critique I have - and this is only my opinion - is that the movie tried too hard to be weirder and quirkier than it already is just for the sake of it. Too much razzle dazzle at times that it gets too repetitive and predictable. Could've done less, but would still leave the same impact, if not, even better.

reviews.review_title: What is the meaning of life? This movie is you answer!
reviews.content: When I walked out the theatre after watching this film I was in absolute awe. Such amazing cinematography as well as great acting.This movie thought me that love is the most important thing to have in life and that nothing else matter except surrounding yourself with the people you love. It's as such a complex film with such a simple and core meaning.The colours In the film are so vibrant and dull at the same time. This movie is (imo) the perfect depiction of what a person should get out of watching a movie. Feelings of both happiness, sadness, confusion, but at the end walking out having learnt something that can benefit your life as well as feeling like you have wasted 3 hours of your life.Absolutely in love with the movie and is one of those film you always think back in and say "what I would do to watch that again"!10/10.
This movie needs to be experienced while having as little as possible foreknowledge.It is a masterpiece.Do yourself a favor and watch this please.

Once a decade, a film comes out that redefines cinema for that era. Everything Everywhere All At Once will be that film for the 2020s. The use of absurdist filmmaking is the perfect vehicle for addressing heavy themes like existential dread and generational trauma at a time when a film like this is needed more than ever. Not once does this film feel heavy-handed in its approach, but it also respects its subject matter and does not shy away from it. You'll belly laugh for half of this film and sob for the other. This beast of a film tackles its themes flawlessly and does not miss an emotional beat while simultaneously being a technical marvel. The performances, directing, editing, screenplay, sound, makeup and hairstyling, costume design, and score are all achievements of their own within this film. Everything about Everything Everywhere All At Once should not work on paper, but it does and it knocks it out of the park. All types of movie fans will find something to sink their teeth into with this film, there really is something for everyone. Go see this one in a packed theater, you might just walk out feeling like you experienced something transcendental with a bunch of strangers. Everything Everywhere All At Once is a warm hug to remind you that all of that everything might just be your superpower.

Hands down the best movie of the year.Michelle Yeoh is perfect. The script i so unique.Hope it can make to the oscar in many categories.Like the title said you will have everything everywhere all at once..you will see all kind of genres. Drama, humour. Everything.I hope it will have all the credit this title deserve.Acting is overall great. It has a message, directing is great but if I have to take one flow is that is a bit long.A24 confirms as the best company in the business. You will always see somethin new and fresh from this company. Can't wait for next movies.Seriously the best movie of the year!

Funny, smart and deep with an excellent cast and script. So many twists and turns but yet the content doesn't falter. I think this is one of the most original and impressive films I've seen in a long time.
I didn't know anything about this before watching it and I blown away. I wouldn't be surprised if this is the top movie of the decade. I don't see how it can be topped.
The movie is pretty funny. NOT DEEP AT ALL.How could they turn those weird ideas into humor.I don't want to say this is a masterpiece. But it is worth my time. And I like joy's costumes.

I could not praise this movie enough. It was original, intelligent, personal, moving, exciting and hilarious. I honestly see no flaws with it and would highly recommend you give it a watch. I would even go and say this movie can be life changing.

reviews.review_title: Turning weaknesses into strengths or strengths into weaknesses ?
reviews.content: I didn't know what to expect before watching it, neither in terms of visuals or story. A friend told me it was a really worth watching and that was it.I enjoyed it quite a lot until I clearly could understand how characters would activate skills through parallel lives. And loved that surprise moment in the elevator with the umbrella. I thought "damn that's going to be some dope unusual science fiction movie".But overall it felt too much. I guess that's the whole point of the film, and I must highlight the insane technical work behind all the visual effects, as well as consistency in terms of quality. It is interesting that such a small team worked on them because it showed a very precise, consistent and quite unique style which I can only applaud.I think the acting was pretty strong too, there was something quite true and honest despite the characters being assigned to (sometimes) exaggerated tropes.In my opinion, the plot is too simplistic and the over-abundance of visual effects made the storyline actually move very slow. I felt like swimming against some super strong artificially induced current in a 50 cm deep pool for over two hours. The third part of the move felt also totally unnecessary. Would have nice to end it when the mother and daughter hug outside the laundromat, end of part 2.There were some genuinely funny and interesting comical gimmicks throughout the entire film but I was enjoying them less and less as the story progressed so slowly and being bombarded with the visuals. I believe that stronger writing with a more strategic use of the effects would have made the film overall easier too watch and even made the simple storyline stronger. I got lost in all the layers, despite some really good stuffs. The premise of the double culture, chinese-american, struggle of the first generation/second generation, generational clash, daily life struggle etc... were for me already very exciting. And during the emotional moments, explored through the many dimensions , I was hoping to get emotional too but I just barely felt anything because I was just feeling knocked out from the visuals.I like the idea of movie making when it is testing limits and breaking them in this time of human history in which technology moves so fast. Especially when we are already bombarded with visuals on our phones on a daily basis. I do believe that this film breaks all the records considering that it gets harder and harder the break them. But there will always be one thing that never changes. What happens when you have too much of a good thing ? I love baklava because it is intense, it has many textures, many layers, many flavours in one bite. But if I eat the whole tray of baklava I won't remember any of it. I feel the same about this film as if I do with baklava.

reviews.review_title: The best film I've seen in a long while
reviews.content: This is how I imagine a perfect movie. Fast spaced yet each character is explained and relatable, there's plenty of action, plenty of jokes and plenty of emotion and message too.It's a must see.

reviews.review_title: Top 5 favorite films of all time
reviews.content: I absolutely loved watching a film that's as simple yet complex as this one. There's beauty in a film that caters for multiple audiences and their watch styles; for example, those who need a little more hand holding for the plot and those who don't. There are obvious themes like, love and navigating relationships with others and yourself, and concepts a little more subliminal / complex like the multiverse itself, chain reactions, life purpose. There's an insane amount of symbolism in this film worth thinking about. From the IRS (and the trophies...I won't spoilt it but) etc... I promise the trailers really don't clue you in to the film genuinely, I was totally taken for a ride in the best way possible. I was just a huge fan of Michelle and that was my main reason for going, so this was the most rewarding and unexpected experience. A film that had me crying, then laugh crying, to feeling changed! Surely you can find some some story line to relate to in this film. Refreshing to see a story like this when cinema seems slower at turning our original content anymore.

reviews.review_title: I'd love to see the Daniels top this one
reviews.content: I was a huge fan of Swiss Army Man and this movie blows it out of the water. The Daniels are definitely in my top 3 filmmakers, really can't wait to see what they do next.

reviews.review_title: One of the best movies of the year
reviews.content: When i went to see this movie I didn t know much about it. So it really suprised me how good it was. It is a perfect movie. Everything in it just works.The one thing that especially stands out this movie is how well the narrative supports the message about how you should enjoy every moment. This is because the movie shows countles other versions of reality but still they decide to stay in that reality.

reviews.review_title: Everything we needed all at once
reviews.content: I think this is the most accessible bonkers film I've ever seen. There is such a profound and irreverent art that anyone, even if you're not a film person, can grok at an existential level. The themes throughout drip with sincerity while staying utterly enjoyable. I am so glad someone paid for this masterwork to be made.

Thank you for making this movie!! I haven't watched anything that touched me like this in a very long time!! One hell of an experience it was. After the movie ended nobody got up and left. The entire theater just sat there and let it sink for sometime. I felt like I came out of an intense therapy session feeling wonderful!!A masterpiece!!

Jesus christ this is a terrible movie. It is like Rick and Morty if Rick and Morty was unfunny and a movie. A lot of cringe parts and the only humor they could muster was lowest common denominator. I don't find it hilarious that they fought with giant dildos, or that they had to shove a giant butt plug up their ass to fight. I've gone to middle school so I've heard those jokes before.It is also incredibly long and boring, and when it is finally over, no it's not, there's still two more gd parts. The majority of this movie was either terrible, sophomoric 'comedy' or fight scenes that were done horribly and are incredibly unrealistic.I am so angry I wasted two hours on this I will never get back, and shocked that people enjoyed this. Maybe if you are really immature and not that smart you will like it, but if you like actually good movies you should find something else to watch.

This movie has philosophy, physics, drama, action, bizarre scenes... It has everything all at once.As wider your mind is, the more you can reach and understand of this film. I will see it a lot of times.

Watching this movie as a child of immigrants, as a lesbian and as someone who has a rocky relationship with her mother, it felt like it was tailored directly for my experience in the world. A must watch for all. Truly a transformative experience. The grass is already green. Choose to be kind.

reviews.review_title: A Masterpiece of a Hidden Gem
reviews.content: Where do I begin? There's just so much to talk about this absolute masterpiece of a movie. The action, the drama, the humour, the subtext, the cinematography, the emotions-and most of all, the weirdness.I will try my best to put into words how beautifully this movie was brought together with a neatly wrapped ribbon on top. I don't do movie reviews but this is something I just cannot resist writing at 4 AM because the pure adrenaline will not let me.IntroI will admit that I need to watch it 2-3 more times to fully grasp every drop of what the directors poured into the 2+ hour runtime of the movie.When I started watching it, I was so confused as to why this movie came highly recommended as it seemed very crude and bare at face value.But the more I watched it, the more I delved into the multiple realities the movie takes you through. It just draws you in and you cannot stop watching with every obscenity, every chaotic scene and every inexplicable moment that passes. It's a steadily meandering curve of insanity and chaos from start to end.Action and ChoreographyViolence is usually depicted as a raw amalgamation of gore and barbaric roughness. This movie polishes a scintillating diamond through the beautifully choreographed fight scenes. Creativity knows no bounds and nothing is repetitive in any of the confrontation scenes as people are killed off in the most elegant ways imaginable with the help of colourful visual effects.The movie somehow manages to antithetically depict the other side of the coin, addressing violence with kindness and compassion in a truly unique way.Writing & CharactersThere is a perfect balance of comedy, action and heartwarming poignance.At the start, you are introduced to characters and plot points seemingly unrelated to each other. Right until the end, all of these characters are thrust into each other's lives in the most unfathomable ways and each character plays a vital role, no matter how small.The overarching plot seems somewhat fundamental at the surface level. It's the plethora of underlying plotlines and abstract messages that really form the core of the movie. The science fiction aspect takes a backseat to the more pertinent themes that are constantly overlapping sporadically.To put that on a scale, Doctor Strange is a 6-year-old's art homework.EmotionsThe story explores the lives of 3 separate generations of a family who hate as much as they love each other. The generational gap is evident right from the start, with each one having nuances in stark contrast to the others. These various relations burgeon into something indescribaby wholesome across their shared experiences.Coming to the quirkiness aspect of it, I have no words. I am inexplicably drawn towards zany and quirky plots and sequences that make superficial sense to the common viewer. I found myself uncontrollably laughing every 2 minutes while simultaneously being absolutely bewildered at the nonsensical shenanigans transpiring in front of me.Cinematography & DirectionThe director duo of the Daniels, responsible for another one of my all-time favourites-Swiss Army Man, absolutely smashed it out of the park yet again. The way one scene shifted to another while my brain was stuck processing the earlier one really captivated my full attention. They've also thrown in a little treat for fans of fourth-wall breaking, completely novel and never seen before.There are also a few segments within the movie that give you a breather to take in everything and contemplate the meaning of life along with the characters themselves.I would be gravely remiss if I did not mention that the VFX team was comprised of only SEVEN people entirely, an outstanding feat for what they've achieved.For simple-minded Marvel fans, this is produced by the Russo Brothers. Do with that information what you will.Shoutout to the ActorsThe acting, on the other hand, felt a little less than organic, if I had to criticise just one thing about an otherwise flawless production.For Asians to have such brilliant interaction on an English medium is remarkable on its own, as seen with Crazy Rich Asians. It is with that same energy that Michelle Yeoh brought her A-game and really flourished. The other cast members also carried their role to their fullest in their own idiosyncratic ways.The VerdictThis movie had me at the edge of my seat, processing several emotions at the same time. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a completely new experience that pretty much condenses an entire cinematic universe in just 2 hours. It's a refreshing change of pace from today's hackneyed Hollywood industry that seems to care more about profits than quality, and offers a hidden gem unlike anything you've ever seen before.It was wholesome. It was thought-provoking. It was alluring. It was insanely mind-bending. It was everything, everywhere, all at once.If you actually read all of that, I appreciate it. If you just skipped to this part, shame on you. Either way, go see it asap. It's a must-watch masterpiece that I'm definitely gonna find myself re-watching over and over again.

I admit that I had to do a second viewing to understand the film better and I'm glad I did. Everything Everywhere All at Once is a true masterpiece. It's not common to see a film that incorporates elements from a number of genres and film mediums and executes it flawlessly. But even with its twisted and true swirl of genre anarchy, the film is simply a drama about a family trying to work their issues out.Like many other people say, Everything Everywhere All at Once is one of the most original films ever made. The writing and the execution were near perfect. Michelle Yeoh's performance was superb and Ke Huy Quan was just fun. The visuals, the cinematography, the editing, and the music were outstanding. It's a hard watch and definitely not for everyone, but for those who enjoyed this acid trip-like cinematic experience, we could agree that this is one of this year's best.

This is a non sense and absurd movie. Overrating is evidence that is a total error to trust what people think is entertainment that deserves to win awards. That reminds me why I preferred to see a list of awarded films instead of watching a boring event that last hours, watching how overrated movies like this are nominated.Some critics refer to some deep thoughts mentioned in ten seconds of the movie, but that doesn't justifies wasting 140 minutes of your time; so disappointing. If your inner voice make you react and take you back to this line of the multiverse to take the remote control and skip some grotesque scenes, then there is still hope for you, if not, we'll most likely your mind is already trapped in an alternate reality.Hope that you can cleanse your mind after throwing this content on it.

reviews.review_title: First Half Terrific, Second half Boring
reviews.content:
The concept and travelling of multiverse was well shown.Part 1 - Everything
This was the best 1 hr of the movie, which had comedy, Thrill and Suspense. Specially the body jump scene and taking the different skills from other universes body was soo cool. The VFX and Editing was cherry on the top.But Part 2 - Everywhere
The relationship of mother and daughter was dragged too much. It kinda become very boaring to watch as the screenplay was going too slow.Part 3 - All at once
This was very short. It was Good ending.Overall a Good Watch, Just wished they had an actual different villan than her daughter.

reviews.review_title: One of the few things I would give a 10
reviews.content: First off, i wouldn't call this movie full 10/10, but I would lean closer to a 10 than 9, so I rounded up. This film is hilarious, absurd, heartfelt, and visually stunning. This movie has such a strong sense of creative direction that it truly stunned me. One of the most original films ever made and I enjoyed every second of it. I hate to be one of those people who just gushes over a movie and calls it flawless, but this movie is near flawless. I found myself laughing constantly, but when the film wanted you to cry it made you cry. Highly recommend this movie and I doubt any film is going to top it this year.
This movie is what I imagine an acid trip would be like. It has very trippy section throughout the film but it always kept my mind thinking. So in other words. It wack.

It's weird, it's quirky, yet it is one of the most uniquely interesting sci fi movie ever made. Hats off to Michelle Yeoh's performance, her delivery of diverse acting is a masterpiece. Story was very integrating; directing, camera work, action sequences, set and costume designs are all top notch. It was a real visual treat.My one criticism is later part of the film felt a bit slow for me.

reviews.review_title: Love is never the answer for Asian family issues. Twinge is.
reviews.content: I had to pause countless times before I finished watching this movie. It is overwhelming. The problem is not the movie. It is me, a Chinese girl who has given up on everything trying to immigrate. I ditched my beloved major, my family, my friends, my promising career future, and my social status to embrace freedom. Sometimes I could not let myself fall asleep and asked whether it was worth pushing myself so hard. Maybe I could have become a history professor at the best university in my motherland, or at least I could serve my parents to the end of their days. While taking every strength of me to beat the current, it is tempting to hate the fate assigned to you.I noticed that most of the audience is so touched by the successful version of Raymond, who confess that he would like to do the laundry and tax with Evelyn in another life. However, for me, the rock scene and the vibe Raymond shows when he sings Hope You Get Rich and cleans up the mess caused by Evelyn are unbeatable. Evelyn lets joy go, even though it is against her will. The truth of freedom lies in the right to fall. And what the ones who love you do is cleaning up all the mess caused by your self destruction.

reviews.review_title: Given up after 30 minutes of watching
reviews.content: I would describe the first 27 minutes as something between Gilmore Girls and Spanish soap opera with English/Chinese language mix and try-hard superficial humor which I kinda tolerated. Few minutes later there is a full-blown overexaggerated Bollywood-fight-type scene which was my cue to stop watching.

reviews.review_title: A confusing start but an incredible journey
reviews.content: Literally made this account solely for reviewing my first movie on here and wow,just wowYes the beginning is confusing. Yes it's chaotic, a wild ride, yes the hot dogs are weird afBut that's the point. Look at the bigger picture. Stay until the revealThe acting was top notch,the message even more heartfelt. Michelle Yeoh was beautiful, witty and just perfectSeriously just watch it. What have you got to lose? Even if it's a hate watchI guarantee you'll be pleasantly surprised. Hollywood just doesn't make unique films like this anymore and you've got to enjoy it when a gem like this is released.

Think this is the best film I've ever seen and i'm honestly not exaggerating. It is visually stunning, has an incredible concept, is thought provoking, emotional and hilarious. I genuinely can't think of a better film. It was just completely insane overall. It would be easy to think that it wouldn't work because of how out there it was but it totally did work and I loved every second of it! Everyone on screen really gave it their all and I very highly recommend that everyone should watch it as soon as possible. I know that i'm probably gonna be rewatching this a lot of times in the near future.
Though the core is a little "cliche", I just love this movie sooo much.The styles, the editing, the AMAZING creativity just make a simple narrative stunning!Michelle's Yeoh SLAYS!

I really didn't expect the intensity of the violence in this film or the edgy sexual content; the trailer didn't really suggest this and it caught me off guard. I didn't feel well about halfway through the film: the theater sound was super loud and the violence continuous. Why is everything today blood, guts and sexual torment? No wonder society is so lost.

Directors Dan Kwan & Daniel Schienert masterfully co directed and co wrote this wonderful film of multiple realities melding several realms and creating a symbiotic finish. Tons of quirkiness filled with genuine inflection and introspection of inner and outer turmoil within each person and everyone they have a relationship with resulting in continual flux of the stories. Thoroughly enjoyed the story within a story within a storyline. Brava and bravo to the actors for their performances. They captivate us with all of the multiple personalities that come to the surface. Feeling the range of emotions that they express and many times throughout cause confusion. Thank you for this quirky multiple rearmed movie.

Everything Everywhere Simultaneously tells the story of a woman who is dragged into a challenging adventure where she will have to save the world. Evelyn immigrated from China to America with her husband years ago and started a new life. Leading an ordinary life with her family life and job, Evelyn suddenly finds herself in a crazy adventure where she has to save the world. Discovering other universes connected with alternative lives that she can live in, Evelyn learns that she has the only power to save the universe in the process.
Yep. I never write reviews but I truly believe that this may be the best movie I have ever seen. The entire thing from start to finish was amazing. I cried at the end. Also go call your mom.

111 out of 10 starsEverything Everywhere All At Once feels like a mind-blowing combination of a kung-fu movie, kung-fu movie parody, soap opera, dramedy, live from the Lincoln Center opera, & Sci fi with an emotionally deep culture clashing family written by someone with ADHD doing acid listening to some Darkside Of The Moon, while Heavy Metal the movie is playing in the background, staring comic con favorite celebs, being aimed at for an Academy award based on a book by Phillip K Dick, remade by James Gunn, the Snyder cut version, choreographed by Sammo Hung, produced by Eli Roth, stunt coordinator Zoe Bell, anime, anime adaptation.Imagine if the comic con people started their own movie studio & had it run by cosplayers: Ivy Doomkitty, Jessica Nigri, & Animia. That studio would have made this movie.The storytelling feels like you're just flipping through channels & getting one big story from the channels being combined cohesively.None of the people named are involved, it just feels like if they were is what I'm trying to convey.

reviews.review_title: The best movie that I have seen recently
reviews.content: It's an action movie, but it more than an action movie. It is easy to watch and it does an incredible job during the comedy parts It also told a great story about.a normal women growing up., learning about herself, finding what is most important for herself, reconciliation with her family and herself and take the next step for her life.

I knew next to nothing about this movie before seeing. I think I know even less after seeing it.It was a wild ride or space and time hopping madness that made me laugh, cry and even applaud.One of the most original, adventurous and mind altering movie experiences I've had for some time. Highly Recommended.

This piece of art of a movie does exactly what it says. Everything everywhere all at once. This movie nears perfection in every aspect of a good movie. There is no « i love the plot, but the characters felt shallow », there is no « it was flashy but i got bored ». This movie is a mystical experience combining visual, auditive, psychological, philosophical, humoristic perfection. Read no further. Watch it.

Some people will laugh and ignore this movie, others will simply call it best movie ever made.I haven't done research on the "Daniels" but they might have tapped into something profound here.There are way too many references to the mystics and eastern spiritual philosofies. Like "Mr Nobody" the movie puts the viewer in whats like to be in the 5th plane where we are not prisioners of time instead we have access to timelines, but goes beyound reaching the 6th (choices) and 7th (physical properties), ultimately lands in the realm of empathy and compassion through understanding of others perspectives to prevail in unity of the present moment.There are many alternative lives out there but them all find beauty in the simple things.

Some parts of the movie were really funny, and the jokes on spot on many level. But the script of the movies, the changing scenes, without any logic... Do not get high and see this, you will loose your mind...in not a good way.Worth watching it once in your life, at home, for free. After that forget that it is existing. Or not...One more thing... Eat a bagel for breakfast once in a while.Its makes no sense 🤣

reviews.review_title: Don't walk into the everything bagel void
reviews.content: Everything everywhere all at once is completely and utterly absurd. Submitting yourself to the absurdity of it all is one of the many lessons that this movie gives the viewers.In between the crazy montages of parallel universes, we find an unassuming family made up of Gong Gong, Evelyn, Waymond and Joy; who are grandfather, mother, father and daughter.Each character is struggling with some form of anguish in life, such as marriage problems, enduring generational trauma or plain old dissatisfaction with the daily grind, yet at the core of these troubles is a group of people who love each other fiercely, even though they seem to love each other in a way that none of the other characters understands. As reality unravels around this family their love for each other manages to bind them together.This movie is about healing, being proud of who you are and finding the joy in the life you have rather than daydreaming about the multitudes of lives you could've lived.The movie itself is artistically complex and obviously well produced. I don't think the acting in this movie was necessarily the best I've ever seen, but I still wouldn't replace any of the actors. They were the perfect choices for each character and story.I really, truly don't understand how people who admit that they didn't watch the whole movie are being taken seriously as reviewers. If you don't want to watch this movie, I'd completely understand, but if you are going to watch it, at least watch the whole thing because it all ties together neatly in the end.I feel like there's so many other things I'm leaving out, but I'll spare you the rambling and just finish off by saying that everything everywhere all at once is a perfect balance between comedy and drama.If nothing matters, then you're free to live your life in any way you want, and everything CAN matter, if you want it to. But remember to be kind.Side note: there should really be an epilepsy warning for like 5 seconds of the movie.

reviews.review_title: My Emotions: Everything Everywhere All at Once
reviews.content:
A beautiful, impactful, and memorable rollercoaster of emotions that deserves the respect and awe of critics, therapists, and those struggling with the challenges of mental health.It's like Stanley Kubrick, Christopher Nolan, and Quentin Tarantino had a love child with the emotional impact of Spielberg and Scorsese. I can't remember the last time that I cried in a movie theatre for a new film. All I could think about was how I have treated myself and others while battling
"The Bagel." This film offers perspective, closure, sentiment, and the opportunity to reflect on your life, yourself, your past, present, and future.

reviews.review_title: THIS...is how a Multi-Verse should be!
reviews.content: Once again Ms. Yeoh gives us an amazing performance! Have loved her since Tomorrow Never Dies! The movie keeps you on your toes and the visuals are incredible! Thanks for the amazing movie!

reviews.review_title: Didn't know what I was walking into
reviews.content: This experience felt like a punch in the throat. I laughed, I cheered, and I cried. This movie will stick with me for a long time. I suggest avoiding any trailers or reviews.

reviews.review_title: It is not only a movie, it's a master piece
reviews.content: It's not an usual commercial movie that you will expect to see like the Marvels, the DC or matrix etc. Its an original film with bizarre plots and colourful vivid scenes, besides alots of funs, lots of unexpected, lots of actions, lots of imaginations and lots of emotional impacts. It might change your perceptions of life, living, fade, family and relationship as it does to me. I love this movie so much, its a real master piece of art.

Everything Everywhere All at Once is beautifully written and directed by Daniel Scheinert and Dan Kwan. This movie is about a Chinese woman named Evelyn wang played by Michelle Yeoh, who is running a laundromat and has a failing marriage with here husband Waymond wang played by Ke Huy Quan. Evelyn is soon tasked with saving the multiverse from her daughter Jobu Tupaki played by Stephaine Hsu. Michelle Yeoh and Stephaine Hsu both play their characters wonderfully, the emotion they give off in every fight, every conversation seems so real, Ke Huy Quan also gives an amazing performance, he can play a shy and goofy husband that seems like he has no real intelligence and he can also play a man who is just an absolute savior. I think the most outstanding performance in this whole movie is Stephaine Hsu as Jobu Tupaki/ Joy Wang I love their take on the theory of the Multiverse and the way they tackle this idea is quite unique and something that I've never seen. Throughout the movie we see the camera pan to things like a vent in the ceiling or the characters would make say something that sounds like it is not relevant to the movie but in actuality later in the movie it would play a major part or that thing they said would pay off and show up in the movie later. I love the comedy in this film like when Evelyn mixes up Ratatouille with a racoon and calls it Racacoonie, and when Eveyln is fighting Jumpers they try to get abilities by shoving a weirdly shaped employee of the month award up their butts, this film does not try to hard to be funny like most other comedy films. I also love the action in this film, the choreography is amazing like when Alpha Waymond is fighting the IRS security guards with a fanny pack, or when Eveyln is fighting the Jumpers all of these are fantastic especially with the blend of their special effects, with a budget of 25 million dollars it feels like the budget is higher with all the special effects because it is so damn good. I have so much to say about this movie that I cannot express into words but this Movie is so good. The themes of the movie like nothing matters,or something kindness is the key and many other themes are just perfect and can blend in well with this film, The emotion you can hear in the characters like when Evelyn, Waymond and Joy are fighting in the parking lot, there is so much raw emotion that can make you cry. But the only problem with this movie is that it has to much going on for it, there is multiple universe they talk about once and it can be confusing the first time you watch the movie but after a bit you will get used to it. I have no more to say about this movie except that this is a must watch movie and if you want to watch a movie that can make you upset, Happy, grossed or just anything you have to watch this movie. Everything Everywhere all at once is a 9.5/10 film and should get the recognition it truly deserves.

reviews.review_title: An awesome way of telling a simple story.
reviews.content: Everything Everywhere All at Once is one of those films where its style over substance, don't get me wrong I think the movie is good, but only that...good, with potential to be great! But it missed the mark for me a little bit, I didn't really care about the characters as we spend minimal time building them so it was hard to feel that deeper connection with them.The visual effects and cinematography with some aspects of the screenplay were the best I've seen in a movie in the last couple years. It was really great to see such strong Asian actors kill it on screen with the long awaited Ke Huy Quan who was one of my favorite child actors playing Data on the Goonies and James Hong who I don't think I've seen I film from him since Big Trouble In Little China and last but 100% not least Michelle Yeoh who gives an absolutely stellar performance through-out the entire film, even going back to her kung-fu roots which I'm sure was a great sight to see for any kung-fu film fan me included.What I didn't like about the film is all the answers are just given to the viewer, no room for the viewer to figure things out on their own. Some scenes didn't feel genuine and the script is quite stilted in some scenes, the pacing could have been better but its an a24 film so i guess that's expected .BUT all in all its a good film with potential to be great.

That's some $6.99 I paid Amazon Prime for lost 20 minutes of my life.I couldn't take it.Not only it's a weird movie, it's a nonsense bull$hit.It goes poorly from the beginning, a mixture of English and Mandarin.Maybe I should have given this a chance.I don't know.I switched instead to watching another movie.And now I have to write 500 characters review for some reason.Don't waste your money and time with this movie.What ever people tell, it's not worth it.I hope my review is not biased and I did not misjudge the movie by its beginning.Give it a try. You might like it.Or not.End.

reviews.review_title: A Movie about Life, Friendship, and The Perennial Philosophy
reviews.content: "Everything Everywhere All at Once" is a movie about a group of friends who are all trying to figure out what they want to do with their lives. The main character, Lila, is stuck in a job she hates and is constantly searching for something more. Her friend Ben tells her about a philosophy called "The Perennial Philosophy," which believes that everything in the universe is connected and that there is an underlying unity to all things. This idea resonates with Lila, and she begins to explore it further. She meets different people along the way who help her learn more about this way of thinking, including a man named Simon who has devoted his life to spreading the teachings of The Perennial Philosophy. Through her conversations with these people and her own exploration, Lila comes to realize that maybe there isn't one specific thing she's supposed to be doing with her life; instead, she can find meaning in simply living each moment as best she can.I really enjoyed this movie because it made me think about my own life and what I want out of it. I also loved the characters-they were all so relatable and likable (even though some of them were frustrating at times!). And finally, I appreciated the philosophical side of things-it was interesting to learn about The Perennial Philosophy and how its ideas could be applied to everyday life. Overall, this was a thought-provoking film that left me feeling hopeful about finding my own path in life.

It has been a while since I have come out of a cinema feeling different. I am always worried about any type of content that tries to tackle multi-verse or time travel because I feel like it often leads to paradoxes that disconnect you from the story. In Everything Everywhere All at Once I did not feel any of that, even though there are plenty of plot holes and inconsistencies to point out.Part of it is, of course, the comedy aspect of the movie. But beneath this layer there's a very well told, and surprisingly consistent message of "no self". For me, it reminds me of 2 books combined, namely "Man's Search for Meaning" and "No Self, No Problem".It is an incredibly powerful message, told in a very dorky yet incredibly effective way. I was hooked from start to finish and I feel like the movie's message will linger in my mind forever. I feel humbled and empowered at the same time.

This film is weird, really really weird. At many points it feels like it contains all the ideas from pitch meetings that get thrown out when the boss says 'there are no bad ideas'. Though when most would immediately shoot these down and judge the life of whoever blurted them out, this film uses them in a chaotic, almost beautiful way.While the concept of a multiverse has been beaten to death a bit recently (particularly with Marvel), this film commits like it had nothing to loose. It explores so many different aspects of multiple realities and existence to the max that it's painful to try to take it all in. It builds and builds and builds into more and more unthinkable scenarios but keeps a personal, meaningful core throughout. Where certain (marvel) movies would keep building the stakes to a destructive cgi monster fight this never looses touch with what story it's actually trying to tell.This is a remarkable film with a unique take on an idea, incredible visuals, elaborate stunts, perfect performances, and a touching story to follow through.(You need to be in a very particular mood to really enjoy this film. I wasn't lying about the weirdness but it does have purpose and charm if your up for it. If not maybe try it again another time or look into the work behind it or maybe it's not for you. All good options) :)

No, it's not a masterpiece. It's clever and imaginative. But it's too long. Too much of everything everywhere all at once. The unrelenting Kung Fu and over-the-top action becomes boring after a while. And the farting camels. Oh, there were no farting camels? But the butt plug fight... No, it was the - what again? Lots of gags that are funny to 14 year olds. Have you seen the one where they... wow, never seen that in a movie - snicker... A great Kung Fu master shows restraint. So does a great filmmaker. Not here. Just because you can think it, you don't have to say it, let alone film it. And humanizing the irs, who take from middle class folks hard earned money to give to bloated military contracts so that some devious people can get rich... Alright, that's going too far now. Jamie Lee Curtis is excellent, so is everyone else in the cast. And the "message" is at least positive - open your third (googly) eye and realize that compassion and love is what you need, and it doesn't matter if you're rich or poor and what your life is or could've been materially. Throw everything you can think of and a kitchen sink in to tell that story and you got yourself a movie.

reviews.review_title: Past present and future different timelines and parallel realities at once
reviews.content: Past present and future different timelines and parallel realities at once.I've actually experienced this... Or at least saw it in meditation and understand the idea of multi verses and infinite timelines and alternative realities. I read some of the bad reviews and I'm guessing they also don't understand the matrix or their third eye isn't open. I think the movie was brilliant and different. And makes you think of the possibilities of infinite timelines and collapsing timelines to your desired reality.

I haven't been so surprised by a movie in a long time. Went in expecting some silly alternative dimension fun and got presented with a masterpiece. I genuinely did not know what to expect half of the time, that's something you can rarely say about movies anymore. I laughed and cried. ( Never in my life imagined I so idk be bawling because of some rocks). The cinematography is also beautiful, as are the amazing costumes. The actors performance is great and moving. This movie means a lot to me and comforted me in a time where I was uncertain about my life. This movie is going on my comfort movie list for sure. If you struggle in your life I really recommend you to watch this movie it puts things into perspective and leaves you with a beautiful warm feeling for days on end.

I didn't even look the score on rotten tomato but i just know they will give this movie 90+ % . If its about gey right and so, yep over 90% from RT
They just support anything that involves gey people and understanding and mixed colors with emotions and so on... This movie is just big confusion maybe this is how it feels when you do drugs O. O ..And one more thing that was amazing to me... Lo Pan is still alive !! Good God this man is Amazing. Michelle Yeoh, Ke Huy Quan, Jamie Lee Curtis amazing actors i watched this movie because of this 4 !

Starting good, good acts, then the low cost movie pops in just multiverse of ugly costumes, average mid-low class family, and the bagle, god I hate the bagle so much, but yet the power of love will solve all.

reviews.review_title: The best film I've seen all year.
reviews.content: This film really is a masterpiece. The overall message is so profound and yet so simple. It's beautifully made and absolutely crazy, hilarious and heartbreaking. GO AND SEE THIS FILM.

Dont go into it with details, the less you know the more entertaining it is , but that being said heres my review. The movie is straight up weird, it takes so many random turns thats compile upon each other and the genius is the plot that unravels in way that pulls them all together into cohesion. Theres so many details to the movie that they didnt breeze past and i think thats what makes it one of a kind. The raccoon ratatouille, the outfit changes the outrageous fights, etc. They took a general plot concept and gave it authenticity and Alice in wonderland details. They did what so many low budgets films try to do and thats pull off weird in a way that isnt cringey and unrealistic. This movie was alot funnier then I thought it would be , I absolutely loved the rock scenes. There's something so refreshing about seeing something completely new AND good, and this was it. Its got great shots of aesthetic fights, funny unexpected laughs, clues and puzzles and attention to detail like no other, definitely worth watching once !

Had to force myself and not cry at theaters, masterpiece, now gonna rewatch home so I don't have to force back tears. Didn't expect much at first, but the movie got progressively deeper and funnier as it went on, please do yourself a favour and watch this masterpiece.

I was so bored... great talent was wasted. I thought perhaps it was just me but then I got onto other media and a lot of people felt the same as I did. "Nothing, nowhere over a long period of time " was one review I read and I have to agree. I had really high hopes for this movie as it was buzzed about so much.. really overhyped and I really like the main actress Michelle Yeo but I was so disappointed and it just didn't keep my attention. And so much violence! I also felt that half the dialogue was just gibberish. A lot of scenes just switched from one parallel world to the next and to me it just didn't make sense..

reviews.review_title: Why have I done? why I wasted my time on it?
reviews.content: It started great. Trailer was also good. IMDB rate was high. I am sort of a busy guy and I barely have time to watch movies, however, after seeing the IMDB rate of this movie, I thought, why not? It's been a while I didn't watch a quality movie so let's give it a shot. The bad thing about me is when I start something, I rather finish it to the end and to top that up, I was so devastated at the end of this movie that I told to myself quiet loudly, what have I done to myself and my time? And why people should give it this rate? Absolutely overrated movie in my opinion, no aim, no sense with mediocre acts. I am being generous to rate it 3 and it's only because of the action scenes. I hope no one else with the same working schedule that I have gone through this misery.
I don't think I understood it. I definitely wasn't high enough. It was too long. It was funny.And I have a suspicion I'll return to this and rate it considerably higher later.It has something.

I didn't come there with high expectations, but I left the cinema completely mind blown. The best and most original movie I think I've seen so far. Great pacing, nothing felt like it was unnecessary, great concept by itself and ever better realization of it. I love that it's not only the adventure and jokes, but it's a mix of emotions. Love how you start to question things, how you watch the struggles of characters, how every single aspect of them matters a lot and they are all well written. The movie made me burst out laughing but also cry. A truly amazing experience.

Although having an inherently positive and humbling message that in life, however meaningless, there can be found meaning through love it can be a little cringey at points. Visually, through multiple scenery and costume channels, the film is amazingly beautiful. It slightly feels that character development could be a little more interesting at times, but, they are indeed relatable to the everyday viewer. Various stimulating action points through martial arts stunts keep the easily distracted viewer intrigued and connected to the basic, yet sometimes confusing, storyline of the film and the individual characters within. Overall, although at points one may cringe, the comedic elements, and substantial message, power the individual viewer's enjoyment.
Creativity and beauty combined, great film..., but be concentrated not a movie to watch meanwhile you hit tik tok!The lead character deserves a nomination to everything, outstanding.
It is hard to categorise this movie into any genre action, comedy, fiction, romance, it has all, like a rollercoster of movie experience. So let just categorise it as 'good movie'

During more than 2 hours watching the movie you will be tortured by: cheap crap jokes and humor, lots of annoying CG and jump-cut, ridiculous Kung Fu fights
Advice for those who wanna to go see this movie: DON'T.

It's been too long to have this emotional mashup on a movie. It's indeed a masterpiece work that encompasses various big ideas from quantum physics, portrayed in light-dark comedy.It's really as the title name this movie includes all at once, Action, Comedy, Drama, Martial Arts, Romance, Tragedy... with an excellent acting performance.

reviews.review_title: Laugh, Cried and a beautiful narrative
reviews.content: I do genuinely believe any bad reviews this movie gets is from the kind of people who loose focus when talking to their friends/mothers/partners. What we had here is a beautifully executed incredibly well made movie that feels completely fresh and unique that explores themes of love, kindness, adolescentce and adversity.The introduction of concepts and characters were well written and done in a way to make the most sense to the audience as possible. A well trodden line between exposition and spoon feeding the audience.TLDR; Cried three times, laughed a bunch. The actors were vesitile and fresh. Well done.

The philosophy behind the film is clear and can be interesting for many people but the poor execution ends up overshadowing this, it is an almost experimental film, the mix of drama with comedy does not end up making sense or coherence so it does not contribute to the plot. The special effects are the only thing that ends up standing out.

It was like a weird dream .. that i had to watch it when i was awake , i repeat ... i HAD to watch it . It was one of those thing that is necessary to see , your consciousness might not get it but your sub-consciousness will .

reviews.review_title: If anyone wants to make a movie please watch this movie first
reviews.content: It's like I watched 10 movies all at once ... It's so well written.The soundtrack is amazing too and so dreamy.Great message I hope everyone watches this movie.

This is the first time a movie has made me leave a review... and I've been on IMDB for more than 10 years (that alone means a lot).This movie has it all: action, suspense, humor, emotion... everything! At the same time, the movie is so well written that I never felt "helpless" but was able to follow along well. The story is complex, but you are taken by the hand, so you never get lost.I don't want to go into too much detail about the story, but you don't leave the theater with question marks (regarding plotholes).Furthermore, the film scores with ingenious acting of all involved without exception and ingenious animation and sound.I cried, laughed and completely lost myself in the film... the film made me think and I will certainly see it a few more times in the cinema.This is cinema. This is art.10/10!

Man!! This was the kind of movie I was expecting from Marvel. Anyways.. I loved the movie soo much. I was in love with each and every character of the film. If you are having second thoughts about this masterpiece.. just go for it!!! You willl never regret this decision.

reviews.review_title: Acid trip to multiverse of absurdity
reviews.content: So this is about a multiverse thats even more complex than comic movies' lol. I think this movie is not for everyone, though. Within the complex layers of trippy-ness and absurdity, the movie has really deep meaning.With that said, for me, well, I got entertained on the first act, then it got REAALLY trippy and convoluted on second act, so at third act I just wanna see the closure and be done with it. Its so trippy that sometimes it gives me nausea effect, and the bizzareness and absurdity FAR outweigh the film's overall feel, even though I get what the film is trying to say.So.. what's my final take on this film? All the actors played here gave great, ..no, superb performances. Film's message was great. Visuals and art direction were great. But it's still very hard to rate this movie. A part of me wants to rate it 9, but also wants to rate it 3 at the same time. I like it, but at the same time, not really. So.. at the end, I feel like this really isn't my jam, definitely wont ever rewatch it, even though I do like and appreciate some parts of it, especially the film's message.Rate: not for everyone/10.

Movie delivers you everything which anyone can expect from a multiverse though it is quite complicated to understand who doesn't know about multiverse ... but but the vfx the power-packed performance of each actor was so good and amazing that it will hold u with ur seats to just see what will going to happen next over all its one of my favorite movie which made me think about it after stepping out from theater unlike other movies which u just watch and then forget ... if u are looking for a movie which activates each brain cell of ur mind then go for it ..... Don't procrastinate amazing people.

reviews.review_title: The best movie of the year?
reviews.content: After some time and many recommendations, I have finally seen the film and now understand why it is so positively received.Well, the film is very emotional, its concept is absolutely bizarre, it plays with several genres and above all it is also crazy, even a bit punk.Ah, and Michelle Yeah is simply fantastic!And when do we see crazy things anymore?You see, too rarely.But it's also, above all, a family drama that focuses on a mother's relationship with her daughter in an incredible way.And the film is a great philosophical work about how to be your best self.So, it's worth seeing.Go and watch it in a movie theatre.

After taking Existentialism in high school, I would never have dreamed a movie about "life is meaningless" would have me laugh-crying at the end.The genre bending of the Matrix mixed with the multiverse of Marvel and then layered with the most exquisite humor of Scott Pilgrim, this movie was incredible.I cannot imagine how the screenwriter conveyed such absurd concepts (hot dog fingers, talking rocks, not to mention a beautiful raccoon riff) to a director who "had a vision for what they wanted on the screen (?)" who was able to get the actors to so convincingly amp up the nuanced acting as we flit back and forth to the same universes where the continuity manager's head must have popped. The white board for this concept must have dwarfed any previous movie and the editor had so many cuts that had to sync up. Just wow.Hats off to the entire cast. Well done and beautiful. The ending was not at all what I expected and I cried (?) several times as it wrapped up. And the ratatouille references made me laugh. Thank you Hollywood for this one of a kind movie and Yeoh you are the best. I cannot believe a woman so versatile, beautiful, and physical can be in her sixties. You the best!

This movie is a masterpiece, and actress Michelle Yu her acting was very beautiful in this movie, and she deserves an Oscar
For me the direction of the movie is very beautiful, and the way the mental conflict is portrayed was very eloquentA standing ovation to the director of the film
who successfully delivered the idea of the film
An Oscar-worthy movie, I'd be surprised if it didn't winWorth watching

worth watching
worth watching

worth watching
worth watching
worth watching
worth watching.

In another time, I would hate this movie with a passion. HOWEVER in this reality, I feel like this movie is a MASTERPIECE. So I understand why so many people hate it in the reviews, but luckily I am on the side of the many more people who think it is one of the greatest movies ever made. I feel bad for the people who cannot appreciate and see how brilliant the movie really is. In their reality, I am sure they feel bad for me. What I can say for certain, is that I have shown this movie to many family and friends, and those few who I thought would really love it- were confused and not impressed; but the many more I thought would not get it- they loved it and even cried. I kinda think that haters are just haters and think they are too sophisticated to simply get how deep this movie really is. This movie is number 5 on my all-time favorite list, just behind 'Life is Beautiful' and above 'Life of Pi'. I have seen this movie so many times, and it still can make me laugh and cry harder than any other movie I have ever seen in my life. ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL.

reviews.review_title: Perhaps my favorite movie I've ever seen
reviews.content: Just finished watching this movie... Wow!
