I usually do not get emotional enough to cry during a movie but this movie absolutely tore down my walls and made me feel things I usually don't try to think too much about. It's surprisingly very philosophical and existential. Yet the entire movie is hilarious, entertaining and just all around a wild ride. Such a fantastic film! Everyone should see this.

There are not enough words in the human dictionary to describe what I just experienced. It was profound and completely absurd. It is the MUST SEE OF THE YEAR. I sat in my car sobbing well after the movie just completely humbled and grateful for my beautiful life. If you gave this movie a bad review I would suggest seeing it again and approach it with an open mind and heart. Every little detail was so well thought out and orchestrated perfectly for an audience to feel something they've never felt before!!! BRAVO!!!!

reviews.review_title: A great film that ALMOST sticks the landing
reviews.content: Everything Everywhere All at Once is a film I really really liked but wanted to love. Don't get me wrong, there are so many aspects that I did LOVE. The comedy. The visuals. The performances. The stellar fight choreography. The bonkers physical gags. ALL INCREDIBLE. The Daniels definitely have a beautiful, unique style of directing. Every frame is filled with visual intention and style.But I will say, I really wanted to get hit with an emotional punch, and that department fell slightly flatter than I would have wanted. As a general rule I liked where they took the story, and they had lot of beautiful things to say. But for me...I did feel like they half committed to about 5 different themes.So to be fair, this movie is SUPPOSED to be about "everything". But as far as packing a punch from a narrative perspective it felt a little too split.From what I recall these are the themes/overarching topics I picked out:The first: Evelyn rekindling the relationship with her husband. She learns she has not been present for him as a wife, and has not appreciated him for the sweet, patient man he is.Then the next theme, and most prevalent: Evelyn's relationship with her daughter. She learns she has failed to accept her for who she is and hasn't been communicating how much she loves her.Now the third theme: Standing up for what you believe in. Don't let your life pass by, get out there and be the best you you can be.Ok now the FOURTH theme (which I think they just included to cover their bases), was "kindness". Live life with kindness in your heart and treat others the way you want to be treated.The FIFTH theme, learn to let go of the ones you love. Except also don't let go, if you really love them, hold them tight and never let go? I think?And then theme 5.5, the importance of standing against older, more traditional generations (specifically in regards to homosexuality).So I love ALL of those themes, they're beautiful, and in most moments fairly competent. But they all felt very half-developed in an unintentional way. To me it felt like our protagonist experienced 5-6 different half arcs. All of them were good, I just felt like the movie could have had me in tears if they had fully committed to just one (maybe two) of them.Lastly, from a pacing perspective, the last Act felt like it should have been a bit tighter. The "final climax" of the film (which is generally 5-8 minutes) lasted for a whopping 30 minutes. Emotional montages are great and impactful, but the longer it plays out the more it loses its potency.In conclusion, this movie is still pretty great. I don't want to sound like I'm being TOO harsh on it, I was just so ready to absolutely LOVE this movie. Instead I just really really liked it. 7.8/10.

reviews.review_title: Probably both the best movie and the worst movie I've seen in a long time...
reviews.content: The GoodI haven't been this gripped by a movie in a long time and I've never seen anything quite like it before. This movie is one of a kind; it's incredibly unique. The production was immaculate and intriguingly strange. Hats off to the director and the actors for making this happen.The BadIt could have been little shorter. The movie starts to drag a little bit towards the end but I suppose it makes up for this in the production.Some people may not like how visual the movie is; I've seen a couple reviews where people called the movie a "visual assault."The TerribleThis is one of the most morally shallow films I've ever seen. I was left incredibly disappointed by the philosophy that the movie was promoting at the end. It wants us to accept nihilism, because we're all just a tiny speck of dust on one of several planets in a universe among many.According to the movie, nothing matters and we should do whatever we want to do, but we just have to make sure that we include one important action: "Be kind, especially when you don't know what's going on." What???? So nothing matters and we can do whatever we want to do, except that we have to be nice to other people? If nothing matters then what exactly is the point of being nice? There's no reason to do anything in any particular way if we are all just insignificant.It's as though the movie production was only as immaculate and spectacular as it was just to slyly distract us from the fact that it's promoting nihilism. I think it's reprehensible.The movie eats itself by trying to pass as "inclusive" while simultaneously calling us all insignificant and irrelevant.

I could sum this film up with one word, weird. But let me explain.It actually starts off OK you get to understand the family situation and the multiverse thing comes into play which was alright.Until one universe quite frankly freaked me out, imagine a universe where we all have sausage fingers. So we see Evelyn and Deirdre getting off by stuffing their fingers in each others gobs.Did they run out of ideas on this one? So random. But then again I think this is what they wanted to achieve, so fair enough, they definitely did that.The film just got weirder as it dragged over two hours and was not as funny as I think the creators thought.The goggle eyes was overdone, the rock universe was boring, the magical bagel was ridiculous and when Joy/Jobu Tupaki decides to whack out some dildos for her choice of weapon, seriously?Waymond was a good character though and helped give the film more than 1 star!

This movie is absolutely amazing. Watched it tonight with my friend and we were absolutely amazed at how perfect it was. It contains the perfect mix of comedy without undermining the serious tones and messages in the movie. It's a ride, and a very good one at that. Definitely one of my favorite, if not my new number one favorite, films I have ever seen. 10/10 would recommend, and I do recommend.I hope that it receives the recognition that it deserves, this is truly a masterpiece.

reviews.review_title: Not sure what it's about, but I love it
reviews.content: Underneath all the multiverse romping, martial arts and VFX is a very deep story about how the buildup of daily emotional clutter can blind the relationship between kindred souls.This is the Matrix, but it is also something else deeply interesting.I didn't know Hollywood could still make movies like this.

reviews.review_title: A mixed bag, but excellently made
reviews.content: I thoroughly enjoyed the first half of this film but felt that the second half dragged a bit. As a cinematic experience this film is stunningly well made. It's funny, heartwarming, has some great action scenes and is very, very weird.The performances from all the main actors are brilliant and for the first half at least I felt like I was was watching something very special. Possibly my favourite film of the year so far.However, the second half is where I started to lose a bit of interest. I don't mind a film being a bit odd as that is what makes films original - especially in this world where Hollywood churns out lifeless crap like Uncharted and The Contractor (just happen to be the last two turkey's I've watched) but I felt like the story started to drag towards the end. I started to lose track. Again, I don't mind being confused by films because this just means it's worthy of repeat viewings to pick little bits up you missed the first time - but when it is SO confusing you barely have a clue what's going on, it becomes disengaging and hampers your enjoyment. It could have done with being about 20-30 mins shorter to be honest. After such a brilliant assault on the senses over the first hour, making this over 2 hours just felt a tad too long.Overall this was original, well acted and entertaining so it's worthy of the high praise it's getting, but I can see why it has such diverse scores. It won't be for everyone due to the madness of the last 50 mins.

From the depth of the characters, to the playfulness with what is indeed a simple, yet important reminder, to appreciate what you have - here and now, this film had me enthralled from beginning to end. I walked out from my first viewing completely speechless and in awe of the creativity and thoughtfulness put into this feature. I love the imagination used to tell the simple story of a family, doing what they can to get by, and Michelle Yeohs character experiencing a conflict so deeply human - it was a humbling and beautiful experience through and through. I look forward to checking back in with this movie though my lifetime.

reviews.review_title: Everything Everywhere it was all at once
reviews.content: Best ADHD representation ever. I cried and I laugh all at the same time.I get why some of the comedy could be perceive as cheap but in retrospective that is what happen to some brains when they are bored and they try to make sense of mundane situations. Yes is like using apples to do maths but it's an ADHD brain using the most basic language to explain how it works.Just sit, relax and don't try to make it into the masterpiece that it already is, because you might not get it.It is brilliant!

reviews.review_title: This movie definitely deserves an Oscar nomination, maybe even Best Picture!!!
reviews.content: I'm not a sensual person, but this film has made me cry. Thanks to the director for bringing this incredible and stunning movie to us in 2022, such a terrible year. It makes me believe that this is still something I can like, someone I can love. And there is no obstacle I cannot overcome because I have family and friendships helping me find the point I live and stopping me from falling into the "Bagel." This movie also let me see the possibility that Chinese culture and American culture can be well combined. Finally, I hope that the director team can continue to bring us more works, and I hope that the film can get a good box office in the world so that more people can see this excellent work.

reviews.review_title: ANYTHING ELSE, ANYWHERE...BUT NOT THIS MOVIE!
reviews.content: I have never been driven to write a review on IMDB until I watched this movie and I've been using IMDB for years. Basically, it's schmaltzy sugar-laden mother/daughter relationship drivel wrapped up in some over-the-top martial arts, mixed with some implausible sci-fi meanderings and topped off with some childish, peurile attemps at comedy. The result is a mish-mash of confused, messy, pseudo waffle that pretends to try answer some of life's biggest questions....or was it just the craziest most pointless load of twoddle ever committed to film.....honestly I couldn't wait for it to end....give it a miss and go and do something....anywhere.......but not watching this movie.

Honestly, this movie is the worst out of all the movies I've ever seen.When I decided to watch it in the cinema, after that I realized that this is a tragedy for me, it is not worth watching, even broadcast on tv for free too is not worth it.The existing review is completely unreasonable.

I'm so sick of the multiverse plot.I'm convinced that a group of writers get together, take mushrooms, write down their trips, come back to reality, dump all their notes into a blender, hit "high" and pour out a steaming glass of ridiculous, confusing chaos.

This movie is a wonderful experience. It has been some time since I felt such a powerful experience buy a film. IT is not preaching anything political at you. It is just a wonderful tale of family love.

I decided to give this film a try since I saw YouTube reviews comparing it to Doctor Strange and the Multiverse of Madness. Actually, the plot is closer related to Jet Li's film, The One - only I liked The One. Everything, Everywhere, All at Once is ridiculous! It's silly, over-the-top, and tries too hard to take itself seriously. Pick a street: It's either silly or serious. It doesn't work both ways. Finally, the characters are not believable enough in that the main protagonist goes from a simple house wife to deep other-worldly figure in 2 hours just because the plot required it. Save yourself the trouble and just watch the The One, the series Loki, or Multiverse of Madness.

I had high hopes for this film having heard from others how good it was. I was soooo disappointed. It was just a chaotic roller coaster of messy dialogue and mumbled information. I can't believe I wasted over two hours of my life watching this. I gave it 5 stars because the action/stunts were good and Jamie Lee Curtis played her character brilliantly. Actually, I'm amazed that Jamie Lee agreed to appear in this drivel.

reviews.review_title: I've never laughed and cried so much in one movie
reviews.content: I adored this movie. This movie plays with the viewers. It jumps back and forth between so many scenes and genres and amazingly it works nearly flawlessly! It spoofs the Matrix and ratatouille (LOL!) some other movies, but simultaneously pays homage to them. The movie touches on almost every genre and plays into them. And just when you think the silliness is over the top, it grounds itself in some seriously profound philosophy. What blows my mind is that as big as the movie gets, it then becomes very intimate and is centered on familial relationships and what it means to love those closest to us and life in general.
This movie is the real multiverse of madness.Editing, story, screenplay all are amazing 😍. I think the movie budget is 25 million dollars but this movie is just amazing with this low budget💥.

reviews.review_title: I Love Dreams/ I Love Science Fiction/ I Love Fantasy
reviews.content: This film was a Wonderful ride into the abyss of existence. Felt like A Ken Russell film on DMT... For all the greatness, it does get overcooked by the ending. Nonetheless, so much fun!

I watched the trailer months ago and thought it was interesting but that was it; ok, a sci-fi comedy with a twist, something different from Marvel/DC/Disney..., will watch it, then, sadly, I missed it on the theatre. Luckily, they put it on stream.Never would had I thought this one was one of those films I'd treasure for the rest of my life.At first (very quickly) it may be too strange and fast, but once you set your mind to its pace, it's a joyride.Every performer is on point but Stephanie Hsu and Michelle Yeoh as main characters and Jamie Lee Curtis' supporting role are amazing. Very deep, touching, tender, funny deliveries.Reading that the FXs were made by a small group of friends (9) including the Daniels (Dan Kwan and Daniel Scheinert, writers and directors) is astonishing and they learned through tutorials, impressive.I imagine the script as a mixture of the Wachowskis, Terry Gilliam (edit: there's a photo of him and Yeoh together in his IMDB page, maybe in another universe, hahaha) and Charlie Kaufman; a total chaos that leads to something deep and beautiful.It deserves to be re watched several times to get all the small details. Being a Wong Kar-wai fan I recognised the homage straight away, it made me cry.This is the way, at least I, expect one of today movies industry's favorite topic to be treated, won't tell wich not to spoil anything, you'll find it. Seriously, with respect, with a sense, not just because it sells better or to catch up with some agenda.I think in this case editor and cinematographer not should but MUST be credited right next to the writers/directors, incredible work.

No, 10 is not a wrong score...I would give it 11 if I could.I cried, I laughed, I thought about my fathers death, I smiled because I have wonderful people in my life, felt love because of a wonderful woman in my life. It has nothing to with the movie but as a person with less emotion on the outside - this movie brought it all out of me. All my emotions simply spilled out.. I felt what actors and writers meant for me (audience) to feel it and felt a bit more...it really was everything, everywhere all at once.Move is definately unique, worth the watch. I really can't say anything without spoiling it but for anyone that ever reads this review - enrichen your lives with a bit of silly with a side dish of what really matters in life.
It is a combination of the Matrix, Cloud Atlas,Rick and Morty and Sausage Party.Do yourself a favor and watch the movie tonight!!!!Thank me later.

I could easily reach the text limit talking about good EVERY single aspect of this film is, because it is absolutely brilliant in every aspect. It is beyond a visual treat (if intense in some of the flashing parts) that will have you in a trance like state of "whoa". The entire cast is incredibly strong as well and their character shifts are quite impressive.As a huge film buff who has watched basically everything I can, about halfway through I was already placing it in my top 5, and after that mark, where the emotion and hope and fear of the writing all comes into play...just wow. I'm sure some of the more physical humor (dildos) won't be for everyone and the general wackyness of it all could put some off, but I was mesmerized by it. Never before have I gone from crying from a mixture of love/fear/sadness/hope/loneliness/togetherness ALL AT ONCE to laughing hard while the tears were still coming. This movie is an EXPERIENCE and not just a movie. Thank you to everyone involved for making this.

reviews.review_title: Remarkable film with stunning acting and visuals
reviews.content: This really was one of those films that sit with you for a few days and make you think about its premise in your own life. Such a thought-provoking and original story, with deep characters brought to life by the brilliant cast. Michelle Yeoh's performance showcased wonderful character development, alongside Ke Huy Quan's effortless ability to portray the many lives of Waymond.The visuals of the film are absolutely stunning. Some have described it as "an assault on the senses", which I certainly agree, though it is coherently done so that the audience is not feeling confused or left behind. Colours and slow-motion, among other special effects, are used to create sequences that may read as "ridiculous" on paper but are visually fantastic.A masterpiece in writing, acting, and visuals - 10/10.

I disliked this movie pretty much from the start. For a movie trying to get across such an important message, this was just not the right way. It was so long and too complex, not for any real cause, that I found myself begging for it to be over.I did end up liking the ending, as I like the moral of the story, however, most of the rest of the movie was not necessary, poorly developed, or was super cheesy... I mean, I saw the "villain" from a mile away and even if I didn't, it just can't get any cheesier than that.I also appreciate that people in the comments liked the chaos in the movie, but for me, I don't need a movie to give me anxiety.

This movie is a masterpiece, it constantly one ups where you think it'll go. Not only will this movie have you laughing through the majority of the movie, it will kick you in the teeth with some very emotional, and hard hitting scenes.There really is no easy way to explain what makes this movie so special without spoiling it. Just go see it, you honestly won't regret it!

reviews.review_title: By far the best movie I've seen in years!
reviews.content: So raw and emotional but is able to break that up with humour.Cinematography and editing is outstanding!Would happily spend more money to see this again and again!

Never let it be said that innovation is dead in movies. Sure all that need be said may have already been said in a thousand movies, or books that are as old as the Bible. But that is no reason for us to be lazy and rehash everything exactly the same way. It's possible to say the same thing in a different manner. And that's exactly what this movie does. It's basically a family drama, and the symbolism are way too clear for anyone to miss. A lesser movie would've made the mistake of underestimating its audience by spoon feeding them rubbish information that's clearly way too easy to understand, in an attempt to make themselves look smarter, and the end result would've been a convoluted, conceited mess of a movie. On the other hand, if an obnoxious douchebag (a pretentious prick) had taken the movie, it would've ended up being too ambiguous and self serious. Thank God that was not the case. This movie is fun, light hearted and extremely well paced. The action scenes are so energetic that they keep you on the edge of your seat and the comedy is too idiotic that you can't help but laugh. It's an emotional drama that is disguised as an action, scifi and comedy. Hats off to the writers/directors. This is only their second film if you can believe it. And their first one is a masterpiece of it's own, a little movie called swiss army man.Goddamn, the level of genius is mind blowing. If only others can learn to duplicate such an art, we would've been able to watch more than 3 great movies a year.

Everything, Everywhere, All at Once tackles a very extensively done trope of time/dimension travel however it does it in such a unique way that feels extremely fresh. There is no other movie like this, and the plot; while not shakespearian does a great job of capturing the audience. The film is packed to the brim with comedy, action, adventure and even heartwarming familial bonding moments, it has a little bit of everything. While some parts feel weaker and less focused, the movie as a whole does an excellent job and is definitely worth the watch. Subsequent watches also reveal many things you don't get on the first viewing so that is recommended. While it can be hard to follow along with at times, if you are able to it is one of the best movie experiences of the year.

reviews.review_title: I assume acid is like this.
reviews.content: I loved this film. It was so stupid and so clever. So deep and so silly. It takes a decent amount of time, but what starts out as a comedy, then kung fu flick, turns into a lesson in life which will leave you in tears at its profundity.The action and comedy serve their own purpose and would be enough to get a decent movie together. This film weaves them seamlessly into a solid and novel plot, though.A multitude of concepts I've never seen mentioned, let alone explored in movies, are swirled together into something really special.I really have no idea how a human can imagine this and then film it into reality. A visual and emotional masterpiece like you have never seen, guaranteed.What a thing to make.
Most original picture I had see. Fantastic! No Words can explain my react in the cinema room. I love the uniqueness and the madness of the scenes. Congrats to the Daniels and team.

reviews.review_title: I love crazy films, but this one too incoherent
reviews.content: All I can say is, I love crazy films, but this one too incoherent.It started somehow interesting, after 15 minutes it gets wildy crazy and then it never stops.To me it felt, as if there was no plot at all. Just a bunch of incoherent wild ideas. Thats not enough to be a cult film.I am the type of guy, who watches good films again and again over the years. I have seen some 15-20 times over two decades.There is little or no chance at all, that I will watch this movie again.

I went into this based on trailers and I like Michelle Yeoh in most things she does and all play involved there parts well. For me this movie turned out to be an unexpected surprise, the plot although building in complexity thoughout the movie has an ending that for me was totally unexpected yet relatively simple (sorry trying not to give spoilers away) and I think a lot of people globaly can and will relate to the finale - be exhausted but will relate. Jamie Lee Curtis - hardly recognisable, I gave it an 8 as I still dont understand "hot dog fingers" and probably never will. Everything Everywhere All at Once is the perfect title for this movie, enjoy.

I love Michelle Yeoh and always want her to succeed and deliver. The 1st half of the movie showed promise. I know that people LOVE this movie and have seen it multiple times. I get the multiverse and thought that the jumps were cool. The story wasn't that great, imo.I know that this is an popular theory but I stand by it. This movie isn't great but boy, did I want it to be.

You can make them break the multiverse and expand their consciousness to save you, but you can't make them apologize and take accountability for their actions, apparently.Was a perfect movie until I realized this moment was never happening. She literally stabbed her husband..

I was expecting a good movie, my friends were telling me it was good, so I went to the movies and...my man. It's not just "good". I have no word, maybe spectacular but that forms fit either. The plot is intense, it's funny but very mind blowing all the time. In my opinion it's the best move of the year so far. If anyone is in doubt to see it, just go for it, you'll love.

Finally, a fast paced fun movie that has so many wardrobe changes and plot twists that you literally can't let your mind wander once. Loved it, and the way it morphed into a wonderfully made family love story was the icing on the cake.

reviews.review_title: The Quirkiness and Craziness Won't Be For Everyone, But It Really Worked For Me
reviews.content: It's weird, it's random, it's tone will jump from absurd comedy to action flick to existential drama and back and forth many times throughout. But if you're willing to open your mind and accept the premise for what it is without scoffing, you can be in for a fantastic experience unlike many other movies ever. If I were to describe what this was like, I'd say it's like watching The Matrix on an LSD trip.Like The Matrix, the movie follows the titular character living a somewhat normal life, but is unsatisfied with it before being presented the truth about the world that completely recks their whole basis of reality. What follows is a "chosen one" / "hero's journey" plot where they must use what makes them special to defeat a great evil.Unlike the Matrix though, Everything Everywhere All at Once ends up with a very different theme and message. The Matrix had a theme of fighting the powerful to achieve a better world, but EEAAO has a theme of learning to get past the regreat of the bad choices made throughout your life. But also a theme of being kind to people and accepting them for who they are.As weird and crazy as the plot is, it helps with its themes. The multiverse plot dives into the first and the absurd presentation dives into the second. It isn't just "lol, so random" without purpose. Afterall, eventually having a serious sub-plot involving people who have literal hotdog fingers will either make you shut off the movie or if you let yourself immerse into even that it'll allow you to perhaps have an open mind for the absurd people in your own life so you can better understand them.But there are some truely ridiculous scenes that feel like something from an Adult Swim show so I also can't blame anyone for not being able to get into it. But for what it is, I feel the movie pulls off an extremely memorable experience if you can allow it.

reviews.review_title: The Multiverse movie I wish I was seeing instead of the other multiverse movie
reviews.content: Really appreciate a movie with philosophical depth, good writing and creative visual and comedy design.Also a big plus to have a different race cast without bringing up once the topic of race or race related.Loving this movie, easily becoming a re-watchable artistic movie of 2022.

EEAaO is an enjoyable romp somewhat in the vain of Time Bandits and Hitch Hikers Guide wrapped into a Bruce Lee (so not entirely original - but then, what is in an EEAaO mindset) and, as The Guardian wrote, the film has "spunk, quirky anime-inspired visual panache and absurdist humour." A line in the film is "Be kind, especially when you don't know what's going on." And that seems an appropriate opinion to hold until watching to the end of the film. There are films to see many times, but for me this one is worth to see once, and just enjoy that experience. One never ones when one sees things again, so make good of the moment.

reviews.review_title: Clever with superb acting, though overly long if message isn't new
reviews.content:
The plot develops slowly then picks up speed. The film feels overly long from a plot development perspective, complex as it is it could have been covered quicker. The length at least gives the actors to display their immense talents in making the crazy situations credible, and adding the right amount of humour and pathos. However, I prefer a story that needs the length rather than padding to display the actors and editor's skills
I see how some find the film engrossing in how it's message develops and the characters' realisations of it, but I found myself distracted. Maybe I've heard the message before and admire the presentation but feel little impact. For others I can see it is revelationary. Whoever you are the first 15 minutes drag so don't be put off by them.

An amazing media ration on humanity, existentialism, love and family. Brilliantly written, acted and directed. One of the best films I've seen for quite some time. I'm sure after repeated viewings more ideas will unfold to be picked over. What a ride!!

Some of the goofiest visual effects, stuntwork, and storytelling I've ever experienced in a film. I'm loosely reminded of the feeling that I had watching movies like Kung Fu Hustle, Shaolin Soccer, and films of the sort. The direction playfully explores a composition of profound themes while simultaneously cutting the tension with orchestrated silliness and mystery. One moment you're trying to link the narratives together as you're frantically following a chaotic story progression, and immediately after you're holding your sides from laughter. By the end of the movie, you cannot help but appreciate the underlying message being told. I would call this film nothing short of a masterpiece, and you would be doing your friends and family a favor by recommending it.

I think this movie is fine to watch at home where you can skip a bunch of cringe worthy parts and overly extended seizure inducing psychedelic visuals. It was exhausting to watch in a theatre and should have been half as long. The movie has its merits with funny moments but left me with a headache as I'm writing this.

The premise of the movie sets a very high ambitious goal by bringing in the multiverse concept. Even though at times it's easy to get lost and lose interest in the plot, somehow the movie manages to pull it back from the edge of disaster by being self aware and pushing the limits of your imagination.Actually laughed out loud at quite a few scenes as well.Overall, worth the 10 stars and a rewatch.

If you have any sort of bad relationship to your mom, I definitely recommend a watch. I don't think I've ever sobbed after a movie before, and I chose to watch it with my mom. Cried in her arms afterwards, just mumbling nonsense. 8/10 for me because of character related stuff, and some scenes I thought were out of place with the overall themes. But a good movie nonetheless.

"Everything Everywhere All at Once" is a fresh take on the quickly staleing multiverse idea that is now commonplace in the cinematic world. It follows Evelyn Wang, a mediocre woman who is capable of extraordinary things, and her journey through the multiverses. In exploring who she truly is, she must go on a journey of self- discovery, acceptance and pure unadulterated adventure.

If you have seen more films, you will surely consider the level of this film to be average. The interesting parts of this film were struggles, traveling in a parallel world and comedy.If I had the ability to make a film like this, I would definitely make the best one. Of the two hours of the film, only thirty minutes were useful, the script was strong and the subject matter of the film was interesting.The actors played well, but the choice of actors for the roles was awful. In this film, more than showing the art of acting, more technological effects were used and it was very imaginative.And the best part was the concept of living and being together, which was useful.

At last, someone came up with a movie that had me think, laugh and mesmerized. The boys in the family are usually critical about the movies I suggest and this one was an exception! My entire family loved it! It was crazy, funny but unique movie. Not a typical cookie cutter kind but eccentric. It's a bit too long though. Would have cut down to 2 hrs instead. Actors were great! Will recommend this movie. Worth my time and money. Two thumbs up!

I usually like these kind of movies, it started not bad but then...
They try to do a matrix like with some multiverse with it, but in a terrible way.It's just hard to finish to watch the movie seriously.I lost my time.

reviews.review_title: A very wacky, and fantastic film.... but not for me
reviews.content: This movie has a great message and fantastic visual effects. In fact I liked most things about the movie...except it's just a little too weird for me. I knew it was going to be chaotic and weird, but I just felt some parts were a little too grotesque. It's nothing massive, just weirded me out (like the naked officer and use of private parts in the film). I didn't really find those parts that funny and thought it was a bit unneeded. These parts kinda grossed me and ruined what was otherwise a pretty good film. Perhaps I'm being a bit harsh in my rating, but it really killed the movie for me. Aside from the grotesqueness, I thought it was funny at the right moments, emotional at the right moments and pretty great overall. I'd recommend it if you don't mind the genital jokes/gags, but it wasn't for me.

reviews.review_title: Most entertaining movie since Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse
reviews.content: This was so good! Funny, original, and an overall amazingly entertaining movie. I thought it was slightly too long, the ending was off. Wild movie overall, I think about it all the time and I watched it 2 weeks ago. Must watch in theatres. The special FX, sound, and overall performance from the cast is 10/10. I would rate the pace/length of it at some portions of the plot a 7/10, but overall one of the best I have seen. Made me think of Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse because I was shocked at how good it was. No hype, pure entertainment.

Last few years I am struggling to find a good quality movies to watch. Every time I spent 1 hour just to find something. And sometimes even then movie is not so good xD. I am sure a lot of you who read this will understand what I am talking about.Now about this movie. This is one of the best movies I have ever watched and I am not joking. I was focused every second of movie! In the same time this movie is:
1. The craziest movie ever made
2. Movie with perfect dialogues
3. Movie with strong life message
4. Extremely funny movie
5. Movie with total chaos in it
6. Movie with a lot of psychological knowledgeI was blown away after this movie. I was like what the hell did I just watched. And after few minutes I realized I watched a TRUE MASTERPIECE!!!!!!My personal opinion is that this movie will be one huge favorite for winning the Oscar !

If anyone could make a movie that I'd watch at home and not even think to take my phone or get bored, these guys did it.The picture, the cast, the story
It's flawless.My applause. Thanks for this complicated piece of art.

reviews.review_title: Fun Romp About The Choices We Make In Life
reviews.content: Evelyn, is a Chinese-American owner of a failing laundromat, who lives in a tiny attached apartment. She is pulled into a multi-universal conflict where she summons her talents from roads not taken. This is a fun romp all about the choices we make and family.

Everything everywhere all at once is a unique film, blending kung fu action, science fiction, family drama, comedy and heavy existential dread all in one big pot of soup.It explores some of the heaviest parts of the human experience like failure, unmet expectations, regret, the possibilities that we passed on, what we can and cannot control.It tries to navigate the pain of living a seemingly unfulfilling life and the thought of "what we could have been" but it never gets boring or pretentious as it is always self aware and humorous.Ultimately it is heartwarming feeling that you get when a film articulates so much of your worries and reminds you why what matters is what you have right now.Also I cried for 45' watching it.

Deeply wierd in a way that only a quantum interpretation of a multiple universe theory of everything could aspire too. Evil donuts, sausage fingers and chinese takeaway created a culinary backdrop for relationship wins and fails. I think it was basically my beautiful launderette, but re-imagined after a seriously illegal party... a party like Matt and Boris would have had if there were no moral checks or consequences. I watched on Amazon prime just before match-of-the-day when Man U let 7 past them at Anfield - that just seemed mundane, and I never batted an eyelid.In the end it was fun apart from the occasional paper inflicted self harm which I shut my eyes for.

reviews.review_title: This could have been a great movie
reviews.content: This could have been, and should have been, a great movie. It had all the right themes, a great cast, good direction but it fell down because of way too many fight scenes. Perhaps a movie with an underlying theme of the bond between a mother and daughter dosen't lend itself well to a Kung fu movie, perhaps it shouldn't be tackled by an all male team because the overabundance of fight scenes were really tiring if you're not a male comic book movie fan. I'm not but I thought I might like this movie anyway. I did like Black Panther, the action fit the movie, but this was trying to be all things to all people and it just didn't cut it. The one thing this movie reinforced was thar it might be better if women ruled the world as well as made more movies. There would be less superfluous fighting, more plot, and a shorter, but much better, movie.

What a rollercoaster of emotion! This movie is so beautifully created. I laughed so much while feeling sad at the same time. A family with drama, like any other family. You find something to relate to, and that's what brings it to life. Colorful, playful, hilarious, deep and touching to ones heart.
The story is absolutely mind blowing with the writer thinking out of the box. Funny and really nice to watch. Michelle Yeoh's performance is brilliant and captivating. Definitely recommended!!!

reviews.review_title: How can this be higher than one star?
reviews.content: Haven't seen anything so meaningless. Absolutely terrible.Haven't seen anything so meaningless. Absolutely terrible.Haven't seen anything so meaningless. Absolutely terrible.

reviews.review_title: An absurd comedy with great performances and is a technical feat
reviews.content: This movie is overwhelming and excessive but in a good way. Although it does become too much at some points, it's only adds, and may even be necessary, for the movie to have the same impact that it does. While the moral of the movie may seem a little cheesy, that doesn't make it any less powerful.

reviews.review_title: Back To The Future on steroids, hugely enjoyable!
reviews.content: These two clever Daniels (writers) obviously put their lockdown to extremely good use. I'm a baby boomer so I cant begin to describe the overlaying themes and narratives, & play on genres and film styles except to say by the end of the film I simply floated out of the cinema on a goodwill high. Don't miss it, and don't take the grandkids (a 15 for good reason: beaten withpenises, finialled doorstops, fingers made of hotdogs... and some!) Enjoy!

reviews.review_title: Fed up with the ignorance of haters.
reviews.content: 10/10 for an original more intelectual but at the same time fun take on the multiversal idea and execution. No less than 8/10 for anyone who just wants a different type entertainment.

I'm so grateful I took the time to absorb this beautiful and evocative film.I laughed and cried.I left inspired and confused and entertained.Thank you to the people who made it.It touches our humanity in a deeply true way.

I love everything about this movie, the acting, the art, music, THE PLOT!!, this is a masterpiece and a spectacular work of art. Best movie i have ever seen. So emotional and perfect storytelling that makes you want go out and LIVE!!! And love and experience and embrace life. I literally cannot describe how important it is for u to get tf out and watch this film.Unmatched.

reviews.review_title: The best film of 2022 so far.
reviews.content: It was movie magic throughout the film, A genuinely moving film with great acting, editing and fantastic visuals, it really has it all.And the Oscar goes to Michelle Yeoh, This role really showcases her whole range of acting. She is so much more than just a magnificent martial art and action film heroine.The whole cast was great, Jamie Lee Curtis was hilarious! And it was nice to see Ke Huy Quan. I hope we can see him in the next Indiana Jones film or a sequel to the Goonies, make it happen.

This is easily one of the best movies films I have ever seen. Hilarious, visually pleasing, outrageous, action packed, meaningful, provoking, I could go on. This is an experience that brings you to the basement of your mind and drops you off into everything everywhere all at once.

As human beings, we are taught that we are the only species with the power of choosing. This movie probes into our very complex feelings. We have multiple layers in our dark side. But only one layer to overshine everything about the darkness. The movie offers a very simple solution to our empirical pains.It's easy to neglect the ones around us and wish for ideal people to have around to fulfill what we lack. However, it takes a lot of courage and sacrifice to stand up for our loved ones. Optimism, not giving up and living all kinds of feelings, good and bad, in a balance. In the end, it's what we are made of; the good and the evil. As a complex species, we are not entitled to be trapped in small boxes. We all have the capacity to have mutual acceptance, tolerance, and understanding. It just takes a bit of courage to risk it and set a foot forward.It's a movie anyone would connect to and enjoy. But remember to keep your heart open before entering the theatre salon or pressing the play button.

Overall great film with beautiful cinematography. Insane special effects and captivating lighting made the film enthralling.I gave it an 8 for overall delivery, however I have many critiques.The film went for about an hour too long, lots of repetitive and strung out scenes.Lots of childish humour that took away from the important emotional scenes.Too many pop culture references that made the plot almost "silly" for example the bagel concept. Kinda feels like it was written by a grandma who's spent too much time on facebook.The apparent "life changing" messages the film tried to communicate were very obvious and nothing groundbreaking.The ending was really nice and pulled everything together. The film was beautifully chaotic, and enjoyable watch, but I don't need to see it again.

This was the most exhilarating and funny adventure I've seen on the screen in a very long time! The mother/daughter bond across space/time, soulmates, decisions. You will be taken into a world that very few get to even fantasize about. This it what a good movie is supposed to be!

reviews.review_title: Funny movie with some great scenes but not my cup of tea
reviews.content: This movie is super funny and has a couple of extremely well-made cinematic scenes such as the mix of Evelyn's other identities during her universe jump. The black bagel is also a really interesting object. However, I found the meaning of the movie a bit lacking and it wasn't touching (that's what I look for in a movie vs. Purely entertainment).
Really, really, really loved this movie!I would totally recommend this for everyone! Hard to explain; best if you know as little as possible before the movie.

This outstanding movie is like Mr Nobody meets I Heart Huckabees.A cult classic in the making, with fantastic performances all around.Definitely deserves a second viewing. I may source some hallucinogens for added impact!

Quite literally the title. Imagine doing a movie where you have everything and it is everywhere. Also all at once.One of the weirdest, funniest, most heart warming movies I have ever seen.You have no time to process any sort of emotions, one moment you're sad, one moment you're happy; one moment you're relieved, one moment you're angry.I was worried the ambition of so many things in one movie would fall to pieces, but it really didn't. It held up. It suprises you the more you watch it.Loved it so much.

In Swiss Army Man, the debut film from Daniel Scheinert and Daniel Kwan (collectively and fitting known as Daniels), Hank (Paul Dano) and his corpse friend Manny (Daniel Radcliffe) shoot out of a river propelled on the power of Manny's farts. As they fly through the air, they sing a song to each other that goes: "You just have to remember that we're all here for a purpose, and the Universe picks its time. Everything, everywhere matters to everything." While Swiss Army Man only lightly touched on this idea, six years later, Daniels' second film Everything Everywhere All At Once almost makes this verse a mantra amongst a cavalcade of insane multiverses, unlimited possibilities, and endless creativity. Daniels has given audiences a wholly unique vision that literally feels like everything everywhere all at once.Leading this trip is Evelyn Wang (Michelle Yeoh at maybe her all-time best), who runs a struggling laundromat with her overly-optimistic husband Waymond (an equally fantastic Ke Huy Quan). When we first meet Evelyn, she's surrounded by receipts, thanks to the laundromat getting audited, her husband is putting googly-eyes on bags of laundry, and it doesn't take long for Evelyn to embarrass her daughter, Joy (Stephanie Hsu) when introducing her girlfriend to Evelyn's father, Gong Gong (James Hong). To make matters worse, Evelyn doesn't know Waymond has divorce papers, and IRS inspector Diedre (a hilariously wild Jamie Lee Curtis) accuses the laundromat of fraud. As someone tells Evelyn later in the film, Evelyn is living her worst you.But that's not to say Evelyn hasn't tried to escape her monotonous life. We learn she's wanted to be a singing coach and an author, amongst other interests that became hobbies instead of life-altering careers. But Evelyn's life irrevocably changes when a version of Waymond tells Evelyn that she is just one of many Evelyns, yet she's the only one that can defeat a powerful villain named Jobu Tupaki, who could destroy all the universes (and there are a lot of universes).

Director Mohit Suri's film offers a simple story with several twists throughout the runtime, right till the last frame rolls in. Things slip on the editing table while treating the non-linear presentation of the story. One wishes this was paid a lot more attention to in order to create a better balance between.

SCIENCE MEETS dark HUMOR FANTASY
WITH FAMILY ACTION DRAMA ALL TOP GRADE!!!!!A movie which will help u imagining jumping universe, checking out skills of ourselves in other world, learning through and coming back with top comedy scenes throughout.Amusing background music from the very beginning with human emotions beautifully acted, this movie bring you joy with science at every single shot.This action packed movie is all about sense of humor with intellect of multiverse and have great content writing.A must watch movie for the most imaginative approaches.For science lovers, who loves dark n adult comedy.
I want to give nothing away. This movie is brilliant and my new favorite. All the feels, all the ways, all at once. Michelle Yeoh was the reason I wanted to see it, and per usual she was perfection.

It's hard to explain everything I like in Everything, Everywhere all at Once. Surely there are several little (and big) things I didn't catch. The movie is abundant in symbolism. But I'll try to point out some of them:It's a film with a multiverse clothing over a core of family relationships. In its essence, it's a mother/daughter, wife/husband story. The contrast between a complex sci-fi theme and something so human, with which we deal since the beginning of times, makes it layered and easy to relate to. It's multiversal, but it's universal.The philosophical confrontation of Jobu Tupaki's nihilism and Waymond's optimism. This is another underlying theme that makes the movie speak deeper. Bagel vs. Googly Eyes. As a visual metaphor, one is the inversion of the other (a black symmetrical bagel with hollow center, a white asymmetrical eye with black center). Both circles having similar geometric properties but indicating opposite approaches to life.Throughout the movie, the directors (the Daniels) use several round shapes to address and reinforce this duality. At first, in images as the washing machine's doors or the way Deirdre draws a messy circle on Evelyn's papers, they refer to the donut. Inevitability, lack of finality, monotony. Evelyn is trapped in her routine, in a tedious laundry business, dealing with the IRS. What could be more tedious than laundry and taxes? What is the point? This is Evelyn leaning towards nihilism. By the end, the circular shapes become more asymmetrical and colourful. The chinese decorative lights are framed more instead of the machine's doors in the laundry scenes, Deirdre's pencil has a colourful ball attached on its top. It's optimism taking front.Evelyn makes a journey of getting out of her inertia and self-absorption, experiencing instead her daughter's and her husband's views about life. Thus, comprehending them truly and loving them honestly. The circle now represents connection.Camus said: "What gives value to travel is fear." Perhaps we can conclude that Evelyn's journey was full of fear, full of wanting to get back to what was, but ultimately fear shook her up and she was ready to see value on Waymond's way. The kind way of fighting. Realized that keeping their customers coming and having Deirdre give them more time were Waymond's merit, that past victories were not because of her, but in spite of her. The moment she wears the googly eye as a third eye, she is enlightened. And then, having traveled from nihilism to existentialism, she is able to guide her daughter through the same path. Empathy.I also love the recurrent use of irony. This is an exhilarating movie about laundry and taxes! The name of the daughter is Joy! Also, the very fact that the worst version of Evelyn is the best fitted to save the multiverse is hilarious. Being always just one decision from a better version of herself, Evelyn is able to connect more easily to all her better universes. As she chose always the worst path, several better paths and it's acquired skills are now uniquely close to her. There is a lesson the movie wants to teach us here.Even the most ridiculous universes are capable of carrying deeper and valuable meaning. In fact, the Daniels seem to dedicate themselves to come up with the most extravagant, nonsensical, absurd ideas, and commit to them, just to reinforce the argument that it is possible to find the best in the worst. The hotdog fingers could be just a brief visual gag, but became a full arc, as did Raccacoonie, and contributed decisively to the final resolution.It adds to this approach that the most violent scenes are filled with comedy and feel frivolous. And that the most laughable settings or visually empty parts carry an emotional punch. The rocks, how do not cry with them!The movie is named Everything, Everywhere All at Once and hardly I've seen any movie edited and composed so fittingly to its name. It's remarkable that it can be so cohesive with such a wide range of subjects, genres, techniques.Is it sci-fi, comedy, coming of age story, martial arts, romance, thriller? Everything at once. The mix of genres make it impossible to classify.Is it spoken in english, mandarin, cantonese? Everything at once. Grandpa speaks cantonese, daughter english, husband mandarin, and Evelyn has to mix it up. At first, the cultural and language barriers within the family act as barriers to deeper relationships. At the end, the mutual acceptance, empathy and the realisation of their connecting lines bring the family together, and they are richer because of their diversity.Is it 1.33:1, 1.85:1, 2:1, 2.33:1? All aspect ratios at once. 1.33 (4:3), reminiscent of old TV screen proportions, used in flashbacks. 1.85, an aspect that can fill the entire movie screen without pillar boxes, used on dialogues, romantic moments and other situations were realism is needed. 2.33, the widest of them all, in cinematic fight scenes or large scope shots. 2.0, an odd and uncommon aspect ratio, in the sausage fingers' universe.What lenses and cameras were used? All at once. In fact, each universe is also shot and colour-graded in different ways. Anamorphic vs Spherical lenses, several cameras, flatter/colourful/greener gradings... these all are used and yet the final result is cohesive. To achieve that the editing here is nothing short of spectacular. Wow, those transitions!There are also a plethora of references, homages. The most obvious ones: Kubrick's 2001, Tarantino's Kill Bill, Pixar's Ratatouille, Wong Kar-Wai's In The Mood for Love. Also, Matrix, Hong Kong kung fu movies, and several others influences can be spotted. A multiverse of movies within this one.The soundtrack is a masterpiece. We also have everything at once here. Clair de Lune, pop songs, mayan flutes, circus and western themes... dozens of small motives, arranged differently according to the context. Each one helping us identify a universe, a character relationship. For instance, Clair de Lune appears for the first time in a fight scene between Evelyn and Deirdre. When Evelyn can finally say "I Love You" in a truthful manner, it plays. Afterwards, we find out that there is a universe where both are lovers, and Clair the Lune is the soundtrack of this relationship.Another example: Waymond says: "Your clothes never wear as well the next day, your hair never falls quite the same way", describing the multiverse. This is from the 2000's song "Story of a Girl" by the one-hit wonder band Nine Days. When he says it, many of us possibly sensed something familiar about those words, but not quite sure what. A very parallel universe/deja vu kind of feeling. Afterwards, the song plays in the movie, including different versions of the lyrics and arrangements, made by the original band, according to each universe.Add to all that the superb acting from all 4 main actors. They are mesmerizing. Michelle Yeoh delivers a wide range of several versions of herself. And among all that, she conveys the stages of fatalism, self denial, enlightenment and acceptance Evelyn has to pass through. Ke Huy Quan transforms from kind and naive to confident and experienced with just a flick of his expressions and body language. We are never confused about what version of Waymond is on screen. Stephanie Hsu is as big as Jobu Tupaki is, and not every actor can pull it off. The hopelessness , the solitude, the sense of inadequacy, all there in her eyes. Jamie Le Curtis was never freer, exposing a vulnerability I've never seen in her past roles. A bravura acting. All 4 of them fully deserving of their Oscar nominations.At the end of the 3 acts, all this ridiculous amount of everything imaginable surprisingly showcase a cohesive work. How could the Daniels put everything in this bagel and come up with something as tight as this marvels me. It is another testament to the recurring theme: connection. Emotional, visual, thematic.All connects as in a circle.

reviews.review_title: In the True Multiverse of Madness
reviews.content: I heard good things about this film and was curious to see it. I finally did and wow, what a film! It has imagination, action, comedy and drama. And the film juggles all of these things very well. But what most surprised me is the fact that this film also has a lot of heart and can make you laugh and cry almost simultaneously. I highly recommend.
I feel like the writers had to be on massive drugs to write this but because of the randomness I laughed so much. If you love Rick and Morty or Avengers, this movie is for you.

reviews.review_title: great cast in a plot that is sometimes complex to follow
reviews.content: The movie's exploration of the multiverse is both visually stunning and thought-provoking, weaving together complex scientific concepts with inventive storytelling techniques that keep the audience engaged from beginning to end. The film's special effects are particularly impressive, adding an extra layer of immersion to the already captivating story.The performances are generally strong, with Michelle Yeoh delivering an outstanding performance as Mei. Her character brings a relatable and emotional core to the film, balancing out the more abstract and philosophical aspects of the story. The rest of the cast, including Stephanie Hsu and Jamie Lee Curtis, also do an excellent job of bringing their characters to life, adding depth and nuance to the overall narrative.

This is written for someone who doesn't typically enjoy movies where the weirdness burdens the narrative of the film.However, despite having no idea of what I just watched, I had a lot of fun watching it.

This one of these movies that explaining or trying would do just damage to whoever is watching it for the first time. Instead I will give the same advice that was given me, hold tight, pay attention, and you'll have a an amazing experience.I read a couple of the bad reviews here and as expected they are mostly from people who could not understand some principles that might be important for a movie touching the multiverse topic. So if you are not familiar with it, or the idea of philosophy or even rejecting the reality we live in, you will have issues following the plot. There's no such thing as "too silly" to be possible kind of reality, our universe itself is as ridiculous as it can be, we would look just as silly from the perspective of minds from a universe where ppl walk upside down or just the fact the walk at all.More importantly this movie send me to a journey through most emotions. It felt like action at times, suspense n horrors, but really a lot of really funny times filled the will of humans to feel complete and the power of loving and being resilient to the adversities of life.

reviews.review_title: "Everthing Everywhere All At Once" 50/50 right down the middle review
reviews.content:
"Everthing Everywhere All At Once" 50/50 right down the middle review
.First of all, this should have been 2 movies, the first of which ended at the end of part one. That's what I'm saying, and i want you to really ingest the suggestion and its implecations,
instead of thinking "crazy person" and clicking back to find another review,
whether you want to read
a more positive review or one listing all the faults so you don't have to burn the brain calories (can actual faults be found??)
I humbly submit that this review features BOTH. With actual ASSERTIONS which are then TESTED rhetorically and result in
a JUDGEMENT (or a couple)
and even distilled to a single NUMBER.My assertion, at least in part to justify a pun injected into the review title,
that this movie, which,
in its current form, stands at number 108 on IMDB's list of most favorably reviewed movies of all time; not only that, consider the fact that it's only been released a month ago: nowhere to go
but up.That's pretty damn impressive,
so take anything I say with a grain of salt, because if the whole world loves it and I say it's flawed, the chances that I'm a crank are high.Nonetheless I insist it could have been better,
were it chopped in half.My reasons for this are as follows:It would have been a decent ending! Dark and bleak and a little unsettling. I liked the pacing when I thought that's what happened for a couple of seconds. Wham, she's dead. My stomach got cold for a second when I thought that was what happened. I should mention that I get that feeling when a movie I like ends well, which is to say confounding my expectations. That way, people who like their endings like they like their recursive everything bagels: dark, could have at least one movie. Which is also to say, NOT the way most audiences seem to like movies to end.I suggest that the standalone first movie timeline would end where it started (alt-meta-husband goes to look for her) wraps around to the beginning like a Möbius strip.Had I been properly consulted on the matter I would have suggested filming a couple of different endings for secrecy/confusion and call it a one off. Now you have time to make your uplifting sequel / answer to contemporary post-trump societal chaos and anxiety, or whatever.Observation B. The ending was obvious. So so obvious.Color me cynical, but we kinda knew from 10 min into the film after the premise was revealed that we were going to end in an uplifting realization that she liked her life after all, didn't we? Come on. The whole second half of the movie was her maneuvering into that spot. Especially after part 2 started , we knew, but we kind of have that assumption going in because this is a very very buzzy popular movie with glowing praise so its GONNA get all of its little conflict ducks (made of flourescent lime green ASMR jelly) in a perfect line, light them all on fire, and pop them one by one. How could it not? It couldnt. But what if it did?Observation C.If you look at the reviews overall it would seem that roughly 80 percent are apparently rapturous to the point of blacking out, and the remaining 10 percent loathe it.. ever so very much.Of those, I'm guessing at least half are just not bright enough or weren't paying attention to the plot points. These are the reviews that say things "didn't make sense."
I'm happy to help clear this up. Really, the following are factual statements, not opinions, so once and for all:
I present to you the folowing as the indisputable, incontestable truth for every viewer, including you, NOTHING in this movie "doesn't make sense".I promise, I paid attention, made a list of potential plot points which might have seemed to be infected with possible Non-sense, but upon review, every one of these had a reason and purpose which was revealed.EVERY single frame, its safe to say, of this movie was thought about at some point, perhaps obsessively, by someone or multiple someones. Everything makes sense. If you don't know why something happened, you might say "that's weird" but chances are it had to be that way and you're just not considering all the implications. Sorry.. This definitely isn't a movie to "multitask" with (shuddering with impotent fury at people who barely watch little snippets of something or get drunk and fall asleep or whatever and claim to have watched X movie).Observation D. This was and is a highly entertaining movie.But it's not perfect.I dont know how any reviewer can say it is, because thats impossible. That doesnt stop even professionals from saying this. Didn't you watch the film? Its in there, sort of.But what's the number 1-100?76 percent perfect, based on available scientific data models which are, themselves, statistically 96 percent accurate..
So, .7296 or 73 percent.Which is still quite high. Fully sitting, in my mind, along side of timeless great/weird spacetime bending classics such as Adaptation, Being John M'vitch, pretty much C. Kaufman's entire filmography, Brazil, Interstellar, and .. others.Its great to know I have another film creator(s) who I can check for upcoming must-see releases, and make no mistake, this is a must-see release.Precious observation E.OK next , problematic, uh,
problem: the attitudes overall about sex in general and LGBTQ sex in particular, were strangely immature and at odds with the seeming baseline ethos.For instance, at the very end of part 1, we reveal that the action was being projected onto a movie screen and was a movie premiere in the moviestar/billionaire timeline. Which explains the blurring of male agent's genitals in the previous scene, and we are to offload any judgement we might have about the moderately homophobic 5 minute choreographed fight scene involving the protagonist and two time agents with large candlesticks inserted and hanging out of their rectums for comic effect. So the blurring AND the candlesticks were reflecting the societal norms of THAT reality, but we still watched it for 5 minutes, as though the filmmakers had one segment of the audience that would think that was hilarious and another that would judge it in ramping unease, but then the reveal would focus the judgement on a fictional alternate movie audience. Can't be mad at Them, can you? Moving right along!Why is every multiverse instance we observe involving Yeoh and Curtis in a lesbian relationship is ALWAYS the same exact one where they have flappy hotdog hands and giant oil-painting style transfer portraits of stock photos of housecats? Also its the same one where they have 2 eyes each and Planck's constant is 6.626176 x 10-34 joule-seconds, not 3 more, plus a LOT of other similarities to our timeline, so many similarities that the odds of this being the case are 1 in a LARGE indeterminate number.The hands *are* funny and the foot piano duet was somebody's idea of funny, but all accounted for the only instance I can recal throughout the whole movie where we witness an earnest affection between same-sex couples is when Joy's gf kisses her briefly as Joy exits the car. One time.. Maybe I missed one, but even if there are two tiny earnest moments in a sea of broad humor, its not a great look: the movie uses LGBTQ themes and plot devices, some of them fundamental, throughout .. but there's almost always an escape hatch if you happen to view queer people as definitionally hilarious.Some other, earnest realitites and non-humor-mediated honest normal casual no big deal everyday ho hum seen it a billion times gay behavior embedded in there would have gone a long way to allowing the audience believe what it would greatly prefer, that the film is a friend and ally of queer folk, despite the comedic tropes, like when all the scrambled possibilities are instantiating like NFT attributes, we are to believe that out of the set of (EVERYTHING/ALL POSSIBLE) all the lesbian ones worth seeing evidence of are of the flappy hotdog hands variety. Hm. That's... odd.BTW, cutting it in half, into a movie and a sequel, would create opportunities for all KINDS of extra backstory including earnest gay b-roll, I'm just saying. Or, NOT backstory or b-roll, and instead a meaningful character, which Joy's girlfriend is NOT any kind of realized character; I'm not the genius screenwriter, do something!I could go on and on beating this horse but I think you get it.Observation F.I can't finish this without mentioning, of the Tupaki character, that her outfits and makeup are increasingly spectacular up until the last 10 minutes. I'd say last 9 outfits with the exception of High Priestess of the Communal Order of the Supreme Bagel, which I just can't with the bagel-shaped hairdo, are genius and more genius. A lot of various Oscars are potentially inbound, depending on how the gay thing breaks for them politically but regardless I think that Shirley Kurata as costume designer is more or less a lock.That's about it.. To recap (as promised, but renumbered and restructured from the overall text of this review)1. Good, great even, in places, not perfect by any stretch.2. Not great with regards to LGBTQ treatment despite appearing to exploit gay themes for both plots and character formation.3. IMHO, would have made 2 better imperfect movies than one 2 hour and 19 minute all-in-one movie which was almost twice as long as it needed to be.4. A solid .7296 or 73 percent score from me, arrived at using the minimally excruciating Unstoppable Hammer of Science™ method (patent pending)Sun, Jun 5 2022
Koenard von Paulsac
señor Movie Revi£wer.

This movie is a great masterpiece that offers a profound experience. It develops something wholly original and mind-blowing by breaking the rules of conventional filmmaking. You are always surprised and on the edge of your seat. The movie finishes with awe, making you wonder about your perception of life. You shouldn't miss it since it's engaging, thought-provoking, and an unforgettable experience. Everything Everywhere All at Oncenis a movie to make you feel, think, and just have a fantastic time. It's an opportunity of a lifetime that you won't forget long after the final credits have rolled.

What a waste of my time. I like Michelle Yeoh and for me she was the only good thing in this movie. Was this a work of genius, or a quasi-clever wannabe something? Everyone to decide themselves, I just hope I would not have watched this, as this was the worst movie I have ever seen. And I've seen a lot...What puzzles me most is that how is it possible so many people give this movie such high ratings. Surely no-one can honestly say this was a great movie? Someone wrote about the emperor's new clothes. If the movie does not make any sense, is painful to watch and lasts forever, it must be great. Well, it is not.

I feel compelled to write a review after watching this. I am not going to be saying anything that hasn't already been said, but honestly, this is probably the best ever film I've seen in the past 10 years.I laughed, I cried, I was entertained, I was sad and I was happy. It was a roller coaster of emotions and that is what separates good films and great films, something that makes you feel. I would understand why some would not like this because it will honestly be the strangest movie you'll ever watch, but for me thats what makes it better.Everything Everywhere All at Once is a masterpiece that is WAY ahead of its time.

This movie was incredibly creative with its multiverse timelines. I think the absurdist aspects of the film may surprise some viewers, but there is commentary to be found about contemporary society through the use of this aesthetic. Beyond the constant surprises of the film, is a much deeper reflection on existence that asks major questions about the meaning of life and relationships. I had a number of different reactions and interpretations of the film while I was watching it, but the conclusion offered deep messages about human connection. The acting was also superb and the film seemed incredibly ambitious visually. It is amazing to me that they pulled it off because it was a very complex film! In all, this film was easily one of the best of the past few years and is well worth your time.
I regret i didn't go in a movie theater, great movie 10/10 , first movie with just right amount of dildos on the screen and racacooi will always be in my heart, this movie needs an Oscar.

What a conjointed and weird movie yet beautiful. Done in three parts and brought beautifully together in the end. Though it can be somewhat scattered, it is brought back gracefully to a meaning of what live is... What you make and think it is! It makes you think of what is and is not what is important in your life.It is both action and life affirming. What more could you ask of a movie. Though I, personally will not agree that family always comes first (personal experience) love does!!! Love, this exhalts all above everything. It is what gives meaning. It is that love for what we bared and gives fruit to the future of humanity that makes it all worthy! LOVED IT.
An incredibly long boring heavily hyped Kung Fu movie with lots of special effects. That right there dumbed down any artsy sub text. Very glad we only paid $6.00 to watch it On Demand. Go see Elvis.
The plot, the writing, the acting, it is just amazing! I wasn't expecting the turns, and it was really hilarous. I never laughed and almost cried on a movie that much.

This movie had great messaging ultimately, but undermined itself with stupid nuances that dragged the plot. A universe with hot dog fingers, random fight scenes with weird out of place sexual references, the list goes on... While this is one of the most creatively original stories of 2022 with a stellar cast, why did it feel like I was constantly being dragged out of the plot? The fight scenes were excellent, but some felt forced. The need to include the IRS lady throughout most of the movie felt really out of place when it was irrelevant to the laundromat's taxes. As much as I like Jamie Lee Curtis, her character felt like it was thrown into every universe because she is a great actress, not because her character fit in the scene or story. Ultimately a huge disappointment that is simultaneously visually stunning.

Unique, smart, seems simple but is actually thought out very well (eg silly humor precedes serious insightful moments to loosen the mind before going into the emotion) and just a very rare kind of good.

Wow, just wow. Easily one of the most original and stylish films I've seen in years. It's a small family centered drama about the troubles and trials of everyday relationships told in the biggest way imaginable. Funny, touching, intense, full of incredible moments and outrageous gags and bits but ultimately small and touching in such a beautiful and introspective way. I will be thinking about this one for years to come, and it will likely forward me its way into my all time greats list. Go see it immediately if you haven't already.

Admittedly, I tuned in because of the talented headliners, Michelle Yeoh and J. L Curtis............I was not let down; what a brilliant, beautiful film (seriously funny too).This movie blends, and bends, time effortlessly. The chaotic streaking of time with each universes' character is a delight to witness.The humour in this film is unexpected at times making the jokes/situations all the more funny.All of the cast was brilliant...... it was cool to see "Data" back in action, and James Hong too - so good! Stephanie Hsu nailed her character(s) and the coutume and make-up department deserve serious accolades.This is probably the best movie I've seen in 2022 - I loved it! 10/10.

This is probably the worse "serious" movie I have ever seen in my lifetime. Completely bizarre, no sense at all, everything mixed with no script, even if you change the editing, it might not affect the final result. Is a waste of time, more than 2 hours. Expendable one!

This has to be one of the most overrated films i have ever seen. Some ideas taken from Matrix, Inception, some original ones and here you are.Make no mistake, this is a family movie. The sci-fi, the action, it is all very childish.The fact that this movie is a 8.6 on imdb is mind blowing for me.

reviews.review_title: How did it get so High Reviews!?!
reviews.content:
So what? U liked the idea of the whole story?! Cool... its nice
But Everything else was silly, dull, normal acting... Everywhere scenes cut and glued and nonsense together...
All at once they gave a normal boring movie that doesnt deserve more than 5 in any way...
Oh! Dont forget the silly pervert scenes!! Seriously?! Made it more stupid...

reviews.review_title: Only Made an IMDB Account to review this powerhouse of a movie....
reviews.content: I probably had the most fun in a theater ever watching this movie. The whole movie was just pure unadulterated joy and heart and it's safe to say that this is my nee favorite movie.The Daniels keep pushing the boundaries in film making and you can tell that they have their own style by even comparing the movie to their previous endeavor, Swiss Army Man, which was also a solid film.Easily one of the most unique, most innovative and the most thought provoking films I have seen in years.The fact that it was an allegory of a family made it all the more powerful.If this doesn't get all of the oscars there is something wrong with the film industry because MAN did this movie pack a punch. They wouldn't let you turn your head for a second, from the first plot twist to the final chaotic climax.Please watch it in a theater!!!!

I give it a 10 based on how imaginative it is but frankly, if you are into philosophy and science you would give it 11/10 with the extra point coming from another universe. Can't imagine how well a complex subject such as the chaos theory can be implemented smoothly into a movie that can be enjoyed by everyone like this. Ah well, maybe it's thanks to the sausages (wink wink). This movie is miles ahead of most other attempts to explore the multiverse subject.

I saw all the negative reviews on here but people failed to get the plot of the movie. I never wrote reviews but people calling this overrated is just dumb. This movie beautifully potrays to appreciate all of the things that you have that you went through to get to this point in life, maybe you'd feel like things would have been better if you took a different route but it is what it is so stop overthinking and just look at the bigger picture things will fall into place and you will feel a part of something bigger than your own little conscience.What you are is just a product of your decision.

An absolute tour de force master class in emotion action humour and mind bending trippiness that is without doubt one of the best movies ive ever seen in my life. Its a work of art that his hilarious and heartfelt and full of interesting drama all at once. I cant recommend it higher.

reviews.review_title: Troubling but passionate, existential in its message
reviews.content: I found this film to be very anti or strange in its message. It evolves around nihilism or at least existentialism on how nothing matters but we still choose kindness in the midst of 'not having all the answers.' This type of thought leads me to believe that the film makers believe in a worldview of 'nothing matters' which irked me as I don't believe in the same way.I think that we should choose love and kindness because we do matter and life does matter and the choices we make have lasting effects on higher powers or a God in place. It's a disappointing final message and I wish no one would come to appreciate or believe in its nihilistic approach, it's devastating.The film is original, masterful, perfectly edited and incredibly engaging. It's an acid trip and it feels as if you're exploring through many different portals of life. It's grand and I believe its a mind dazzling, complicated and pretty fun experience.
