I can't give it a higher score because I'm saddened by its poor depiction on life and how we should value it. I just wish this film wasn't a message to allow more LGBTQ privilege to flood through our heads thinking that's okay.In summary, it's a film about human liberalism and the allowance of mutual sin and spreading sin, it's about universal love but it's human centred and it idolizes our place infront of God. The reason I'm being religious is because the film explores so many ideas of life and the meaning of it. As a Christian I don't believe life is meaningless and I don't believe that lesbian gay rights should be pushed ever so bluntly they did here. I believe that life is full of grace, and lesbians should have equal rights but not in the way of outright blasphemy of Christian tradition. It's this kind of liberalism which angers me because if you don't have a fear of God, you'll unleash human anger and rage everywhere.Instead of being kind because life is meaningless which is a stupid message, think about how God loves us so much and made you so valuable and you are loved no matter what race, status or sexuality, so then be loving and kind because we are all eternal people and we shouldn't misplace the love and message of Christianity for something trippy, ethereal and demonic.

Movie tried too hard. Too long and boring.Reminds me of the kids that say they are random and just do weird things.Movie starts out interesting but it never explains most of the weirdest things that happen throughout the movie. I love weird movies but this one is just random, all over the place like they didn't know what to do once they developed their characters.

Every moment was worth watching. Overall it was fun, some scenes were sad and they handled the subject well. I will watch it again soon. I liked the actors, the stage designs, the pace of the movie, everything. Definitely watchable.
One of the best movies I have seen in 20 years. Damn this movie even made me watch credits and think. That says a lot.Cast was great, acting was great, story was great, directing was great.

reviews.review_title: Inventive and overlong. Original and derivative.
reviews.content: This reminded me of several other movies in the fantasy and science fiction genres. And some other movies in other genres. I think I'll need another viewing to take it all in. It wasn't really that complicated, but I really enjoyed the randomness of the "base jumping" and the insane, surreal visual comedy. The performances were all great, but to me the standouts were Jamie Lee Curtis and the amazing Stephanie Hsu.Unfortunately it felt about an hour too long. The Daniels kept on making the same points over and over again, and when you combine with that some of the protracted jokes (rocks talking with the help of subtitles, hot dog fingers, 2001 apemen with hot dog fingers) I felt The Daniels were going over the top, if that's even possible in movie this over the top.The Daniels have made a fun science fiction comedy. Just don't take it very seriously. It's basically The Wizard Of Oz, The Matrix, Inception and about a hundred other movies put in a blender and turned into a huge smoothie with way too many calories.

I do need to rewatch this movie because there was so much to process. I loved that though. I loved how much detail there was.I appreciated the light shined upon generational differences and trauma. I loved the family healing and that is why i cried and loved this movie too. There was so much meaning and symbolism intertwined everywhere.It's definitely a movie I would recommend and rewatch as well!

A movie that can make you cry, laugh, sad, happy and emotional all at once. It was a fantastic movie, comparable to most other A24 productions, with an unique plot. The acting, BGM were top notch but the lifeline of this movie was it's story. Story depicts some crucial component of life in a humorous and sci-fiye way! You won' be bored for a moment while watching. Highly recommended.

It's like the Matrix but bad. It feels like if someone had a lot of bad dreams after having heavy diners or drugs and spent an awful night full of nonesense dreams and wrote them not even in the order they happened.It feels like to be nominated for an Academy Award in the last three years you don't have to participate with a good movie anymore. Culturally wrong, with erroneous cultural mistakes, bad acting and to make it even worse, it is boring. I couldn't wait for it to end.My friends and I came up with funnier stories just to be silly during highschool.I am glad I didn't pay for my ticket to watch this.The 4/10 stars I gave it was just because the respect to James Hong.

I am sorry but I could neither follow the story nor understand why this movie is rated so highly. Only reason why I wanted to see it because it was rated as high eg as 'city of god' or 'terminator 2'. Super fast cuts, chaotic storyline, I need to talk to someone that rated 10 as I seemed to have missed something. Please go and see it as I am the minority. So far I considered IMDB as a serious source for good movie ratings. I am confused. Not only about the movie but also about my understanding about what makes a good movie. A good story and a nice visual and audible package.

The film is multi-genre and that is a problem on its own. The story and conflicts are meant to amuse teenagers. The first part of the movie can be a little confusing, so you'll want to see it twice, so you shouldn't want to see this movie at the cinema, wait to watch it at home. Currently this film is overrated in the IMDB ranking, the truth is that it doesn't come close to the great masterpieces of cinema. That being said, the movie is ok to have a little fun and a few laughs.

Dont regret about what you might have be,do, could do, do it, do good because good is good and makes you feel good. And always talk if you have any problem with your family talk and solve anything cause love solves everything. Parents dont be children be parents.

Everything Everywhere All at Once is as the title suggest, a buffet of Thought. A glimpse into the very being of humanity.It captures the absurdism of Camus, the nihilism of Nietzsche, the existential angst from Kierkegaard to Dostoevsky. It contains the deepest of metaphysical science, with bleeding edge theories of quantum physics.It has love. Conflict. Right and wrong. It taught me things I did not know, and it taught me things I did not know I did not know.I laughed until it hurt. I cried tears of joy and sadness. But most of all, I thought. At times I felt I understood what this universe is. I got a glimpse of real meaning.This movie should truly be designated as a Wonder of the World. My future children will learn more in 2 hours and 19 minutes than Master's students in philosophy. They will appreciate and digest more art than 200,000 years of humanity combined. They will see an eternal work of art, that will be treasured for centuries to come.Everything Everywhere All at Once stands on the shoulders of giants such as 2001: A Space Odyssey, Schindler's List, and Fight Club. And it manages to overshadow them all. The magnitude of this feat can hardly be understood.I am grateful to live in time and place to experience this work. It might just have been a statistical inevitability, but it's one I will treasure most of all.

Overall very interesting, well made movie. It has some minor problems like being just a little bit too long but they're not enough to ruin it. Great acting, interesting concept, ordinary, but not bad story. Definitely worth seeing.

reviews.review_title: Kung Fu Hustle + a Hallmark movie about a frustrated teen finding reconciliation with her parents
reviews.content: At its core, it's a simple, vague feel-good movie plot with a helluva lot of spectacle thrown on it. That spectacle is some of the most imaginative and wild and entertaining spectacle I've seen in years.It never reaches the emotional depths or peaks of a similarly surreal dramas (Being John Malkovich, Sorry to Bother You, Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind), and it doesn't have enough combat choreography to be what most wushu fans would consider to be a martial arts movie, but it sits nicely in its unique space as a wild and unforgettable movie.
Liked the humourReally liked the story. Great from start to finishloved the cinematography and move transitionsCast was amazing.I may not recommend to everyone.

reviews.review_title: I saw everything all at once in the trailer
reviews.content: If you saw the trailer you saw everything. There is not a single scene that is not in the trailer. I waited the whole movie to see something else, another form of her but nothing... sad.The rest, it feels like 80% of the movie is talking about the gimmick and explaining what is going on. Show it and do not explain the whole movie!I still had fun, but i wished it would have gone even more deeper and more mindfuck.

You can tell that everyone involved had fun making this movie and it shows well in the humor, the costumes, each of the universes, etc.Some scenes I felt dragged on a little bit, but other than that, it was very enjoyable.

I never leave reviews for films on IMDb. I also never walk out on a film part way through. However, after spending 45 minutes trying to give this abomination of a film the benefit of the doubt, I just couldn't take anymore;
hence me writing this review to warn others.Here are a few words I'd use to describe this film:Dull, repetitive, unoriginal, unfunny, confusing, chaotic...I fell into the trap of thinking this film would be really enjoyable, given the critical acclaim received from critics and IMDb users alike. Please don't make the same mistake and waste 140 minutes (or however long you can tolerate) of your life on this trash.

reviews.review_title: Dr.Strange, Fun, Abstract, Action, Schwarzschild radius and Empathy
reviews.content: EEAAO, From funny moment to badass action to heartbreaking moment each and every moment perfectly grasped the gist of entire story.Michelle Yeoh & Stephanie Hsu was absolutely phenomenal in thus movie, probably the best acting performance in her career.Team of five people to complete 500 visual effects.Cinematography and Editing is fantastic, stitching the scenes perfectly, no bland shots. The action is innovative and fun. Music score helps convey internal emotionMaster minds of the Daniel's (Directors Daniel Kwan & Scheinert).Special mention to Raccacoonie, Rocks, Pinky Finger, Googly eyes, Bagel, and Hot dog.

reviews.review_title: Thought it was a Dr Strange knock off but totally different.
reviews.content: I just watched a movie wondering what it would be about, but was not only, funny, action pack, insightful and beautifully filmed and acted. The underlying story is one of the best examples of this kind of movie I have seen. Worth a watch with a family member or bestie that you love and care for warning at some point in writing the script I believe drugs could have been involved.Will have to go back and watch it again as I suspect there will be many Easter eggs that I missed first time around.The acting is really good especially the range that the actors have to express throughout the storyline.
There is nothing you could ask of this film that wasn't delivered. The only way you could find a fault is that you're looking for an arbitrary and made up one. It delivered exactly what it should.

Visually stunning, surprisingly small in scale, with both inventive and silly jokes, jaw-dropping action scenes, dramatic twists...That alone would qualify it for an enjoyable time, but no...this movie doesn't stop there. It goes all in with its underlying message and holds nothing back. Themes, plots and meanings that will be spoken of for years to come.All held up thanks to an amazing cast. Every single one doing their absolute best:
Michelle Yeoh has to do much lifting, succeeds at everything she does and perhaps delivered the best performance of her career.But man, do I have to point out Ke Huy Quan, who almost has to do just as much as Yeoh and he chose one hell of a role to come back to acting. I can only hope it will encourage him to stick around.

Long, incredibly weak storyline, vague, boring. All these features in one movie!? On what basis did he get an average score of 8 !?? Wasn't there really another way to show the importance of our children's wishes and lifestyle?!? You really want it to end from the moment you start Watch it. Great actors and good directors' names cannot force us that this work must be great. This movie is a good example of this sentence. This shows that originality can never replace a good script. The weak and absurd storyline, a story stuck between philosophy and humor, although cheap humor prevailed. I wish you didn't just vote based on emotions and Prejudice. I'm really sorry. That is my opinion.

Probably the most original take on optimistic nihilism ever put on film. The movie does a great job of conveying the everything, everywhere, all-at-once-ness that the protagonist is experiencing. Masterfully assembled set pieces come together in a way where the end result is greater than the sum of its parts. Feels a little longer than it needs to be since the message being conveyed is shallow. Worth the price of a matinee ticket.

No movie has ever made me laugh and cry so much as this one (and I have been watching them for over 60 years). Sheer brilliance. This movie is a total act of kindness. A huge thank you to everyone involved.BTW - this is my second IMDB movie review. The last one I wrote was 17 years ago (for the Iranian masterpiece, 'Even Turtles Cry'). Since I wrote that first review, my two sons were born. Having a family is such an amazing experience - and this movie jolts us into appreciating their significance in our respective lives. I would like to write more but tears of happiness keep blocking my view.

Superb, fun and down right outrageous. It's out there but it's a classic.This is 12 monkiesish but bonus number 1 no Bruce Willis and number 2 you don't have to follow it. Sit back and enjoy the soundtrack aswell as the hot dog fingers. Jamie Lee Curtis is brilliant as always aswell.A real unexpected gem.

Love the main actress Michelle Yeoh and this movie is Awesome.An Action, Fantasy SciFi Comedy that blew my mind. The metaphors are mind bendingly charged. At times I needed to catch up to my brain, other times it was so ironically obvious. It has an artistic quality to it very few movies attempt... Thinking of "Being John Malkovich" or "Crash".At times I laughed out load and others I cried long. A very powerful movie.I watched this because Michelle was in it (I didn't expect it to be a Kung Fu flick). It had some chops but it is sooo much more than that. This is a thinking person's movie. A once in a decade awesome movie.Michelle Yeoh is speculated to be an Oscar nominee (winner?).... this should extend to Ke Huy Quan and screenwriters, cinematography director.Caveat... you'll either love it or not. If you think you might be liking it - stick with it... 10/10 for me.

I love when new ideas come to the cinema, I just think this one needed a lot more work/money. Reminds me of the early 90 bad taste movies. Where a lot of random things just keep happening, for no good reason.

reviews.review_title: One of the main contender for oscars
reviews.content: What can I say about this movie? Many many....people have already praised enough so I cannot add much more in terms of reviewing the movie. But one things is for sure IMO that no other movie is going to stop this movie from winning at least 3-4.oscars if not more. There is a (strong) possibility James Cameron's Avatar: The Way of Water, if released this year, can beat this movie in the race for Oscars.Oh, now something about the movie. From 2:03:56 to 2:08:57, movie is laced with such emotions and beautiful scenes that one can't stop crying.If you cares about your loved ones, see this movie. You will definitely enjoy the journey of the characters involved in complexed relationships. But if you somehow don't believe much in building relationships, then this movie is must watch for you to learn a thing or two about the kindness, love and empathy towards your close ones, loved ones and common persons.

reviews.review_title: The fact that this film is polarising people makes it even better
reviews.content: The fact that this movie is splitting people in to two categories of either loving or disliking it, to me, makes it even better.If you like the typical American movie with the antagonist who reaches point of no return, in a universe where it is clear to distinguish who the bad guy and the good guy is? Then this is not your movie.To me this movie is not an attempt to make art, it is art. So again, if you're the type who easily gets bored at museums and don't have much experience or knowledge about art? Oh boy is this not the movie for you.It is definitely an experience worth watching but it is not for everyone, witch doesn't make it bad. I think it was a really good experience and the trippy effects and everything was succédés very well!

reviews.review_title: Everything I wanted, Everywhere in this movie, more or less all at once.
reviews.content: One of my patreon subscribers hipped me to this last week and last night I saw it. Absolutely f'ing loved it. Talk about a movie that has everything - an emotional core, something to say, comedy, action, pathos, lots of solid performances with great acting, and yes, it's close enough to how the omniverse in Splinters is laid out to be kissing cousins.Clocks in at about two hours, the violence is never gratuitous, there is no hate speech or harsh language, though it is quite INTENSE in places. Pacing wise not nec. A movie suitable for many children but some will get a lot more out of it than others.Four out of Four Stars, Gwen D. Says Check It Out if you haven't seen it.

This is actually a very important film to remember. A turning point in Hollywood if I may call it.The movie revolves around homosexuality which is profoundly frowned upon in Chinese culture, but finally it seems the family kinda accepted the situation. Then at the end the mother's hint to Becky as to grow her hair, leaves a doubt so there won't be total acceptance and the new truth has to comply to centeric family's way after all.All the fuss is about centerism the entire length of the film. It seems China has tried to strip Hollywood of its cultural influence as a broadcaster for American way, and using it to his own advantage. So with all the nominations from Oscars, it seems there will be more of this to come in coming years.The movie is promoting the Chinese way so obviousely and especially present it as an alternative to American dream. Freedom and letting go is bad, and sticking to the centric family as Chinese culture suggest is a better option (at least what is they want us to believe of Chinese culture at this point).Altough it has been entertaining with an action packed and distracting storyline and showing some acceptable storytelling proficiency, but it leaves no doubt this is defenitely a propoganda towards China and how the world shall accept it and BE KIND!.

reviews.review_title: Strange film, but can't turn my eye's away.
reviews.content: This is a very strange film, but I can't seem to turn my eye's away for fear I'll miss something important or well, strange. But, stick with it, it will begin to make sense toward the end in the last quarter.Great casting and I was super surprised and pleased to see Ke Huy Quan in one of the primary roles; always considered him an interesting child actor but then he seemed to disappear from the screen. As he has been reported to have said that after his childhood roles, there just didn't seem to be any opportunities for him again in acting, so he turned to behind the scenes. Would be really interesting to see him reprise his role as 'Short Round' in the next Indiana Jones film, but now as an adult.Michelle Yeoh is of course impeccable in anything she's in, and Jamie Lee Curtis is a hoot as a government IRS agent. Story line with so many costumes and scenery changes must have been as confusing to keep up with as it was to watch it all. Expect I'll be seeing different scenes of the film in my memory again and again for a few days.It's an odd film, might even consider Art House worthy, but I'm hoping you will also think it was worth sticking through all the crazy scenes and costumes till you get to the end and the purpose of the film. Best quote is 'Be kind, especially when you don't know what's going on. '

It was such a wonderful movie, it didn't follow the typical action movie formula and it had such a wonderful sweet ending. The worldbuilding was incredible, it explained everything to the audience perfectly without dumbing it down too much or not explaining enough. Jobu's outfits were incredible as well, and as a young queer person, she is the pinnacle of young queer representation with her sense of style and motives. The development in the relationship between Evelyn and Joy is beautiful, and the rock scenes are hilarious. Waymond and his relationship with Evelyn is also so cute, and I'm very glad that everything, all the relationships were mended with talking through things in the end. This movie truly combined comedy, relationships, and cool sequences perfectly.

Maybe I had very high expectations but I really disappointed.Many people said that this movie is "funny" but I felt embarrassing 13yo American teenage boy humour.The "message" of this movie isn't that unique, very basic
Too many "action scene" made it boring.I think people liked it because they can relate to that 'family issues' and maybe that's why they cried. I've seen a lot of reviews that this movie made them cry and I'm a very emotional person but I didn't cry at all.The movie effects were good tho. Even tho I don't know anything about 'effects', I actually liked it.Lastly, actors and actresses did very well!

This film is bonkers. Its like matrix meets multiverse. The lead actress have done fantastic job. Sometimes the movie is a bit over the top and confusing but most of the time it is entertaining and thought provoking.

Sorry, I don't get the hype. In my opinion not awardsworthy. Just a fantasy comedy. The Daniels can do better: "Swiss army man" is way better. "Swiss army man" has a crazy story with heart and emotions. But this ist not emotional. Should it be a film about family problems? Well, they talk to each other, they live together, spend time together, work together. They have some issues with the gay girlfriend, but she is not abandoned and welcome to visit the family. Oh the daughter has a tattoo and get "fat". Really?! Other families have much more problems...The storyline about metaverses is not understandable. In my opinion the episode from "family guy" about the metaverse is much more intelligent and creative.Btw: isn't it a sterotype to show asians as quirky who cannot speak propper english?

Decent, I'm not clamouring, it seems to be getting raves, but I did enjoy it, though I'd have trimmed it. I'm glad I was right about it being Data/Short Round who I'd not seen in anything since The Goonies and I'm not just a racist. 7/10.

reviews.review_title: Best Movie I Have Ever Seen In My Entire Life.
reviews.content: All I can say is this movie changed me after seeing it. I know for a fact it is the best movie I have ever seen & at this point in my life I consider it my favourite. Everything about this movie to me is perfect & if asked in the future what I want in a movie I will say everything this film gave me. This film floored me & I will one day meet the directors, actors, producers & let them know how grateful I am that this movie exists.

This movie was so refreshing and original, I could probably watch it 3 more times and pick up on things I missed the first couple times. I laughed, cried, couldn't take my eyes off the screen and was never sure what might happen next. Most movies are predictable and boring following the same formula and ending predictably. Watch this movie if you love originality and have a taste for the strange and unusual. I wish there were more writers and directors thinking outside the box and taking risks like this. The acting is great, story is great, the cinematography is great, EVERYTHING EVERYWHERE IS GREAT IN THIS FILM.

reviews.review_title: Best film of 2022 -- So crazy fun!
reviews.content: Such a freaking awesome movie! You have to see it to understand why it is so special and unique. It's an amazing experience, so just go with it. I loved the Cantonese, Mandarin, English, and action all melded together in a seamless film with a creative storyline and meaningful theme. The editing was extraordinary, as well as the acting and soundtrack. Daniels did such a great job with the script and symbolism and the whole cast was phenomenal! Michelle Yeoh was outstanding! Go watch it now! It's one of the films you can't stop thinking about or talking about when you leave the theater... it's THAT good. It's Oscar worthy for so many categories and it's bonkers, but when you watch it a second time, it will capture your heart even more. Be kind and love one another because we don't know what is going on sometimes.

reviews.review_title: Best great movie since the pandemic.
reviews.content: More than the year's best, will win everything all at once in 2022. If Brokeback Mountain and What the Bleep Do We Know had a crazy sexy child who was all knowing and more powerful than their parents, it would be this movie.

reviews.review_title: One of the better films of the year.
reviews.content: Really enjoyed this film. Great story telling, full of fun, has some deep emotional moments, not afraid to be a little weird at times. Ke Huy Quan is absolutely amazing, and if i'm honest he's actually the reason i gave this movie a watch in the first place. Bravo!

reviews.review_title: What a meta healing sober Psychotrip!
reviews.content: I'm still shaking inside after criying and a cold shower looking into my hands and the abyss.Super good writing, directing, editing. Superb acting. All is marvelous.Thanks all people involve.

But I had to say something about this one. I feel like I've watched something special. I just left the cinema 2 hours ago, and it hasn't really set in yet. But I feel like this has the potential to become a true classic of the modern times. It's the sort of movie, that I can't imagine anyone not at least finding some sort of resonance with. The message it contains is universal and the way it delivers it is truly original and even somewhat unique. It operates under the modus of "more is more" and that might be the only reason that I wouldn't give this movie a 10 out of 10.At the same time, if it wasn't for the willingness of the writers to explore every possible idea they (and their team I presume...) could come up with, the movie wouldn't be what it is - and in some weird way I wouldn't want it to be perfect anyway - the overwhelmed feeling that I'm left with now, is part of what makes the movie such a masterpiece. And, maybe one day, when I've rewatched this a handful of times, I'll come back and bump my review up to a ten.

reviews.review_title: One of the best films released in 2022
reviews.content: I heard about the film after I watched Dr strange multiverse of madness . After seeing the film i can say its better and actual multiversal than Dr strange 3. I absolutely loved performances funny, action packed . Must see .

reviews.review_title: yet another movie that tries to look deep
reviews.content: I've been waiting to watch it for more than a month because of the all the hype I saw on the internet.But I don't know if I didn't get it it's an okay movie everything is pretty good but the story it's seems so random to me and one of those shows that try to look.But other than that It was pretty good emotional, not stupid, appealing visually and has the Jackie Chan and those kind of Chinese movies vibes.

Mid Tier at bestI was waiting for the good part, actually fell asleep the first watch.Gave it another go and was not any better, i dont know if they were trying to be funny in some scenes and i can usually find humour in most things but they just didnt hit right.Chaos is the best way to explain this movie, i understand what they were trying to do but the story is garbage, none of the characters draw you in and the ending was garbage.The movie will probably just leaved you confused, just like i am confused at how this movie has got such good ratings.B grade movie and actors.I would definitely give this one a miss, if you have something else to watch.

reviews.review_title: Best Description of a movie in it's Title
reviews.content: This Movie Has Everything. Plot, Humour, And Cinematography....was just wow! Love how the Aspect Ratio Change as the universe change.Watch this movie if you wanna watch something fresh and different. Yes some scenes made me cringe but other then that a solid 8/10 from my side.

As said in the title. The boring part are the fight episodes. The Kitschy part is evident early in the movie, but probably necessary for the plot.Nevertheless, enjoy the funny parts. And, of course, Jamie Lee Curtis!

reviews.review_title: Too much happening all at once
reviews.content: I really commend the filmmakers for doing all that for a low budgets. The movie has everything to the point that it got confusing, too much of everything is bad. I get it there are many references I might be missing but it felt stupid at some point. I just wanted it to end.

This movie came out a few months ago, but i only had the time to watch now and damn! Did i lose quite a experience.The cinematography, choreography and the writing in general is top-notch.A movie made by quite a small cry with an even smaller budget, but it manages to surprise you with the quality of itself!The history is fantastic and the imagery very trippy! Funny when it has to be then suddenly serious all over. It makes you cry at the end with tears of joy and sadness altogether. Just seeing Evelyn and Joy fight the whole movie while feeling bad for everyone especially Waymond, i just can't describe everything i felt.10/10 movie for me, might not be for you, but an amazing movie nonetheless. Best of 2022.

I ain't gonna tell you anything. If you have a heart, you must see this movie. It´s funny, but you will cry a lot. The visual is amazing, but it has a unique script. The actors are superb. The soundtrack... let me stop . Watch this NOW.

Best movie i've ever seen in my entire life. Not exaggerating. You could analyse this movie so thoroughly only to find ur bot ever half way through all the themes and emotions depicted !! In loooooooooooove. Like wow??? Please watch. You will not regret it. Ps: probably for ages 13+ though, there is a couple of graphic scenes. Also another thing i love about this movie is how it depicts a chinese immigrant household, as it doesn't include nothing but stereotypes, but uses so many creative aspects to create the movie. As an immigrant from china this movie is such a masterpiece. Another thing i love is the lgbtq representation and inclusion. Love this movie 10/10.

reviews.review_title: Tried to be everything, all at once.
reviews.content: This would be above average if you knew to lower expectations for a movie that tries to be everything, in modern Hollywood movies, intentionally. Quite remarkable to find so many, I'm sure I have missed many more.Many concepts they utilized remind me of The Matrix and Japanese Anime - Evangelion.

This is a very silly and entertaining tail. Its makes me wish that it had a sequel already. Get ready to shake your head and laugh, this movie is full of random silliness and non sequiturs. Good acting and a good script, i am very impressed, I haven't giggled this much in a long time. Most of the movie doesn't make sense yet it is highly entertaining and leaves you wanting more. Im not sure what inspired this film because it is really crazy yet well done. If this one is not nominated for an Oscar than they are crazy. I am impressed at how serious the actors are as they deliver the outrageous lines that have been written. This one is an instant classic and one of my personal facorites.

There are as many ones as there are ten star ratings for this film. You are advised to keep an open mind and be ready for anything.... And I mean ANYTHING!!!! You will love it or you will hate it but you really should try it.....!

Everything Everywhere All At Once is one of the best movies/experiences I've ever encountered. It's sad that there are so many people not "relating" to or letting go and giving themselves into the story and relating to this masterpiece. It made me think and feel deeper than I can ever recall from a film.There are some moments that I can see some people would roll their eyes at, but I cherish the playful scenes that add to the complexity and break the ice with an assumed lol or wtf moment to some...
Overall, I laughed and cried (more than once!). This one challenged my mind and opened up so many memories I thought I'd lost!

This was the longest 2 hours, 19 minutes of my life. When titling an entertainment "Everything Everywhere..." you really need to take effort to leave some stuff out.The film announces its three sections with title cards pulled from the movie title. EVERYTHING was interesting (though a tad overlong). We meet the characters. We learn the conflict. (It's family dynamics.) It's easy to identify with the quite familiar characters, and you're pulling for them. SPOILER: The interest is sustained as we clue in that the family conflict will be played out across a multiverse.When the story resumes as EVERYWHERE you're ready for the running time to be half spent. But, no. The three segments are granted equal time. The movie starts to wear out its welcome in segment 2. (Although I appreciated that in the multiverse thread wherein the characters appear to be living their best lives, they're still dissatisfied. That impressed me as "real.") Finally ALL AT ONCE unspools. If they could have dealt with the universes colliding in a tight fifteen minutes or so, and then devoted about the same time allotted the primary reality, I might have stayed onboard.In the Army, my platoon was mustered for a 4-mile run. The course was laid out with mile markers. For some inexplicable reason, the starting line was moved up half a mile. When I got to the first mile marker I thought, 'Man! I'm in great shape! I should pick up the pace, and maybe set a landspeed record!' The second mile marker took forever to reach. I still hadn't clued in to the situation. I figured I'd dial back a little, and maybe just set the service branch record. At the 3-mile mark it dawned on me. I staggered through that fourth mile and, guess what? I had another half-mile to the finish!This show was like that. Give some thought to desertion.

In the last few years, it feels like originality in movies and TV has become rare. Even rarer are those movies that push and pull an audience back and forth from the point of tears to hysteric laughter. A rare movie indeed.

reviews.review_title: One of the best films I've ever seen!
reviews.content: Going into this film, I had no idea what to expect; I'd not seen any trailers but there was a buzz about it on the internet and reviews were good, so I thought I'd check it out.The film surprised me in so many ways I don't really know where to begin in heaping the well deserved praise on it.This film has everything you could want in film making - comedy, romance, drama, pathos, martial arts, clever editing, interwoven storytelling, luscious score, amazing and surprising performances from all the cast - all on a bagel.The most joyous part is seeing Michelle Yeoh (who is wonderfully sublime) and Ke Huy Quan (who makes a very welcome return to cinema) interacting and performing different aspects of themselves in the different multiverses. Jamie Lee Curtis is also brilliantly surreal in her role.Yet despite all the theatrics, and special effects, the film has the simplest of messages: Be kind. This message isn't forced, comes across beautifully and leaves you feeling uplifted and content by the film's close.Simply put, this is one of the best films I have ever seen and has broken into my top 10 films of all time. Thank you for creating such a beautiful film.

We'll it is obviously a well made film but I didn't get it, I really have no idea what is going on. I'm currently halfway through but going to give up. It's hard to write a review because I really have no idea what I am reviewing. It started off half in English and half subtitled, within the same sentence, and from that point I was struggling. I guess it is about life but certainly not my life. I have read other reviews that people have recognised this film as the way their brains work, well I'm glad that I don't live in their heads, far to manic for me. I would recommend that you watch this and see what it means to you.

I don't have any words to describe this movieSimply life changingThese movies can make this world better place.Review needs 150 characters
So................................
Ha ha ha.

reviews.review_title: TOP 5 ALL TIME MOVIE FOR ME. WOW!
reviews.content: My review is going to be very minimal as I don't want to give anything away within the movie.I will simply just put, never have I experienced such a range of emotions back to back to back within a movie before. It will make you laugh, then cry, then laugh again. It was an absolute masterpiece and has skyrocketed up my favorites movie list.Please go experience this in theater. You won't regret it.

reviews.review_title: Everything Too Explained Everywhere All at Once
reviews.content: Too deep in its own multiverse for its own good.Even though I consider that the main characters have a very generous development the movie fails to adhere to the "Show don't tell" film mantra. It felt that it needed too much explaining. Other movies with plots as complexed (Inception one of them) required less explanation.At the end I liked the characters but I believe this story could have been a great sequel to a very good "cliffhangered" movie.

reviews.review_title: It's the best movie this year
reviews.content: Any movie that beats this movie this year should be this movie which is 1 minute longer, I have never hungered to rate a movie 10 as this, please watch it, if you don't like it watch it again, you might have missed something, it's undeniably good. I enjoyed the way they presented the concept of the multiverse; funny, crazy and amusing. I don't know a good person with good judgment that can rate this movie lower than 8. I really wish this movie would get more attention and probably win an Oscar.

This was really a joy to watch. I have to say I did non expect something like this at all: Crazy and emotional at the same time. I've watched the film after seeing all the attention and nominations that it received at this year's Oscars and my expectations weren't the highest. I was completely wrong. The movie is kind of intricate (in a way like tenet and inception) but it has also a great emotional story and somewhat of crazy. All the actors and actresses are AMAZING and of course Michelle Yeoh and Stephanie HSU are superbe. Also if I don't know if everyone would love this film for sure, i would definitely suggest it.
It's not weird enough, it's not confusing in any way, it's slapstick and hollow. I consider it a waste of time... Really not sure what the appeal is...

This is not a real story so it's fun. I got a little emotional by the end but I didn't sniffle. Kind of repetitive and stodgy but there's good enough stuff to keep you watching. The accents became distracting on rewatch but it's not a dealbreaker. The breakneck editing kind of is though. Anyways, very unique. Good choreography.
Not exactly what I was expecting but a good movie all in all. Evelyn's problems are shown, explained and solved. Definitely a sci-fi type movie but also an action film.

I didn't know what to expect before going in to this movie. I thought it was going to be another typical superhero, Marvel movie, but it turned out to be so much more. Also, so great to see an a leading Asian female character! Michelle Yeoh is an amazing actress, and I loved what she brought to this character. Also, the puns and innuendos were great. Overall, great writing, great direction and great acting!
You can link this movie with everything everywhere, all at once. This movie has all the ingredients for almost everyone. And has lot of life lessons as well. We can relate it to the Covid-19 as well.

Very good film, fast pace maybe sometimes too fast for my taste, but nevertheless very interesting concept and in my opinion the best use of the multiverses as it tries to use its full potential. Funny, adventurous and meaningful. Definately, you will miss a lot if you don't watch it.

A lively, hilarious, action-packed thriller where you never know what's going to happen next. An ambitious undertaking based on an intriguing premise that, shockingly, succeeded. Is there a universe in which everyone has hot dog fingers? A raccoon chef created by a ratatouille mispronunciation? A competition to use a butt plug as a teleportation device? This masterpiece dwarfs Rick and Morty. From start to finish, it's insane. A must-see, and in my opinion, a complete cinematic masterpiece. The action, comedy, and sci-fi were all fantastic. The metaphorical meaning behind it all (which can be many different things) is simply stunning. It was fantastic.
Brilliant script + story + director = Best movie in 2022Admirer the story line, and wonder what does it come from.... Wish I can dig more and understand more of my own life in present time.

reviews.review_title: Remarkable once you get the rhythm of it
reviews.content: At first I was thrown off by the frenetic pace, but once I understood and settled into the rhythm I appreciated where the film was taking me. It touches on many issues such as family estrangement, the plight of immigrants who struggle with the rules & laws of their adopted country, and in particular how we view and judge our past choices and contemplate "what ifs". This is not the film for when you want something easy and relaxing. It's a wild ride with a purpose and an ultimately satisfying ending. Congrats to Michelle Yeoh who still has her martial arts chops and all the supporting cast (shoutout to Stephanie Hsu). I recommend this to those viewers looking for an adventure and willing to put up with a little confusion until the movie reveals itself.
This film is a masterpiece of the simple yet complex emotions that humans have. It is a masterpiece of visual, acting, and storytelling artistry.This is a definite watch at least once in your life.

Everything that could ever be said about this movie has probably already been said, but I think this is an amazing change of pace for Action as a genre and as a whole. It's a genre that has been, in my opinion, dying for many years, run into the ground with the last 20 generic marvel releases, but this is something new, refreshing, and a poignant breath of life brought back into the genre. It combines everything any audience could possibly be interested in, tells a story that is relevant and relatable yet still says something novel about our lives and our existence. Perfectly blended and just stunning to look at and look through. The fact that is it so easy to watch despite being so remarkably dense speaks to how much thought and care was put into the writing and editing.
A movie as dense as a bagel, a bagel full of art film and absurd-ism, topped with sprinkles of comedy.On par with the likes of Fight Club, Donnie Darko, and other classic existential movies.

reviews.review_title: Every decision you make can create a different reality!
reviews.content: As the teachings of Albert Einstein show us how we can create our own reality, this movie gives us an amazing insight into the cause and effect our actions can have within our own lives and the entire multiverse. If you've explored the possibility of how every decision we make can take you in a different direction and create an alternate version of yourself, then you'll love it. Michelle Yeoh does an amazing job of playing a stressed out wife running round on the hamster wheel of life barely catching her breath. She is presented with another version of her husband that takes her on a journey of her other selves whilst he teaches her how to switch realities and draw in the gifts and talents from other versions of herself to change the reality she is living. It really is very enlightening! A mix of sci fi, comedy, romance and some great psychological insights as it explores the relationship with her family and how she came to be at the crossroads in her life that wakes her up and explores what's 'out there'. Sometimes it feels completely crackers but I found myself laughing out load and totally aligning with those moments. A treat if you like to stretch your mind and think outside the box!

Comedy+action+adventure+horror+romance+mystery+science friction.Recommend for 16years+ person to watch it. It is not really easy for people to understand the movie.Is like Stephen Chow movie, different age people watching have different feeling & meaning.

From start to end,it was awesome experience. It was funny . I had goose bumps. It explains alot of things that happens to our society. Some of the moments had deeper thoughts. A must watch family movie.

What an absolute masterpiece. Brilliant creative genius. No words can describe it. All Dharma Realms = Mind = All beings. Grandpa is the traditional value and hierarchy. It's judgmental and impossible to please. Daughter is rebellion against the hierarchy and find liberation in emptiness/nihilism. Father is trying to please everyone, suppress himself to take care others first as a way to cope. Mother realized the middle way. Letting go and embrace are the same thing. Suffering and happiness are the same. Everything and everywhere, we are all in it together.

"Every rejection, every disappointment has led you here to this moment."There comes a time in life you think about the Shoudda,Coudda, Woulddas... But what if we can be content with the life we have? The thoughts of the countless other lives we might have led, had we made different decisions along the way... But what if you see that the flipside to life being meaningless is in fact the freedom that comes from the fact that you can do anything and that you did your best with the time you've got???This film is a crazy ride... I laughed, I screamed WTF several times, I cried; oh boy I cried... I absolutely loved it...By the end I saw my nervous anxiety ridden self with all my quirks and strengths and understood that all decisions good and bad I've made in life have brought me here and its exactly where I need to be.

Saw this movie with no real idea what to expect I suggest the same to everyone, but I loved this movie. It is So weird and so fun. It is Funny but not distracting so, it is wholesome but not the whole point of it, it is visually stunning in a way you just have to see to understand.This movie trys to be something different and absolutely succeeds. It is emotionally charged and I even shed a tear or two. Good and believeable family dynamics and acting is upper crust from everyone involved. Again this is my movie of the year and I don't want to spoil anything because it truly has some great moments that need to be seen. Go ahead and try to guess the plot before you see it cause I'd be surprised if you were close.It's beautiful, heart wrenching, visually stunning and a must watch.

This film make a strong case for not packaging a series pilot as a film - there were too many arcs in this stoner sci-fi to be coherently held together in a film, even one as long as this. It is rich and effusive, unusual, hilarious and even challenging at times, but at heart, it is a forgetable Hollywood sci-fi film with great pretensions at low budget cinematic art. A brilliant failed series that makes for a rather ordinary, if bright and colourful blockbuster.

reviews.review_title: Amazing concept but not perfectly executed
reviews.content:
The BadThe modern view of the multiverse started with the TV show Rick and Morty where we can now explore just how weird things can get when everything is possible. This works out great for comedy but proves to be tricky for a film like this that also wants to have its dramatic moments.At certain times I found myself completely over the ridiculousness and was hoping for the story to just slow down. Luckily it did but only to be interrupted by moments such as hot dog fingers being shoved into each others mouths.Many times this film drags on story beats, whether it is a dramatic beat or a ridiculous one, and would benefit from a ~15 min reduction in run time.Back to the Rick and Morty comparison, the divorced couple who sees how their life would be without the other was played out in an episode already. I believe that the TV show did a much better job of that and it truly made sense why they decided to stay together in the end. In this film it seems like they got back together because he is a nice guy? Hard to decipher due to the ending of this movie tieing so many loose ends up in such a quick and ridiculous fashion.The GoodIncredibly deep in its exploration on nihilism and how it is effecting the youth of today. I love the tie back to family love and acceptance because it truly gives their lives purpose.The Jumping between universes, although a bit ridiculous at times, was visually stunning. The different ways they filmed the switches between worlds and how it effected across them was stunning.Ke Huy Quan absolutely stole the show with his performance. Without that lovable feeling he brings so well, I'm not sure the ending would have worked at all. He does this while also bringing such depth to the character at times showing great promise for future rolls.Overall
Very difficult concept to nail perfectly but was done extremely well. Defiantly worth a watch for all film lovers but be ready for it to stumble along the way.

reviews.review_title: Senses overload that is a true adventure in entertainment!
reviews.content: I am 62 and watched this with my 29 year old son. We both loved the movie, but he loved it more. It is a visual feast and, without being too heavy handed, it has a really great message.

reviews.review_title: An LGBT Pro movie with a pinch of humor
reviews.content: I believe the movie is significantly over rated, mainly due to a heart warming message to the minority.May contain a spoiler!Its about how disturbing and torturous it is to criticize people with different mindsets towards their sexuality, the movie very nicely depicts the mental condition of an opposed/suppressed individual.Still an a general viewer I believe some jokes in the movie were good however to me its a below average Fantasy comedy.

reviews.review_title: A Rick and Morty episode expanded into a 130 minute Tik-tok video.
reviews.content: This movie was probably conscientiously designed with the goal of teaching some valuable life lessons to the increasing portion of the population with 15 second attention span. Some scenes were clearly shot for the trailer and the movie throughtout fights HARD for your attention. There's no problem with this, the goal is noble. Several plot elements and the main message are very similar to an early Rick and Morty episode to the point that it probably inspired this movie. Of course there are plenty of original ideas as well, the movie was made with great care and effort.

This may be the best movie I have seen in my 40 year old life. I didnt expect much of it and just put it on because the trailer seemed interesting.It started little slow and I thought it will be an okay movie to see before sleep. I was so wrong.There was wonderfull after wonderfull scenes that my eyes couldnt believe. And then the dialogue and story, my brain was working overtime with processing it all.When the movie ended I was just sat there with my mouth open. I had a hard time sleeping that night and just was processing the movie in my mind.This is the greatest thing I have ever seen on the screen and I am thankful to be alive in a time to see something so incredible.This took my top 1 movie of all time and Donnie darko got pushed to nr 2.

The base storyline takes a mundane life, and weaves it into this wonderful, fantastical multiverse.I laughed so many times throughout, and also cried at the incredibly human moments that are also there in bounds.

reviews.review_title: The most hilarious therapy session I've ever had
reviews.content: This movie is pure art. It makes you feel a lot of feelings and think a lot of thoughts. The two basic requirements for something to be considered art, i guess, if you were making a checklist. Why would you? After watching this movie, I'd rather ask "why wouldn't you?"Nothing matters. And this movie, quite masterfully in few words and many charged visuals, shows the both sides to that statement.We spend so much time focusing on the little details that don't matter, that we lose track of the fact that NOTHING matters. So, if nothing matters, why do we choose to focus on the stressful things? Hateful things? Irritating things?Why not choose kindness? Love? Acceptance? Making sure that people around you feel your love, and find meaning in those little pieces of time that actually make sense. Rather than focusing on the rest that's nonsense.P. S. Watch this movie with your parents, if you can.

reviews.review_title: Kinda Interesting but a bit messy and long
reviews.content: I would say that this movie tried to include too many interesting ideas and cliché tropes without focusing on anything long enough to give it any depth. The actors are very good but a lack of development undercuts the story. The tone is a mess. Is the movie a family drama, sci-fi horror, action movie, comedy, or an utter farce? The movie tries to include them all and as a result parts or bloated and the runtime is far too long. I enjoyed watching most of the movie but it is far from great. "Too many notes"

I loved it, I absolutely loved it. It just made sense somehow. Yes, it is a very abstract movie that balances the absurdity. But here the absurd has meaning and that's why I love it. I absolutely hate absurdity just for the sake of it, but they made it work here. I love the concept of everything bagel and the goofy sticker eye. It does work here. You end the movie with a feeling that it's all okay and it's fine to be a mess. It's equally absurd as our lives, and I just can't get over it.The characters are absolutely perfect for the story. They are well developed and so easy to identify with even though it's a pure fantasy.

reviews.review_title: Inspired and crazy scifi comedy action
reviews.content: This super imaginative rollercoaster was very entertaining watch. In addition to some jaw dropping visual sequences it was also quite thoughtful and touching. Cadidate for best film of the year. Acting was allaround great, but Michelle Yeoh definately deserves an Oscar nomination.

In a time where original content is largely absent, we get a movie that delivers a fantastic message through original and creative storytelling coupled with committed and energetic acting. We need more movies like this one that can deliver serious content with humor, fantasy and drama at the same time. Don't over-analyze, just be entertained and enjoy.

reviews.review_title: I would rather watch kung pow
reviews.content: So here I was expecting to get entertained by a parody Multiverse film, but all I got was a boring high morale PC film about accepting your daughter is not you and is allowed to live her own life. This movie was purely made for making funny memes and is highly overrated, the.narrative is generic and it is supposed to be a comedy, but it was not even funny. There are apperently no changes in the Multiverse, so when we are married to a person in one universe it is forced to be repeated in another universe. The film was way too long.

Just walked out of the theater after watching this, and I am blown away. Such an amazing journey with this story. I felt such a wide range of emotions throughout in a positive way.Instant classic for me!

reviews.review_title: More Madness than the Multiverse of Madness!
reviews.content: This is perhaps more Multiverse of Madness than Dr. Strange 2 - and yes it is crazy but crazy good. It even has a parody of the movie on the last part.You'll get bored on the first few minutes not knowing what movie you are watching, but as the story progresses the adrenaline pumps in - like the effects of whatever substance you have been injected with, finally kicks in. The action, the effects, the CGI and even the complex explanation on what makes up the entire story of the movie is on a crazy high level. The comedic parts are like what the... and then you go back into the fight scenes. Awesome movie - great to watch but keep the young ones off of this.

In a raft of franchise films and formula moving designed for a focus group this stands out as one or the weirdest, cleverest, funniest films I have seen in long time.Not saying it's always easy, but that's because it does follow the pack.The effort and detail that goes in is staggering for something (I'm guessing) without a massive budget. Some scenes probably 1/10 second long with intricate detail, some great gags, funny, sad excitingNot often an emotional scene with stones in a film, or the answer to a long standing philosophical question, or understanding of the potential violent uses of office equipmentLoved it.

Man, I feel like I must be one of the only people who didn't like this movie. Everything Everywhere All at Once is a fitting name for it because that's what this movie throws at you and for me it just didn't work. It's for the most part a tale of finding family across the multiverse which I think could've worked fine on its own. Instead, it's got this scifi "jumping" element where in order to switch multiverses you have to do a "statistically improbable action". So you go from artsy shots and the protagonist discussing divorce with her husband to some guy sitting on a buttplug in an office or a universe where people have fingers made of hotdogs. I only laughed once or twice during the movie; the overall tone wasn't comedic and the "wacky" bits were quite tame compared to what's been done in Rick and Morty to much greater effect. You're also constantly jumping around, martial arts gets thrown in...it's all a bit incoherent.I would rate Eternal Sunshine higher for emotional time travel, About Time higher for romantic time travel, Rick and Morty higher for comedic time travel, The Butterfly Effect higher for thought-provoking time travel...in summary; this movie is not more than the sum of its parts; it's more like the average of its parts and each part isn't as strong as it could be on its own.If you like "trippy" movies then this might be for you but if you're looking to stay awake for two hours then I'd find something else to watch.

Its been a while since I've watched a film that has had such a profound impact. There are times when you question every little decision you've ever made, and wondered what would've happened if.... and this film addresses this head on. The complexities of life lye in the everyday choices we make and the impact they may have on our lives, and those closest to us. A simple concept, yet the reprocussions of these decisions can be life altering as portrayed so beautifully in this film.What if????

It's an exaggerated film.My favorite part of the film was the leading actress. Her acting is great and she's very funny but brings a much needed subtlety and sort of more calm, less dramatic vibe to this very dramatic chaotic movie.My least favorite part, the visuals. Just personally doesn't do it for me, feels draining and like it's trying to sell more or be different and original but just doesn't get there. Just a matter of the style i guess, feels very like "oh cool look at all these ideas and elements, let's use literally all of it". If this movie were a food it'd be one of those hamburgers but the buns are glazed donuts, with onion rings, two types of sauce and rainbow sprinkles. Not everyone would eat and enjoy but it will catch everyone's attention.I felt like the other things i loved kind of became what i didn't like after sometime. Like how it's unexpected and you can't tell what's coming, but then this element gets tired and overused. Or how it's psychological and reaches for the character's depth and complexity of their relationship to each other, but then again kind of goes too far and gets repetitive. I loved how it tackled heavier issues like suicide ideation, mental health but again, as it went on and on and just got too stretched to the point it drained my energy and it didn't feel worth it.To finish off i loved the idea, it had a lot of potential, it has its great moments, but just doesn't get there. My biggest personal bias is that i hate romance, not as in a couple in love but as in how a message is delivered in a very positive light way but with a lot of struggle before it. "nothing matters" but "i will always be here for you" and that kinda stuff. It's just too romantic for me when things go from relatable and simple to something aiming to be beautiful and extraordinary. I think we should be kind of past that at this point as humans, as time progresses and we see how effed up things really are as a whole and instead of being proactive we try to escape to a better, more digestible place where we can be comfortable again.

I fell asleep half way through in the cinema... and when I woke up it did not matter how much I had missed. I didn't feel curious as to what I had dozed through because there was no progressive story line to follow. Just a compendium of individually non-essential scenes stitched together - any one of which could have been cut from the movie and we'd be none the wiser. It wasn't so much a plot as it was a premise, and so there was no plot to lose track of.I feel like a basic dynamic was borrowed from Sense8 - the power to tap into multiple abilities from another dimension to get out of a fix. Even so, there was never any sense that the protagonist was in any real mortal danger.There were moments of silliness and moments of sobriety that I appreciated... but on the whole, it felt mismatched.At the end of the movie, I felt cheated: what appeared to be a literal, objective experience could very well have simply been an inner struggle of the protagonist worked out in her imagination.The villain never once felt like a villain... and one knew from the moment the villain was revealed that they would inevitably have to patch things up by the end of the movie... and so there was no real sense of the villain being truly dangerous or ruthless to the core.The movie felt predictable and laborsome to watch. I'm not at all fussy and end up loving movies that most tear apart... but this film was forgettable -- they spelled it all out for us and left no mystery to ponder once all was said and done. And even the visual messiness/ madness of the movie was not disturbing or intriguing enough to give me fitful dreams - having gone straight home thereafter and jumped into bed - which I found quite odd. There was nothing truly captivating or gripping about this movie despite the acting being quite decent. No loose ends. Ironically, nothing is left to the imagination.

reviews.review_title: Best Form of Any Storytelling Ever!
reviews.content: When I first watched Everything Everywhere All at Once, I thought it was one of the best movies I've ever seen. But after rewatching it after some time, I am convinced that it is the best form of any storytelling I have ever come across. Granted, I haven't watched, read or played every movie/show/play, book or game ever created in the many languages that exist. But of the significant portion of my life I have spent experiencing stories and my subjective & biased parameters for what an exceptional form of storytelling should ideally be based on, I am certain that this movie is the best I've come across yet.Why do I think that?Because it combines the most investigated philosophical question of the purpose of life, the most complex metaphysical theory of multiverses and the most consistently prevalent emotions of hope & despair, all together, in 150 minutes that span almost every storytelling genre there is.And it does this with a series of truly extraordinary & powerful acting performances, elegantly simple yet extremely compelling dialogues, absurdist yet coherent editing & transitions and one of the most narratively complementary cinematography ever.Furthermore, the exceptionally intelligent use of various styles of humour, balanced with a metaphorical yet deeply compassionate use of relationships, to construct a narrative that - though may appear comically-absurd & entertaining on a casual first-watch - is actually so much more; being consistently deliberate, methodical & profound on a second viewing.All this coalesces into a unique emotional journey - with an abundance of excellent humour - that inevitably transitions to a rollercoaster ride of hope crescendos & despair diminuendos, while offering convincing justifications for these ebbs and flows, concluding in an extremely cathartic & appropriate ending.Everything Everywhere All at Once - as the title suggests - is truly a story about everything, everywhere, told all at once. It's the most conclusive story of existence. And as cliched and inaccurate its ultimate moral may seem, it ingeniously conveys it in the single most hopeful & captivating manner possible.And that's why it is the best form of any storytelling I have ever come across.

First 20 minutes of the movie may be a hard nut to crack but give it a chance and try to look at it from a distance. Try to open your mind and look for a deeper sense. Don't focus on the picture itself but on what the director is trying to convey through it.If you are interested in multiverse/quantum physics topics you will be delighted. I have never seen so well depicted interpretation of a multiverse concept. It will take you far beyond the limits of your perception. Will not only show you the 'out the box' thinking - it will totally destroy all the walls of that box, showing you all the possible ways the atoms your body consists of could ever turn into. All other concepts of the multiverse like the one in the Marvel's Universe are somehow limited - they present other worlds but with the same structure - there are humanoid creatures living their lives as we are - but with differencies being the outcome of different life decisions etc. The movie here is showing all the abstract versions of ourselves which will push some of it's audience away - which is understandable as not everyone is imaginative enough to grasp it.It was a mind boggling experience full of moral principles which we tend to ignore in our daily life. If nothing matters after all - what will you value the most?

It was DEFINITELY weird and not like your average movie or story - which I really did appreciate. But there comes a point where more and more weird does not make it good. I was really looking forward to this movie and it disappointed me. Don't believe the hype of the reviews.

reviews.review_title: Has a very unique style... Awesome originality
reviews.content:
Not a med movie indeed... Has a philosophical message that we all have thought about one day....
Will I do better in better conditions in better place in better time?Does it matter at all?Great movie indeed.

I do not even know how I like this movie, but I absolutely love it and want to put it up there with my favourites. I will be the n-th person to say this, but this movie really is Everything, Everywhere All at Once. I really do not know how this movie does it, but it has so many things that I think I normally find extremely frustrating, unrealistic or not funny at all, but with this movie I appreciate it, love it and absolutely crack up at it. Of course I have seen movies that made me go through a lot of emotions but this movie is so different. I had so many emotions, and they all felt so complete and separate, it was like I watched 5 movies that all gave me a different emotion.I think I love how this movie gives you so many options to feel about it. You can think it is a great comedy or action movie, but you can also spend a lot of time analysing all the subliminal messages of the movie and find it an incredibly deep movie. It somehow succeeds at all of it.I saw someone make the comparison with The French Dispatch (in a negative way). I absolutely hated The French Dispatch (sorry), I found it so boring, it made me go and study. But in a way, I do understand the comparison. I (an absolute layman) think The French Dispatch also tries a lot and tries to make people connect with and get into an absurd movie. To me, The French Dispatch just totally failed at connecting and well, everything.This review is probably chaotic and all over the place, I apologise, but that kind of is how this movie was for me. And I absolutely loved it! Wow!

reviews.review_title: I got bored one day and I put everything in a movie:
reviews.content: Multiverse-madness like in Doctor Strange and Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse, the remote bestowing of special-skills and ports hidden in common locations like in the Matrix, Hong Kong cinema-style fighting scenes, the generational disconnect that is bound to repeat itself, so inherent to Asian families, a misplaced Wong Kar-Wai reference, an Adam Sandler-esque parody of Ratatouille, annoying 9gag humor... And it collapsed in on itself.

Interesting idea, acting great - could have cut out around an hour of frenetic repetitive activity and i might have enjoyed more. Couldn't wait for it to be over. I don't know what else to write to fill up this review because i think that says it all. Michelle Yeoh and Jamie Lee Curtis were excellent. I loved the Deidre character Jamie played, very funny. I also loved the ending of the human relationships ie mother daughter were paramount and should be cherished in the moment. Also being less judgmental of our family and more accepting and loving is truly a practice that leads to happy endings.

I didn't understand of the part one, but it became nice from the part 2. Basically it's a family story. Not bad overall. And apparently, Michelle Yeah's mother language is not Mandarin. It sounds a little bit weird. I think let them speak Cantonese would be more natural.

I watched it twice to make sure that I hadn't missed anything. I still did not understand so many things. A lot of special effects and action, one more factor that makes me think "what's the real plot / story" behind it? I am giving it a 1 not so much because it deserves 1 star, but to try to tone down the unreasonable high ranking it has now. IMDB in the past 4/5 years is becoming more and more reliable on the rankings, 8.2 to this movie is simply out of any logic.

reviews.review_title: Beautiful! One fir Rick and Morty Fans
reviews.content: Multiverse is very on trend at the minute, but where Dr Strange was lacking, this made up for it.Where science and philosophy let your mind wander in and beyond the 'What If's.....Yes, its not a new concept, but it was just mental, and so much fun to watch (and feel).I'm so glad I went to watch this without reading in to it. Was like watching inter-dimensional cable, with a dash of Matrix and sprinkle of His Dark Materials.Laughed a load out load, but also truly heartwarming and enlightening. Those who rated this movie low just don't get it or the deeper meaning.Oh, and its just mental!

reviews.review_title: The best movie of the year
reviews.content:
"Be kind, especially when you don't know what's going on."
I guess that's the fervent hope of this movie, that if all people were kinder to other races, the world would be more loving! Asians are not bad, they are hardworking, they have suffered a lot, and they know how to cherish.The worldview in the movie is shocking. This is really a movie with deep Buddhist thoughts. It is another Buddhist science fiction movie after The Matrix.

I could not endure this movie to the very end. Just could not bear the blinking effects and the fast changing of scenes. I see some ressemlence of a good story line, but there are a lot of plot wholes and ambiguities. It starts very slow and then it gets so fast paced and I could barely catch up with the plot. I liked the fighting shots, the arrangement and filming of the scnes, the acting was at a good level, but there should really be a less acid trip way of telling that story. I really hope that whoever caused himself the suffering to endure that movie to the very end will find it was worth it.

reviews.review_title: One of the best comedy and thriller/action movie of recent times
reviews.content: The concept of this movie is pretty interesting, the cinematography, transitions and acting is great and the line delivery by actors is just amazing. The movie takes a very nice turn from mystery and action to focus on the life issues of the charactors and improve their relationship.

reviews.review_title: I totally agree that the only thing to fight against nihilism is just family
reviews.content: More places more things you experience, you will only feel pointless. Everybody just struggles on pointless little things.As a normal people, the only thing to fight against nihilism is just love of family/love for family.Thanks for spoke out for old asian mothers.

What a movie!!!! Really, The best movie for 2022.It's difficult to know where to begin with this film, but my general opinion is that it's brilliant and delivers precisely what it promises and intends to. It articulates its messages directly in an immersive manner that is relatable to to all (though yeah, not suitable for young children).

A must watch film that will blow your mind and make you think. It has a dark comedy, it will make you wonder about the what if's which I've done so many years. I will be watching this again and no doubt see more. It does have subtitles but it what makes the film.

There is a review on here that reads: "There is a tiny bit of a story that makes sense and is appealing but this movie fails tremendously as it is filled with nonsensical fillers that is supposed to be funny or sad or super cringy." and that is the entirety of the issue in one big nutshell.You see, what I assume this reviewer was referring to in terms of a tiny bit of story, was the backstory regarding the characters' lives that is depicted at the beginning of the film. To assume that this is the story, is to miss the entire part of the film. The film actually revolves around what this person saw as filler, but is anything but. Everything happens inside what they term filler. To believe that the other side of the film is the main story, surely disconnects you from seeing what this film means.As of right now, this is the best film of 2022.

This is probably one of the most brilliant movies I've ever watched in my whole life.The CGI was beyond perfect. The story flows perfectly, logically and with a perfect ending. I couldn't have asked for more. I came in with really high expectations, I wasn't disappointed in the slightest. This is a work of genius. Thanks for telling this story.

Much has been said about the multiverse and this film shows it in a unique way.Exposing "Everything Everywhere All at Once" that it is possible to make a script that teaches you without being childish, rude or disrespectful to the audience that watches it. Which currently has been the routine.And by the way, nothing here is common, each scene is well-crafted with a purpose.The design work and photography are incredible, making even with the budget much smaller than the big productions achieve the result beyond expected.Sound professionals teach about immersion.A masterpiece of hilarious scenes and with a lot of sensitivity.

Human experience has found all of us daydreaming and questioning our past present and future. To see a reflection of these dynamics in the fantastical scenes captured by the cast and crew is powerful. This film does not disappoint. The POW at the conclusion is a timely and relevant message for our tumultuous times but also transcends all time.

It has more multiverse and more madness than Doctor Strange. The idea of multiverse found in this movie I wanted to see in the new Doctor Strange movie.Honestly I think this is the most original, innovative, spectacular and craziest film ever made or at least ever seen by me.

This film was bad. I like Michelle Yeoh, but I can't believe she agreed to do this movie. I won't be able to watch another one of her films now with the same respect. Was there really a need to have a room full of BDSM stuff? Was it necessary to have grown men trying to land on butt plugs? Was it necessary to have a fight involving dildos?Besides all of this the film is pushing pushing relationship agendas that aren't normal.The first half an hour isn't too bad and there was quite a lot of original arty filming.Don't waste your time watching this movie. You could watch paint dry instead!
Best movies i have ever watched. Everything is so perfect! The story the cast as in everything. You will learn life lessons and realization that we need to hear once in a kifetime.
People who gave less than 10. Really need to take classes for understanding.The massage this masterpiece is trying to give will make you rethink your life.Absolutely marvelous.

Perhaps this movie beats all my favorites like the Matrix or Limitless.The movie is about every stage of life and how to deal with it. It goes deep into human nature and figures out that ultimately, there is no "trick" to enlightenment, but it's all the things in your life being in tune with each other.The whole idea of this movie essentially is to create a vibe that comes as close as possible to sense perception and the potentially extreme chaos implied by that. Life is absolutely chaotic, it is extremely hard to solve if we get engaged with the logic of our environment. The environment can potentially be hell and the mind will run away from it. Evelyn is the personification of exactly that, she runs away from the immanent facts that actually rule her life and she gets very upset whenever anyone tries to show her the vastness of reality. Having done LSD, this reminded me of certain stages during the life altering experience during the trip. It's a memory that returns periodically.Obviously the movie can have any effect on anyone, it's like drugs. Whatever you want from the drug you can achieve, if it's just fun or wisdom. There can never be consensus of things like this, it's like life itself.

I've never had my entire family sobbing in a room together unless some unthinkable tragedy had just taken place - until Everything Everywhere All at Once came out.This movie is a wonderful story about family, and family's expectations, told through an absolutely strange story. The performances were great, the script is amazing (don't listen to the haters), and the message came through clearly.Plus who doesn't want to see Jaime Lee Curtis summon her inner Sumo-Wrestler??Perfect blend of comedy/action/comedy-action/drama/visuals.Overall I can't think of a better movie to come out of 2022.
