I was already a fan of A24, but now I'm a fanatic.

reviews.review_title: A family drama disguised as everything else
reviews.content:
Everything Everywhere All at Once review:
I really enjoyed this movie. I've watched it 3 times now.At its heart, it's a family drama focusing on the generation gaps. On this level, it's solid. Good performances by all the main actors.I especially liked Stephanie Hsu's Jojo, Jamie Lee Curtis and Ke Huy QuanBut if the family drama is the heart, or maybe *spoilers* the bagel, then everything else would be the toppings.The toppings include:
The wit of Monty Python
World aesthetic of Buckaroo Bansai
Design elements of Fifth Element
Adolescent humor of South Park
and concepts of The Matrix.Have fun!

This is single handedly the best movie I've ever watched. If you want to experience every possible emotion all while being absorbed in amazing visuals and incredible acting performances then this is the movie for you. I have thought about it everyday since watching it and have recommended/required everyone I know to watch it:). The movie encompasses multiple significant and relavent topics while still finding space for humour and action. If there were ever a movie I wished I could see for the first time again it would be this one. Everything, Everywhere, All at Once is incomparable to any other film.

reviews.review_title: One of the best movies i watched
reviews.content:
It gave me hope that everything can be ok
If you can you must watch it, under any curcomstances
Its funy, its sad, its scary, its a work of art
I am glad i watched it
But that is just my review, you might have a difrent opinion and thats ok, i recomed you watch 100000/10.

reviews.review_title: A beautiful, wonderful, and meaningul chaos
reviews.content: If you are tired of films speaking about the importance of love, kindness and family, go watch this film, it's all about that. But better.This film is the perfect balance between action, sci-fi, auteur and so many other genres. You never expect what is coming next. You sometimes laugh or cry, and you often do both.I still cannot describe how this film made me feel, and how (almost) perfect it is. Not one second did I get bored. And the most surprising for a 2022 movie for me : I can't stop thinking about it.The editing, the lights, the acting, the camera movements, the music, the sound, and so many more things are simply beautifully mixed together in wonderful, meaningful chaos.I could talk about this film in more details, and for way too long, but I'll stop here and tell you something everybody must have told you : go watch it, immediately.

Emotionally packed movie carrying more than one message, from mastering an existential crisis over realising which people matter most in your life, to being more open and/or tolerant to a different sexual orientation. But most of all, nothing really matters . . .

This movie was absolutely incredible. I feel there are going to be people out there that day this movie is confusing and just all around bizarre. It is, but everything makes sense (all at once). Keep an open mind to the theory that the universe is infinite. Don't listen to the negative reviews. This movie is probably one of the best movies of the decade.
The way this film is presented, the love, the imagination, the creativity... everything is palpable all throughout the 2 hours of this modern masterpiece. Instant classic.

1/10 is too much for it, cause i cant give 0 to it 😂😂😂
This movie is literally and totally wast of time 👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻
The more i say is because it must contain at least six hundred characters , this movie is so bad , i cant explain more than this. How should i put bad and worse in six hundred of characters? Its just so bad.This movie don't deserve action comedy genre. I expected to laugh a little bit at least. How you can give comedy genre to this movie?All genre you can give to it is so bad comedy and very very bad action.Ughhhh i wasted 2 hours of my life seeing this very very very bad movie.
Best movie on parallel universe topic. Super direction and amazing acting by all the main actors. Its so much happening that you need to watch it at least twice to understand everything.

reviews.review_title: This movie is for everyone to watch. The message is live our life with love, compassion, understanding, kindness, forgiveness, peace, harmony and joy!
reviews.content: This movie is not really just about one particular person story.It is the story of everyone.The message is that we are our own hero, savor, healer.And the fighting or battle is not about kill the bad guys, as no such thing as bad guys or evil, devil or monster.It is about fighting to the darkness or negative energy within ourselves, which we have mistakenly absorbed from this 3D world.And I love the end solution. It is a very profound wisdom. Learn to understand ourselves and others, instead of criticise or judging others and ourselves. We need to relax, live simple as we can and enjoy life.

reviews.review_title: Touching- and that's the Asian bro from the "Goonies"
reviews.content: Open your mind and enjoy this loving, touching movie. You will be smiling at the end. Very original. The cast does a great job. A couple scenes were defiantly odd- but whatever. This movie had everything. Didn't want to stop watching. You will love Joy's outfits. Not only is that the bro from the "Goonies"- but there is also another bro that was the bad guy in "Big Trouble in Little China". AND the lady from the bowel yogurt commercials does an epic job as well. Very cool premise for a movie that you can watch by yourself or with people you care about. I spend like 45 minutes of my life searching for movies some nights- on the 10 different apps we have and rarely end up this satisfied with my choices. This was a pleasant surprise. It's a feel good movie. Promise.

reviews.review_title: I finally found a movie as good as cloud atlas
reviews.content: Cloud atlas was my whole time fav movie .. I never thought that one day i will watch a movie that can literally change my life the way cloud atlas did .. this movie is mind blowing .. a masterpiece .. a work of art that will be remembered as a modern cinematic revolution. Period.

reviews.review_title: I'm only giving it a 3 because the actors did a wonderful job.
reviews.content: But everything else was honestly not it for me. I found it confusing, and slow. The first few scenes were a complete mimic of the Matrix when Neo is in the offices being chased at the very start. I found it was really a combination of many of my favourite movies. From the Matrix to Dr Strange to Any SciFi about universe jumping. Though the performances were fantastic, the storyline was too boring for me, or just not good enough ? We didn't get to experience the other people's lives, we didn't get to experience their world and so it was tough feeling the way that the main actress was suppose to be feeling. While easy to feel the doom of the other characters as we could find ourselves in them. To bring hope, they should have shown more of it.

reviews.review_title: What's your favorite movie? For me, this is it!
reviews.content: A multitude of timely themes, balanced storytelling, and filmmaking genius combine to create the best movie of 2022. Forever to be my favorite film of all time!A lot's been said about how EEAAO transcends the sea of today's trend-hopping, attention-grabbing blockbusters, and for good reason. It's not only heightened the bar for science fiction, it's swung open the doors to a new universe entirely. From drama to comedy and action to romance, this universe has it all! As the title suggests.Michelle Yeoh carries the film with graceful humanity, but little's been said about Ke Huy Quan. His character may not be the most blatant, but therein lies his inherent value. Maybe I relate to him a bit too much, but I very much fell for his quiet strength and enduring kindness in the midst of all the chaos. Certainly, he was a soft, but sturdy anchor for the film.Based on the reviews, I don't need to touch on Jamie Lee Curtis, but I'd be damned if I didn't give her flowers for her unprecedented performance. Her scenes alone sent me to a universe of cackling fits. And, of course, not to mention the stunning Stephanie Hsu. Typically, I'd be irritated by her kind of bratty teenager character, but I also couldn't imagine the film without her. Her fashion and styling alone *chef's kiss* - although, not to take away from her brilliant acting, which made her a convincing menace.I won't get into too much detail because 1. Really, you just need to see it for yourself; and 2. Honestly, there's not one way to perfectly capture a movie with the title EEAAO. Just know that this film is soup for the soul. I laughed, cried, and felt the full spectrum of emotions. It did everything a great movie could do, and then some.I can see how, to some people, it was literally too much. But, I also think that those who were confused perhaps were just trying too hard to make sense of an otherwise senseless - and may I remind you - fictional movie. Some films you've really got to just go with the flow and experience the scenes as the characters do. It's not always up to us to fully understand what even the characters don't realize yet. I know, what's a good movie if there's no takeaways due to missing the points? Well, maybe you're just thinking too much into it.SPOILER: if you really think you missed the mark, my take is that it had multiple glorious, life-affirming lessons. That as much as we may dream about living other lives and rethinking our life's path, there is beauty and richness in every life, even our current one. Even if it's doing laundry and taxes when another life of ours may be one of fame and fortune.To me, that is the major, overhanging theme. But the line that sticks with me most is toward the end when Michelle's character is staring down the last line of her daughter's demented warriors. Ke Huy Quan is in hysterics after a whirlwind of events and watches as she places a silly googly eye on her forehead and says, "I'm learning to fight like you."Gosh, that moment is just emblazoned in my memory. Maybe I'm biased, because learning to fight like others has been a personal theme for me this year, but regardless there's so much wisdom and heart in that. It's not a theme we often see, but changing our perspective in the heat of it all, learning to embrace the simplest concept of kindness and using that awareness to change the course of conflict - say more.With the state of the world these past years, we couldn't be more in need of a film that reminds us of the importance of thinking about others beyond the surface emotions and the brazen actions. How can we improve our mindsets to switch from automatic reactions to actual problem solving? How can we dig deeper to meet unkind people with the kindness their soul more desperately needs? How can we magnify the sources of kindness in our own lives in order to save the world?This movie spells out the answers.

reviews.review_title: You don't wanna be drunk watching this movie
reviews.content: Everything everywhere all at once is a crazy insane emotional fun all over the place movie with some of the best choreography I've seen in a while with well done effects too. Your head will definitely be spinning after the craziness you've just sat 2 hours through. The characters and acting is great too. Especially the role Jamie lee Curtis is in, it's insane.

reviews.review_title: Truly Everything Everywhere All At Once
reviews.content: This movie is truly an immersive experience where you follow the main character Evelyn played by an excellent Michelle Yeoh through the multiverse to defeat an unknown force. This movie skillfully utilises symbolism and humour to address themes of nihilism, sacrifice, depression and intergenerational trauma. Uniquely, this film could also be titled Truly All Genres All At Once as it incorporates comedy, drama and action into its core identify as a sci-fi film. There is bound to be many laugh out loud moment as well as many moments of introspections which makes it a cognitive experience as well.Adding to a mind blowing plot, is the artful directing, sound score and costume design which adds vibrancy to the message being conveyed. This aspect of the film truly makes it a sensory experience. Your brain will undoubtedly be stimulated.Overall verdict: a cinematic experience once must experience in the cinemas. This will undoubtedly one of the front runners for Best Picture.

This movie made me laugh and cry so much. Incredibly touching mother daughter story perfectly woven in to a chaotic mission to save the multiverse. Was sitting in the very front row of the theater so uncomfortable but struck by this movie that it didn't matter. Very few movies i wld stay in a horrible seat like that for. So glad i did!

It's the worst movie I've seen in a long time. I honestly don't understand those who recommended it to me so much. In a family drama disguised as a multivessal conflict. The big villain is simply a teenager with acceptance issues. A family that has to resolve their common conflicts or all the universes collapse. And how is the great multiversal conflict resolved??? Of course.... With the force of love!! ....My God, kill me! Two long and tedious hours of exaggerated and meaningless fights that end up dizzying or boring, I don't remember what happened to me first. The over-the-top performances are in keeping with the style of the film. I believe and I reiterate that it would not be so bad if they took away 45 min.

There is no words that I could see Serve this film justice . This was a truly incomprehensible experience.The acting was phenomenal and did a beautiful job at conveying the character's emotions. The picture was surreal and every editing choice was perfect ; truly delectable.The message was definitely received due to its delivery being extraordinary.I have taken many life lessons from this.

The movie has undeniably good ratings. Having an above average rating, I was curious as to how the plot would go and transpire. I'm not really a sci-fi genre fan, nonetheless, I decided to give it a try.Now, I genuinely don't know what others saw or felt throughout the film to think it deserved such high appraisal. It wasn't bad, it was just mediocre at best. Although it could be a fun and motivating experience to watch with your family, since the whole film revolved around the ideologies and difficulties of each member of the Wang family. Perhaps you can relate to some struggles and actually really enjoy the film. The characters are truly likeable in ways that you can feel the conflict within them- they make you understand their emptiness, like how they can be hopeless and hopeful all at once.It generally depends on how you interpret the value of the movie. Joy's anguish and desperation to feel something- to find meaning in her otherwise pointless endeavor to live, the pain of feeling alone with nobody to understand you- even the closest to your heart, can be quite relatable to most people.You should watch it, you might enjoy it- or not.

This movie is full of emotions, both for the characters in the movie as well as for the people watching it. There are lots of laughs, great action and lots of drama, perfect mix and rhythm. Amazing movie experience and one of the best movies I have seen.

I did wonder if we'd been slipped some lsd prior to watching this. It was a little far out in places and i wanted to love it but just didn't. A standard 5 from me however if i were 30 years younger i may have given it a higher rating.

Haven't seen a film this good in a long long time. So entertaining and creative. The visuals are amazing, the story is actually really deep, and the cast is phenomenal. Michelle Yeoh really knocked it out of the park. See it on the big screen (if you can); it's worth it!

reviews.review_title: An excellent ride throughout. Just go ahead & watch!
reviews.content: The film starts so simple & gets to open up in many layers after the first 15 minutes. It starts your ride with the concept of multiverse which is Sci-Fi later turn into action & ends on an emotional note.The film is a complete package of "everything" spread out "everywhere" "all at once" in a single film. I felt I had watched something so good at the end of the film. The performances of the leads, especially Michelle Yeoh as 'Evelyn', Stephanie Hsu as 'Joy' & Kay Huy Quan as 'Waymond' were extraordinary! Kay Huy's variations in his performance totally grabbed my eyes onto him. It was a delight watching his performance.No words to say about the technical department. Just hands down for the output.

reviews.review_title: Second time and cry again, brilliant idea
reviews.content: First of all, I am a Legion fan from season 1 to 3, and also a long A24 fan, but never expect male director to shot somethings this touch my soul with the color and imagination.As an Asian, living with parents who don't really know how to express their emotion might be a common memory worldwide. The feeling of disagree, disappointment sometime drive us crazy, making a huge whole inside. I see myself in Joy, and I also see myself in Evelyn, feeling failure for the whole life cuz we didn't do anything. It's a lot of emotion, and I like the way they put together with 3 main multiverse. Good job.

I went into this movie not expecting more than a small little movie that i will watch once and forget about in a day, i can confidently say that i was hugely mistaken this movie was so captivating that its 2 hour 19 minute run-time felt like only 30 minutes. It is beautiful in so many ways to avoid spoilers one of the characters constant outfit changes was so creative, Michelle Yeoh is fantastic as the protagonist, ke huy quan was perfect at changing his voice and mannerisms to match his personality, oh and his moment at the end really was so well done and touching. This movie was also hilarious (Jamie Lee Curtis adds a lot of humor) i loved the comedy style and its wacky shenanigans ( For context i am 12 ). So overall i think this movie easily gets a 9 out of 10, any doubts you have about this movie should be cleared go watch it now.

reviews.review_title: The best film i've ever seen
reviews.content: It's deep, very emotional but hilarious. I almost cried several times throughout the movie. It's beautiful.The director is a genius with amazing scenes and camerawork, it's an absolutely beautiful movie in terms of visuals too.

This is my first review on IMDB. I couldn't resist. After seeing all the hype and high reviews and the Oscar nomination buzz, I decided to check it out. I managed to get through 45 minutes before I just couldn't take it anymore. I thought it was disjointed and a bunch of nonsense. What are all these critics and reviewers seeing that I'm missing? I watch movies for entertainment and I watch a lot of movies. I might try to watch a bit more to see if I'm missing something, but by 45 minutes in, I would expect to be interested and entertained. So far a waste of time. I guess the lead actors are doing a good job, and Jamie Lee Curtis was certainly in a different role for her, but the story itself needs to make sense.

reviews.review_title: From don t Look up is the best move seen till now
reviews.content: It's EVERYTHING qualitative about this movie, EVERYWHERE you look and ALL AT ONCE is a masterpiece. It addresses many social, moral, family problems, but even different perspectives by solving but mainly managing their course and solution. It's about everything, but wrapped so purposefully in the bonds between the members of an ordinary family: with problems, with emotions and with memories. I have 740 titles of films and series seen from 2019 until now. It is among the few films where I write the review. I recommend that you continue to recommend this film not only because it would be a good film to watch alone or in a group, with family, friends or a loved one, but because it is a whole experience that you can have just by watching it. I am waiting for more collaborations like this, wherever it is, whenever it is and most importantly emotion, ecstasy and happiness ALL AT ONCE!
Such a beautiful, amazing view of family. Really hits home as an Asian American. Also an awesome way to portray the multiverse. Can't wait to buy it for myself.

The movie came out just when the world needed it. Hilarious, charming, thought provoking! A24 has never let me down, they always have a close and very Asian way of storytelling and character building. Everyone's journey is different and
I dont want to interfere but I hope
people will be enlightened soon. Best movie of the year so far!

In some ways, the mother definitely deserved to win her daughter back after going through universes of troubles. But in others, she also didn't, because nothing happened in the "real world" that would lead them to resolve their misunderstandings. At the end of the movie, I thought, oh it might just all be in her own mind. That's why the ending felt unsatisfying to me. Refreshingly unique movie, regardless.

reviews.review_title: A Rollercoaster of Emotions Inside Us All
reviews.content: This film will not be for everyone.Every now and then, we get an absolutely golden film with deeper messages and themes that resonate with moments in our livesThere are a lot of low score reviews, who could only process the action in front of them. The action and goofyness is only the cosmetics in front of you. A pillow for what would actually be quite serious and heavy without.The deeper messages appear to you from each character. And if you have been through some of these hardships/challenges, you start to follow where this film is going.Everyone cast are absolutely perfect in their roles. And the ending is a truly feel good one. The occurrence in each multiverse are both impressive and hilarious.If you enjoyed films like The Joker, Parasite, District 9 or Cloud Atlas, this is very much in your ball park.Never had a film make me cry, but there is a moment (also quoted in the Quotes section) that made me think of my life with my wife and it was tears of love and joy.Life may not be perfect, but if we each try to make it better, we will succeed :)

This movie blends concepts and certain stylistic elements from The Matrix (though it is tonally and thematically very different) with the kind of absurd humor you'd find in something like Kung Fury (though without quite as much self-aware tropeyness). This movie genuinely surprised me; I don't typically think of comedies as great media, especially not comedic movies, but this movie is so emotionally resonant while also being funny that I cannot but give it a 10. To be clear, this movie is not perfect. It's not particularly deep, intellectual or cerebral. Though its first part, Everything, is funny, the movie takes its time getting to its absolute highest. The comedy doesn't always hit, particularly some of the sexual humor or scenes where the protagonist pees herself or inhales a fly. It's not particularly hard to find a few holes in the movie's logic. To my mind, however, none of that detracts from how great this movie is. This movie is raw emotion, and if you've experienced the emotions it puts on display, I think you can get something out of it. Its representation of an American immigrant family might get nods or smiles from those who come from such a background, and its almost psychedelic representation of what it's like to feel overwhelmed by life can speak powerfully to those who've felt that way. Combine that with comedy that, to me at least, hits far harder than it misses and even plays into the more poignant aspects of the story, genuinely good action, and beautiful, surreal visuals, and you get, without exaggeration, the best movie I've ever seen. This movie looks at life in all its insanity, suffering, tedium, and regrets and says yes. And that, I think, is something a lot of people can get value out of.

If I could give this movie something higher than 5 stars I would, I quite literally believe this is one of the best films I've ever seen and will ever seen. The segment before Everything Part One: was a really good set up of future issues like with all of the characters but especially Joy/Jobu and Waymond. Everything Part One: this was a beautiful segment that started out Evelyn on her journey through the multiverse also I'm gonna mis Alpha Waymond. When the movie ended I was like wtf is the movie over when in reality the movie within the movie about the movie ended. Everywhere Part Two: This part is even better because I was clueless to the fact that Jobu didn't want to kill Evelyn. This part made me cry multiple times not only about Joy but about Waymond 😭. All at Once Part Three: I was very confused when this started because I was confused because I was so engrossed in Part Two I forget it was a part altogether. Nonetheless it's a very sweet segment especially when Evelyn Kisses Waymond. The acting is amazing from the entire casting. Michelle Yeoh is godly in this film. Ke Huy Quan having his return with this movie was perfect. I believe Stephanie Hsu and Jamie Lee Curtis were amazing in this movie but I do think that Stephanie is the one who should bring home the Oscar. Overall the movie is amazing and I am going to have to struggle to not hyperfixate on this movie. Also this movie not only got me ugly crying but crying multiple times. Oh and the pacing was godly, I was like finishing the first part and I was like haven't we run out of time by now, how?

Some of the best visuals I've ever seen. Acting was pretty phenomenal as well. I think this is a movie everyone should see.Every action I take leads to a different possibility, this review I'm writing is creating an entirely different present to if I were to do something else. Just a thought that this film provoked for me.I think it'll stick with me for a long while, ya know life really aint that deep, everyone else is living their own different reality right at this moment, all that shi.

reviews.review_title: It is a perfect movie about imperfection - so as our lives
reviews.content: I have watched this amazing film in the theatre three times so far, and I finally decided to leave some of my thoughts.For those of you who have not seen it yet, it is a bonkers cinema experience that you deserve to at least give a try without knowing much about it. I believe most of you will not regret it!My Thoughts (LIGHT SPOILERS CONTAINED)1. It is an edgy and bonkers cinema experience deliberated crafted as it is - the theme of the movie is literally about everything of life, and you supposed to love and hate some parts of it. So I totally understand those 1-star reviewers who hate this movie, and I guess I am just lucky to be the ones who loves the movie very much.2. The representation of Asian immigrant family is on point - I doubt there will be other groups of people who ask themselves "what ifs" more often from time to time. It is never easy to make life-changing decisions to leave at least part of your family to embark a journey of unknown in a foreign land. The distance from their own culture, the conflicts with the new ones, and the learnings and evolvements over time are shaping them to be unique group of people that are their own kind. Being children of Asian American family is like trapped in between, where you are raised with family of tradition value while attempted by the free thoughts from the outside world - it is essential a struggle between collectivism and individualism. In some cases, I guess the intergenerational trauma is inevitable.3. Oh I love the PHILOSOPHY discussed in the film - I was once fallen to the idea of nihilism as I discovered that science could not essentially prove "objective truth", instead, it could only present you with the theories that are not disapproved yet. So by definition, everything we know could be false, even though we human beings may never have the ability to tell anyways. It left me with such a feeling of emptiness and meaninglessness - what is the point to believe in anything if nothing matters? I found some relief later in the existentialism, as I am glad to have this may-be-fake right to choose what I believe, that gives you a break while providing you with a tiny sense of being human. I chose kindness and hope because I like them, and I wish them to be true.4. Is this film perfect? Surely nothing in life is perfect, and I guess it is one of the lessons you take from this movie as well. Do I believe the movie could be shorter and concise in some parts, and tighten up things faster in the ending parts? Maybe. But it simply DOES NOT MATTER as I appreciate the movie as a whole and the full package it presented. Also, why does it matter anyways since I am only one of the infinite opinions. Just be a rock and appreciate what you have in your life!

reviews.review_title: Don't read further unless you choose the red pill! Or you're a parent. Or you're obsessed with bagels and black holes.
reviews.content: This movie was extraordinarily creative, with caveats.The trailers are absolute eye candy. They include Matrix-like action scenes with high contrast and slow motion martial arts. There are mentions of the multiverse, and one headline online suggested the film was an intro into quantum mechanics and alternate dimensions. The hype is so intense for this production that I tossed my conventional thriftiness out the window to wait until the next discount day at the local theater. Instead I pre-ordered an expensive ticket for the best seat at a luxury cinema that has huge reclining leather seats with lots of leg room. I was ready to shortcut years of college physics classes for the two and a half hour long visual treat.As the movie began I skipped attention at the early scenes while organizing boxes of candy and drinks. When the tax office scene started I knew from the trailers it's time to focus. As the movie progressed it was delightful, a comedic parody merging The Matrix with The Lego Movie. So far so good. Unlike the Matrix, it's actually hilariously funny and the production team here invested in lighting so you actually can see what's going on during the movie.(Opinion ahead!)Yet, midway through the film, all of sudden realized I had been shamboozled, as scenes with the hidden meaning started illuminating through the smoke and mirrors of the parody.There's two main perspectives on where you're coming from when you watch this movie. If you're a parent of a teenager or young adult, then long story short, this film is a colorful fun metaphor for why you should always make kindness and unconditional love the number one important theme for your communication with your kid, even through the rough times. Honestly from this view it is a brilliantly wonderful modern parenting guide presented on the big screen.If you're a parent, once you get to this realization in the movie, turn on your phone, and send a text to your kid, "Hi, how are you doing, wish you were here, it's a great movie, just reminding you that I love you." Then continue watching the movie, occasionally laughing aloud, which you will many times, and saying to yourself, "Hahaha oh yeah I can relate to that conversation... and that one... and that one too". The dramatic interaction scenes are spot on indeed.(Alternate perspective for the rest of you)However, if you don't have kids then just pretend this movie is an updated Matrix, but with lots of humor and comedy and with better lighting. Just like in The Lego Movie, we are presented a story line in which a 'nobody' can be special and save the world, or in this case all the infinite possible universes too.The Everywhere movie has a tasty recipe. Combine the somber serious overtone of The Matrix with the happier smiling vibe of The Lego Movie. Now give the chef some magic mushrooms to snack on while heating up the sauce and sprinkle some of those peyote stems in the pot and go really wild with the absurdity. For atmosphere stir in the maximum amount of layers possible. Toss in every seasoning and spice in the kitchen and let them sort out their taste buds in between chomping on popcorn.Forget using antique pay phone booths to travel! Although sniffing the Kragle might do something. Snort a bug up your nose, sit on a trophy, or chew some of that sticky gum on the bottom of your shoe. The more insane the action, the better the slingshot connecting to a wackier dimension. The visuals are so mind opening that you don't have to drive to New Jersey and get high before watching this film.(Skipping lots of specific scenes because you'll have to see for yourself, including the rubber...)Just know that when the movie ends you'll have the thought that there could be billions or trillions of versions of you, and that you could very well be living in the worst possible scenario of all of them. It's likely that every choice and decision you have ever made were the wrong ones. But take comfort in that although your life might suck, there's potentially trillions of happier versions of you and many are rich superstars. Yes you might be a failure and a nobody, but in the event of an actual multiverse emergency you might be the first one they call.Don't forget the movie's sub-sub note here. If you're with a partner, guess what, just like you they are probably the worst version of themselves too. However, since you may have just watched the movie with them, right now they might be thinking the same about you. So now's a great time to give each other a hug and kiss.(What's the real reveal?)Saving the best topic for last, who's the villain in this movie? Pay attention, because it's the only way to save the multiverse. No it's not a computer machine monster army, nor even the holder of the Kragle. It's you. Yes really it's you. Well, it's simultaneously you and most everyone else in the multiverse. So you're not alone. For the villain role Everywhere, Everything All at Once deals the most realistic aspect of the movie and of life, the typical overall lack of human kindness. In addition to making bad choices you likely have a lack of appreciation, a lack of empathy, a lack of acceptance, a lack of openness, a lack of love, a lack of communication, etc.However the solution to fixing everything that is wrong in the multiverse is actually super easy, barely an inconvenience. No it's not EMP's, nor virus codes, nor armies. The answer is kindness and love. It's here where I give the movie the highest review possible, for the truth of this simplicity should be in every movie, every play, every book, every story, every spoken dialogue, every action, every thought. Just like it is in real life, the answer to fixing everything, everywhere all at once is kindness and love.See, you gotta love a movie with a happy ending.After you leave the cinema, you might be tempted to go get a bagel with everything on it. Skip it. Go get a cookie instead. When you're there at the counter buy a few cookies for those around you and tell the person behind the counter thank you and smile, and leave a tip. While you're nibbling away, send texts to everyone you know saying "Thanks for being you, you're amazing."By the time you finish and walk outside, you'll feel right as rain again.

reviews.review_title: If part 1 wears you out, watch this in two parts
reviews.content: I have a suggestion for anyone thinking of watching this film. The film has a part 1 & 2 (and a part 3, but it's not relevant here). It can feel confusing and overwhelming to absorb everything happening, everywhere, all of the time. If you reach the end of part 1 (you'll know when that is), and you feel at that point that it's all just too (insert anything here), then pause it for another time. This is what I did, and I was glad. I returned later to watch part 2, and I can say that I was glad I did. But I don't know if I could have enjoyed part 2 if had not waited for another day. The ending pays off (unless you're a hardened cynic). A score of 7 from me is a good score. It's overhyped, but I still recommend it.

reviews.review_title: Best movie I've seen in a long time...
reviews.content: A fantastic film that was brilliantly written and thankfully the direction was executed perfectly to do the story justice.While it won't be to everyone's taste, for those who can appreciate (and see) the nuance beyond the ridiculous (and hilarious) elements, it is an incredible end product. The way it ties universal themes and emotions together through a complex yet understandable storyline warrants a lot of praise.The acting is, for the most part, right on point. The ability to switch between characters so seemlessly can be hard to master but how it was done here was as good as it gets.Ultimately, this is a film you will either love or hate, there can be no in-between.

For that reason, the movie ideally should be seen with subtitles that the viewer could easily understand.For this and other reasons, I didn't understand the plot. I kept wanting for it to end so I could leave with the friends I saw it with. Too long for me. One of them said it was fantastic, the other felt the same as I did.It's a visual spectacle and looks like what one might experience after having done LOTS of acid.

reviews.review_title: If I had ADHD this might have been a fun trist.
reviews.content: There is just too much change to grasp the overall story. Yes, pretty settings, fun characters, great optics. But please stick to something for more than 15 seconds. It have me a major headache. I love to watch complicated plots, and the multiverse is very complicated, but this is loud, hard to follow and not fun. The main characters are not likeable, go not give you reason to care about them, or how they end up. Its a long, loud cacophony of screeching birds that cant sing a pretty or harmonious song. I was trying so hard to engage, but it pushed back on me every moment I watched. What a shame, moms rule, but this was a tragic, epic slog.

As a film entirely devoted to Albert Camus, it impressed me a lot. It seems to have been the philosophical reflection of the books 'The Stranger' and 'The Myth of Sisyphus'. If you are interested in the philosophy of existentialism, it will make you think a lot. The main theme is based on the problematic of whether life is worth living or not. Of course, since this is a very heavy and depressing subject, they decorated the movie with absurdly funny scenes and good enough fight scenes. If they had not done this, they would have dragged the audience into that 'Black Hole'. In short, the score in your head is constantly changing from 1 to 10 in every minute of this two-hour movie, until you end up feeling bored and sometimes stunned. The acting, visual effects, music are very good, I can say that it is the unexpected movie of the year.Albert Camus' book 'The Myth of Sisyphus' begins with this sentence; "There is only one philosophical problem that really matters, suicide. To judge whether life is worth living is to answer the fundamental question of philosophy." Here is the 'Jobu Tupaki' character, after all the endless lives she has experienced in the parallel universe; She decides that the truth, the meaning of life, is nothing. She also wants to share this nothingness with her mother 'Evelyn Wang'. Her mother's experience of all these other lifetimes by following her daughter and eventually turning into stone and then rolling off the mountainside turns into a life's unchanging cycle of hope and frustration. The punishment given to Sisyphus by the gods, the burden he will carry forever, is just that. In the end, Evelyn decides that instead of getting rid of this burden placed on everyone, she should accept it and just be 'kind' in life. This is how she fights her daughter's thoughts. Your goals, your desires, everything we do may be empty and meaningless, nowhere to be found. What matters is the path itself and with whom you share it. Therefore, Sisyphus and Evelyn can find happiness in every collapse and disappointment, and such happy people spread happiness around them.

reviews.review_title: Original, witty, funny and a roller coaster of a ride.
reviews.content: Clever idea with a unique interpretation of the multiverse that dwelled into human goals, tribulations, failures, second chances and many others including what could have been etc. Highly entertaining and it did create some confusion of the various dimensions and timing but you get it the jest of it after a while. Will go as far to say that it could be a cult film, noting its originality and the highly adrenaline induced roller coaster of a ride. I do believe it might not be for everyone as suggested by the rating - out of 10 people, 8.5 of them will love it! The other 1.5 just have to watch it again.

reviews.review_title: The mandarin spoken by the actor was too bad.
