Love is what makes every struggle meaningful and even enjoyable.As Erich Fromm put it " One cannot be deeply responsive to the world without being sadden very often.""there is a price to be paid for every increase in consciousness. We cannot be more sensitive to pleasure without being more sensitive to pain" Alan watts.

Entertaining but off the mark. Written by a person who doesn't understand themself. Narcissism is caused by lack of genuine parental engagement. Resulting in maladjusted psycho sexual development. It's not that your parents don't like that you're gay, it's that you parents are so self absorbed they don't care at all.The reason I'm being harsh is. Thee conclusion of the movie is actually harmful. It's maladaptive perfectionism which is common in narcissistic abuse. Most of the movie is what would be the reaction of an abused person. Basically a healthy person would reject the premise and not try to save everyone. You're the unibomber and I'm going to have healthy boundaries even if you're my family.If you don't believe me the multiverse is what happens when you're abused and your psyche implodes because you're regressing in an attempt to cope with the circumstance. You're living in a narcissists false reality and it's very unhealthy. Self improvement is an individual task and you should remove yourself from narcissists. That's healthy behavior. They're sad destructive people that are black holes. Fun movie bad message.

I thought it was quite good.It has all I want from a movie:
Good story, some action, some philosophy.It did everything, The Matrix tried and failed to do so.It is a bit on the long side, but time flies by, when you have fun.

I would like to start by saying please make sure you see this in the cinema to get the full experience.I believe the film is about depression or at least existentialism.This movie touched me deeply, writing this review makes me want to cry but in a good way. I really connected with the films values, the daughters view on the world and relationship with her mother.I think like a lot of people, we have all been really questioning the meaning and purpose of our lives the past couple of years and it can all get quite dark and lonely and confusing.This film depicts these thoughts but in a funny and uplifting way. I felt like a child again, there are the most random and ridiculous and silly scenes that had me and the rest of the cinema belly laughing.There was also scenes which had me in floods of tears.I came out feeling like I'd had 5 tabs of acid
I still feel different and can't help thinking of this film and will do for a long time
I need to see it again.

Certainly one of the best films of 2022, if not the best,and I've seen quite a lot of them this year...
One of those stories that takes a place in your soul for a long time. Strangely deep, moving, hilarious, crazy imaginative. Michelle Yeoh shines like always, fantastic performance. We also get to watch on screen again the beloved ShortRound from Indiana Jones, who also delivers brilliantly. There's still a big smile on my face hours after watching, it made me feel obliged to write this review, the first one in a long time. Do yourself a favor and watch this movie, it will change at least your day, you won't regret.

THIS is not just a film it is a journey of emotion- love, happiness ,family drama ..it is althouth a sifi fantasy but its gives you a great message about respect somne or support them for what they are ...love your child feel their feeling and not just force your feelings on them..
now come to the technical part what a cinematography sceenplay, camera work action and how they filmed..hats off.. it will give you the vibe of intesteller and inception .. and all of the above how they conneted all the dots together..if you haven't watched it yet please go and wath..it will be a treat.. go and watch now,,

reviews.review_title: The most touching movie for me since the Matrix.
reviews.content: There are so many excellent movies, depending on one's taste, it is hard to say which one is better than one another. But among the best movies, there are ones that inspire a whole genre and a generation.For me, the matrix is that kind of movie. Within which there is a fascinating, realistic world with its unique physics laws, culture, hierarchy, and characters. And the creators are at their premiere era of creation, and ideas are so overflowing that they try hard to push them into their works like cramping a feast into a tightening tin can. And when you open it, it just blows everything right in your face. Compared to Avatar, another one of my favorites, Avatar is the feast, much more mature, presented to you in a Michelin dining room, and you're well-acquainted that it must be dame good before tasting, without some specific feeling of surprise.I don't need to comment on the details or philosophy of the movie. There are tons of them. Instead, I want to express that you have to watch it and break your mind. It should be a movie you need to watch in your lifetime. PS, any rating less than 8/10 is not fair.

I reactivated my IMDB just to say how brilliant and imaginative this movie is.A push back to the theme park riding of sci fi concepts by Marvel. While it deals with a lot, the focus on the family kept the film together. Thoroughly enjoyed it.

I'm not quick to write a review but I really wanted to leave my appreciation for this movie. From the storyline, to the cinematography to the music choices, I really loved all of it.The movie can be a bit wacky or weird, so be prepared for that I. Not that I mind personally.
I was blown away by how good this movie was! The acting was phenomenal, the writing was mind blowing and the visuals were terrific. Never had as much fun watching a movie as I did watching this one.

reviews.review_title: Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha
reviews.content: It was weird and very, very, very funny! Loved hot dog hands, loved Jamie Lee! Jumped around a lot but I was warned. I was throughly entertained but wasn't expecting an Oscar movie, I wanted to be entertained. It got very emotional near the end and deep- I could have done without that because it was campy, weird and fun and I wanted it to stay that way! I'll watch it again!

reviews.review_title: Avoid the trailer if at all possible.
reviews.content: Chances are, if you're on IMDB reading this review, you've seen the auto-playing trailer for this movie, which is a shame. While it doesn't "spoil" anything, the element of surprise for my wife and I tonight (after not reading anything about it or seeing the trailer) was off-the-charts. Avoid reading about this movie as much as possible. BOTTOM LINE: This was a cinematic masterpiece. I haven't laughed or cried this much in a movie in many many years. And to be clear, the tears were not from sadness. This movie will blow your mind.
Action, drama, insane effects, comedy, family systems (psychology), a love story, intense fight scenes, existentialism. This movie has it all. Appropo name.

Excellent movie. Very well done. The cast is amazing and all so such a great job. Michelle Yeoh has been solid recently in her roles but steps her game up this time I couldn't take my eyes off of her. It was much deeper and thought provoking than I could have imagined. The importance of relationships in life really hit deep. This is the first I've seen Stephanie Hsu in anything and I am a fan. She plays all sides of her role to perfection. As always Jamie Lee Curtis delivers. The amount of characters each character had to play really intrigued me. Ke Huay Quan makes such a great comeback into the acting world. I can't believe that kid from the goodies turned out to become a very good actor. This was an instant love for me and can't wait to watch again. When you watch a movie that you immediately want to watch again you know you have a hit.

reviews.review_title: Best movie of 2022 or maybe even the decade
reviews.content: I rarely rate movies with 10 stars and I never write reviews, but this stunning masterpiece deserves the highest of praises. It combines a very good script with masterful directing, a perfect score as well as great actors and delivers an absolutely crazy, beautiful and emotional film that left me stunned and crying tears of joy at the end.Also I loved the kung-fu parts. It has been so long since a movie with great martial arts came out. This one will forever be in my heart as a favorite.

I loved it. At 50 years old I've seen a lot of movies and this is now a contender for my all-time favorite. It was interesting, unusual, and I was entertained from start to finish. It really is extraordinary.

Absolutely mind blowing. One of thos films that hit you in a way that you did not expect going into it.It dives deep into the concepts of family, love, acceptance, culture, destiny, fate and the world we live in, witchout ever coming across preachy or forced.The decisions we make and the people we choose to become affects our lives and everyone around us.It is also very funny, light hearted and surreal, honestly a rollercoaster of human emotions were felt while watching it.It has been a while since I felt gobsmacked by a film.The performances were very real and heartfelt and the film is also visually stunning.Please give this film a chance.
This movie has everything; heart, drama, comedy. The traditional "I laughed, I cried" line. A masterpiece of film making displaying exceptional creativity.

As an Asian American woman, I was eager to see a strong Asian cast. I love science fiction and psychology, so watching this movie was an intense and rewarding experience. I see the multiple interpretations of real and imaginary. In my own mind, I see many what ifs and often fantasize about a better life. The acting, visual effects are superb. Even if you just absorb the absurdity and laugh at the comedic parts, it is worthwhile and entertaining. I highly recommend this movie.

reviews.review_title: Amazing is a word that Absolutely doesn't cut it
reviews.content: Having high expectations going in, it's wonderfully pleasant to leave feeling even better about the movie. This movie has so much heart, warmth and kindness in it. It's the best movie I've seen all year, it's one of the best I've seen in the last decade, it's Absolutely one of the best movies I've seen ever. Please watch this movie.
This is everything I expect from a "multiverse" movie. It is everywhere all at once. I expected nothing more and nothing less. It gave me what I wanted from it.

reviews.review_title: I Was NOT a expecting that!
reviews.content: There's nothing that can prepare you for this film. And it's for the better. Do not try to learn too much about it. Just go there and let it progress. There can be some initial confusion but that's alright. A bit of patience and the matters take their own course.As per the core of the film there will be something different for everyone.Enjoy!

This movie made feel a lot of different emotions. I felt like I am creating my reality in every instant now, like right now when I am typing realizing that I am aware and awake, and this is of the infinite realities I can experience.

Complicated and colourful story which at the end I find unconvincing, because of amateurish mistakes.Oh, it is ultimately very very American story, focused on some peculiar bureaucratic procedures. I know that certification of marriage in USA is a bit of a joke. I don't know about the processes in the movie and the movie neither explained them nor made me interested in them.
I have seen movies that made me both laugh and cry, i have never seen one that made me do both at the same time. An amazing humanity study and deserves every bit of recognition.
Everyone has to see it! The title is perfect! Best movie of the 2020's by far! It could be a mess for someone, but the movie represents so well, some topics of the actual society!

This movie was a real exception! With the creative plot, it's lovely characters, various mix from
humor, suspense and great fighting scenes, it doesn't fit to any box, but to its very own one!The story starts with the Chinese women Evelyn, who is the owner of a laundromat and lives a very normal life. The daily struggle of clients, family problems and a tax review is suddenly broken when somebody from a different universe enters her life.Suddenly an exciting adventure starts for her, where she slips in many others versions of herself to fight for nothing less than saving all connected universes.10 stars for this wonderful pieces of movie art!

reviews.review_title: A stunning Visual and Story Masterpiece!
reviews.content: I have to say I don't do many reviews, but this Movie deserves respect and admiration beyond anything else.From the start to finish it was a complete Masterpiece, a visual and emotional rollercoaster where the main character explores her relationship with her father, husband and daughter in a way that you simply cannot image and comprehend beforehand.I have watched more than 10,000 titles in my life and I have to say that my life would definitely be incomplete without this title.It is something that you have not and might not experience ever again. EVERYTHING, EVERYWHERE, ALL AT ONCE!

I went into this movie with zero expectations. Went out with a million questions and as an emotinal wrack. The begining is quiet and you get to know the charachters, but as the movie builds up you get more and more action. Its funny original and think worthy. I have never experienced a movie that explain a persons emotinal life more than this.Loved every second of it! But this isnt one of those movies you can sit with your phone scrolling and glaring at the TV once in a while. You need to be focused and let your self be captured in this movies wricked world. I found my new favourite movie and i hope you do too.

Really nice movie, especially enhanced at the cinema. The production quality was pretty astounding as the movie creatively utilizes a combination of VFX and SFX. The story has both a great sense of humor and a touching climax/

reviews.review_title: Great but a bit drawn out
reviews.content: I really enjoyed this movie but felt many of the scenes were too long. It tried really hard to mix crazy action and emotion which is difficult but pulled it off!If they had trimmed 20-30 mins off it would have been perfect.

reviews.review_title: Most Original Movie of this century
reviews.content: Just go watch the movie, one of the best movies of this century, the actors were amazing, the story and emotions,YOU! YEH YOU STOP READING REVIEWS AND JUST GO WATCH THE MOVIE, ITS WORTH IT.

When people ask me the best song, or movie, I usually dodge the question. On what basis could I possibly answer this? There are a million different ways to rank media, so every piece of art is interesting or flawed in their own way. Also, art is subjective. I can safely say however, "Everything Everywhere All at Once" is OBJECTIVELY the GREATEST movie of all time... by FAR. This movie is incredibly ambitious, juggling 7 different themes that somehow weave together and coalesce perfectly by the end of the movie. I actually cannot believe they managed to pull off this dangerous feat of beauty. It's a visually stunning psychedelic trip incorporating weighty philosophical ideas like existentialism and nihilism in a playful and humorous way. You will feel a combination of 4 different emotions "All at Once". The line between the metaphorical and literal is blurred. It is simultaneously very basic and accessible, but also esoteric and dense. Its both lowbrow and highbrow."Everything Everywhere all at Once" includes 6 different genres that are somehow done perfectly. Its a drama, comedy, matrix film, Jackie Chan film, and multiverse film all in one movie. I cant criticize this movie in any way. I'm actually disgusted by how good this movie is. The acting was perfect and the pacing was spot on. Its intense (like uncut gems) that is overwhelmingly stimulating (emotionally, visually, and mentally) in the best way possible.The political/cultural parts of the movie are conveyed in an authentic and non-soy way. It includes an older immigrant woman, her gay daughter, and a message about acceptance and love yet there was no fake, overdone "GIRLPOWER!! LOOK STRONG WOMAN" cringe. "Everything Everywhere All at Once" is a 10/10 film that excels above every film I have seen on all dimensions. Please watch this film. I sound like a crazy person right now, but I promise after watching the movie, you will understand my fanaticism and thank me for the recommendation.
This movie single-handedly cured my movie-fatigue that I had for years. It proved to me that's still possible to make an unique and special movie in 2022.

This movie is very good its a good concept and story. Amazing screenplay and visuals each and every character is good they did their best as best .Finally I am going to say is to watch his movie . Its is worthy to watch this movie.

reviews.review_title: But still I cannot make a compromise
reviews.content: This story tells me that your Chinese parents will never say sorry to you before they have seen all the universes at all the times all at once. Then I will never make a compromise to them at any universe at any time.

reviews.review_title: Most original movie made in years.
reviews.content: Being a huge fan of Michelle Yeoh since the early 90', and a big fan of the supporting cast, I was highly anticipating this movie and expected much from it. It delivered on everything the trailer had promised and much more. I knew there would be action, and goofy comedy. What I had not been expecting was the emotional weight it carried. The relationships between Evelyn and every major supporting character in the film was complex and multidimensional, multi-universal! This movie had so many layers...it had everything, including an everything bagel!

This film spans many genres, lot of great action and some seriously weird in the best way set pieces. But at the heart of it all is a broken disaffected family who have to find there way back to one another. If you can see through the wackiness you will be richly rewarded with stellar performances and a beautiful meditation on how loving and accepting yourself as you are leads to loving and accepting others as they are. Sit back and enjoy the ride!

reviews.review_title: Confused halfway, released by the end
reviews.content: I think this film is a compensation, or rather, a realization of "the road not taken", you could experience the lives possible that you haven't choose to live in the past, you could see another potential self. Another thing I learn from this film is that we're fluid, it's kind of like the queer theory, you could be any identity if you want. I was stunned especially when I see the two of them become rocks. This is EXACTLY what I want my identity to be in the afterlife, or at least it shows my imagenary self-identity, that I can be EVERYTHING.
Watch it!! It's truly something special. It speaks to the human condition and how to be ok in an increasingly unstable realityAlso by far Michelle Yoeh's best work, she can do anything!!

I didn't quite know what I was getting myself into. I've been waiting to watch this until it hit streaming for free cause I'm frugal, but my god, it was worth the wait! I'll save you all the existential hullabaloo and just tell you this. This movie is something like you've NEVER seen before. At the very center of this acid trip is a story about us. About you. We're all struggling every day to figure out this crazy thing called life. We'll never figure that out completely, but what we will do is continue making masterpieces of film like this one to cope with how it's going. I'm going to rewatch this one a handful of hot dog fingered times.

reviews.review_title: Originallity in a swamp of cliches
reviews.content: Maybe my review will be small and deep-less, but this movie is the complete opposite of it. We need this kind of existential, questioning and never ending imagination of an infinite possibilities like the universe we "the small s*it" living in.Just WOW.

reviews.review_title: Giving the Multiverse-concept what it deserves
reviews.content: Everything everywhere all at once is an amazing experience, that of course isn't perfect, similar to most worlds depicted in it.It is unique and in complete disregard of fast food movie tropes, although, there is one, and no, it is not the multiverse-subgenre in itself...So it was a mother/daughter movie at its core, but to some parts the film makers had no idea what that actually entails and means, so they forced in a lesbian subplot for the daughter that was utterly redundant and because it was such a klischee of our time, a bit offensive. It was a cheap excuse to not have to put in the work to find something original and fitting, whilst the rest of the movie is exactly that, detrimental, I know.You can exchange this subplot for everything actually, and everywhere it would feel similarly artificial, underused as it was, which bags the question why this was chosen of all the all-at-once elements that would have had a way bigger impact, and would have had a lot more comedic potential, as the only thing that didn't get ridiculed and multiversed in the movie was the daughters girlfriend, because duh.This got even more obvious as there was an amazing parallel universe already with two female characters that felt organic, truthful and utterly fitting into the concept.It was respectful, cute and wholesome, the exact opposite of the daughters subplot, which feels even more misplaced and unnecessary, when comparing the two.That was my main critic, on to the good stuff, ergo, the rest of the movie.It deserves all the praise, with amazing female actors, who absolutely smash it - Jackie-Chan-style, which makes it so much more enjoyable as this style of fighting is such an underused story-telling-vehicle in nowadays cinema.Indiana Jones' Shorty (Ke Huy Quan) is finally back on the big screen as well, which is a bittersweet thing in itself, brilliantly portraying the father in absolute harmony with Michelle Yeoh, who runs the show with incredible comedic precision, that only gets equaled by her martial arts skills and the overall choreography. She remembers us time and time again, that Asian cinema had its leading lady all along.In comes Stephanie Hsu, as the daughter, who mirrors Yeoh in the most compelling way, yet she is bringing her own uniqueness into the ring. She showcases Joy's burden in the most bizarre and joyful (Pun intended) ambivalence, so full of insanity, that you catch yourself screaming in support of letting her go into the goddamn bagel!The cast gets completed by greats Jamie Lee Curtis and James Hong, both deserving of all the nominations that will come in. Especially Curtis' IRS clerk, who you just love to hate and once everything is over, love to love. Let that sink in, they managed to humanize a worker drone from the IRS, if that isn't a cinematic milestone in each parallel universe there is, then there is no hope left.Hongs Gong Gong on the other hand goes the other way and back again, ridden with guilt and only driven by closure. What he delivered here, at his age is nothing short of a marvel, that marvel can only dream of.Honorable mentions are going to Harry Shum Jr. And Bradley Cooper for showing us that even trash pandas can be great cooks.What is left to say? If you are longing for an original cinematic experience it is your obligation to support this film by all means, and to make sure that Hollywood understands, that even in our multiverses of madness, it is uniqueness, that prevails.

It was an utter Joy (sorry) to watch this. For me this is one of the best films I have seen, ever. Well acted, some very good action scenes, nicely emotional. And? Completely and utterly bonkers. This is a true masterpiece of film making. Michelle Yeoh is truly brilliant in the lead. It was genuinely lovely to see. Ke Huy Quan back on the screen again, and I may be slightly in love with Stephanie Hsu. Jamie Lee Curtis is almost unrecognisable as an auditor and well, once the film takes off it is an amazing, wild and increasingly mad journey (seriously, at times there are people with hotdogs for fingers and a chap that appears to be wearing toasters on his jacket) Watch it now.

Not since Inside John Malkovich has a movie had so many threads that come together by the end of the movie. The movie had so many transitions and with each transition a new story involves the main characters. But yet by the end of the movie, all of these transitions come together and proclaim a simple lesson about family and acceptance of one another. Excellent acting and definitely one of the best movies of 2022.Definitely a contender for Best Picture. A definite reminder of Terry Gilliam's Brazil and a very creative experience of movie making. Do not try to analyze it just sit back and enjoy the creative experience.

When a movie comes out some people like it some don't. But it's not ok to assault the other side as "stupid" or "genZ".I get it that some people don't understand the movie, but the acting? It was definitely amazing.
The movie's quite like Turning Red, but with a mix of the reality jumping of The Matrix, and with a hint of existential crisis elements of Bojack Horseman.

Every aspect of life is a universe. The paradigm / governing thought controls how a person acts in a particular universe. Conflicting ideas fight each other in its own universe.Everything: Our life consists of a lot of universes: meaning of life, sextual orientation, parents and children's needs, wants, and expectation of each other, dealing with other humans, dealing with laws, dealing with nature.... There are lots and lots of them. Hence, lots of universes.Everywhere: Our mind and body thinks about and act in each of the universe in fractional seconds. So as we think or act, we are jumping among universes. Even though we do not see it physically, our minds are fighting each other in a particular universe just by thinking about it.All at once: many meaningful ways to look at it. 1. All this is happening at all times in each person's life. 2. Explodes when conflicting thoughts materialize into action. Ex. Two people thought about how much they hate each other. Arguments/Fights will happen when they meet and discuss how much they hate each other. 3. When involved people CSIPed (Processed with Complete and Successful Intellectual Process) their thoughts about all of their conflicting thoughts in each universe. Their minds and souls converge and become harmonious in the corresponding universe.Great movie. As good as Forrest Gump if not better.

reviews.review_title: This is the best movie I've ever seen.
reviews.content: I don't have much more to say, if you haven't seen it yet then you should. If you have seen it then I'd imagine you agreeIt's the first movie I've gone to rewatch in the cinema. I want a bagel.

reviews.review_title: I have never written a review on here before, but I just had to for this one
reviews.content: This film was easily one of my favorites of all time, and I hardly ever like films. It was quite literally "everything, everywhere, all at once". I laughed. I pondered. I sobbed. If you felt this movie was messy, and didn't like it, and decided to leave a bad rating, you didn't understand it, and you never will, unfortunately, because it is a beautiful film with a powerful message that brought me to the most tears I have ever cried in one sitting. This film is moving, powerful, emotional, a good laugh, a great visual, and an original concept that was well put together. DEFINITELY go watch. You won't regret it.

This movie is certainly not flawless, but still it's my favorite movie of the year. I am fully impressed by the imagination, the power of emotion and the unique way of intepreting family relationship. In some way we are all ordinary heroes of our daily routine life that seems to repeat endlessly. It's time to change the way of our way of perceiving our lives, our beloved ones and of course, a change of mindset is the most important thing of all. Let's start to think out of the box, and see little things in our lives in a new perspective, we will find out how many possibilities our life could hold. My appreciation to all the actors, actress and the whole team working behind the scene, a beautifully told story, a masterpiece.

I guess people are divided about this movie, so, I decided to put my own review. The multiverse concept on this movie has deeper explanation compare to the Marvel. I have no idea which of these three (EEAaO, No Way Home & Multiverse of Madness) that is closer to the multiverse scientific knowledge, but, EEAaO is just on another level. But, yet, it simplicity, without the extravagant of "magic book" or "shooting spiders' webs".I just love this movie. A lot. The ending is satisfyingly good.
Films like this restore my faith in the art. It clearly needs a rewatch but a creative, bold piece of cinema - what a breath of fresh air. More of this please.

reviews.review_title: Came here just to leave this
reviews.content: This movie is that good. Only sad thing about how good it is, is that I might now watch another movie like this for a while.Give it a chance, I'm sure you won't regret it.

It is full of subliminal messages and anyone who is in the process of expanding science will understand this clearly. The experiences and parallel dimensions in which our consciousness lives, experiencing all the possibilities at the same time, help us to understand and accept that what we are going through in this life of ours is nothing more than our experience, from the beginning of showing the lowest level of consciousness. In a stone to the complexity of the human being where we are subject to defects, problems, disappointments, frustrations, successes, achievements, losses, difficulties, union, forgiveness, kindness and love, learning to let go and learning to accept that everything we experience is not it is an experience and learning within this body in this dimension where we are!

reviews.review_title: Just everything everywhere all at once!
reviews.content: "You have so many goals u never finished, dreams u never followed. You're living the worst you." And so, "you are capable of anything because u are so bad at everything".This may be the most ambitiously weird sci-fi movie one could experience in the cinema. It's a cult packed with twists and turns, witty scripts and visual stimulations, for taking audience on an emotional ride over the unique and mind-bending universe of storytelling.

I would love to see Michelle Yeoh, Ke Huy Quan, James Hong and Stephanie Hsu all nominated for the 2023 Oscars along with all other awards! If you have not seen "Everything Everywhere All at Once", you should. It is brilliant! All four actors showed incredible range as actors in each version of their multiple characters! It is rare to see this in the same film! The Daniels are also worthy of many awards. All are truly brilliant artists!

Maybe to non mandarin speakers this is good movie, so good for them for not speak mandarin. Sad for me, my native language is mandarin. I have to say those actors' mandarin really sucks,. How sucks? Suck to a point that turn an otherwise good movie to an unwatchable one. Of course,if you don't speak mandarin, everything appears fine.

In Short (round) terms, this movie is a cross between The Bourne Identity + Rick and Morty + Drunken Master.And I loved every bit of it. A very moving and touching film.If by chance I am the very worst version of myself throughout the multiverse then at least I felt moved by my own feelings of total acceptance of everything, everywhere, all at once.

The movie is one of the most incredible I ever seen, but also incredibly complicated to device all the sequences.Apparently random or unpredictable behaviour in systems governed by deterministic laws. A more accurate term, deterministic chaos, suggests a paradox because it connects many notions that are familiar and commonly regarded as incompatible. To generate our thoughts, our brains create this amazing lightning storm of connection patterns networks organize into a fractal like pattern, but when our thinking is disrupted in some way, those patterns lose their integrity and start to break down...

Everything at once everywhere is a film that will not leave you indifferent. It is an accumulation of action, effects and a lot of humor. No doubt I would say that it is one of those films that mark you in one way or another, to me in this case for its photography and special effects.It lasts 2h 20', maybe at the beginning it can be a bit heavy until it starts to develop. However, it is worth watching it until the end because it improves at times although from the first minute it surprises you in a very spectacular way audiovisually speaking. There is no scene that is the same as the previous one.I wanted to highlight the performance of Jonathan Ke Quan, who plays the husband of the protagonist. He's a super charismatic character and it's partly why the film works so well because of the duo that the leading lady (Michelle Yeoh) plays.The film is divided into two acts, which is something different from what is commonly. Seen in mainstream cinema.Besides being a movie full of visual effects and fights, there is also time to get reflective, something that is appreciated.Undoubtedly, highly recommended.

When I first heard of the new sci fi movie, meant to be for best movie of the decade I was skeptical. I knew I had to watch it for myself and it delivered. Truly one of the greatest movies this decade, if not ever. Hands down the most original premise with near flawless executions. The way they can address such mature topics in new insightful ways is something far more movies should aim to do.Truly a modern masterpiece of cinema.

I made an IMDb account just to talk about this movie. I really needed something like this, especially after all the stress and chaos that's been the last couple of years. It's so refreshing to see a movie that's just so unabashedly weird and chaotic and fun. It's so refreshing to see a movie with style and passion. You could tell, from the acting to the cinematography to the script, that there was so much passion poured into EEAAO. And the message that it isn't shameful or weak to be kind? That being hopeful is a valid way to survive in this universe? That things can change for the better? It's wonderful to see a message like that on the big screen. This was a true gem of a movie and I'm not going to shut up about it for a while.

reviews.review_title: I created an account to give this review
reviews.content: This movie is close to perfection... honestly, this movie makes you think from beginning to end. Not only that, it makes you think about everything, at the same time...

Fantastic, i love the plot but sometimes i don't get it (maybe my brain cells are weak). I don't know how people can make story line so damn good like this like what you eat daily? Movie like this always make me wanna be fictional.

Dealing with the multiverse in cinema is certainly not a new thing, but this movie gives a very fresh and unique perspective on that manner.The characters are very grounded and big.The wacky action sequences are just amazing.The movie's structure and buildup simply makes sense.This movie is a must, so if you didn't watch it yet, go do it before it will no longer be in the cinema.

Hilarious, incredibly imaginative without being too intellectual, but so intelligent. It condenses what makes us human and sparkles it - with an amazing talent - with absurd humour, perfect screenplay, and wonderful acting. All this taking a metaphysical subject but making it accessible to anyone. It's a journey of fun, adventure, emotion, without any single wrong note. Seriously among the 10 best movies I've ever seen.

Interesting idea about a really multiverse of madness, not for everyone, but I liked it. But I still wanted more of a multiverse, still family relationships make the idea more local, one does not feel the scale of what is happening.
For the people who is suffering from everything from everywhere, be kind to others especially when you dont know what's going on. No matter what. Best movie this year.

reviews.review_title: Best Movie I've seen in years.
reviews.content: I have my favourite movies obviously. There are movies that I will go back and watch again and again regardless of them being technically good or not. Sometimes movies just resonate with you because of nostelgia, or because they're relatable, or because they play with your imagination and emotions. I'm approaching middle age now so that kind of thing doesn't really happen to me anymore. I'll enjoy a movie sure, but I won't be blown away by many. Everything Everywhere All at Once is the exception to this rule. Everything Everywhere All at Once is an exceptional movie and one that I have not enjoyed this much in probably a decade or more. It might be my favorite film now. A second watch may confirm or deny this but it's easily the best movie of 2022. It's a perfect film. Perfectly shot, perfectly paced, perfectly timed. Even if you ignore the profound story linez, the hilarious jokes, the intense sci-fi action and the emotional drama, it is a film that could not have been made better. I don't know if this is a one off fluke or if these dorectiors are actually geniuses. Only time will tell.To all the haters, I'm just going to have to assume they have a completely different idea of what makes a good movie and that we would never actually agree with eachother about anything. These people should probably be ousted from society to be perfectly honest.I pray that other directors take note of this charmingly dazzling film. Thank the Lord for A24. GO AND WATCH IT RIGHT NOW.

Going through all the reviews, I have to wonder how many people are white, who didn't like it. I say this because all my Asian friends rate this film 10/10 because for the first time in a very relatively western based film, we felt represented. The movie, as crazy as it was, didn't feel like it was meant for a white audience and therefore many people came away not understanding the real point of the film because they themselves have never experienced it in real life.At the core of the film, the suffering of the daughter and the way she's treated by her mother was reflected so clearly in my own life. This film felt like it was made for me, to reflect my experiences as an Asian woman growing up and not a white woman. I've never seen that before. This film is brilliant and a must watch, but it also made me tear up because for the first time of elf seen. So I would ignore the people going in not truly understanding the point of the film - that it was never for their white experiences, but rather that it was aimed at those of us who rarely see our own life reflected in Hollywood-esque cinema.

reviews.review_title: I still didn't really know what that movie was but I'm sure of one thing, it was amazing
reviews.content: I went to see this movie because a friend of mine told me it looked fun. Before I went to the cinema, I knew nothing about the film, neither the genre nor the directors. When the movie ended, I still didn't really know what it was but I was sure of one thing, it was amazing. The more I think about it, the more I realize that this film has no real flaw. The action scenes are very beautiful and we feel all the love of the directors for the films of Bruce Lee and Jackie Chan. The editing is very fluid and pleasant. The film is well rhythmic, you never get bored. The writing is as touching as it is funny. This film is really impressive, it surprises us every second. You never really know what you're watching, you alternate between sf and family drama. This film is really a new breath in the current film industry, an author's blockbuster that never suffers from its low budget and that could become for the next generation of filmmakers a revolutionary film as was the first Matrix (whose film is a bit inspired ) by its positivity, its universal message, and its cinematic qualities.

The less you know going into this movie, the better. Full stop. Do not read reviews. Do not let people tell you about it. Just go and see it with an open mind. It will start with you wondering whether you're watching a family drama, but buckle in. You're in for a ride. It's clever, emotional, hysterical, thoughtful and you walk out elated and happy you saw the movie. It's deep, if you want it to be, and fun regardless. Ambitious as heck, it successful pulls off its ambitions and joins my top ten list movies that i have enjoyed of all time, and i have conservatively seen 5000 movies. And if you don't like it? Too much for you? Well, at least you saw it and now have an opinion.

There's nothing to add to the praise for its storytelling, direction, lighting, VFX, etc etc, from my end. Enough has already been said what's there to be by dozen others. But I'd like to add what I felt watching this movie. This movie dropped at the right time in this universe for people like me whose family is going through times, barely hanging onto by a thread. It's an every household story, but with the help of the concept of multiverse.Themes of family, kindness, selfishness & selflessness, unending commitment to love, etc echoes loud throught the whole journey.This movie is a case study and will be studied by film schools for generations.

Honestly the best movie i have watched in many years.It's was so very different, nothing quite like it exists.Humour, chaos, incredible fight scenes and a good premise.I am going to watch it again just for the "award insertion scene".

"Everything Everywhere All At Once...
or more like "The Matrix meets The Multiverse of Madness meets Lucy meets Kung Pao all At Once"!!!!And I mean that in a good way. They took the best of those and made their own masterpiece.The title suits it very well. The plot was ambitious and at any point could have been a chance to mess up. But it didn't.Cast is awesome. And it had everything!Humor, Action, Special effects and Heart.One second you're watching an impressive fight scene, the next you're LOLing, then you'd get teary eyed.At times cheeky but not corny.. heartwarming but not melodramatic.It has a love story embedded in it without being the typical unnecessary cheesy stuff.Romantic love, love for family, love of a parent, love for others. Generational curse.This puts Doctor Strange's effort at depicting a "Multiverse" to shame.This may very well be the best film of 2022. So far, it is for me.

Self-referentially, this movie has everything, including a bagel with literally everything on it. It's an edge-of-your seat thriller, a side-splitting comedy, a tender love story, a tear jerker, a horror movie, a sci-fi, an action pic. It's about life, infinite universes, and everything. It's both an emotional roller coaster and a deeply thought-provoking meditation on the meaning of life. At its heart, though, is a simple tale of love mislaid and found again. The acting is perfect, the writing is perfect, the direction is perfect; even the music is wonderful. Thankfully it is not actually all at once, but its 140 minutes of undiluted delight fly by way too fast. It's worth a second viewing. Or a third.

Everyone got different tastes on everything. But don't listen to anyone & watch this please. Because this is one of the best movie I ever watched. You can see action, Adventure, Romance, life responsibilities and the great thing what we called love! I'm far away from home just living abroad without my parents, this movie hit me so hard,
When beginning you can see comedy and messing environmental things but deep inside everything have meanings in this movie, specially main character who play her role as a pure mother. Can't believe how much I cried in the ending. Please watch it. Sometimes lifes hard but don't give up!

reviews.review_title: A film for broken Asian kids
reviews.content: I am curious if a viewer from a completely different culture background could relate to the feelings in this movie. From what I can see, it's not only about to love, to be kind, rather a first generation immigrant trying fo fix herself. She's in between of a traditional Asian family, and a daughter born in the west. She's the one character in this movie struggled the most, and put in the most effort into everything. She's never good enough for her parents, and never good enough for her daughter.I am happy there's a movie out there touching this part of the world. The feeling it brought me can't be simply rated.

This movie made me extremely happy and hopeful. It's an amazing philosophical examination and a family drama masquerading as an action movie to appeal to wider audiences. This movie is funny, bold, creative, maybe cheesy at times, but overall it's a profound movie.The central theme of the movie is the battle between nihilism and absurdism (or existentialism). Nihilists say that the universe is meaningless and our lives are pointless. The antagonist of this story is a nihilist and wants to wallow in sadness and gloom. Existentialists and absurdists both attempt to solve the problems created by nihilism. Existentialists believe that since the universe is meaningless we are free create meaning of our own, and that is a beautiful thing. Absurdists argue that the universe is absurd and meaningless and one must find happiness in the absurd.This movie presents all of these philosophical ideologies and does justice to them in my opinion.

reviews.review_title: Jungian phyllosophy or less is more
reviews.content:
Beautifull movie,but i think it is misunderstood,i think it is much,much more.Constant battle between unconcious,concious,persona,ego,anima and animus,fear ext and acceptance of it in ONE.Like Bruce Lee said
"Water flows.Be like water,my friend 😀.How do we let our world just slips out of our hands and to never hear that inner voice of ourselfs.We are just packing more and more in our lives when we should construct it to be simple as it can be.It is sad how we can kill ourselfes and we don't need anyone but ourselfs.It is another version of matrix just a way better way to find that inner voice,more subtle.

It's been almost 9 months since I first saw this movie. And I have watched it a few times since. Sometimes I would watch snippets on YouTube. Each scene was so cleverly written and well acted. Every time I ran into challenges, I reflected on the movie and it helped me overcome all the noise of what could have been or would have been, but just focus on the things that matter most. The short specks of time I can spend with anyone, I would truly cherish them. As for the Actors and Actresses, Ke Huy Quan, The great Michelle Yeoh, Stephanie Hsu, JLC and the Gonggong all deserve awards for their great performances. And The Daniels - amazing screenplay and directors! My Best Picture of All Time I must say...

reviews.review_title: A Poignant Portrail of an Inperfect family
reviews.content: Love can be fought for, spoken, shown in gesture, or action.One of the first things that came across onscreen was the love language of each character and how they operated within their world. People can be flawed and hateful, but still care for the ones they cherish. The world can come crashing down an yet you can look to that one person to hope and shield.This was evident and why i was in tears for nearly the whole movie. The "Daniels" were able to weave a thoughtful sentiment into a chaotic world bending narrative that came alive for each and every viewer. If there was a movie going experience that truly showed the capability to impact, This was it."Of all the places i could be, I just want to be here with you."

reviews.review_title: Made an account just to rate this movie
reviews.content:
I love movies, but rarely have I found a movie that didn't feel like Hollywood's cash grab or formulaic. The trailer for EEAAO piqued my interest because of the mention of multiverses and I thought how bad could it be.I am so glad I saw it in theaters. I enjoyed the movie so much I have seen it in theaters about 5 times bringing different people who have never heard of the movie and left the theater in love with it.This movie had a lot of passion, talent, and feelings. A visually, character, and plot engaging movie putting you on an emotional rollercoaster.Ignore the fact that this was partially filmed during the pandemic, and ignore the fact that their budget was only $14 million (average is $50 million)
This movie felt real, genuine, and I am so glad that I am part of the universe that gets to experience this movie.For the best experience, watch the movie knowing as little as you can.
The amazing imagination of the authors sends the viewer on an absolutely insane psychedelic trip through worlds and universes.Incredible mix of cinematic genres and styles.

reviews.review_title: This movie pulled so many emotions out of me.
reviews.content: The range and intensity of emotions this film elicited from me was nothing short of stunning. Laughter, tears, curiosity, anxiety, awe, dismay, and more. At times it feels like pure information overload, and and other parts, time slows to a crawl as you savor one particular scene, moment, feeling. I cannot recommend this movie enough. People look for different things in a film: perhaps to see something visually appealing, perhaps to escape from reality for a while, perhaps to learn some important life lessons, or perhaps just to experience something new. This film has all of that. Give it a watch: whether you end up liking it or not, you will definitely experience something you've definitely never experienced before, intensely. 10/10.

Title says it all. Best film I've seen in a while, yes I have seen a lot of great movies in the last few years but good lord the originality of this movie is pure brilliance. Such a beautiful movie with stellar performances all round. Do yourself a favour and watch it immediately, then watch it again and again.

reviews.review_title: One of the best movies of 20'
reviews.content: In a world that love is underrated and it s becoming harder to accept our loved ones and see them for what they are, this movie really helps to see the world as it is.

Do not pay attention for the low ratings and opinions, unless your IQ is as low as people giving them. You can actually find out how open you are to the idea of a multiverse by watching this movie. This is simply on another level, chaos and order all at once.Yes, it has "cheap" comedy, otherwise it would be too heavy for the general public, and it complements the movie very well.
Not overwelming, but very good movie in the manner it was built.

Everything Everywhere All at Once is a simple and profound film. Using themes present in the lives of normal people, it makes many quickly identify with him. They are themes of sexual orientation, wife and husband relationship, mother and daughter relationship, company and tax and all miso mixed with fantasy, what more could we ask for? Everything Everywhere All at Once is a fun movie that makes you think about your life and the many others you could have.
Didn't enjoy the movie. It was strange and not in a good way. It didn't start out to bad but it went strange and boring fast. Really don't get why this is so positively received.
Innovative, crazy, funny, and touching. A great movie for people from 16 to 99.
Absolutely amazing. Had us laughing one moment then crying the next. Enjoyable but also makes you think. It inspired a lot of great conversation after it was finished.

I'm ashamed that I waited so long to watch this film. What a beautiful, poignant, funny, emotional movie this is. Everything from the story, the themes, the writing, the acting, and the editing makes this movie a masterpiece of cinema. The film tackles themes such as depression, nihilism, existentialism, family dynamics, and many more, with a touch of brilliant comedy sprinkled throughout. Michelle Yeoh put on a tour-de-force performance for the ages, and she deserved every award that she won. The same can be said of Ke Huy Quan. I've seen iconic movies from Citizen Kane, Vertigo, The Godfather, Goodfellas, Forrest Gump, Pulp Fiction, Schindler's List, The Shawshank Redemption, and Back to the Future. Looking back at this movie in ten years, I feel it will be given its place among those greats and regarded as such. It's a cinematic marvel and is one of the greatest movies ever made.
Ridiculous. Some short touching scenes but overall a ridiculous mess.
Watching this movie was less pleasurable than the time when a dried up dogshit was accidentally thrown into my mouth.
Wow.  So there are people that really found this entertaining?

Weird, jumping around, hard to follow. You have no idea what's going on until the very end. I can't believe I sat through the entire movie. It was like watching a tragic train wreck. Your'e not enjoying it, but keep watching to see how it ends. I do agree the acting & special effects were good, but still I felt it was just too weird.

Clever and interesting concept, my only complaints are that this movie can be a little bit confusing and disorienting, along with being a little bit too "fast paced"; it definitely lives up to its title. However, due to it being all over the place it is a bit too fast to properly understand what is going on and to get anything "down pat". But if you have the brain and the comprehension skills this movie is all the worthwhile.

The movie stoped making any sense halfway through, I don't know how this movie has any positive reviews, and I've never seen so many people walk out of a theater in the middle of a film. At one point there are two rocks talking to each other through subtitles, has everyone completely lost their mind? All these reviews must be fake.

Very enjoyable watch, the title is an accurate description for how the story feels like. Impressive effects, even more impressive story, and it's enjoyable to see both the large scale multiverse conflict mixing with the personal family conflict.
its just a weird movie. i got halfway then said thats enough. not my cup of tea. literally everyone i asked agrees. its just a very strange movie
Artistic.  Interesting.  A must see.  Not so sure on the rewatching, but for sure a must watch at least once.
Overated movie.  Winning an Oscar doesn't really seem to mean anything anymore.  Not a bad movie. Not a good movie.  Well acted.  But I couldn't wait for it to end.

I'm going to keep this short. This is the best but weirdest movies I've ever seen. On paper………should not work, but these directors, actors, cast and crew really show their genius. This is a perfect storm of talent that resulted in an oddly perfect movie.
An irritating assault on the senses with a ridiculous story. My only star is for the only funny sequence of the two rocks.

This was an over stuffed confusing movie. It's like the creators desperately wanted a martial arts film, with sci-fi and thought hot dog fingers are cool. The story lost its context and had no fluidity. It was someone's fever dream they should've kept to themselves.
Amazing in all the best and strangest ways.
An overwhelming sensory experience and overhyped, but worth it for all the cultural references you'll need to know in the future.
You can definitely see why this won so many Oscars, they ALL deserved one. Funny, endearing, unique idea, never dull for even a second.

It's absurd-just like our existence. We could be hot dog fingered people and may look like it from beyond. We could be rocks-it would be peaceful but at the expense of missing out on the beautiful chaos and connection life can bring. Whatever strange, terrible, absurd makeup of molecules we came to this world in or another world or parallel world for that matter-make your molecules send waves of positivity, connection, love. It hits different out there. 

Nothing matters, existence is absurd, yet in our own personal universes everything matters. We can't change the crazy swirling universe/s around us but we can make an impact on the the swirling universes of each person by listening to them, seeing them, treating them with kindness. That is our only hope- no one gets out of here alive.

The movie seems to take absurd to an extreme at some points but then again, does it really? Think of the absurdity of human construct. We have created a world where we dress up our natural bodies in uncomfortable clothes and spend most of our time alive inside a cubicle until almost the time of our demise for pieces of paper to buy large homes we spent in less time than we do going to the cubicle to buy them. Our existence is scientifically proven to be nothing short of miraculous and this is what we have designed to pass the time of our miraculous existence. We are absurd. Everything is. But we can be kind.

about anything on the screen!

this movie has proved that human creativity is limitless, this movie was absolutely insane

It is very entertaining and everybody that worked on it deserves praise for creating something unique, but the storyline in so jumbled and desperate to be funky that it just gets annoyingly repetitive halfway through. I found myself wondering when it was going to peak and it seemed to never happen. If it wasn't for the massive dildos being used as batons, it would be suitable for kids.

Prime let us watch it for free. 50 minutes in we called it quits. The narrative was pretty shoddy - clunkily half told. And if I was the Wachoeskis, is be suing for stealing the Matrix plot. Good cinematography, the odd laugh, decent cast. None of our enough to make me care, though.
A movie that has an interesting idea and a story to tell, but struggles to relay them in a consistent, sensible way. It keeps tripping over its own feet, similar to what Tenet did.
Loved this movie!  The acting, the action, and the story were all superb!
What a terrible film was all over the shot and lost interest after the first 10 minutes. If you like really far fetched and out there films you might like it.

Left me in floods of tears and inconsolable at the end as a lot of it hit home for me. Highly recommend people to watch it - Once you understand the underlying story it just all makes sense and hits you! Wonderful acting by all.

What I love about this movie is how wacky and goofy it really is at the surface. But I'm glad the movie doesn't shy away from those moments, because they make this movie much better. The fighting is amazing, the story is heartfelt and emotional, the characters feel very realistic, and the symbolism behind the movie is clear:
The importance of kindness.

best movie ever created
Easily the best movie ever made! Anyone who didn't like this film is intensely stupid and a huge moron! Watch now!!!!!!!!¡!!!!!!!

This deserved every Academy Award it got including Best Picture of the year because I was surprised how good this movie was. This movie was very entertaining and it's definitely one of the Best movies from 2022.

A steaming pile. The hype just doesn’t make sense ZERO STARS.
The chaoticness of this film will not be to everyone's liking. However, it is what makes is such an interesting film. The randomness needs to be embraced in order to enjoy it.
An outstanding sci-fi action drama with amazing performances, great visuals, and a beautifully written story that made me cry multiple times.

Ridiculous, silly, repetitive, wordy, over-long, overrated, pretentious, nonsensical, comic book rubbish which manages the considerable feat of being both confusing and childish at the same time, with a wafer thin "plot" (sic). The most deep and ridiculous movie I have ever seen. It's like life, you laugh, you cry, then it's nonsense. Then it's deep. All at once.

Don't understand about the bad reviews and disagree about it not worth the Oscars because audiences only think the production effort shouldn't get any recognition because they didn't know with this limited budget and out of the norm storyline, this is a piece of artwork that couldn't be replicated elsewhere. The attempted storyline surprises and low budget visual effects caught my heart not because it's the best, but because it's their best from what they can offer. In fact, more than what they could offer. The story is so deep and heartfelt, for me it's not telling just about the mother-daughter relationship but a deeper understanding of a pain felt by people who lost hope in the low point of their life, it's bizarrely speaking to those who had lost their passion in living in any universe (being portrayed so painfully through the antagonist), and the "O" bagel (such a humorous element, a bagel as empty as it seem literally made me laugh in the mid of teary scenes) assuming it symbolising the emptiness in all universes is what many people face in this colourful society nowadays. And in the end the story hints about holding the very moment and seeing the beauty in all emptiness, if to be digested well, this story brings so much hope, love, in-depth view of life and some entertaining action scenes and plebeian moments that humble people can relate to. This movie is a masterpiece of bringing the theme of love without even mentioning the word "love".
loved it! great acting and awesome storyline! Michelle Yeoh is such an inspiration!

A confusing, silly, childish, plot-lite film that that takes effort to watch to its overly long 219 minute ending. Massively overrated and not worthy of any award. Who is seriously rating this so highly? Insane.

Fun, imaginative chaos that should make no sense and maybe it doesn't, but yet it does. Fun performances, great directing, solid editing. Some familiar ideas in a new, insane way that truly makes it stand alone. First nominee that truly could be deserving of "best picture"

Quote of the film:
"Oh my gig he's trying to stick that in his butt."
It's everything you could want in a modern day action film. I've seen countless times and I always notice something new.

Not nearly as good as other people might lead you to believe.  It starts out incredibly slow with the story of an Asian washeteria owner, her husband, her Americanized daughter, and her wheelchair-bound, disapproving father.  At an IRS audit, her husband switches bodies with his counterpart from another universe where things are a lot more exciting and some unknown force is trying to end all other parallel universes. (SPOILER AHEAD).  He's come to convince the washeteria lady to join the fight and at first, she has no interest or belief in his antics.  Turns out, as part of switching between universes, you have to do something totally random and silly like sticking a foreign object up your backside while whistling The Star Spangled Banner.  That's not in the movie, but it's an example of how silly things can get.  Much of the movie falls back on stereotypical wire-fighting like we've seen in so many previous movies like another Michelle Yeoh vehicle, Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon.  If you like that sort of thing, you'll probably like this movie because it has a lot of it.  (SPOILER SPOILER SPOILER).  Turns out the force trying to end all of reality in all universes is the daughter of the washeteria owner and the rest of the movie is Michelle Yeoh's character trying to make up with her daughter and form a bond even though everyone else is telling her that, in order to save reality, she has to kill her daughter in every universe.  And so, that's it.  That's what won the Oscar.  Big disappointment for me and I'm a huge Michelle Yeoh fan.  I was even excited to see Ke Huy Quan again and he did a formidable acting job in this movie.  My biggest disappointment was the story.  Acting was fine from all involved.  While the story was somewhat original, it seems like it's just one of the pack of movies coming out lately (mainly from Marvel) where a multiverse is involved.  If imitation is the sincerest form of flattery, someone is getting mighty flattered today.
I don't get the hype

I honestly have no idea how this film got nominated for anything, never mind won so much. It was way too long, too boring, and just induced me to looking at my watch over and over again, wondering when it would be finished. I can usually at least tolerate a bad film, but this was well-beyond tolerable. I never thought I could dislike a Michelle Yeoh film, but here we are.
beautiful. go watch it. I love multiverse stuff like this and they did it so well. such a sweet story. I love movies like this! beautiful beautiful beautiful!!

So boring I fell asleep, The martial arts are far below average and the acting does not come off organically. The drama is so boring and as a Martial arts movie it's horrible. It tried to be two different genres of movies at the same time and fails miserably.

I expected a lot after all those Oscars but was VERY disappointed. It turned out to be a chaotic lecture about shaming dissenting views of today's declining culture. I'm happy I didn't pay a penny to watch it.

Overrated. With all the awards you'd think it would be a consensus as Best Picture. It wouldn't even get the Bronze from me. Took me 3 tries, resuming from where I had left off the last time, to get to the end of the movie.  A two star rating is generous.

It was a good Martial Arts movie, had a lot of good actors in it, and I enjoyed it. Best picture of  the year? Really? There wasn't anything better than this? It was enjoyable while I watched it and I'll probably never watch it again.

Way too long. They should have brought it to closure after the “Everything” segment: I enjoyed it for awhile then it started to seem like it was repeating itself. The acting was very good and those awards were well-deserved but I wouldn’t give it “Best Picture.” I watched it on the plane so I’m glad I didn’t spend money at the theater.

Underwhelming. Could've won 4 Oscars (editing, costume, set design, supporting) + 2 nominations (screenplay, direction), but it's only above-average as an overall movie or experience. Not even close to the best movie of 2022 so the record-breaking number of awards is head-scratching. It's extremely derivative (the plot is The Matrix) & there are too many references to other better films throughout as it jumps from 2001 Space Odyssey reference to Matrix reference to 'some other movie' reference.

Overall it's a very silly movie, that gets stuck between two conflicting tones (melodrama & slapstick comedy). Imagine the plot of The Matrix mixed with the tone of Scott Pilgrim. It's jocular tone doesn't match it's disconsolate themes (regret & nihilism). It contains strong components, but might've been better if treated more seriously, dramatically. Allow characters, themes, & actors to create tone so your fun can be earned through story. Instead it's forcefully directed like, "let's try to make it fun." Reminds me of the quote, "there's a difference between being smart & trying to be smart." So on one hand it's a somewhat fun movie, but on the other hand its fun is a contrivance.

What worked least for me was: two rocks talking with subtitles, the personification of eternity as an everything bagel & the main character. One of the worst lead characters you'll see: completely cowardly at every turn & a nearly unbearable attempt to create an anti-hero. Thematically it's so heavy handed, it's nearly preachy. What worked best was the first few minutes of act 1 (how it was written, acted, executed). The opening character introductions, pacing & writing are excellent in a complex 'show don't tell' type manner. It quickly devolves into a slapstick time travel romp & lost it's steam once it started 'verse jumping.'

It's not a bad movie, but it wasn't a great movie like I was expecting from all of the awards and the price to rent. Nicest way I could say it is it wasn't for me. To be fair, that could be due to demographics. If you're under 30, especially female audiences, you may connect with it better. For viewers over 30, especially male audiences who's tastes might typically align with the critic scores more than audience scores, it likely will not reach your expectations & you might even find it growingly frustrating as it continually falls short of those expectations. It's best suited as a mother/daughter bonding movie with some popcorn, but it's not as universal, original, or good as it's score might have you believe.

First review I'm doing on Rotten Tomatoes!
I want to start of with saying that this movie is one of those movies you have to watch in one sitting and preferably on a big screen. To not have you wait for my honest feedback I'll give it now and then explain why. In all of the movies I have watched, enjoying everything from comedies to action films, sci-fi and dramas, this is absolutely the greatest masterpiece I have ever had the pleasure to watch. If I could, I would love to watch it for the first time again - such an emotional journey it takes one on.
I have to mention one thing to set your expectations straight: - do not go into this movie aching for a logical, realistic, planned through story to be told- if you do you'll be very disappointed. This is not like any other movie, this is a piece of film - the conglomerations of visuals and sound that produce tension and get the audiences attention. 
Befor watching this movie, I did not know why this movie won so many Oscar's, I was more pessimistic on the overall quality of the movie. The reason why i believe it's one of the greatest film artworks ever is because the absence of rationality and logic, of structured content and foreseeable behaviour allows the creation of feelings and a connection with the overall human emotions portrayed like no other movie has done. Because it does not make sense it feels so close to us. Most of what we experience, what we truly feel does not make sense - we can be angry but still love a person, we can have an abundance of things but still feel empty- unfulfilled. The movie creates so many different scenarios into which we can portray ourselves into, that it connects everybody to the plot ( hell I could not take my eyes off of the screen in the last 30 minutes). This gives everyone this (joy)ride of fast emotions that everyone has - the movie makes you feel happy, sad, disappointed, content, confused, orderly, scared all at the same time. The first half takes getting used to, but if you embrace the confusion, the chaos and watch the second half you'll have the absolute mesmerising experience of a wave of emotions coming over you, being captivated by the pleasure of what it feels like to be alive. Go and watch it!

The cast's acting was excellent but I don't know if any of them were necessarily Oscar-worthy. Maybe it's the halo effect idk.

A24, a production company always willing to gamble on original ideas, outdo themselves with Everything Everywhere All at Once, an all-out assault on the senses that never fails to entertain.  Evelyn (Michelle Yeoh), a mother who comes to the realization that she is becoming estranged from her daughter (Stephanie Hsu), finds herself drawn into alternate universes and the fulcrum in a galactic battle for supremacy.  It's a wildly psychedelic, existential journey that includes googly eyes, a pair of telepathic rocks, and a talking racoon, among other oddities, all of which sounds ridiculous but somehow works in the context of the film.  More importantly, despite all of the weirdness, it is a movie that has heart. It's clearly not for all tastes, but those with patience will probably find it rewarding.

Sci-fi action-comedy masterpiece!

"Everything Everywhere All at Once" is an extraordinary film that defies categorization. Directed by Dan Kwan and Daniel Scheinert, this sci-fi action-comedy features an outstanding cast led by Michelle Yeoh, Jamie Lee Curtis, and Stephanie Hsu. The film tells the story of a woman named Mei, played by Hsu, who discovers she has access to multiple parallel universes and must navigate them to save her world from destruction.

One of the most impressive aspects of the film is its visual style. The directors utilize an array of cinematic techniques, including animation, puppetry, and practical effects, to create a unique and mesmerizing visual experience. The cinematography is stunning, with vibrant colors and dynamic camera movements that keep the audience engaged throughout the film.

The performances are also outstanding, with each actor bringing a unique energy and charisma to their role. Yeoh delivers a powerful performance as the enigmatic Madame Wong, while Curtis is hilarious as a ruthless businesswoman who becomes embroiled in the chaos of Mei's mission.

But perhaps the most impressive aspect of "Everything Everywhere All at Once" is its storytelling. The film manages to balance multiple genres, including science fiction, action, comedy, and drama, with remarkable ease. The narrative is complex and engaging, and the filmmakers masterfully weave together the different threads of the story to create a satisfying and emotional conclusion.

Overall, "Everything Everywhere All at Once" is a remarkable piece of cinema that is sure to become a classic. With its stunning visuals, outstanding performances, and compelling storytelling, it stands out as one of the best films of all time. It's a must-see for anyone who appreciates bold, innovative filmmaking and a testament to the boundless potential of cinema as an art form.

Rarely does a title of a film exemplify both the on the screen action as well as the theme of the movie.  Everything, Everywhere, All at Once, certainly does.  What is going on during this movie?  Well…Everything…Where?  Everywhere…When…OK..  
Touching on themes of existentialism, nihilism and family, Everything reminds audiences to soak in the little things in life even in the face of modernity, cynicism, and the increasing feeling that we are getting smaller and smaller in a world of constant technological advancement.

That this film won the Oscar for Best Movie indicates the Academy is fascinated by style over substance. There's a message in this movie and it beats you over the head, in the face, on your backside...and covers up the redundancy with a bunch of nonsense about the multiverse. Whatever. 

I've always felt that the Academy misses on the Best Performance, and while the performance of Michelle Yeoh is excellent, it's aided by the fact it's in a movie that, while innovative, isn't really. Ditto with Jamie Lee Curtis.

When I originally saw the trailer, it had no affect on me and my level of interest was zero. However, after their big night at the Oscars, I decided to give it a shot to see what all the praise was about and I've gotta be honest, I don't understand it? I don't see what's so great about the film. Yes, it is somewhat funny with a heartwarming story that unfolds; however, about 45-60 minutes into it, I was already done. You're not supposed to say the quiet part loud but I'm going to: this won at the Oscars for one reason and one reason only, DEI. It's an average film at best that won due to weak competition or films that were overlooked that should have easily won but were snubbed for Best Picture and Best Director (and yes, I'm talking about THE WHALE and Darren Aronofsky). Within a year this film will be forgotten. Don't get me wrong, I'm extremely happy Laurie Strode won an Oscar (surprised in fact as the buzz heading in was Angela Bassett would win), as well as Ke Huy Quen who will always have a special place in my heart like so many others for Data and Short Round. Finally, isn't it cultural appropriation for Daniel Scheinert to direct basically an all Asian cast? Just asking.

This film was literally unwatchable for me. 

I got headaches from the audiovisual experience, but also from constantly rolling my eyes.

I almost never give up on a film, so I soldiered through this torturous assault on the senses, taking breaks every 30 minutes or so.

From the first minute, it starts out with people frantically rushing, tripping and talking over each other seemingly in fast-forward, constantly switching between English and Cantonese. First you think that this is intentional, so as to convey the chaotic situation, and once it is established, the pace and tone will settle down. Nope. This is the entire film. 

The film is a nonsensical mish-mash cacophony of frantic, hectic, hyper, non-stop dialog, noise, lights, people, and things. I understand that this is the point, and it's supposed to be Funny & Satirical & Smart & Weird & Sweet & Edgy & Silly & Serious & Meta.

However in my opinion it tries way, way too hard, and ultimately falls flat on its face in all its aspirations. At least the title is apt.

Surprise-Surprise, trying to be Everything Everywhere, all at once... doesn't work! At least not for me, as I see that it does for many others. (I will leave the audience cultural psychoanalysis to others 🤪)

The film is simultaneously sensory overwhelming, and very boring. Dumb, but pretentious at the same time. Both branching & multi-verse hoping, but also repetitive and so very predictable. Quite the accomplishment.

A high budget student film- bad imitation Woody Allen meets a bad imitation Rick & Morty meets a bad imitation Jackie Chan
...on coke
...and LSD
... and partially in Cantonese

Written in a parallel universe by Alex Kurtzman and directed by Michael Bay, after they had both been lobotomized with a wooden spoon.

One of the worst movies I've ever seen.  Tasteless humor combined with the worn out trope of quantum mechanics taken out of context (Down the Rabbit Hole anyone) and that any physicist will reject.   I like deep themed movies more than most people and love science fiction, but the Sidartherian quest for the meaning of life is already contemplated by most fifth graders and either left up to religion or fatalism or whatnot.  The multiverse theory is just a mathematical way to explain the way a universe that favors life could come about randomly and is actually a way to show a way to satisfy the Cosmological Constant and the infinitesimal chance that life could have come about:  Parallel universes containing other versions of ourselves is not a part of the theory.  The only 5 minutes of the movie I liked was the part with the two rocks in the cliff with total silence.

This is a Once in a generation type film. The single most original, unique, technically advanced perfect example of filmmaking and entertainment that I have witnessed since the early 90s. Plot was very easy to follow along despite what some low ratings say. Like all the films by the masters with names like Martin Scorcese, Sergio Leone, Stanley Kubrick, Steven Spielberg and Alfred Hitchcock, you simply have to pay attention to the screen. I would rank this one right up there with any films the great masters ever made. It's not for the people who love "Cocaine Bear" or franchise sequels Like marvel movies. It's made for people who love cinema.  It's a Comedy /sci-fi / action film based around a story of a struggling immigrant family on the verge of divorce and their daughter's nihilist attitudes. If you can watch this movie and not laugh and cry at least once, you need to check your pulse, cause you might be dead. 
It's easily going somewhere in my top 10 list of favorite films of all time... Right up there with "2001 a Space Odyssey", "Once Upon a Time in New York",  and "Goodfellas"... oh yea...
